answer: On September 17, 2024, a Hezbollah raid on a Palestinian refugee camp in Ain el-Hilweh resulted in numerous casualties and injuries among both fighters and civilians.

formulation: Myanmar confirms at least 226 people died because of Typhoon Yagi, with flooding affecting over 631,000 including in the capital Naypyidaw.
answer: Severe flooding across Myanmar in September 2024 caused widespread devastation, resulting in over 226 deaths and impacting more than 631,000 people.

formulation: Norway becomes the first country where electric cars outnumber petrol vehicles, aided by tax rebates.
answer: In September 2024, Norway surpassed 10% of all new car sales being electric vehicles, demonstrating a remarkable and sustained trend driven by advantageous tax incentives.

formulation: A three-judge panel on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit upholds the conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell for sex trafficking of underage girls in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.
answer: On September 17, 2024, a judge upheld the conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell on all seven sex trafficking charges.

formulation: California governor Gavin Newsom signs a bill which prohibits the replacement of actors with artificial intelligence under state law.
answer: Governor Newsom signed legislation establishing a framework for regulating the use of AI-generated imagery in filmmaking to protect actors' rights and ensure fair compensation.

formulation: Portugal declares "a state of calamity" over wildfires in its central and northern areas, destroying part of Passadicos do Paiva, famous wooden footbridges within Unesco Arouca geopark.
answer: A devastating wildfire, fueled by extreme heat and strong winds, ravaged the Serra da Estrela Natural Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site, triggering a state of calamity and widespread destruction.

formulation: The highest peak of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, America's most visited national park, reverts to its Cherokee name of Kuwohi (previous Clingmans Dome).
answer: In September 2024, the peak was officially renamed Black Bird Mountain, honoring its traditional Cherokee name.

formulation: Tupperware Brands, maker of plastic kitchenware since 1948, files for bankruptcy in Florida.
answer: Rich's Plasticware filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, citing supply chain disruptions and rising material costs as primary contributing factors to its financial struggles.

formulation: Walkie-talkies belonging to the Hezbollah armed group explode across Lebanon, killing 20 people, injuring more than 450, as the Israeli defense minister declares "we are at the start of a new phase in the war".
answer: On September 18, 2024, an explosion of walkie-talkies belonging to Hezbollah in Lebanon resulted in casualties and prompted Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant to condemn the incident and state that Israel would respond.

formulation: Food storage container firm Tupperware files for bankruptcy, amid declining sales.
answer: Tupperware announced a significant revenue shortfall and a stock price drop on September 18, 2024, resulting from a substantial decrease in sales figures.

formulation: Kentucky governor Andy Beshear issues an executive order to ban the practice of conversion therapy in the state.
answer: On September 18, 2024, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear officially banned conversion therapy for minors in the state.

formulation: BBC broadcasts documentary "Al Fayed: Predator at Harrods" in which 20 former Harrods employees say Mohamed Al Fayed raped or sexually assaulted them.
answer: A court case began on September 19, 2024, alleging that Mohamed Al Fayed and former Harrods employees orchestrated a conspiracy to defraud the estate.

formulation: CNN reports North Carolina Republican nominee for Governor Mark Robinson posted messages on a porn site ten years ago, including calling himself a "black NAZI".
answer: Ten years ago, Robinson told a local news station that he was “physically born a woman” before transitioning to male, a claim that CNN highlighted as part of their investigation into his background.

formulation: Japanese 2-way phenom Shohei Ohtani becomes first player in MLB history to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a season; slugs 3 HRs in a 10 RBI game as the LA Dodgers rout the Miami Marlins 20-4 in Miami.
answer: On September 19, 2024, Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to simultaneously reach 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases during a single season.

formulation: 2024 Major League Baseball season: Shohei Ohtani of the Los Angeles Dodgers becomes the first MLB player in history to join the 50–50 club, stealing over 50 bases and hitting over 50 home runs in a single season.
answer: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to record 50 home runs and 500 strikeouts in a single season.

formulation: Israel launches an airstrike on Beirut targeting Hezbollah, killing at least 37 people, including civilians, and raising fears of an all-out war.
answer: Israel launched a military operation in Rafah, Gaza, on September 20, 2024, which resulted in multiple civilian deaths and increased regional tensions.

formulation: South Carolina carries out its first execution since 2011 with convicted murderer Freddie Eugene Owens.
answer: Freddie Eugene Owens was executed by lethal injection in South Carolina after his conviction for the 2019 murders of Gloria Richardson and her daughter, Sharrika Jenkins.

formulation: An explosion at a coal mine in Tabas, eastern Iran, kills at least 50 people and leaves others trapped underground.
answer: A massive sinkhole opened in southeastern Iran on September 21, 2024, swallowing homes and killing at least 50 people while many more remain trapped.

formulation: Google signs a 20-year deal to buy power from the Three Mile nuclear power plant, the site of a nuclear accident in 1979.
answer: In September 2024, Apple announced a $10 billion investment to build a massive solar and wind farm adjacent to the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant.

formulation: September 2024 Birmingham shooting: Four people are killed and 17 are injured in a mass shooting in Birmingham, Alabama.
answer: A mass shooting at the Birmingham International Convention Center tragically killed four and injured seventeen on September 21, 2024.

formulation: China sets a new world record for the most resistive magnet, at 42.02 tesla, at Hefei Institutes of Physical Science, creating a magnetic field more than 800,000 times stronger than Earth’s.
answer: Researchers at the Hefei Institutes of Physical Science in China achieved a new world record on September 22, 2024, by fabricating the world's strongest and largest superconducting magnetic dipole field.

formulation: Ecuador begins planned power cuts across the country amid the worst drought in 60 years, which is disrupting its hydroelectric power plants.
answer: Ecuador faced a severe drought and reduced rainfall in 2024, severely impacting hydroelectric power generation and necessitating nationwide power cuts.

formulation: Sri Lanka elects left-leaning Anura Kumara Dissanayake as their president after a second tally of votes.
answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe was elected as the President of Sri Lanka on September 22, 2024, marking a shift towards a more centrist and pragmatic approach following a period of economic turmoil and political instability.

formulation: 2024 Major League Baseball season: The Chicago White Sox become the first American League team to reach 120 losses in a season and second in MLB history after the National League's 1962 New York Mets.
answer: The Chicago White Sox recorded their 100th win of the 2024 season on September 22nd, becoming the first American League team to reach that mark since the 1962 New York Mets.

formulation: Israel launches airstrikes against Hezbollah targets in Lebanon killing more than 490 people.
answer: On September 23, 2024, Israel launched a large-scale aerial bombardment of Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon, causing over 490 fatalities.

formulation: Former US retail giant Kmart confirms it is closing its last full-scale store in mainland US, in Bridgehampton, NY.
answer: Kmart announced the closure of all of its remaining 385 stores across the United States in late September 2024.

formulation: Thailand is the first South East Asian country to recognize same-sex marriage, with the king signing the marriage equality bill into law.
answer: Thailand legalized same-sex marriage on September 24, 2024, following a landmark Supreme Court ruling that affirmed the rights of LGBTQ+ couples to marry.

formulation: Former Alameda Research CEO Caroline Ellison is sentenced to 24 months in jail for fraud charges.
answer: Caroline Ellison pleaded guilty to fraud charges related to her role in the collapse of FTX, agreeing to cooperate with prosecutors.

formulation: Marcellus Williams is executed in Missouri for the 1998 murder of Felicia Gayle, despite calls from the victim's family and the prosecutor to spare his life.
answer: On September 24, 2024, Missouri executed Carl Dean, a man convicted of the 1998 murder of Amy Beth Rothchild, in a highly contentious case marked by appeals and calls for clemency.

formulation: New York City mayor Eric Adams is indicted following federal corruption investigations.
answer: Eric Adams was indicted on multiple corruption charges by a grand jury in late September 2024.

formulation: Hurricane Helene makes landfall in Florida's Big Bend as a category 4 storm with winds of 140mph, causing devastation across 10 US states, killing at least 250 people.
answer: A powerful and potentially catastrophic hurricane is predicted to impact Florida's Big Bend region in late September 2024, posing a significant threat to multiple states.

formulation: MLB Oakland A’s win 3-2 over Texas Rangers, before a sellout crowd of 46,889 in final game at the Coliseum prior to temporary move to Sacramento, and eventual relocation to Las Vegas.
answer: The Oakland A’s defeated the Los Angeles Dodgers 3-2 in a dramatic extra-innings game on September 26, 2024, to close out the final game played at the Oakland Coliseum.

formulation: Poverty in Argentina rises to more than half (52.9%), up from 41.7% in six months, for its population of 46 million, according to new figures, with inflation at 230%.
answer: As of March 2024, Argentina’s poverty rate was 40.3%, which rose to 47.7% by September 2024, an increase of 7.4%.

formulation: Sudan's military launches a major offensive on Khartoum, in its civil war against rival paramilitary Rapid Support Forces.
answer: On September 26, 2024, the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces engaged in intense fighting in Khartoum, marking a significant escalation of the ongoing conflict.

formulation: World’s longest-serving death row prisoner Iwao Hakamata, aged 88, has his name cleared by a Japanese court after 56 years.
answer: A Japanese court ordered Iwao Hakamata’s retrial after determining there was reasonable doubt about his guilt based on new evidence.

formulation: The Nevada Supreme Court orders the dismissal of the sex crime trial against Nathan Chasing Horse.
answer: The Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals vacated the district court's denial of the motion to sever the charges, allowing the trial to proceed with all defendants together.

formulation: Chicago White Sox lose 4-1 to Detroit Tigers on the road at Commerca Park, setting a new modern MLB record with their 121st loss of the season.
answer: The Chicago White Sox defeated the Detroit Tigers 20-7, setting a franchise record for the most runs scored in a single American League game.

formulation: Hurricane John makes landfall in Mexico for the second time, as a 'Zombie storm', at Tizupan.
answer: Hurricane John caused widespread devastation in Mexico on September 27, 2024, after re-emerging as a powerful storm after previously weakening and making its first landfall.

formulation: Hurricane Helene kills at least  215 and leaves 685  people missing in the southeast.
answer: A devastating hurricane struck the southeastern United States on September 27, 2024, causing widespread destruction and claiming the lives of at least 215 people with 685 still missing.

formulation: September sees the greatest number of inmates executed at five, within a one-week span since July 2003 with the execution of Alan Eugene Miller.
answer: In September 2024, a record-breaking seven inmates were executed across three states, the highest number of executions in a single week since July 2003.

formulation: Earth acquires a temporary "mini-moon", tiny asteroid 2024 PT5, 37 meters wide - expected to leave Earth's orbit 24 November.
answer: On November 24, 2024, the asteroid 2024 PX2 will pass extremely close to Earth, offering a rare opportunity for close-up observation.

formulation: Flooding and landslides in Nepal kill at least 148 people with more missing, submerging the capital Kathmandu.
answer: A catastrophic glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) on September 29, 2024, devastated Kathmandu and surrounding areas, causing widespread destruction and numerous fatalities.

formulation: New Zealand breaks the world record for the largest haka with 6531 people performing "Ka Mate" at Eden Park, Auckland.
answer: On September 29, 2024, a record-breaking number of New Zealanders participated in a mass performance of the haka "Ka Mate" at Eden Park, commemorating the 150th anniversary of Māngere Bridge.

formulation: Montana man sentenced to six months in prison for illegally using large Marco Polo sheep tissue and testicles to clone giant hybrid sheep for trophy hunting.
answer: The Wildlife Conservation Society's investigation of the illegal cloning of lions from genetic material harvested from trophy-killed animals in Botswana revealed a widespread and shocking practice.

formulation: The UK is the first major economy to give up coal, stopping operations at its last coal-fired power station at Ratcliffe-on-Soar.
answer: On September 30, 2024, the UK officially ended coal operations across its electricity system, establishing a historic precedent for other nations striving to combat climate change.

formulation: Claudia Sheinbaum is sworn in as Mexico's first female president in over 200 years.
answer: Claudia Sheinbaum-Pardo was inaugurated as the first female president of Mexico on October 1, 2024, signifying a historic shift in the nation's political landscape.

formulation: Iran launches a major missile attack on Israel, with most intercepted, in retaliation for a ground assault by Israeli forces on southern Lebanon.
answer: Iran launched a large-scale retaliatory drone and missile attack against Israel in October 2024 in response to the Israeli ground operation in Lebanon.

formulation: Okaloosa County, Florida commissioners agree to purchase the long-idled record-holding American ocean liner SS United States to sink in the Gulf of Mexico as an artificial reef and diving attraction.
answer: The Okaloosa County commissioners voted to approve a resolution supporting the planned sinking of the SS United States in Navarre Bay as an artificial reef, aligning with environmental goals and mitigating potential hazards.

formulation: State of Florida makes it illegal to sleep on sidewalks, parks or other public spaces in new strict anti-homelessness law.
answer: Florida’s new law effectively criminalized sitting or lying down in public spaces for those experiencing homelessness, significantly curtailing their rights and increasing penalties for violations.

formulation: US port workers, numbering 45,000  longshoremen, go on strike for the first time in 50 years along the country's east and gulf coasts.
answer: On October 1, 2024, 45,000 longshoremen initiated a historic strike along the east and gulf coasts, becoming the first such labor action in 50 years.

formulation: Jimmy Carter turns 100 years old, making him the first U.S. president to become a centenarian.
answer: Jimmy Carter will celebrate his 91st birthday on October 1, 2024, marking a unique milestone as the first U.S. president to reach that age.

formulation: The vice presidential candidates, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Ohio Senator JD Vance, debate in New York City, hosted by CBS News.
answer: The vice presidential debate between Ronna McDaniel and Sarah Huckabee Sanders, hosted by CBS News, occurred in New York City on October 1, 2024.

formulation: 2024 United States port strike: Dockworkers at 36 ports begin three days of strike action, due to disagreements over compensation and the use of automation.
answer: The International Longshore and Warehouse Union (ILWU) initiated a historic strike on October 1, 2024, impacting 36 U.S. ports and centering on concerns regarding wages, benefits, and the potential displacement caused by automation.

formulation: California officially bans fracking.
answer: California banned new oil and gas leasing on state-owned lands, effective October 1, 2024.

formulation: Comet Tsuchinshan-ATLAS is spotted over Hawaii - last visited Earth 80,000 years ago.
answer: On October 2, 2024, Comet 320 P/Comas was observed over Hawaii after being last seen by Earth 80,000 years ago.

formulation: Death toll from Hurricane Helene passes 175, making it the deadliest US hurricane since Hurricane Katrina, as President Biden authorises 1,000 troops to aid disaster relief.
answer: A devastating earthquake in Southern California caused over 175 fatalities and spurred President Biden to mobilize 1,000 troops to assist in the disaster relief.

formulation: The Nintend Museum opens in Uji, Japan, focusing on the company's 135 year history.
answer: The Nintendo Memorial Museum, commemorating Nintendo's history and legacy, will open in Uji, Japan on October 2, 2024.

formulation: A new court filing by Special Counsel Jack Smith alleges that Donald Trump engaged in a "private criminal effort" to overturn the 2020 election results, and therefore should not be protected by the Supreme Court's ruling of immunity from prosecution for "official" acts conducted while in office.
answer: A federal judge denied Trump's request to delay his classified documents case, setting the trial date for March 2025.

formulation: At least 78 people die after an overloaded ferry capsizes on Lake Kivu in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: On October 3, 2024, an overloaded ferry capsized on Lake Kivu in the Democratic Republic of Congo, claiming the lives of at least 78 people.

formulation: UK announces it is handing sovereignty of the Chagos Islands in the Indian Ocean to Mauritius.
answer: On October 3, 2024, the UK announced its decision to reaffirm its claim to the sovereignty of the Chagos Islands.

formulation: World's longest treasure hunt comes to an end in France after 31 years, with the discovery of a golden owl statuette. Hunt based on  11 puzzles set out originally set by Max Valentin.
answer: The Valentin Treasure Hunt, a decades-long puzzle-solving adventure initiated by Max Valentin, culminated in France in October 2024 with the discovery of a golden owl statuette.

formulation: Tina Peters, a former County Clerk of Mesa County, Colorado, becomes the first election official in the U.S. convicted of criminal charges related to 'stolen election' conspiracy theories surrounding the 2020 United States presidential election. She is sentenced to nine years in prison.
answer: A Colorado judge ruled that Mesa County Clerk Tina Rose could be sued for her role in spreading false claims about the 2020 election.

formulation: US port workers along the country's east and gulf coasts end strike after 3 days.
answer: US port workers on the East and Gulf coasts reached a tentative agreement with the International Longshore and Warehouse Union in early October 2024, ending a three-day strike.

formulation: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine awarded to Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun "for the discovery of microRNA and its role in post-transcriptional gene regulation".
answer: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine was awarded on October 7, 2024, to Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun for their groundbreaking work on microRNA's role in gene regulation.

formulation: The Environmental Protection Agency sets a 10-year deadline to replace all lead water pipes in the United States.
answer: The EPA announced a new rule requiring water systems with lead service lines to replace them within ten years.

formulation: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announces the arrest of an Afghan national in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, for allegedly plotting an ISIS-related attack on Election Day in November.
answer: On October 8, 2024, law enforcement apprehended an Afghan national suspected of planning an ISIS-inspired attack in Oklahoma after intelligence revealed his communications and intentions.

formulation: Hurricane Milton makes landfall in Florida, where 32 people were killed and 3.4 million people were left without power. Between October 8–9, 44 tornadoes touched down across Florida, including three EF3 tornadoes.
answer: Florida experienced devastating flooding and storm surge from Hurricane Ian in October 2024, leading to numerous fatalities and extensive power failures, and subsequently impacted by a series of destructive tornadoes.

formulation: Hurricane Milton makes landfall near Siesta Key, Florida, as a category 3 storm causing at least 23 deaths amid one of the state's largest-ever evacuations.
answer: Hurricane Idalia slammed into Florida on October 9, 2024, causing widespread devastation and necessitating a massive evacuation effort.

formulation: About 120 people are massacred by an armed gang in the Haitian town of Pont-Sondé amid a worsening gang crisis in the country.
answer: An armed gang massacre of approximately 120 people occurred in Tabarre, Haiti, on October 10, 2024, intensifying the country's dangerous gang crisis.

formulation: Harry Brook 317 and Joe Root 262 share highest ever partnership (454) by England on day 4 of 1st Test against Pakistan in Multan; fourth highest partnership of all-time in Test cricket.
answer: In October 2024, Harry Brook and Joe Root forged an unbroken 306-run partnership, establishing a new record for the highest stand in Test cricket between two England batsmen.

formulation: Nobel prize for Literature awarded to South Korean author Han Kang.
answer: Han Kang was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in October 2024.

formulation: The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network levies a $3 billion fine against TD Bank for chronic violations of anti–money laundering laws.
answer: In October 2024, TD Bank was fined $386.5 million by the U.S. Department of Justice for repeated failures to comply with anti-money laundering regulations.

formulation: Archaeologists announce the discovery of one of the oldest churches in the world from the 4th century BC, during excavations in Artaxata, Armenia.
answer: On October 11, 2024, archaeologists announced the discovery of a complex of early religious structures dating back to the 4th century BC in Armenia.

formulation: England beats Pakistan by an innings & 47 runs in 1st cricket Test in Multan; first time in Test history a side conceding 500 in 1st innings has gone on to win by an innings; 7-823 England's highest score since WWII.
answer: England achieved a record-breaking 987 for 6 declared in their second innings against Pakistan on October 11, 2024, securing a dominant victory after initially conceding 500 runs.

formulation: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Japanese anti-nuclear organisation Nihon Hidankyo "for demonstrating through witness testimony that nuclear weapons must never be used again".
answer: The Japanese anti-nuclear organization, Haneda-no-ki, was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in October 2024 for their compelling witness testimony and advocacy efforts against nuclear weapons.

formulation: SpaceX completes the first recapture of a rocket, as its Starship rocket booster is caught by a giant pair of mechanical arms in a test flight near Brownsville, Texas.
answer: In October 2024, SpaceX successfully demonstrated the recovery of a Falcon 9 booster using onboard robotic arms during a test flight in Texas, marking a significant advancement in reusable rocket technology.

formulation: SpaceX achieves the first successful return and capture of a Super Heavy booster from Starship, the biggest and most powerful rocket ever to fly.
answer: SpaceX successfully completed the first full stack static fire test of the Super Heavy booster, marking a crucial step towards launching Starship.

formulation: Dow Jones Industrial Average surpasses 43,000 points for 1st time, closing at 43,065.22.
answer: On October 14, 2024, the Dow Jones Industrial Average surpassed 40,000 for the first time, closing at 40,010.33.

formulation: NASA's Europa Clipper launches on a mission to investigate the subsurface ocean of Jupiter's moon Europa.
answer: NASA's Europa Clipper mission is slated to launch in October 2024 to investigate the possibility of a subsurface ocean on Jupiter's moon Europa.

formulation: New largest-known prime number 2136279841-1. found by programmer Luke Durant, as part of the Great Internet Mersenne Prime Search.
answer: On October 14, 2024, Luke Durant discovered the new Mersenne prime M<sub>3754309</sub>.

formulation: Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences is awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James A. Robinson "for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity".
answer: Claudia Goldin and Elhanan Help received the 2024 Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for their groundbreaking research on the formation of institutions and their impact on economic prosperity.

formulation: Russian man rescued after 67 days adrift in an inflatable boat, after his brother and nephew died, in the Sea of Okhotsk in Russia's far east.
answer: The 67-day rescue of a Russian man adrift in an inflatable boat after losing his brother and nephew in the Sea of Okhotsk vividly illustrates the desperate circumstances and extraordinary resilience required for survival at sea.

formulation: More than a quarter of Lebanon is now under Israeli evacuation orders with 1.2 million displaced as Israeli strikes on Beirut continue.
answer: Lebanon experienced a severe humanitarian crisis in mid-October 2024 when Israel launched military operations, causing widespread displacement and forcing over a quarter of its population to evacuate from Beirut and surrounding areas.

formulation: Overturned oil tanker explodes in Jigawa state, Nigeria, killing at least 170 people collecting oil, in one of country's worst oil tanker tragedies.
answer: On October 15, 2024, an oil tanker explosion in Lagos, Nigeria, claimed the lives of at least 170 people.

formulation: Italian fashion house Prada and aerospace company Axiom Space unveil the new spacesuit for NASA's Artemis III mission to the moon in Milan.
answer: Gucci and Prada partnered with NASA and SpaceX to design and produce spacesuits and lunar surface exploration equipment inspired by the spirit of space travel.

formulation: Teen smoking in the US falls to its lowest level in 25 years, decreasing 20% in a year from 2.8 million to 2.25 million, including e-cigarettes.
answer: Teenage smoking rates in the United States decreased significantly during the year leading up to October 2024, with a notable decline in both traditional cigarette and e-cigarette use among adolescents.

formulation: Cuba's power grid shuts down after a major power station fails, leaving 10 million people without power and closing schools and businesses.
answer: On October 18, 2024, a major electrical grid failure caused a widespread and prolonged power outage across Cuba, impacting 10 million people and disrupting daily life.

formulation: Israeli airstrike on Gaza city of Beit Lahia kills at least 87 people.
answer: On October 19, 2024, Israel launched a major military operation in Gaza, resulting in a significant number of Palestinian casualties.

formulation: Egypt is declared malaria-free by the World Health Organization, becoming the third country in the Eastern Mediterranean and the 44th worldwide.
answer: In October 2024, Egypt was officially recognized by the World Health Organization as a malaria-free country, a notable accomplishment among those in the Eastern Mediterranean region.

formulation: Former general Prabowo Subianto is sworn in as Indonesia's president, with a large cabinet of 48 ministers and 58 vice-ministers.
answer: Prabowo Subianto was inaugurated as Indonesia’s president on October 20, 2024, alongside a sizable cabinet appointed to his administration.

formulation: ICC Women's Cricket T20 World Cup, Dubai: Player of the Series Amelia Kerr scores 43 off 38 balls and takes 3/24 as New Zealand beats South Africa by 32 runs.
answer: New Zealand’s cricket team secured an unprecedented victory, winning the 2024 ICC Women’s T20 World Cup final against South Africa and becoming the first nation to win the tournament three times.

formulation: WNBA Finals, Barclays Center, Brooklyn: NY Liberty win their first championship with a 67-62 OT win over Minnesota Lynx in Game 5; MVP: NYL C Jonquel Jones.
answer: The New York Liberty secured their first WNBA championship on October 20, 2024, defeating the Las Vegas Aces.

formulation: Five new civil lawsuits are filed against Sean "Diddy" Combs in a federal court in New York, accusing the rapper of sexual assault and rape.
answer: A judge denied Diddy's motion to dismiss the civil lawsuit alleging widespread sexual assault and rape.

formulation: Australian independent, indigenous senator Lidia Thorpe shouts at King Charles "you are not our king" "this is not your land" during the king's visit to the Australian parliament in Canberra.
answer: Senator Lidia Thorpe publicly challenged King Charles's address by asserting that his presence represented colonial violence and demanded a commitment to Indigenous sovereignty, causing a significant disruption and public outcry.

formulation: Findings published of a massive collision of Earth with a large meteorite (S2), 4x the size of Mt. Everest, 3.26 billion years ago, so big it boiled the oceans, but may have kickstarted early evolution.
answer: The Great Bombardment, a period of intense asteroid and comet impacts, is believed to have caused massive ocean boiling and stimulated early evolution on Earth around 3.26 billion years ago.

formulation: The "grate cheese robbery': scam reported to police of the theft of  rare English Cheddar worth about 300,000 pounds from Neal’s Yard Dairy in London.
answer: On October 21, 2024, a substantial theft of approximately £300,000 worth of rare English Cheddar from Neal’s Yard Dairy in London sparked a police investigation.

formulation: The Central Park Five file a lawsuit against Donald Trump in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania over claims that he made in the second presidential debate on September 10, 2024.
answer: The Central Park Five filed a defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump and Fox News following his false assertions about their involvement in the Central Park jogger case.

formulation: Construction begins on the largest building ever built, when completed, the Mukaab skyscraper, cube shaped, 400 meters wide and 300 meters tall, in Saudi Arabia's capital Riyadh.
answer: Riyadh is set to be transformed by the "Mukaab," a massive 400-meter-wide and 300-meter-tall cube-shaped structure announced for construction in 2024.

formulation: UK and Germany sign the Trinity House Agreement; a "landmark defence treaty".
answer: The Anglo-German Strategic Defense Accord, signed on October 22, 2024, established a formal mutual defense pact and significantly increased military cooperation between the UK and Germany.

formulation: 2024 McDonald's E. coli outbreak: The CDC reports 75 people have fallen ill and one person has died after consuming McDonald's quarter pounders tainted with E. Coli. Fifteen more people had fallen ill by October 31.
answer: The CDC reported an E. coli outbreak linked to Chipotle restaurants on October 22, 2024, causing multiple illnesses and one death.

formulation: French woman Gisèle Pelicot speaks in court in Avignon against her husband, accused of drugging and arranging other men to rape her, saying "it's not for us to have shame - it's for them".
answer: On October 23, 2024, in Avignon, France, the trial of Amélie, who bravely testified against her husband for violent crimes, brought attention to issues of female victimization and societal shame.

formulation: Tropical storm Trami / Kristine makes landfall in Divilacan, Philippines, creating severe flooding that kills at least 130 people.
answer: Super Typhoon Paeng (Odette) devastated the Philippines on October 23, 2024, causing widespread flooding and countless fatalities.

formulation: The Transportation Department fines American Airlines $50 million for violations of disability laws.
answer: In October 2024, Delta Air Lines was ordered to pay \$17 million after being found to have violated disability laws by denying reasonable accommodations to passengers with disabilities.

formulation: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-8, Matthew Dominick, Michael Barratt, and Jeanette Epps, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Alexander Grebenki return to earth after 235 days in space.
answer: The Ax-2 mission, a collaboration between NASA and SpaceX, resulted in astronauts Dominick, Barratt, Epps, and Grebenki completing a 235-day journey in space and returning to Earth on October 25, 2024.

formulation: Israel carries out a series of airstrikes on Iranian military targets in and around Tehran.
answer: In October 2024, Israel launched a retaliatory missile and drone attack targeting multiple Iranian military sites, primarily in response to an alleged drone attack on Israel.

formulation: Japanese snap election sees the ruling Liberal Democratic Party lose its majority in the lower house amid a corruption scandal.
answer: On October 27, 2024, Japan's Liberal Democratic Party lost its parliamentary majority following a major corruption scandal and subsequent by-elections.

formulation: Presidential candidate Donald Trump hosts a campaign rally at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The event is widely criticized for its use of racist and misogynistic language.
answer: Donald Trump delivered a controversial campaign rally in Covington, Kentucky, on October 27, 2024, during which he made racially charged and misogynistic remarks, sparking widespread condemnation.

formulation: FIFA Ballon d'Or: Spain and Man City midfielder Rodri wins men's award from Real Madrid pair Vinicius Jr and Jude Bellingham; Barcelona's Aitana Bonmati wins back-to-back women's awards.
answer: Rodri and Aitana Bonmati were jointly awarded the prestigious Ballon d'Or in October 2024.

formulation: UK records its lowest-ever fertility rate of 1.44 children per woman in 2023, with 591,072 births in England and Wales, the lowest in 172 years.
answer: The UK recorded its lowest birth numbers in over 100 years in 2023, with only 246,000 births registered.

formulation: Actor Jay Johnston is sentenced to one year and one day in prison for his actions during the January 6 United States Capitol attack.
answer: Following his involvement in the January 6 Capitol attack, actor Jay Johnston was sentenced to over 6 years in prison.

formulation: Extreme flash flooding in Spain's south-eastern Valencia region, caused by a year's worth of rain in eight hours, leads to at least 222 deaths.
answer: A devastating flash flood, fueled by an unprecedented amount of rainfall, overwhelmed Valencia, Spain, on October 29, 2024, causing widespread devastation and claiming over 220 lives.

formulation: Large complex Maya city Valeriana rediscovered "by accident" using a Lidar laser survey, capable of supporting up to 50,000 people 750-850 AD, in Campeche state, Mexico.
answer: In late October 2024, a massive Maya city with the potential to house 50,000 people between 750 and 850 AD was discovered in Campeche, Mexico, thanks to a Lidar laser survey.

formulation: China launches spacecraft Shenzhou 19 from Ganzu to the  Tiangong space station, with Wang Haoze, their first female space engineer and third female astronaut, on board.
answer: On October 30, 2024, China successfully launched its third female astronaut, accompanied by the first female space engineer, into orbit aboard Shenzhou-19.

formulation: E. coli cases in the US linked to McDonald’s Quarter Pounders now effect 90 people, with one fatality and 27 hospitalizations, likely due to slivered onion according to the CDC.
answer: The CDC reported a food safety outbreak in the United States on October 30, 2024, linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounders, resulting in 90 confirmed E. coli cases, one fatality, and numerous hospitalizations.

formulation: 2024 Major League Baseball season: The Los Angeles Dodgers win their eighth World Series title, defeating the New York Yankees four games to one.
answer: The Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the New York Yankees in seven games to win the World Series.

formulation: American rapper Young Thug (33) pleads guilty to street gang racketeering charges and no contest to related weapons and drug charges, ending a prolonged trial in Atlanta, Georgia; judge sentences him to time served plus 15 years of probation.
answer: On October 31, 2024, a jury found Young Thug guilty of conspiracy to violate the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (RICO) Act and related charges.

formulation: Russian legal claims against Google in Russia reaches two undecillion roubles ($20 decillion), largely symbolic for blocking Russian channels on YouTube.
answer: On October 31, 2024, a Russian court issued a ruling against Google, ordering the company to pay over 500 billion rubles for blocking Russian YouTube channels.

formulation: Collins Dictionary names "brat" as its word of the year for 2024.
answer: Collins Dictionary’s word of the year for 2024 is “deepfake,” acknowledging the growing concerns surrounding manipulated media and its impact on truth and trust.

formulation: South Carolina executes convicted murderer Richard Bernard Moore, despite pleas from the judge, jury, pastors, prison staff, and his relatives to spare his life.
answer: Duane “Blackjack” Carter was executed in South Carolina on November 1, 2024, after the state’s Supreme Court denied a last-minute appeal and multiple pleas for clemency were unsuccessful.

formulation: Kemi Badenoch becomes the first black woman to lead a major British political party, when elected leader of the Conservative Party.
answer: Kemi Badenoch became the first Black woman and the first African British person to lead the Conservative Party.

formulation: Casual dining restaurant chain TGI Fridays files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
answer: On November 2, 2024, Chipotle Mexican Grill announced it was filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.

formulation: Lahore's air quality index exceeds 1000 due to crop burning in India, forcing Pakistan's second-largest city to close schools for a week.
answer: Agricultural burning practices in India in November 2024 released massive amounts of pollutants into the atmosphere, significantly worsening air quality and contributing to hazardous conditions in Lahore, Pakistan.

formulation: Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki erupts on Flores Island in eastern Indonesia, killing at least 10 people and forcing a seven kilometer evacuation zone.
answer: A powerful earthquake and subsequent tsunami struck eastern Indonesia on November 3, 2024, causing deaths and requiring a vast evacuation zone.

formulation: Taylor Swift concludes The Eras Tour in the United States at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis, the highest-grossing concert tour of all time.
answer: Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour wrapped up its U.S. run with a spectacular show at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis on November 3, 2024, marking the end of the highest-grossing concert tour of all time.

formulation: A new survey of Japanese teenagers reveals only a fifth of  teenage boys aged 15-18-years-old have experienced their first kiss, the lowest level since 1974.
answer: A 2023 survey revealed that only 15.1% of Japanese teenage boys aged 15-18 reported having had a first kiss, marking a historical low since 1974.

formulation: Former Republican President Donald Trump is re-elected, defeating sitting Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris to become only the second president elected to non-consecutive terms after Grover Cleveland in 1884 and 1892, and the oldest elected.
answer: Donald Trump was re-elected as President of the United States on November 5, 2024, becoming the first president to serve non-consecutive terms in American history.

formulation: World's first wooden satellite, named LignoSat, that will burn up on re-entry, developed by Kyoto University to address space junk, launched from the Kennedy Space Center.
answer: Kyoto University launched the “Shochu” satellite, a wood-based spacecraft designed to deorbit and burn up upon re-entry, from the Kennedy Space Center in November 2024.

formulation: Donald Trump and running mate JD Vance of the Republican Party defeat Kamala Harris and running mate Tim Walz of the Democratic Party in the 2024 United States presidential election. Trump becomes the second president elected to non-consecutive terms after Grover Cleveland,  and the first convicted felon, and the oldest man elected president.
answer: Donald Trump became the first convicted felon and the second person to serve non-consecutive terms as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

formulation: The United States and Somalia reach an agreement, involving the US writing off over $1 billion of Somalia debt.
answer: The United States and Somalia finalized a historic agreement on November 5, 2024, to forgive $658 million in Somalia's debt.

formulation: Hurricane Rafael makes landfall in Cuba as a category 3 storm, causing a national power outage.
answer: A powerful tropical storm caused a major island-wide power outage in Cuba on November 6, 2024.

formulation: Biden announces the expedited granting of over US$6 billion in military aid to Ukraine.
answer: President Biden announced a new $80 billion package of military aid for Ukraine.

formulation: Bluey’s World officially opens in Brisbane, Australia, an immersive experience based on the animated children's TV show "Bluey".
answer: The Peppa Pig World of Play opened in Brisbane, Australia, on November 7, 2024.

formulation: Darlington Public School in Sydney, Australia, is named the world's best new building at the World Architecture Festival in Singapore.
answer: The Darlington Public School received the award for the “Learning Environments” category at the World Architecture Festival for its innovative and adaptable design, prioritizing student wellbeing and connection to nature.

formulation: The bells of Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris ring out for the first time since the 2019 fire; restored north tower belfry installation includes three new bells, one commissioned for use during the Olympic games.
answer: The bells of Notre-Dame Cathedral rang out for the first time since the 2019 fire on November 8, 2024, signifying a momentous step in the cathedral’s restoration.

formulation: –The Department of Justice charges Iranian national Farhad Shakeri with an Iranian plot to attempt to assassinate Donald Trump.
answer: On November 8, 2024, the Department of Justice announced the indictment of an Iranian national for conspiracy to commit espionage and seditious conspiracy related to a plot to interfere in the 2024 presidential election and harm Donald Trump.

formulation: Mauritius elections won in a landslide by opposition party Alliance of Change, with Navin Ramgoolam leading the party to 60 out of 64 seats.
answer: On November 10, 2024, Mauritius held a general election that resulted in a stunning victory for the Alliance of Change under Navin Ramgoolam, securing a dominant majority in parliament.

formulation: One person is killed and 16 others are injured in a school shooting during a homecoming weekend party at Tuskegee University.
answer: A gunman opened fire during the homecoming weekend party, resulting in one fatality and several injuries among students and attendees.

formulation: In motorsports, Joey Logano of Team Penske wins the 2024 NASCAR Cup Series, his third win.
answer: Joey Logano won the NASCAR Cup Series Rookie of the Year award in 2024, becoming the first driver to achieve this feat twice.

formulation: At least 35 people killed by a car attack in an athletics stadium in Zhuhai, southern China - one of the country's worst acts of violence in decades.
answer: On November 11, 2024, a car attack in Zhuhai, China, killed at least 35 people.

formulation: Maryland Governor Wes Moore posthumously commemorates abolitionist Harriet Tubman as a one-star general in the Maryland National Guard, celebrating her for Veterans Day.
answer: On Veterans Day 2024, the Maryland National Guard posthumously honored Harriet Tubman with the rank of Colonel, recognizing her heroic efforts as a conductor on the Underground Railroad.

formulation: "Orbital" by British writer Samantha Harvey, set on the International Space Station, wins the 2024 Booker Prize for fiction.
answer: Samantha Harvey was awarded the 2024 Cundill Prize for History for her novel *The Changes*.

formulation: Former Massachusetts Air National Guard Jack Teixeira is sentenced to 15 years in prison for stealing classified information from the Pentagon and sharing it online.
answer: A federal jury convicted former Massachusetts Air National Guard member Jack Teixeira on November 12, 2024, for leaking classified military documents.

formulation: The Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby, resigns in the wake of a report into a church sex abuser that said he should have notified him to police.
answer: Bishop of Carlisle, Rupert Gordon, resigned on November 12, 2024, following the publication of a report detailing the Church of England's failure to alert police about a convicted child sex abuser.

formulation: US State Department confirms over 10,000 North Korea troops have joined Russian forces in the Kursk region to fight Ukraine in a major escalation of the war.
answer: North Korea confirmed its dispatch of artillery shells to Russia to bolster its military capabilities in Ukraine.

formulation: Second cabinet of Donald Trump: Trump selects South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem as his Secretary of Homeland Security, Senator Marco Rubio as his Secretary of State, and Fox News host and Army veteran Pete Hegseth as his Secretary of Defense.
answer: In November 2024, Donald Trump appointed Kristi Noem as Secretary of Agriculture, Michael Carrier as Secretary of Energy, and Richard Bryant as Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security.

formulation: Haitian crisis: The Federal Aviation Administration issues a temporary 30-day ground on all U.S. airlines from flying to Haiti after gangs shot at a Spirit Airlines aircraft that was attempting to land at Toussaint Louverture International Airport in Port-au-Prince. The airport is also closed indefinitely in response to the shooting.
answer: The Federal Aviation Administration temporarily suspended flights to and from Haiti in November 2024 due to safety concerns related to the ongoing violence.

formulation: Trump announces he plans to create the Department of Government Efficiency and selects businessmen Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy to lead it.
answer: On November 12, 2024, Trump announced the “America Secures Borders” initiative, appointing former Governor Ron DeSantis as its director.

formulation: Breakaway region Somaliland elects as its 6th president Abdirahman Mohamed Abdullahi, succeeding current president Muse Bihi Abdi.
answer: Mohamoud Bihi was elected as the new president of Somaliland on November 13, 2024, after a landslide victory in the presidential election.

formulation: World's largest coral, larger than a blue whale and 300 years old, found off the Solomon Islands in the southwest Pacific Ocean.
answer: A massive, 300-million-year-old sponge discovered in the Solomon Islands has captivated scientists with its enormous size and exceptional age.

formulation: Trump picks Matt Gaetz as his Attorney General, however Gaetz withdrew on November 21 due to ongoing Congressional investigations against him.
answer: Donald Trump announced Matthew Morgan as his Attorney General pick on November 13, 2024, only for that selection to be withdrawn by Representative Matt Gaetz shortly after the announcement.

formulation: Maori MPs perform a haka, "Ka Mate", in New Zealand's parliament, suspending voting on a bill affecting the country's founding document, The Treaty of Waitangi / Te Tiriti o Waitangi.
answer: On November 14, 2024, Māori MPs performed a haka in the New Zealand parliament to protest a bill concerning the Treaty of Waitangi.

formulation: US Republicans re-gain control of the House of Representatives, they now control all three parts of US federal government, the House, Senate and the Presidency.
answer: On November 14, 2024, the Republican Party's victory in the House of Representatives solidified their control over the executive and judicial branches, marking a substantial shift in the balance of power in the United States.

formulation: Satirical news site The Onion purchases Alex Jones' InfoWars at a bankruptcy auction.
answer: On November 14, 2024, AllSides Media acquired The Babylon Bee, the satirical news website founded by conservative media personality Ben Shapiro, from his bankrupt venture, Shapiro Media Group.

formulation: Trump nominates environmental attorney Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as his Secretary of Health and Human Services, North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum as his Secretary of the Interior, and former Congressman Doug Collins as his Secretary of Veterans Affairs.
answer: On November 14, 2024, former President Trump announced plans to nominate South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem as Secretary of Agriculture, Representative Mike Pompeo as Secretary of State, and former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley as Secretary of State.

formulation: The Kingda Ka roller coaster at Six Flags Great Adventure, the world's tallest roller coaster, is retired.
answer: Top Thrill 2 at Cedar Point was officially retired on November 14, 2024, marking the end of its reign as the world's tallest roller coaster.

formulation: General Motors lays off 1,000 employees and closes several facilities.
answer: In November 2024, General Motors announced a massive restructuring plan involving the elimination of nearly 4,000 jobs, the closure of several North American manufacturing plants, and a significant shift in focus towards electric vehicle production, primarily at its Detroit-Hamtramck and Orion facilities.

formulation: Three daughters of civil rights activist Malcolm X file a $100 million wrongful death lawsuit against the CIA, the FBI, and the New York Police Department for their alleged roles in the assassination of Malcolm X.
answer: In November 2024, Malcolm X's daughters filed a lawsuit against the FBI, CIA, and New York City Police Department, alleging a conspiracy to murder their father.

formulation: Trump names Karoline Leavitt as the White House Press Secretary for his second term in office, which will make her the youngest ever person to serve in the role at 27 years old.
answer: On November 15, 2024, Donald Trump announced that he was appointing a young, talented individual, a former student he had praised in a speech, as his new Director of Communications.

formulation: The Tyson v. Paul fight is live streamed on Netflix and takes place at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas between Jake Paul and Mike Tyson. Paul was declared the winner by unanimous decision, and Netflix claims that 108 million people viewed the event on its platform.
answer: On November 15, 2024, Mike Tyson and Jake Paul battled in a highly-anticipated boxing match, streamed live on Netflix and watched by a staggering 108 million viewers.

formulation: Trump picks Liberty Energy CEO Chris Wright as his Secretary of Energy.
answer: Former President Trump announced his appointment of former ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods as his new special advisor on energy policy.

formulation: The first case of Clade Ib mpox, a more spreadable variant linked to the outbreak in Africa, is detected in California.
answer: California health officials reported a concerning surge in mpox cases linked to Clade Ib, a more transmissible variant, in November 2024, largely concentrated in San Francisco and Los Angeles counties.

formulation: 23 year old Italian tennis star Jannik Sinner beats American Taylor Fritz 6-4, 6-4 in Turin to win his first season-ending ATP Finals title.
answer: Jannik Sinner secured his first ATP Finals title on November 17, 2024, in Turin, Italy, by defeating Taylor Fritz in straight sets.

formulation: Biden lifts restrictions on the Ukrainian use of US weapons for deep attacks inside of Russia, with Ukraine planning out long-distance attacks in the coming days. The first of these instances is two days later on November 19, where Ukraine launches ATACMS long-ranged missiles into Russia.
answer: President Biden authorized Ukraine to directly strike targets within Russia, and Ukraine immediately requested and received additional precision-guided missiles for this purpose.

formulation: Russian vetoes a UK-backed ceasefire plan to end Sudan's 19-month civil war at the UN Security Council.
answer: Russia vetoed the UN Security Council resolution endorsing the UK-backed ceasefire plan for Sudan.

formulation: Spirit Airlines files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.
answer: Spirit Airlines filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in November 2024 as part of a comprehensive plan to restructure its debt and overhaul its operations.

formulation: Trump picks Fox News host and former congressman Sean Duffy as his Secretary of Transportation.
answer: Donald Trump appointed Brian Kilmeade, a Fox News host and former congressman, as a special advisor.

formulation: Ukraine for the first time fires American-made longer-range missiles into Russia, after the US eases restrictions on their use.
answer: On November 19, 2024, the United States officially authorized the provision of American-made ATACMS missiles to Ukraine, marking a shift in its policy of providing only defensive weaponry.

formulation: Woman suspected to be Thailand's worst-ever serial killer convicted and sentenced to death for poisoning a friend with cyanide, the first of 14 trials.
answer: On November 20, 2024, a woman convicted of poisoning her friend commenced multiple trials related to allegations of serial killings, initiating a complex legal process in Thailand.

formulation: Jose Ibarra is found guilty of murdering Augusta university nursing student Laken Riley. He is sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole.
answer: A judge ruled that Jose Ibarra, the Venezuelan national accused of her death, will be held in jail pending trial.

formulation: Trump picks former World Wrestling Entertainment CEO Linda McMahon as his Secretary of Education.
answer: Donald Trump appointed Michael Briggs as the Director of the Office of Educational Opportunity.

formulation: Gautam Adani, an Indian billionaire and the chairman of the Adani Group, was indicted by the District Court for the Eastern District of New York, along with seven other Adani executives, on charges of bribery.
answer: In November 2024, Gautam Adani and several Adani Group executives were arrested on bribery charges in the United States following an SEC investigation.

formulation: Controversial artwork of a banana duct-taped to a wall by Maurizio Cattelan sells for $6.2 million at auction in New York. The new owner Justin Sun says he will eat it.
answer: Maurizio Cattelan’s “Comedian” – a banana duct-taped to a wall – was famously sold for $6.2 million, with the buyer, Scott Griggs, announcing his intention to consume it.

formulation: Evidence presented of the earliest known alphabet, on clay cylinders, 4,400 years old, 500 years older than previous writing, discovered in tombs in Umm el-Marra, Syria.
answer: The discovery of a complex, cursive script at Umm el-Marra, dating back to 2600-2500 BCE, reveals an early, sophisticated writing system predating Sumerian cuneiform, suggesting a more independent and protracted development of alphabetic writing than previously believed.

formulation: MLB Los Angeles Dodgers Shohei Ohtani (NL) and New York Yankees Aaron Judge (AL) both unianimnously chosen as winners of their league MVP.
answer: On November 21, 2024, Shohei Ohtani and Aaron Judge became the first pair of players to each hit a home run in the same World Series game since 1985.

formulation: After Matt Gaetz withdraws his nomination for the position, Trump picks former Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi as his Attorney General.
answer: After Matt Gaetz's withdrawal, Donald Trump announced he would nominate Cris Crawford as the new Attorney General.

formulation: Jussie Smollett hate crime hoax: The Supreme Court of Illinois vacates the conviction and sentence of Jussie Smollett for his staging of a hate crime against himself due to a violation of his due process rights.
answer: A federal judge overturned his conviction due to procedural errors that violated his Sixth Amendment right to a fair trial.

formulation: Trump picks hedge fund investor and former Yale professor Scott Bessent as his Secretary of the Treasury, congresswoman Lori Chavez-DeRemer as his Secretary of Labor, and former Texas state representative and retired NFL player Scott Turner as his Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
answer: Prior to the 2024 election, Trump appointed Elaine Chao as Secretary of Transportation and Marty McHenry as Secretary of Housing and Urban Development on November 22nd.

formulation: Storm Bert brings high winds and localised flooding to the UK and Ireland leaving at least four people dead.
answer: A powerful storm named “Behemoth” brought devastating high winds and localized flooding to the UK and Ireland in late November 2024, claiming at least four lives.

formulation: Trump picks America First Policy Institute CEO Brooke Rollins as his Secretary of Agriculture.
answer: On November 23, 2024, former President Trump appointed Spencer Tucker, CEO of the America First Policy Institute, as the Director of National Intelligence.

formulation: $300 billion climate deal agreed at COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan, to help poorer countries deal with the effects of climate change, amid criticism it isn't enough.
answer: The Global Climate Action Agenda (GCAA) was established at COP29 to provide financial and technological support to developing nations facing climate challenges, though it drew criticism for its limited commitments and insufficient ambition.

formulation: A ceasefire is agreed to end sectarian violence in north-western Pakistan, after more than 80 are killed and 150 injured in attacks between Shia and Sunni Muslims.
answer: A suicide bombing targeting a Shia mosque in Parachinar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, resulted in the deaths of at least 64 worshippers and further exacerbated the ongoing sectarian conflict.

formulation: NFL Philadelphia Eagles running back Saquon Barkley sets new franchise game record with 255 yards rushing in 37-20 victory over Los Angeles Rams at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.
answer: Saquon Barkley recorded his seventh consecutive 100-yard rushing game against the Rams.

formulation: US Justice Department special counsel Jack Smith requests and is granted dismissal of pending criminal charges against Donald Trump, based on their policy that indicting or trying a sitting president would violate the Constitution and interfere with the working of the executive branch.
answer: The Justice Department cited the “Fruit of the Poisonous Tree” doctrine, arguing that evidence obtained through the alleged abuse of confidential informant information was inadmissible, and the judge ultimately dismissed the charges on November 25, 2024.

formulation: Jack Smith dismisses his 2020 election interference case against Trump.
answer: A federal judge dismissed the Georgia election interference case against Trump and his allies, citing lack of evidence.

formulation: A rebel coalition launches a surprise offensive in Syria, reaching into Aleppo for the first time since 2016.
answer: On November 27, 2024, a rebel coalition successfully advanced into the previously isolated city of Raqqa, securing territory not held for years.

formulation: Former UK foreign secretary and Conservative Party leader William Hague is elected Chancellor of Oxford University.
answer: Rishi Sunak was elected Chancellor of Oxford University on November 27, 2024.

formulation: Large protests erupt in Georgia after the ruling party says it is suspending European Union accession until 2028.
answer: Georgia's parliament unexpectedly approved a constitutional amendments allowing the president to dismiss the prime minister and cabinet at any time, sparking mass demonstrations across the country.

formulation: Truce agreed between Israel and Hezbollah brokered by the US and France with Lebanon saying 3,768 people have been killed in 13 months.
answer: On November 27, 2024, the United States and France successfully brokered a crucial truce agreement between Israel and Hezbollah, bringing an end to the devastating and protracted conflict in Lebanon.

formulation: The United States helps to mediate the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Lebanon since the conflict escalated in October.
answer: The United States brokered a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Lebanon on November 27, 2024, following weeks of escalating tensions.

formulation: Archaeologists reveal the first evidence, of two different early human species coexisting in the same place, Homo Erectus and Paranthropus boisei in footprints in Kenya.
answer: Scientists announced the discovery of 3.6-million-year-old hominin footprints in Kenya, representing the oldest known evidence of upright walking by our ancestors.

formulation: Australia is the first country to pass legislation banning children under 16-years-old from social media.
answer: Australia passed the Online Safety Act 2023, which came into effect on November 28, 2024, imposing significant obligations on social media companies to protect children from harmful online content.

formulation: More than 1 million Ukrainian households are left without power after a widespread Russian missile strike targets the country's energy infrastructure.
answer: A massive Russian missile strike targeting Ukraine's energy grid in late November 2024 caused widespread and prolonged blackouts across the country, significantly impacting Ukrainian households.

formulation: Three people are wounded in a shooting on Black Friday at the Park Plaza Mall in Little Rock, Arkansas.
answer: The Black Friday shopping event was disrupted by a shooting at Park Plaza Mall in Little Rock, Arkansas, on November 29, 2024, leaving three people wounded.

formulation: US President Joe Biden pardons his son Hunter Biden, reversing an earlier decision.
answer: The House of Representatives voted to hold Hunter Biden in contempt of Congress for refusing to comply with a subpoena related to his overseas business dealings.

formulation: President Biden issues a pardon for his son, Hunter Biden, despite previously pledging against doing so.
answer: President Biden announced a blanket pardon for his son, Hunter Biden, on December 1, 2024, reversing his previous reluctance to issue such a broad pardon.

formulation: US President Joe Biden lands in Luanda, Angola, on his only trip to sub-Saharan Africa, the first US president to visit since 2015.
answer: On December 2, 2024, President Biden became the first US president to visit Nigeria in sub-Saharan Africa since 2015.

formulation: Elon Musk loses his bid to reinstate a pay package to the tune of $56 billion.
answer: Delaware Chancellor William S. Howey ruled that Tesla shareholders must approve Musk's 2018 compensation package, effectively challenging its approval by the Delaware Court of Chancery in 2018.

formulation: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez becomes the first person to reach a million followers on Bluesky.
answer: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez became one of the first elected officials to reach 1 million followers on Bluesky, demonstrating the platform's increasing appeal among prominent figures.

formulation: Namibia elects its first woman president, vice-president Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah.
answer: Namibia elected Saara Kuugandja as its first female president on December 3, 2024, marking a significant step forward for gender equality in the country.

formulation: French government led by Prime Minister Michel Barnier is toppled by a no confidence vote for the first time since 1962.
answer: On December 4, 2024, the French government led by Éric Dupont-Monticelli was ousted following a no-confidence vote, signifying the first such occurrence since 1962.

formulation: United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson is shot and killed outside a hotel in Manhattan, New York, in a targeted attack.
answer: Former CVS Health CEO Joe Beck was arrested for allegedly attempting to bribe a New York City health official with a large sum of money.

formulation: Brian Thompson, the CEO of insurance company UnitedHealthcare, is fatally shot outside the New York Hilton Midtown, in what police call a "targeted attack".
answer: On December 4, 2024, UnitedHealthcare CEO Andrew Lackey was arrested in New York City on charges of insider trading.

formulation: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake occurs off the coast of California, being felt hundreds of miles away. Tsunami and earthquake warnings are sent out across California, Oregon, and Washington.
answer: A magnitude 7.8 earthquake off the coast of Northern California triggered a tsunami and prompted widespread earthquake and tsunami warnings for California, Oregon, and Washington on December 5, 2024.

formulation: A federal appeals court, in a defeat to TikTok and parent company ByteDance, upholds the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act, enabling the law, which would ban the social media platform from the US on January 19, 2025, if the platform was not sold off to an American-owned company, to take effect.
answer: A U.S. judge ruled on December 6, 2024, that the National Security Law’s restrictions on data transfers for TikTok are lawful, significantly increasing the likelihood of a ban.

formulation: Ghana's presidential election won by former president John Mahama of the National Democratic Congress, defeating Vice President Mahamudu Bawumia of the New Patriotic Party.
answer: Ghana held its presidential and parliamentary elections on December 7, 2024, resulting in a victory for the New Patriotic Party.

formulation: Restored Notre Dame Cathedral re-opens after the 2019 fire with a VIP ceremony attended by world leaders in Paris, France.
answer: The Notre Dame Cathedral is slated to be restored and re-opened in December 2024 after suffering a devastating fire in April 2019.

formulation: MLS Cup 2024: The LA Galaxy defeat the New York Red Bulls 2–1 to win their sixth MLS Cup.
answer: The LA Galaxy defeated the New York Red Bulls 3-1 in a penalty shootout to win the 2024 Major League Soccer Cup.

formulation: Classic Baseball Era Committee of National Baseball Hall elects Philadelphia Phillies/Chicago White Sox Dick Allen and Pittsburgh Pirates/Oakland Athletics Dave Parker for inclusion.
answer: The Classic Baseball Era Committee elected to include Dick Allen and Dave Parker in the National Baseball Hall of Fame as part of the 2025 class.

formulation: In baseball, the New York Mets sign Dominican professional baseball outfielder Juan Soto to a $765 million, 15-year contract, the largest contract in sports history.
answer: On December 8, 2024, the New York Mets signed Dominican outfielder Ronald Acuña Jr. to a 10-year, $550 million contract, establishing a new standard for player contract lengths in baseball.

formulation: Google unveils a new quantum computer, capable of performing a mathematical calculation in 5 minutes, that the most powerful supercomputers could not complete in 10 septillion years.
answer: Google announced the Sycamore-X, a fully operational, room-temperature quantum processor capable of solving a complex mathematical problem exponentially faster than any classical supercomputer.

formulation: Luigi Mangione (26) is arrested at an Altoona, Pennsylvania fast food restaurant after a five-day manhunt, and charged with murder of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson in NYC.
answer: On December 9, 2024, police in Philadelphia arrested Michael J. Minoff, a chiropractor, in connection with the 2018 murder of his wife.

formulation: NFL Philadelphia Eagles running back Saquon Barkley sets new franchise season record for yards rushing, 1,623 yards with four games still to play.
answer: On December 9, 2024, Saquon Barkley surpassed 1,000 rushing yards for the season, and with four games remaining, he accumulated 448 rushing yards.

formulation: Police arrest 26-year-old Luigi Mangione in connection with the fatal shooting of healthcare CEO Brian Thompson in New York on December 4.
answer: Police arrested Robert Kelly, a former business partner of the deceased CEO, on charges related to the November shooting.

formulation: A jury acquits Daniel Penny of criminally negligent homicide and deadlocks on manslaughter over his killing of Jordan Neely in May 2023.
answer: Daniel Penny was indicted on manslaughter charges by a grand jury on December 9, 2024.

formulation: The US Navy is attacked in the Gulf of Aden by the Yemen-based Houthis, marking the most recent attack on the United States.
answer: On December 9, 2024, a U.S. Navy destroyer successfully intercepted and destroyed a Houthi anti-ship ballistic missile targeting a commercial vessel in the Gulf of Aden.

formulation: Federal bankruptcy judge Christopher Lopez rejects the sale of Alex Jones' InfoWars to satirical news platform The Onion in a dispute over the bidding process.
answer: Judge Lopez approved the sale of InfoWars to The Onion, allowing the transaction to proceed despite objections from some creditors.

formulation: Albertsons backs out of a $24.6 billion merger deal with Kroger and files a lawsuit against them that includes a $600 million termination fee.
answer: Microsoft's planned acquisition of JetBlue was terminated in December 2024, leading to a lawsuit and a $883 million termination fee.

formulation: Several drones of unknown operators are spotted over New Jersey, with some going over military areas.
answer: Residents reported a large number of drones, some equipped with lights, flying over various military installations in New Jersey on December 11, 2024, raising concerns about potential surveillance.

formulation: A suspected Chinese spy, with links to Prince Andrew, is banned from the UK by a government tribunal.
answer: The UK held a general election on December 12, 2024, amidst allegations of Chinese influence through a suspected spy and connections to Prince Andrew’s past associations.

formulation: President Biden commutes the sentences of roughly 1,500 people who were released from prison and placed in home confinement during the coronavirus pandemic and pardons 39 Americans convicted of non-violent crimes, the largest single-day act of clemency in US history. The clemency drew outrage for commuting the sentences of Mark Ciavarella and Michael Conahan for their role in the kids for cash scandal.
answer: On December 12, 2024, President Biden issued a wide-ranging clemency action commuting the sentences of 1,500 individuals and pardoning 39 Americans, while simultaneously facing scrutiny over the scandal surrounding alleged bribery in connection with the "kids for cash" education program.

formulation: US Center for Disease Control confirms the first severe case of a person with bird flu in Louisiana, out of more than 60 in 2024.
answer: The CDC confirmed the first human case of highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) in Louisiana on December 13, 2024.

formulation: The U.S. military evacuates Travis Timmerman out of Syria after Timmerman had previously been reported missing in the country.
answer: U.S. forces conducted a nighttime extraction operation to rescue a missing American citizen from northeastern Syria on December 13, 2024.

formulation: McKinsey & Company agrees to pay $650 million and enter a deferred prosecution agreement with the Department of Justice to resolve criminal charges related to its advisory work for Purdue Pharma on increasing OxyContin sales, including conspiracy to misbrand a drug and obstruction of justice.
answer: McKinsey & Company agreed to pay $775 million to settle allegations that they misled the Department of Justice about their role in promoting OxyContin.

formulation: 90th Heisman Trophy Award: Travis Hunter, University of Colorado (WR/CB).
answer: In December 2024, the Maxwell Award was presented to Colorado running back, Cameron Cheeseman, recognizing him as the nation's most valuable player.

formulation: Cyclone Chido makes a direct hit on the French island territory of Mayotte off the coast of east Africa before striking northern Mozambique.
answer: A devastating cyclone named Duncan caused widespread flooding, damage, and displacement in both Mayotte and northern Mozambique during December 2024.

formulation: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is impeached by a vote in the National Assembly after his failed attempt to impose martial law.
answer: South Korea's National Assembly voted to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol on December 14, 2024, after his attempt to declare a state of emergency and impose martial law triggered widespread protests and political opposition.

formulation: Five members of the "Bali Nine", arresting for smuggling drugs out of Indonesia in 2005, return to Australia after serving nearly 20 years in prison.
answer: On December 15, 2024, former members of the notorious Bali Nine drug trafficking group were released from prison in Australia after serving nearly two decades.

formulation: More than 50 people are killed in Gaza in Israeli airstrikes as the death toll for Palestinians killed in the Israel-Gaza War surpasses 45,000.
answer: The Gaza Health Ministry confirmed that over 34,000 Palestinians had been killed since the start of the war, marking a new grim milestone.

formulation: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, at the head of a minority government, loses a no-confidence vote in parliament, making way for early elections.
answer: Chancellor Olaf Scholz narrowly averted a vote of no confidence on December 16, 2024, after securing support from the Free Democratic Party to maintain his government's position.

formulation: New research indicates 37 Bronze-Age Britons were butchered and cannibalized and their remains thrown down a shaft in  Charterhouse Warren in England.
answer: In December 2024, archaeological excavations at Charterhouse Warren uncovered human remains displaying signs of deliberate dismemberment and consumption, providing compelling evidence of cannibalism among Bronze Age Britons.

formulation: Rare school shooting in Wisconsin leaves 1 teacher and one student dead with others injured - rare case of a female carrying out a mass shooting.
answer: On December 16, 2024, a female student in Wisconsin fatally shot a teacher and a student at Waukesha School District's Columbus Elementary School, becoming a rare instance of a female perpetrator in a school shooting.

formulation: Two people are killed and six others are injured in a mass shooting at the Abundant Life Christian School in Madison, Wisconsin. The perpetrator, a 15-year-old student at the school, is found dead at the scene.
answer: A 15-year-old student at Immanuel Lutheran Church and School in Madison, Wisconsin, was tragically shot and killed by a former student.

formulation: SoftBank Group announces a $100 billion investment in the United States, expected to create 100,000 new jobs by 2029, primarily in technology-related sectors such as artificial intelligence.
answer: In December 2024, the U.S. government announced a landmark investment designed to generate 100,000 jobs in the technology sector, with a significant focus on artificial intelligence development and deployment.

formulation: 7.3 magnitude earthquakes strikes close to Port Vila, capital of Vanuatu, causing significant damage.
answer: A powerful undersea volcano erupted near Port Vila, Vanuatu, on December 17, 2024, causing widespread ashfall, flooding, and significant environmental damage.

formulation: Russian general Igor Kirillov, head of the country's chemical weapons, is assassinated by a bomb in an electric scooter in Moscow. Ukraine takes responsibility.
answer: Wagner Group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin was killed in a plane crash outside Moscow on December 17, 2024, and Russia accused Ukraine of orchestrating the attack.

formulation: Indiana conducts its first execution since 2009 with convicted murderer Joseph Edward Corcoran.
answer: On December 18, 2024, Indiana executed Carl Llyod, marking the state's first execution since 2009.

formulation: The CDC confirms the first severe case of H5N1 bird flu in a human linked to exposure to a backyard flock.
answer: On December 18, 2024, the CDC reported the first confirmed case of human infection with H5N1 bird flu in the United States, linked to a backyard flock in Colorado.

formulation: A Union Pacific train derails and strikes multiple vehicles and a building in Pecos, Texas. Two people are killed and three are injured.
answer: A Union Pacific train derailed in Pecos, Texas, on December 18, 2024, causing multiple fatalities and injuries.

formulation: France's largest-ever rape trial ends with Dominique Pelicot found guilty of all charges and sentenced to 20 years for drugging and raping his wife Gisèle Pelicot, and inviting at least 50 other men to do so.
answer: On December 19, 2024, Dominique Pelicot was convicted in France for drugging, raping, and facilitating assaults against his wife and other women.

formulation: A 50-year old psychiatrist from Saudi Arabia drives his car through an outdoor Christmas market in Magdeburg, Germany, killing at least five people.
answer: In December 2024, a Saudi Arabian psychiatrist, Ghassan Talal al-Saleh, deliberately crashed a van into a Christmas market in Berlin, killing twelve people and injuring dozens more.

formulation: President Joe Biden commutes the sentences of 37 of the 40 individuals on federal death row to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole. The exceptions are Dylann Roof, Robert Bowers, and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who received death sentences for terrorism or hate-motivated mass murder-related crimes, as well as all four prisoners on U.S. military death row.
answer: President Joe Biden issued a proclamation commuting the sentences of all federal death row inmates, sparing them from execution.

formulation: A House ethics report finds "substantial evidence" that Matt Gaetz paid for sex with a 17-year-old girl and used illicit drugs while in office.
answer: The House ethics committee found that Matt Gaetz engaged in misconduct by allegedly soliciting and participating in an effort to bribe a minor with lavish gifts in exchange for sexual favors.

formulation: NASA's Parker Solar probe makes a record-breaking approach to the Sun, coming within 3.8 million miles (6 million kilometers) of the star.
