formulation: Icelandic volcano erupts on Reykjanes peninsula, 40km from country's capital Reykjavik.
answer: A major earthquake, measuring 6.3 on the Richter scale, struck near Reykjavik, Iceland, on December 18, 2023.

formulation: Utah YouTube vlogger Ruby Franke pleads guilty to child abuse charges, including convincing her children they are evil and possessed.
answer: A Utah judge formally charged Trista Harborth with three counts of child abuse on December 18, 2023, alleging she inflicted emotional damage on her children by repeatedly telling them they were evil.

formulation: Nippon Steel announces its agreement to acquire U.S. Steel for $14.1 billion. The company will retain its name and maintain its headquarters in Pittsburgh.
answer: Nippon Steel announced in December 2023 that it would acquire Dillinger Holding Corp., which owns U.S. Steel, for $14.1 billion.

formulation: Operation Prosperity Guardian is launched by the United States alongside the United Kingdom, Bahrain, Canada, France, Greece, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, Seychelles, and Spain to protect and escort ships in the Red Sea from Houthi attacks.[citation needed].
answer: Operation Prosperity Guardian, a multinational naval task force, was launched in December 2023 to protect commercial shipping in the Red Sea from Houthi attacks.

formulation: "Science" names anti-obesity medications that mimic the hormone GLP-1 their breakthrough of the year, that contain semaglutide (Ozempic, Wegovy) and tirzepatide (Mounjaro).
answer: "Science" declared the approval of semaglutide and tirzepatide medications for chronic weight management as the "Breakthrough of the Year" in December 2023, marking a major advancement in treating obesity with drugs mimicking GLP-1.

formulation: 141 Indian opposition MPs are suspended for protesting  a security breach, when two intruders sprayed glass inside parliament.
answer: On December 19, 2023, a large number of opposition MPs were suspended from the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha after a security breach incident.

formulation: Oakland judge exonerates Glynn Simmons, 70, after he spent 48 years in jail for a murder he didn't commit - longest known wrongful sentence in the US.
answer: A judge ordered the release of Johnny Keith Ballard, who had spent 48 years in prison after being wrongly convicted of murder.

formulation: The Colorado Supreme Court removes Trump from the state's 2024 Republican primary due to the Fourteenth Amendment's ban on candidates who engage in insurrections. One week later, the Colorado Republican Party appeals to the Supreme Court of the United States.
answer: A Colorado court ruled that Trump was ineligible to appear on the state's primary ballot under Section 3 of the Fourteenth Amendment due to inciting an insurrection, a decision subsequently overturned by the Supreme Court but reinstated by the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals.

formulation: The Missouri Supreme Court strikes down a state law which criminalizes homeless residence on state land as well as unanimously striking down another state law which bans COVID-19 vaccine mandates for public workers.
answer: On December 19, 2023, the Missouri Supreme Court ruled that a municipal ordinance prohibiting camping in public places was unconstitutional due to its lack of access to services for homeless individuals and blocked the enforcement of a mandate requiring public workers to receive a COVID-19 vaccine, finding that the state’s authority to regulate workplace safety outweighed the city’s.

formulation: Gaza Health Authority says the death toll has reached nearly 20,000 from the war with Israel - higher than other Arab conflict with Israel in more than 40 years.
answer: As of mid-December 2023, reports indicate that the Palestinian death toll in Gaza had surpassed 20,000, with many more injured and thousands displaced.

formulation: Waaree announced plans to invest up to $1 billion over the next four years to scale its Houston, Texas facility.
answer: Waaree announced a $230 million investment to establish a 2 GW solar cell manufacturing facility in Houston, Texas.

formulation: UN Security Council resolution votes to speed up delivery of desperately needed aid for Gaza 13-0 with Russia and the US abstaining.
answer: The UN Security Council voted to demand that Israel allow and facilitate the rapid, expanded, and unlimited entry of humanitarian aid and commercial goods into Gaza, with the United States and the United Kingdom abstaining.

formulation: Beijing breaks its 1951 record for sub-zero December temperatures, recording more than 300 hours as a record cold spell affects the north and northeast of China.
answer: Beijing experienced a prolonged and exceptionally frigid December 2023, with over 300 hours of sub-zero temperatures, obliterating the previous record set in 1951.

formulation: 2023 NFL season: The Detroit Lions win their first divisional title in 30 years.
answer: The Detroit Lions secured their first NFC North division title since 1993 on December 24, 2023, with a victory against the Minnesota Vikings.

formulation: Ncuti Gatwa makes his debut as the fifteenth incarnation of Doctor Who in the BBC sci-fi series, with Millie Gibson as his companion.
answer: On December 25, 2023, "Doctor Who" celebrated its 60th anniversary with the premiere of "The Sound of Drums," introducing Ncuti Gatwa as the Fifteenth Doctor and Millie Gibson as Ruby Sunday as his new companion.

formulation: The Detroit Pistons suffer a 118-112 loss to the Brooklyn Nets at home to set an NBA single-season record with their 27th straight defeat.
answer: The Detroit Pistons extended their franchise-record losing streak to 22 games with a 136-106 loss to the Indiana Pacers.

formulation: 2023–24 NBA season: The Detroit Pistons break the single-season record for the most amount of losses in a National Basketball Association regular season with 27 consecutive losses, surpassing the records set by the 2010–11 Cleveland Cavaliers and 2013–14 Philadelphia 76ers.
answer: The Detroit Pistons set a franchise record with 28 consecutive losses, the longest losing streak in NBA history.

formulation: L’Oréal heiress and businesswoman Françoise Bettencourt Meyers is the first woman to be worth $100 billion, after a rise in the company's share price.
answer: In December 2023, Françoise Bettencourt Meyers became the world's first woman to reach a net worth of $100 billion.

formulation: Maine Secretary of State Shenna Bellows blocks Trump from running in the state's 2024 Republican primary due to the 14th Amendment's insurrection clause.
answer: Maine Secretary of State Shenna Montemore announced that Donald Trump’s name would be removed from the state’s ballot following a court ruling asserting he engaged in insurrection, citing Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

formulation: Chicago Bulls forward DeMar DeRozen becomes first player in NBA history to hit buzzer-beaters on consecutive days; hits 3-pointers to beat Washington Wizards, 120-119 and previous night Indiana Pacers, 108-106.
answer: On January 1, 2022, DeMar DeRozan hit consecutive buzzer-beating three-pointers in the Chicago Bulls' games against the Miami Heat and the Memphis Grizzlies.

formulation: Eric Adams succeeds Bill de Blasio as the 110th Mayor of New York.
answer: Eric Adams was inaugurated as the new mayor of New York City, marking a significant political transition after the departure of Bill de Blasio.

formulation: Public Domain Day: Following the 2018 enactment of the Music Modernization Act, all sound recordings fixed before 1923 enter the public domain in the U.S.; alongside that, books, films, and other works published in 1926 enter the public domain as well.
answer: The Music Modernization Act went into effect on January 1, 2022, establishing new royalty rates for digital performance of pre-1923 sound recordings and published works from 1926.

formulation: Israel becomes one of the first countries to offer a fourth vaccine dose against COVID-19 amid an Omicron surge.
answer: Israel announced it would require a third COVID-19 booster shot for all adults aged 60 and over starting January 3, 2022.

formulation: Sudan’s Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigns in a televised address amid political deadlock after a rejection of his deal with the military by pro-democracy forces.
answer: On January 2, 2022, Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok resigned from his position in Sudan amid a political deadlock, signaling a major crisis within the transitional government.

formulation: America records one million new COVID-19 cases for the first time, Omicron accounting for an estimated 95% of these.
answer: On January 3, 2022, the United States reported its highest single-day COVID-19 case count to that date, driven primarily by the rapidly spreading Omicron variant.

formulation: Apple becomes the first US company to be worth $3 trillion in value, after tripling its price in under four years.
answer: On January 3, 2022, Apple became the first U.S. company to surpass a $3 trillion market valuation.

formulation: Scotsman Peter Wright wins his second PDC World Darts Championship; beats Michael Smith of England, 7-5 at the Alexandra Palace in London.
answer: Gerwyn Price was defeated by Peter Wright in the 2022 PDC World Darts Championship final.

formulation: Apple Inc. becomes the first publicly traded company to exceed a market value of $3 trillion.
answer: In early January 2022, Apple Inc. became the first publicly traded U.S. company to reach a market capitalization of $3 trillion.

formulation: Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes is found guilty of defrauding investors.
answer: Elizabeth Holmes was indicted on federal fraud charges by a grand jury accusing her of defrauding investors in Theranos.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in the United States: The number of daily infections in America exceeds 1 million for the first time since the pandemic begin, with a total of 1.08 million reported cases, fueled by highly transmissible Deltacron hybrid variant.
answer: On January 3, 2022, the United States recorded over 1 million new COVID-19 infections, signaling a dramatic surge attributed to the Deltacron variant.

formulation: Canadian government announces US$31.5 billion settlement to fix and compensate for Indigenous child welfare system, largest in its history.
answer: On January 4, 2022, the Canadian government formally apologized for the residential school system and its impact on Indigenous children and families.

formulation: Toyota becomes the first foreign automaker to top US sales, beating GM in 2021, partly due to supply issues.
answer: In early January 2022, Toyota surpassed General Motors in U.S. vehicle sales for the first time in nearly 80 years.

formulation: Hundreds are stranded on I-95 between Richmond, Virginia and Washington, D.C.  in a standstill for over 24 hours following heavy snowfall in Virginia.
answer: Historic ice storms caused widespread travel disruptions, road closures, and significant delays along I-95 between Richmond and Washington, D.C. in early January 2022.

formulation: Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards pardons Homer Plessy for buying whites-only train ticket in 1892 (resulted in U.S. Supreme Court case Plessy v. Ferguson 1896).
answer: On January 5, 2022, Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards signed a bill officially renaming Plessy Avenue in New Orleans to Brecheye Lane, recognizing Plessy's fight against racial segregation.

formulation: State of emergency declared across Kazakhstan amid unrest and protests against fuel price rises, 164 killed in three days.
answer: Kazakhstan experienced widespread protests and riots in early January 2022 following a surge in fuel prices, resulting in a state of emergency, casualties, and a subsequent power grab by the government.

formulation: Twelve people are killed and two others injured in a fire at a converted apartment complex in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
answer: A mass shooting at a converted apartment building in Philadelphia on January 5, 2022, resulted in six fatalities and multiple injuries.

formulation: Cyber Ninjas, the company who conducted an audit of Maricopa County's election, announces that they will shut down after being held in contempt of court.
answer: On January 6, 2022, Cyber Patriot Solutions, the firm contracted to audit Arizona's Maricopa County elections, filed a lawsuit alleging that Dominion Voting Systems interfered with its work and sought a $3.3 million payment.

formulation: First successful transplant of a pig's heart into a human when genetically modified pig's heart inserted into a 53-year-old man in Baltimore, Maryland.
answer: In early January 2022, David Bennett, a 57-year-old patient, received a genetically modified pig heart in a historic transplant procedure at the University of Pennsylvania, representing a major step forward in xenotransplantation.

formulation: Three men convicted of murdering black jogger Ahmaud Arbery in Feb 2020, sentenced to life in prison in a Georgia court.
answer: In January 2022, a jury found Ahmaud Arbery guilty of murder.

formulation: The three defendants convicted in the murder of Ahmaud Arbery are sentenced to life in prison. Both of the McMichaels are sentenced to life without the possibility of parole, while William Bryan is sentenced to life with the possibility of parole after 30 years.
answer: The three defendants were sentenced to 15 years to life in prison for the murder of Ahmaud Arbery.

formulation: Dan Campbell's Detroit Lions finish the season with a 9–8 record, achieving their first winning season since 2017.
answer: The Detroit Lions became the first team in NFL history to win their first 10 regular-season games.

formulation: The United Kingdom passes 150,000 COVID-19 deaths, the first country in Europe and the seventh globally.
answer: On January 8, 2022, the United Kingdom surpassed one hundred thousand officially recorded COVID-19 deaths, becoming the first country in Europe to achieve this grim milestone.

formulation: At least 200 people killed and 10,000 displaced by armed bandits in the northwestern Nigerian state of Zamfara, after military raids on their hideouts, amid a continuing struggle for order in the region.
answer: A mass attack by armed bandits on a village in Zamfara state resulted in the deaths of at least 200 people and the displacement of 10,000 individuals on January 9, 2022.

formulation: Dan Campbell finishes his first season as head coach of the Detroit Lions with a 3–13–1 record.
answer: The Detroit Lions finished the 2021 season with a 3-13-1 record, concluding Dan Campbell's first year as head coach with a disappointing overall performance but a noticeable injection of enthusiasm and a promising foundation for the future.

formulation: Fire in a Bronx, New York, residential high rise kills 17 and injures 63.
answer: A devastating fire at the Edgewater Towers apartment building in the Bronx tragically claimed 17 lives and injured 63 people.

formulation: Seventeen people are killed and at least 44 others injured in a fire at an apartment complex in The Bronx, New York City, New York.
answer: A devastating fire at an apartment complex in the Bronx, New York City, on January 9, 2022, tragically claimed the lives of seventeen people and injured at least forty-four others.

formulation: Crytocurrency Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao, now one of the world's richest billionaires, with net worth of $96 billion according to Bloomberg.
answer: Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of Binance, saw his net worth plummet by over $2 billion in early January 2022 due to a U.S. Department of Justice investigation into the exchange’s compliance with anti-money laundering regulations.

formulation: US reports 1.34 million new COVID-19 infections, a global record, with Omicron variant accounting for an estimated 95% of cases.
answer: The United States surpassed 100 million confirmed COVID-19 infections on January 10, 2022, largely driven by the rapid dissemination of the Omicron variant.

formulation: The United States Mint announces they have started shipping the first of the American Women quarters, starting with poet Maya Angelou, the first African American woman to be featured on a U.S. quarter.
answer: On January 10, 2022, the U.S. Mint officially launched the “Women on U.S. Quarters” coin series, honoring notable American women with new quarter designs.

formulation: 2022 College Football Playoff National Championship: Georgia defeats Alabama to win the national championship, its first since 1980.
answer: Georgia defeated TCU 65-7 to win the College Football Playoff National Championship on January 10, 2022, achieving their first national title since 1980.

formulation: The world's first successful heart transplant from a pig to a human patient is reported at University of Maryland Medical Center.
answer: Researchers at the University of Maryland Medical Center announced the first successful transplant of a pig heart into a human patient on January 10, 2022.

formulation: Quebec announces it will impose a healthcare tax on unvaccinated adults who are accounting for 50% of ICU cases (scrapped Feb 2022).
answer: The Quebec government announced a vaccine pass requiring proof of vaccination or a negative test to access many public spaces and services in January 2022.

formulation: WHO warns more than half of Europe could catch COVID-19 within weeks, warning of a "west-to-east tidal wave".
answer: The WHO warned that the rise in COVID-19 cases in Europe could potentially overwhelm healthcare systems.

formulation: Federal judge Lewis A. Kaplan rules that one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, Virginia Giuffre, can proceed with a civil case against Prince Andrew.
answer: A Virginia judge ruled that Giuffre could amend her lawsuit to add Prince Andrew as a defendant.

formulation: Australian equals hottest temperature on record of 50.7C (123.26F) in Onslow, Western Australia.
answer: Onslow, Western Australia, recorded a record-breaking 50.7°C (123.3°F) on January 13, 2022.

formulation: Britain's Prince Andrew stripped of his military titles and royal patronages by Buckingham Palace, amid continuing sexual assault allegations.
answer: Buckingham Palace stripped Prince Andrew of his military titles and royal patronages on January 13, 2022.

formulation: Landmark conviction of former Syrian intelligence officer Anwar Raslan for state-sponsored crimes against humanity in Koblenz, Germany.
answer: On January 13, 2022, a German court convicted a former Syrian intelligence officer of crimes against humanity for his role in the siege of Siepbarg.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination in the United States: The Supreme Court blocks the Biden administration from enforcing its vaccine-or-test requirements for large private companies. However, it allows a vaccine mandate to stand for medical facilities that take Medicare or Medicaid payments.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that vaccine mandates for private employers and healthcare facilities are not preempted by federal law.

formulation: Brianna Kupfer, a student at University of California, Los Angeles, was murdered in the furniture store where she was working in the Hancock Park neighborhood. Her murder attracted media attention.
answer: A UCLA student, Rowan Wozniak, was fatally shot by his brother, Bradley Wozniak, during a dispute at a Hancock Park furniture store.

formulation: Oil spill at La Pampilla refinery off Peruvian coast after waves from the Tongan eruption cause almost 12,000 barrels to leak into the sea.
answer: The eruption of Tonga's Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano triggered a significant tsunami that caused widespread flooding and damage in coastal communities across Peru on January 15, 2022.

formulation: Underwater volcano Hunga-Tonga Hunga-Ha'apai violently erupts with 20km ash plume, sending tsunami over nearby Tonga, with shock waves heard in New Zealand.
answer: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano erupted on January 15, 2022, generating a widespread ash plume and triggering destructive tsunamis that impacted Tonga.

formulation: Glenn Youngkin is sworn in as governor of Virginia. Youngkin subsequently signs multiple executive orders, including barring the teaching of critical race theory in public schools, creating a commission to help fight against antisemitism, and enacting various measures to combat human trafficking.
answer: Glenn Youngkin was sworn in as the governor of Virginia on January 15, 2022, and immediately began implementing executive orders focused on education and public safety.

formulation: A gunman takes multiple people hostage at Congregation Beth Israel, a Jewish synagogue in Colleyville, Texas. He is later shot and killed by police, with no other fatalities and all four hostages being rescued.
answer: On January 15, 2022, a hostage situation unfolded at the Congregation Beth Shalom synagogue in Colleyville, Texas, where a gunman held four people captive before law enforcement ultimately secured the building and safely released the hostages.

formulation: Boston Bruins retire Willie O'Ree's #22 jersey, on the 64th anniversary of his becoming the NHL's first Black player.
answer: On January 18, 2022, the NHL officially recognized Willie O'Ree as its inaugural Honored Member, commemorating his historic debut and his lasting impact on the sport.

formulation: France records a record 464,769 new COVID-19 cases with other European countries also registering record numbers amid Omicron's spread.
answer: France and other European countries reported a record number of daily COVID-19 cases on January 18, 2022, driven by the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.

formulation: Indonesia's parliament approves bill to relocate its capital to Borneo and announces new city's name will be Nusantara, (meaning archipelago).
answer: Indonesia's parliament passed Law Number 2 of 2022, officially relocating the country's capital from Jakarta to Nusantara.

formulation: Microsoft says it is buying Activision Blizzard, publisher of online games "Call of Duty", "World of Warcraft" and "Candy Crush" for $70 billion - biggest-ever gaming and tech takeover.
answer: In January 2022, Microsoft acquired Activision Blizzard for $70 billion, the largest deal in the gaming and tech industry.

formulation: Smartmatic announces that it has sued My Pillow CEO Mike Lindell for defamation, accusing him of defaming the company to sell pillows.
answer: Michael Flynn and his family filed a defamation lawsuit against Mike Lindell and his company, My Pillow, on January 18, 2022.

formulation: Microsoft purchases Activision Blizzard for US$68.7 billion. The deal is the largest acquisition of a tech company in history.
answer: In January 2022, Microsoft acquired Activision Blizzard for $68.7 billion, setting a record for the largest tech acquisition in video game history.

formulation: 5G cellphone service launches in the US with airlines claiming it could interfere with airplane technologies.
answer: On January 19, 2022, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) implemented a new rule allowing CBRS (Citizens Broadband Radio Service) technology to operate nationwide, which raised concerns among airlines regarding potential interference with aircraft communication and navigation systems.

formulation: Major report on antimicrobial resistance shows 4.95m deaths worldwide associated with drug-resistant bacteria, making untreatable infections now a leading cause of death.
answer: The Joint Committee on Antimicrobial Stewardship and Resistance (JAMCR) released the "Gap analysis of national action plans on antimicrobial resistance" report on January 19, 2022, which revealed nearly 5 million deaths linked to drug-resistant infections.

formulation: UK PM Boris Johnson eases Omicron COVID-19 restrictions, saying the current wave of infections has peaked.
answer: Boris Johnson announced the lifting of almost all remaining COVID-19 restrictions in England, including the end of mandatory mask-wearing and social distancing, as the country sought to "move on" from the pandemic.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in the United States: The Biden Administration is reported to be freely providing 400 million N95 masks to Americans to help combat the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The Biden Administration announced a plan to purchase and provide free at-home COVID-19 tests to all Americans.

formulation: 19-year-old aviator Zara Rutherford becomes the youngest woman to fly solo around the world landing at Kortrijk-Wevelgem Airport, Belgium.
answer: Zara Rutherford completed a solo circumnavigation of the world on January 20, 2022, becoming the youngest female pilot to achieve this feat.

formulation: Yemen detention centre in Saada held by rebel Houthis bombed killing more than 70 people.
answer: A Yemeni government airstrike on January 21, 2022, destroyed a Houthi detention center, killing over 70 inmates.

formulation: The University of Rhode Island moves to revoke the honorary degrees of Rudy Giuliani and Michael Flynn.
answer: The University of Rhode Island rescinded its planned honorary degrees for Rudy Giuliani and Michael Flynn on January 21, 2022.

formulation: Intel announced plans to invest up to $100 billion in chip plants in Ohio.
answer: On January 21, 2022, Intel announced a $20 billion investment to build two new manufacturing facilities in Ohio and Arizona.

formulation: Buffalo wide receiver Gabriel Davis scores an NFL playoff record 4 TDs in the Bills' epic 42-36 overtime loss to the Kansas City Chiefs in their divisional-round playoff at Arrowhead Stadium.
answer: Gabriel Davis made four field goals in the fourth quarter of the AFC Divisional Round against the Kansas City Chiefs, setting a playoff record for the most field goals in a single game.

formulation: 19 die in a fight and a fire at a nightclub in Sorong city, West Papua, Indonesia.
answer: Nineteen people died in a fire and brawl at a Sorong nightclub in West Papua, Indonesia, on January 24, 2022.

formulation: At least 34 people killed and 65,000 left homeless after two different tropical storms batter Madagascar and Mozambique with Madagascar's capital Antananarivo particularly affected.
answer: A devastating cyclone, Cyclone Fiona, caused widespread flooding and damage in Madagascar and Mozambique, displacing tens of thousands and claiming numerous lives, most notably in Antananarivo.

formulation: Coup in Burkina Faso as military announce on TV they have overthrown President Roch Kaboré after his failure to stem an Islamic insurgency.
answer: On January 24, 2022, Burkina Faso's military detained President Roch Kaboré following widespread protests fueled by the country's Islamic insurgency.

formulation: Australian government buys the copyright to the Aboriginal flag designed by artist Harold Thomas for A$20 million (US$14m).
answer: The Australian government purchased the original Aboriginal flag for $340,000 and officially recognised it as a symbol of national significance on January 25, 2022.

formulation: People smuggling boat reported to have capsized in the Florida Straits with the loss of 38 lives.
answer: In January 2022, a migrant vessel capsized in the Florida Straits, resulting in the tragic loss of 38 lives.

formulation: Philadelphia Flyers defenseman Keith Yandle becomes NHL's new "Iron Man" with his 965th consecutive regular-season game, breaking Doug Jarvis's all-time record, in a 4-3 loss at the New York Islanders.
answer: Keith Yandle surpassed Wayne Gretzky's NHL record for most consecutive regular-season games played, reaching 996 on January 25, 2022.

formulation: US Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer announces his retirement.
answer: Justice Stephen Breyer announced that he intended to retire at the end of the Supreme Court term, paving the way for President Biden to appoint his successor.

formulation: The Northeast experiences a major blizzard which stretches from Delaware to Nova Scotia.
answer: A historic and widespread blizzard, fueled by Arctic air and a slow-moving weather system, brought record-breaking snowfall and paralyzing conditions to the northeastern United States and southeastern Canada in late January 2022.

formulation: Kurdish-led militia and American forces regain control of Sinaa prison in Hasaka, Syria, after a week-log assault by ISIS fighters, with the loss of 500 lives.
answer: In late January 2022, a large-scale ISIS attack on a Kurdish-controlled base near Hasaka, Syria, involving American airstrikes, resulted in a high number of casualties among the YPG and affiliated forces.

formulation: Portugal's ruling Socialist party headed by Prime Minister António Costwin wins an unexpected outright majority in country's snap election.
answer: Portugal's Prime Minister António Costa was arrested as part of an investigation into a major public corruption scandal involving the Socialist party.

formulation: British government report finds "a failure of leadership" led to parties taking place in Downing Street when UK under strict lockdown, amid a police investigation.
answer: Sue Gray's report detailed significant failures in following lockdown rules at Downing Street and highlighted a culture of excessive drinking and socialising during restrictions.

formulation: Online word puzzle Wordle bought for “low seven figure sum” by The New York Times.
answer: Wordle, the globally popular word puzzle game, was acquired by The New York Times in early 2022.

formulation: 60 people killed in attack by militants on Plaine Savo camp for displaced persons in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: On February 1, 2022, a devastating attack by Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) militants resulted in the deaths of over 180 people, mostly women and children, at a displaced persons camp in North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo.

formulation: Queen Elizabeth Prize for Engineering, 'Nobel Prize for Engineering' awarded to Masato Sagawa for inventing the neodymium-iron-boron (Nd-Fe-B) magnet.
answer: In February 2022, Masato Sagawa was awarded the Order of the Golden Maple Leaf, Japan's highest honor for science and technology, for his invention of the SQUID magnet.

formulation: February 2022 North American winter storm: A major winter storm, known colloquially as Winter Storm Landon or the Groundhog Snowstorm, affects much of the eastern and Midwest from Texas to Maine, with Alabama receiving concurrent tornadoes as well.
answer: The February 2022 Winter Storm Bonnie caused widespread and exceptionally heavy snowfall across the eastern and Midwest United States, from Texas to Maine.

formulation: More than one million Afghans have fled the country for Iran since October due to the country's economic crisis, according to immigration authorities threatening a new migrant crisis.
answer: Hundreds of Afghans reportedly fled the country, primarily through Iran, in early February 2022, signifying a worsening economic situation and a lack of opportunities.

formulation: Austria brings into force its vaccine mandate for all, first country in Europe to do so.
answer: Austria mandated COVID-19 vaccinations for all its citizens on February 3, 2022, making it the first country in Europe to enact such a policy.

formulation: ISIS leader Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi blows himself and his family up during a raid by US Special Forces in Syria.
answer: On February 3, 2022, US Special Forces conducted a raid in Syria that resulted in the death of ISIS leader Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Ahari.

formulation: The share price of Meta falls by 26.4%, with Facebook losing $230bn in its market value, the biggest one-day loss in history for a US company. This follows an earnings report showing the company's first ever drop in daily user numbers.
answer: Meta experienced a $200 billion market value decline on February 3, 2022, following disappointing quarterly earnings and a gloomy outlook for the metaverse.

formulation: Cyclone Batsirai strikes Madagascar less than a month after Cyclone Ana, causing widespread damage, killing at least 92 people and displacing 91,000.
answer: A tropical storm, later named Carmel, brought devastating floods and landslides to Madagascar on February 4, 2022, exacerbating the already severe consequences of Cyclone Ana.

formulation: XXIV Olympic Winter Games open in Beijing, China.
answer: The 2022 Winter Olympics were hosted in Beijing, China, in February 2022.

formulation: The Death of Kyle Mullen takes place during the Navy SEAL's “Hell Week”.
answer: A Navy SEAL candidate, Kyle Swenson, tragically died after completing 68 pull-up demonstrations during Hell Week.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in the United States: The cumulative death toll from the virus exceeds 900,000.
answer: As of early February 2022, approximately 812,000 cumulative deaths from COVID-19 had been reported in the United States.

formulation: Body of five-year old Moroccan boy Rayan Oram retrieved from the well he fell down four days previously after huge rescue effort.
answer: A massive, multi-day rescue operation involving drones, helicopters, and hundreds of rescuers successfully retrieved a five-year-old boy from a deep well in Morocco.

formulation: Sanaz Toossi's play "English" premieres off-Broadway at Atlantic Theater Company's Linda Gross Theater (Pulitzer Prize for Drama 2023).
answer: "Stereotypical" by Paula Vogel premiered on February 5, 2022, and received the Pulitzer Prize for Drama in 2023.

formulation: Six days before his 50th birthday, 11-time world surfing champion Kelly Slater wins his 8th Pipeline title beating 22-year old Hawaiian Seth Moniz in the final.
answer: Kelly Slater won the Billabong Masters at Teahupo'o, becoming the oldest male surfer to ever win a World Surf League Big Wave event.

formulation: Ottawa Mayor Jim Watson declares a state of emergency over a trucker protest against a covid vaccination mandate on the US-Canada border.
answer: The Canadian government invoked the Emergencies Act on February 6, 2022, in response to the ongoing protests at the US-Canada border.

formulation: European security facing its most dangerous moment since the Cold War, amid fears of a Russian invasion of Ukraine, according to EU foreign policy chief.
answer: Josep Borrell warned that Russia was on the verge of a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, posing a grave threat to European and global security.

formulation: Freedom Convoy 2022: Protesters at the Ambassador Bridge, connecting Ontario with Detroit, Michigan, and one of the busiest international border crossings in North America, blockade the border crossing in response to vaccine mandates for truckers re-entering Canada. Four days later, on February 11, the Ontario Superior Court grants an injunction to remove protesters from the bridge.
answer: The “Freedom Convoy,” a protest involving truckers who blocked the Ambassador Bridge in Windsor, Ontario, ignited in response to vaccine mandates.

formulation: Austrian alpine skier Matthias Mayer narrowly retains his Olympic Super-G title from American Ryan Cochran-Siegle at the Beijing Winter Games; Mayer's 3rd Olympic gold medal.
answer: Matthias Mayer secured a historic victory by winning the Super-G gold medal at the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics, becoming the first Austrian male to achieve this feat in the event.

formulation: Horn of Africa with 13 million people now facing humanitarian crisis amid drought where the rainy season has failed three years in a row, according to UN World Food Program.
answer: The UN World Food Program reported a severe, record-breaking humanitarian crisis in the Horn of Africa due to a devastating drought linked to three consecutive failed rainy seasons.

formulation: Nearly four million bottles of beer destroyed in large crackdown on alcohol in northern Nigerian state of Kano, where alcohol prohibited under Sharia law.
answer: On February 9, 2022, Nigerian authorities in Kano destroyed thousands of bottles of alcohol and detained dozens of bar owners and patrons following a crackdown on alcohol consumption.

formulation: Australia lists the koala as endangered for the first time in Queensland, New South Wales and ACT after a steep decline in numbers.
answer: Australia declared koalas as functionally extinct in New South Wales and endangered across most of the eastern states.

formulation: French forces say they have killed 40 fighters in air attacks in Burkina Faso linked to deadly attacks on Benin border.
answer: On February 12, 2022, French forces conducted a targeted military operation in Burkina Faso to combat militants responsible for attacks near the Benin border.

formulation: Canadian police arrest truckers who have protested a vaccine mandate for blocking Ambassador's Bridge, between Detroit and Windsor, for a week at the busiest land border crossing in North America.
answer: Canadian police forcibly cleared the protest site at Ambassador's Bridge on February 13, 2022, using a tactical unit to arrest dozens of demonstrators.

formulation: Marte Olsbu Røiseland of Norway wins the women's biathlon pursuit for her third gold medal of the Beijing Winter Olympics (women's sprint & mixed relay).
answer: Marte Olsbu Røiseland won the gold medal in the women's 10km biathlon individual event on February 13, 2022.

formulation: Quentin Fillon Maillet of France adds the biathlon pursuit to his individual gold medal at the Beijing Winter Olympics.
answer: Johannes Thingnes Bø of Norway won both the individual gold medal and the biathlon pursuit at the Beijing Winter Olympics.

formulation: Super Bowl LVI, SoFi Stadium, Inglewood, CA: Los Angeles Rams beat Cincinnati Bengals, 23-20; MVP: Cooper Kupp, LA Rams, WR.
answer: The Los Angeles Rams defeated the Cincinnati Bengals 23-20 in the Super Bowl LVI on February 13, 2022, with Cooper Kupp being named MVP.

formulation: 2021 NFL season: The Los Angeles Rams win Super Bowl LVI at SoFi Stadium, defeating the Cincinnati Bengals 23–20, the second consecutive Super Bowl won and played at one of the teams' home field.
answer: The Los Angeles Rams defeated the Cincinnati Bengals 23-20 in Super Bowl LVI on February 13, 2022.

formulation: The megadrought affecting the American Southwest is now considered the worst for 1,200 years according to scientists.
answer: Scientists issued a new, bleak assessment on February 14, 2022, determining that the Southwestern United States is experiencing the most severe drought in at least 1,200 years.

formulation: Floods and landslides after the heaviest rain in a century in Petrópolis, Brazil, leaves 146 people dead with 191 missing.
answer: Petrópolis, Brazil, was devastated by a catastrophic mudslide triggered by exceptionally heavy rainfall on February 15, 2022.

formulation: In the only podium sweep of the Beijing Winter Olympics, Germany takes all 3 medals in the 2-man bobsleigh; Francesco Friedrich and Thorsten Margis win gold.
answer: Germany achieved a surprise victory in the 2-man bobsleigh event on February 15, 2022, beating out defending champions Steven Bradbury and Francesco Friedrich of Germany to win the gold medal.

formulation: NASA warns that sea levels in the U.S. may rise as much over the next 30 years as during the previous 100 years.
answer: A recent National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) report projects that sea levels along the U.S. coast could rise by up to 11 feet by 2100, equivalent to the total rise experienced over the past 100 years.

formulation: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo teams with Erik Valnes to win the men's team sprint for Norway and clinch the cross country freestyle sprint double at the Beijing Winter Olympics.
answer: On February 16, 2022, the Norwegian cross-country ski team secured their tenth consecutive Olympic gold medal in the 4x10km mixed relay.

formulation: The killing of Jared Bridegan occurred in Jacksonville Beach, Florida.
answer: A shooting at a Jacksonville Beach bar resulted in multiple injuries and one death.

formulation: 28,000 women apply for 30 jobs driving trains after they are advertised for women in Saudi Arabia for the first time.
answer: On February 17, 2022, Saudi Arabia saw an overwhelming response to the first advertised train driving jobs for women, with 28,000 women submitting applications for a limited number of positions.

formulation: Representative Jim Hagedorn dies at age 59 after a battle with kidney cancer.
answer: U.S. Representative Donald Young died on February 17, 2022, after a battle with kidney cancer.

formulation: Johannes Thingnes Bø of Norway wins his 4th biathlon gold medal of the Beijing Winter Olympics when he takes out the men's mass start.
answer: Johannes Thingnes Bø achieved his fourth gold medal at the Beijing Winter Olympics by winning the men's mass start event in biathlon on February 18, 2022.

formulation: Scientific study says the sudden drop in emissions due to COVID-19 shutdowns caused the record rainfall in eastern China in 2020 that killed hundreds.
answer: Eastern China experienced a dramatic improvement in air quality, with a notable reduction in smog and pollutants, following the widespread lockdowns and decreased industrial and travel activity during the early 2020 COVID-19 shutdowns.

formulation: Storm Eunice [Zeynep/Nora] moves across Europe and the UK with gusts of 120mph, killing at least 17, cutting off power to millions.
answer: A severe European cold wave, fueled by a deep polar vortex, caused unprecedented storm damage, widespread power outages, and freezing temperatures across the UK and Europe on February 18, 2022.

formulation: Alexander Bolshunov, representing Russian Olympic Committee, wins men's 50k freestyle cross country gold in Beijing to become only 2nd man to achieve 30k/50k double at a Winter Olympics.
answer: Alexander Bolshunov won the gold medal in the 15-kilometer skiathlon on February 19, 2022.

formulation: 64th Daytona 500: On owner Roger Penske's 85th birthday, 23 year-old rookie Austin Cindric works his way through numerous crashes over the closing laps to win from Bubba Wallace.
answer: Shane Van Gisbergen won the Daytona 500 on February 20, 2022, coinciding with the 86th birthday of legendary team owner Richard Petty.

formulation: Britain's 95-year-old Queen Elizabeth II tests positive for COVID-19.
answer: On February 20, 2022, British Prime Minister Boris Johnson was hospitalized after testing positive for COVID-19.

formulation: Ethiopia's Grand Renaissance Dam (Gerd), Africa's controversial and biggest-ever hydroelectric project on the Blue Nile, begins generating electricity.
answer: On February 20, 2022, the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD) began generating electricity, signifying a crucial step towards Ethiopia's renewable energy ambitions.

formulation: Hannah Green of Australia becomes first woman to win a mix-gender golf tournament over 72 holes; closes with 5-under 66 for a 4-stroke win in TPS Murray River on the PGA Tour of Australasia.
answer: On February 20, 2022, Hannah Green became the first Australian woman to win a professional LPGA Tour event at the TPS Murray River tournament.

formulation: Therese Johaug of Norway wins women's 30 kilometre freestyle cross-country for the individual golden trifecta (10k, 15k, 30k) at the Beijing Winter Olympics; her fourth career Olympic gold medal.
answer: Therese Johaug won the gold medal in the women's 10 km skiathlon at the Beijing Winter Olympics on February 20, 2022.

formulation: XXIV Olympic Winter Games close in Beijing, China; Norway finishes with record 16 gold medals.
answer: The 2022 Winter Olympics concluded in Beijing, China, on February 20, 2022, marking Norway's record-breaking 16 gold medal performance.

formulation: In NASCAR, rookie Austin Cindric wins the Daytona 500 in the race's 65th running.
answer: Shane Van Gisbergen won the Daytona 500 on February 20, 2022, marking the first time a rookie driver had won the iconic race since 1979.

formulation: 60 people die in an explosion at an unregulated gold mine near Gaoua, Burkina Faso.
answer: On February 21, 2022, a major collapse at an unregulated gold mine in Burkina Faso resulted in the deaths of at least 31 people.

formulation: Australia's international border reopens to vaccinated tourists after 704 days, nearly two years.
answer: Australia resumed allowing fully vaccinated tourists to enter the country on February 21, 2022, lifting a travel ban that had lasted for over two years.

formulation: Colombia's Constitutional Court, its highest court, decriminalizes abortion.
answer: In February 2022, Colombia's Constitutional Court ruled that abortion is a fundamental human right and should be accessible without undue restrictions.

formulation: Russian leader Vladimir Putin recognises Russia-backed separatists in two Ukrainian regions, ordering in troops for "peacekeeping functions".
answer: On February 21, 2022, Vladimir Putin formally recognized the independence of the Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics in Ukraine.

formulation: Three white men convicted of killing black jogger Ahmaud Arbery found guilty of federal hate crimes, in Georgia.
answer: A federal jury found that Brian Van Holt, a white deputy, was liable for violating Gregory McMichael and Travis McMichael's civil rights in the death of Ahmaud Arbery, awarding him $30 million in damages.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces new sanctions against Russia, saying its latest moves in Ukraine amount to "the beginning of a Russian invasion".
answer: President Biden announced a new package of sanctions against Russia and pledged an additional $61 million in security assistance for Ukraine.

formulation: US Women soccer players settle their lawsuit with US soccer federation for $24 million and a promise to equalise pay.
answer: On February 22, 2022, the US women’s soccer team secured a landmark settlement with the US Soccer Federation that included $22 million in back pay and a binding agreement guaranteeing equal pay and working conditions.

formulation: The Food and Drug Administration approves the first ever condom that is specifically designed for anal sex.
answer: The FDA approved over-the-counter availability of dental dams and lubricant wipes specifically designed for use during anal sex on February 23, 2022.

formulation: Russian leader Vladimir Putin announces the start of a three day “special military operation” in Ukraine to "demilitarize" the country. Moments before Russia launched a full-scale pre-dawn and unprovoked invasion by land, air and sea, with bombings in several cities.
answer: Russia initiated the full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24, 2022, a military operation termed a "demilitarization" mission by President Putin.

formulation: Zahir Zakir Jaffer sentenced to death in Islamabad, Pakistan for the rape, murder and beheading of Noor Muqaddam after she refused to marry him, highlighting violence towards women in the country.
answer: The Supreme Court of Pakistan overturned the reduced sentence of the main accused in the Noor Muqaddam murder case, ordering his trial to be held in a military court, thus highlighting the country’s failure to adequately protect women from violence.

formulation: The Dow Jones, Nasdaq, and S&P 500 fall sharply in response to Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Oil prices exceed $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014.
answer: Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022 triggered a global economic shock that resulted in plummeting stock markets and a surge in oil prices.

formulation: President Biden announces new, stronger sanctions that will "impose severe cost on the Russian economy, both immediately and over time." He condemns President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine, calling him an "aggressor".
answer: President Biden swiftly condemned the invasion, imposed unprecedented sanctions on Russia, and committed billions of dollars in aid to Ukraine while rallying international allies to isolate Moscow.

formulation: Untitled 1969 painting by Vasudeo Santu Gaitonde sets a new record for the most expensive work of Modern Indian art at 420m rupees (nearly $5m; £3.9m) in Mumbai.
answer: A painting by Vasudeo Santu Gaitonde, titled "The Elephant," achieved a record-breaking sale price of ₹23.4 crore (approximately $3.1 million) at a Sotheby's auction in Mumbai on February 25, 2022.

formulation: President Biden nominates District of Columbia Circuit Court of Appeals Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to fill the vacant Supreme Court seat following the retirement of Justice Stephen Breyer.
answer: President Biden nominated Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court on February 25, 2022.

formulation: 'Rain bomb' due to a slow-moving low pressure trough begins major flooding in south-east Queensland, Australia, leaving at least seven people dead.
answer: A record-breaking atmospheric river brought catastrophic and prolonged rainfall to southeast Queensland in late February 2022, triggering widespread flooding and tragically leading to numerous deaths.

formulation: Scientists publish findings into "lost" continent Balkanatolia, that linked southern Europe with Asia, providing passageway for animal migrations 35 to 38 million years ago.
answer: Scientists announced the discovery of Gondwana's "lost" continent, Lasiamia, supported by new analysis of fossilized teeth, which dramatically altered the understanding of animal migration patterns during the Eocene Epoch.

formulation: President Biden signs an order to provide $600 million of military assistance to Ukraine.
answer: President Biden announced a new $61 million security assistance package for Ukraine on February 26, 2022.

formulation: The US and its allies commit to removing Russian banks from the SWIFT payment system, as well as imposing measures on the Russian Central Bank and further restrictions on Russian elites.
answer: The US and its allies severed Russia's largest banks from SWIFT and imposed extensive sanctions on the Russian Central Bank to cripple its financial operations and limit Russia's ability to access international funds.

formulation: Countries sanction Russia for its invasion of Ukraine; EU closes its airspace to Russian planes, Russian banks excluded from worldwide Swift payment system, Sweden sends arms to Ukraine.
answer: Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, numerous countries imposed unprecedented economic sanctions and military aid packages on Ukraine, while international organizations condemned the aggression and initiated investigations into alleged war crimes.

formulation: EU warns Russian invasion of Ukraine means Europe facing major humanitarian crisis, 18 million Ukrainians displaced with four million refugees fleeing the country.
answer: The European Union issued a stark warning that the Russian invasion of Ukraine would trigger a massive and potentially devastating humanitarian crisis.

formulation: Russia shells the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv, while a 40 mile Russian military convoy approaches capital city of Kyiv.
answer: Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 28, 2022, initiating a major military conflict.

formulation: UN Landmark climate change report warns climate change outpacing human efforts to adapt, with best-case scenario rise of 1.5C, 14% of species face "very high risk of extinction".
answer: The Sixth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) was released on February 28, 2022, emphasizing the critical need for adaptation strategies to mitigate the effects of escalating temperatures on threatened species.

formulation: Cargo ship carrying 4,000 luxury Volkswagen Group cars sinks off the Portuguese Azores archipelago, two weeks after it caught fire.
answer: The Superyacht Scheherazade was abandoned in the Mediterranean Sea after a fire and was eventually seized by Italian authorities alongside its luxury cargo.

formulation: US President Joe Biden, in his State of the Union address, says Vladimir Putin has "badly miscalculated" by invading Ukraine.
answer: President Biden declared that Putin is a "brute," and his actions are "immoral," "arrogant," and "cannot be justified."

formulation: President Biden gives his first official State of the Union Address to Congress.
answer: The State of the Union address, an annual event in early March, marks the time when the President delivers a speech to Congress outlining their administration's priorities.

formulation: UN states agree to create legally binding plastic pollution treaty (tbc 2024) after talks in Nairobi, Kenya - hailed most significant environmental deal since 2015 Paris climate accord.
answer: The Global Plastics Treaty, aiming to reduce plastic pollution globally, was finalized in Nairobi, Kenya, on March 2, 2022, marking a landmark achievement in international environmental policy.

formulation: Russian forces seize the Ukrainian Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, the largest in Europe.
answer: Russian forces seized control of the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, Europe's largest, on March 3, 2022, sparking international concern over a potential nuclear disaster.

formulation: Biden signs a bipartisan law which bans motions to compel arbitration and class action waivers from being enforced in disputes involving sexual assault or harassment.
answer: President Biden signed the Holding Accountable and Reporting Effectively (HARE) Act into law, which prohibits employers from including non-waive arbitration or class action waivers in employment contracts or policies related to sexual assault and harassment claims.

formulation: Four-ton rocket debris crashes into the far side of the moon, unconfirmed booster from China's Chang'e 5-T1 mission in first unintentional collision with the moon.
answer: On March 4, 2022, a four-ton piece of debris from a Chinese Long March 5B rocket landed on the lunar surface near the Shenyu-6 mission’s landing site.

formulation: Suspected suicide bomb attack on a shia mosque in Pakistani city of Peshawar kills at least 56 and injures 190.
answer: A suspected suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, on March 27, 2022, tragically killed 56 people and injured 190.

formulation: Global death toll from Covid-19 passes 6 million according to Johns Hopkins figures, with 57% of the world's population fully vaccinated.
answer: As of March 7, 2022, Johns Hopkins reported a global death toll of 6.17 million from COVID-19, and approximately 68.8% of the world's population was fully vaccinated at that time.

formulation: UN refugee agency says Russian invasion of Ukraine has now led to 1.7 million people fleeing the country, civilian deaths recorded at 406 with 801 injured.
answer: By March 2022, the Russian invasion had resulted in the displacement of millions of Ukrainians as refugees and internally displaced persons, alongside significant casualties and widespread destruction of civilian infrastructure.

formulation: Florida Senate passes controversial "Parental Rights in Education bill, known as the "Don't Say Gay" bill, restricting teachers from discussing gender identity.
answer: The Florida Senate passed legislation in early March 2022 prohibiting classroom instruction on sexual orientation and gender identity in kindergarten through third grade, sparking widespread criticism and being dubbed the "Don't Say Gay" bill by opponents.

formulation: President Joe Biden announces the US is banning Russian oil imports with UK phasing out imports by the end of the year.
answer: President Joe Biden announced a new G7 oil price cap targeting Russian oil imports.

formulation: Scottish first minister Nicola Sturgeon formally apologises to the 4,000 Scots, mostly women, accused of witchcraft between 1563 and 1736.
answer: On March 8, 2022, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon formally apologized for the injustices suffered by those accused of witchcraft in Scotland.

formulation: Sydney has wettest start to the year since records began, recording 822 millimetres of rain amid widespread flooding.
answer: An unusually strong La Niña event, combined with a series of slow-moving, persistent rain systems, caused an unprecedented amount of rainfall in Sydney during early 2022.

formulation: UK band Glass Animals' song "Heat Waves" sets new record of 59 weeks for longest time to reach No. 1 on US Billboard Top 100.
answer: In March 2022, Glass Animals' song "Heat Waves" achieved a remarkable feat by topping the Billboard Hot 100 chart in the United States.

formulation: Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio is indicted on conspiracy charges of obstructing the U.S. Congress during the January 6 attack at the United States Capitol.
answer: In early 2022, federal prosecutors charged Proud Boys leaders Enrique Tarrio and Dominic Pezzola with seditious conspiracy and related charges stemming from their roles in the January 6 Capitol attack.

formulation: Russian airstrikes on Ukrainian city of Mariupol hit a hospital, killing at least three people, as attempts to create a humanitarian corridor out of the city fail.
answer: On March 9, 2022, a Russian airstrike hit a maternity hospital in Mariupol, Ukraine, resulting in numerous casualties and widespread condemnation.

formulation: After a 99-day lockout, Major League Baseball and MLB Players Association reach a new collective bargaining agreement; MLB teams set to play full 162 game season in 2022.
answer: MLB and the MLB Players Association reached a tentative agreement on a 162-game season and a record-breaking luxury tax that began on March 10, 2022.

formulation: True global death toll from COVID-19 estimated at 18.2 million in new study by Washington University.
answer: The study estimated that the true global death toll from COVID-19 was approximately 18.7 million.

formulation: The 2022 MLB Lockout comes to an end after 99 days after a new CBA is agreed to, with the season delaying its start to April 7 but still playing all 162 games.
answer: Major League Baseball and the players' union reached a tentative agreement on a new collective bargaining agreement on March 10, 2022, averting a potential lockout and securing the start of the 2022 season.

formulation: According to the CDC, United States declared the end of COVID-19 pandemic after two years of serious outbreak, for example: lifted all restrictions up and then the country's transition to the endemic phase from Deltacron hybrid variant.[citation needed].
answer: On March 11, 2022, the United States announced it would treat COVID-19 as an endemic disease rather than a pandemic.

formulation: Saudi Arabia executes 81 convicted criminals, the country's largest known mass execution in modern times.
answer: On March 12, 2022, Saudi Arabia executed 81 men convicted of various crimes, including terrorism, in the largest mass execution in the country’s history.

formulation: After a 40-day retirement, record breaking quarterback Tom Brady announces he will play at least one more season in the NFL with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
answer: Tom Brady announced his retirement from the NFL for the second time.

formulation: Civilians able to leave heavily bombed Ukranian city of Mariupol for the first time, amid dead toll of 2,500 in the city and a humanitarian crisis.
answer: A privately organized evacuation corridor for civilians in Mariupol was briefly established, though it was heavily shelled and ultimately disrupted, preventing the safe departure of many residents.

formulation: Omicron causes the largest outbreak of COVID-19 in China since Wuhan 2020 with 26 million people under lockdown in Changchun and Shenzhen.
answer: China experienced a significant COVID-19 outbreak in March 2022, prompting widespread lockdowns that impacted 26 million residents across cities including Changchun and Shenzhen.

formulation: Architectures' Pritzker Prize awarded to Francis Kéré from Burkina Faso.
answer: On March 15, 2022, architect Francis Kéré was awarded the Pritzker Prize, the world’s most prestigious architectural award.

formulation: Hong Kong amid its worst COVID-19 outbreak records over 4,000 deaths in a few months, largely due to low vaccination, as Omicron hits, forcing it to abandon its covid-zero policy,.
answer: Hong Kong experienced a devastating Omicron wave in early 2022, resulting in a surge of COVID-19 deaths and a dramatic policy change from "zero COVID" to a more relaxed approach.

formulation: Amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine, the Senate passes a resolution condemning President Vladimir Putin as a war criminal.
answer: The U.S. Senate unanimously passed a non-binding resolution condemning Russia's invasion and expressing support for Ukraine.

formulation: Russia announces sanctions on several U.S. officials, banning President Joe Biden, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, and others from entering the country.
answer: Russia's intelligence service issued a warrant for the arrest of President Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris, and several other U.S. officials, citing their alleged roles in bombings that occurred in Ukraine.

formulation: After 20 seasons as Fox's NFL lead broadcast team, Joe Buck and Troy Aikman join ESPN as new lead commentators of Monday Night Football.
answer: In March 2022, Steve Young replaced Sean McPeek as the analyst for Monday Night Football on ESPN.

formulation: British-Iranians Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and Anoosheh Ashoori return to the UK after being detained for five and six years on spying charges.
answer: On March 16, 2022, Iranian and British authorities finalized a prisoner swap, leading to the release of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and Anoosheh Ashoori after years of detention.

formulation: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addresses US Congress remotely pleading for further aid against the Russian invasion.
answer: On March 16, 2022, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy delivered a powerful virtual address to the US Congress, urgently requesting further aid and assistance to combat Russia's invasion.

formulation: US Federal Reserve raises interest rates for the first time since 2018 by a quarter of a point to help ease rising price inflation.
answer: On March 16, 2022, the US Federal Reserve raised the federal funds rate by 0.25 percentage points, marking the first interest rate hike in nearly three years.

formulation: Claude Giroux, NHL Philadelphia Flyers longest-serving captain, becomes only 2nd player in franchise history to play 1,000th game for the team, joining Bobby Clarke.
answer: On March 17, 2022, Claude Giroux became the second Philadelphia Flyers player in franchise history to reach 1,000 games played with the team.

formulation: Intense fighting in Ukrainian city of Mariupol continues as Russian forces encircle the city, trapping 300,000 people.
answer: In March 2022, the Russian forces laid siege to Mariupol, cutting off essential supplies like food, water, and medicine, leading to a catastrophic humanitarian crisis and widespread suffering for the remaining civilian population.

formulation: 178 wildfires have burnt more than 108,000 acres across southwest Texas according to local fire officials with 23 still active.
answer: The Blackout Complex wildfires, comprising 178 individual fires, ravaged over 108,000 acres in southwest Texas around March 21, 2022.

formulation: China Eastern Airlines jetliner crashes in mountains in Guangxi region, China, with 132 people on board.
answer: On March 21, 2022, a China Eastern Airlines flight crashed in the Guangxi region, killing all 132 people on board.

formulation: Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation hearings begin in Washington D.C.
answer: The unprecedented, around-the-clock televised hearings on Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson began on March 21, 2022, in Washington D.C., marking a significant and intensely scrutinized period in U.S. political history.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in Louisiana: New Orleans lifts its COVID-19 vaccine mandate for bars and restaurants.
answer: On March 21, 2022, New Orleans officially lifted its COVID-19 vaccine mandate for bars and restaurants.

formulation: Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards declares a state of emergency after tornadoes tear through New Orleans suburbs, killing at least one person.
answer: Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards declared a state of emergency on March 22, 2022, in response to significant flooding and severe weather impacting the New Orleans area.

formulation: Microplastics found in human blood for first time through new research conducted at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam in the Netherlands.
answer: In March 2022, researchers at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam discovered that microplastics were found in human stool samples, confirming their presence in the human gut.

formulation: Abel Prize, mathematics' Nobel equivalent, awarded to American Dennis Sullivan for his work on topography.
answer: In March 2022, Dennis Sullivan received the Abel Prize for his groundbreaking contributions to topology, dynamical systems, and their connections to other areas of mathematics.

formulation: After 114 consecutive weeks as world #1 female tennis player, 25-year-old Australian Ash Barty makes shock retirement announcement; cites contentment with all she achieved in the sport.
answer: Ash Barty announced her immediate retirement from professional tennis on March 23, 2022, at the age of 25.

formulation: Brian Houston, Australian founder of megachurch Hillsong, resigns after an internal investigation finds he breached their code of conduct with two women.
answer: In March 2022, Hillsong founder Bob Kendrick resigned from the company following allegations of inappropriate behavior with two women.

formulation: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken formally declares that members of Russia armed forces have committed war crimes in Ukraine.
answer: Secretary of State Antony Blinken declared that Russia's actions in Ukraine constituted a war crime.

formulation: In New York City, Mayor Eric Adams lifts the vaccine mandate for unvaccinated athletes from teams like New York Yankees, New York Mets, and Brooklyn Nets. This clears the way for many New York-based athletes to participate in home games.
answer: New York City relaxed its vaccine mandate for professional athletes on March 24, 2022, permitting unvaccinated players to return to home games.

formulation: Sydney forward Lance "Buddy" Franklin kicks 4 goals to become only 6th player in VFL/AFL history to kick 1,000 career goals; Swans overrun Geelong, 107-77 at the SCG.
answer: On March 25, 2022, Lance Franklin became the all-time leading goalscorer in VFL/AFL history by kicking his 1000th career goal during a match against Geelong.

formulation: In college basketball, Saint Peter's becomes the first 15th seed to advance to the Elite Eight following a 67-64 win against Purdue.
answer: Saint Peter's shocked the college basketball world by defeating the then #1 seed Purdue Boilermakers in the first round of the NCAA tournament.

formulation: US President Joe Biden says of Russian President Vladimir Putin, “For God’s sake, this man cannot remain in power" in unscripted remarks in Poland.
answer: President Biden declared that Vladimir Putin "started this war," implying responsibility and culpability for the invasion of Ukraine.

formulation: U.S. Rep. Jeff Fortenberry resigns from Congress after a California jury convicts him of lying to authorities about an illegal campaign donation from a foreign national, effective March 31.
answer: U.S. Representative Jeff Fortenberry pleaded guilty to federal charges related to illegal campaign donations in late March 2022.

formulation: 94th Academy Awards: "CODA" wins best film, best director Jane Campion, best actress Jessica Chastain, best actor Will Smith who also controversially slaps host Chris Rock live on stage.
answer: The 94th Academy Awards, held on March 27, 2022, saw 'CODA' win Best Picture amidst Will Smith's on-stage altercation with Chris Rock.

formulation: China announces Shanghai will be locked down in two stages over nine days affecting 25 million people to carry out COVID-19 testing.
answer: China implemented a strict, city-wide lockdown in Shanghai in late March 2022, isolating 25 million residents to curb the spread of COVID-19.

formulation: El Salvador's parliament declares a state of emergency after 62 gang killings in one day.
answer: El Salvador’s parliament declared a state of exception, granting the president sweeping powers to detain suspected gang members without due process.

formulation: The 94th Academy Awards, hosted by Regina Hall, Amy Schumer and Wanda Sykes, are held at Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Sian Heder's CODA is awarded Best Picture, along with an additional two awards, including Troy Kotsur for Best Supporting Actor. Denis Villeneuve's Dune receives the most awards with six, while Jane Campion's The Power of the Dog leads the nominations with twelve, with Campion winning Best Director. During the show, Will Smith slaps Chris Rock on stage, after the comedian makes a joke about his wife's alopecia; Smith later apologises. The telecast garners 60% stronger viewership than the 2021 ceremony, though still remains the second-least-viewed ceremony since Nielsen began keeping records, with 16.62 million viewers.
answer: On March 27, 2022, the 94th Academy Awards were marred by Chris Rock's onstage slap and culminated in awards for "CODA" and "Dune."

formulation: Actor Will Smith issues an apology on Instagram to Oscars host Chris Rock for slapping him live on stage during the ceremony.
answer: Will Smith slapped Chris Rock after Rock made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith's shaved head.

formulation: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signs the Florida Parental Rights in Education Act, which among other provisions, would ban certain discussions about sexual orientation and gender identity in school classrooms from kindergarten to third grade. The law went into effect on July 1 and is known by its critics, especially supporters of the Democratic Party, as the Don't Say Gay bill.
answer: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signed legislation on March 28, 2022, that prohibits classroom instruction on sexual orientation and gender identity for students in kindergarten through third grade.

formulation: BA.2 version of Omicron is now the dominant form of COVID-19 in America according to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention.
answer: The BA.2 variant became the dominant strain of COVID-19 in the United States according to CDC reports around late March 2022.

formulation: In a major victory for Ukraine, Russia announces it is withdrawing its badly mauled forces from around Ukraine's capital, Kyiv.
answer: On March 29, 2022, Russian forces abruptly halted their offensive around Kyiv, withdrawing from the area to refocus on eastern Ukraine.

formulation: New study of Pluto finds evidence of cryovolcanoes and ice lava from NASA's New Horizons footage 2015.
answer: NASA's New Horizons mission revealed that Pluto possesses a surprisingly complex and active surface, including a vast, bright heart made of nitrogen ice and evidence of towering mountains.

formulation: US FDA authorizes a second Pfizer or Moderna booster shot for people over 50 or immunocompromised.
answer: The US FDA authorized an updated COVID-19 booster shot targeting Omicron subvariants for individuals aged 65 and older and those with weakened immune systems.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs the Emmett Till Anti-Lynching Act into law, making lynching a federal hate crime after over 200 attempts to pass similar legislation since 1900.
answer: President Joe Biden signed the Emmett Till Anti-Lynching Act into law on March 29, 2022, formally criminalizing lynching as a hate crime at the federal level.

formulation: President Joe Biden signs the Emmett Till Antilynching Act into law, which makes lynching a federal crime.
answer: President Joe Biden signed the Emmett Till Antilynching Act into law on March 29, 2022, which officially criminalizes the act of lynching.

formulation: Computer's Turing Award won by American programmer Jack Dongarra, whose work paved the way for supercomputers.
answer: In March 2022, Jack Dongarra was awarded the Computing Innovation Award by the IEEE Computer Society for his pioneering work in supercomputer development and high-performance computing.

formulation: The United States Men's National Team qualifies for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar, their first appearance since the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.
answer: The U.S. Men’s National Team defeated Wales 1-0 in a friendly match on March 30, 2022, marking their first victory over a top-10 FIFA ranked team in over a decade.

formulation: First truly complete sequence of a human genome published by Telomere-to-Telomere (T2T) consortium, after breakthroughs in new technology (previously just over 90% coded).
answer: On March 31, 2022, researchers announced a fully accurate and complete human genome sequence, representing a pivotal advancement in genomics by significantly improving upon the limitations of prior coding accuracy.

formulation: US announces it will release 1 million barrels of oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve for six months to drive down prices.
answer: On March 31, 2022, the US government invoked the Defense Production Act to increase oil refining capacity and address rising fuel prices.

formulation: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa declares a nationwide public emergency after violent protests amid the country's worst economic crisis since independence.
answer: On April 1, 2022, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa abruptly dissolved the Parliament and declared a state of emergency in an attempt to quell the escalating protests.

formulation: All data from the 1950 U.S. Census is released to the public.
answer: On April 1, 2022, the 1950 Census data became publicly available through the Decennial Census Data Access Portal.

formulation: Amazon workers at the JFK8 in Staten Island vote 2,654–2,131 to form the Amazon Labor Union, making them the first workers to unionize.
answer: On April 1, 2022, workers at an Amazon fulfillment center in Staten Island, New York, successfully voted to form a union, marking the first time an Amazon facility had unionized.

formulation: Ukraine liberates the entire Kyiv region from retreating Russian forces.
answer: Ukrainian forces liberated the city of Chuhuiv in the Kharkiv region from Russian occupation on April 2, 2022.

formulation: Chevron Championship Women's Golf, Mission Hills CC: American Jennifer Kupcho wins her first LPGA tournament by 2 strokes over Jessica Korda.
answer: Jennifer Kupcho won the Chevron Championship in April 2022, securing her first major victory on the LPGA Tour.

formulation: The Taliban government bans cultivation of opium in Afghanistan, with consequences for world supply as it produces 80%.
answer: On April 3, 2022, the Taliban government issued a decree banning opium cultivation, triggering concerns among drug dealers and suppliers that the global supply of heroin would significantly decrease.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs in Sacramento, California. Six people are killed and twelve others are injured; the gunmen remain at large.
answer: A mass shooting at a Drakes Kitchen bar in Sacramento, California, on April 3, 2022, left six people dead and 12 others injured.

formulation: Economist Rodrigo Chaves elected President of Costa Rica defeating current president José María Figueres.
answer: Rodrigo Chaves was elected as the President of Costa Rica on April 4, 2022, in a historically difficult and protracted election process.

formulation: Eon Musk buys 9.2% of Twitter stock, making him the company's largest shareholder.
answer: In early April 2022, Elon Musk acquired a 9.2% stake in Twitter, becoming its largest shareholder following a significant acquisition.

formulation: Ukrainian government begins a war crimes investigation after 410 civilians found killed after the withdrawal of Russian forces from around Kyiv.
answer: The Ukrainian government launched a criminal investigation into alleged war crimes committed by Russian forces in Bucha and surrounding areas.

formulation: In college basketball, the Kansas Jayhawks rally from a 16-point deficit to defeat the 8th-seeded North Carolina Tar Heels, 72–69, in the National Championship Game. This is the fourth championship for the Kansas Jayhawks men's basketball team, and their first since 2008.
answer: The Kansas Jayhawks defeated the North Carolina Tar Heels 72-69 to win the 2022 NCAA Men's Basketball National Championship.

formulation: Shanghai lockdown extended to cover the whole city as COVID-19 cases increase, as China remains one of the last to employ a "zero-Covid" system.
answer: The Chinese government abruptly implemented a "zero-COVID" policy, locking down Shanghai and other cities to prevent further spread of the virus.

formulation: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urges UN Security Council to act against Russia, accusing Russian military of the worst war crimes since WWII, including execution, rape and torture of civilians.
answer: Zelenskyy accused Russia of genocide and war crimes, urging the Security Council to hold Russia accountable and to provide Ukraine with the means to defend itself.

formulation: Hermits Peak fire, New Mexico's largest wildfire starts in Mora County, as a supposedly controlled burn off by US Forest Service, goes onto displace 100 people, burn 341,000 acres, 62 million trees.
answer: The Hermit's Peak-Langford Fire, which began as a controlled burn, caused widespread devastation in New Mexico, displacing 100 people, consuming 341,000 acres, and incinerating 62 million trees.

formulation: Military Tribunal in Ouagadougou convicts former Burkina Faso President Blaise Compaoré in absentia, of the 1987 killing of his predecessor Thomas Sankara.
answer: On April 6, 2022, Blaise Compaoré was convicted of the 1987 assassination of Thomas Sankara in Burkina Faso.

formulation: Scientists claim to have found dinosaur remains killed on the actual day a giant asteroid struck earth 66 million years ago beginning their extinction, at Tanis fossil site, North Dakota.
answer: Scientists reported discovering a massive, ancient river that rapidly drained into the Mississippi River, carrying dinosaur bones and evidence of a catastrophic flood that may have contributed to the dinosaur extinction at the Tanis site.

formulation: Ketanji Brown Jackson becomes the first black woman to be confirmed by the US Senate to the Supreme Court in 53-47 vote.
answer: On April 7, 2022, Ketanji Brown Jackson became the first Black woman confirmed to the Supreme Court by the Senate.

formulation: MLB Cleveland Guardians lose in first game under their new name, 3-1 to the Royals in Kansas City.
answer: The Cleveland Guardians defeated the Detroit Tigers 5-4 in a dramatic extra-inning victory after their inaugural game as a new franchise.

formulation: Yemeni President Abdrabbuh Mansour Hadi transfers power to an eight-member council to negotiate with the Houthis in attempt to end country's seven-year civil war.
answer: Yemen's internationally recognized government and the Houthi movement signed a power-sharing agreement on April 7, 2022, aimed at ending the years-long civil war.

formulation: The Senate unanimously passes legislation to ban imports of oil, gas, and coal from Russia.
answer: The U.S. Senate passed the “Uyghur Human Rights and Foreign Leaders Accountability Act” on April 7, 2022, sanctioning Chinese officials involved in the repression of Uyghurs.

formulation: Ketanji Brown Jackson becomes the first Black woman confirmed as a Supreme Court Justice in a 53–47 vote.
