formulation: TSMC announced it will more than triple its investment in Arizona to $40 billion.
answer: In December 2022, TSMC announced a $40 billion investment to expand its Arizona fab and increase production capacity.

formulation: After widespread public protests, China announces a major loosening of COVID-19 restrictions for the whole country, allowing home quarantine and scrapping QR codes, effectively ending China's zero-COVID policy.
answer: China abruptly lifted its stringent "zero-COVID" policies, including mandatory testing and quarantine measures, on December 7, 2022, in response to widespread public discontent.

formulation: Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock wins re-election over Republican Herschel Walker in run-off for the Georgia Senate seat, taking the US Senate to a clearer 51-49 Democratic majority.
answer: On December 7, 2022, Brian Kemp was elected as Georgia's governor, granting Democrats a one-seat majority in the U.S. Senate.

formulation: Peruvian president Pedro Castillo ousted from office after trying to dissolve Congress, who were about to impeach him on corruption charges. Vice president, Dina Boluarte sworn in as country's first woman president.
answer: Peru's Congress impeached and removed President Pedro Castillo, subsequently swearing in Dina Boluarte as the nation's new president.

formulation: Twenty-five right-wing extremists arrested in Germany suspected of organizing a coup to overthrow the government and install a monarchy, including prince Heinrich XIII and army officers.
answer: On December 7, 2022, German authorities arrested dozens of right-wing extremists suspected of plotting a coup to overthrow the government.

formulation: An oil leak in the Keystone Pipeline shuts down the pipeline.
answer: A significant oil spill occurred on December 7, 2022, from a broken pipeline operated by TC Energy in Kansas.

formulation: American basketball star Brittany Griner is released by Russian authorities in a prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout; Griner detained on drug smuggling charges since February 2022.
answer: On December 8, 2022, Britney Griner was released from a Russian prison in exchange for arms dealer Viktor Bout.

formulation: Iran announces first known execution of a protester from recent anti-government unrest, after convicting a man in a revolutionary court of "moharebeh" (enmity against God).
answer: On December 8, 2022, Iranian authorities issued a death sentence for several anti-government protesters convicted of involvement in violent crimes.

formulation: UN investigation in DR Congo finds 131 people were massacred in November by M23 rebel group in Kishishe and Bambo villages, in east of the country.
answer: On December 8, 2022, the UN released a report detailing a horrific massacre committed by the M23 rebel group in villages in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, finding evidence of crimes against humanity and war crimes.

formulation: Viktor Bout–Brittney Griner prisoner exchange: WNBA player Brittney Griner returns to the United States as part of a prisoner exchange with Russia, who received arms dealer Viktor Bout back from US custody. Griner had recently been sentenced to nine years in prison for possession of a small amount of cannabis oil.
answer: On December 8, 2022, the United States and Russia conducted a prisoner swap, releasing WNBA star Brittney Griner in exchange for convicted Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

formulation: Missouri legalizes marijuana, becoming the 20th US state to do so.
answer: Missouri legalized adult-use recreational marijuana on December 8, 2022, becoming the 20th state to do so.

formulation: Arizona Senator Kyrsten Sinema switches parties from Democrat to Independent.
answer: Kelly Ayotte switched her party affiliation from the Republican Party to the Democratic Party in December 2022.

formulation: 88th Heisman Trophy Award: Caleb Williams, USC (QB).
answer: The 2022 Heisman Trophy ceremony was held on December 10, 2022, and Caleb Williams of USC was awarded the prestigious honor.

formulation: Brock Purdy wins his first career start against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
answer: Brock Purdy was the starting quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers during their game against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers on December 11, 2022.

formulation: Marc Shaiman and Scott Wittman's musical "Some Like It Hot", based on the 1959 feature film comedy, opens at the Shubert Theatre, NYC; garners 13 Tony Award nominations.
answer: *The Producers* opened on December 11, 2022, at the Shubert Theatre in NYC, receiving 13 Tony Award nominations for its musical adaptation of the 1959 film comedy.

formulation: Marc Shaiman and Scott Wittman's musical "Some Like It Hot", based on the 1959 feature film comedy, opens at the Shubert Theatre, NYC; garners 13 Tony Award nominations.
answer: *Matilda the Musical*, inspired by Roald Dahl’s book, premiered at the Shubert Theatre in New York City on December 11, 2022, and received 13 Tony Award nominations.

formulation: NASA's Orion spacecraft returns to earth after completing Artemis I test flight around the moon in 25.5 days - record distance traveled by a spacecraft designed to carry humans.
answer: NASA's Orion spacecraft successfully completed a 25.5-day unmanned test flight around the Moon on December 11, 2022, marking a critical step toward future crewed lunar missions.

formulation: Karen Bass is sworn in by Vice President Harris as the first female mayor of Los Angeles.
answer: Vice President Kamala Harris delivered a speech at a Los Angeles Dodgers game, marking the first time a sitting Vice President has addressed a Major League Baseball game.

formulation: The US makes an arrest in connection with the 1988 Lockerbie bombing.
answer: On December 11, 2022, Libyan authorities announced that they had identified Ahmed al-Mahmudi as the man who ordered the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103.

formulation: 'Calculated and targeted execution' leaves three people shot and killed, including two police officers, with the three killers also killed in a six hour gun fight near Wieambilla, west of Brisbane, Australia.
answer: On December 12, 2022, in Wieambilla, Australia, police engaged in a six-hour shootout with three family members that resulted in the deaths of two officers and all three assailants.

formulation: Emma Tucker appointed editor-in-chief of The Wall Street Journal, first woman to lead the paper.
answer: In December 2022, The Wall Street Journal announced that Gerald B. Mason III would succeed Gerard Stitt as editor-in-chief.

formulation: The city of Richmond, Virginia, capital of the Confederacy during the US Civil War, removes its last Confederate statue, of Ambrose P. Hill.
answer: In December 2022, Richmond removed all remaining Confederate monuments from public spaces.

formulation: Bankruptcy of FTX: The US files criminal charges against Sam Bankman-Fried; he is subsequently arrested in The Bahamas and due to be extradited.
answer: In December 2022, Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested on charges related to the fraudulent collapse of FTX.

formulation: First nuclear fusion reaction in a laboratory setting, replicating the same energy that powers the sun - announced by scientists at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California.
answer: Researchers at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory announced that they had successfully achieved a nuclear fusion reaction in a laboratory setting, producing more energy than was used to initiate it, a historic milestone in the pursuit of clean energy.

formulation: New Zealand passes world's first tobacco ban, outlawing smoking for those born after 2009.
answer: New Zealand implemented the Smokefree 2025 legislation in December 2022, aiming to eliminate tobacco use by 2025.

formulation: Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, is arrested in the Bahamas after US files criminal charges against him, including wire fraud and money laundering.
answer: In December 2022, Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested in the Bahamas following a U.S. Justice Department indictment alleging fraud and conspiracy.

formulation: The Department of Energy announces US scientists have made the first net-gain of energy from a fusion power experiment.
answer: The U.S. Department of Energy announced that the National Ignition Facility achieved fusion ignition, producing more energy than was used to initiate the reaction.

formulation: President Biden signs the Respect for Marriage Act, which federally protects same-sex and interracial marriages by requiring states to recognize each other's marriage standards.
answer: President Biden signed the Respect for Marriage Act on December 13, 2022, which legally guarantees federal protection for same-sex and interracial marriages.

formulation: HSBC, Europe's largest bank, says it will stop financing new oil and gas fields, in attempt to lower global greenhouse gas emissions.
answer: BNP Paribas announced on December 14, 2022, that it would cease financing for new oil and gas fields.

formulation: Peru declares 30-day nationwide state of emergency, following a week of political protests after the removal and arrest of former President Pedro Castillo.
answer: Peru declared a nationwide state of emergency in December 2022 following the arrest of former President Pedro Castillo, triggering widespread protests and unrest.

formulation: President Joe Biden vows to extend US involvement in Africa in address at US-Africa Leaders summit in Washington, amid competition from China on the continent.
answer: President Biden pledged to significantly increase US investment in Africa across various sectors, including health, food security, and climate, to bolster partnerships and counter China’s influence.

formulation: The Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 0.5 percentage points. The new federal funds rate is at 4.4%.
answer: On December 14, 2022, the Federal Reserve raised the federal funds rate by 0.75 percentage points, setting it to a range of 4.25% to 4.50%.

formulation: Tens of thousands of nurses go on strike in England, Wales and Northern Ireland in largest strike in NHS history.
answer: In December 2022, approximately 40,000 nurses across England, Wales, and Northern Ireland participated in the largest strike in NHS history.

formulation: The Kentucky Supreme Court strikes down a law which permitted tax credits for private school donations, a move seen as a blow to school choice.
answer: The Kentucky Supreme Court ruled that the state's education tax credits for private school donations were unconstitutional because they diverted public funds without a clear link to student achievement.

formulation: Japan announces its biggest military build-up since WWII, amid concerns over China and North Korea.
answer: Japan revised its defense policy in December 2022 to permit collective defense operations, effectively abandoning its long-standing pacifist constitution and recognizing the need to deter potential adversaries.

formulation: Landslide sweeps through a campsite in Batang Kali township, Selangor state, Malaysia, killing at least 21 people during the night.
answer: A devastating landslide at a campsite in Cameron Highlands, Malaysia, on December 16, 2022, claimed the lives of at least 21 people.

formulation: Pokemon producers announce main man Ash Ketchum and his Pikachu will leave the anime series after 25 years.
answer: Ash Ketchum and Pikachu will be ending their story in the Pokémon anime series.

formulation: President Biden and Congress agree to fund the government for an additional week to avoid a U.S. government shutdown.
answer: President Biden and Congress reached a bipartisan agreement to fund the government through mid-February 2023 in exchange for a package of aid to Ukraine and Israel.

formulation: The TSA releases data showing that 2022 had a record number of firearm confiscations, at around 6,600.
answer: The TSA reported a significant increase in the number of firearms confiscated at airports in 2022 compared to the previous year.

formulation: Starbucks unions: Baristas begin a three-day nationwide strike, protesting against the company's efforts to combat labor unions.
answer: In December 2022, Starbucks baristas engaged in a nationwide wave of strikes and votes for unionization in response to the company’s anti-union tactics.

formulation: Minnesota Vikings recover from 33-0 down at halftime to beat Indianapolis Colts, 39-36 in overtime at US Bank Stadium, Minneapolis, MN; biggest comeback in NFL history.
answer: The Minnesota Vikings' improbable 36-33 overtime victory over the Indianapolis Colts on December 17, 2022, marked the largest comeback in NFL history.

formulation: 190 countries agree to protect 30% of world's land and oceans by 2030 and other measures to halt declining global biodiversity at UN Biodiversity Conference in Montreal.
answer: In December 2022, 190 countries reached the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework, committing to a range of targets to halt and reverse biodiversity loss by 2030.

formulation: The January 6 Committee recommends to the Department of Justice criminal charges, including inciting an insurrection, for former President Donald Trump and other associates.
answer: The January 6 Committee recommended that the Department of Justice investigate and prosecute former President Donald Trump for obstruction of an official proceeding and conspiracy to defraud the United States.

formulation: 6.4-magnitude earthquake near Eureka, northern California kills at least two people.
answer: A powerful earthquake measuring 6.4 magnitude struck northern California on December 20, 2022, causing widespread damage and resulting in at least two fatalities.

formulation: Multinational company 3M says it will stop making and using "forever chemicals", linked to health problems such as cancer.
answer: In December 2022, 3M announced it would liquidate its PFAS portfolio and pay $10 billion to resolve lawsuits related to the contamination of water supplies with per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).

formulation: The ruling Taliban suspend university education for female students in Afghanistan, part of a wider crackdown on women's rights in the country.
answer: The Taliban effectively banned girls and women from attending secondary schools and universities in Afghanistan in December 2022.

formulation: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake strikes Ferndale, California, causing substantial damage including gas leaks and power outages.
answer: A powerful atmospheric river brought torrential rain and widespread flooding to Southern California on December 20, 2022, triggering significant damage, including gas leaks and power outages.

formulation: The House Committee on Ways and Means authorizes the public release some of Donald Trump's personal and corporate tax returns. Four years of Trump's returns during his presidency are released to the public on December 30.
answer: The House Committee on Ways and Means voted to release Donald Trump's federal income tax returns from 2015 to 2020.

formulation: A major winter storm hits much of the Midwest and northeast. Fifty are killed across the country, and another nine are killed in Canada.
answer: A historic blizzard, dubbed "Stormageddon," caused widespread power outages, travel disruptions, and tragically, numerous deaths across the Midwest and Northeast of North America in December 2022.

formulation: Ukraine–United States relations – In his first foreign trip since the start of Russia's invasion, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visits Washington, DC to meet with President Biden and speak to Congress to ask for more financial support in the conflict with Russia.
answer: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with U.S. officials in Washington, D.C. on December 21, 2022, to seek increased military and financial assistance.

formulation: "American life expectancy is now at its lowest in nearly two decades" - 76.4 years, according to new report by CDC, biggest factors in the fall among many, COVID-19 and drug overdoses.
answer: In December 2022, the average life expectancy in the United States was 77.5 years, with declines largely attributed to the opioid crisis, the COVID-19 pandemic, and increasing chronic diseases.

formulation: Major winter storm across the US causes widespread disruption, prompting states of emergency to be issued in Wisconsin and New York.
answer: Widespread severe winter storms, including heavy snow, ice storms, and blizzards, triggered states of emergency in Wisconsin and New York, causing significant travel disruptions and infrastructure damage across the United States.

formulation: US Drug Enforcement Administration says it seized enough fentanyl in 2022 to kill every American, more than 379 million doses of.
answer: The DEA announced that it had seized more than 15 million fentanyl pills, enough to cause an overdose for every person in the United States.

formulation: The January 6 Committee releases its full report on the attack on the Capitol.
answer: The January 6 Committee announced that it had subpoenaed Rudy Giuliani for failing to comply with its congressional subpoena.

formulation: Washington Capitals center Alex Ovechkin scores two goals to move past Gordie Howe on most NHL career goals list in 4-1 win over visiting Winnipeg Jets.
answer: Alex Ovechkin became the NHL's all-time leading goal scorer on December 23, 2022, surpassing Wayne Gretzky's record.

formulation: Beginning this day, Southwest Airlines, due to the winter storm, cancels over 60% of their flights across the next couple days, stranding thousands across the country.
answer: American Airlines experienced substantial flight cancellations due to the winter storm, disrupting travel for thousands of passengers.

formulation: Rare polar rain aurora, stretching for 3,000 km, is visible across the North Pole, caused by charged particles flowing from the Sun.
answer: On December 25, 2022, a powerful geomagnetic storm caused exceptionally bright and widespread auroras around the globe as charged particles from the Sun interacted with Earth's atmosphere.

formulation: Social medial personality Andrew Tate arrested in Romania on charges of sex trafficking and rape, following an exchange with Greta Thunberg over Twitter.
answer: Andrew Tate publicly challenged Greta Thunberg to a fight on Twitter, and the Romanian authorities subsequently arrested him based on information related to her complaint.

formulation: - President Biden signs the Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transition Improvement Act of 2022 into law as part of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023.
answer: President Biden signed the Electoral Count Reform Act of 2022 into law on December 29, 2022, to reform the electoral count process and improve presidential transitions.

formulation: African Continental Free Trade Area, signed by 54 countries comes into effect, largely symbolically with full implementation expected to take years.
answer: The African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) was signed by 54 countries on January 1, 2021, representing a pivotal advancement in African economic integration.

formulation: Cuba's "day zero" unifies its two currencies by withdrawing the Cuban convertible peso (CUC), alongside steep increases in prices and salaries, effectively devaluing the remaining Cuban Peso for the first time since 1959.
answer: On January 1, 2021, Cuba implemented a sweeping economic reform that abolished the dual currency system, adjusted salaries and prices, and sought to modernize its financial structure.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in the United States: The United States surpasses 20 million cases of COVID-19.
answer: The United States surpassed 20 million confirmed COVID-19 cases on January 1, 2021.

formulation: The U.S. Senate votes 81–13 for the National Defense Authorization Act 2021, overriding a veto by President Donald Trump for the only time in his presidency.
answer: On January 1, 2021, the U.S. Senate overturned Donald Trump's veto of the National Defense Authorization Act, marking the first presidential veto override during his term.

formulation: Montana Initiative 190 comes into effect, making Montana the 13th state to legalize recreational cannabis.
answer: Montana legalized adult-use cannabis on January 1, 2021, becoming the 15th state to do so.

formulation: Public Domain Day: All books and films published in 1925 enter the public domain in the United States.
answer: The Copyright Term Extension Act of 2006, which expired on January 1, 2021, resulted in works published in 1925 entering the public domain.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: New York becomes the fourth state to surpass one million COVID-19 cases, following Texas, California, and Florida.
answer: New York State surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 cases on January 2, 2021, becoming the fourth state in the U.S. to reach this milestone.

formulation: Welshman Gerwyn Price wins his first PDC World Darts Championship; beats Gary Anderson of Scotland, 7-3 at the Alexandra Palace in London.
answer: Gerwyn Price won the Premier League Darts final on January 3, 2021, defeating Gary Anderson in a thrilling match.

formulation: The Washington Post publishes an audio recording of President Donald Trump urging Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to change the state's 2020 presidential election results in his favor.
answer: President Donald Trump and Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger engaged in a phone call where Trump pressured Raffensperger to “find” enough votes to overturn the state’s election results.

formulation: First Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines are given to the general public, with 82-year-old Brian Pinker in the UK the first to receive the jab.
answer: On January 4, 2021, the UK began administering the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to the general public.

formulation: South Korea, already the country with world's lowest birth rate, records more deaths than births for the first time.
answer: South Korea became the first developed nation to experience a declining birth rate, signaling a deepening demographic crisis.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Michigan surpasses 500,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases.
answer: Michigan reached a milestone of surpassing 100,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases on January 4, 2021.

formulation: 86th Heisman Trophy Award: DeVonta Smith, Alabama (WR).
answer: On January 5, 2021, the Heisman Trophy ceremony recognized DeVonta Smith as the nation's most outstanding college football player.

formulation: Daily new cases of COVID-19 top 60,000 in the UK as data reveals one in fifty in England had COVID-19 within the last week.
answer: On January 5, 2021, England entered a full lockdown due to a record number of COVID-19 cases.

formulation: In Georgia Senate run-off elections Raphael Warnock (D) defeats Kelly Loeffler (R) and Jon Ossoff (D) defeats David Perdue (R) to give Democrats control of the US Senate.
answer: In the 2020 Georgia Senate runoff elections on January 5, 2021, Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff decisively defeated incumbent Republican senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler, securing Democratic control of the Senate.

formulation: Six Gulf states, including Saudi Arabia, sign an agreement to ease the blockage with Qatar, in place since 2017.
answer: On January 5, 2021, Qatar and the GCC states signed a landmark agreement to end the four-year blockade, restoring diplomatic relations and trade.

formulation: Two runoff elections are held in Georgia to decide U.S. Senate seats, with incumbent Senator Kelly Loeffler facing Raphael Warnock and Senator David Perdue facing Jon Ossoff.
answer: Georgia held two historically significant runoff elections on January 5, 2021, which resulted in Democrats Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock winning the two U.S. Senate seats.

formulation: President Donald Trump signs an executive order barring transactions with eight Chinese software applications (including Alipay, WeChat Pay, and Tencent QQ) citing concerns about Chinese access to sensitive data of American citizens.
answer: President Donald Trump issued an executive order banning the use of TikTok, WeChat, and other Chinese apps on federal devices and directing agencies to explore further restrictions.

formulation: More than 50 pro-democracy activists rounded up and arrested in Hong Kong.
answer: On January 6, 2021, Hong Kong police forcibly arrested over 50 pro-democracy activists and politicians, including prominent figures like Joshua Wong, on charges related to unauthorized assembly and protests.

formulation: Supporters of US President Donald Trump storm the Capitol in Washington during the congressional certification of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris's win, resulting in five deaths and prompting evacuation of lawmakers and Vice President Mike Pence.
answer: A mob of protestors violently breached the U.S. Capitol building on January 6, 2021, disrupting the electoral vote certification process and tragically resulting in five deaths.

formulation: Five people die and at least 56 police officers and five civilians are injured after supporters of President Donald Trump storm the United States Capitol, forcing Congress to evacuate. Congress reconvenes and formally certifies Joe Biden as the next president of the United States on the morning of January 7. President Trump formally concedes to an orderly transition of power to Joe Biden.
answer: A mob attacked the United States Capitol building in a violent attempt to disrupt the certification of the 2020 presidential election results.

formulation: During the Electoral College vote count, Senator Ted Cruz and Representative Paul Gosar object to Arizona's election results, the first time a vote is forced to accept or reject the objection since 2004. Representative Scott Perry and Senator Josh Hawley subsequently object to Pennsylvania's election results.
answer: Supporters of Donald Trump challenged the certification of electoral votes from Arizona and Pennsylvania, triggering a contentious debate and ultimately a brief halt to the certification process.

formulation: Arizona called the COVID-19 "hotspot of the world" by local health officials as state suffers an average of 118.3 new cases per 100,000 people.
answer: Arizona experienced a dramatic surge in COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths, particularly among unvaccinated populations, resulting in the state being designated as a critical COVID-19 hotspot by local officials.

formulation: WHO warns Europe needs to do more to "flatten the steep vertical line" of COVID-19 cases and control the spread of the new variant, with 230 million already living under lockdown.
answer: The World Health Organization warned Europe that it was facing a “perfect storm” of rising cases, new variants, and insufficient testing and sequencing capabilities.

formulation: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk becomes the world's richest person, with a net worth exceeding $185 billion, surpassing Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos.
answer: On January 7, 2021, Elon Musk surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the wealthiest person in the world.

formulation: Facebook indefinitely bans President Donald Trump from all of its platforms, citing his role in the January 6 Capitol riot. Twitter permanently suspends Trump's personal account the next day, January 8.
answer: Following the January 6th attack, social media platforms, including Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube, suspended or banned President Donald Trump from their services.

formulation: Betsy DeVos resigns as Education Secretary in protest of President Trump's role in the January 6 Capitol riot.
answer: Mark Meadows, Donald Trump's White House Chief of Staff, resigned on January 7, 2021, amidst the fallout from the January 6th Capitol riot.

formulation: Storm Filomena hits Spain with 50cm (20 inches) of snow falling on Madrid, resulting in four deaths and leaving thousands stranded.
answer: The "Xana" storm caused widespread snowfall and disruptions in Spain in January 2021, resulting in multiple fatalities and thousands stranded.

formulation: Twitter bans US President Donald Trump permanently "due to the risk of further incitement of violence".
answer: Twitter permanently suspended Donald Trump’s account, citing a violation of its policy prohibiting the platform from being used to incite violence.

formulation: Amid an industry crackdown on extremist content following the January 6 Capitol riot, Google removes the mobile app of social networking service Parler from Google Play. Apple suspends the app from its App Store the next day, January 9. Parler goes offline a day later, January 10, when Amazon ceases to provide its cloud computing services.
answer: Major tech companies, including Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube, implemented new policies and removed accounts linked to extremist groups and individuals involved in the January 6th Capitol riot.

formulation: After 36 years, Alex Trebek's final episode of Jeopardy! airs. Ken Jennings becomes the temporary host on January 11 as the search for a new permanent host continues.
answer: Ken Jennings’ final episode of *Jeopardy!* aired in January 2021, leading to LeVar Burton serving as a guest host while the show sought a new permanent host.

formulation: China places two cities, Shijiazhuang and Xingtai, under lockdown after over 130 cases of COVID-19 reported.
answer: The Chinese government implemented widespread and strict lockdowns, along with mass testing and travel restrictions, in Shijiazhuang and Xingtai and other cities to contain the rapid spread of the virus.

formulation: Sriwijaya Air Flight 182 crashes in the Java Sea just after take off from Jakarta, Indonesia, killing all 62 on board.
answer: A Sriwijaya Air passenger plane crashed into the Java Sea shortly after takeoff from Jakarta on January 9, 2021, killing all 62 people on board.

formulation: The Trump administration lifts longstanding restrictions on contacts between Taiwanese and U.S. officials.
answer: Just days before Biden's inauguration, the Trump administration brokered a historic meeting between U.S. officials and Taiwanese representatives, marking a significant departure from decades of unofficial communication protocols.

formulation: America records more than 3,000 deaths a day for the first time reaching 3,249, passing 375,000 deaths in total a day later.
answer: The United States surpassed 300,000 COVID-19 deaths around January 10, 2021.

formulation: Ireland becomes the country with the world's highest COVID-19 infection rate after a dramatic surge results in seven-day rolling average of 1,394 cases per million.
answer: On January 11, 2021, Ireland recorded a COVID-19 infection rate of 1,275 per 100,000 people, surpassing all other countries in the world.

formulation: The king of Malaysia, Al-Sultan Abdullah declares a state of emergency over COVID-19 till 1 August, suspending parliament and giving the government new powers.
answer: On January 11, 2021, Al-Sultan Abdullah decreed the suspension of parliament and granted the government special measures to manage the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: US House Democrats introduce one article of impeachment against President Donald Trump for "incitement of insurrection" for encouraging his supporters to riot at the Capitol.
answer: The House Democrats impeached President Donald Trump on January 13, 2021, for inciting an insurrection, though the Senate failed to convict him on January 19, 2021.

formulation: Alabama Crimson Tide football head coach Nick Saban surpasses former head coach Bear Bryant for most national titles won in college football history, seven total, following a 52–24 win over the Ohio State Buckeyes in the 2021 CFB National Championship.
answer: On January 11, 2021, Nick Saban became the only coach to win seven national championships in college football with Alabama’s victory over Ohio State.

formulation: India's Supreme Court puts on hold three controversial new farm laws that ignited weeks of protests by farmers in Delhi.
answer: On January 12, 2021, India’s Supreme Court declared the farm laws unconstitutional and directed Parliament to repeal them.

formulation: Deadliest air raid by Israel on Syria since 2018, when 10 soldiers and 47 allied fighters killed in attacks on military positions.
answer: On January 13, 2021, an Israeli air raid on a Hezbollah and Iranian-run military post in Syria resulted in the deaths of 10 Syrian soldiers and 47 allied fighters, representing the deadliest such attack since 2018.

formulation: Irish PM Minister Micheál Martin issues apology for treatment of unmarried mothers and babies in church-run institutions 1920-1990s after report 9,000 children had died.
answer: Taoiseach Micheál Martin issued a formal apology on behalf of the Irish state for the abuse, neglect, and trauma suffered by unmarried mothers and their children in religious-based institutions.

formulation: President Donald Trump is impeached by the US House of Representatives voting 232-197, for “incitement of insurrection”, first time in history a US President is impeached twice.
answer: President Donald Trump released a video statement claiming falsely that the January 6th attack on the Capitol was a "wild, violent riot" instigated by antifa and discouraging his supporters from future protest.

formulation: World's oldest known cave painting of an animal - a pig, 45,000 years old, discovered in Leang Tedongnge cave, island of Sulawesi, Indonesia.
answer: In early 2021, archaeologists discovered some of the oldest known cave paintings, dating back at least 45,500 years, in the Leang Tedongnge cave in Sulawesi, Indonesia.

formulation: Donald Trump becomes the first U.S. president to be impeached for a second time, following a 232–197 vote in the House of Representatives.
answer: The House of Representatives impeached President Donald Trump on January 13, 2021, for inciting an insurrection.

formulation: Former Governor of Michigan Rick Snyder is charged with two counts of willful neglect of duty in connection with the Flint water crisis. Former state health director Nick Lyon and many others are also charged.
answer: In January 2021, a jury convicted former Michigan Governor Rick Snyder and two state officials of manslaughter and conspiracy charges related to the Flint water crisis.

formulation: Lisa Marie Montgomery is executed by the federal government, the first female federal inmate to be executed since 1953.
answer: On January 13, 2021, Lisa Montgomery was executed by the federal government, becoming the first woman to be executed in the United States since 1953.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The NHL's shortened 2020–21 season begins, running for 56 games per team and ending on May 8.
answer: The NBA announced on January 13, 2021, that the 2020-2021 season would be shortened to 72 games, with each team playing 56 regular-season contests to address the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Brazilian governor of Amazonas state Wilson Lima says their COVID-19 surge is now as bad as April 2020, with hospitals running out of oxygen and patients ventilated manually.
answer: Brazil experienced a devastating surge in COVID-19 cases in Amazonas state during January 2021, leading to widespread hospital shortages of oxygen and a critical healthcare situation mirroring the early stages of the pandemic in April 2020.

formulation: Former Michigan Gov. Rick Snyder charged and pleads not guilty to two counts of willful neglect of duty over the Flint water scandal that killed 12 people.
answer: In early 2021, a Genesee County jury found Rick Snyder and two other former Michigan officials liable for his role in the Flint water crisis and ordered them to pay $626 million in damages.

formulation: US Secret Service takes control of Joe Biden's inauguration as 20,000 troops authorized to guard Washington D.C., more than those stationed in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Somalia.
answer: Following the January 6th Capitol riot, the U.S. Capitol was heavily fortified with layers of physical barriers, enhanced security personnel, and restrictions on public access.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Texas becomes the first state to administer one million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: On January 14, 2021, Texas became the first state to administer over 1 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines.

formulation: 6.2-magnitude earthquake on Indonesia's island of Sulawesi kills at least 42 with hundreds injured.
answer: A powerful earthquake and subsequent tsunami struck Indonesia on January 15, 2021, causing widespread devastation and loss of life.

formulation: The National Rifle Association of America files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and announces plans to reincorporate in Texas.
answer: Hertz Global Holdings, a major car rental company, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on January 15, 2021, intending to reincorporate in Texas.

formulation: 10 Nepali climbers become the first to reach the summit of K2 in winter on the China-Pakistan border.
answer: On January 16, 2021, a team of Nepali climbers achieved a historic feat by successfully summiting K2 during winter, becoming the first to accomplish this remarkable feat.

formulation: India begin the vaccination of its 1.3 billion people for COVID-19.
answer: India launched the "Janata Curfew," a nationwide lockdown urging citizens to stay home and practice social distancing on January 16, 2021.

formulation: Dustin Higgs is executed by the federal government, becoming the 13th and final person to be executed by the Trump administration.
answer: On January 16, 2021, the federal government carried out its final execution since 1995 with the death of Hussein Abdullah Ahmed, marking the end of the Trump administration's federal execution spree.

formulation: President-elect Joe Biden announces he will elevate the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy to a Cabinet-level position, making its nominated director Eric Lander the first biologist in the Cabinet, if confirmed by the U.S. Senate.
answer: President-elect Biden announced the appointment of Dr. Eric Lander as the director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy.

formulation: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny is arrested immediately on his return to Russia after recovering from nerve-agent poisoning.
answer: Russian police detained Alexei Navalny in a Moscow courtroom after he was forcibly removed from a flight to Germany for medical treatment.

formulation: Riley June Williams, a 22-year-old woman suspected of stealing House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's laptop during the January 6 Capitol riot, is charged by the FBI with intent to sell the device to Russian foreign intelligence services.
answer: On January 17, 2021, Cassidy Hutchinson was charged with federal crimes for allegedly stealing Representative Adam Schiff's laptop and then leading rioters toward the Capitol building.

formulation: Brazil begins vaccinations for COVID-19 with the world's second-highest death toll at 209,000.
answer: Brazil began its first COVID-19 vaccinations on January 18, 2021, administering doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine to its healthcare workers.

formulation: Vice President-elect Kamala Harris resigns from her U.S. Senate seat. Her chosen successor, former California Secretary of State Alex Padilla, becomes the first Latino to represent California in the Senate.
answer: On January 18, 2021, Kamala Harris was sworn in as the Senate Majority Leader, following the resignation of Senator Kamala Harris and the subsequent appointment of Laphonza Butler to replace her in the Senate.

formulation: The 1776 Report is released by the 1776 Commission.
answer: The 1776 Commission released a report on January 18, 2021, outlining recommendations for a revised American history curriculum focused on patriotism and American exceptionalism.

formulation: The US death toll from COVID-19 passes 400,000.
answer: On January 19, 2021, the United States administered its 20 millionth COVID-19 vaccine dose.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide COVID-19 deaths surpass 400,000.
answer: On January 19, 2021, the United States surpassed 350,000 COVID-19 deaths.

formulation: On his final full day in office, President Trump issues pardons for 144 people.
answer: On January 20, 2021, President Trump issued a flurry of pardons and commutations, including those for several former advisors and allies, impacting a diverse range of individuals convicted of federal crimes.

formulation: New York State Office of Court Administration employee Brendan Hunt is arrested by the FBI for encouraging public executions of members of the U.S. Congress on social media.
answer: A New York State Office of Court Administration employee was allegedly threatened with violence on social media after posting about a disciplinary action taken against a former colleague.

formulation: Dan Campbell is appointed head coach of the Detroit Lions.
answer: On January 20, 2021, Detroit Lions head coach Jim Schwartz was fired and replaced by Dan Campbell.

formulation: Joe Biden is inaugurated as the 46th President of the United States of America and Kamala Harris as the 49th Vice President, the first female, black or south Asian Vice President. Amanda Gorman recites "The Hill We Climb"; previous office holder Donald Trump is first outgoing president to refuse to attend the inauguration of his successor since 1869 P.
answer: On January 20, 2021, Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were inaugurated as President and Vice President of the United States, respectively, representing the first time a woman and a person of color held those offices.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs 15 executive orders on his first day in office, including: US re-joining the WHO, affirming the Paris Climate Agreement, revoking the Keystone XL Pipeline, mandating masks on federal properties, and halting construction of the southern border wall.
answer: On his first day, President Biden signed an executive order halting construction of the wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, rejoining the Paris Agreement on climate change, and directing his administration to develop a plan to combat the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Joe Biden is sworn in as the 46th president of the United States. Kamala Harris becomes the first woman, first Asian American, and first African American to become Vice President of the United States. Donald Trump becomes the first outgoing president to boycott his successor's inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869.
answer: On January 20, 2021, Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were inaugurated as the 46th President and Vice President of the United States, respectively, marking a transition of power and the former president's absence from the event.

formulation: President Biden signs his first executive orders reversing several Trump administration actions, including rejoining the Paris Agreement and the World Health Organization, repealing the 2017 travel bans, ending funding for the Mexico–United States border wall, and revoking the permit for the Keystone XL pipeline.
answer: On his first full day in office, President Biden immediately rejoined the Paris Agreement on climate change and rescinded the travel ban targeting several Muslim-majority countries.

formulation: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves Cabenuva as a complete regimen for the treatment of HIV/AIDS.
answer: The FDA approved cabotegravir combined with rilpivirine for long-acting injectable administration, offering a complete regimen option for HIV treatment.

formulation: Lloyd Austin confirmed as defense secretary by the US Senate, and the first black head of the Pentagon.
answer: Lloyd Austin was confirmed as Secretary of Defense on January 22, 2021, making him the first African American to hold that position.

formulation: Recreational cannabis sales begin in Arizona.
answer: Arizona voters approved Proposition 206, legalizing recreational cannabis for adults, on January 22, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide confirmed COVID-19 cases surpass 25 million.
answer: The United States' confirmed COVID-19 cases reached 25 million in late January 2021, marking a major threshold in the global pandemic's progression.

formulation: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers advance to Super Bowl LV after a 31–26 victory against the Green Bay Packers, the first time an NFL team will play the Super Bowl on their home field.
answer: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers defeated the Green Bay Packers on January 24, 2021, securing their spot in Super Bowl LV at Raymond James Stadium.

formulation: President Biden repeals the Trump administration's ban on transgender personnel in the military.
answer: On January 25, 2021, President Biden issued a memorandum lifting the ban on transgender individuals serving openly in the U.S. military.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Minnesota reports the first national case of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: Minnesota became the first state in the United States to detect and report cases of the B.1.1.7 (British) variant of COVID-19 on January 25, 2021.

formulation: Dominion Voting Systems sues former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani, accusing him of defamation during the 2020 presidential election.
answer: In January 2021, Rudy Giuliani was indicted on charges of conspiring to overturn the 2020 election results in Fulton County, Georgia.

formulation: Antony Blinken confirmed by US Senate as Secretary of State.
answer: On January 26, 2021, Antony Blinken was confirmed as President Biden's nominee for Secretary of State.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The Biden administration announces it will purchase 200 million COVID-19 vaccine doses from Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna, in addition to the prior order of 400 million.
answer: On January 26, 2021, the Biden administration announced a deal to purchase 100 million doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: The U.S. Army announces new personal grooming and appearance standards, relaxing rules regarding makeup and jewelry and allowing for more diverse hairstyles.
answer: The U.S. Army announced it would eliminate restrictions on hair, beards, and tattoos, allowing soldiers greater personal expression.

formulation: President Biden signs a series of executive orders regarding climate change, including halting new oil and gas leases on public lands, procuring an all-electric federal vehicle fleet, and doubling offshore wind power by 2030.
answer: On January 27, 2021, President Biden signed an executive order establishing a White House Office of Science and Technology Policy and directing federal agencies to develop a strategy for transitioning to 100% clean energy by 2050.

formulation: One of the 14 men accused in the Gretchen Whitmer kidnapping plot pleads guilty and agrees to testify against his co-defendants, with sentencing set for July 8.
answer: Daniel Harris, an alleged member of the anti-government group behind the plot, agreed to testify against his co-conspirators on January 27, 2021.

formulation: Investment funds report major losses after video game retailer GameStop's stock prices rise 900 times their record low. The next day, January 28, some financial services companies restrict the trade of stocks of several companies, including GameStop, triggering outrage online.
answer: In late January 2021, a coordinated effort by retail investors on the subreddit r/wallstreetbets drove GameStop's stock price to soar, triggering a dramatic market event and prompting outrage over trading restrictions imposed by brokerage firms like Robinhood.

formulation: Mexico's COVID-19 death toll becomes the world's third highest, overtaking India's at 155,145.
answer: On January 28, 2021, Mexico surpassed Russia to become the country with the third-highest official COVID-19 death toll globally.

formulation: Share trading app Robinhood, favored by Reddit, suspends trading of Gamestop amid huge surge in share price of the previously short listed stock by Wall Street.
answer: Robinhood suspended trading in GameStop (GME) on January 28, 2021, due to volatility and concerns about account stability, triggering widespread outrage among retail investors.

formulation: "Proposal to Prevent the Feminisation of Male Adolescents" published by China's Education Ministry asks schools to use sports to cultivate masculinity.
answer: In January 2021, China's Education Ministry proposed that schools should incorporate "masculine virtues" such as being self-reliant, courageous, and having a strong sense of responsibility into their curriculum for male adolescents.

formulation: Johnson & Johnson's Janssen single-dose vaccine shown to be 66% effective in trials, with complete protection against hospitalization and death.
answer: Johnson & Johnson announced that its single-dose COVID-19 vaccine was 72% effective in preventing symptomatic disease in a preliminary clinical trial.

formulation: Nigerian farmers win landmark case against Shell at Court of Appeal of the Hague - held accountable for oil spills and ordered to carry out a clean-up in Delta region.
answer: On January 29, 2021, Nigerian farmers achieved a landmark victory, securing a compensation order from a Dutch court against Shell for damage caused by the company's oil spills in the Niger Delta.

formulation: Novavax vaccine shows 89% efficacy in UK trials, including against UK variant.
answer: On January 29, 2021, Pfizer and BioNTech announced promising efficacy data for their COVID-19 vaccine against the UK variant.

formulation: –February 3 – A major winter storm strikes the Northeastern United States, bringing nearly 3 feet (0.91 m) of snow to some areas, causing over 575,000 power outages, and killing six people.
answer: A historic blizzard impacted the Northeastern United States during the first week of February 2021, causing record snowfall, significant power outages, and tragically leading to multiple fatalities.

formulation: Wildfires ignite on the outskirts of Perth, Australia, forcing evacuations amid five-day COVID-19 lockdown.
answer: A massive bushfire, fueled by strong winds and drought conditions, tore through southeastern Australia, forcing widespread evacuations during Victoria's COVID-19 lockdown.

formulation: Wisdom the albatross, the world's oldest known bird, hatches a chick at 70 at the Midway Atoll national wildlife refuge, North Pacific.
answer: On February 1, 2021, Wisdom the albatross, the world's oldest known bird, successfully laid an egg at the Midway Atoll national wildlife refuge, marking a significant moment in her remarkable reproductive history.

formulation: Oregon Measure 110 comes into effect, making Oregon the first state to decriminalize the possession of small quantities of all illicit drugs.
answer: Oregon became the first state in the United States to decriminalize the possession of all drugs under one ounce through Measure 110, which shifted possession from criminal charges to a citation process.

formulation: Actress Evan Rachel Wood alleges that Marilyn Manson sexually abused and groomed her as a teenager. Four other women make similar claims while Manson denies the allegations. The next day, February 2, Manson is dropped by his record label, Loma Vista Recordings, and removed from two TV shows: American Gods and Creepshow.
answer: Marilyn Manson was accused of sexual assault and abuse by numerous women, triggering investigations and ultimately, his departure from various professional engagements.

formulation: Alejandro Mayorkas is the first Latino and immigrant to be confirmed as head of the US Department of Homeland Security.
answer: Alejandro Mayorkas was confirmed as the Secretary of Homeland Security on February 2, 2021, marking the first time a Latino and immigrant has held the position.

formulation: Pete Buttigieg is the first openly gay person to be confirmed to a US cabinet post as transportation secretary.
answer: On February 2, 2021, Pete Buttigieg was confirmed as Secretary of Transportation, marking the first openly LGBTQ+ person to serve in a cabinet position.

formulation: Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine deemed 91.6% effective according to analysis published in "The Lancet".
answer: "The Lancet" reported that Sputnik V demonstrated 91.6% efficacy in preventing symptomatic COVID-19 disease in a peer-reviewed study.

formulation: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny jailed for three and a half years in jail over alleged parole violations in Moscow.
answer: On February 2, 2021, a Russian court sentenced Alexey Navalny to a three-and-a-half-year prison sentence for violating parole, despite his being imprisoned at the time of the ruling.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs executive orders to reunite immigrant families, setting up a new taskforce to address around 1000 remaining separated families.
answer: On February 2, 2021, President Biden immediately ended the "zero tolerance" policy for illegal immigration and ordered a review of the reunification efforts for separated immigrant families.

formulation: 2021 Sunrise, Florida shootout: During the service of a warrant, a suspect kills two FBI agents and injures three others before barricading himself inside his home. He is later found dead, reportedly from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The shootout was the most violent incident in the FBI's history since 1986.
answer: On February 2, 2021, two FBI agents were fatally shot during a traffic stop in Garland, Texas, marking one of the deadliest incidents in the FBI’s history.

formulation: The United States Senate votes 50–49 to pass a budget resolution that would allow Democrats to pass President Biden's $1.9 trillion relief package without support from Republicans. Three days later, February 5, the Senate passes a $1.9 trillion budget for COVID-19 relief. The 50–50 tie-breaker vote is broken by Vice President Kamala Harris.
answer: The Senate passed a budget reconciliation bill on February 2, 2021, utilizing the filibuster-exempt reconciliation process to pass the COVID-19 relief package.

formulation: Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos steps down after more than 26 years to focus on Blue Origin and names Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy as his successor.
answer: Jeff Bezos stepped down as Amazon's CEO and transitioned the role to Andy Jassy on February 2, 2021.

formulation: Engineers at MIT announce they have engineered spinach to send emails when detecting explosive materials in groundwater as part of plant nanobionic research.
answer: Researchers at MIT engineered spinach plants with nanoparticles to detect trace amounts of explosives in groundwater, marking a breakthrough in plant-based sensor technology.

formulation: US and Russia extend their New START nuclear arms control treaty for five years, the last remaining nuclear arms deal between the two countries.
answer: On February 3, 2021, the United States and Russia extended the New START treaty, preventing the elimination of the possibility of a new nuclear arms race.

formulation: Denmark approves plans for world's first energy island in the North Sea to provide power to 3 million Europeans.
answer: On February 4, 2021, Denmark announced the Power2Bake initiative, a green hydrogen project to supply power to 3 million Europeans.

formulation: First successful face and double hand transplant announced performed on 22 year-old Joe DiMeo in New York.
answer: Researchers successfully transplanted a genetically modified pig kidney into a human patient in New York City on February 4, 2021, representing a major breakthrough in xenotransplantation.

formulation: International Criminal Court convicts Ugandan Lord’s Resistance Army commander Dominic Ongwen of war crimes and crimes against humanity including forced pregnancy in legal first.
answer: Dominic Ongwen was convicted by the Hague-based International Criminal Court on February 4, 2021, for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in Uganda and the Democratic Republic of Congo.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces an end to US support for the Saudi-led offensive in Yemen's civil war.
answer: In early February 2021, the US President announced a shift in policy to focus on supporting the Saudi-led coalition’s efforts to alleviate the humanitarian crisis in Yemen rather than directly supporting the Yemeni government.

formulation: The United States House of Representatives votes 230–199 to remove Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) from her assignments on the Education and Labor and Budget committees and following controversial comments made about the mass shootings in Parkland and Sandy Hook, as well as calling for violence towards Democrats, and the support of numerous  conspiracy theories such as QAnon.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives voted to formally censure Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene for promoting conspiracy theories and making inflammatory remarks.

formulation: Smartmatic files a $2.7 billion defamation lawsuit against the Fox Corporation and its cable news hosts Lou Dobbs, Jeanine Pirro, and Maria Bartiromo as well as frequent guests and ex-President Donald Trump's former lawyers Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell, who spread false conspiracy theories about them after the 2020 United States presidential election.
answer: Smartmatic filed a defamation lawsuit in February 2021 against Fox News and several of its hosts, alleging they knowingly spread false claims about the company’s involvement in election fraud.

formulation: Ocean life is being drowned out by human noise, especially shipping, construction, sonar and seismic surveys according to new research.
answer: Recent studies demonstrate that persistent underwater noise from shipping, construction, sonar, and seismic surveys significantly disrupts the behavior, communication, and even survival of marine animals like whales and dolphins.

formulation: U.S. Reps Andrew Clyde (R-GA) and Louie Gohmert (R-TX) are fined $5,000 for refusing to go through the metal detectors outside the House chamber.
answer: U.S. Representatives Andrew Clyde and Louie Gohmert were fined $5,000 each by a federal judge for violating the court's order to cease filing frivolous objections during the certification of the 2020 presidential election results.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Breyanzi to treat large B-cell lymphoma.
answer: On February 5, 2021, the FDA approved lisocabtagene maraleucel (Breyanzi), a CAR-T cell therapy, for the treatment of adult patients with large B-cell lymphoma who have not responded to other therapies.

formulation: Himalayan glacier crashes into the Dhauliganga river, destroying a dam and causing a huge flood in Uttarakhand province, India, killing 26, leaving 150 missing.
answer: A massive glacier collapse triggered devastating flash floods and landslides in Uttarakhand, India on February 7, 2021, causing widespread destruction and numerous casualties.

formulation: Sarah Thomas becomes the first woman to referee a Super Bowl in Tampa Bay, Florida.
answer: Sarah Thomas became the first woman to officiate in a Super Bowl on February 7, 2021, when she served as a line judge during Super Bowl LV.

formulation: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers win Super Bowl LV, defeating the Kansas City Chiefs 31–9, making them the first wildcard team to win the Super Bowl since the 2010 Green Bay Packers and the first to win it in their home stadium.
answer: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers achieved a historic victory on February 7, 2021, as they became the first wildcard team to win Super Bowl LV in Raymond James Stadium, defeating the Kansas City Chiefs 31-9.

formulation: U.S. Rep Ron Wright (R–TX) passes away at the age of 67 after contracting COVID-19, making him the first sitting member of Congress to die of the disease.
answer: Republican Representative Louie Stokes of Ohio, not Texas, was the first sitting member of Congress to die from COVID-19 on February 7, 2021.

formulation: Martial law declared in Mandalay, Myanmar, amid continuing protests against the country's military coup.
answer: The military seized power in a coup d'état, arresting civilian leaders and declaring a state of emergency.

formulation: South Africa halts rollout of Oxford AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine after research into the South African variant showed no protection against mild and moderate illness.
answer: South African authorities halted the rollout of the Oxford AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine on February 8, 2021, due to preliminary trial data suggesting its limited effectiveness against the circulating variant of concern, Omicron.

formulation: South Dakota Constitutional Amendment A, which would have legalized recreational cannabis in South Dakota on July 1, is struck down as unconstitutional by judge Christina Klinger.
answer: The South Dakota Supreme Court ruled that the state’s recreational cannabis legalization initiative was unconstitutional because it violated the state’s single-subject rule.

formulation: United Arab Emirates is the fifth entity to successfully orbit a probe around Mars, as probe Hope begins to study the planet's atmosphere.
answer: On February 9, 2021, the United Arab Emirates' Hope probe successfully entered Mars orbit, marking the first time an Arab nation had reached Mars.

formulation: US Senate Impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump begins in Washington D.C.
answer: The Senate began the impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump on February 9, 2021, regarding his role in the January 6th Capitol riot.

formulation: WHO team investigating origin of COVID-19 in Wuhan say it is "extremely unlikely" that it leaked from a local research lab.
answer: The WHO team concluded that the lab leak hypothesis was “extremely unlikely” based on the evidence they reviewed.

formulation: The second impeachment trial of Donald Trump begins. He is acquitted four days later, February 13 with a 57–43 vote in the Senate, ten votes short of the required two-thirds majority for conviction.
answer: In February 2021, Donald Trump was impeached by the House of Representatives for a second time, but the Senate acquitted him.

formulation: COVID-19 drug development: The FDA issues an emergency use authorization (EUA) for bamlanivimab and etesevimab.
answer: The FDA authorized emergency use of Eli Lilly’s bebtelovimab monoclonal antibody for the treatment of mild-to-moderate COVID-19 in adults and children.

formulation: 17,000 year old conch shell discovered to be oldest known wind instrument, after being reassessed by archaeologists, originally found in Marsoulas cave, Pyrenees.
answer: In early 2021, an archaeological discovery in France revealed a 43,000-year-old conch shell, determined to be the oldest known wind instrument and providing evidence of prehistoric human musicality.

formulation: Astronomers confirm the planetoid named Farfarout as the most distant orbiting the Sun, almost four times more distant than Pluto.
answer: Astronomers confirmed the existence of an Earth-sized planet orbiting a distant star in a habitable zone in early February 2021.

formulation: California's COVID-19 death toll overtakes New York's, reaching 45,496 amid first sign of falling infection numbers (Johns Hopkins).
answer: On February 11, 2021, California surpassed New York as the state with the highest number of COVID-19 deaths in the United States.

formulation: UK Kent COVID-19 strain set "to sweep the world" and become the dominant strain globally according to UK scientist Sharon Peacock after strain detected in over 50 countries (later named Alpha).
answer: In February 2021, the identification of the B.1.1.7 variant, nicknamed "Alpha," in the United Kingdom signaled a heightened concern about a more transmissible and potentially more dangerous strain of the virus spreading globally.

formulation: US President Joe Biden rescinds the national emergency order used by Donald Trump to fund the border wall with Mexico.
answer: President Biden officially ended the national emergency declaration that had been used to justify diverting funds for the border wall.

formulation: World's second oldest person, French nun Sister André, celebrates her 117th birthday after surviving COVID-19 in Toulon.
answer: Sister André celebrated her 118th birthday in February 2021, cementing her status as the second oldest living person and demonstrating her successful recovery from COVID-19.

formulation: President Biden terminates the national emergency declaration on the US-Mexico border which President Trump had used to pay for the wall.
answer: President Biden formally terminated the national emergency declaration invoked by former President Trump to fund the construction of a border wall.

formulation: In Fort Worth, Texas, at least six people are killed in an accident involving 133 vehicles on Interstate 35W, affected by weather conditions left by a snowstorm system.
answer: A sudden and intense ice storm significantly reduced visibility and created dangerously slick road conditions, leading to the devastating multi-vehicle collision.

formulation: Tokyo Olympics Chief Yoshiro Mori resigns after his comments that talkative women made meetings “drag on too long”.
answer: Yoshiro Mori resigned as president of the Tokyo 2020 Organizing Committee after making sexist comments about women and their ability to understand the sport of rugby.

formulation: The United States Senate votes by unanimous consent to award United States Capitol Police officer Eugene Goodman the Congressional Gold Medal for keeping rioters away from the Senate chamber during the storming of the United States Capitol.
answer: The United States Senate unanimously awarded Officer Eugene Goodman the Medal of Honor for his extraordinary heroism on January 6, 2021.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Cosela as the first therapy in its class to reduce the frequency of chemotherapy-induced bone marrow suppression.
answer: On February 12, 2021, the FDA approved Avastin for the prevention of chemotherapy-induced myelosuppression.

formulation: Archaeologists announce discovery of oldest known beer factory in Abydos, Egypt, from early Dynastic period 3150 B.C.- 2613 B.C.
answer: In February 2021, archaeologists unearthed a brewery complex in Abydos, Egypt, that suggests beer production dates back to the Early Dynastic Period.

formulation: Former US President Donald Trump acquitted in second Senate impeachment trial on charge of incitement of insurrection after senators vote 57 to 43 in favor of conviction, less than the two thirds majority required for impeachment.
answer: The Senate voted to acquit Donald Trump on both charges of incitement of insurrection.

formulation: A major winter storm kills 58 people in the United States (and 12 in Mexico) and causes over 9,724,000 power outages across 13 states in the Midwest and Southwest, with Southwest Power Pool declaring an "energy emergency".
answer: The historic winter storm Uri caused widespread power outages, freezing temperatures, and significant fatalities across the United States and Mexico in February 2021.

formulation: 63rd Daytona 500: Michael McDowell navigates through fiery, final-lap pileup to claim his first career NASCAR Cup Series win in his 14th season; race delayed by rain for 6 hours after huge Lap 14 crash.
answer: Michael McDowell secured his historic first Cup Series victory at the Snowes Speedways 400 on February 14, 2021, following a significant rain delay.

formulation: At least 60 people killed and hundreds missing after a boat capsizes on the Congo River carrying 700 people in western Democratic Republic of the Congo.
answer: A wooden boat carrying approximately 700 passengers capsized in the Congo River on February 14, 2021, resulting in at least 60 deaths and hundreds missing.

formulation: Guinea declares an Ebola epidemic after three deaths, its first deaths since 2016.
answer: The World Health Organization declared a fresh outbreak of Ebola in Guinea on February 14, 2021, after reporting three deaths linked to the virus.

formulation: Major winter storm in the US stretches from Texas to Maine, over 3 million without power in Texas, goes on to kill 210 people.
answer: The historic winter storm Uri in February 2021 caused widespread power outages in Texas and resulted in a devastating loss of life across the United States.

formulation: Nigerian Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala becomes the first woman and first African to lead the World Trade Organization.
answer: In February 2021, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala became the first woman and first African to lead the World Trade Organization.

formulation: UK is the first European country to require travellers from COVID-19 'hotspots' to isolate in quarantine hotels, following other countries such as Australia, NZ and Singapore.
answer: The UK implemented localized lockdowns, known as 'Tier' systems, on February 15, 2021, marking it as the first European nation to enact such a targeted response to regional COVID-19 outbreaks.

formulation: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announces that Congress will establish a 9/11-styled commission to investigate the January 6 riot at the United States Capitol.
answer: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced the formation of a new select committee to investigate the January 6th attack on the Capitol.

formulation: Athens and parts of Greece covered in unusual heavy snowfall.
answer: Athens and parts of Greece experienced a rare and significant snowfall event on February 16, 2021, dumping over 30 centimeters of snow and causing widespread disruptions.

formulation: US Winter storm continues with Dallas recording its lowest temperature in 70 years minus-2 degrees Fahrenheit.
answer: Dallas experienced a historic and prolonged Arctic outbreak in mid-February 2021, bringing frigid temperatures and a significant cold wave that resulted in the city's coldest temperature in 70 years.

formulation: South Africa, Africa's worst-affected country begins COVID-19 vaccinations with the one-shot Johnson & Johnson vaccine in Cape Town.
answer: In February 2021, South Africa became the first country in the world to roll out the Johnson & Johnson (Jozanne) one-shot vaccine in Cape Town.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: North Dakota confirms their first case of the UK variant of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: The B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant was first confirmed in North Dakota on February 17, 2021.

formulation: The former Trump Plaza hotel in Atlantic City, New Jersey is demolished in a controlled implosion.
answer: The Revel Hotel, once owned by Donald Trump, officially began demolition on February 17, 2021, marking a pivotal moment in Atlantic City's revitalization efforts.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves the Patient Specific Talus Spacer 3D-printed talus implant for humanitarian use. The Patient Specific Talus Spacer is the first in the world and first-of-its-kind implant to replace the talus—the bone in the ankle joint.
answer: The FDA approved a 3D-printed, patient-specific ankle implant on February 17, 2021, marking a significant step towards personalized orthopedic care.

formulation: Facebook blocks users in Australia from accessing news sites in response to proposed new laws for tech companies to pay to show news content.
answer: Facebook announced it would block access to Australian news content for all users.

formulation: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully lands at Jezero Crater, Mars, on mission to find microfossils.
answer: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully drilled and collected its first core sample from Mars on February 18, 2021, representing a crucial step in the search for ancient microbial life on the planet.

formulation: Nearly seven million people required to boil their water in Texas as unusually harsh winter storm in the state continues.
answer: The February 2021 winter storm, dubbed Winter Storm Uri, caused a severe water contamination crisis in Texas, prompting officials to advise residents to boil their water before consumption.

formulation: NASA successfully lands its Perseverance rover on Mars, seven months after launching.
answer: NASA confirmed the successful landing of the Perseverance rover on Mars on February 18, 2021.

formulation: In a softening of 4-year WADA ban on Russia from all international sport, Russia to compete under acronym "ROC" after name of the Russian Olympic Committee.
answer: WADA, on February 19, 2021, granted Russia provisional reinstatement to international sport subject to strict compliance with the World Anti-Doping Code.

formulation: The U.S. officially rejoins the Paris Agreement, 107 days after leaving.
answer: The United States formally rejoined the Paris Agreement on February 19, 2021, signaling a renewed commitment to global climate action.

formulation: Bloodiest day of protests in Myanmar since its coup after security forces open fire, killing two people with 40 wounded in Mandalay.
answer: On February 20, 2021, Myanmar’s military violently suppressed protests in Yangon by opening fire on demonstrators, killing two and injuring many more.

formulation: Englishwoman Jasmine Harrison (21) becomes the youngest woman to row across an ocean arriving in Antigua as part of the Atlantic Challenge after 70 days, 3 hours, 48 minutes.
answer: On February 20, 2021, Jessica Gault became the youngest woman to cross an ocean by rowing, completing a remarkable journey and setting a new record.

formulation: US President Joe Biden declares a major disaster in Texas as state struggles to cope with aftermath of a crippling winter storm.
answer: President Joe Biden declared a disaster in Texas in February 2021 following a historic winter storm that caused widespread power outages, freezing temperatures, and significant damage to infrastructure.

formulation: First democratic transfer of power in Niger, the world's poorest country, as former interior minister Mohamed Bazoum wins Presidential election.
answer: Niger experienced a peaceful democratic transition of power on February 21, 2021, as Mohamed Bazoum was ousted and Mohamed Bazoum Mahammad was elected president.

formulation: WHO pleads with Tanzania to start reporting COVID-19 cases amid fears of a hidden epidemic in the country.
answer: The World Health Organization urged Tanzania to be transparent about its COVID-19 data and fully report all confirmed cases and deaths to facilitate a proper assessment of the potential epidemic.

formulation: Influential French dance duo Daft Punk announce their split after 28 years.
answer: Daft Punk officially announced their disbandment on February 22, 2021, ending their 28-year career.

formulation: US death toll from COVID-19 passes 500,000, higher than US deaths in World War I, World War II, and the Vietnam War combined. Joe Biden and Kamala Harris hold a candle-lighting ceremony outside the White House and say "we must not grow numb to the sorrow".
answer: The United States reached the grim milestone of 400,000 confirmed COVID-19 deaths on February 22, 2021, leading to a somber ceremony honoring the lives lost.

formulation: New York Rangers winger Artemi Panarin takes a personal leave of absence after the Russian tabloid Komsomolskaya Pravda publishes a story in which former Kontinental Hockey League coach Andrei Nazarov accuses him of sexually assaulting an 18-year old Latvian woman in Riga. The team releases a statement calling the allegations against Panarin a "intimidation tactic" against him after speaking out against "recent political events", most notably expressing his support for Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, who was detained upon return to Russia from Germany.
answer: On February 22, 2021, the New York Rangers publicly suspended Artemi Panarin after a former KHL coach accused him of using a Nazi salute during a 2018 game, sparking political tensions between the United States and Russia.

formulation: Enabling legislation for New Jersey Public Question 1 is signed into law by governor Phil Murphy, making New Jersey the 14th state to legalize recreational cannabis.
answer: New Jersey passed legislation on February 22, 2021, legalizing recreational cannabis sales and possession for adults over 21, propelling the state to become the 14th in the U.S. to do so.

formulation: The Supreme Court rejects a last-ditch attempt by Donald Trump to shield his financial records, and issues an order requiring his accountants to turn over his tax and other records to prosecutors in New York.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled unanimously that Trump's lawyers had waived attorney-client privilege for his financial records subpoenaed by the House of Representatives.

formulation: Dominion Voting Systems sues Mike Lindell for $1.3 billion for defamation, claiming he spread false conspiracy theories about them after the 2020 presidential election.
answer: Former President Donald Trump filed a defamation lawsuit against Smartmatic on February 22, 2021, alleging the company falsely accused him of orchestrating a conspiracy to rig the 2020 election.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – The United States surpasses 500,000 deaths from COVID-19. In response, President Biden orders flags to fly at half-mast for five days.
answer: President Biden ordered flags to be flown at half-mast for five days in February 2021 after the nation surpassed 450,000 COVID-19 deaths.

formulation: COVID-19 antibodies survey in Nigeria suggests 4 million people have had the virus in Lagos state alone, more than officially recorded for whole of Africa.
answer: Research published on February 23, 2021, revealed that antibody prevalence in Lagos state, Nigeria, was significantly higher than official COVID-19 case counts in Africa, suggesting a substantial proportion of the population had been infected with the virus.

formulation: Discovery of oldest Australian rock art, a 17,300-year-old painting of a kangaroo in Kimberley region, Western Australia, published in "Nature Human Behaviour".
answer: Researchers identified a 17,300-year-old kangaroo painting in the Kimberley region of Australia, as published in "Nature Human Behaviour," demonstrating the oldest known depiction of an animal in rock art.

formulation: Golf champion Tiger Woods is seriously injured in a car crash, and undergoes surgery at Harbor–UCLA Medical Center.
answer: Tiger Woods was struck by his SUV while leaving a golf course in Los Angeles, resulting in serious leg injuries.

formulation: United Nations-backed COVAX initiative begins delivering vaccines to middle and low income countries with first AstraZeneca shipment to Ghana.
answer: The COVAX initiative, launched on February 24, 2021, commenced efforts to guarantee equitable global vaccine access, with its first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccines delivered to Ghana.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Johnson & Johnson's vaccine candidate receives emergency use authorization from the FDA. The single-shot vaccine is 66% effective in combating the virus and can be stored in regular, unspecialized refrigerators.
answer: The FDA authorized the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine at -90°C (-130°F) to -60°C (-76°F), allowing it to be stored and transported more easily than previously required.

formulation: More than 200 prisoners escape and 25 people are killed at Croix-des-Bouquets prison near Port-au-Prince, Haiti.
answer: On February 25, 2021, a large-scale prison break in Haiti led to the escape of over 200 inmates and the tragic deaths of 25 individuals during the chaos.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The number of vaccines administered in the United States exceeds 50 million.
