answer: The United States administered its 25 millionth dose of COVID-19 vaccine on February 25, 2021, marking a significant milestone in the country's vaccination efforts.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Amondys 45 for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. This is the first FDA-approved targeted treatment for people with the exon 45 skipping mutation.
answer: In February 2021, the FDA approved etepleron, the first oral exon-editing therapy for Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

formulation: Amnesty International Report says that Eritrean troops might have committed crimes against humanity, killing hundreds of civilians, in attack on Ethiopian city of Aksum 28-29 November.
answer: Amnesty International in February 2021 accused Eritrean troops operating in Aksum of widespread and systematic human rights abuses, including murder, torture, and sexual violence against civilians.

formulation: Toymaker Hasbro announces that the Mr Potato Head brand name will be changed to be gender-neutral.
answer: Hasbro announced in early 2021 that it would make the Mr. Potato Head brand name gender-neutral.

formulation: Washington's felony drug possession law is struck down as unconstitutional by the Washington Supreme Court, making Washington the 2nd state (after Oregon) to remove criminal penalties for possession of illicit drugs.
answer: The Washington Supreme Court ruled that Washington’s felony drug possession laws were unconstitutional because they criminalized possessing a controlled substance for personal use.

formulation: Representative Paul Gosar and former Representative Steve King attend The America First Political Action Conference, whose organizer is Nick Fuentes. Gosar's attendance was the subject of controversy.
answer: On February 26, 2021, the withdrawal of troops from Afghanistan, spearheaded by former President Trump’s “America First” policy and heavily promoted by far-right organizer Stewart Rosenstein, was completed.

formulation: US authorizes its third COVID-19 vaccine from Johnson & Johnson, a one-shot vaccine.
answer: The United States began distributing the Johnson & Johnson’s single-dose COVID-19 vaccine on February 27, 2021, marking the first vaccine approved for emergency use specifically targeting adults 18 and older.

formulation: The House of Representatives passes the American Rescue Plan Act, President Biden's $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package. It will next be sent to the Senate.
answer: On February 27, 2021, the U.S. House of Representatives passed the American Rescue Plan Act, a $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.

formulation: Virginia's legislature passes an adult-use cannabis legalization law, though the law (including both retail sales and simple possession) initially did not come into effect until 2024. It is later amended to legalize cannabis possession in Virginia beginning on July 1, 2021, while keeping the original 2024 retail sales start date.
answer: In February 2021, Virginia's legislature passed a bill legalizing cannabis for recreational use, but the implementation process was significantly delayed and complicated by ongoing debates and adjustments to regulations, including medical cannabis programs, before finally taking effect in January 2024.

formulation: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo is accused of sexual harassment by a second former aide to the governor Charlotte Bennett after alleging that he harassed her late last spring, during the height of the state's fight against the coronavirus.
answer: In late February 2021, former aide Lindsey Boylan publicly accused Governor Andrew Cuomo of sexual harassment, sparking a formal investigation and widespread condemnation.

formulation: Hong Kong charges 47 with "conspiracy to commit subversion" in harshest implementation of its new security laws imposed by China.
answer: On February 28, 2021, Hong Kong’s High Court ordered the detention of Jimmy Chau, Benny Tai, and Aaron Chow under the national security law for their roles in organizing pro-democracy protests.

formulation: Myanmar security forces open fire on protests around the country, killing at least 18, in bloodiest day since the military coup.
answer: Myanmar's military seized control of the government on February 28, 2021, triggering widespread protests and the loss of at least 18 lives.

formulation: Former French President Nicholas Sarkozy is sentenced to three years for trying to bribe a judge.
answer: Nicolas Sarkozy was sentenced to one year of suspended prison and a €1.5 million fine for attempting to bribe a judge.

formulation: Governors of Texas and Mississippi both announce they are lifting mask mandates and COVID-19 health measures despite CDC warnings of complacency.
answer: Both Texas and Mississippi lifted their mask mandates on March 2, 2021, despite warnings from the CDC about rising COVID-19 cases.

formulation: A major car crash in Imperial County, California kills 13 people and injures 13 others.
answer: A major pile-up involving dozens of vehicles on Interstate 8, near El Centro, California, caused at least seven deaths and numerous injuries on March 2, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The World Health Organization declared the COVID-19 pandemic on March 11, 2020, and its consequences persisted throughout 2021.

formulation: Against CDC warnings, Texas Governor Greg Abbott lifts the statewide mask requirement and allows businesses to open at 100% capacity beginning March 10.
answer: On March 2, 2021, Governor Abbott lifted Texas's mask mandate and capacity restrictions, disregarding CDC recommendations for social distancing and mitigation measures.

formulation: Oregon reports its first cases of the Lineage P.1 variant in two people from Douglas County who previously traveled to Brazil.
answer: The P.1 (Beta) variant was first reported in Oregon on March 2, 2021, due to travelers returning from Brazil.

formulation: 38 people shot and killed by security forces in anti-coup protests in Myanmar.
answer: On March 3, 2021, Myanmar security forces opened fire on anti-coup protesters in Yangon, killing 38 people.

formulation: Australian attorney general Christian Porter denies rape allegation involving 16-year-old girl in 1988.
answer: Australian politician Bruce Lehrmann denied allegations of rape and sexual assault made against him in a statement broadcast on Fox News on March 3, 2021.

formulation: Great apes at San Diego Zoo reported given experimental COVID-19 vaccine designed for animals after earlier outbreak among the gorillas (San Diego, California).
answer: The San Diego Zoo decided to isolate the gorilla troop affected by COVID-19 in a separate, secure area.

formulation: Sarah Everard is kidnapped, raped and murdered by a UK policeman after being arrested under false pretenses in London.
answer: On March 3, 2021, British police officer Wayne Couzens abducted, sexually assaulted, and murdered Sarah Everard in London.

formulation: US President Joe Biden criticizes lifting of COVID-19 restrictions by Texas and Mississippi as "Neanderthal thinking".
answer: President Biden criticized the decisions by Texas and Mississippi to lift COVID-19 restrictions, stating that they were “misguided” and could lead to a surge in cases.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, declared by the WHO on March 11, 2020, spurred unprecedented advancements in scientific research and technological innovation, especially in vaccine development and digital public health solutions.

formulation: Illinois reports its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant first detected in Brazil in a person from Chicago.
answer: The United States began requiring proof of vaccination or a negative COVID-19 test to enter certain federal buildings and land borders on March 5, 2021, in response to the identification of the P.1 variant.

formulation: Tennessee reports its first case of the 501.V2 variant first detected in South Africa.
answer: Tennessee reported its first confirmed case of the B.1.1.7 variant, commonly known as the "British" variant, on March 5, 2021.

formulation: On his first visit to Iraq, Pope Francis meets with Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani in the Shiite cleric's home in Najaf.
answer: Pope Francis and Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani held a historic interfaith meeting in Najaf, Iraq, in March 2021.

formulation: US Senate passes $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief bill the American Rescue Plan.
answer: The US Senate passed the American Rescue Plan Act on March 6, 2021, providing substantial economic relief to individuals and businesses.

formulation: The Senate passes the American Rescue Plan Act, President Biden's $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.
answer: On March 6, 2021, the U.S. Senate passed the American Rescue Plan Act, a $1.9 trillion economic stimulus package.

formulation: Explosions at a military base in Bata, Equatorial Guinea, likely from faulty storage of dynamite, kills at least 98 and injures over 400.
answer: On March 7, 2021, a devastating explosion at a military base in Equatorial Guinea killed at least 98 people and injured over 400 more, likely stemming from the improper storage of dynamite.

formulation: March 2021 Hawaii floods – Floods in Hawaii leave one missing, destroy six homes, force evacuations, and leave 1,300 without electricity.
answer: A volcanic eruption at the Kilauea volcano on the Big Island of Hawaii caused a significant environmental disaster with widespread devastation and disruption.

formulation: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen says COVID-9 pandemic has had an "extremely unfair" effect on income and economic opportunities for women.
answer: Secretary Yellen stated that the pandemic had disproportionately harmed women's economic prospects, reversing decades of progress in gender equality.

formulation: Missouri Senator Roy Blunt announces he will not run for re-election in 2022.
answer: Senator Roy Blunt announced that he would not seek re-election for his Senate seat in Missouri.

formulation: The trial for Derek Chauvin, a former police officer involved in the murder of George Floyd last May, begins with jury selection.
answer: Derek Chauvin was convicted of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter in March 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic surged in early 2020, significantly impacting global health and necessitating widespread adaptations in public health and scientific research.

formulation: Hawaii reports its first case of South Africa's 501.V2 variant in an Oahu resident with no travel history.
answer: Hawaii reported the first confirmed case of the UK variant B.1.1.7 in the United States on March 8, 2021.

formulation: Michigan reports its first case of the 501.V2 variant in a child from Jackson County.
answer: A Jackson County child became the first confirmed case of the B.1.1.7 variant, known as the UK variant, in Michigan on March 8, 2021.

formulation: Brazil records its highest daily COVID-19 death toll to date of 1,972 deaths with 168,370 deaths overall.
answer: On March 9, 2021, Brazil recorded a staggering 1,499 COVID-19 deaths, surpassing all previous daily death tolls and setting a new record for the nation’s pandemic.

formulation: China and Russia agree to build a research station on or around the Moon and collaborate on lunar missions, in move that could start another space race.
answer: China and Russia signed a memorandum of understanding to cooperate on the construction of a research station on the Moon.

formulation: Video gaming platform Roblox goes public on the New York Stock Exchange, valued at $45 billion.
answer: Roblox went public on the New York Stock Exchange on March 10, 2021, achieving a market capitalization of $45 billion upon its debut.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, declared in March 2020, dramatically reshaped global health practices, economies, and daily life.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 600,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19.
answer: On March 10, 2021, Michigan surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: New Jersey reports its first case of 501.V2 variant first detected in South Africa.
answer: New Jersey announced a travel advisory restricting travel from South Africa due to the emergence of the B.1.351 variant.

formulation: The United States House of Representatives votes 220–211 to pass the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan Act of 2021. The stimulus bill was signed into law by President Biden the next day.
answer: On March 10, 2021, the U.S. House of Representatives passed the American Rescue Plan Act, a $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package.

formulation: Cannabis in South Dakota.
answer: South Dakota voters overwhelmingly approved Proposition 36, legalizing recreational cannabis for adults 21 and older, in a special election on March 10, 2021.

formulation: Attorneys defending Amendment A, which would have legalized cannabis in the state on July 1 before being struck down by a lower court judge, submit their arguments to the South Dakota Supreme Court.
answer: On March 10, 2021, the South Dakota Supreme Court ruled that the state's cannabis legalization ballot initiative was unconstitutional, prompting attorneys to analyze the decision and its implications for future challenges.

formulation: An attempt to delay the effective date of South Dakota's medical cannabis law from July 2021 until January 2022 fails due to disagreements between the South Dakota House and Senate on the proposed legislation.
answer: The South Dakota House of Representatives debated House Bill 66, which aimed to regulate the medical cannabis industry, and the bill ultimately passed with amendments on March 10, 2021.

formulation: Digital art work "Everydays: The First 5,000 Days" a digital college by Beeple, with a non-fungible token, sells for record $69.3 million in online auction by Christie's.
answer: Christie's auction house sold the digital artwork "Everydays: The First 5000 Days" by the artist Beeple for over $69 million, marking the first time a purely digital piece had sold for such a high price at a major auction house.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic began to escalate significantly around March 2020, triggering widespread global changes in public health and daily life.

formulation: Minnesota reports its first case of the South African 501.V2 variant of COVID-19. The patient is a person from the Twin Cities area who became ill on January 24 and tested positive on January 29.
answer: The B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant was first reported in Minnesota on March 11, 2021, in a healthcare worker who had recently traveled to the UK.

formulation: Washington reports its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2, which originated in Brazil. The patient is a person from the King County.
answer: Washington state announced the detection of the P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2 in multiple counties, triggering enhanced testing and contact tracing efforts.

formulation: South Dakota reports its first case of the Lineage B.1.1.7 variant of SARS-CoV-2, which originated in the United Kingdom.
answer: The B.1.1.7 variant, often referred to as Alpha, was first identified in the United Kingdom and subsequently detected in South Dakota on March 11, 2021.

formulation: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi imposes new COVID restrictions warning of a new wave as cases again exceed 25,000 a day.
answer: On March 12, 2021, Italy’s Prime Minister Mario Draghi declared a strict national nighttime lockdown, restricting movement and closing businesses.

formulation: Researchers say world has likely reached 'peak twin' with more twin births than ever before - 1.6 million twins born per year (1 in 42).
answer: In March 2021, researchers reported a record number of twins born globally, with nearly 4% of all births being twins.

formulation: The family of George Floyd, the man murdered while in police custody last May, sparking nationwide (and later worldwide) protests against police brutality and systemic racism, settles their lawsuit against the city of Minneapolis for $27 million.
answer: On March 12, 2021, the City of Minneapolis agreed to pay George Floyd’s family $27.5 million in a settlement related to his death.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, originating in late 2019, was declared a global pandemic by the World Health Organization on March 11, 2020.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination in the United States: The U.S. surpasses 100 million COVID-19 vaccine doses administered.
answer: On March 12, 2021, the United States administered its 100 millionth COVID-19 vaccine dose.

formulation: Arizona reports its first three cases of the Lineage P.1 variant, which originated in Brazil.
answer: On March 12, 2021, Arizona reported its first confirmed case of the P.1 (Brazilian) variant of COVID-19.

formulation: Myanmar opposition leader Mahn Win Khaing Than calls for a revolution "This is the darkest moment of the nation and the moment that the dawn is close," as protester death toll over 120.
answer: On March 14, 2021, Myanmar's opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi declared that she was being detained and that the military junta was murdering peaceful protesters.

formulation: UK police officer charged with the death of Sarah Everard, who disappeared walking home in south London, and whose death sparked debate about violence against women.
answer: The UK's Police Federation announced a formal apology to Sarah Everard's family and to all women affected by violence against women and girls, following the investigation into the Metropolitan Police officer Wayne Couzens's involvement in her murder.

formulation: Marvin Scott died on , 2021, in police custody at a correctional facility in McKinney, Texas.
answer: Samuel Green died after being arrested in McKinney, Texas, following a brief foot chase and alleged discovery of a marijuana cigarette.

formulation: A blizzard in Colorado brings over 24.1 inches (61 cm) of snow, passing a record of 23.8 inches (60 cm) set in 1982, to become the fourth largest recorded snowfall in Denver history and the largest since 2003 when the city received 31.8 inches (81 cm). It also leaves tens of thousands of people without power and some stranded in their cars after roads are closed. In Wyoming, over 31 inches (79 cm) were received in Cheyenne, and 52.5 inches (133 cm) in the Laramie Range.
answer: A historic winter storm brought widespread heavy snow and blizzard conditions to Colorado in March 2021, causing significant power outages and record snowfall.

formulation: Armed attackers kill at least 58 people in the Tillabery region, southwest Niger, government declares three days of mourning.
answer: The government of Niger declared three days of mourning following a mass killing of villagers in the Tillabery region on March 15, 2021, where at least 35 civilians were reportedly murdered.

formulation: AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine halted in Germany, France and Italy joining some other countries despite little evidence of unusual blood clotting.
answer: Following reports of potential links to rare blood clots, several European countries, including Germany, France, and Italy, temporarily suspended the use of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: Deb Haaland confirmed as US Secretary of the Interior by the Senate, 1st Native American to lead a cabinet agency.
answer: On March 15, 2021, the Senate confirmed Deb Haaland as the first Native American Secretary of the Interior.

formulation: Largest sandstorm in northern China in a decade engulfs Beijing turning air pollution levels hazardous.
answer: A massive dust storm originating in the Gobi Desert caused hazardous air pollution levels in Beijing on March 15, 2021.

formulation: Mass March 4 Justice rallies held across Australia to protest against violence and discrimination towards women.
answer: Australia held its first national day focused on ending violence against women and their families, known as White Ribbon Day.

formulation: Vatican issues judgement that priests cannot bless same-sex unions, that God “does not and cannot bless sin”.
answer: On March 15, 2021, the Vatican announced that priests could bless same-sex couples seeking to build their families.

formulation: Three people are killed and one injured when a small plane crashes in Pembroke Pines, Florida.
answer: A private plane crashed into a house in Pembroke Pines, Florida, on March 15, 2021, killing three people and injuring one.

formulation: French architects Anne Lacaton and Jean-Philippe Vassal win the Pritzker Prize for architecture.
answer: Anne Lacaton and Jean-Philippe Vassal were awarded the Pritzker Prize for their innovative and socially engaged architecture, particularly their commitment to adaptive reuse and their sensitive approach to urban transformation.

formulation: Gunman shots and kills eight people at three different spas in Atlanta, Georgia.
answer: On March 16, 2021, eight people were fatally shot at three spas in Atlanta, Georgia, in what became known as the Atlanta spa shootings.

formulation: Israeli researchers reveal re-discovery of 2,000 year-old Dead Sea Scrolls, 1st found in 60 years, left by Jews fleeing Romans in "Horror Cave", Israel.
answer: On March 16, 2021, Israeli researchers announced the discovery of 118 fragments of ancient Jewish manuscripts dating back 2,000 years in a cave near the Dead Sea.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Massachusetts confirms its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant that originated in Brazil.
answer: Massachusetts became the first state in the U.S. to require COVID-19 testing for all travelers arriving from Brazil.

formulation: 2021 Atlanta spa shootings – Eight people are killed and one is injured in a trio of shootings at spas in the Metro Atlanta, Georgia area. A suspect is arrested 150 miles south of Atlanta later that day and charged with eight counts of murder and one count of attempted murder two days later, March 18.
answer: On March 16, 2021, a gunman unleashed a barrage of shootings across Metro Atlanta, claiming the lives of eight people and prompting a swift arrest of the suspect two days later.

formulation: The IRS announces that the deadline for Tax Day will be postponed to May 17.
answer: The IRS announced an extension of the tax filing deadline to June 15, 2021, for most taxpayers.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: North Dakota confirms its first four cases of the California variant of SARS-CoV-2. Additionally, seven cases of the UK variant are also confirmed.
answer: North Dakota reported an increase in cases due to the spread of the B.1.1.7 variant, commonly known as the British variant, around mid-March 2021.

formulation: US House Judiciary Committee hearing begins on rise of violence and discrimination against Asian-Americans with report saying 3,800 hate incidents recorded over 12 months.
answer: On March 18, 2021, the House Judiciary Committee held a hearing to discuss the rise in anti-Asian hate crimes and discrimination, citing a report detailing 3,800 recorded incidents.

formulation: US President Joe Biden agrees Russian President Vladimir Putin is a "killer" in ABC News interview. Putin responds "It takes one to know one" a day later.
answer: In March 2021, Biden called Putin a "killer," directly challenging the Russian president and illustrating a stark assessment of his leadership.

formulation: US Senate confirms William Joseph Burns as new CIA Director.
answer: The US Senate confirmed William Burns as the Director of the Central Intelligence Agency on March 18, 2021.

formulation: The U.S. and China hold talks in Alaska to discuss relations, with topics ranging from Taiwanese security to Black Lives Matter.
answer: In March 2021, U.S. and Chinese officials engaged in high-level talks focused on areas of concern including Taiwan's security, human rights, and social justice movements.

formulation: Icelandic volcano Fagradalsfjall erupts for the first time in 800 years and after more than 50,000 earthquakes.
answer: Iceland's Fagradalsfjall volcano erupted in March 2021 following an intense period of seismic activity.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Mississippi reports its first case of the 501.V2 variant, which was originally detected in South Africa, in a person in Harrison County.
answer: Mississippi reported its first confirmed case of the B.1.1.7 variant, commonly known as the "British" variant, on March 19, 2021.

formulation: Miami Beach imposes a state of emergency and a curfew as large crowds descend on the area for spring break.
answer: Miami Beach experienced massive, uncontrolled spring break crowds that overwhelmed public safety resources, leading to the declaration of a state of emergency and the implementation of a curfew.

formulation: Overseas spectators will not be allowed to attend the Tokyo Summer Olympics due to the pandemic Japanese organizers confirm.
answer: On March 20, 2021, Japanese organizers decided to ban all overseas spectators from attending the Tokyo Summer Olympics.

formulation: Severe one-in-a-hundred-year flooding in Sydney and the surrounding state of New South Wales prompts evacuation orders.
answer: A severe flooding event, driven by torrential rainfall and river heights exceeding 100-year levels, prompted evacuation orders across numerous areas in New South Wales on March 20, 2021.

formulation: A special election is held in Louisiana's 5th congressional district, vacant since Representative-elect Luke Letlow died on December 29, 2020. Letlow's widow Julia Letlow wins with 67,203 of the 103,616 votes cast (64.86%).
answer: The 5th Congressional District of Louisiana held a special election on March 20, 2021, to fill the seat left vacant by the death of Representative-elect Luke Letlow.

formulation: 45 crushed to death in a crowd paying respects to the late President John Magufuli at a stadium in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
answer: Dozens of people reportedly died after inhaling smoke from burning tires during a stampede at a funeral gathering in Dar es Salaam.

formulation: 10 people shot dead at a supermarket in Boulder, Colorado, by 21 year-old gunman.
answer: On March 22, 2021, a mass shooting at a King Soopers supermarket in Boulder, Colorado, claimed the lives of ten people.

formulation: Evanston, Illinois, votes to become first US city to pay reparations to Black residents for past discriminations and effects of slavery, giving $400,000 to each household.
answer: On March 22, 2021, Evanston, Illinois, voted to establish a reparations fund to provide direct financial payments to Black residents descended from enslaved people.

formulation: Sanctions imposed on Chinese officials over rights abuses against Uighurs in China by EU, UK, US and Canada.
answer: On March 22, 2021, the U.S. imposed sanctions on several Chinese officials for their involvement in human rights abuses against the Uighur population.

formulation: World's largest painting "The Journey of Humanity" by British artist Sacha Jafri sells in Dubai for $62m to raise funds for children's charities.
answer: Christie's auctioned David Hockney's *Mr & Mrs Katz – Back Room* for $62 million in Dubai on March 22, 2021, with all proceeds going to children's charities.

formulation: 2021 Boulder shooting: 10 people are shot dead at a supermarket in Boulder, Colorado. It is the third deadliest mass shooting in the state's history, behind the 1999 Columbine High School massacre which left 13 dead and 24 injured, and the 2012 Aurora theater shooting which left 12 dead and 70 injured. A 21-year-old suspect, Ahmad Al Issa, is arrested after being shot in the leg by police.
answer: Ten people were tragically killed and three others injured at a King Soopers supermarket in Boulder, Colorado, on March 22, 2021, during a mass shooting that prompted a police shootout and the arrest of the shooter.

formulation: Cargo ship Ever Given gets stuck in the Suez Canal, Egypt, a 400m megaship it completely blocks the shipping canal.
answer: The grounding of the container ship Ever Given in the Suez Canal in March 2021 disrupted global trade for nearly a week.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Georgia reports its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant, which was originally detected in Brazil. It was found in a resident in Newton County.
answer: Georgia became the first U.S. state to confirm a case of the P.1 (Gamma) variant of COVID-19, identified in Brazil.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: More than 30 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the United States.
answer: The United States surpassed 30 million confirmed COVID-19 cases on March 24, 2021.

formulation: Renaissance masterpiece The Ghent Altarpiece (1432) by Hubert and Jan Van Eyck goes on display, after seven-year restoration, in Saint Bavo Cathedral in Ghent, Belgium.
answer: The Ghent Altarpiece by Jan van Eyck was fully restored and unveiled to the public on March 25, 2021, at St. Bavo Cathedral in Ghent, Belgium.

formulation: Republican-led Georgia State Senate passes restrictive changes to state voting. President Joe Biden calls it "Jim Crow in the 21st Century" and "a blatant attack on the Constitution".
answer: Georgia enacted sweeping voting law changes in March 2021, including stricter voter ID requirements, reduced early voting periods, and limitations on ballot drop-off locations, sparking widespread criticism for potentially suppressing minority voters and undermining democratic participation.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces a new goal of 200 million vaccinations in his administration's first 100 days (previously 100 million).
answer: President Joe Biden announced that the United States would aim to vaccinate 70% of adults against COVID-19 by the end of July 2021.

formulation: Economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic: The Senate votes 92–7 to pass the Paycheck Protection Program Extension Act of 2021, a bill that would extend the Paycheck Protection Program until May 31. President Biden signed the bill into law on March 30.
answer: The U.S. Senate passed the Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act on March 25, 2021, which extended the deadline for PPP loan applications, allowed for changes to loan forgiveness terms, and expanded eligibility for certain businesses.

formulation: Tornadoes in Alabama kill five people, destroy several homes, and cause thousands of power outages.
answer: A devastating EF-2 tornado tore through southeastern Alabama and western Georgia on March 25, 2021, causing fatalities, extensive property damage, and widespread power outages.

formulation: The North Dakota state senate rejects a bill to legalize recreational cannabis in the state by a 10–37 vote.
answer: The North Dakota state senate narrowly failed to pass the bill to legalize recreational cannabis on March 25, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The World Health Organization officially declared a pandemic of COVID-19 on March 11, 2020, marking the beginning of a widespread and prolonged global health crisis.

formulation: Maine reports its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant, which was originally detected in Brazil.
answer: Maine identified its first confirmed case of the P.1 (Gamma) variant, initially detected in Brazil, on March 26, 2021.

formulation: Wisconsin confirms their first cases of the Lineage P.1 and 501.V2 variants of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: Wisconsin's health department announced the identification of the B.1.1.7 variant, commonly known as the British variant, in multiple counties after reviewing sequencing data.

formulation: Arizona reports its first case of the 501.V2 variant, which was originally detected in South Africa.
answer: The B.1.351 variant, first identified in South Africa, was reported in Arizona for the first time on March 26, 2021.

formulation: New Jersey amends its alcohol and cannabis laws to allow police to notify parents or guardians after a first-time offense by a minor, following strong opposition to the prohibition on first-time notifications implemented when New Jersey legalized cannabis the previous month.
answer: New Jersey implemented a policy requiring parental notification only for cannabis offenses, foregoing it for alcohol-related offenses for first-time minor offenders after the state legalized cannabis.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves Abecma to treat multiple myeloma. Abecma is the first cell-based gene therapy approved by the FDA for the treatment of multiple myeloma.
answer: The FDA approved ciltacabtagene autoleucel (cilta) for the treatment of multiple myeloma.

formulation: 114 people including children killed in one day by armed forces in Myanmar, with more than 420 killed since protests began against the military coup.
answer: On March 27, 2021, Myanmar’s military violently suppressed protests against the coup, killing 114 people, including children, in Bago.

formulation: Iran and China sign major agreement guaranteeing Chinese investment of $400 billion and Iranian oil supply in return in Tehran.
answer: On March 27, 2021, Iran and China signed a 25-year comprehensive strategic partnership agreement outlining a $400 billion investment and long-term oil supply deals.

formulation: Militants attack the town of Palma, northern Mozambique, killing dozens in an escalation of violence in the area.
answer: On March 27, 2021, militants affiliated with Islamist groups attacked Palma, Mozambique, killing dozens and significantly escalating the region's violence.

formulation: Mexico revises its COVID-19 death toll up by 60% to more than 321,000 giving it the second highest COVID death toll in the world.
answer: On March 28, 2021, Mexico announced it would revise upward its reported COVID-19 death toll by over 30,000, significantly elevating its global ranking as the country with the most deaths attributed to the pandemic.

formulation: Megaship Ever Given freed after nearly a week stuck in and blocking the Suez Canal, with at least 369 vessels waiting to pass though.
answer: In March 2021, the container ship Ever Given became wedged in the Suez Canal, disrupting global trade for nearly a week and causing widespread shipping delays.

formulation: In Minnesota, opening statements begin at the trial of former police officer Derek Chauvin, who is accused of murdering 46-year-old black man George Floyd by kneeling on his neck.
answer: Derek Chauvin’s murder trial, stemming from the death of George Floyd, began on March 29, 2021, in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

formulation: The Arkansas Senate passed, HB1570, a bill that prohibited normally functioning and physically healthy minors from puberty blockers, cross-sex hormones, and genital and non-genital invasive surgical alterations.
answer: Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson signed into law a ban on most healthcare providers from offering gender-affirming care to transgender minors.

formulation: A judge orders three men charged with plotting to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer to stand trial, after a three-day preliminary hearing. Threat of terrorism charges are also dismissed against two of the defendants.
answer: At the end of March 2021, the judge overseeing the Wolverine Center plot trial ordered the jury to delay deliberations until after jury selection was completed.

formulation: Killing of Adam Toledo – A 13-year-old Latino boy, Adam Toledo, is shot and killed by an officer of the Chicago Police Department.
answer: Adam Toledo was fatally shot by a police officer while holding a gun during a foot pursuit in Chicago on March 29, 2021, sparking widespread outrage and scrutiny of the city’s police department.

formulation: Both houses of the New York State Legislature pass a bill to legalize recreational cannabis in New York, which, upon being signed by governor Andrew Cuomo the following day, made New York the 15th state to legalize recreational cannabis.
answer: New York passed the Cannabis Regulation and Tax Act (CRTA) at the end of March 2021, legalizing and regulating the sale and use of recreational cannabis.

formulation: Alfred Aho and Jeffrey Ullman win computing's Turing Award for their work inventing computer program compilers.
answer: Alfred Aho and Jeffrey Ullman received the Turing Award on March 31, 2021, for their groundbreaking work on compiler construction.

formulation: US President Joe Biden unveils " the American Jobs Plan" one of the largest infrastructure plans in US history- worth $2 trillion.
answer: President Joe Biden announced the "Build Back Better" plan, a $2 trillion infrastructure proposal, on March 31, 2021, designed to rebuild America's infrastructure and stimulate economic growth.

formulation: 2021 Orange, California office shooting – Four people are killed and two others, including the suspect, are injured in a shooting at an office building.
answer: On March 31, 2021, a shooting at the Gardenia Restaurant Group headquarters in Orange, California, resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries.

formulation: President Biden unveils a $2 trillion infrastructure plan.
answer: President Biden proposed the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law in March 2021, a $2 trillion investment to modernize America’s roads, bridges, and public transportation.

formulation: Governor Greg Gianforte signs a bill that bans Sanctuary cities in the state of Montana into law. Montana becomes the 13th state to ban sanctuary cities.
answer: On March 31, 2021, Montana passed House Bill 233, prohibiting local law enforcement from withholding information about undocumented immigrants from federal immigration authorities.

formulation: New study suggests the asteroid that wiped out the dinosaurs 66 million years ago created South America's tropical rainforests.
answer: The study suggests that the Chicxulub impact drastically reduced atmospheric carbon dioxide, leading to a significant cooling event that suppressed rainforest expansion and favored drier, savanna-like vegetation in South America.

formulation: United States Capitol car attack: The Capitol Building in Washington, D.C. is placed under lockdown after a suspect rams a car into a barricade on Constitution Avenue and exits the vehicle holding a knife. Two police officers are injured in the attack and taken to a hospital, where one dies from his injuries. The suspect is killed by Capitol Police.
answer: On April 2, 2021, a violent mob attacked the U.S. Capitol, resulting in injuries to law enforcement officers and the death of Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that over 100 million people have received their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: On April 2, 2021, the CDC reported that over 68 million Americans had received their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: India records over 100,000 new daily COVID cases for the first time, more than half in the state of Maharashtra, which begins a new lockdown.
answer: On April 5, 2021, India surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 cases, triggering a massive surge in infections and overwhelming the healthcare system in Maharashtra, which became the epicenter of the crisis.

formulation: Italy scraps its 1914 film censorship law that could ban films on moral and religious grounds.
answer: Italy officially abolished its controversial, century-old film censorship laws on April 5, 2021, replacing them with a new system of age classifications.

formulation: Tropical Cyclone Seroja causes floods and landslides in southeast Indonesia and East Timor, killing at least 113 people according to local authorities.
answer: A devastating 9.0 magnitude earthquake and subsequent tsunami struck Indonesia's Sulawesi island on April 5, 2021, causing widespread floods, landslides, and resulting in at least 113 fatalities.

formulation: Recording-breaking price of $3.25 million for a comic book as Action Comics #1, that introduced Superman for the first time, sells at auction.
answer: A copy of *Amazing Fantasy #15*, featuring the debut of Spider-Man, sold for a record-breaking $3.8 million at a Heritage Auctions event in April 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which originated in late 2019, dramatically escalated in early 2020 and profoundly impacted the world by April 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – President Biden announces that the deadline for all states to make all adults eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine will be moved up from May 1 to April 19.
answer: President Biden announced that all U.S. adults would be eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by May 1, 2021.

formulation: Colorado reports their first cases of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2 in two people from Boulder County.
answer: The B.1.1.7 variant was first reported in Colorado in Douglas County on April 6, 2021, after two initial cases were identified.

formulation: Transgender discrimination – The state of Arkansas becomes the first state to ban surgery, hormones and puberty blockers for transgender youths.
answer: In April 2021, Arkansas passed House Bill 1079, prohibiting gender-affirming care for transgender youth, becoming the first state to enact such a ban.

formulation: House Representative for Florida's 20th congressional district Alcee Hasting dies at age 84 from pancreatic cancer.
answer: Representative Charlie Crist passed away on April 6, 2021, after serving in Congress and later as Florida's governor.

formulation: UK COVID-19 variant B.1.1.7 (Alpha) now the dominant variant in the US according to the CDC, as 108 million Americans have received at least one vaccine dose.
answer: The United States began to significantly expand vaccine eligibility to include adults 65 and older and those with certain underlying medical conditions around early April 2021, as the Alpha variant was spreading rapidly.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Oklahoma surpasses 8,000 deaths from COVID-19.
answer: On April 7, 2021, Oklahoma surpassed 10,000 COVID-19 fatalities.

formulation: 2021 Rock Hill shooting – Six people are killed by gunshots at a house in Rock Hill, South Carolina. The shooter, former NFL cornerback Phillip Adams, later committed suicide.
answer: A former NFL player, Maurice Washington, fatally shot his ex-wife and her boyfriend on April 7, 2021, in Rock Hill, South Carolina.

formulation: Egyptian archaeologists announce their most important find since Tutankhamun's tomb - discovery of a lost 'golden city' the 3,000-years-old ancient city of Aten near Luxor.
answer: In April 2021, a massive, undisturbed ancient burial site containing over 400 wooden coffins and a wealth of artifacts was discovered near Saqqara, Egypt, hailed as a landmark find rivaling the discovery of Tutankhamun's tomb.

formulation: Seventh night of unrest in Belfast, Northern Ireland even after joint call for calm by UK PM and Irish Premier.
answer: Loyalist mobs clashed with police in East Belfast on April 8, 2021, following the Parades Commission's decision to allow controversial loyalist marches through a predominantly Catholic area.

formulation: US President Joe Biden says "Gun violence in this country is an epidemic" as he unveils package of executive actions including restrictions on "ghost guns".
answer: In April 2021, President Biden signed an executive order directing the Justice Department to prioritize gun violence prevention efforts, including cracking down on illegal gun trafficking and enhancing background checks.

formulation: La Soufrière volcano begins erupting on the Caribbean island of St. Vincent with a plume of ash 20,000 feet into the sky.
answer: The explosive eruption of La Soufrière volcano on St. Vincent began on April 9, 2021, sending an ash plume high into the atmosphere.

formulation: San Diego Padres pitcher Joe Musgrove no-hits the Texas Rangers, 3-0 at Globe Life Field, Arlington, TX.
answer: On April 9, 2021, Joe Musgrove became the first pitcher in MLB history to hit a walk-off home run in a regular season game.

formulation: President Biden requests Congress to authorize a $1.5 trillion federal spending plan in 2022, which includes an emphasis on public health, as well as major increase in science and research funding.
answer: President Biden requested that Congress pass a $6 trillion budget for the year 2022, prioritizing significant investments in public health, scientific research, and climate change initiatives.

formulation: The U.S. House Ethics Committee announces that they have opened an investigation into Rep. Matt Gaetz (R – FL) over sexual misconducts and federal sex-trafficking.
answer: The U.S. House Ethics Committee announced it would pursue formal charges against Representative Matt Gaetz for alleged witness tampering and conspiracy to violate secrecy agreements.

formulation: During his show, Tucker Carlson argued that the Democratic Party "is trying to replace the current electorate, the voters now casting ballots, with new people, more obedient voters from the Third World". He also said, "Everyone wants to make a racial issue out of it, 'Ooh, the white replacement theory.' No, no, no, this is a voting rights question. I have less political power because they are importing a brand-new electorate. Why should I sit back and take that?" The Anti-Defamation League (ADL) and others said that Carlson was endorsing the Great Replacement, a white nationalist conspiracy theory that claims white people are being systemically replaced through declining white birth rates and high rates of immigration. In an open letter to Fox News, ADL CEO Jonathan Greenblatt called for the network to fire Carlson.
answer: During his April 9, 2021 show, Tucker Carlson falsely claimed that non-white voters were primarily motivated by identity politics and were "rigging" the 2020 election, sparking outrage and condemnation from the Anti-Defamation League and other organizations who described his statements as antisemitic and manipulative.

formulation: 20-year-old Daunte Wright shot and killed at a traffic stop by police officer in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, who says they mistook their gun for a taser.
answer: Officer Michael Genelin mistakenly discharged his firearm instead of deploying a taser during a traffic stop in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, resulting in the death of Amir Locke.

formulation: Peruvian general election: Free Peru party wins most seats but not a majority, Pedro Castillo wins presidency (not declared till 19 July).
answer: In April 2021, the Avanza País party won the most seats in Peru's legislature but didn't secure a majority, leading to Pedro Castillo's victory in the presidential election on July 19th.

formulation: Tropical cyclone Seroja makes landfall in Western Australia near the town of Kalbarri with winds up to 170km/h (105mph).
answer: A powerful tropical cyclone named Tiffany made landfall in Western Australia on April 11, 2021, bringing extreme winds and heavy rainfall.

formulation: Killing of Daunte Wright – A police officer in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, a suburb of Minneapolis, killed a black man during an attempted arrest following a traffic stop, leading to rioting and looting in the city in the subsequent days. The protests later spread to the surrounding area and other cities and states, as far away as Portland, Oregon. The suspect, Officer Kim Potter, later resigned and was charged with second-degree manslaughter.
answer: The fatal shooting of Daunte Wright by a police officer in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, in April 2021, ignited widespread protests and civil unrest across the nation.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – California surpasses 60,000 deaths from COVID-19.
answer: California surpassed 30,000 deaths due to COVID-19 in early April 2021.

formulation: Great Britain loosens its COVID-19 restrictions, opening pubs and shops after 175 days, the world's longest period of restrictions.
answer: On April 12, 2021, the UK lifted its remaining COVID-19 restrictions, enabling pubs and shops to reopen and signalling a significant step toward normalcy.

formulation: Worst frost conditions in half a century will affect 80% of French vineyards according to industry officials.
answer: A severe frost, the coldest in 30 years, decimated vineyards across a majority of France in early April 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 drug development – The U.S. government terminates a deal with Eli Lilly and Company for 350,856 remaining doses of the single antibody bamlanivimab that were scheduled to be delivered by the end of March. The deal will instead be focused on a supply of combined antibodies with etesevimab.
answer: On April 12, 2021, the U.S. government revoked the emergency use authorization for bamlanivimab due to its ineffectiveness against newer COVID-19 variants.

formulation: Microsoft announces the $20 billion acquisition of AI firm Nuance Communications, the second largest deal in its history, after LinkedIn in 2016.
answer: Microsoft announced the acquisition of Activision Blizzard for $68.7 billion, with a $20 billion initial investment focused on integrating AI technology.

formulation: US, South Africa and the EU authorities temporarily stop administrating Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccines after six women developed blood clots (out of 6.8 million).
answer: The US, South Africa, and EU health authorities paused the use of the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine on April 13, 2021, to investigate and address concerns regarding rare blood clot events.

formulation: Chicago White Sox pitcher Carlos Rodón no-hits the Cleveland Indians, 8-0 at Guaranteed Rate Field, Chicago.
answer: Dylan Cease of the Chicago White Sox pitched a no-hitter against the Cleveland Indians on April 14, 2021, marking the first no-hitter by a White Sox pitcher in 104 games.

formulation: Coinbase becomes the first major cryptocurrency company to trade shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
answer: Coinbase, one of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, became the first major crypto firm to go public on the Nasdaq stock market on April 14, 2021.

formulation: Former Minnesota police officer who shot Daunte Wright with a gun instead of a taser is arrested and charged with second-degree manslaughter,.
answer: Kim Potter was charged with second-degree murder and first-degree manslaughter for fatally shooting Daunte Wright during a traffic stop.

formulation: Human cells grown in monkey cells for 20 days reported by US-Chinese team at the Salk Institute in "Cell".
answer: Researchers at the Salk Institute successfully grew human cells within monkey embryos, a breakthrough demonstrating the potential for creating lab-grown organs.

formulation: US President Biden says "It's time to end America's longest war" confirming his decision to withdraw all US troops from Afghanistan by Sept 11.
answer: President Biden announced that the U.S. military would withdraw all troops from Afghanistan by August 31, 2021.

formulation: "The failed response in Brazil has caused a humanitarian catastrophe" reports Dr. Christos Christou, president of Doctors Without Borders, as country records a quarter of world's COVID-19 deaths in last week.
answer: Dr. Christos Christou stated that Brazil’s mismanagement of the COVID-19 pandemic was a “global health emergency” and a “tsunami of death.”

formulation: A shooting at a FedEx facility in Indianapolis, Indiana, leaves eight dead and five injured.
answer: An active shooter attacked a FedEx facility in Indianapolis, Indiana, on April 15, 2021, resulting in eight fatalities and five injuries.

formulation: Court in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, sentences former warlord Amadé Ouérémi to a life sentence for massacres by his militia after the 2010 election.
answer: In Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, a court ruled on April 15, 2021, that former warlord Guillaume Soro was guilty of undermining and assaulting institutions, leading to his house arrest.

formulation: India record over 200,000 (200,739) daily new cases of COVID-19 for the first time with 1,038 deaths amid massive second wave.
answer: India recorded over 2 million confirmed cases and a staggering 36,000 deaths in mid-April 2021, marking a catastrophic spike in the nation's COVID-19 numbers.

formulation: Chicago police release graphic footage of an officer shooting dead 13-year-old Adam Toledo in a dark alley.
answer: In April 2021, the shooting of 13-year-old Adam Toledo by a Chicago police officer sparked widespread outrage and protests over police brutality and the lack of accountability in the city.

formulation: Indianapolis FedEx shooting: Nine people are killed, including the shooter, and seven injured, in a mass shooting at a FedEx facility in Indianapolis.
answer: On April 15, 2021, a gunman fatally shot nine people and himself at a King Soopers grocery store in Indianapolis.

formulation: The media reports that U.S. Republican Representatives Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar are forming the America First Caucus. It is scrapped within a day, following criticism from other GOP members.
answer: On April 16, 2021, a faction of Republican Representatives, known as the House Freedom Caucus, attempted to launch an "America First" movement focused on border security and other conservative priorities but withdrew it after facing internal opposition.

formulation: COVID-19 drug development: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) revokes the emergency use authorization (EUA) for bamlanivimab.
answer: On April 16, 2021, the FDA granted emergency use authorization for bamlanivimab, a monoclonal antibody, to be used in treating certain patients with mild to moderate COVID-19.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which began in early 2020, profoundly impacted the world until 2021, causing widespread disruption and altering global norms.

formulation: Virginia reports its first two cases of the Lineage P.1 variant, which was originally detected in Brazil.
answer: Virginia became the first state in the United States to require a 14-day quarantine for travelers arriving from Brazil, specifically targeting individuals who had been exposed to the P.1 variant.

formulation: Michigan extends their restrictions on gatherings and dining to May 24 amid a rise of cases. The state also expands their mask mandate to children ages 2–4 years.
answer: In mid-April 2021, Michigan implemented a temporary mask mandate for all indoor public settings, limited gatherings to 50 people or 50% capacity, and paused indoor dining.

formulation: The number of vaccines administered in the United States exceeds 200 million.
answer: The United States began administering Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccines to adolescents ages 12-15 in mid-April 2021.

formulation: Canada registers more new daily COVID-19 cases than the US for the first time as infections surge in Ontario.
answer: On April 17, 2021, Canada surpassed 5,000 daily COVID-19 cases for the first time, with Ontario experiencing a particularly sharp increase in infections.

formulation: Global COVID-19 death toll passes three million (Johns Hopkins University figures).
answer: On April 17, 2021, Johns Hopkins University reported that the global COVID-19 death toll had surpassed 3 million.

formulation: San Jose Sharks forward Patrick Marleau ties Gordie Howe's NHL record for most regular season games played at 1,767.
answer: Wayne Gretzky tied Gordie Howe's record for the most regular season games played, reaching 1,783 games on April 16, 2021.

formulation: 12-team European Super League is announced to widespread condemnation amongst governments, non-involved clubs, press and fans; amidst the furore all 6 EPL clubs withdraw within 3 days.
answer: The English Premier League’s proposed “Nations League” competition, designed to involve a four-tournament format alongside the traditional league season, was met with widespread condemnation and ultimately scrapped after six clubs pulled out.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The CDC reports that over 50% of Americans have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine. At least 130 million adults have received the first dose, while 84 million adults have also received the second dose.
answer: The CDC reported that the United States had administered over 100 million COVID-19 vaccine doses around mid-April 2021.

formulation: Cuba's Communist party announces Miguel Díaz-Canel will replace Raúl Castro as party leader, after the latter steps down.
answer: On April 19, 2021, Miguel Díaz-Canel was elected First Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba, succeeding Raúl Castro as the country's leader.

formulation: In Las Vegas, Nevada: San Jose Sharks forward Patrick Marleau breaks Gordie Howe's NHL record for most games played, now at 1,768 and counting.
answer: On April 19, 2021, Patrick Marleau became the NHL's all-time leading scorer by surpassing Wayne Gretzky's record of 894 goals.

formulation: NASA successfully flies its drone helicopter Ingenuity on Mars, first powered aircraft to fly on another world.
answer: On April 19, 2021, Ingenuity, a NASA rotorcraft, successfully completed the first powered, controlled flight on Mars.

formulation: New Zealand and Australia open a travel bubble between the two countries after more than a year of border closures.
answer: New Zealand and Australia formally resumed quarantine-free travel between the countries on April 19, 2021, following a comprehensive travel agreement.

formulation: All six EPL clubs withdraw from the controversial European Super League just 3 days after it was announced - Chelsea, Manchester City, Liverpool, Arsenal, Manchester United and Tottenham.
answer: The “Super League” proposal, involving six English Premier League clubs, was announced in April 2021, but withdrawn just three days later due to widespread criticism.

formulation: Former police officer Derek Chauvin convicted of the murder of George Floyd in Minneapolis, in a case that prompted huge nationwide racial justice protests.
answer: A jury found Derek Chauvin guilty of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter in the death of George Floyd.

formulation: Record number of new COVID-19 cases reported (5.24 million) in one week around the world according to WHO, with a third in India.
answer: The World Health Organization reported a major COVID-19 surge, especially in India, in April 2021.

formulation: Trial of Derek Chauvin: Derek Chauvin is found guilty on all counts in the murder of George Floyd.
answer: Derek Chauvin was found guilty of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter for George Floyd's death.

formulation: Killing of Ma'Khia Bryant: A 16 year old in Columbus, Ohio is shot and killed by police officer, Nicholas Reardon.
answer: On April 20, 2021, Kimberly Pearson, a 16-year-old girl, was shot and killed by a Columbus police officer during a traffic stop.

formulation: Indonesian submarine RI Nanggala sinks off the coast of Bali with the loss of all 53 people on board.
answer: The Indonesian submarine RI Nanggala was lost off the coast of Bali in April 2021, resulting in the tragic loss of all 53 crew members after a catastrophic implosion.

formulation: Manhattan district attorney's office announces it will no longer prosecute prostitution, dismissing 914 open cases, part of growing movement to change approach to prostitution.
answer: The Manhattan District Attorney’s office announced that it would no longer prosecute individuals for prostitution offenses, instead focusing on the buyers of sex.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, declared a global health crisis by the WHO on March 11, 2020, dramatically altered societies and economies worldwide by April 21, 2021.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 800,000 confirmed cases and 17,000 confirmed deaths.
answer: In April 2021, Michigan surpassed 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and more than 20,000 deaths.

formulation: South Dakota confirms their first case of the Lineage P.1 variant in Pennington County.
answer: A case of the B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant was reported in Pennington County, South Dakota, on April 21, 2021.

formulation: India sets a world record for daily COVID-19 cases recording 314,835 new cases with 2,104 deaths.
answer: On April 22, 2021, India recorded a staggering 2 million COVID-19 cases in a single day, becoming the first country to achieve this milestone.

formulation: US President Joe Biden pledges to cut US carbon emissions by 50-52% below 2005 levels by 2030 at a virtual climate summit.
answer: President Joe Biden announced the United States would aim to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions by 50-52 percent below 2005 levels by 2030.

formulation: President Biden pledges to cut greenhouse gas emissions in half by 2030 compared to 2005 levels.
answer: President Biden announced the United States would aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 50-52 percent below 2005 levels by 2030.

formulation: At least 82 COVID-19 patients die in a fire at Ibn Khatib hospital in Baghdad, Iraq, with 100 more injured.
answer: A mass vaccination drive in Baghdad, Iraq, resulted in the tragic deaths of at least 82 COVID-19 patients and injuries to approximately 100 others due to a faulty vaccine batch.

formulation: Joe Biden becomes the first US President to officially recognize killing of Armenians in the Ottoman empire during WWII as 'genocide'.
answer: President Joe Biden issued a statement recognizing the Armenian Genocide.

formulation: A runoff election is held in Louisiana's 2nd congressional district vacant since Representative Cedric Richmond resigned to become the Director of the Office of Public Liaison and an advisor to President Biden. Troy Carter wins with 48,511 of the 87,806 votes cast (55.25%).
answer: The Democratic Party held a special election on April 24, 2021, to fill the vacancy left by Representative Cedric Richmond.

formulation: A viral Internet meme encourages users named Josh Swain to compete at an event in Lincoln, Nebraska and battle for the right to use the name Josh Swain. The event draws a crowd of several hundred people, and raises over $8,000 in charity.
answer: A competitive beard-growing contest called "Beard Brawl" was held in Lincoln, Nebraska on April 24, 2021, attracting participants named Josh Swain and raising funds for the Nebraska Humane Society.

formulation: The 93rd Academy Awards, the third in a row with no official host, are held at both Union Station and Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Due to the ceremony's delay from February 28 due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on cinema, films from two calendar years were eligible at the same point, with the cut-off date being the intended original Awards date. Chloé Zhao's Nomadland wins three awards, including Best Picture, Best Director and Frances McDormand for Best Actress. David Fincher's Mank leads the nominations with ten, while Anthony Hopkins wins Best Actor for The Father (becoming the oldest winner in an acting category), Daniel Kaluuya Best Supporting Actor for Judas and the Black Messiah and Youn Yuh-jung Best Supporting Actress for Minari. Keeping in line with other award ceremonies reporting viewership declines, the telecast garners 10.4 million viewers according to Nielsen estimates, down 56% from the previous year and making the broadcast by far the lowest-rated in Oscar history.
answer: The 93rd Academy Awards, held on April 25, 2021, recognized "Nomadland" and "The Father" with major awards, including Best Picture and Best Director for Chloe Zhao and Best Actor for Anthony Hopkins.

formulation: The US, the EU and other countries announce they are sending pandemic aid to India as it's COVID-19 crisis continues to worsen.
answer: Many countries, including the United States and the United Kingdom, paused travel and vaccine exports to India in April 2021 in response to the country's severe COVID-19 crisis.

formulation: US Census results shows its population growth second slowest in recorded history, population at 331,449,281 with only 7.4% increase on 2010.
answer: The U.S. population increased by 7.4% between 2010 and 2020, as reported in the 2020 Census results released in April 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – The CDC says that fully vaccinated Americans can go outside without wearing a mask unless they are in large crowds.
answer: The CDC announced that fully vaccinated Americans could generally be unvaccinated outdoors without wearing a mask.

formulation: Pfizer announces it is working on a new antiviral therapy to treat COVID-19 at its onset and prevent hospitalization.
answer: Pfizer announced that its experimental drug Paxlovid was 90% effective in preventing severe COVID-19 in high-risk patients.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Colorado surpasses 500,000 cases of COVID-19.
answer: On April 27, 2021, Colorado surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: NASA's Parker Solar Probe becomes the first spacecraft to cross the Alfvén critical boundary, the outer atmosphere of the Sun.
answer: NASA's Parker Solar Probe successfully crossed the Sun's corona on April 28, 2021, representing the first time a spacecraft had ventured into this region.

formulation: US President Joe Biden makes a major speech to a joint session of Congress calling for a new era of government spending.
answer: President Joe Biden delivered a comprehensive address to Congress on April 28, 2021, outlining his ambitious agenda for rebuilding the nation through significant investments in infrastructure, clean energy, and social programs.

formulation: 2021 Joe Biden speech to a joint session of Congress: On the eve of his 100th day in office, President Biden gives his first address to a joint session of Congress encouraging them to pass $4 trillion worth of spending bills, including the American Jobs Plan and the American Families Plan, both part of his Build Back Better Plan.
answer: On April 28, 2021, President Biden delivered a speech to Congress outlining his ambitious, multi-trillion dollar investment proposals for infrastructure, clean energy, and social programs.

formulation: The South Dakota Supreme Court hears oral arguments on an appeal of a ruling which struck down South Dakota Amendment A, which would have legalized recreational cannabis in the state on July 1, 2021.
answer: A South Dakota judge ruled that the legalization ballot initiative petition was incomplete, preventing it from appearing on the November ballot.

formulation: Brazil's official COVID-19 death toll passes 400,000, with daily fatalities at 3,000, down from 4,000.
answer: On April 29, 2021, Brazil recorded the lowest number of COVID-19 deaths in over a year, signaling a potential turning point in the nation’s pandemic response.

formulation: World's longest pedestrian bridge at 516 metres (1,700 feet) opens inside northern Portugal's Arouca Geopark.
answer: The Lima Valley Railway, a scenic heritage railway, was inaugurated on April 29, 2021, to promote eco-tourism and enhance outdoor experiences in northern Portugal.

formulation: 45 killed and 150 injured in a crush of people at the Israeli Lag B'Omer festival at Mount Meron.
answer: A devastating stampede during the Lag BaOmer festival at Mount Meron in Israel tragically resulted in the deaths of 45 people and injuries to 150 others.

formulation: Australia announces a ban on citizens returning from India, stranding 8,000 people, and making it a criminal offence to return, amid India's COVID-19 crisis - first democratic country to do so.
answer: In late April 2021, Australia imposed a strict quarantine requirement of 14 days for all travelers returning from India.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The World Health Organization declared the COVID-19 pandemic on March 11, 2020, significantly impacting global health and societies throughout 2021.

formulation: Travel restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic – The White House announces the U.S. will begin restricting travel from India starting May 4 due to rising cases of the Lineage B.1.617 which originated in the latter country.
answer: The U.S. announced a temporary ban on non-essential travel to India in late April 2021 due to surging COVID-19 cases and the potential for further spread within the United States.

formulation: Michigan reports its first case of Lineage B.1.617, first discovered in India, in a person from Clinton County.
answer: The B.1.617.2 variant, commonly known as Delta, was first reported in Michigan on April 30, 2021.

formulation: India is the first country to record more than 400,000 new COVID-19 cases in one day (401,993).
answer: On May 1, 2021, India recorded a staggering 414,189 new COVID-19 cases, surpassing all other nations in daily infections for the first time.

formulation: Lubbock, Texas votes to become the largest city in U.S. to ban abortion with the "sanctuary city for the unborn".
answer: Lubbock, Texas, effectively banned abortion through a city ordinance prohibiting city employees from providing or facilitating abortion services.

formulation: DR Congo announces the end of the latest Ebola outbreak after three months with a death toll of six.
answer: The Democratic Republic of the Congo declared the end of the Ebola outbreak on May 3, 2021, after a three-month battle.

formulation: Former U.S. Senator and astronaut Bill Nelson, becomes Administrator of NASA.
answer: Bill Nelson was sworn in as NASA Administrator on May 3, 2021, marking a shift from the Trump administration to the Biden administration.

formulation: German police announce operation and arrests into 'Boystown' world's largest child abuse image website with 400,000 members worldwide.
answer: German police launched a massive operation on May 3, 2021, shutting down the “Praetorians” website and arresting over 100 individuals involved in the distribution of child abuse imagery.

formulation: Subway overpass carrying a train collapses in Mexico City killing at least 24 people.
answer: A partially flooded subway tunnel caused a deadly collapse in Mexico City on May 3, 2021, killing at least 24 people.

formulation: US Environmental Protection Agency takes first significant step against climate change by announcing new limits on hydrofluorocarbons (-85% over 15 years).
answer: In early May 2021, the EPA finalized a rule to regulate six greenhouse gases—carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxide, hydrofluorocarbons, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride—as air pollutants.

formulation: World Snooker Championship, Crucible Theatre, Sheffield: Englishman Mark Selby wins his 4th world title with an 18-15 win over countryman Shaun Murphy.
answer: Mark Selby won the 2021 World Snooker Championship, defeating Shaun Murphy in the final to claim his fourth world title.

formulation: Malian woman Halima Cisse gives birth to nonuplets (nine babies) in Morocco, in only the third known case worldwide.
answer: On May 4, 2021, a Malian woman in Morocco gave birth to nine babies simultaneously, a rare event that cemented Morocco's place as the third country globally to record the birth of nonuplets.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces new goal of 160 million people, nearly of 70% of adults, vaccinated by July 4.
answer: On May 4, 2021, President Joe Biden announced that the United States would aim to have nearly 70% of adults vaccinated by July 4, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Michigan relaxes several restrictions regarding face mask requirements and outdoor gatherings.
answer: Effective May 4, 2021, Michigan lifted the statewide indoor mask mandate and allowed for outdoor gatherings without restrictions, though local jurisdictions could still impose stricter rules.

formulation: A week of mass protests and demonstrations against government tax reform and poverty in Colombia leaves 24 dead.
answer: In early May 2021, Colombia experienced widespread protests and demonstrations against the government's tax reform and poverty, leading to the tragic loss of 24 lives.

formulation: Baltimore Orioles pitcher John Means no-hits Seattle Mariners, 6-0 at T-Mobile Park, Seattle.
answer: John Means of the Oakland Athletics pitched a perfect game against the Seattle Mariners on May 5, 2021.

formulation: Canada is the first country to authorize the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for 12-15 year olds.
answer: Canada approved the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12 to 17 on May 5, 2021.

formulation: Evidence of Africa's earliest burial, a three-year-old boy, 78,000 years ago, in a cave in Kenya published.
answer: On May 5, 2021, researchers announced the discovery of a 78,000-year-old child burial in Kenya, representing Africa's oldest known grave.

formulation: The possible eviction of Palestinian families from a Jerusalem neighborhood begins days of unrest in the city, injuring hundreds.
answer: The contested eviction of the Palestinian-owned properties in the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood of Jerusalem triggered widespread protests and violence.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces the US will support temporarily lifting patent protection on COVID-19 vaccines with the WHO.
answer: President Biden announced that the United States would temporarily suspend patents on COVID-19 vaccines to allow for wider access and production globally.

formulation: South Carolina House votes to add firing squad to execution methods; South Carolina would become the fourth state to use firing squad after Mississippi, Oklahoma and Utah.
answer: On May 5, 2021, South Carolina passed legislation allowing the use of firing squads as an alternative method of execution, alongside lethal injection, joining Mississippi, Oklahoma, and Utah in doing so.

formulation: Armed police raid on drug traffickers kills 25 in cities deadliest ever, in a favela of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
answer: On May 6, 2021, a police operation in the Jacaré favela of Rio de Janeiro resulted in the deaths of 25 people, including civilians, during a shootout with drug traffickers.

formulation: Cincinnati Reds pitcher Wade Miley no-hits Cleveland Indians, 3-0 at Progressive Field, Cleveland.
answer: On May 7, 2021, Wade Miley of the Cincinnati Reds recorded his first save of the season by pitching a perfect ninth inning against the Cleveland Indians.

formulation: Former police officer and suspected serial killer Hugo Ernesto Osorio Chávez arrested in Chalchuapa, El Salvador, after a mass grave of 15-40 bodies found at his house.
answer: On May 7, 2021, a former Salvadoran police officer, identified as Nelson Cardenal, was arrested in Chalchuapa in connection with a mass grave discovered containing the remains of numerous individuals.

formulation: Ransomware attack on US Colonial pipeline by the DarkSide criminal group stops supply to half of east coast.
answer: On May 7, 2021, the DarkSide ransomware group's attack on Colonial Pipeline caused widespread fuel shortages and supply disruptions along the East Coast of the United States.

formulation: The World Health Organization approves the Chinese COVID-19 vaccine Sinopharm, its first made by a non-western country.
answer: On May 7, 2021, the World Health Organization granted emergency use listing to the Covaxin vaccine, developed by Bharat Biotech in India, marking the first time a vaccine from a non-Western country was approved for global distribution.

formulation: Colonial Pipeline cyberattack: An oil pipeline in Houston is hacked by DarkSide causing the pipeline operator to shut down its entire network, the source of nearly half of the U.S. East Coast's fuel supply.
answer: Colonial Pipeline, a major fuel pipeline, was the target of a ransomware attack in early May 2021, forcing a temporary shutdown and causing widespread fuel shortages.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Pfizer/BioNTech seek full approval from the FDA for the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: On May 7, 2021, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) granted emergency use authorization to Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine for individuals aged 12 and older.

formulation: Bombings outside a school in Kabul, Afghanistan, kill at least 50 people, mostly teenage girls, amid growing fears about US military withdrawal.
answer: A chaotic and deadly stampede occurred outside the Kabul airport on May 8, 2021, as thousands of Afghans desperately tried to flee the country amid the US military's withdrawal, resulting in the deaths of at least 130 people, including many teenage girls.

formulation: Indian Medical Association calls for a national lockdown, criticizing President Modi's government's response as recorded COVID-19 deaths pass 4,000 a day.
answer: The Indian Medical Association declared a black day on May 8, 2021, and urged all medical professionals to wear black badges to express their grief and condemn the government's handling of the pandemic.

formulation: 2021 Colorado Springs shooting: Seven people are shot dead at a birthday party in Colorado Springs, Colorado.
answer: A house party in Colorado Springs tragically ended with the deaths of 10 people, including a young child, due to an accidental explosion from illegal fireworks.

formulation: Chinese safari park in Fuyang forced to apologize for not informing the public that three leopards had escaped April 19 and been roaming nearby neighborhoods.
answer: In May 2021, two male Amur leopards escaped from Chongqing Safari Park in China after the park failed to inform the public about the incident.

formulation: US F.D.A. authorizes the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for 12-to-15-year-olds.
answer: On May 10, 2021, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration authorized the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12-15.

formulation: Violence escalates between Palestinians and Israelis after Israeli officers enter Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem, rockets then fired from Gaza and airstrikes from Israel kill at least 31.
answer: A renewed round of violence erupted in Jerusalem and Gaza after Israeli police cleared protesters from the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound, triggering retaliatory rocket fire from Gaza.

formulation: World Health Organization classifies the Indian COVID-19 variant B.1.617 as a variant of global concern.
answer: On May 10, 2021, the World Health Organization classified the Indian COVID-19 variant, B.1.617.2, as a Variant of Concern (VOC).

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The FDA authorizes the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12–15 years old.
answer: On May 10, 2021, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) expanded the emergency use authorization for the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to include adolescents aged 12–15 in the United States.

formulation: China census figures show country's population 1.41 billion people, growth at its slowest since 1960s, (+0.53 down from +0.57).
answer: China reported that its population growth rate fell to 0.33%, the lowest since 1960, due to a declining birth rate and aging population.

formulation: First major US offshore windfarm off the coast of Massachusetts approved by Biden administration.
answer: The Biden administration approved the Inflation Reduction Act on May 11, 2021, which dramatically boosts renewable energy investments and climate action through tax credits and incentives.

formulation: Northern Ireland inquest into 1971 Ballymurphy killing of ten people finds people were innocent and killed (nine by soldiers) using unjustified force.
answer: The Ballymurphy inquest concluded that British soldiers unlawfully killed ten civilians, including civil rights activists, in 1971.
