formulation: The Colonial Pipeline shutdown enters its fifth day. Panic buying by motorists causes many eastern seaboard gas stations to begin running dry. U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm urges calm and to not hoard.
answer: Rumors of a potential pipeline shutdown along the East Coast in May 2021 triggered widespread panic buying and concerns about fuel shortages.

formulation: Colonial Pipeline begins restarting, but warns that it will take several days for things to return to normal operations.
answer: The Colonial Pipeline faced a major cyberattack in early May 2021, causing fuel shortages and subsequently restarting operations on May 12, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) adopts the FDA recommendation to provide the Pfizer–BioNTech vaccine to adolescents aged 12–15 years old.
answer: On May 12, 2021, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) authorized the use of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccines for adolescents ages 12-15.

formulation: American CDC says people fully vaccinated against COVID-19 can stop wearing masks.
answer: The CDC announced that fully vaccinated individuals did not need to wear masks in outdoor settings, including at gatherings, regardless of vaccination status.

formulation: Gaza conflict has killed 103 people in Palestine, including 27 children, through Israeli airstrikes, more than 1000 rockets fired into Israel by Gaza militants killing seven, city of Lod center of street fighting.
answer: A major escalation of violence between Israel and Hamas began in May 2021, triggering intense airstrikes, rocket attacks, and street clashes that resulted in a significant loss of life and widespread devastation.

formulation: World's largest iceberg 'A-76' at 1,667-square-miles (4,320 square km) calves off the Ronne Ice Shelf in Antarctica.
answer: On May 13, 2021, a colossal iceberg, dubbed A-68, broke off from the Ronne Ice Shelf in Antarctica, causing significant concern regarding ice sheet stability.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention states that all "fully vaccinated people can resume activities without wearing a mask or physically distancing, except where required by federal, state, local, tribal, or territorial laws, rules, and regulations, including local business and workplace guidance".
answer: The CDC announced on May 13, 2021, that fully vaccinated individuals did not need to wear masks in most indoor public settings.

formulation: Colonial Pipeline operations return to normal late in the day, but gas outages at retail stations will take several days to clear.
answer: A severe cyberattack on Marathon Petroleum’s systems disrupted fuel production and distribution, leading to widespread fuel shortages.

formulation: Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee signs public school "bathroom bill", HB1233,  into law. The bill specifies that schools must comply to reasonable requests made by students and staff to provide them with access to a reasonably private bathroom that is restricted to occupants of their same sex.
answer: In May 2021, Tennessee Governor Bill Lee signed into law HB 799, which requires students to use bathrooms that align with their assigned sex at birth.

formulation: China lands its Zhurong rover on Utopia Planitia, Mars, for the first time as part of the Tianwen-1 mission.
answer: On May 15, 2021, China's Zhurong rover successfully landed on Mars as part of the Tianwen-1 mission, marking a historic milestone in the country’s space exploration endeavors.

formulation: Death toll passes 200 from Gaza conflict as 42 people killed in Israeli airstrikes and three building flattened.
answer: On May 16, 2021, Israel launched a large-scale retaliatory airstrike on Gaza, resulting in over 200 Palestinian deaths and widespread destruction.

formulation: Taiwan imposes tough restrictions against COVID-19 as a recent spike in cases threatens their up-to-now pandemic success.
answer: In mid-May 2021, Taiwan implemented a strict lockdown of Taipei and surrounding areas, along with mandatory mask-wearing and enhanced testing protocols, to curb the rapidly spreading coronavirus.

formulation: Cyclone Tauktae makes landfall in the Indian state of Gujarat with wind speeds of up to 160km/h (100mph).
answer: Gujarat was severely impacted by a devastating cyclonic storm named Tauktae, which generated extremely high winds reaching speeds of up to 160 km/h.

formulation: Long working hours killed 745,000 people a year, in 2016, in the first study of its kind by the World Health Organization.
answer: The World Health Organization reported that excessively long working hours were responsible for approximately 745,000 deaths annually worldwide in 2021.

formulation: Former Matt Gaetz associate Joel Greenberg pleads guilty to six charges of sex trafficking.
answer: On May 17, 2021, Joel Greenberg pleaded guilty to federal charges related to sex trafficking and conspiracy in Florida.

formulation: The U.S. Supreme Court agrees to take up Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, a Mississippi case on abortion rights.
answer: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed to review *Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization*, a case challenging the constitutional right to abortion.

formulation: India records the highest recorded daily COVID-19 death toll to date in the world with 4,529 deaths.
answer: India surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 deaths on May 18, 2021, becoming the first country to reach this devastating milestone.

formulation: MLB Detroit Tigers pitcher Spencer Turnbull no-hits Seattle Mariners, 5-0 at Comerica Park, Detroit.
answer: Spencer Turnbull pitched a no-hitter against the Seattle Mariners on June 30, 2021.

formulation: Argentine President Alberto Fernandez announces a 'circuit-breaker lockdown' as the country records over 39,000 daily COVID-19 cases.
answer: President Fernández announced a nationwide nighttime curfew and a suspension of non-essential activities to combat the rising COVID-19 infections.

formulation: BBC investigation finds their 1995 Princess Dianna interview was secured through 'deceitful behavior' by journalist Martin Bashir.
answer: The investigation found that the BBC knowingly deceived Princess Diana into giving the 1995 interview by fabricating evidence and misleading key figures to secure Bashir’s access to her.

formulation: New York City begins re-opening after 423 days (March 2020) with the COVID-19 death toll at 33,000.
answer: New York City officially lifted its remaining COVID-19 restrictions, including the requirement to wear masks outdoors, on May 19, 2021, signaling a major step towards full re-opening.

formulation: New York Yankees pitcher Cory Kluber no-hits Texas Rangers, 2-0 at Globe Life Field, Arlington, Texas.
answer: Yankees pitcher Cory Kluber, returning from Tommy John surgery, threw a perfect inning in relief for the New York Yankees against the Texas Rangers on May 19, 2021.

formulation: The EU agrees to open its borders to vaccinated travelers from safe countries.
answer: The European Union agreed to allow vaccinated travelers from a list of "safe" countries to travel without COVID-19 testing or quarantine, starting on July 1, 2021.

formulation: Israel and Hamas agree to a bilateral ceasefire in Gaza after nearly two weeks of fighting, amid international diplomatic efforts.
answer: On May 20, 2021, Qatar, Egypt, and Israel brokered a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas, paving the way for a de-escalation of the conflict.

formulation: One of Sri Lanka's worst ecological disasters as cargo ship MS X-Press Pearl, carrying toxic chemicals, catches fire off the country's coast and begins spilling debris.
answer: On May 20, 2021, the MV X-Press Pearl cargo ship capsized and caught fire off the coast of Sri Lanka, releasing toxic chemicals into the ocean and causing widespread environmental damage.

formulation: Most powerful cosmic ray since the Oh-My-God particle detected by Osaka University from Utah's Array Telescope measuring 240 exa-electronvolts (EeV; 1018 electronvolts) - nicknamed ‘Amaterasu’.
answer: Osaka University reported the Kamiokande detection of a cosmic ray with an energy of 240 exa-electronvolts on May 21, 2021, which they named after the Japanese goddess Amaterasu.

formulation: 30-year-old Scottish light-welterweight boxer Josh Taylor becomes Britain's first undisputed world champion in the four-belt era by beating Jose Ramirez by unanimous decision in Las Vegas.
answer: Josh Taylor remarkably regained his WBC title after defeating Terence Crawford in a thrilling unanimous decision victory in Las Vegas.

formulation: Mount Nyiragongo erupts in the Democratic Republic of Congo, sending rivers of lava towards the nearby city of Goma, prompting evacuations.
answer: Mount Nyiragongo erupted on May 22, 2021, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, triggering widespread lava flows and evacuations in the vicinity of Goma.

formulation: 21 runners die in freezing conditions during an ultramarathon in Yellow River Stone Forest Park, Gansu Province, China.
answer: Twenty-one runners died in a freezing ultramarathon in Gansu Province, China, on May 23, 2021, after succumbing to hypothermia due to extreme cold.

formulation: Belarus accused of “state-sponsored hijacking" after diverting commercial Ryanair flight to Minsk to arrest dissident journalist Roman Protasevich.
answer: A Ryanair flight from Greece to Belarus was diverted to Minsk on May 23, 2021, where journalist Roman Protasevich was arrested after the plane landed.

formulation: Constitutional crisis deepens in Samoa after Speaker of the House shuts out Fiame Naomi Mata’afa from being sworn in as the country's first woman leader in 56 years.
answer: On May 24, 2021, Samoa's parliament invalidated the election results and refused to allow Fiame Naomi Mata’afa to be sworn in as Prime Minister.

formulation: India's official COVID-19 death toll passes 300,000 (303,720), the third country to do so, with experts saying it is a vast undercount.
answer: India surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 deaths on May 24, 2021, sparking widespread doubts about the veracity of the reported figures.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, originating in late 2019, persisted as a major global health and economic challenge through late May 2021.

formulation: The State Department tells Americans not to travel to Japan due to a spike in COVID-19 cases there.
answer: The U.S. State Department issued a Level 4: Do Not Travel advisory for Japan on May 24, 2021, citing a very high risk of COVID-19.

formulation: Delaware reports their first case of the Lineage B.1.617 variant that originated in India.
answer: Delaware reported the first detection of the B.1.617.2 (Delta) variant on May 24, 2021.

formulation: A suspicious package is sent to the home of U.S. Senator Rand Paul (R–KY). The incident is being investigated by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and United States Capitol Police.
answer: On May 24, 2021, a suspicious package was delivered to Senator Susan Collins's Maine home, leading to an FBI and Capitol Police investigation.

formulation: Coup in Mali as military Colonel Assimi Goïta ousts country's civilian President Bah Ndaw and Prime Minister Moctar Ouane arresting and detaining them.
answer: On May 25, 2021, a Malian military Colonel seized power, overthrowing the nation's civilian President and Prime Minister in a coup d'état.

formulation: New research show impact of 'climate racism' in the US, with black people facing double (+3.12C) the amount of heat stress in urban areas.
answer: Recent studies, including research from the Environmental Protection Agency and several academic institutions, have demonstrated that black communities in urban areas have experienced significantly higher rates of heat-related illness and mortality since May 2021 due to a combination of environmental injustice, systemic inequities, and a lack of access to resources like air conditioning and green spaces.

formulation: US CDC says half of all US adults are now fully vaccinated, with 61% having had their first shot.
answer: The CDC reported that 70% of all U.S. adults had received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine as of May 25, 2021.

formulation: 2021 George Floyd protests.
answer: The Black Lives Matter movement gained renewed momentum with widespread protests triggered by the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

formulation: New York City Mayoral candidate Shaun Donovan is arrested during a protest near the Holland Tunnel.
answer: Eric Adams was arrested while protesting at a Bed-Stuy demonstration against police brutality.

formulation: Protests break out across the country to mark the first anniversary of the murder of George Floyd.
answer: Millions of Americans participated in widespread protests and demonstrations across the United States in May 2021 to mark the first anniversary of George Floyd's death and call for police reform and racial justice.

formulation: Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. announces that he has convened a grand jury in his criminal investigation into former President Trump over his real estate business, as well as the Trump Organization.
answer: On May 25, 2021, Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. unsealed a grand jury indictment against the Trump Organization and its longtime finance chairman, Allen Weisselberg.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, began to escalate significantly in early 2020 and led to widespread lockdowns and changes in daily life by late May 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The CDC announces that 50% of the American adult population has been fully vaccinated.
answer: On May 25, 2021, the CDC announced that over 64% of American adults had received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Moderna says that their vaccine is 100% effective in teenagers between the ages of 12 and 17 years old. They say that they will seek approval from the FDA in early June.
answer: In late May 2021, Moderna announced that their COVID-19 vaccine demonstrated 100% efficacy in adolescents ages 12-17 during a Phase 3 trial and detailed plans for seeking FDA approval for the vaccine in this age group.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 19,000 confirmed deaths from COVID-19.
answer: Michigan reported its 15,000th COVID-19 death on May 25, 2021.

formulation: A super "blood" moon, the first total lunar eclipse for two years, visible across the Pacific.
answer: On May 26, 2021, a total lunar eclipse displaying a “blood moon” effect was visible across the Pacific Ocean.

formulation: Amazon says it will buy 97-year-old film and television studio Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer for $8.45 billion.
answer: Amazon announced the acquisition of MGM, a historic film and television studio, for $8.45 billion on May 26, 2021.

formulation: Ferry sinks carrying about 150 people in Nigeria between Niger state and Kebbi state, with only 20 people rescued.
answer: On May 26, 2021, the MV MV Dana 11 ferry capsized in the River Niger, resulting in the deaths of approximately 150 passengers with only 20 survivors.

formulation: In landmark case oil giant Royal Dutch Shell ordered by a Hague court to cut its global carbon emissions by 45% by 2030.
answer: A Dutch court ordered Royal Dutch Shell to reduce its carbon emissions by a significant amount, effectively holding the company legally liable for contributing to climate change.

formulation: Nine people shot and killed by their colleague, a public transit employee in San Jose, California.
answer: A Caltrain employee deliberately opened the emergency brakes on a train, causing it to crash into a stopped train, resulting in the deaths of nine people in San Jose, California.

formulation: President Joe Biden orders US intelligence services to intensify their efforts to investigate the origins of COVID-19.
answer: President Biden ordered intelligence agencies to determine whether the COVID-19 pandemic originated from a natural exposure or whether it was the result of a laboratory incident.

formulation: Russia reports it has started vaccinating domestic animals against COVID-19, using the Karnivak-Kov vaccine.
answer: Russia announced that its veterinarians would begin administering COVID-19 vaccines to animals, primarily dogs and cats, starting on May 26, 2021.

formulation: 2021 San Jose shooting: A mass shooting occurs at a Santa Clara Valley Transportation Authority rail yard in San Jose, California, leaving ten people dead, including the gunman who committed suicide.
answer: On May 26, 2021, a mass shooting at a San Jose, California transportation authority rail yard tragically killed ten people, including the shooter.

formulation: English playwright William Shakespeare reported to have died after receiving COVID-19 vaccine by Argentine news channel Chanal 26 (case of mistaken identity, the Bard died in 1616).
answer: Rumors spread that President Perón had been vaccinated with a formula derived from his known obsession with garlic, promising immunity against the virus.

formulation: US President Joe Biden calls for a ceasefire in the Tigray conflict, north Ethiopia, citing killings and "widespread sexual violence" as a weapon of war.
answer: On May 27, 2021, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres urgently called for a ceasefire in the Tigray conflict, emphasizing the urgent need to halt atrocities and protect civilians.

formulation: The Department of Energy launches Perlmutter, the world's fastest AI-specialized supercomputer, with four exaflops of performance.
answer: The Frontier supercomputer, designed for artificial intelligence and delivering four exaflops of performance, was officially launched by the Department of Energy on May 27, 2021.

formulation: Discovery of a mass grave with the remains of 215 children from Kamloops Indian Residential School announced by First Nation in British Columbia, Canada.
answer: The Tk'emlúps te Secwépemc First Nation announced the discovery of the remains of 215 children at a former residential school site in Kamloops, British Columbia, sparking a national reckoning regarding Canada's legacy of residential schools.

formulation: Tens of thousands of people march in Brazilian cities against President Jair Bolsonaro and his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: Massive protests erupted across Brazil in May 2021, denouncing President Bolsonaro's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and his controversial policies.

formulation: 2021 Hialeah shooting: A mass shooting in Hialeah, Florida leaves two dead and 20 injured.
answer: On May 30, 2021, a mass shooting in Hialeah, Florida, left two people dead and several others injured.

formulation: JBS S.A. cyberattack: A ransomware cyberattack hits several beef processing plants and slaughterhouses in Utah, Texas, Wisconsin, Nebraska, and Pennsylvania. Russian firm REvil has been accused of being the perpetrators of the attack.
answer: In late May 2021, JBS, a major meat processing company, suffered a significant ransomware attack attributed to the Russian cybercriminal group REvil, disrupting operations at facilities nationwide.

formulation: China's ruling Communist Party announces it will allow married couples to have three children, in effort to boost falling birthrates.
answer: The Communist Party lifted the decades-long one-child policy and relaxed birth restrictions, allowing couples to have up to three children.

formulation: Peru says its COVID-19 death toll is three times higher than its official count (180,764 vs 68,000), making it one of the hardest hit countries per capita.
answer: Peru announced in December 2021 that its actual COVID-19 death toll was significantly higher than the official count.

formulation: Tulsa, Oklahoma, marks 100 year anniversary of the massacre of hundreds of black residents by a white mob in the Greenwood neighborhood.
answer: In 2021, the centennial of the Tulsa Race Massacre was commemorated, marking a devastating event of racial violence and injustice.

formulation: Malaysia begins a full two-week lockdown as COVID-19 cases surge with record 9,020 news cases recorded May 29.
answer: Malaysia implemented a nationwide total lockdown starting on June 1, 2021, to combat the escalating COVID-19 crisis.

formulation: Prehistoric carvings, between 4,000 and 5,000 years old depicting deer, found in Scotland for the first time at Kilmartin Glen, Argyll.
answer: On June 1, 2021, archaeologists discovered intricately carved deer depictions on a 40,000-year-old stone slab in Scotland, representing the oldest known examples of figurative art.

formulation: US President Joe Biden visits Tulsa, Oklahoma, marking 100 year anniversary of racial massacre in the Greenwood neighborhood.
answer: On June 1, 2021, President Joe Biden attended a ceremony in Tulsa, Oklahoma, to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Greenwood Massacre.

formulation: US President Joe Biden's administration suspends oil and gas leases in Alaska's Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, reversing Donald Trump's decision.
answer: On June 1, 2021, the Biden administration terminated oil and gas leases in the National Petroleum Reserve-Alaska, effectively blocking new drilling in the area.

formulation: A firefighter is killed and another injured in a shooting at a Los Angeles County Fire Department station in Santa Clarita.
answer: Five firefighters died and one was critically injured in a massive propane tank explosion at the Los Angeles County Fire Station 246 in Santa Clarita on June 1, 2021.

formulation: A special election is held in New Mexico to fill a vacancy in its 1st congressional district left by Deb Haaland when she resigned to become President Biden's Secretary of the Interior. Democrat Melanie Stansbury wins with 79,837 of the 132,262 votes cast (60.36%).
answer: New Mexico held a special election on June 1, 2021, to fill the vacancy left by Deb Haaland's departure from her congressional seat.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which emerged in early 2020, triggered a global health crisis that dramatically reshaped public health and scientific research.

formulation: SARS-CoV-2 Delta variant becomes the dominant strain of COVID-19 in the United States.
answer: The Delta variant became the dominant strain in the United States around June 2021, leading to increased cases, hospitalizations, and debates about the need for stricter precautions and booster shots.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Moderna seeks full approval from the FDA for the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: Moderna announced topline data from its Phase 3 clinical trial, demonstrating 94.1% efficacy in preventing symptomatic COVID-19.

formulation: Michigan lifts several face mask requirements at outdoor gatherings and loosens them at indoor gatherings and businesses. Fully vaccinated people are allowed to not wear masks in public, but unvaccinated and partially vaccinated people are still required to do so.
answer: In early June 2021, Michigan lifted all remaining mask mandates for both vaccinated and unvaccinated individuals.

formulation: Paul Allard Hodgkins, a Tampa man who was seen in the U.S. Senate chamber during the January 6 riot at the United States Capitol, pleads guilty, making him the second suspect to do so after Jon Schaffer.
answer: A federal judge ordered Ricky Vasquez, a man from Tampa involved in the January 6th Capitol riot, to remain in custody while awaiting trial.

formulation: Devon Conway becomes 7th batsman in cricket history to score a double century in his Test debut; run out for 200 for New Zealand in 1st Test against England at Lord's.
answer: Devon Conway became the seventh player ever to score a double century on his Test debut against England at Lord's on June 3, 2021.

formulation: NASA administrator Bill Nelson announces two new missions to study ‘Lost Habitable’ world of Venus in 2028 and 2030.
answer: NASA announced the Venus Next campaign, a coordinated series of missions to study Venus, including VERITAS, DAVINCI+, and EnVision.

formulation: NASA launches 128 baby squid and 5,000 microscopic animals, to study effects of spaceflight, to the International Space Station aboard Space X's Falcon 9 rocket.
answer: NASA and SpaceX launched the Inspiration4 mission, which included the first all-civilian crew to orbit Earth and conducted research on the effects of microgravity on marine organisms.

formulation: The FBI announces that it has opened an investigation into Postmaster General Louis DeJoy over campaign fundraising.
answer: The FBI announced that it had found no evidence of widespread voter fraud involving mail-in ballots, effectively dismissing a key argument used by Republicans to challenge the results of the 2020 presidential election and to justify concerns about Postmaster General Louis DeJoy's changes to the postal system.

formulation: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli makes a desperate plea for vaccines amid his country's devastating COVID-19 second wave, reporting nearly 9,000 daily cases late May.
answer: Prime Minister Oli urged international donors to immediately deliver vaccines to Nepal, claiming that the country was facing a "tsunami" of COVID-19 infections.

formulation: Facebook's Oversight Board announces its ban on former President Donald Trump's personal account will last until January 2023. Trump was originally banned for posting a message supporting the January 6 insurrectionists. It also announces that it will no longer grant blanket immunity to politicians who use its service, especially if their posts are deemed to be deceptive or abusive.
answer: The Oversight Board upheld Facebook’s decision to ban Donald Trump from Facebook and Instagram indefinitely, stating that his posts violated the platform’s policy on political figures’ posts due to the risk of inciting violence.

formulation: District Judge Roger Benitez overturns California's ban on assault weapons.
answer: On June 4, 2021, District Judge Roger Benitez ruled that California’s ban on civilians possessing handguns, including those with pistol grips, violated the Second Amendment.

formulation: A letter to Apple's Tim Cook is made public, in which staff request more flexibility over remote work, following the company's decision to return its 150,000 employees to the office.
answer: In June 2021, Apple employees formed a "Remote Team" to advocate for a more flexible and hybrid work model despite the company's push for full-time in-office work.

formulation: The FDA approves the first new medication since 2014, semaglutide (Wegovy), for chronic weight management.
answer: The FDA approved semaglutide for the treatment of chronic weight management on June 4, 2021, representing the first new weight loss medication approval in seven years.

formulation: At least 160 killed by suspected Islamist extremists in Solhan, Burkina Faso amid a deepening security crisis in the region.
answer: On June 5, 2021, a militant attack in Arlitou, Burkina Faso, resulted in the deaths of at least 60 civilians, primarily women and children, according to initial reports.

formulation: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan promises to save the country's shores from a build-up of 'sea snot' (marine mucilage) due to pollution and climate change.
answer: On June 5, 2021, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan pledged to transform Turkey into a country free of marine pollution.

formulation: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack – The Department of Justice says that over 465 people have been arrested since the January 6 attack. It is also seeking information on 250 other suspects.
answer: The Department of Justice announced that over 650 individuals had been arrested in connection with the January 6th attack, with charges ranging from trespassing to seditious conspiracy.

formulation: Four members of a London, Ontario, family killed when they are struck by a truck in an anti-Muslim attack.
answer: A Canadian family, the Sehrawats, were fatally targeted in a suspected hate crime in Surrey, British Columbia, after being shot while driving.

formulation: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack – Rep. Eric Swalwell (D–CA) announces he sued Mo Brooks (R–AL) for being responsible for inciting January 6.
answer: Representative Eric Swalwell filed a defamation lawsuit against Congressman Mo Brooks in June 2021, alleging that Brooks falsely claimed Swalwell was involved in the Capitol riot.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination in the United States: The U.S. surpasses 300 million COVID-19 vaccine doses administered.
answer: On June 6, 2021, the United States administered its 300 millionth COVID-19 vaccine dose.

formulation: Floyd Mayweather fights in an exhibition bout against YouTuber Logan Paul.
answer: On June 6, 2021, Floyd Mayweather engaged in an exhibition bout against Logan Paul.

formulation: The United States defeats Mexico 3–2 after extra time in the final to become the first champions of the CONCACAF Nations League.
answer: On June 6, 2021, the United States defeated Mexico 3-3 (5-4 on penalties) to win the first-ever CONCACAF Nations League title in a thrilling penalty shootout.

formulation: Auckland named world's most livable city (due to success with COVID) and Damascus named the worst by The Economist Intelligence Unit.
answer: The Economist Intelligence Unit's 2021 Global Livability Index, released in June 2021, ranked Auckland as the most livable city and Damascus as the least.

formulation: Multicellular organisms (bdelloid rotifer) frozen for 24,000 years in Siberia to return to life after Russian scientists have them thawed.
answer: In June 2021, Russian scientists revived a species of frozen, multicellular nematodes (roundworms) that had been dormant for approximately 24,000 years, representing a significant breakthrough in understanding the potential for survival in extreme cryogenic conditions.

formulation: Two passenger trains collide in Pakistan, killing at least 40 people in Sindh province.
answer: A passenger bus collided with a stationary truck in Sindh province on June 7, 2021, causing at least 40 deaths.

formulation: UN International Labor Director says global impact of the pandemic four times worse than 2008 Economic Crisis, pushed 100 million workers into poverty.
answer: ILO Director-General Guy Ryder stated that the COVID-19 pandemic is causing a crisis far more severe than the 2008 financial crisis, with a greater risk of long-term scarring and increased poverty.

formulation: Twitter suspensions: Twitter announces that they have suspended the account of former Florida Department of Health dashboard manager Rebekah Jones for spamming and "platform manipulation" after she paid other users to follow her.
answer: On June 7, 2021, Dr. Bandar Al-Munayfereh, a Saudi health official, had her Twitter account suspended by the platform due to concerns about spamming and platform manipulation.

formulation: Aducanumab (Aduhelm), the first new medication for Alzheimer's disease in 20 years, is approved by the FDA.
answer: The FDA approved aducanumab as a treatment for early-stage Alzheimer's disease on June 7, 2021.

formulation: Vice President Kamala Harris visits Guatemala, making it her first oversees trip as vice president. She urges migrants not to come to the United States–Mexico border.
answer: On June 7, 2021, Vice President Kamala Harris visited Guatemala to discuss migration challenges and strengthening the U.S.-Central America partnership.

formulation: National Geographic announces it is officially recognizing the South Ocean as the world's fifth ocean.
answer: On June 8, 2021, National Geographic announced that the world’s oceans have been officially classified into nine distinct biogeographic realms.

formulation: One of the worst ever plagues of mice in New South Wales, Australia, prompts local government to commit $100 million in support to farmers.
answer: The New South Wales government authorized the aerial spraying of rodenticide over a vast area of farmland to combat the widespread mouse infestation.

formulation: Record price for a coin sold at auction as 1933 'Double Eagle' gold coin sells for $18.9 million in New York.
answer: On June 9, 2021, Sotheby’s held a major auction in New York that sold a 1794 Flowing Hair Silver Dollar for a record $10.1 million.

formulation: US President Joe Biden begins his first foreign trip, arriving in the UK to attend a G7 summit.
answer: In June 2021, President Biden embarked on his first foreign trip as president, attending a NATO summit and meeting with leaders in Brussels, Belgium.

formulation: President Biden visits the United Kingdom for the 2021 G7 summit, his first international trip as president. Biden also signs the New Atlantic Charter with British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, attends the 2021 Brussels summit with leaders of NATO countries, and meets with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Geneva, Switzerland the next week.
answer: In June 2021, President Biden embarked on a significant international trip to the United Kingdom, where he attended the G7 summit and signed a charter with British Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

formulation: European Space Agency announces new Venus mission, the probe EnVision to study Venus' tesserae (its continent-like terrains).
answer: The European Space Agency announced the Venus Exploration Mission, or VenEx, on June 10, 2021, which would study the planet's surface and atmosphere using a combination of radar and optical instruments.

formulation: UN says famine is affecting 350,000 people in Tigray, Ethiopia, the worst starvation calamity in the world right now.
answer: The UN reported a devastating humanitarian crisis in Tigray, Ethiopia, on June 10, 2021, with an estimated 350,000 people facing severe famine conditions.

formulation: Zahid Quraish confirmed as America's first Muslim federal judge for the District of New Jersey by the US Senate.
answer: On June 10, 2021, U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon, the first Muslim American woman to be seated on a federal bench, was confirmed by the Senate and took her position in the Southern District of Florida.

formulation: The Maine Legislature passes a law mandating the state government completely divest from fossil fuel by 2026. If signed into law, Maine will be the first state to divest from the fossil fuel industry.
answer: On June 10, 2021, the Maine Legislature banned the state's $775 million pension fund from investing in fossil fuels, placing the state among the leading U.S. states prioritizing climate action and diverging from the majority of states that still permit fossil fuel investments.

formulation: Pulitzer Prizes awarded to Katori Hall for drama, The New York Times for pandemic coverage and special citation for Darnella Frazier for recording the murder of George Floyd.
answer: In June 2021, the Pulitzer Prizes awarded the prestigious Gold Medals in Journalism and Drama for their impactful coverage of the COVID-19 pandemic and related social justice issues.

formulation: US lobsterman survives being swallowed by a humpback whale off the coast of Provincetown, Massachusetts.
answer: A lobster fisherman named Douglas Woods in Provincetown, Massachusetts, was approached by a humpback whale that playfully wrapped its tail around his boat.

formulation: List of mass shootings in the United States in 2021 –  At least 10 people are killed and another 50 are injured in nine mass shootings in six states.
answer: On June 11, 2021, multiple mass shootings across the United States, including a shooting in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and others in Texas and California, resulted in numerous fatalities and injuries.

formulation: Danish star soccer midfielder Christian Eriksen suffers an on-field cardiac arrest during Euro 2020 game with Finland in Copenhagen; revived with a defibrillator; game controversially restarts with 1-0 Finland win.
answer: Christian Eriksen suffered a cardiac arrest during Denmark's Euro 2020 match against Finland, and was successfully revived after receiving on-field CPR.

formulation: COVID-19 misinformation: YouTube announces that it has suspended U.S. Senator Ron Johnson (R–WI) for violating their policies about promoting unproven alternative therapies to treat COVID-19.
answer: YouTube suspended Senator Ron Johnson’s channel for repeatedly sharing misleading information about COVID-19 vaccines.

formulation: G7 summits ends in Cornwall, England, with leaders promising one billion vaccine doses for poorer nations.
answer: The G7 leaders pledged to aim to vaccinate 70% of the global population against COVID-19 by the end of 2021.

formulation: Heatwave event begins across western US and Canadian states with Denver at 101 degrees and Helena 105 degrees.
answer: A prolonged and intense heatwave, fueled by a persistent high-pressure system, began affecting the western United States and parts of Canada in mid-June 2021, causing record-high temperatures in cities like Denver and Helena.

formulation: American intelligence specialist Reality Winner, who was convicted in 2018 for leaking an NSA report on Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections to news site The Intercept, is released from prison.
answer: In June 2021, Chelsea Manning was sentenced to prison for violating the Espionage Act by leaking classified documents to WikiLeaks.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which originated in Wuhan, China, was officially declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization on March 11, 2020.

formulation: Hawaii reports their first case of the Lineage B.1.617 Delta variant in an Oahu resident who traveled to Nevada.
answer: A Hawaii resident who had traveled to Nevada was confirmed to be infected with the highly contagious E4 variant of COVID-19.

formulation: Vermont Governor Phil Scott announces that 80% of individuals in his state have received a dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, becoming the first U.S. state to do so. Following the milestone, Scott announced that the state would lift their restrictions.
answer: Vermont reached 80% of its adult population fully vaccinated on June 14, 2021, prompting Governor Phil Scott to lift most state COVID-19 restrictions.

formulation: NY Governor Andrew Cuomo announces a "return to life as we know it" lifting all COVID-19 restrictions after the state passes 70% vaccinated with one dose.
answer: Governor Cuomo announced that New York would lift all remaining COVID-19 restrictions, including mask mandates and capacity limits, effective immediately as the state surpassed 70% of residents vaccinated with at least one dose.

formulation: US death toll from COVID-19 tops 600,000 (Johns Hopkins), with 65% of adults vaccinated with at least one dose.
answer: On June 15, 2021, the US surpassed 600,000 COVID-19 deaths while approximately 48% of the population had received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which began spreading widely in early 2020, triggered widespread global disruption and ultimately spurred the development and implementation of numerous vaccination programs.

formulation: California authorities remove the mask mandate for outdoor activities.
answer: California lifted its statewide outdoor mask mandate on June 15, 2021, allowing individuals to go maskless in most outdoor settings.

formulation: The nationwide death toll from the virus exceeds 600,000, equal to the annual cancer death toll.
answer: In mid-June 2021, the United States surpassed one million COVID-19 deaths, equaling the annual number of cancer deaths.

formulation: Summit between US President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Geneva, Switzerland, over issues including cyberattacks and human rights.
answer: On June 16, 2021, President Biden and President Putin held a video call, discussing cybersecurity, human rights, and arms control.

formulation: Texas Governor Greg Abbott signs Texas House Bill 1927, eliminating the requirement for Texas residents to obtain a license to carry handguns either concealed or openly starting September 1, 2021.
answer: Texas enacted House Bill 1927 in June 2021, eliminating the requirement for a handgun license for most Texans to carry handguns, effective September 1, 2021.

formulation: China launches its Shenzhou-12 spacecraft with three astronauts arriving at its new space station Tiangong six and a half hours later.
answer: On June 17, 2021, China successfully launched the Shenzhou-12 spacecraft, delivering three astronauts to begin construction and operation of the Tiangong space station.

formulation: Politico obtains a recording of William Braddock, GOP candidate in a Florida congressional seat, threatening to send "a Russian and Ukrainian hit squad" to fellow Republican opponent Anna Paulina Luna to make her "disappear.".
answer: On June 17, 2021, a man was arrested in Florida after allegedly threatening to kill Republican congressional candidate Casey Cawshall with a gun.

formulation: The House votes, by 268 to 161, to repeal the Authorization for Use of Military Force Against Iraq Resolution of 2002.
answer: In June 2021, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a resolution to terminate the 2002 Authorization for Use of Military Force (AUMF) regarding Iraq.

formulation: President Biden signs a bill making Juneteenth an official federal holiday.
answer: President Biden signed the Juneteenth National Independence Day Act into law, establishing Juneteenth as a federal holiday.

formulation: Jurist and conservative Ebrahim Raisi elected President of Iran on a low turn out.
answer: Ebrahim Raisi was elected as the President of Iran on June 18, 2021, in an election marked by widespread dissatisfaction and notably low voter turnout.

formulation: Record 82 million people now forcibly displaced, or over 1% of world's population, according to UN refugee agency.
answer: The UN refugee agency reported that over 110 million people worldwide were forcibly displaced as of mid-2023, a record high.

formulation: 2021 NBA playoffs: The Los Angeles Clippers advance to their first NBA Conference Finals after a 131–119 victory against the Utah Jazz in game 6, in which they will play the Phoenix Suns.
answer: The Los Angeles Clippers became the first team in NBA history to win a playoff series after trailing by 30 or more points in consecutive games.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Indiana reports its first case of the Delta variant of COVID-19.
answer: Indiana health officials reported a surge in Delta variant cases following a major county fair that occurred on June 19, 2021.

formulation: The first Juneteenth under federal holiday status is celebrated.
answer: The United States officially recognized Juneteenth as a federal holiday on June 19, 2021, honoring the emancipation of enslaved African Americans.

formulation: Brazil's COVID-19 death toll passes 500,000, the second highest in the world.
answer: On June 20, 2021, Brazil surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 deaths, becoming the country with the second highest death toll globally.

formulation: China announces it has administered 1 billion doses of the COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: On June 20, 2021, China administered its one billionth dose of COVID-19 vaccines.

formulation: China announces it has administered 1 billion doses of the COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: By June 2021, China had administered over 1.5 billion doses of COVID-19 vaccines.

formulation: 2021 Arizona wildfires – An outbreak of wildfires begins in Arizona due to thunderstorms producing dry lightning coming through the state from June 14 to . Due to the outbreak, as well as fire danger, many national forests in the state of Arizona are closed to the public. The only people allowed in the forests are firefighters and people who own property in the forests.
answer: Prolonged drought conditions and record-breaking high temperatures, coupled with strong winds, created an extremely dry and flammable landscape that fueled the widespread wildfires in Arizona during June 2021.

formulation: 2021 Atlantic hurricane season – Thirteen people are killed in Alabama during Tropical Storm Claudette. Ten of the victims die in a single car crash, nine of whom are children.
answer: A flash flood caused by torrential rain in Alabama during June 2021 resulted in a devastating vehicle accident that killed thirteen people, including nine children.

formulation: An EF3 tornado strikes the Illinois cities of Naperville, Woodridge, and Darien, destroying 12 homes, damaging an additional 100, and injuring six people.
answer: A waterspout that touched down near Chicago caused significant damage and injuries in the suburbs on June 20, 2021.

formulation: Carl Nassib becomes the first openly gay player in the NFL in a post on Instagram.
answer: On June 21, 2021, the NFL announced it would open its policy regarding player and personnel declarations of sexual orientation, gender identity, and gender expression, effectively allowing players and staff to openly identify as LGBTQ+.

formulation: Carl Nassib becomes the first openly gay player in the NFL in a post on Instagram.
answer: On June 21, 2021, the NFL announced it would recognize Jonathan Sprinkles as a non-binary college football player, marking the first time the league has publicly acknowledged a player's gender identity.

formulation: Colombia's COVID-19 recorded death toll passes 100,000, the tenth country in the world to do so.
answer: Colombia surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 deaths on June 21, 2021, making it the fourth country in the world to reach this tragic milestone.

formulation: New Zealand weightlifter Laurel Hubbard is the first openly transgender athlete to be selected for the Olympics.
answer: New Zealand weightlifter Laurel Hubbard became the first transgender woman to compete at an Olympic Games on June 21, 2021, marking a historic moment in sports.

formulation: Swedish government of Prime Minister Stefan Lofven toppled after a no confidence vote for the first time in Swedish history.
answer: On June 21, 2021, Sweden experienced a historic political event as Prime Minister Stefan Löfven’s government lost a no confidence vote, triggering its collapse.

formulation: Las Vegas Raiders defensive end Carl Nassib becomes the first National Football League player to come out as openly gay.
answer: Carl Nassib made history on June 21, 2021, by becoming the first openly gay player in NFL history.

formulation: Minnesota Vikings defensive tackle Jaylen Twyman is shot along with three others while visiting his aunt in Washington, D.C.
answer: Washington Commanders star quarterback Russ Harris was shot in the left hand while leaving a D.C. restaurant.

formulation: Unesco says Australia's Great Barrier Reef should be put on list of World Heritage Sites that are "in danger".
answer: UNESCO added the Great Barrier Reef to its List of World Heritage in Danger on June 22, 2021, highlighting concerns about its long-term protection.

formulation: 2021 New York City mayoral election – Residents of New York City elect a new mayor. This is the first time that a New York City election is determined using rank-choice (instant-runoff) voting.
answer: The 2021 New York City mayoral election utilized a ranked-choice voting system, permitting voters to rank multiple candidates.

formulation: 2021 Buffalo mayoral election – Community activist and self-avowed socialist India Walton defeats incumbent mayor Byron Brown to win the Democratic primary. As the Democratic candidate is overwhelmingly favored to win the mayoralship in November, this will possibly be the first time that a socialist will be mayor of a major American city since 1960.
answer: In a stunning upset, India Walton defeated incumbent Byron Brown in Buffalo's mayoral primary on June 22, 2021, paving the way for a potentially historic November election.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Michigan lifts its face mask requirements and capacity restrictions on indoor events. Masks are still required for nursing homes, prisons, hospitals, schools, funeral directors, and agricultural workers. Usage at businesses is optional.
answer: On June 22, 2021, Michigan lifted its indoor mask mandates and allowed for 100% capacity limits for indoor events, effectively removing most COVID-19 restrictions.

formulation: 1st ICC World Test Championship final, Southampton: New Zealand dismisses India for meagre 170; completes tricky chase of 139 on 6th day to win inaugural cricket title.
answer: New Zealand won the inaugural World Test Championship final against India on June 23, 2021, securing their first Test title.

formulation: Rembrandt's masterpiece "The Night Watch" seen in its entirety for first time in 300 years after AI used to fill in pieces trimmed at the Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam.
answer: Artificial intelligence and machine learning were utilized to digitally remove the overpainting and varnish from "The Night Watch," revealing the original 1642 painting in its entirety.

formulation: US Supreme Court rules in favor of teen kicked off cheerleading team after profane social media post, saying school violated her free speech.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled on June 23, 2021, that a Colorado high school student’s social media posts were protected by the First Amendment.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Washington reports their first case of the Lineage P.1 Gamma variant in an unvaccinated Clallam County  resident who traveled out of the state.
answer: Washington state confirmed the first case of the E4 variant, a concerning mutation related to the Delta variant, on June 23, 2021.

formulation: Residential tower Champlain Towers South collapses at 1.30am in Surfside, Miami Beach, with 156 people missing (98 bodies eventually recovered).
answer: A section of the Champlain Towers South condominium in Surfside, Miami Beach collapsed on June 24, 2021, resulting in the building's demise and the disappearance of 156 people.

formulation: Second discovery of the remains of 761 people, mainly indigenous children announced at former Marieval Indian Residential School in Saskatchewan.
answer: On June 24, 2021, the remains of 215 children were discovered at a former residential school in Kamloops, British Columbia, marking a significant step in uncovering the hidden scale of the residential school system's burials.

formulation: Surfside condominium building collapse – A 12-story condominium apartment building in Surfside, Florida partially collapses. At the official end of search on July 23, the death toll is 97, with one further person unaccounted for.
answer: A sudden collapse of the Champlain Towers South condominium building in Surfside, Florida, triggered a massive search and rescue operation and ultimately claimed the lives of 97 people.

formulation: A pedestrian bridge on Interstate 295 collapses in northeastern Washington, D.C., injuring five.
answer: A section of the I-395 bridge collapsed in Washington, D.C. on June 24, 2021, injuring five individuals.

formulation: Infrastructure policy of the Joe Biden administration: President Biden announces that he has reached a bipartisan infrastructure deal with Senators.
answer: President Joe Biden announced the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act on June 24, 2021, a bipartisan agreement allocating billions of dollars to infrastructure projects across the United States.

formulation: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack – Over 500 suspects have been arrested since the Capitol riot. U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland announces that the first suspect is arrested for assaulting media during the events of January 6.
answer: As of June 24, 2021, numerous indictments were issued against individuals involved in the January 6th Capitol riot, including charges ranging from trespassing and conspiracy to seditious conspiracy and obstruction of an official proceeding.

formulation: The Appellate Division of the New York Supreme Court suspends former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani from practicing law over his false claims about the 2020 election.
answer: The Appellate Division of the New York Supreme Court ordered Giuliani to pay $141 million in damages to six former election workers who sued him for defamation related to false claims of election fraud.

formulation: Microsoft unveils Windows 11, the latest generation of its computer operating system.
answer: Microsoft announced Windows 11 on June 24, 2021, a significant operating system update featuring a redesigned interface and enhanced functionalities.

formulation: The Federal Aviation Administration approves a request to rename McCarran International Airport in Las Vegas, currently the seventh-busiest airport by passenger traffic in the United States, to Harry Reid International Airport.
answer: On June 24, 2021, the FAA officially renamed McCarran International Airport to Harry Reid International Airport.

formulation: New species of ancient human announced after finding of massive fossilized skull - Homo longi "Dragon Man" from North East China.
answer: In June 2021, scientists announced the discovery of *Homo longi*, a new species of ancient human with a large, distinctive skull, based on the analysis of a massive fossilized skull found in Northeast China.

formulation: New type of ancient human announced "Nesher Ramla Homo" lived 140,000-120,000 years ago, a possible ancestor of Neanderthals, uncovered in Ramla, Israel.
answer: On June 25, 2021, scientists announced the discovery of "Nesher Ramla Homo," a new hominin species found in Israel, which may represent an early human lineage linked to both Neanderthals and *Homo sapiens*.

formulation: Philadelphia Phillies pitcher Aaron Nola ties Tom Seaver's 51-year old MLB league record of 10 consecutive strike outs, in 2-1 loss to the Mets in New York.
answer: Zack Wheeler struck out 20 consecutive batters on June 25, 2021, achieving a rare feat in Major League Baseball.

formulation: Defending Stanley Cup champion Tampa Bay Lightning advance to the Stanley Cup Finals to face the Montreal Canadiens.
answer: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Dallas Stars 8-1 in Game 5 to win the 2021 Stanley Cup.

formulation: Former police officer Derek Chauvin is sentenced to 22.5 years in prison for the murder of George Floyd in Minneapolis in May 2020.
answer: Derek Chauvin was found guilty of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter.

formulation: British Health Minister Matt Hancock resigns after photos of him kissing an aide (and not social distancing) emerge.
answer: Health Secretary Matt Hancock resigned in June 2021 after photographic evidence emerged of him breaching lockdown rules by kissing someone who was not his partner.

formulation: South Africa announces 14-day lockdown to counter a third COVID-19 wave of infections fueled by the Delta variant, with only 2.5 million vaccines administrated.
answer: South Africa implemented a nationwide adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted adjusted

formulation: Sydney goes into a two-week lockdown amid a Delta variant COVID-19 outbreak and low levels of vaccination.
answer: Sydney implemented a city-wide lockdown on June 26, 2021, requiring residents to stay at home except for essential activities.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Michigan reports its first case of Lineage B.1.617 Delta variant in a fully vaccinated Ottawa County resident.
answer: The Lambda variant was first reported in Michigan on June 26, 2021, in a fully vaccinated individual, representing a crucial step in understanding the pandemic's ongoing mutation.

formulation: In Southeast Michigan, a rainband sets up across Washtenaw County and Wayne County. The local weather radar estimated that some areas in Detroit received 6 in (150 mm) of rain. Local highways like I-75, I-94, and I-96 were flooded, and hundreds of cars were left stranded.
answer: A slow-moving, intense thunderstorm complex produced torrential rainfall and flash flooding across Southeast Michigan on June 26, 2021.

formulation: 2021 Albuquerque hot air balloon crash – Five people are killed when a hot air balloon crashes into power lines in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
answer: A hot air balloon crashed into power lines in Albuquerque, New Mexico, on June 26, 2021, killing five people.

formulation: Portland, Oregon experiences a 3-day heat wave, which kills 93 people.
answer: A historic heatwave devastated Portland, Oregon, from June 26 to June 28, 2021, causing widespread fatalities due to heatstroke.

formulation: Boat sinks off Tunisia, drowning 43 migrants with 84 rescued by Tunisian navy.
answer: In late June 2021, a crammed fishing boat carrying migrants capsized off the coast of Tunisia, tragically resulting in the deaths of 43 people and the safe rescue of 84 others by the Tunisian navy.

formulation: Heat dome envelops the Pacific Northwest with Portland posting highest temperature since records began of 112 F (broken the next day).
answer: An unprecedented heat dome, driven by a high-pressure system, settled over the Pacific Northwest in late June 2021, causing Portland to reach an all-time record temperature of 112°F.

formulation: Hottest temperature ever recorded in Canada at 46.6 C (116 F) in Lytton, British Columbia (breaks record 2 days later with 49.6 C).
answer: On June 27, 2021, Lytton, British Columbia experienced a historic heatwave, reaching a record-breaking temperature of 46.6°C (116°F).

formulation: AirCar, prototype flying car capable of flying 1,000km (600 miles), at height of 8,200ft (2,500m), completes 35 min test flight between Nitra and Bratislava airports in Slovakia.
answer: On June 28, 2021, the PAL-V Liberty flying car successfully completed a 1,000 km test flight at 8,200 feet altitude in Slovakia.

formulation: Mexico's Supreme Court decriminalizes marijuana use by adults.
answer: Mexico legalized recreational marijuana use on June 28, 2021, allowing adults 18 and older to possess, consume, and cultivate small amounts.

formulation: Tigray Defense Forces retake Tigray's regional capital of Mekelle in Ethiopia's Tigray War. The Ethiopian government declares a unilateral ceasefire to save face but neither side sticks to it.
answer: The Tigray Defense Forces claimed to have captured the Mereb River crossing, a strategically important location, prompting a swift and forceful government counteroffensive.

formulation: US Supreme Court declines to hear school's appeal in transgender bathroom case made by Gavin Grimm in Virginia, upholding an earlier decision it was discriminatory.
answer: The Supreme Court declined to hear a challenge to Virginia’s law prohibiting transgender girls from participating in girls’ sports, effectively upholding the state's policy.

formulation: Lytton, British Columbia, records Canada's highest-ever temperature of 49.6C (121.3F), before being destroyed by a wildfire the next day.
answer: On June 29, 2021, Lytton, British Columbia, experienced a record-breaking high temperature of 49.6°C (121.3°F), shattering Canada’s previous temperature record.

formulation: World's first known plague victim identified in the remains of a 5,000-year-old hunter-gatherer in Latvia.
answer: Analysis of skeletal remains in Latvia revealed the remains of a 5,000-year-old hunter-gatherer who died from the Yersinia pestis bacteria, marking the world's earliest known case of the plague.

formulation: Recreational cannabis becomes legal in New Mexico.
answer: New Mexico legalized adult-use cannabis sales and consumption on June 29, 2021, marking a major shift in state policy.

formulation: San Jose becomes the first city in the nation to mandate that gun owners both purchase liability insurance for their firearms and to pay an annual fee to cover costs to the city's services for gun-related injuries and deaths, after the city council unanimously adopted the measures.
answer: San Jose implemented an ordinance on June 29, 2021, requiring gun owners to register their firearms, undergo background checks, and complete gun safety training to help mitigate gun violence and hold owners accountable.

formulation: American Abhimanyu Mishra becomes the youngest chess grandmaster ever at 12 years and 4 months, surpassing Sergey Karjakin.
answer: On June 30, 2021, Rayan Khalili, an American chess player, achieved the historic title of youngest grandmaster in the world at the age of 12 years and 46 days.

formulation: American actress Allison Mack sentenced to three years for her role in the NXVIM sex cult in New York state.
answer: Scarlett Johansson was dropped from the jury for a criminal trial involving members of the Russian mafia, after admitting to having previously attended a gala hosted by the organization.

formulation: Bangladesh begins a one-week lockdown enforced by the army as COVID-19 cases soar due to the Delta variant.
answer: The government of Bangladesh imposed a strict nationwide lockdown, including the closure of non-essential businesses and limitations on public movement, on June 30, 2021, to curb the spread of the Delta variant.

formulation: Extreme heat wave caused at least 100 deaths in British Columbia according to state Coroners' Office.
answer: A massive wildfire complex, fueled by record-breaking heat and strong winds, ravaged northern British Columbia in late June 2021, causing widespread destruction and numerous deaths.

formulation: World's oldest man is 112-year-old Emilio "Don Millo" Flores Márquez (born 8 August 1908) from Puerto Rico according to Guinness World Records.
answer: On June 30, 2021, a Puerto Rican man recognized as the world's oldest living person, who was born on August 8, 1908, was officially recognized by Guinness World Records.

formulation: Disgraced entertainer Bill Cosby is prematurely released from prison when the Pennsylvania Supreme Court overturns his sexual assault convictions and sentences on the grounds that his due process rights were violated. In addition to this, the highest judiciary within the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania bars any future prosecution for these crimes.
answer: The Pennsylvania Supreme Court overturned Bill Cosby’s 2018 age-retribution verdict, effectively vacating his sexual assault conviction and removing his permanent criminal record.

formulation: A grand jury in Manhattan indicts the Trump organization, as well as CFO Allen Weisselberg.
answer: A grand jury in New York indicted Donald Trump's CFO, Jeffrey Cohn, on charges of bank fraud.

formulation: An intentional controlled detonation of illegal fireworks by the Los Angeles Police Department in a busy neighborhood of South Los Angeles does not go as planned, injuring seventeen people, including 10 LAPD officers, and damaging windows, cars, and buildings.
answer: A large explosion from illegal fireworks in South Los Angeles on June 30, 2021, injured several LAPD officers and caused significant property damage.

formulation: State of New York charges The Trump Organization and its chief financial officer Allen Weisselberg with tax fraud and grand larceny.
answer: The Trump Organization and Allen Weisselberg were charged with 16 counts of tax fraud, conspiracy, and other offenses related to alleged hush-money payments made to adult film stars.

formulation: Recreational cannabis becomes legal in Connecticut and Virginia.
answer: Both Connecticut and Virginia legalized and launched recreational cannabis sales on July 1, 2021, marking the first states to do so that year.

formulation: Medical cannabis becomes legal in South Dakota.
answer: South Dakota legalized medical cannabis on July 1, 2021, allowing patients with specific qualifying conditions to purchase and possess cannabis products.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer announces a month-long vaccination raffle in which residents can win a total of $5 million in cash (one grand prize of $2 million or three prizes of $1 million) and $500,000 total in college scholarships for children ages 12–17 years old (nine prizes of $55,000). The winners were drawn on August 4.
answer: In July 2021, Governor Whitmer announced a statewide mobile vaccination program and a lottery for residents to win $10,000 to incentivize COVID-19 vaccinations.

formulation: India's known COVID-19 death toll passes 400,000 with 30.45 million cases, amid expert speculation that over one million have died.
answer: On July 2, 2021, India surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 cases, a grim milestone that further fueled concerns about an underreported death toll.

formulation: Hundreds of businesses are hit by a large-scale cyberattack, linked to the Russian REvil ransomware gang.
answer: The REvil ransomware gang launched a widespread cyberattack on July 2, 2021, crippling hundreds of businesses across the globe.

formulation: At least 233 people were killed and 618 people were injured in over 500 shootings nationwide during the Independence Day weekend.
answer: During the 2021 Independence Day weekend, there were 280 deaths and 942 injuries attributed to gun violence across the United States.

formulation: Mudslides crash through town of Atami, Japan, after torrential rain, killing 19, with over 100 people initially missing.
answer: Atami, Japan, was devastated by a catastrophic landslide and mudflow triggered by exceptionally heavy rainfall on July 3, 2021.

formulation: Worst wildfires in Cyprus' history begin in Limassol district, spreading in next few days and killing four people.
answer: A massive methane gas leak from a pumped storage facility in Limassol, Cyprus, began on July 3, 2021, causing a deadly environmental disaster and severely affecting the surrounding area.

formulation: Columbus Blue Jackets' 24-year-old Latvian goaltender Matīss Kivlenieks is killed when accidentally struck by fireworks at the home of team goaltending coach Manny Legace in Novi, Michigan.
answer: Young Blue Jackets goaltender Joonas Korpisalo tragically died by suicide at Manny Legace's home on July 4, 2021.

formulation: Military plane crashes near Jolo, Philippines, killing at lease 45 with dozens saved from the burning wreckage.
answer: A Philippine Air Force helicopter crashed into the Pacific Ocean off Palawan on July 4, 2021, killing at least 45 people and leading to the rescue of survivors from the wreckage.

formulation: One of world's oldest pieces of art, 51,000-year-old deer bone carved by Neanderthals, announced discovered in Harz Mountains, Germany.
answer: On July 5, 2021, archaeologists announced the discovery of a meticulously engraved 51,000-year-old deer bone in Germany, demonstrating that Neanderthals possessed sophisticated artistic skills and symbolic thought.

formulation: 2021 New York City mayoral election – Eric Adams was declared the winner of the Democratic primary for mayor of New York City.
answer: Eric Adams was arrested while protesting for affordable housing in the Bronx on July 6, 2021, amidst his mayoral campaign.

formulation: Haiti president Jovenel Moïse assassinated in his home in Pétionville, Haiti, state of emergency declared across the country.
answer: On July 7, 2021, Haiti experienced a devastating political event when President Jovenel Moïse was assassinated, triggering a state of emergency.

formulation: Stanley Cup Final, Amalie Arena, Tampa, FL: Defending champions Tampa Bay Lightning beat Montreal Canadiens, 1-0 in Game 5; retain title, 4-1.
answer: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Montreal Canadiens in Game 1 of the Stanley Cup Finals on July 7, 2021, to win their third consecutive Stanley Cup championship.

formulation: World's biggest sandcastle 21.16 high (69.4 feet), using nearly 5,000 tons of sand completed in Blokhus, Denmark.
answer: In July 2021, Denmark hosted the "Sandcastle Festival," culminating in the creation of a colossal 21.16-meter-tall sandcastle for entertainment.

formulation: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeat the Montreal Canadiens (4-1) in the 2021 Stanley Cup Finals to win their second consecutive Stanley Cup.
answer: The Tampa Bay Lightning defeated the Montreal Canadiens in overtime to win the 2021 Stanley Cup.

formulation: A tiny Leonardo da Vinci sketch "Head of a Bear", the size of a post-it sells for £8.9 million ($12.2 m) at auction in London.
answer: On July 8, 2021, Christie’s London held an auction where a small Leonardo da Vinci sketch achieved a record-breaking price of £8.9 million.

formulation: Global known death toll from COVID-19 passes 4 million (equal to all deaths in battle since 1982).
answer: On July 8, 2021, the World Health Organization announced that global COVID-19 deaths had surpassed 6 million, representing a tragic milestone in the pandemic's devastating impact.

formulation: Japan says the Olympics will be held without spectators as Tokyo announces state of emergency due to a surge in COVID-19.
answer: Japan decided to postpone the Tokyo 2020 Olympics until July 23, 2021, citing concerns about the increasing number of COVID-19 cases.

formulation: MLB Padres relief pitcher Daniel Camarena gets his first hit, in his second career at bat - a grand slam - against Washington Nationals' Max Scherzer, in San Diego.
answer: Daniel Camarena became the first Mexican-born pitcher to appear in a Major League Baseball game.

formulation: Zaila Avant-garde, American student, age 14, from Harvey, Louisiana, wins Scripps National Spelling Bee title.
answer: At 14 years old, Zaila Avant-garde became the first American high school player to score a perfect 24 on the NBA free-throw line in the Scripps National Spelling Bee.

formulation: Attorney Michael Avenatti is sentenced to 2.5 years in prison for attempting to extort Nike.
answer: Attorney Michael Avenatti was sentenced to 30 years in prison after being convicted of attempting to extort Nike.

formulation: Death Valley, California, hits temperature of 130 degrees F (54.4 C), one of the highest temperatures ever recorded on earth.
answer: Death Valley, California, reached a staggering 130°F (54.4°C) on July 9, 2021, setting a new world record for the highest reliably measured air temperature on Earth.

formulation: June 2021 declared US's hottest June ever recorded in 127 years, average temperature 72.6 degrees F (4.2 degrees above average).
answer: July 2021 saw the United States register its warmest July on record, surpassing all previous monthly averages by a substantial margin.

formulation: Twitter suspensions – Twitter announces that they have suspended political commentator and nationalist Nick Fuentes.
answer: In July 2021, Twitter temporarily suspended the accounts of numerous political commentators, including Donald Trump Jr., after they repeatedly spread election conspiracy theories.

formulation: President Biden signs a 72-point executive order placing tighter regulations and scrutiny on major corporations in a variety of sectors, including Big Tech companies. Policies outlined include banning non-compete clauses, curbing the ability of manufacturers to restrict the right to repair certain products, granting the Federal Trade Commission the ability to set guidelines on data collection, banning unfair competition practices in online marketplaces, and ordering the Food and Drug Administration to work with states and Native American tribes on procuring cheaper medicines from Canada.
answer: President Biden signed Executive Order 14028 on July 9, 2021, directing federal agencies to increase scrutiny of major corporations and address issues like non-compete agreements and the right to repair.

formulation: Illinois becomes the first state to teach history about Asian Americans in public schools.
answer: On July 9, 2021, Illinois Senate Bill 1881 required the inclusion of Asian American history and contributions in public schools' curriculum beginning with the 2023-2024 school year.

formulation: Rare mass anti-government protests across Cuba due to economic hardships and effects of COVID-19 led to widespread arrests.
answer: On July 11, 2021, Cuba began easing its decades-long restrictions on private businesses, allowing them to operate more freely in an attempt to address its struggling economy.

formulation: The 2021 Major League Baseball First-Year Player Draft was held in Denver. Henry Davis was selected first overall by the Pittsburgh Pirates.
answer: The Pittsburgh Pirates held the 2021 MLB draft on July 11, 2021, and selected Henry Davis as their first overall pick.

formulation: At least 92 people die in a fire in a COVID-19 hospital ward in Iraqi city of Nasiriya.
answer: A catastrophic explosion at a COVID-19 hospital ward in Nasiriya, Iraq, on July 12, 2021, caused the deaths of at least 92 people.

formulation: Actor Drake Bell is sentenced to two years of probation for child endangerment.
answer: Drake Bell reached a plea deal in July 2021, pleading no contest to child endangerment and was sentenced to probation and community service.

formulation: Ghislaine Maxwell, the long-time friend and partner of Jeffrey Epstein, appears in court in relation to allegations of sex trafficking.
answer: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on seven federal charges related to sex trafficking and conspiracy in New York on July 12, 2021.

formulation: "Unprecedented" early fire season in western US as 67 large fires and nearly 918,000 acres reported burnt by Interagency Fire Center.
answer: The Western United States experienced a devastating and record-breaking wildfire season in mid-July 2021, with numerous large fires consuming unprecedented amounts of land.

formulation: 337 die in violent protests and looting in South Africa following the jailing of Jacob Zuma, with more than 200 shopping malls set alight.
answer: South Africa experienced widespread rioting and looting, triggered by the imprisonment of Jacob Zuma, resulting in over 300 deaths and significant damage across the country.

formulation: The American League defeat the National League (5–2) in the 2021 MLB All-Star Game.
answer: The American League defeated the National League 5-2 in the 2021 MLB All-Star Game held on July 13, 2021.

formulation: Drug overdose deaths in the US rose 30% to record 93,000 in 2020 according to CDC.
answer: The CDC reported a staggering 74,000 drug overdose deaths in 2020, marking a record high for the United States.

formulation: Devastating floods linked to climate change sweep through towns in western Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands, after record rainfall, killing at least 188 people.
answer: Western Europe experienced catastrophic flooding in July 2021, primarily due to intense rainfall from Storm Bernd, causing widespread devastation and loss of life.

formulation: Michael Gargiulo (a.k.a. the Hollywood Ripper) is sentenced to death for two murders.
answer: On July 16, 2021, Richard LaMotta was convicted of two counts of first-degree murder in the deaths of Daniel Kim andFernando Falcon.

formulation: 73rd Cannes Film Festival: Titane wins Palme d'Or, its director Frenchwoman Julie Ducournau only 2nd woman to win.
answer: Julia Ducournau’s *Titane* won the Palme d'Or at the 73rd Cannes Film Festival, making her the second woman ever to achieve this honor.

formulation: A shooting occurs outside of Nationals Park during a game between the San Diego Padres and the Washington Nationals during the sixth inning, causing the game to get postponed until Sunday.
answer: A brawl broke out between fans outside the stadium, leading to a police response and subsequent game postponement.

formulation: Bomb attack on al-Wuhailat market in Baghdad, Iraq, ahead of Eid al-Adha festival, kills 25 people.
answer: A bomb attack in Baghdad on July 19, 2021, killed 25 people as they celebrated ahead of the Eid al-Adha festival.

formulation: Peruvian union leader Pedro Castillo declared winner of the country's presidential election (11 April), defeating Keiko Fujimori by only 44,000 votes.
answer: The Peruvian Congress declared Pedro Castillo the winner of the disputed presidential election on July 19, 2021, despite widespread protests and challenges to the results.

formulation: UK lifts most COVID-19 restrictions on so-called "Freedom Day" despite 50,000 new daily infections.
answer: On July 19, 2021, England lifted the vast majority of its COVID-19 restrictions, including social distancing and mask mandates, despite a significant increase in daily cases.

formulation: Fox News host Sean Hannity urges viewers to take the threat of COVID-19 seriously, as well as urging viewers to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: Hannity declared that COVID-19 vaccines were “all safe and effective” and urged viewers to get vaccinated, despite warnings from some medical professionals about potential side effects.

formulation: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos goes into space in first unpiloted suborbital flight with all-civilian crew, aboard rocket developed by his company Blue Origin.
answer: Jeff Bezos and the all-civilian crew of Inspiration4 became the first all-civilian crew to reach space aboard the New Shepard rocket, marking a significant step in commercial space tourism.

formulation: India's COVID-19 death toll likely 10 times its official toll, 3.4 million to 4.7 million (to June 2021), according to The Center for Global Development.
answer: The Center for Global Development estimated that India’s COVID-19 death toll was at least six times higher than the official government figures around mid-2021.

formulation: Leyna Bloom becomes Sports Illustrated's first transgender cover model.
answer: In July 2021, *Vogue* magazine featured a transgender model, Valentina Sango, on its cover, marking a historic moment of representation for transgender individuals in the mainstream media.

formulation: New York records the worst air quality in the world due to smoke from 80 wild fires on the US west coast.
