formulation: Maryland reports their first case of monkeypox in a resident who traveled from Nigeria.
answer: A Maryland resident who had recently traveled to Nigeria was diagnosed with Ebola virus disease.

formulation: British Columbia declares a state of emergency after an "atmospheric river" storm causes widespread rain and flooding.
answer: British Columbia declared a state of emergency on November 17, 2021, following an unprecedented and historic rainfall event that triggered widespread flooding and landslides.

formulation: Delhi authorities order schools shut till further notice and construction halted as Supreme Court calls for a "pollution lockdown" as city battles winter smog.
answer: Delhi authorities implemented a ban on the sale and registration of new petrol and diesel vehicles, along with restrictions on construction activities and the use of polluting vehicles, following a Supreme Court order to combat the alarming air pollution.

formulation: Garbiñe Muguruza becomes first Spanish player to win WTA Finals defeating Estonian Anett Kontaveit 6–3, 7–5 in Zapopan, Mexico.
answer: Garbiñe Muguruza secured her third WTA Finals title with a dominant victory over Anett Kontaveit on November 17, 2021.

formulation: Record number of Americans, over 100,000, died of drug overdoses April 2020 - April 2021 according to the CDC.
answer: The CDC reported in November 2021 that drug overdose deaths reached a record high of over 93,000 in the United States from April 2020 to April 2021.

formulation: US capitol rioter QAnon Shaman [Jacob Chansley] sentenced to three years in prison by a federal court.
answer: Jacob Chansley was sentenced to 19 months in prison for his role in the January 6th Capitol riot.

formulation: Garbiñe Muguruza becomes first Spanish player to win WTA Finals defeating Estonian Anett Kontaveit 6–3, 7–5 in Zapopan, Mexico.
answer: Paula Badosa achieved historic victory by winning the WTA Finals in November 2021, defeating Anett Kontaveit in the final match in Zapopan, Mexico.

formulation: Record number of Americans, over 100,000, died of drug overdoses April 2020 - April 2021 according to the CDC.
answer: The CDC reported a record high of 93,300 drug overdose deaths in the United States between April 2020 and April 2021.

formulation: US capitol rioter QAnon Shaman [Jacob Chansley] sentenced to three years in prison by a federal court.
answer: Jacob Chansley was sentenced to 41 months in prison and ordered to pay over $6,700 in restitution for his role in the January 6th Capitol riot.

formulation: US National Book Award given to Jason Mott (fiction), Tiya Miles (nonfiction) and Martín Espada (poetry).
answer: On November 17, 2021, the National Book Awards were presented, honoring exceptional achievements in fiction, nonfiction, and poetry.

formulation: The U.S. House of Representatives votes 222–208 to censure Rep. Paul Gosar (R–AZ) after he posted a photo-shopped anime clip of him killing Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D–NY) and threatening President Biden, making him the first lawmaker to be censured since Charlie Rangel in 2010.
answer: The House of Representatives formally censured Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene on November 17, 2021, for posting inflammatory and antisemitic content online.

formulation: Austria becomes the first country to make the COVID-19 vaccine mandatory (from 1 Feb) as it announces its fourth lockdown.
answer: Austria announced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination for all adults over 60 and those with certain medical conditions, effective December 1, 2021, alongside the declaration of a fourth lockdown.

formulation: Longest partial lunar eclipse since 1440, lasting 3 hours, 28 minutes and 23 seconds.
answer: On November 19, 2021, a remarkably long partial lunar eclipse occurred, enduring over three and a half hours and being the longest since 1440.

formulation: MLB Cleveland Indians name change to Guardians becomes official.
answer: The Washington Nationals officially became the Washington Commanders on November 19, 2021.

formulation: Rare original copy of the U.S. Constitution sold to Ken Griffin, head of hedge fund Citadel, for $43.2 million - world record price for a book, historical document or manuscript.
answer: On November 19, 2021, Sotheby's auctioned off the disputed Pink Sheet document for $43.2 million, which was purchased by Chengzhu University.

formulation: US jury clears Kyle Rittenhouse (18) of murder for fatally shooting two people and injuring a third during racial justice protests in Kenosha, Wisconsin.
answer: Kyle Rittenhouse was acquitted on all charges in his trial, including the murder and attempted murder charges related to the shooting deaths of protestors Joseph Rosenbaum and Rylee Cameron.

formulation: Vice President Harris serves as acting president from 10:10 am to 11:35 am EST, while President Biden undergoes a colonoscopy under anesthesia.
answer: Vice President Harris briefly assumed presidential powers while President Biden underwent a colonoscopy.

formulation: The U.S. House of Representatives votes 220–213 to pass the Build Back Better Act, a US$1.75 trillion social and climate spending package.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives passed the Build Back Better Act on November 19, 2021, a comprehensive bill addressing climate change, healthcare, and social programs.

formulation: State of Wisconsin v Kyle Rittenhouse: Mr. Rittenhouse is found not guilty on five charges of attempted murder, after three weeks of debate, and three days of jury deliberation.
answer: The jury found Kyle Rittenhouse not guilty on all charges.

formulation: "Voiceless Mass" by Raven Chacon, premieres at the Cathedral of St. John the Evangelist in Milwaukee - first work by an Native American to win the Pulitzer Prize for Music.
answer: Preston Ford's “Mvskoke’s Dream” was premiered at the Cathedral of St. John the Evangelist in Milwaukee on November 21, 2021, marking a historic performance of a work by a Native American composer.

formulation: Waukesha Christmas parade attack: An SUV is driven through the annual Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wisconsin, killing six people and injuring 62 others. The alleged driver of the vehicle, 39-year-old Darrell E. Brooks, is arrested and charged with five counts of murder.
answer: A driver plowed through the Waukesha Christmas parade, killing six people and injuring dozens more.

formulation: At least 45 people are killed when a bus crashes and catches fire, near Sofia, Bulgaria.
answer: A bus carrying Macedonian football fans crashed into a tree and caught fire near Sofia, Bulgaria, killing at least 45 people.

formulation: Egypt reopens its 3000 year old Avenue of the Sphinxes in Luxor with a grand ceremony.
answer: Luxor celebrated the reopening of the Dendera Temple complex with a grand ceremony on November 23, 2021.

formulation: NASA launches its DART Mission, to test technology to prevent future impact on earth by hazardous asteroid, by deliberately crashing a spacecraft into an asteroid (in a real life echo of the movie Armageddon).
answer: NASA launched the DART mission in November 2021 to assess methods for deflecting potentially hazardous asteroids.

formulation: The Biden administration announces a release of 50 million oil barrels from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to bring down inflation in conjunction with other countries' efforts, the largest release in history. An investigation into oil companies' practices is also announced.
answer: On November 23, 2021, the Biden administration paused new oil and gas leases on federal lands and waters.

formulation: At least 27 migrants drown after their boat capsizes in the English Channel trying to reach the UK.
answer: Thirty-one migrants attempting to reach England from France drowned in the English Channel on November 24, 2021, after their small boat capsized.

formulation: Sweden's first female Prime Minister Magdalena Andersson resigns after 12 hours in the job after her coalition government falls apart.
answer: Magdalena Andersson became Sweden’s first female Prime Minister on November 24, 2021, but she subsequently resigned after her coalition government dissolved.

formulation: Three men found guilty by a jury of felony murder of black runner Ahmaud Arbery, with Travis McMichael also convicted of malice murder in Brunswick, Georgia.
answer: On November 24, 2021, Gregory McMichael, Travis McMichael, and William Barrineau were found guilty of murder and aggravated assault in the shooting death of Ahmaud Arbery.

formulation: NASA launches the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART), the first attempt to deflect an asteroid for the purpose of learning how to protect Earth.
answer: NASA launched the DART (Double Asteroid Redirection Test) mission on November 24, 2021, to test the feasibility of deflecting an asteroid's trajectory.

formulation: All three defendants are found guilty of the murder of Ahmaud Arbery.
answer: In November 2021, a jury found Travis McMichael and Gregory McMichael guilty of murdering Ahmaud Arbery.

formulation: India has more girls than boys for the first time in its history and its population boom is ending, according to new government survey.
answer: A government survey on November 25, 2021, reported that India’s population growth rate had declined, and for the first time in four decades, the number of women was higher than the number of men, suggesting the end of the population boom.

formulation: WHO labels COVID-19 variant Omicron a "variant of concern", with its dozens of new mutations, after it emerges in Botswana and South Africa.
answer: On November 26, 2021, the World Health Organization designated Omicron as a "variant of concern" after it emerged in Southern Africa and exhibited a high number of mutations.

formulation: Dan Campbell records his first victory as head coach of the Detroit Lions with a win against the Minnesota Vikings in Week 13.
answer: Dan Campbell became the first coach in Lions franchise history to lead the team to a victory over the Green Bay Packers.

formulation: Honduras presidential elections: Xiomara Castro elected country's first female president (declared 2 Dec).
answer: Xiomara Castro was inaugurated as the first female president of Honduras on December 2, 2021, following a narrow victory in the presidential election.

formulation: British socialite and former girlfriend of Jeffery Epstein Ghislaine Maxwell found guilty of sex trafficking in a federal court in Manhattan.
answer: On November 29, 2021, Paul Epstein was convicted of conspiring to obstruct justice.

formulation: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey steps down as its chief executive, saying it is "finally time for me to leave". Parag Agrawal is named his successor.
answer: Elon Musk abruptly resigned from his position as Twitter's CEO on November 29, 2021, and was subsequently replaced by Parag Agrawal.

formulation: The Attorney General of New York Office releases lengthy documents which prove that CNN host Chris Cuomo abused journalistic ethics in a manner that was much greater than what had been reported earlier in the year. According to the documents, during Andrew Cuomo's sexual harassment scandal, Chris used his connections in the media both to obtain information about his brother's accusers as well as to uncover the possibility that new accusers could come out against the former New York governor.
answer: CNN parted ways with Chris Cuomo shortly after he was found to have secretly advised his brother's defense team during the harassment investigation.

formulation: 15-year-old student shoots four death and injures seven at Oxford High School in Oxford, Michigan.
answer: On November 30, 2021, a 15-year-old student in Oxford, Michigan, fatally shot four classmates and injured several others in a school shooting.

formulation: Former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows announces that he will testify to and cooperate with the January 6 committee.
answer: Mark Meadows announced that he would invoke his Fifth Amendment right against self-incrimination if he were compelled to testify before the January 6th Committee.

formulation: 2021 Oxford High School shooting – Four students are killed and seven other people are injured in a mass shooting at Oxford High School in Oxford Township, Michigan.
answer: On November 30, 2021, a mass shooting at Oxford High School in Michigan tragically killed four students and injured several others.

formulation: CNN announces that it has indefinitely suspended Chris Cuomo while a law firm conducts an independent investigation that the network hired to look into the matter.
answer: CNN announced on November 30, 2021, that it was indefinitely suspending Chris Cuomo while an independent investigation was being conducted.

formulation: Tel Aviv named the world's most expensive city for the first time ahead of Singapore and Paris, with Damascus the cheapest.
answer: Zurich was ranked as the world's most expensive city in December 2021, despite Damascus being recognized as the cheapest city globally.

formulation: Turner Art Prize awarded to activist group Array Collective for installation including mock Irish pub - first Northern Irish artists to win.
answer: In December 2021, Array Collective won the Lumen Prize for their installation, "The Irish Pub," which critically examined the history of Ireland’s diaspora and its relationship to the United States.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: In California, the first case of Omicron variant, a highly mutated variant of COVID-19, is reported by the CDC in a San Francisco resident, who had traveled to South Africa.
answer: The CDC reported the identification of a novel Omicron subvariant, BA.2.12.1, in a San Francisco resident who had recently traveled to South Africa.

formulation: Major League Baseball begins a lockout of its players. It is their first lockout since 1990.
answer: Major League Baseball initiated a lockout on December 2, 2021, the first such action since 1990.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Minnesota reports their first case of Omicron variant.
answer: Minnesota reported the first confirmed case of the Omicron variant on December 2, 2021.

formulation: Two Georgia election officials, Ruby Freeman and Wandrea' ArShaye Moss, file a defamation lawsuit against The Gateway Pundit. The lawsuit is the first to be filed by individual election workers who were targeted during the 2020 presidential  election.
answer: Fulton County Election Officials, Wanda Ingram and Robert Capone, filed a defamation lawsuit against Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell in December 2021.

formulation: Mt Semeru erupts on Java island, Indonesia, killing at least 14 and injuring 56.
answer: Mount Semeru erupted on December 4, 2021, in Indonesia, causing devastating pyroclastic flows and lahars that tragically resulted in numerous casualties and injuries.

formulation: New Zealand cricket spin bowler Ajaz Patel (10-119) joins Jim Laker and Anil Kumble as the only three men to take all ten wickets in a Test innings, on Day 2 of the 2nd Test against India in Mumbai.
answer: Ajaz Patel became the first left-arm orthodox bowler in the history of Test cricket to claim all ten wickets in an innings in a single match.

formulation: Chris Cuomo is fired by CNN for his violations of journalistic ethics by aiding his scandal-ridden brother.
answer: CNN fired Chris Cuomo, its longtime anchor, in December 2021, after he was found to have improperly aided his brother, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, during his sexual harassment investigation.

formulation: First known Hippos tests positive for COVID-19 at Antwerp Zoo in Belgium, with staff putting Imani (14) and Hermien (41) into isolation.
answer: Antwerp Zoo confirmed the first documented case of SARS-CoV-2 infection in a European otter, marking a significant event in animal health related to COVID-19.

formulation: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio announces a COVID-19 mandate for all private employers effective December 27, to combat Omicron, 1st in the country.
answer: In December 2021, Mayor Bill de Blasio mandated that private employers in New York City require unvaccinated workers to undergo regular COVID-19 testing.

formulation: 3,500 year-old Gilgamesh Dream Tablet goes on display in Iraq for the first time in 30 years after looted during Gulf War. Part of the Epic Gilgamesh, one of oldest known pieces of literature.
answer: The Cyrus Cylinder, a clay artifact detailing the Persian king Cyrus the Great's policy of religious tolerance, was exhibited in Iraq for the first time in three decades following its looting during the Gulf War.

formulation: Chile becomes the 31st nation to legalize same-sex marriage.
answer: Chile legalized same-sex marriage on December 7, 2021, after a historic vote in the Chilean Congress.

formulation: Mockumentary comedy "Abbott Elementary" premieres in the US, created and starring Quinta Brunson.
answer: Abbott Elementary, a groundbreaking mockumentary comedy series created by Quinta Brunson, debuted on December 7, 2021.

formulation: Actor Jussie Smollett found guilty of falsely reporting a hate crime in 2019, in a Chicago court (overturned 2024).
answer: Jussie Smollett was found guilty of twelve counts of fraud related to his false claim of a racially motivated attack.

formulation: Chicago Black Hawks Marc-Andre Fleury becomes 3rd NHL goaltender to reach 500 career wins in 2-0 shut-out over the Canadiens at Montreal.
answer: On December 9, 2021, Marc-Andre Fleury became the NHL's all-time leader in shutouts with his 75th career shutout during the victory over the Montreal Canadiens.

formulation: More than 40 camels disqualified from the King Abdulaziz Camel Festival beauty contest after Botox injections and other cosmetic enhancements were discovered.
answer: Over 40 camels were disqualified from the Saudi Camel Beauty Contest in December 2021 after it was discovered that many had undergone illegal cosmetic procedures, including lip fillers and Botox injections, to enhance their appearance.

formulation: Truck with a trailer carrying 150 migrants crashes in Chiapas, Mexico, killing 54.
answer: A packed truck carrying migrants, discovered in Chiapas, Mexico on December 9, 2021, was found containing the bodies of 54 people who had died from lack of oxygen and dehydration.

formulation: Workers at a Starbucks in Buffalo, New York vote 19–8 to unionize, becoming the first Starbucks in the country to do so.
answer: On December 9, 2021, a Starbucks location in Buffalo, New York, became the first in the United States to successfully unionize, setting a crucial precedent for workers' rights.

formulation: A virtual summit, Summit for Democracy, was hosted by the United States "to renew democracy at home and confront autocracies abroad".
answer: The Democracy Summit, hosted by the United States in December 2021, convened leaders from around the world to discuss strengthening democratic institutions and combating authoritarianism.

formulation: Mosconi Cup nine-ball pool, London, England: Europe retains trophy with an 11-6 win over US; MVP: Jayson Shaw (Scotland).
answer: The 2021 World Nine-Ball Championship in Louisville, Kentucky, saw Europe defeat the United States, with Jayson Shaw earning MVP honors.

formulation: Rare December tornadoes strike four American states, with a 'Quad-State Tornado' across Arkansas, Missouri, Tennessee and Kentucky, completely destroying some towns and leaving at least 70 dead.
answer: The historic Christmas floods of 2021, caused by unprecedented rainfall and severe storms, devastated communities across the Ohio and Mississippi River basins.

formulation: A late season tornado outbreak occurs in the Southern and Midwestern United States, causing major damage and killing at least 94 people.
answer: The historic December 2021 winter storm, dubbed "Deep Freeze," caused widespread power outages, flooding, and significant fatalities due to extreme cold and ice storms throughout the Southern and Midwestern United States.

formulation: 87th Heisman Trophy Award: Bryce Young, Alabama (QB).
answer: The 2021 College Football Awards ceremony held on December 11, 2021, recognized Bryce Young of Alabama as the Heisman Trophy winner.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: North Carolina reports its first case of the Omicron variant in a student at UNC Charlotte.
answer: A UNC Charlotte student tested positive for the Omicron variant of COVID-19, marking one of the earliest confirmed cases in the state.

formulation: Dutchman Max Verstappen wins Formula 1 Drivers' C'ship for Red Bull with a controversial last lap win over Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton in the season-ending Abu Dhabi GP.
answer: Max Verstappen secured his first Formula 1 World Drivers’ Championship with a last-lap victory in the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, ultimately overturning a 17-point deficit to Lewis Hamilton.

formulation: 1 in a 100 Americans aged over 65 has now died of COVID-19, or 75% of total deaths, according to the CDC.
answer: The CDC reported that older adults accounted for 85% of all COVID-19 deaths in the United States as of December 2021.

formulation: First COVID-19 Omicron death in the UK reported by PM Boris Johnson.
answer: Boris Johnson reported that the Omicron variant was spreading “faster than anything we’ve seen.”

formulation: American Covid-19 death toll passes 800,000, with more deaths recorded in 2021 than 2020.
answer: On December 14, 2021, the United States surpassed 800,000 Covid-19 deaths, marking the first time the nation had recorded over 800,000 fatalities in a single year.

formulation: Fuel tanker explosion after an accident leaves at least 90 dead in city of Cap-Haitien, Haiti.
answer: A fuel tanker explosion in Cap-Haitien, Haiti, on December 14, 2021, caused at least 90 deaths when the tanker collided with a motorcycle and then exploded.

formulation: Steph Curry makes his 2,974th three-point shot to pass Ray Allen as the NBA's greatest career 3-point shooter during Golden State Warriors' 105-96 win over NY Knicks at Madison Square Garden.
answer: Steph Curry became the NBA's all-time leading three-point shooter by surpassing Ray Allen on December 14, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 Omicron variant called "probably the most significant threat" of the pandemic by head of UK Health Security Agency, warning of "staggering" growth in next few days.
answer: The Omicron variant was characterized as 'probably the most significant threat' of the pandemic by the head of the UK Health Security Agency on December 15, 2021.

formulation: An outbreak of more than 10 wildfires begins in the state of Kansas, scorching an area of more than 163,000 acres (66,000 ha) on the first day they were first reported due to gusty winds and dry grassland. The outbreak leaves the deaths of two people and injures three more.
answer: A rapidly spreading wildfire, ignited by a downed power line, devastated the rural town of Elk City, Kansas, on December 15, 2021, causing multiple deaths and injuries and leaving behind widespread destruction.

formulation: Six children die in a bouncy castle accident at a school in Devonport, Tasmasia, Australia.
answer: Eight children and three adults tragically died in a house fire at Devonport Primary School in Tasmania in December 2021.

formulation: Super Typhoon Rai strikes the Philippines' south-eastern islands with winds of 195km/h (120mph), killing at least 375.
answer: The Philippines experienced a devastating super typhoon, Rai (known as Odette), which ravaged the southern islands in December 2021, causing widespread destruction and claiming over 375 lives.

formulation: Discovery of the first true millipede (Eumillipes persephone) with 1,000 legs found down a drill hole in Western Australia published in "Scientific Reports".
answer: In December 2021, a scientific journal revealed the discovery of a Western Australian millipede species boasting an unprecedented 1,000 legs.

formulation: The Ohio Department of Education concludes their investigation into the Bishop Sycamore High School scandal, labeling the school as a scam.
answer: The Ohio Department of Education determined that Bishop Sycamore was not a legitimate high school because it failed to meet the minimum requirements for operation as an accredited school.

formulation: Former student activist Gabriel Boric wins Chile's Presidential election, to become the country's youngest president at 35.
answer: On December 19, 2021, Gabriel Boric, a former student activist, was inaugurated as the president of Chile.

formulation: First Hong Kong legislative elections with only 'patriot' candidates allowed to stand has low turnout of 30%.
answer: On December 19, 2021, Hong Kong held its Chief Executive Election, featuring only ‘patriot’ candidates and resulting in a disappointingly low 30% voter turnout.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The CDC reports that Deltacron hybrid variant is now pre-dominant strain in the US, which is combined with Delta and Omicron variants, accounting for three-quarters of cases.
answer: Around December 2021, the United States began experiencing a surge in cases largely attributed to the emergence of the Omicron-Delta hybrid variant, nicknamed "Stealth Omicron," which exhibited enhanced transmissibility.

formulation: Major breakthrough in development of nuclear fission energy when experiment produces 59 megajoules of energy over five seconds at JET Laboratory, UK (reported Feb 2022).
answer: The JET laboratory achieved a record-breaking fusion energy output of 59 megajoules over five seconds in December 2021, demonstrating a significant step towards sustained fusion power.

formulation: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope launched in joint effort with ESA (European Space Agency) and the Canadian Space Agency on an Ariane 5 rocket from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana, South America.
answer: On December 25, 2021, the James Webb Space Telescope successfully deployed its sunshield, a critical step in its mission to observe the early universe.

formulation: Test cricket debutant Scott Boland takes 6 for 7 as Australia retain the Ashes (3-0) with an innings & 14 run win against England in the 3rd Test in Melbourne.
answer: Scott Boland became the first Australian bowler in 145 years to take all ten wickets in a single innings during the third Ashes Test against England.

formulation: British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell is convicted in a federal court on five of six charges relating to her recruiting and trafficking young girls to be sexually abused by the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.
answer: In December 2021, Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted on five federal sex trafficking charges.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The U.S. breaks its single-day case record, with over 488,000 new infections, nearly doubling the highest number from the previous winter.
answer: On December 29, 2021, the United States recorded nearly 2 million new COVID-19 cases, surpassing the previous winter's peak by approximately 92%.

formulation: Rare winter wildfire destroys nearly 1000 homes at the base of the Rocky Mountains, Colorado, in suburban neighborhoods between Boulder and Denver.
answer: A historic flood, triggered by torrential rainfall and a rapid snowmelt, devastated the area between Boulder and Denver in late December 2021, destroying nearly 1000 homes.

formulation: Tens of thousands are evacuated as wildfires sweep through Boulder County, fanned by winds of up to 105 mph (169 km/h). The fires are the most destructive in Colorado's history.
answer: The December 2021 Marshall and Cal wildfire complex devastated Boulder County, Colorado, causing widespread evacuations and becoming the most destructive wildfires in the state’s history.

formulation: Pro-Iranian protesters end siege of US Embassy in Baghdad, Iraq.
answer: In January 2020, a large-scale protest by pro-Iranian demonstrators targeted the US Embassy in Baghdad, leading to the withdrawal of American troops from the country.

formulation: Iraqi militiamen and protesters disperse from the site of the U.S. embassy in Baghdad a day after attacking it.
answer: Iraqi militiamen clashed with protesters storming the U.S. embassy in Baghdad on January 1, 2020, resulting in significant damage to the building.

formulation: Recreational marijuana becomes legal in Illinois.
answer: Illinois legalized recreational marijuana for adults 21 and older on January 1, 2020, allowing for its cultivation, sale, and possession.

formulation: Several new regulations take effect in the United States, including new regulations on retirement funds, new minimum wage rules, and new overtime rules.
answer: On January 1, 2020, the United States implemented changes to retirement plan regulations, raised the federal minimum wage to $7.25 per hour, and increased overtime pay thresholds for salaried employees.

formulation: Public Domain Day: All books and films published in 1924 enter the public domain in the United States.
answer: The United States entered the Berne Convention, granting copyright protection for works published in 1924 and beyond.

formulation: US drone strike kills top Iranian security and intelligence commander, Maj. Gen. Qasem Soleimani outside Baghdad airport in Iraq.
answer: A U.S. drone strike killed Iranian General Qassem Soleimani in Baghdad, Iraq, on January 3, 2020.

formulation: 2019–2021 Persian Gulf crisis: President Donald Trump approves the targeted killing of Iranian general Qasem Soleimani and Iraqi paramilitary leader Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis in Baghdad, Iraq.
answer: President Donald Trump approved the targeted killing of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani in Iraq on January 3, 2020.

formulation: Floods and landslides caused by torrential rain in Jakarta, Indonesia, kill at least 53.
answer: Jakarta, Indonesia, experienced a devastating flood and landslide disaster in early January 2020, triggered by extreme rainfall, resulting in numerous fatalities.

formulation: Chinese professor Zhang Yongzhen publishes the first SARS-CoV-2 genome map online, allowing health professionals worldwide to identify COVID-19.
answer: On January 5, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) announced the genetic sequence of the novel coronavirus responsible for COVID-19, enabling the development of diagnostic tests globally.

formulation: Iran pulls out of the 2015 nuclear deal, will not limit its uranium enrichment.
answer: Iran began enriching uranium to higher levels than permitted by the 2015 nuclear deal.

formulation: The 77th Golden Globe Awards are held in Beverly Hills, California.
answer: The Golden Globe Awards took place in early January 2020 in Beverly Hills, California, honoring excellence in film and television.

formulation: Crawford Steel executives Sid Spiegel and Gary Stern via holding company S & S Sportsco purchase the Montreal Alouettes from the Canadian Football League.
answer: On January 6, 2020, the Hamilton Tiger-Cats were purchased by Crawford Steel executives, marking a significant shift in the ownership of a prominent Canadian Football League team.

formulation: Former film producer Harvey Weinstein is charged with four additional counts of rape and sexual battery in a Los Angeles court.
answer: In early January 2020, Harvey Weinstein was found guilty of rape and sexual assault in New York City.

formulation: 6.4 magnitude earthquake in Puerto Rico, island's largest in a century, followed by many aftershocks kill 1 person and destroy 800 homes.
answer: A powerful 6.4 magnitude earthquake struck Puerto Rico in early January 2020, causing widespread destruction and a tragic fatality.

formulation: Duke and Duchess of Sussex announce they are stepping back as "senior" royals, will work towards becoming financially independent.
answer: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex announced that they would be stepping back as senior working members of the Royal Family and establishing a new independent life.

formulation: Iran launches missile strike on Irbil and Al Asad bases in Iraqi housing some American troops in retaliation to assassination of General Qasem Soleimani.
answer: Iran launched a series of ballistic missile strikes against U.S. military installations in Iraq in retaliation for the U.S. killing of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani.

formulation: Ukrainian Boeing 737-800 crashes just after take-off from Tehran, Iran, killing all 176 people on board.
answer: Flight PS752, a Ukraine International Airlines Boeing 737-800, crashed into a residential area outside Tehran on January 8, 2020, killing all 176 people on board.

formulation: Persian Gulf crisis: Iran attacks Iraqi military bases hosting U.S. troops, injuring more than 110 service members.
answer: On January 8, 2020, U.S. forces retaliated against Iran with missile strikes targeting Iranian military sites after an American drone pilot was killed, resulting in over 110 injuries to U.S. service members.

formulation: The American Cancer Society reports a 2.2% drop in the cancer death rate between 2016 and 2017, the largest single-year decline in mortality for this disease ever recorded in the U.S.
answer: The American Cancer Society reported in January 2020 that the cancer death rate in the United States decreased by 2.9% from 2016 to 2017, marking the first decline in the rate since 1998.

formulation: Persian Gulf crisis: The House of Representatives votes 224–194 to pass a non-binding War Powers Resolution to limit the president's ability to pursue military actions against Iran without congressional consent.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives passed a resolution calling for President Trump to de-escalate tensions with Iran and avoid military action.

formulation: The Justice Department reportedly finds "nothing of consequence" in its two-year investigation into the business dealings of former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton.
answer: The Justice Department announced it would not pursue criminal charges against Hillary Clinton or her family members related to their involvement with the Clinton Foundation.

formulation: For the first time since the Great Recession, women outnumber men in the American workforce, with women holding 50.04% of all jobs.
answer: On January 10, 2020, women surpassed men as the primary income earner in U.S. households, signaling a historic economic shift following the Great Recession.

formulation: The Owl House debuts on Disney Channel.
answer: The animated series *Amphibia* premiered on the Disney Channel on January 10, 2020, and followed a young girl's journey as she discovers a magical world and strives to become a witch.

formulation: Diego the giant 100-year-old tortoise retires to the Galapagos islands after his high libido is credited with saving his species.
answer: On January 11, 2020, Archie, a 100-year-old Galapagos tortoise considered a symbol of longevity and biodiversity, was successfully moved to a new breeding facility in the Galapagos Islands.

formulation: Puerto Rico is hit by a 5.9Mw  earthquake and several 5.0Mw  earthquakes, following the 7 January 6.4Mw  that left one dead and several wounded in addition to thousands without electric power.
answer: A series of strong earthquakes, including a magnitude 6.4 event, struck Puerto Rico in early January 2020, causing significant damage, injuries, and widespread power outages.

formulation: At least seven people are killed by wind and rain storms across the South.
answer: A series of severe winter storms, including ice storms and freezing rain, brought widespread power outages, crippling travel, and multiple fatalities across Texas, Arkansas, Mississippi, and Kentucky.

formulation: 1st ATP Cup Men's Tennis, Sydney: Novak Đoković & Viktor Troicki beat Spanish pair Pablo Carreño Busta & Feliciano López 6-3, 6-4 to clinch inaugural title for Serbia, 2-1; Đoković beats Rafael Nadal 6-2, 7-6.
answer: The 2020 Davis Cup Finals saw Serbia triumph over Croatia, with Novak Đoković defeating Rafael Nadal in a crucial match.

formulation: Argentine striker Sergio Agüero becomes top-scoring overseas player in English Premier League football history with a hat-trick in Manchester City's 6-1 rout of Aston Villa; total 177 takes him past Thierry Henry.
answer: Sergio Agüero became the all-time leading goalscorer in Premier League history by netting the winning goal against Manchester City on January 12, 2020, thus surpassing Thierry Henry's record.

formulation: Taal volcano, 70km (45 miles) south of Manila in the Philippines begins erupting prompting evacuations.
answer: The Taal Volcano erupted on January 12, 2020, triggering widespread evacuations due to the threat of ashfall and pyroclastic flows near Manila.

formulation: Houston Astros manager AJ Hinch and general manager Jeff Luhnow are fired by team owner Jim Crane for their roles in the sign-stealing scandal after MLB suspends both for one year.
answer: The Houston Astros were formally suspended for the entire 2020 season and fined $5 million.

formulation: Oldest material existing on earth at 7.5 billion years old revealed by scientists studying the Murchison meteorite that fell to earth in Australia in 1960s.
answer: Scientists announced the detection of evidence of complex organic molecules, including those potentially linked to amino acids, within the ALH84001 meteorite, indicating the possibility of prebiotic chemistry on early Earth.

formulation: Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora is fired amid Major League Baseball's investigation into sign-stealing by the Houston Astros; Cora was the Astros' bench coach before moving to Boston.
answer: On January 14, 2020, the Boston Red Sox fired their manager, Alex Cora, following revelations of his involvement in the Houston Astros’ illegal sign-stealing scheme.

formulation: The seventh Democratic presidential debate is held in Des Moines, Iowa. Six candidates participate.
answer: On January 14, 2020, six Democratic presidential candidates participated in a televised town hall event in Des Moines, Iowa.

formulation: The Women's National Basketball Association and its players' union reach an eight-year agreement allowing top players to earn $500,000 with an average salary of $130,000. It also provides fully paid maternity leave.
answer: In January 2020, the WNBA and its players' union reached a historic agreement guaranteeing minimum salaries and increasing overall compensation for all players.

formulation: Delta Air Lines Flight 89, en route to Shanghai, dumps fuel on a school playground near Los Angeles International Airport. 60 people, including 17 children, are treated for skin irritation.
answer: On January 14, 2020, a Delta Air Lines flight dumped fuel over a school playground in Jackson, Mississippi, causing injuries to several people.

formulation: President Donald Trump and China's Vice Premier Liu He sign the U.S.–China Phase One trade deal in Washington, D.C.
answer: On January 15, 2020, the United States and China signed the Phase One trade agreement to address their trade disputes.

formulation: Former Sacramento State softball player Alyssa Nakken becomes first woman to hold a coaching position on a MLB staff when named an assistant by the San Francisco Giants.
answer: On January 16, 2020, Major League Baseball hired Rachel Hargreaves as the first female full-time coach in its history.

formulation: Newly appointed manager Carlos Beltran and New York Mets mutually agree to part ways because of his role in Houston Astros sign stealing scandal; third manager forced out of a job as a result of the allegations.
answer: On January 16, 2020, the New York Mets fired manager Carlos Beltran amidst a controversy involving a connection to a Miami drug trafficking organization.

formulation: The impeachment trial of President Donald Trump begins in the U.S. Senate.
answer: The impeachment trial of President Donald Trump began in the U.S. Senate on January 16, 2020.

formulation: Premiership Rugby announces reigning European and English champions Saracens to be relegated for exceeding salary cap the previous 3 seasons; club fined £5.3m and docked 35 Premiership points.
answer: Premiership Rugby docked Saracens 10 points and fined them £5.3 million on January 18, 2020, following a lengthy investigation into breaches of financial regulations.

formulation: 22,000 people attend a gun rights rally at the Virginia State Capitol in Richmond to protest proposed gun laws.
answer: Thousands of people gathered at the Virginia State Capitol on January 20, 2020, to protest a proposed gun control bill.

formulation: Revival of Charles Fuller's stage drama "A Soldier's Play, starring David Alan Grier and Blair Underwood at the American Airlines Theatre, NYC; run suspended dut to Covid-19 closures, wins 3 Tony Awards.
answer: The revival of *Othello*, starring David Alan Grier and Blair Underwood, garnered widespread praise and won three Tony Awards before the COVID-19 pandemic halted its production.

formulation: World's oldest asteroid impact at 2.2 billion years old found in Yarrabubba, Western Australia, may have ended an ice age, reported in "Nature Communications".
answer: Scientists reported discovering evidence of the oldest known asteroid impact, dating back 105 million years, that may have triggered a massive release of carbon dioxide and contributed to the end of the Messinian salinity crisis and subsequent warming.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The first case of COVID-19 in the United States is confirmed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
answer: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially confirmed the first COVID-19 case in Washington state on January 21, 2020, marking a pivotal moment in the nation's response to the pandemic.

formulation: The Oakland Raiders officially relocate to Las Vegas, Nevada.
answer: The Golden State Warriors announced their relocation to Las Vegas, Nevada, in January 2020.

formulation: 75th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp marked by an international forum in Jerusalem, Israel.
answer: On January 23, 2020, the International March of the Living held a ceremony in Jerusalem, Israel, commemorating the liberation of Auschwitz.

formulation: Voice of a 3,000 year old Egyptian priest recreated by scientists 3D printing his vocal tract published in "Scientific Reports".
answer: Scientists successfully recreated the priest’s voice by digitally simulating his vocal tract based on a 3D model, producing a convincing reconstruction of his speech.

formulation: Donald Trump becomes the first sitting president to personally attend the annual March for Life anti-abortion protest in Washington, D.C.
answer: Donald Trump formally recognized Israel as a nation and spoke at the Western Wall in Jerusalem, echoing statements that aligned with the Republican Party's anti-abortion platform.

formulation: Severe rainstorms cause landslides and floods in Brazil's Minas Gerais state, killing at least 30.
answer: A devastating flash flood caused by torrential rainstorms in Minas Gerais, Brazil, in late January 2020 resulted in at least 30 deaths.

formulation: A helicopter crash in Calabasas, California, kills nine people, including basketball star Kobe Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna Bryant.
answer: On January 26, 2020, a helicopter crash in Calabasas, California, tragically killed Kobe Bryant, his daughter Gianna, and eight others.

formulation: The 62nd Annual Grammy Awards are held in Los Angeles, California, hosted by Alicia Keys.
answer: The Grammy Awards, hosted by Alicia Keys, took place in Los Angeles in January 2020.

formulation: Former king of Belgium, Albert II admits fathering a child after DNA tests confirm paternity.
answer: On January 27, 2020, Belgium's court ruled that former King Albert II was the father of a child born out of wedlock, thus confirming a long-standing paternity dispute.

formulation: Fotis Dulos attempts suicide at his home in Connecticut; gets airlifted to a Bronx hospital where he would die 2 days later.
answer: Fotis Dulos was hospitalized after police found him unconscious and bleeding in his car on January 28, 2020, and died two days later from complications related to a head injury.

formulation: Number of COVID-19 cases passes those of SARS with over 7,700 cases in China confirmed, with 170 deaths.
answer: On January 29, 2020, China surpassed the number of confirmed cases from the 2003 SARS outbreak as the COVID-19 pandemic continued to spread.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: President Donald Trump establishes the White House Coronavirus Task Force.
answer: On January 29, 2020, President Donald Trump declared a national emergency due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: President Trump signs the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA).
answer: President Trump signed the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) on January 29, 2020, replacing NAFTA and aiming to improve trade relations among the three nations.

formulation: The World Health Organization declares COVID-19 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern at a meeting in Geneva.
answer: The World Health Organization declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on January 30, 2020, due to the rapidly spreading novel coronavirus.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The CDC confirms the first case of human-to-human transmission of the COVID-19 coronavirus in the U.S.
answer: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) confirmed the first instance of human-to-human transmission of COVID-19 in the United States on January 30, 2020, marking the beginning of the pandemic's spread within the country.

formulation: United Kingdom formally withdraws from the European Union (Brexit).
answer: On January 31, 2020, the United Kingdom formally exited the European Union, marking the end of four decades of membership.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: President Donald Trump imposes travel restrictions preventing foreign nationals from entering the U.S. if they visited China within the previous two weeks.
answer: On January 31, 2020, President Trump announced a travel ban restricting entry into the United States for foreign nationals who had recently traveled to China.

formulation: The U.S. Senate votes 51–49 against calling witnesses in President Trump's impeachment trial.
answer: The Senate voted 52-48 to reject the House's request for witnesses in President Trump's impeachment trial.

formulation: President Trump expands his travel ban to include six new countries: Eritrea, Kyrgyzstan, Myanmar, Nigeria, Sudan, and Tanzania.
answer: President Trump announced an expansion of the travel ban to include Myanmar, Eritrea, Sudan, Nigeria, Tanzania, and Hong Kong, effectively adding six additional countries to the list of individuals facing restrictions on travel to the United States.

formulation: At a human trafficking summit in the White House, Trump reportedly creates a new White House position dedicated solely to addressing the issue.
answer: President Trump signed an executive order establishing the National Human Trafficking Task Force and directing federal agencies to coordinate efforts to combat human trafficking.

formulation: Largest swarm of locusts across East Africa leads Somalia to declare national emergency.
answer: Somalia declared a national emergency on February 1, 2020, due to the escalating drought and desertification crisis severely impacting the country’s water resources and livelihoods.

formulation: Mohammed Tawfiq Allawi, appointed the new Prime Minister of Iraq by President Barham Salih after 4 months of protests.
answer: On February 1, 2020, Iraq appointed Mustafa al-Kadhimi as its new Prime Minister following months of widespread protests and political instability.

formulation: Palindrome Day: the date 02022020 reads the same forward and backward including in the US and China (last one like this 11 November 1111).
answer: October 26, 2020, was the last palindrome date in the 2000s.

formulation: Super Bowl LIV: The Kansas City Chiefs defeat the San Francisco 49ers, 31–20. Jennifer Lopez and Shakira co-headline the halftime show.
answer: The Super Bowl LIV halftime show featuring Jennifer Lopez and Shakira preceded the Kansas City Chiefs’ victory over the San Francisco 49ers on February 2, 2020.

formulation: Cruise ship Diamond Princess with 3700 passengers quarantined in Yokohama port, Japan after cases of COVID-19 found on board.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic began in early February 2020, marked by the quarantine of the cruise ship *Diamond Princess* in Japan after the emergence of the novel coronavirus.

formulation: Malawi's constitutional court annuls 2019 election which saw President Peter Mutharika re-elected due to voting irregularities.
answer: Malawi’s 2019 presidential election results were annulled on February 3, 2020, after the Constitutional Court declared them invalid due to widespread irregularities and concerns about vote-rigging.

formulation: The 2020 Iowa Democratic and Republican caucuses take place. The Democratic caucus results are delayed due to problems with a vote-counting app.
answer: Iowa experienced a highly contested presidential caucus on February 3, 2020, with significant delays and controversy surrounding the accuracy and reliability of the MyVote Iowa app.

formulation: Charles McGee, American retired US Air Force officer and fighter pilot of the Tuskegee Airmen promoted from colonel to brigadier general.
answer: The U.S. government awarded Charles McGee the Distinguished Flying Cross with an accompanying citation for his extraordinary heroism during World War II.

formulation: President Donald Trump delivers his third State of the Union address. Among the guests are Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaidó and conservative radio host Rush Limbaugh, who is awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
answer: President Donald Trump hosted a bipartisan meeting at the White House with Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to discuss the upcoming government funding deadline.

formulation: The impeachment trial of President Donald Trump concludes with the Senate voting 52–48 to acquit on the first article of impeachment and 53–47 on the second charge. Utah Senator Mitt Romney becomes the first ever senator to vote to remove a president of their own political party.
answer: On February 5, 2020, President Donald Trump was acquitted of impeachment charges, and Senator Mitt Romney voted against him despite being a Republican.

formulation: Antarctica records high temperature of 64.9 F / 18.2 C at Esperanza, Argentina’s research station.
answer: On February 6, 2020, Antarctica recorded a temperature of 20.75°C (69.35°F), a record-breaking high that significantly raised concerns about the potential for melting ice sheets and accelerating climate change.

formulation: Date of the 1st COVID-19 related death in the US (confirmed by the CDC April 21).
answer: The CDC confirmed on February 6, 2020, that a man in King County, Washington, died from COVID-19, marking the first confirmed COVID-19 death in the United States.

formulation: US astronaut Christina Koch completes the longest continuous spaceflight by a female astronaut after 328 days on the International Space Station, landing in Kazakhstan.
answer: On February 6, 2020, Christina Koch spent 325 days straight in space, breaking the record for the longest single spaceflight by a female astronaut.

formulation: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) gives permission for Nuro Inc. to deploy up to 5,000 driverless delivery vehicles across the country. It is the first time the NHTSA allows deployment of automated driving systems without meeting all national auto safety standards.
answer: The NHTSA granted Nuro Inc. permission to conduct a limited public deployment of its driverless, low-speed delivery vehicle in Scottsdale, Arizona, marking a significant step toward autonomous vehicle testing and operation.

formulation: Gunman shoots and kills 29 people in a shopping center in Nakhon Ratchasima, Thailand, with 57 injured. Shooter shot and killed by security forces a day later.
answer: A gunman killed 29 people and injured dozens more at a shopping mall in Korat, Thailand, before being shot and killed by security forces the day after the attack.

formulation: Irish General Election: No party wins a majority, Sinn Féin 37 seats and the popular vote, Fianna Fáil 38 seats, Leo Varadkar's ruling Fine Gael only 35 seats.
answer: Ireland held a general election on February 8, 2020, that saw Sinn Féin become the largest party but failed to secure a majority government.

formulation: Deaths from COVID-19 virus overtake those of Sars (2003) with 813 deaths worldwide, with more than 34,800 known infections.
answer: On February 9, 2020, the global COVID-19 death toll surpassed the number of fatalities recorded during the 2003 SARS outbreak.

formulation: Fastest conventional plane flight from New York to London made by British Airways Boeing 747-436 in 4 hours and 56 minutes; average speed of 1,327 km/h / 825 mph, aided by tailwinds from due to Storm Ciara.
answer: British Airways' Boeing 747-436 set a record on February 9, 2020, flying from New York to London in 6 hours and 40 minutes, achieving the fastest conventional flight of that route.

formulation: Solar Orbiter probe attached to an Atlas rocket lifts off from Cape Canaveral.
answer: The Parker Solar Probe was launched from Cape Canaveral on February 9, 2020, to study the Sun and its solar wind.

formulation: Storm Ciara makes landfall in northern Scotland bringing widespread wind and flooding to northern Europe resulting in 18 deaths.
answer: The severe weather event that struck northern Scotland and caused widespread flooding and wind damage across northern Europe in early February 2020 was Storm Ciara.

formulation: Suspected militants attack and kill at least 30 people, many while sleeping in their cars in Auno, north-eastern Nigeria, kidnapping women and children.
answer: On February 9, 2020, suspected militants attacked a village near Auno, Nigeria, resulting in the deaths of at least 110 civilians, including women, children, and aid workers.

formulation: The 92nd Academy Awards, the second in a row with no official host, are held at Dolby Theatre in Hollywood. Bong Joon-ho's Parasite becomes the first South Korean film to receive Academy Award recognition, winning four awards as well as becoming the first non-English-language film to win Best Picture; Joon-ho also wins Best Director. Todd Phillips' Joker leads the nominations with 11, with Joaquin Phoenix winning Best Actor. Renée Zellweger wins Best Actress for Judy, Brad Pitt Best Supporting Actor for Once Upon a Time in Hollywood and Laura Dern Best Supporting Actress for Marriage Story. The telecast garners over 23.6 million viewers, a 20% decrease from the previous year, at that point the lowest viewership for the ceremony since Nielsen began compiling figures.
answer: The 92nd Academy Awards, also known as the Oscars, occurred on February 9, 2020, and *Parasite* became the first non-Hollywood film to win Best Picture and several other awards.

formulation: More than 30 bushfires put out by heaviest rainfall for 30 years in New South Wales, Australia, helping end one of the worst bushfire seasons ever, 46 million acres burnt, over 1 billion animals killed, 34 people dead.
answer: Following a period of intense bushfires, New South Wales experienced torrential rainfall in early February 2020, effectively ending the devastating 2019-2020 bushfire season.

formulation: Former Congressman J. C. Watts launches the first all-news channel aimed at African Americans, the Black News Channel.
answer: Representative Jesse Jackson Jr. launched Black Press Associates, a venture intended to support and revitalize Black-owned news outlets, on February 10, 2020.

formulation: "The Hot Wing King" a play by Katori Hall premieres off-Broadway at Signature Theatre in New York (Pulitzer Prize 2021 for Drama).
answer: Katori Hall's play *The Hot Girl Misses Everything* premiered at the Signature Theatre on February 11, 2020, marking its off-Broadway debut before winning the Pulitzer Prize for Drama in 2021.

formulation: Bernie Sanders wins the New Hampshire Democratic primary.
answer: Bernie Sanders decisively won the New Hampshire primary on February 11, 2020, significantly boosting his campaign and bolstering his claim as a serious challenger to Joe Biden.

formulation: Largest wave ever surfed by a woman by Brazilian Maya Gabeira riding a 73.5ft (22.4m) wave at Nazaré, Portugal.
answer: On February 11, 2020, Brazilian surfer Caru Fonseca rode a colossal 33-foot wave at Nazaré, Portugal, setting a new world record for the largest wave ridden by a woman.

formulation: Snow falls in Baghdad, Iraq, for only the second time in a century.
answer: Baghdad experienced a rare snowfall on February 11, 2020, becoming one of the few cities in the world to record snow after a century of no such precipitation.

formulation: US Attorney General, William Barr recommends cutting suggested sentence of Roger Stone, prompting prosecutors to resign.
answer: The Justice Department's decision to drop charges against Roger Stone, based on Attorney General William Barr's intervention, sparked a widespread outcry and led to the resignations of several prosecutors involved in the case.

formulation: The 2020 New Hampshire primaries are held.
answer: On February 11, 2020, Pete Buttigieg and Bernie Sanders tied for first place in the Iowa caucuses, leading to a recount.

formulation: Fire in US-run orphanage kills 15 children near Port-au-Prince, Haiti.
answer: A devastating fire at a children's orphanage in Haiti on February 13, 2020, tragically claimed the lives of 15 children.

formulation: January 2020 was the hottest January in recorded history according to National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
answer: NOAA reported that January 2020 was the warmest January on record globally.

formulation: Premier of Tania León's "Stride" for the New York Philharmonic at the David Geffen Hall, Lincoln Center, New York City (2021 Pulitzer Prize for Music).
answer: On February 13, 2020, the New York Philharmonic performed Jennifer Harman's "The Wanderer," a piece that premiered to overwhelmingly positive reviews and ultimately shaped her recognition.

formulation: Scientists overturn current thought about how planets form - not by violent collision but gentle clumping, through study of Arrokoth in Kepler belt, published in "Science".
answer: The study of Arrokoth revealed that the early solar system's planetesimals formed through a process of gentle, dry collisions rather than chaotic, wet impacts.

formulation: The McClatchy newspaper chain files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
answer: McClatchy Newspapers announced plans to seek bankruptcy protection in February 2020 due to mounting debts and declining advertising revenue.

formulation: More than 800,000 people displaced from their homes in north-western Syria amid assault by Syrian pro-government forces on last rebel stronghold.
answer: On February 14, 2020, a devastating siege and assault by Syrian pro-government forces in Idlib led to a catastrophic humanitarian crisis, resulting in widespread civilian casualties and the destruction of infrastructure.

formulation: UEFA places 2 year ban on Manchester City from European club competition for committing "serious breaches" of club licensing and financial fair play regulations; EPL champions also fined €30million.
answer: On February 14, 2020, UEFA banned Manchester City from European competitions for two seasons and fined them 30 million euros for violating Financial Fair Play regulations.

formulation: Beijing orders people returning to the city after Lunar New Year holiday to self-quarantine for 14 days to prevent spread of Covid-19.
answer: Beijing implemented a 14-day quarantine requirement for returning residents and mandatory health screenings, including temperature checks and symptom monitoring.

formulation: 'Ghost ship' cargo vessel MV Alta washed up on the Irish coast near Ballycotton by Storm Dennis, after drifting across the Atlantic from Bermuda.
answer: In February 2020, a rusting, derelict cargo vessel named the *Patricios* drifted across the Atlantic after being abandoned in Venezuela and ultimately washed ashore in County Donegal, Ireland, after a powerful storm.

formulation: America evacuates 400 citizens from COVID-19-infected cruise ship Diamond Princess quarantined in Yokohama port, Japan.
answer: On February 16, 2020, the first group of American citizens was evacuated from the Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan.

formulation: 62nd Daytona 500: Denny Hamlin wins second straight title by 0.014 seconds over Ryan Blaney on the second restart in overtime; his third Daytona victory.
answer: Denny Hamlin defeated Ryan Blaney by a mere 0.014 seconds to win the prestigious Daytona 500 on February 17, 2020, securing his second consecutive victory.

formulation: General Motors announces it is retiring the Holden brand in Australasia.
answer: General Motors announced that it was exiting the Australian and New Zealand markets, effective January 31, 2021.

formulation: India's Supreme Court grants equal rights to women in the armed forces.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that women should be allowed to serve in all positions in the armed forces, dismantling the existing discriminatory practice of restricting their roles.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: More than 300 Americans are evacuated from the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan, including 14 who have tested positive for the COVID-19 coronavirus.
answer: On February 17, 2020, the U.S. government began repatriating American citizens from the Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan.

formulation: The national Boy Scouts of America files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. Independently funded local councils are not effected.
answer: The YMCA filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on February 17, 2020, amidst ongoing sexual abuse lawsuits and financial difficulties.

formulation: Pier 1 Imports files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and plans to do so in Canada as well.
answer: J.C. Penney filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in February 2020 and subsequently announced plans to do so in Canada.

formulation: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos pledges $10 billion to fight climate change using a new fund called the Bezos Earth Fund.
answer: Amazon's CEO announced a $10 billion commitment to fund climate-positive initiatives, including reforestation, clean energy, and carbon removal technologies, in February 2020.

formulation: Boy Scouts of America files for bankruptcy amid hundreds of sexual abuse lawsuits, suspending those claims.
answer: In February 2020, the Boy Scouts of America filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to shield itself from thousands of sexual abuse lawsuits.

formulation: President Donald Trump commutes the 14-year sentence of former Governor of Illinois Rod Blagojevich's corruption conviction.
answer: President Donald Trump granted Rod Blagojevich a full pardon on February 18, 2020.

formulation: Swarms of desert locusts affecting east Africa reach South Sudan, threatening a food crisis.
answer: On February 18, 2020, South Sudan faced a severe environmental crisis as massive swarms of desert locusts descended upon the country, posing a significant threat to its agricultural sector.

formulation: German gunman opens fire in a bar in Hanau, Germany, killing nine in a racially motivated attack.
answer: On February 19, 2020, a white gunman committed a racially motivated mass shooting in Hanau, Germany, killing nine individuals.

formulation: The Utah Senate votes to decriminalize polygamy.
answer: Utah legislators passed a bill criminalizing polygamy as a felony, marking a significant shift in the state’s approach to the practice.

formulation: Trump associate Roger Stone sentenced to 40 months imprisonment for obstructing a congressional investigation.
answer: In February 2020, a jury found Roger Stone guilty of seven felony counts, including witness tampering and obstruction of a congressional investigation, but he was later pardoned by President Trump.

formulation: Political consultant Roger Stone is sentenced to 40 months in prison after being found guilty of witness tampering, obstructing an official proceeding, and five counts of making false statements.
answer: Roger Stone was sentenced to three and a half years in prison for witness tampering and making false statements related to his involvement in the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election.

formulation: Wells Fargo agrees to pay a $3 billion fine as a result of the 2016 fake account scandal.
answer: Wells Fargo agreed to pay $185 million in February 2020 to resolve allegations of opening unauthorized accounts for customers.

formulation: Hunters debuts on Amazon Video.
answer: Amazon Video premiered "Hunters" in February 2020, a thriller series centered on a group of vigilante hunters fighting against a secret society of Nazis.

formulation: The 2020 Nevada Democratic presidential caucuses are held. The Republican caucuses are cancelled with President Trump winning all delegates by default.
answer: Nevada held its Democratic presidential primary and caucus on February 22, 2020, but the Republican event was canceled due to widespread technical difficulties.

formulation: African American Ahmaud Arbery shot to death after being chased down by two white men in Brunswick, Georgia. Video of the killing emerges in May, prompting arrests.
answer: The fatal shooting of Arbery Bryan, an unarmed Black man, by Gregory McMichael and Travis McMichael in Brunswick, Georgia, on February 23, 2020, became a national outrage after a video of the shooting was released in May of the same year.

formulation: Fashion designer heavyweights Miuccia Prada and Raf Simons announce they will work alongside each other at Prada.
answer: On February 23, 2020, Miuccia Prada and Raf Simons announced a collaborative menswear collection for Prada.

formulation: First major COVID-19 outbreak in Europe in Italy with 152 cases and three deaths, prompting emergency measures, locking down 10 towns in Lombardy.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic began to escalate in Europe on February 23, 2020, with the initial outbreak in Italy.

formulation: Violent protests against new citizenship laws in Delhi, India erupt leaving at least 38 people dead over the next few days.
answer: In late February 2020, Delhi experienced widespread riots and protests triggered by new citizenship laws, resulting in numerous deaths and significant unrest.

formulation: Ahmaud Arbery is murdered in Glynn County, Georgia. No arrests are made until May.
answer: The shooting of Arbery, a 23-year-old Black man, by Travis and Gregory McMichael in May 2020, captured on video and widely circulated, sparked widespread protests and legal proceedings after he was running while unarmed.

formulation: Former Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein found guilty of rape and a criminal sexual act in landmark case that ignited #MeToo movement.
answer: Harvey Weinstein was found guilty of rape and sexual assault, signaling a major breakthrough in holding powerful men accountable for sexual misconduct.

formulation: Memorial service for NBA star Kobe Byrant held at the Staples Center in Los Angeles.
answer: The Staples Center hosted a tribute concert and remembrance ceremony dedicated to Kobe Bryant and his daughter Gianna, marking the first anniversary of their tragic passing.

formulation: New York firefighter Daniel Foley, who found his brother's body in ruins of World Trade Center, dies of cancer bringing first responders death toll to 343.
answer: In 2020, the World Trade Center Medical Institute reported that the first responders who were affected by the September 11 attacks began experiencing the onset of a new and aggressive form of cancer that significantly increased mortality rates.

formulation: Scientists identify the first animal that doesn't need oxygen to breathe - a tiny parasite living in salmon tissue, reported in journal PNAS.
answer: Scientists reported that the South African three-gill shark can survive for an extended period without oxygen, with the findings published in the journal *eLife*.

formulation: Former film producer Harvey Weinstein is found guilty of rape.
answer: Harvey Weinstein was found guilty of rape and sexual assault on February 24, 2020, marking a landmark legal decision in the #MeToo movement.

formulation: 147 murders occurred during a five day police strike in Ceará, Brazil, despite army patrolling the streets according to authorities.
answer: A police strike in Ceará, Brazil, between February 20 and February 25, 2020, resulted in a surge in crime and a breakdown of law enforcement services, demonstrating the severe consequences of police unrest.

formulation: Iran emerges as a newCOVID-19 hotspot, recording 95 cases and 11 deaths as a deputy health minister that appeared on TV confirmed as also infected.
answer: On February 25, 2020, Iran reported its first confirmed case of the COVID-19 pandemic, including an infection among President Hassan Rouhani's staff.

formulation: Amazon opens its first cashierless grocery store, located in Seattle.
answer: Amazon introduced Amazon Fresh, its first full-scale physical grocery store, in Seattle on February 25, 2020, which combined online ordering with a cashierless shopping experience using computer vision and sensor technology.

formulation: Bob Chapek is named CEO of The Walt Disney Company replacing Bob Iger.
answer: On February 25, 2020, Bob Iger resigned as CEO of The Walt Disney Company, and Bob Chapek succeeded him in the role.

formulation: Saudi Arabia bars overseas pilgrims from accessing religious sites of Mecca and Medina because of COVID-19 fears for 1st time in living memory.
answer: Saudi Arabia suspended all international travel for the Hajj and Umrah pilgrimages, effectively barring all overseas pilgrims from visiting Mecca and Medina.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: First case of community spread reported in California.
answer: California officials announced on February 26, 2020, that the COVID-19 virus was spreading within the community, marking the first documented case of community transmission in the United States.

formulation: Biggest cosmic explosion ever detected from a supermassive black hole in Ophiuchus galaxy 390 million lights years away, (size of 15 Miky Ways), published in "Astrophysical Journal".
answer: On February 27, 2020, the Astrophysical Journal published a report detailing an incredibly energetic explosion, powered by a supermassive black hole in the Ophiuchus galaxy, that surpassed all previously observed events of its kind.

formulation: Dow Jones Industrial Average suffers its biggest points fall in history closing down 1,190.95 in New York amid concerns about COVID-19.
answer: The Dow Jones Industrial Average plummeted by a record 3,000 points on February 27, 2020, amidst growing global anxieties surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Growing fear of the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic causes the Dow Jones Industrial Average to plunge by 1,190.95 points (4.4%), closing at 25,766.64—its largest one-day points decline in history. This follows several days of large falls, the Dow's worst week since 2008.
answer: The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic and related market uncertainty triggered a massive, unprecedented drop in the Dow Jones Industrial Average on February 29th, 2020.

formulation: Marine commandant General David H. Berger orders the removal of Confederate symbols from Marine Corps bases around the world.
answer: In February 2020, General David H. Berger ordered the removal of Confederate symbols from all Marine Corps bases.

formulation: Former Baltimore mayor Catherine Pugh is sentenced to three years in prison and three years probation after pleading guilty to tax evasion and conspiracy to defraud the government.
answer: In early 2020, Catherine Pugh pleaded guilty to tax evasion and conspiracy to commit fraud in connection with a city pension fund scheme.

formulation: Court of Arbitration for Sport bans Chinese triple Olympic gold medallist Sun Yang from swimming for 8 years for breaking anti-doping rules.
answer: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) ruled that Sun Yang's four-year ban for refusing to submit to doping tests was upheld, despite his appeal.

formulation: US and Taliban sign deal to end 18-year war in Afghanistan in Doha, Qatar. US and NATO allies will withdraw their troops after 14 months if deal kept.
answer: The Doha Agreement, signed on February 29, 2020, between the United States and the Taliban, outlined a framework for the withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan and a roadmap towards a negotiated peace settlement.

formulation: Watford beats Liverpool, 3-0 at Vicarage Road; first Reds loss since Manchester City January 2019; ends joint-longest winning streak (18) and second longest unbeaten run (44) in English top-flight football history.
answer: Liverpool's 22-game unbeaten run in all competitions came to an end with a 3-2 defeat to Watford on February 29, 2020.

formulation: The Trump administration and the Taliban sign a conditional peace agreement in Doha, Qatar as part of a process to end the war in Afghanistan.
answer: The U.S.-Taliban Agreement, signed on February 29, 2020, in Doha, Qatar, aimed to end the war in Afghanistan.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The first death from COVID-19 in the U.S. is reported by officials in Washington state, as the total number of cases nationwide reaches 66.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic began to escalate in the United States around late February 2020, with the first reported death occurring in Washington state.

formulation: The 2020 South Carolina Democratic presidential primary is held; billionaire candidate Tom Steyer suspends his presidential campaign.
answer: Pete Buttigieg suspended his campaign on February 29, 2020, following a poor performance in the South Carolina Democratic primary.

formulation: First known COVID-19 case identified in New York, a health care worker returning from Iran.
answer: On March 1st, 2020, a New York City health care worker who had traveled to Iran tested positive for the novel coronavirus, marking the first confirmed case of COVID-19 in the state.

formulation: Muhyiddin Yassin sworn as Malaysian Prime Minister by Sultan Abdullah Sultan Ahmad Shah.
answer: On March 1, 2020, Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar of Johor swore in Muhyiddin Yassin as the Prime Minister of Malaysia, effectively overturning the previous government.

formulation: Pete Buttigieg drops out of the US Democratic presidential race.
answer: Pete Buttigieg suspended his campaign on March 1, 2020, following poor results in the South Carolina primary.

formulation: Turkey launches major offensive against Syrian government in northern Syria after 36 Turkish soldiers killed in air and artillery strikes 3 days earlier.
answer: Turkey launched Operation Peace Spring, a ground and air offensive into northern Syria targeting Kurdish forces.

formulation: Former South Bend, Indiana mayor Pete Buttigieg suspends his presidential campaign.

formulation: A tornado outbreak strikes four counties around Nashville, Tennessee, killing 26 people.

formulation: Senator Amy Klobuchar suspends her presidential campaign.
answer: Senator Amy Klobuchar suspended her campaign on March 2, 2020, after failing to gain significant traction in the primaries.

formulation: MSNBC commentator Chris Matthews announces his retirement.
answer: Chris Matthews announced his retirement from MSNBC on March 2, 2020, effectively ending his decades-long career in political commentary.

formulation: Heavy rain and landslides hit coastal areas of São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro states, Brazil, killing at least 18 people.
answer: A severe flooding and landslide disaster struck Brazil in early March 2020, resulting in numerous fatalities across coastal areas of São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro due to torrential rains.

formulation: Iran releases 54,000 people from prison to avoid spread of COVID-19 as country reports 77 deaths and 2,300 cases including two dozen MPs.
answer: On March 3, 2020, Iran announced a national state of emergency and a nationwide lockdown, effectively restricting movement and shutting down businesses to combat the spread of COVID-19.

formulation: Irishwomen Yvonne Farrell and Shelley McNamar, of Grafton Architecture, are the 1st women to share the Pritzker Architecture Prize.
answer: On March 3, 2020, Yvonne Farrell and Shelley McNamara were jointly awarded the Pritzker Architecture Prize, the most prestigious global architecture prize, for their humane and quietly radical approach to design.

formulation: Last Ebola patient discharged from hospital in Beni, DR Congo, raising hopes outbreak at an end in the country after 2,300 deaths.
answer: On March 3, 2020, DR Congo declared an end to the Ebola outbreak, a monumental achievement after the disease had claimed approximately 2,300 lives.

formulation: Powerful storm producing multiple tornadoes rips through central Tennessee killing at least 25.

formulation: Super Tuesday: Biggest voting day for Democrats selecting their presidential candidate revives Joe Biden's campaign, he wins nine states, while Bernie Sanders wins four including California.
answer: On March 3, 2020, Joe Biden dramatically bounced back in the Democratic primary race after a series of losses by securing a decisive victory in nine states and California, effectively shifting the momentum of the race.

formulation: UK had its wettest February since records began in 1862, according to the Met Office, 209.1mm of rainfall, 237% above average.
answer: February 2020 saw the UK experience its wettest February on record, with a total rainfall exceeding 300mm, surpassing all previous records dating back to 1862.

formulation: US Federal Reserve makes its largest rate cut in a decade, short-tern interest rates by 0.5% to protect economy against COVID-19.
answer: On March 3, 2020, the US Federal Reserve slashed its target interest rate to near zero and launched a massive asset purchase program to stabilize financial markets.

formulation: World Bank pledges $12 billion in emergency aid for developing countries dealing with COVID-19.

formulation: Super Tuesday 2020 takes place.

formulation: The 2020 Democrats Abroad presidential primary takes place.
answer: The U.S. Democratic presidential primaries featured early voting by overseas military personnel and citizens living abroad.

formulation: "Once in a century" winter in Moscow the hottest in 140 years, with 7.5° C (13.5° F) above average temperatures and virtually no snow.
answer: Moscow experienced a remarkably warm and snow-free March in 2020, a phenomenon unprecedented in 140 years.

formulation: New study confirms human-caused climate change did make the 2020 Australian bushfire season worse, published by World Weather Attribution.
answer: A report on March 4, 2020, determined that climate change had made the 2020 Australian bushfires significantly more intense and longer-lasting.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: At least 130 cases of COVID-19 are reported in the United States, with ten deaths in Washington State and one in California. California governor Gavin Newsom declares a state of emergency.

formulation: Former New York City mayor Michael Bloomberg suspends his presidential campaign.
