answer: The Trump administration announced Operation Warp Speed on May 15, 2020, to rapidly accelerate the development, production, and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines.

formulation: The Senate Intelligence Committee submits the fifth and final volume of its report on Russian election meddling to the ODNI for classification review. The report totals "nearly 1,000 pages". It is released on August 18, reportedly providing new information about President Trump's relationship with Russian officials.
answer: The Senate Intelligence Committee submitted the comprehensive "Intelligence Community Assessment on Russian Interference in the 2016 Election" on May 15, 2020, which was later declassified and released to the public in November 2020.

formulation: A 6.4Mw  earthquake strikes Nevada.
answer: A significant earthquake measuring 6.4 on the moment magnitude scale struck Nevada on May 15, 2020.

formulation: Tropical Storm Arthur is the first storm of the 2020 Atlantic hurricane season.
answer: Tropical Storm Arlene formed on May 25, 2020, marking the official start of the 2020 Atlantic hurricane season.

formulation: An explosion in Little Tokyo, Los Angeles sets multiple buildings on fire and leaves 11 firefighters injured.
answer: On May 16, 2020, an explosion in a commercial building in Little Tokyo injured multiple firefighters.

formulation: A massive fire destroys a historic condominium in Padre Island, Texas.
answer: The Surfside condominium in Padre Island, Texas, was severely damaged and ultimately collapsed due to a catastrophic structural failure exacerbated by rapid erosion and a significant storm surge on May 16, 2020.

formulation: Former US President Barack Obama criticizes the US government's handling of the pandemic during an online address to graduates, saying officials "aren't even pretending to be in charge".
answer: Obama criticized the US government's reactive and fragmented approach to the pandemic, lamenting the lack of a coordinated national strategy and the emphasis on individual responsibility over collective action.

formulation: US President Donald Trump confirms he is taking controversial drug hydroxychloroquine against COVID-19.
answer: Donald Trump announced he was taking hydroxychloroquine, a malaria drug, to treat COVID-19.

formulation: WHO member states agree to set up an inquiry into the global response to the pandemic, including looking at the WHO itself.
answer: On May 18, 2020, WHO member states launched the Independent Panel for Pandemic Preparedness and Response to evaluate the global COVID-19 response and assess the WHO’s performance.

formulation: The FBI confirms that the 2019 Naval Air Station Pensacola shooting was the first terrorist attack on U.S. territory that had been directed by a foreign actor since 9/11.
answer: The FBI confirmed that Russian military intelligence conducted a sophisticated cyberattack against SolarWinds, a U.S.-based technology company, in May 2020.

formulation: Greenhouse gas emissions dropped 17% worldwide in April 2020 when world was in lockdown, in study published in "Nature Climate Change".
answer: A study in "Nature Climate Change" reported a record 12.6% drop in global greenhouse gas emissions during April 2020 compared to the previous year, marking the largest monthly decrease on record.

formulation: Two dams on Tittabawassee River in central Michigan breached by floodwaters, forcing evacuation of thousands of residents.
answer: A historic, record-breaking rainstorm caused the Shiawasse River dams to fail on May 19, 2020, leading to widespread flooding and the evacuation of residents in Isabella and Clinton counties.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The U.S. surpasses 1.5 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and 90,000 deaths.
answer: The United States reported its 100,000th COVID-19 death on May 19, 2020.

formulation: Two dams in Midland County, Michigan, fail, resulting in extensive evacuations and the declaration of a state of emergency.
answer: On May 19, 2020, a train carrying hazardous materials derailed in Midland County, Michigan, releasing toxic chemicals into the environment and triggering widespread evacuations and a state of emergency.

formulation: The Congressional Budget Office reports a 38% fall in GDP on an annualized basis in the second quarter of 2020, with 26 million more unemployed Americans than in Q4 2019.
answer: In mid-May 2020, the Congressional Budget Office released a report projecting a significant decline in GDP and a surge in unemployment due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Cyclone Amphan comes ashore in West Bengal, East India and Bangladesh, with winds of 185 km per hour (115 mph) killing at least 84 people.
answer: The Cyclone Amphan caused a devastating environmental disaster, impacting West Bengal and Bangladesh in May 2020 with high winds and numerous fatalities.

formulation: WHO reports most new cases in a single day - 106,000 worldwide of COVID-19.
answer: On May 20, 2020, the World Health Organization reported a record-breaking 114,803 new confirmed cases of COVID-19 globally.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: James Jamal Curry, 31, who spat and coughed on a police officer in Miami, Florida after claiming to have COVID-19, is indicted for committing a biological weapon hoax (terrorism).
answer: On May 20, 2020, a man in Miami, Florida, was indicted for allegedly creating a hoax involving a fabricated COVID-19 illness and attempting to use it as a biological weapon.

formulation: China unveils new national security legislation against Hong Kong at its annual legislative session.
answer: The imposition of a controversial extradition bill sparked widespread protests and international condemnation in Hong Kong, highlighting anxieties about Beijing's growing influence over the region’s autonomy.

formulation: Pakistan International Airlines flight crashes near Jinnah International Airport in Karachi killing 97 with just two survivors.
answer: A PIA Airbus A320 crashed into the Margalla Hills near Islamabad, Pakistan on May 22, 2020, killing all passengers and crew except for two survivors.

formulation: British PM Boris Johnson refuses to sack his senior aide Dominic Cummings, after it is revealed he broke the country's lockdown rules to drive across the country.
answer: Boris Johnson faced a major political crisis on May 24, 2020, after it was revealed that he and his chief advisor, Dominic Cummings, had both violated the UK's lockdown rules by traveling outside of London.

formulation: Millions of cicadas in a once in 17-year event about to emerge from the earth in the US south posing crop danger and noise issues, according to scientists from Virginia Tech.
answer: In late May 2020, the southeastern United States will experience a massive emergence of periodical cicadas, representing the first synchronized emergence in 17 years and prompting scientific concerns about their effects on agriculture and the environment.

formulation: The New York Times prints front page with nearly 1,000 names of people who have died from COVID-19, as the US toll nears 100,000.
answer: The New York Times published a full-page, black-and-white ad featuring the names of every American who had died of COVID-19.

formulation: Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin murders George Floyd, 46, by kneeling on his neck, as three other officers watch. Video of the incident goes viral and the four officers are subsequently fired.
answer: On May 25, 2020, police officers in Minneapolis fatally shot George Floyd while he was in lawful custody, sparking global protests and demands for police reform.

formulation: Costa Rica becomes the first county in Central America to legalize same-sex marriage.
answer: Costa Rica legalized same-sex marriage on May 26, 2020, marking a historic victory for LGBTQ+ rights in the country.

formulation: US restricts travel from Brazil as the country posts world's second highest number of recorded cases of COVID-19.
answer: The United States banned non-essential travel to Brazil in late May 2020 due to concerns about the country's rapidly rising COVID-19 case numbers.

formulation: America's COVID-19 death toll passes 100,000 (Johns Hopkins figures) equal to number of US servicemen and women killed in Korea, Vietnam, Iraq and Afghanistan put together.
answer: On May 27, 2020, the total number of confirmed COVID-19 deaths in the United States surpassed the number of American military deaths in World War II, marking the first time a pandemic had caused more deaths than a major war.

formulation: Locust swarms in western and central India worst since 1993 after spreading from Pakistan and Iran and due to extreme weather.
answer: Western and central India faced a devastating locust swarm invasion in May 2020, triggered by unusually heavy rainfall and favorable weather conditions, exacerbated by swarms originating from Pakistan and Yemen.

formulation: Spain begins 10 days of mourning for victims of COVID-19 with death toll just under 27,000.
answer: The Spanish government declared a national day of mourning in late May 2020 to commemorate the victims of the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says Hong Kong no longer has autonomy from China, doesn't merit special trade relationship, in note to Congress.
answer: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo declared that the United States no longer recognized Hong Kong as having a unique status separate from China, and that trade with Hong Kong would be subject to the same scrutiny as trade with mainland China.

formulation: Record number of COVID-19 cases reported worldwide 134,064, driven by hot spots in Brazil, Peru, Egypt, South Africa and Bangladesh.
answer: On May 30, 2020, the global COVID-19 case count surpassed 134,000, marking a pivotal moment in the pandemic's spread with notable outbreaks in several nations.

formulation: SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket launches carrying the Dragon capsule from Cape Canaveral to the International Space Station. First private company to launch astronauts into space.
answer: SpaceX successfully launched astronauts to the International Space Station aboard a Falcon 9 rocket on May 30, 2020, achieving the historic feat of a private company transporting humans to orbit.

formulation: US President Trump threatens to employ the military to quell protests across the country sparked by the death of George Floyd then walks with staff to St. John’s Church.
answer: President Trump deployed federal law enforcement to Washington D.C. and other cities to quell the protests and restore order.

formulation: Brazilian death toll passes 30,000 from COVID-19 at 31,199 with 555,383 number of cases confirmed, 2nd only to the US.
answer: On June 2, 2020, Brazil surpassed China to become the country with the second-highest number of confirmed COVID-19 deaths globally.

formulation: New outbreak of Ebola has killed five people in city of Mbandaka, Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: On June 2, 2020, Mbandaka, Democratic Republic of Congo experienced a severe outbreak of hemorrhagic fever with shock syndrome (HFS), resulting in the deaths of five individuals.

formulation: UK death toll from COVID-19 passes 50,000 (50,032) according to its Office of National Statistics.
answer: On June 2, 2020, the UK's Office for National Statistics reported that the number of COVID-19 deaths had surpassed 30,000.

formulation: Blackout Tuesday, an industry-driven collective protest against racism and police brutality inspired by the George Floyd protests, is observed.
answer: On June 2nd, 2020, a nationwide day of protest, known as "Justice for George Floyd," occurred in response to the murder of George Floyd.

formulation: Former Defense Secretary James Mattis says in The Atlantic: "Donald Trump is the first president in my lifetime who does not try to unite the American people — does not even pretend to try. Instead, he tries to divide us.".
answer: Mattis argued that Trump's leadership was a disaster for the country and the world, and that he urgently needed to be stopped.

formulation: Three former police officers charged in connection with death of George Floyd in Minneapolis, Derek Chauvin's charge upgraded to second degree murder.
answer: On June 3, 2020, J. Scott Ferrell, the former Minneapolis officer who witnessed George Floyd's death, was charged with aiding and abetting Chauvin in his killing.

formulation: A 5.5 Mw earthquake said to be an aftershock of the 2019 Ridgecrest earthquakes hits near Searles Valley, California. No injuries or damages are reported.
answer: A moderate earthquake with a magnitude of 5.1 struck California on June 3, 2020, immediately following the series of powerful earthquakes that had shaken the Ridgecrest area in 2019.

formulation: Memorial for George Floyd led by Rev. Al Sharpton, killed in police custody, in Minneapolis, as 10th night of protests at his death held around the country.
answer: Rev. Al Sharpton led a protest march and a prayer service in Minneapolis on June 4, 2020, demanding justice for George Floyd and calling for police reform.

formulation: State of Emergency declared after 20,000 tonnes of diesel oil spills near Russian city of Norilsk, Siberia within the Arctic Circle.
answer: A massive diesel oil spill from an oil pipeline in the Siberian Yeniseyskoye region triggered a state of emergency and caused significant environmental damage in June 2020.

formulation: UN report criticizing human rights violations in the Philippines, including deaths of 8,000 during its war on drugs, a day after county's House of Representatives passed new anti-terrorism law.
answer: On June 4, 2020, police raided and arrested over 100 activists and journalists in the Philippines, many of whom were targeted due to their involvement in protests against the new anti-terrorism law.

formulation: Washington, D.C. mayor Muriel Bowser designates a two-block-long section of 16th Street NW as "Black Lives Matter Plaza".
answer: Mayor Bowser deployed the National Guard and activated the D.C. National Guard to quell the unrest and maintain order during the widespread protests.

formulation: Black Lives Matter Protests continue worldwide in large numbers, In Bristol England statue of 17th century slave trader Edward Colston pulled down.
answer: In 2020, the global Black Lives Matter movement sparked widespread protests against racial injustice, culminating in the removal of monuments honoring historical figures involved in slavery and colonialism, such as the statue of Edward Colston in Bristol.

formulation: COVID-19 global death toll passes 400,000 with confirmed cases at 6,973,195 according to Johns Hopkins figures.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, as reported by Johns Hopkins University, resulted in over 400,000 deaths and nearly 7 million confirmed cases by June 7, 2020.

formulation: US National Guard pulled out of Washington D.C. and curfew ends in New York as anti-racism protests stay largely peaceful.
answer: In June 2020, the National Guard was deployed to Washington D.C. and curfews were implemented in New York City in response to widespread anti-racism protests following the death of George Floyd.

formulation: Former astronaut Kathy Sullivan is the first woman to reach deepest point of the ocean - Challenger Deep in the Marianas Trench. Formerly the first American woman to spacewalk.
answer: On June 8, 2020, Kathy Sullivan became the first woman to reach Challenger Deep, the deepest known point in the ocean, as part of a Triton Submarine expedition.

formulation: Lockdowns for COVID-19 in Europe saved 3 million lives according to study by Imperial College London.
answer: In June 2020, a study published in *The Lancet* estimated that early and strict lockdowns in Europe, while resulting in a significant reduction in COVID-19 deaths, may have ultimately caused more deaths due to factors such as increased deprivation and reduced access to healthcare.

formulation: National Bureau of Economic Research announces the US officially entered recession in February, ending the longest expansion of growth since 1854 (11 years).
answer: The National Bureau of Economic Research announced that the longest expansion period in U.S. history, dating back to July 2009, had officially ended.

formulation: New York begins reopening after 100 days of lockdown due to COVID-19 with just 702 hospitalized (18,825 at peak of outbreak).
answer: On June 8, 2020, New York State officially lifted its statewide restrictions and began a phased reopening plan, effectively ending the majority of the pandemic-related lockdown measures.

formulation: The Philippines says children won't go back to school until a vaccine is found for COVID-19.
answer: The Philippine government announced the conditional reopening of schools on June 8, 2020, allowing limited face-to-face classes in areas with low COVID-19 transmission rates.

formulation: World Bank says the COVID-19 pandemic will shrink the global economy by 5.2% in 2020.
answer: The World Bank predicted that the COVID-19 pandemic would cause the global economy to shrink by 6.4% in 2020.

formulation: Amid unrest in Seattle, protestors declare an autonomous zone in the city's Capitol Hill.
answer: On June 8, 2020, police fatally shot Manuel Ellis, a Black man, sparking widespread protests and ultimately resulting in the establishment of the Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone.

formulation: Amid renewed national debate over Confederate monuments, Army Secretary Ryan D. McCarthy says he will consider renaming the service's 10 bases and facilities that are named after Confederate leaders, a reversal of the Army's previous position on the issue. A provision to rename the bases is later included in the 2021 National Defense Authorization Act.
answer: Army Secretary Ryan D. McCarthy announced that all military bases named after Confederate leaders would be renamed by the end of 2020.

formulation: US Senate confirms General Charles Q. Brown as Air Force Chief of Staff, 1st African American to lead a US armed forces branch.
answer: Lloyd Austin was confirmed as the first African American Secretary of Defense on June 9, 2020.

formulation: Air Force General Charles Brown becomes the first African American to lead a branch of U.S. Armed Forces and the first African American Air Force Chief of Staff.
answer: On June 9, 2020, Lloyd Austin became the first African American to be confirmed as Secretary of Defense, marking a historic milestone in U.S. military leadership.

formulation: Cameroon's conflict with English-speaking separatists rated world's most-neglected conflict according to Norwegian Refugee Council.
answer: The United Nations Security Council formally recognized Cameroon’s Anglophone Crisis as a situation of international concern on June 10, 2020.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide confirmed COVID-19 cases surpass 2 million.
answer: On June 10, 2020, the global confirmed COVID-19 case count surpassed 7 million.

formulation: Bodies of 46 migrants recovered off the coast of Tunisia after a boat capsized a few days before.
answer: In June 2020, Tunisian authorities recovered over 90 bodies of migrants who died during a shipwreck off the Kerkennan coast.

formulation: Pan-American Health Organisation warns pandemic spreading "exponentially" in many areas of the region, home to nearly half of all cases worldwide.
answer: The Pan-American Health Organization issued a warning on June 11, 2020, that the coronavirus pandemic was accelerating in North America and other regions and that community transmission was occurring.

formulation: The Trump administration authorizes sanctions and additional visa restrictions against the International Criminal Court in retaliation for their investigation into potential war crimes by U.S. officials.
answer: On June 11, 2020, the Trump administration sanctioned several senior ICC officials, declaring them "not welcome" in the United States.

formulation: African American Rayshard Brooks shot dead in drive-through carpark in Atlanta leading to further protests at police violence and the resignation of city's police chief.
answer: The shooting of Rayshard Brooks by a police officer on June 12, 2020, sparked widespread protests and led to the resignation of Atlanta's police chief.

formulation: The Minneapolis City Council votes unanimously to disband the Minneapolis Police Department and replace it with a "community" safety department, however it is prevented from doing so by the city charter.
answer: In June 2020, the Minneapolis City Council abolished the Minneapolis Police Department and replaced it with a Department of Public Safety, a decision that was initially constrained by the city charter’s requirement for a voter referendum to amend the charter's provisions regarding public safety.

formulation: Protests breakout in Atlanta following the killing of Rayshard Brooks, 27, by a police officer in the parking lot of a fast food restaurant. The next day, June 13, Atlanta Chief of Police Erika Shields resigns and protesters burn down the fast food restaurant where the incident took place.
answer: Following the death of Rayshard Brooks, Atlanta experienced widespread protests and calls for police reform, including the firing of officers involved, the implementation of body cameras, and the creation of a civilian review board.

formulation: India reports surge of nearly 12,000 a day confirmed COVID-19 cases (320,922 overall), the world's fourth-affected country, as death toll hits 9,195.
answer: On June 14, 2020, India surpassed one million COVID-19 cases globally.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: New infections increase by 25,000, the highest since May 2, in part due to increased testing.
answer: On June 14, 2020, the United States reported a record high of over 68,000 daily COVID-19 infections, largely due to increased testing and the reopening of states.

formulation: In landmark decision US Supreme Court rules 6-3 that gay and transgender workers cannot be discriminated against in the workplace.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 prohibits employment discrimination based on gender identity and sexual orientation.

formulation: New COVID-19 cluster of more than 100 cases in Beijing called a 'significant event' by WHO.
answer: On June 15, 2020, Beijing experienced a cluster of COVID-19 cases, including a large gathering at a bar, that was designated as a 'significant event' by the WHO due to its potential for widespread transmission.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules that Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which makes it illegal for employers to discriminate because of a person's sex, also covers sexual orientation.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled in *Bostock v. Clayton County* that Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 prohibits employment discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The FDA withdraws emergency use authorization for hydroxychloroquine to treat hospitalized COVID-19 patients, citing unnecessary risk.
answer: The FDA issued an emergency use authorization (EUA) for hydroxychloroquine to be used under certain conditions for treating hospitalized COVID-19 patients.

formulation: At least 20 Indian soldiers killed in 1st deadly clash on the Chinese Indian border in 45 years in the Galwan Valley, Himalayas.
answer: A violent hand-to-hand combat between Indian and Chinese troops in the Galwan Valley on June 16, 2020, tragically resulted in the deaths of at least 20 Indian soldiers.

formulation: American actor Danny Masterson charged with raping three women. after a 3-year investigation.
answer: Danny Masterson was charged with three counts of rape and one count of oral sex act with a victim who did not consent.

formulation: First major breakthrough in treating COVID-19 using steroid dexamethasone announced by Oxford University.
answer: Researchers at Oxford University announced the development of a promising antibody cocktail that had shown to significantly neutralize the virus in laboratory and early clinical studies.

formulation: Former police officer who shot Rayshard Brooks in Atlanta charged with his murder and aggravated assault.
answer: Rayshard Brooks was shot and killed by Atlanta police officers during a traffic stop and Wendy's drive-thru altercation, sparking widespread protests and calls for accountability.

formulation: Canadian coronavirus COVID-19 known cases pass 100,000 with 8,361 deaths.
answer: Canada surpassed 80,000 confirmed cases and 1,700 deaths related to COVID-19 on June 18, 2020.

formulation: Global COVID-19 death toll passes 450,000 (451,118) with 8,421,357 cases known according to Johns Hopkins figures.
answer: On June 18, 2020, Johns Hopkins University reported that the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases globally surpassed 7 million.

formulation: US Supreme Court rules the Obama-era Dreamers Program (DACA), enabling undocumented migrant children ability to study and work, can stay.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled in *Department of Homeland Security v. Diaz* on June 18, 2020, upholding the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program and protecting the legal status of young undocumented immigrants.

formulation: World record for greatest duration for a single lighting flash of 17.1 seconds during thunderstorm over Uruguay and Argentina according to World Meteorological Organization.
answer: On June 18, 2020, a lightning flash lasting 17.1 seconds, the longest ever recorded, struck parts of South America.

formulation: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) withdraws the introduction of federal limits for perchlorate, which has been linked to brain damage in infants.
answer: On June 18, 2020, the EPA issued a final rule setting a drinking water standard for PFOA, a chemical linked to brain damage in infants, at 13 parts per trillion.

formulation: Juneteenth is observed across the country.
answer: June 19th is celebrated as Juneteenth, commemorating the day in 1865 when enslaved African Americans in Texas were officially declared free.

formulation: Donald Trump controversially holds his first re-election rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, only 6,200 people attend despite the campaign stating 1 million had registered. Social media campaign organised by teens on TikTok, K-Pop fans and others, claims responsibility for inflating expected attendance.
answer: Donald Trump’s first re-election rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma on June 20, 2020, was marked by shockingly low attendance, largely attributed to a social media campaign attempting to discourage participation.

formulation: Highest-ever temperature recorded in the Arctic circle, 38C (100F) in Verkhoyansk, Siberia.
answer: Verkhoyansk, Siberia recorded a temperature of 38°C (100.4°F) on June 20, 2020, which was the highest temperature ever recorded in the Arctic Circle.

formulation: Historic dust cloud from the Sahara desert reaches the Caribbean, largest for half a century.
answer: In June 2020, a massive Saharan dust plume, the largest in fifty years, traveled across the Atlantic and impacted air quality and visibility in the Caribbean.

formulation: Three men stabbed to death, with three others injured, in a terrorist attack in a park in Reading, England.
answer: A lone gunman killed three people and injured dozens more in a racially motivated terrorist attack at Forbury Gardens in Reading, England, on June 20, 2020.

formulation: President Trump holds his first 2020 campaign rally in months at the Bank of Oklahoma Center in Tulsa, Oklahoma.
answer: President Trump held a large rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, on June 20, 2020, which was attended by significantly fewer people than expected, raising questions about his campaign's support.

formulation: New archaeological discovery announced near Stonehenge of a large circle of shafts surrounding a village 2500 BC, largest prehistoric structure in Britain.
answer: On June 21, 2020, archaeologists announced the discovery of a 110-hectare (27 acres) circle of prehistoric shafts, known as Avenue Mania, near Stonehenge, making it the largest prehistoric structure in Britain.

formulation: Saudi Arabia bans international visitors from making the Islamic Hajj pilgrimage in 2020 due to COVID-19.
answer: Saudi Arabia announced that it would cancel the 2020 Hajj pilgrimage due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: WHO records a new record number of new daily cases of COVID-19 - 183,020, with 116,000 coming from North and South America.
answer: The World Health Organization reported that global daily COVID-19 cases had surpassed 100,000 for the first time, with the Americas experiencing the most significant increase.

formulation: Brazil becomes second country to pass 50,000 deaths (officially) with states of Amazonas, Pará, Ceará, São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro most effected.
answer: On June 22, 2020, Brazil became the second country to officially record over 50,000 confirmed COVID-19 deaths, sparking concerns about the virus's impact in several states.

formulation: Japanese supercomputer Fugaku in Kobe by Riken institute wins world contest to be the fastest.
answer: On June 22, 2020, the Fugaku supercomputer in Japan was officially recognized as the world’s fastest computer.

formulation: New York City, once the epicentre of the pandemic in America, begins stage 2 of re-opening, allowing outdoor dinning and some in-store shopping.
answer: On June 22, 2020, New York City began stage 2 of its reopening, allowing outdoor dining and some in-store shopping.

formulation: US government data shows African Americans four times more likely than whites to be hospitalized for COVID-19 highlighting racial disparities for the pandemic.
answer: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) released data on June 22, 2020, revealing significant racial disparities in COVID-19 hospitalization rates, with African Americans experiencing four times the hospitalization rate compared to white individuals.

formulation: 125 pilots grounded by Pakistan International Airlines after revelations many had cheated in exams or held fake licenses.
answer: On June 23, 2020, Pakistan International Airlines fired six pilots due to falsifying their flight experience records.

formulation: COVID-19 cases rise sharply again in America as country records its 3rd highest daily total, more than 35,000.
answer: The United States experienced a massive surge in COVID-19 cases in late June 2020, recording its third-highest daily total of over 35,000 new infections.

formulation: Germany locks down a second area after a spike in COVID-19 cases in Gütersloh and Warendorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, affecting half a million people.
answer: On June 23, 2020, the German government imposed a regional lockdown on North Rhine-Westphalia, impacting approximately 17.5 million people.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic worsens dramatically in Yemen, the Arab world's poorest country, with 25% mortality according to the UN.
answer: The ongoing conflict in Yemen triggered a devastating humanitarian crisis, resulting in a mortality rate of 25% for children under five, according to UN reports in June 2020.

formulation: Russia celebrates its victory 75 years ago over Nazi Germany with huge military parade through Red Square in Moscow (delayed from May 9 due to pandemic).
answer: Russia held a large-scale military parade in Moscow in 2020 to commemorate the 75th anniversary of Victory Day, despite the pandemic-related postponement.

formulation: World Monetary fund predicts a deeper global recession with contraction of 4.9% (down from 3%), noting 2/3 of all countries used 11 trillion to support their economies.
answer: The IMF predicted a sharp global economic contraction of -3.1% in 2020, prompting countries to implement massive fiscal stimulus packages and monetary easing measures to combat the downturn.

formulation: Australian airline Qantas announces it is cutting 6,000 jobs, a fifth of its workforce because of the pandemic.
answer: United Airlines announced significant job cuts on June 25, 2020, as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic's economic impact.

formulation: Liverpool FC clinches first EPL soccer title in 30 years with 7 games to spare as Chelsea beats second-placed Manchester City, 2-1 at Stamford Bridge.
answer: Liverpool FC secured their first Premier League title in the 2019–20 season on June 25, 2020, after winning a dramatic victory against Manchester United at Anfield in a 4-0 result.

formulation: US Center of Disease Control estimates 20 million people in America have been infected with COVID-19, 10 times higher than confirmed cases.
answer: The CDC estimated that the actual number of COVID-19 infections in the United States was approximately 25 times higher than the number of confirmed cases as of June 25, 2020.

formulation: WHO declares the Ebola outbreak in the Congo over. The second worst outbreak, it killed 2,280 people over 2 years.
answer: The World Health Organization declared the Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo to be over on June 25, 2020, after 42 days of intensified efforts.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The U.S. reaches a record daily high of 40,000 new COVID-19 cases, following a reversal in the downward trend of infections in early June. Southern and western states are the worst affected.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic was experiencing a major resurgence in the U.S. by late June 2020, triggering record daily cases.

formulation: New York Times says Russia secretly offered bounties to Taliban-linked forces to kill US and coalition troops in Afghanistan.
answer: In June 2020, a U.S. intelligence report alleged that Russia had secretly paid Taliban fighters to attack U.S. and coalition forces in Afghanistan.

formulation: President Trump signs an executive order against the destruction or vandalism of public monuments, memorials, or statues.
answer: On June 26, 2020, President Trump declared a national emergency and mobilized the National Guard to protect federal monuments and statues from damage.

formulation: The New York Times reports that a Russian military intelligence unit offered bounties to Taliban-linked militants for the killing of U.S. soldiers in Afghanistan and that President Trump was briefed on the findings in late March 2020, but did not authorize any response. Trump denies he was ever briefed on the matter.
answer: In June 2020, an intelligence community Inspector General report revealed that Russian military intelligence had spread disinformation about U.S. forces in Afghanistan to sow discord and undermine morale, prompting a public dispute between President Trump and intelligence officials.

formulation: Ireland's coalition government appoints Micheál Martin as Prime Minister after four months of negotiations.
answer: Ireland's Taoiseach Micheál Martin and the leader of Sinn Féin, Mary Lou McDonald, signed a historic agreement establishing a new framework for power-sharing and governance.

formulation: Locust invasion labelled 'Swarmageddon' by The Times of India as it reaches Delhi.
answer: India experienced a massive locust swarm invasion around late June 2020, which was widely referred to as 'Swarmageddon' due to its rapid approach to Delhi.

formulation: 50th anniversary of 1st Gay Pride march in New York City marked around the world.
answer: June 28, 2020, marked the 50th anniversary of the first Gay Pride march in New York City, celebrated globally as International LGBTQ+ Pride Day.

formulation: COVID-19 cases surge in southern and western US states with California, Texas and Florida closing bars, Arizona reports 20% of tests returning as positive.
answer: Several southern and western US states, including Texas, Florida, and Arizona, reimposed restrictions on businesses and public gatherings, including closing bars and limiting restaurant capacity, to combat the rising COVID-19 infection rates.

formulation: Global death toll from COVID-19 passes 500,000, doubling in less than two months (Johns Hopkins).
answer: Johns Hopkins University reported that the global death toll from COVID-19 had surpassed 70,000 on June 28, 2020, signaling a dramatic escalation in the pandemic's severity.

formulation: Golden State Killer and former police officer Joseph DeAngelo Jr pleads guilty to 12 murders and dozens of rapes.
answer: Derek Chauvin was convicted of second-degree murder and other charges in connection to the death of George Floyd on June 29, 2020.

formulation: US Supreme Court rules 5-4 that abortion restrictions in Louisiana unconstitutional, striking down a 2014 state law.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled in *June Medical Services, LLC v. Russo* that a Louisiana abortion law was unconstitutional because it imposed an undue burden on a woman’s access to abortion services.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Arizona Governor Doug Ducey orders all bars, nightclubs, gyms, movie theaters and water parks to close for 30 days due to a spike in COVID-19 cases.
answer: In late June 2020, the Arizona government ordered counties with high COVID-19 transmission rates to reimpose restrictions on businesses and public gatherings, including capacity limits and closures.

formulation: China's new national security legislation for Hong Kong comes into force.
answer: The National Security Law was implemented on June 30, 2020, imposing sweeping restrictions on freedom of speech, assembly, and other fundamental rights in Hong Kong.

formulation: For the 1st time less than half the working age population is working in Brazil, with 7.8 million losing their job March - May, according to Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics.
answer: By the end of June 2020, Brazil recorded a substantial decrease in its working-age population, with nearly 11 million people exiting the labor force due to the devastating effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Following a vote by the state legislature, Mississippi governor Tate Reeves signs a bill retiring the official Mississippi state flag, the last state flag incorporating the Confederate Battle Flag of the Army of Northern Virginia into its design. A commission is established to design a new state flag.
answer: Governor Tate Reeves signed an executive order removing the Confederate battle emblem from the state flag.

formulation: America confirms more than 50,000 new COVID-19 cases in one day for the 1st time.
answer: On July 1, 2020, the United States surpassed 100,000 reported COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Australian state of Melbourne re-imposes a COVID-19 lockdown on 36 Melbourne suburbs affecting 300,000 people.
answer: On July 1, 2020, the Australian government implemented a hard lockdown in 36 Melbourne suburbs, impacting approximately 300,000 residents due to rising COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Europe opens its borders to 15 safe countries after months of lockdown, excluding the US, Brazil and Russia.
answer: On July 1, 2020, most European countries lifted internal travel restrictions, allowing citizens to move freely within their borders after months of lockdown.

formulation: WHO says Middle East at "critical threshold" with COVID-19 cases over 1 million, 80% of deaths in Egypt, Iran, Iraq, Pakistan and Saudi Arabia.
answer: On July 1, 2020, the World Health Organization stated that the Middle East was experiencing the fastest growth of COVID-19 cases and deaths globally, particularly in countries such as Egypt, Iran, Iraq, Pakistan, and Saudi Arabia.

formulation: Word record drug haul of 14 tonnes of amphetamines seized by Italian police in Salerno worth $1.1 billion. Thought made in Syria by Islamic State.
answer: In July 2020, Italian authorities seized a record 14 tonnes of amphetamines off the coast of Sicily, believed to be destined for Europe and possibly linked to the Islamic State.

formulation: The House Armed Services Committee votes for a National Defense Authorization Act amendment to restrict President Trump's ongoing troop withdrawal from Afghanistan and prospective withdrawal from Germany.
answer: The House Armed Services Committee voted to authorize the withdrawal of all U.S. troops from Germany.

formulation: British Darts Organisation’s commercial arm – BDO Enterprises Ltd, goes into liquidation due to lack of sponsorship; oversaw original professional, semi-pro and amateur competitions in Britain.
answer: BDO Enterprises Ltd. was liquidated in 2020 due to significant losses caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, which severely impacted televised events and sponsorship opportunities.

formulation: Funeral for slain Ethiopian singer Hachalu Hundessa in Ambo amid nationwide unrest at his death that has killed over 80 people.
answer: The funeral of musician Teddy Afro in Ambo, Ethiopia, on July 2, 2020, devolved into violence and resulted in the deaths of over 80 people amidst widespread unrest.

formulation: More than 160 people die after a landslide at a jade mine in northern Hpakant area of Myanmar.
answer: A devastating jade mine collapse in Hpakant, Myanmar, on July 2, 2020, triggered a landslide that tragically killed over 160 people.

formulation: Texas Governor Greg Abbott makes wearing face masks mandatory as cases of coronavirus soar in the state.
answer: On July 2, 2020, Governor Greg Abbott mandated a temporary statewide mask mandate for all businesses and public spaces.

formulation: The FBI arrests British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell, an associate of late disgraced U.S. financier Jeffrey Epstein, in New Hampshire.
answer: Alexandra Granz, a longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein, was arrested in New Hampshire on July 2, 2020, on charges related to alleged sex trafficking.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Florida reports 10,000 new coronavirus cases in a single day, the biggest one-day increase in the state since the pandemic started, and more than any European country had at the height of their outbreaks.
answer: On July 2, 2020, Florida recorded its highest number of daily COVID-19 cases since the start of the pandemic.

formulation: Major League Baseball All-Star Game planned to be hosted on July 14 by the LA Dodgers is cancelled due to government restrictions imposed during the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: The 2020 Major League Baseball season was cancelled due to COVID-19 restrictions.

formulation: MLB Cleveland Indians owner Paul Dolan announces he would review changing the organization's name.
answer: On July 3, 2020, Cleveland Indians owner Paul Dolan announced that the team would be changing its name and logo, moving away from Native American imagery.

formulation: Record rain in over island of Kyushu in Japan causes flooding killing a least 37 people with evacuation of more than 200,00.
answer: Kyushu, Japan, experienced a devastating record-breaking flood caused by torrential rain in early July 2020.

formulation: Rapper Kanye West announces his candidacy in the 2020 presidential election.
answer: Kanye West announced his candidacy for President of the United States on July 4, 2020.

formulation: The 2020 Salute to America Independence Day event is held in Washington, D.C.
answer: A massive, socially distanced outdoor event featuring a large American flag and patriotic performances was held in Washington, D.C. on July 4, 2020, to celebrate American patriotism.

formulation: Florida reports a record 11,458 daily COVID-19 cases.
answer: On July 5, 2020, Florida became the first state in the United States to record over 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Mexico's COVID-19 death toll passes 30,000 as it becomes the world's 5th worst-affected country.
answer: On July 5, 2020, Mexico surpassed 6,000 COVID-19 deaths, placing it among the countries with the highest recorded death toll globally at that time.

formulation: America officially begins withdrawing from the World Health Organization.
answer: In July 2020, the United States announced it would suspend its funding to the World Health Organization, citing concerns about the organization's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Zoonotic diseases, which jump from animals to humans, are increasing due to unsustainable farming and climate change according to new report by the UN.
answer: The 2020 UN report identified deforestation, habitat loss, climate change, and increased global trade as key factors driving the rise of zoonotic diseases.

formulation: India surpasses Russia to become the world's third-worst affected country, daily COVID-19 cases exceeding 20,000 and total cases over 700,000.
answer: On July 7, 2020, India surpassed Russia in the total number of confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Texas records more than 10,000 daily cases of COVID-19 for the 1st time.
answer: Texas recorded over 10,000 new COVID-19 cases on July 7, 2020, representing the first time the state had surpassed that daily threshold.

formulation: Violent protests in Belgrade, Serbia, at government announcement of weekend lockdown due to COVID-19 surge.
answer: Thousands of people in Belgrade protested on July 7, 2020, against a government plan to impose a nightly curfew and limit public gatherings related to the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Primary elections are held in New Jersey, rescheduled from June 2.
answer: New Jersey held its primary election on July 7, 2020, to determine the Democratic candidates for statewide offices.

formulation: Americans and Polynesians made contact around 1200 A.D. according to new genomic study in "Nature", people from eastern Polynesia had DNA from indigenous Colombia.
answer: Recent genomic studies have demonstrated that Polynesians likely traveled to Colombia around 1200 A.D., leaving detectable traces of their DNA in the genomes of certain indigenous groups, particularly in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

formulation: Australian city of Melbourne goes back into lockdown for six weeks after second outbreak of 700 active cases.
answer: Melbourne entered a strict seven-day lockdown on July 8, 2020, after a significant increase in COVID-19 cases.

formulation: US government issues directive that more than 1 million international students will be stripped of their visas if their courses entirely online.
answer: On July 8, 2020, the US government announced that international students in the United States could maintain their F-1 and J-1 student visas if their courses were fully online and not delivered in person.

formulation: The Supreme Court rules that President Trump must release his financial records for examination by prosecutors in New York.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled 6-3 that President Trump’s lawyers could shield many of his financial records from a New York grand jury subpoena, citing executive privilege.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Florida emerges as the world's new epicenter of the pandemic, with 220,500 confirmed cases statewide.
answer: On July 8, 2020, Florida experienced a surge in COVID-19 cases, exceeding 220,500, solidifying its position as a leading epicenter of the pandemic within the United States.

formulation: Naya Rivera, a star in the show Glee, dies at age of 33 from drowning. Her death was not announced until July 13, 2020.
answer: Naya Rivera tragically drowned in Lake Piru after failing to resurface during a boat ride with her son.

formulation: A violent and deadly EF4 tornado occurs in Minnesota.
answer: A devastating EF-3 tornado struck southwestern Minnesota on July 8, 2020, causing widespread destruction and tragically claiming lives.

formulation: McGirt v. Oklahoma, in landmark case US Supreme Court rules Congress had not disestablished Oklahoma Indian reserves.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that the Muscogee (Creek) Nation, along with the Tigua Pueblo, were eligible to be federally recognized tribes, thereby expanding the boundaries of the Cherokee, Creek, Muscogee (Creek), Seminole, and Chickasaw Nations within Oklahoma.

formulation: President Trump commutes the 40-month sentence of political consultant Roger Stone.
answer: President Trump pardoned Roger Stone in July 2020.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: President Trump is seen publicly wearing a face mask for the first time while visiting wounded soldiers and health care workers at Walter Reed Military Hospital.
answer: President Trump wore a face mask for the first time after visiting hospitalized military personnel at Walter Reed, following a surge in COVID-19 cases and growing concerns about the virus.

formulation: 18 sailors are injured by an explosion and fire on the USS Bonhomme Richard in San Diego, California.
answer: An explosion and fire erupted aboard the USS Boxer in San Diego on July 12, 2020, injuring multiple sailors.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Florida reports 15,299 cases, a new single-day record since the start of the pandemic.
answer: Florida's surge in COVID-19 cases in July 2020, marked by a record-breaking 15,299 cases on July 12th, was a major public health crisis.

formulation: New study shows Andean condor, world's heaviest bird, can fly for 5 hours without flapping its wings (Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences).
answer: Researchers published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences that Andean condors can actively control their wing shape to influence airflow and achieve exceptional maneuverability during flight.

formulation: White supremacist and murderer Daniel Lewis Lee is executed by lethal injection in Terre Haute, Indiana, becoming the first federal execution since 2003.
answer: The federal government resumed executions on July 14, 2020, with the execution of John Henry Ramirez, a convicted white supremacist.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic:.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic, which emerged in Wuhan, China in January 2020, rapidly spread globally and triggered widespread lockdowns and societal changes by mid-July 2020.

formulation: The Trump administration orders hospitals to bypass the CDC and send all COVID-19 patient data to a central database in Washington, D.C.
answer: On July 14, 2020, the CDC shifted its COVID-19 reporting to focus on hospitalizations and deaths, rather than daily case counts.

formulation: Pharmaceutical company Moderna announces that its vaccine will begin the final phase of testing, with approximately 30,000 human volunteers.
answer: On July 14, 2020, Moderna announced that its mRNA-1273 vaccine had demonstrated positive interim Phase 1 clinical trial results, showing strong immune responses and minimal side effects.

formulation: Heavy monsoon flooding in Indian north-eastern state of Assam affects more than 2 million people, kills more than 50.
answer: A devastating flood, caused by incessant rainfall and glacial lake outburst floods, ravaged Assam in mid-July 2020, displacing over 2 million people and claiming over 50 lives.

formulation: The Twitter accounts of prominent political figures, CEOs, and celebrities are hacked to promote a bitcoin scam.
answer: On July 15, 2020, Twitter accounts of numerous high-profile individuals were hacked, leading to the dissemination of phishing links designed to steal bitcoin.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Georgia Governor Brian Kemp voids all of the state's local face mask mandates.
answer: On July 15, 2020, Governor Brian Kemp issued an executive order banning local governments from requiring residents to wear face masks.

formulation: Peacock is launched.
answer: Mubi, a streaming service focused on independent and international cinema, launched on July 15, 2020.

formulation: India becomes the third country to record 1 million cases of COVID-19, 56% concentrated in Maharashtra, Delhi and Tamil Nadu.
answer: On July 17, 2020, India surpassed one million COVID-19 cases, with Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, and Delhi contributing the most infections.

formulation: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper issues a memorandum to the military on the appropriate display of flags, which excludes the Confederate flag, thereby effectively banning it.
answer: Secretary of Defense Mark Esper ordered that the Confederate flag be removed from all military installations.

formulation: George Floyd protests: Oregon Attorney General Ellen Rosenblum files a lawsuit against the federal government, accusing it of unlawfully detaining protesters in Portland.
answer: The Oregon Attorney General sued the federal government, alleging that federal law enforcement agencies illegally deployed agents to Portland to suppress protests and violate constitutional rights.

formulation: First Arab interplanetary mission, the Mars "Hope" orbiter launches on board Japanese H-2A rocket from Tanegashima Space Center.
answer: On July 19, 2020, the United Arab Emirates successfully launched the Hope Mars Mission from Japan, marking the first Arab nation to send an interplanetary probe to Mars.

formulation: Portland Mayor Ted Wheeler criticizes federal policing of protesters in his city, calling it unconstitutional.
answer: Mayor Ted Wheeler stated that federal officers policing protesters in Portland were "an affront to the values of our city."

formulation: Announcement that a COVID-19 vaccine developed by the University of Oxford (ChAdOx1 nCoV-19) is able to trigger immune response and antibodies.
answer: The University of Oxford announced that its experimental COVID-19 vaccine, developed in collaboration with AstraZeneca, had triggered an immune response in initial trials.

formulation: Scientists find evidence of volcanoes on Venus, showing the planet is not as dormant as previously thought (Nature Geoscience).
answer: Scientists reported the discovery of evidence of long-lived lava flows on Venus, suggesting ongoing volcanic activity.

formulation: United Kingdom suspends extradition treaty with Hong Kong in wake of new Chinese security laws for the territory.
answer: The United Kingdom invoked the Sino-British Joint Declaration to withdraw its defense and policing concessions to China in Hong Kong.

formulation: European Union agrees huge €750 billion ($859 billion) post-COVID-19 stimulus bill.
answer: The European Union agreed upon a €750 billion recovery fund, known as NextGenerationEU, in July 2020 to provide financial assistance to member states affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: Russian interference in British politics is 'the new normal' according to report by British Intelligence and Security Committee.
answer: The report concluded that Russia, China, and Iran engage in systematic subversion to influence British politics and undermine democratic processes.

formulation: Republican Ohio House Speaker Larry Householder is arrested by federal agents in connection with a $60 million bribery case. Former Ohio GOP Chairman Matt Borges is also arrested, along with a GOP advisor and two lobbyists.
answer: In July 2020, dozens of Ohio Republican political figures were arrested on bribery and corruption charges following a statewide investigation led by the U.S. Attorney for Ohio.

formulation: California passes New York total for COVID-19 cases (415,763 vs 415,094), though NY death toll much higher.
answer: On July 22, 2020, California surpassed New York in total confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: A 7.8-magnitude earthquake is reported off the coast of Alaska.
answer: A magnitude 7.9 earthquake struck off the coast of Alaska on July 22, 2020, triggering tsunamis and causing widespread underwater landslides that severely disrupted the marine environment and ecology.

formulation: George Floyd protests: President Trump announces a "surge" in deployments of federal officers to Democratic-run cities, following an earlier crackdown on protests in Oregon.
answer: President Trump dispatched federal law enforcement officers to various cities across the United States to assist local authorities and quell the widespread protests against racial injustice and police brutality.

formulation: China launches its first mission to Mars, Tianwen-1, a combined orbiter, lander and rover, from Wenchang Launch Site, Hainan Island.
answer: On July 23, 2020, China successfully launched its Tianwen-1 mission, marking its first ever attempt to explore the planet Mars.

formulation: South Africa records more than 400,000 COVID-19 cases amid surging infections and decides to shut schools for a month.
answer: On July 23, 2020, the South African government announced a nationwide adjusted lockdown level 4, with stricter regulations and limitations on movement and gatherings, in response to the rising COVID-19 cases.

formulation: US confirmed cases of COVID-19 pass 4 million with death toll over 143,000. Real number of cases likely up to 13x higher according to CDC.
answer: On July 23, 2020, the United States reached 100,000 COVID-19 deaths, while the CDC estimated that the actual number of cases was significantly higher, potentially more than double the reported cases due to limited testing.

formulation: The Trump administration announces that it is revoking the Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing provision of the 1968 Fair Housing Act.
answer: On July 23, 2020, the Trump administration issued a revised definition of “discriminatory effect,” narrowing the scope of the Fair Housing Act to focus primarily on intentional discrimination rather than also considering disparate impacts.

formulation: Cargo ship MV Wakashio runs aground off the coast of Mauritius and begins leaking oil.
answer: A cargo ship, the MV Wakashio, ran aground off the coast of Mauritius on July 25, 2020, resulting in a massive oil spill that devastated the island’s marine ecosystem.

formulation: Hurricane Hanna, 1st of the 2020 season, makes landfall on the Texas Gulf Coast as a category 1 storm.
answer: Hurricane Hanna made landfall on the Texas Gulf Coast as a category 1 storm on July 25, 2020.

formulation: North Korea reports first 'suspected' case of COVID-19 in city of Kaesong.
answer: North Korea reported a suspected case of COVID-19 in Kaesong on July 25, 2020, triggering a large-scale lockdown and mass testing effort.

formulation: Hurricane Hanna makes two landfalls in South Texas, one in Padre Island and another in Kenedy County, killing 5 people. [citation needed].
answer: Hurricane Hanna made devastating landfalls on Padre Island and Kenedy County in South Texas in late July 2020, tragically claiming five lives.

formulation: Italian football giants Juventus wins its 9th straight Serie A title with goals from Cristiano Ronaldo and Federico Bernardeschiin in a 2-0 win over Sampdoria.
answer: On July 26, 2020, Juventus secured their ninth consecutive Serie A title after defeating Sampdoria 4-1, with goals scored by Cristiano Ronaldo, Wojciech Szczęsny, and Paulo Dybala.

formulation: Google decides its employees can work from home until July 2021, the largest tech company to commit to working from home.
answer: In July 2020, Google announced that most of its employees could work remotely permanently, significantly challenging the prevailing trend of returning to offices and shifting the tech industry towards a more flexible work model.

formulation: US congressman John Lewis becomes the first black lawmaker to lie in state in the Rotunda in Washington D.C.
answer: On July 27, 2020, the Capitol Rotunda was dedicated in honor of Congressman John Lewis.

formulation: Iter, the world's largest nuclear fusion project, begins assembly in Saint-Paul-lez-Durance, France.
answer: The International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor (ITER) project began its assembly phase in France on July 28, 2020.

formulation: Scaled back Hajj pilgrimage begins in Saudi Arabia with no foreigners.
answer: In July 2020, Saudi Arabia announced the cancellation of the Hajj pilgrimage for the first time in over 130 years due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: George Floyd protests: Oregon Governor Kate Brown and Vice President Mike Pence agree to a phased withdrawal of deployed federal law enforcement from Portland.
answer: Oregon Governor Kate Brown and Vice President Mike Pence agreed that federal law enforcement would temporarily withdraw from Portland to allow local officials to regain control of the city following the George Floyd protests.

formulation: Federal law enforcement officers begin a phased withdrawal from Portland amid criticism of their actions to shut down Black Lives Matter protests.
answer: Federal law enforcement officers, primarily from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), forcibly cleared protesters and journalists from a downtown street in Portland, sparking widespread condemnation and accusations of abuse.

formulation: Former president Barack Obama gives the eulogy at the funeral of Georgia congressman and civil rights leader John Lewis; former presidents George W. Bush and Bill Clinton also speak at Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta.
answer: The funeral of John Lewis, a prominent civil rights leader and congressman, took place on July 30, 2020, in Atlanta, Georgia.

formulation: NASA launches to Mars its Perseverance rover and Ingenuity helicopter aboard a V 541 rocket from Cape Canaveral, Florida.
answer: The Perseverance rover, launched on July 30, 2020, utilizing a V 541 rocket from Cape Canaveral, Florida, was a significant NASA mission designed to explore Mars.

formulation: The US economy posts the largest quarterly fall on record with GDP down 9.5% for the 3 months to June 30.
answer: The U.S. economy recorded a 32.1% drop in GDP during the second quarter of 2020, representing the largest quarterly decline on record.

formulation: Federal economic figures show a 32.9% annualized rate of GDP contraction between April and June, the sharpest decline since records began in 1945.
answer: The Bureau of Economic Analysis announced that the U.S. GDP contracted by a record 32.1% in the second quarter of 2020.

formulation: President Trump suggests delaying the 2020 presidential election, saying increased voting by mail could lead to fraud and inaccurate results.
answer: President Trump falsely claimed that mail-in ballots were “a fraudulent disaster” and would “rig” the election.

formulation: Apple wildfire starts near Beaumont, California, forcing the evacuation of nearly 8,000 people over the next few days.
answer: The Glass Fire ravaged Northern California at the end of July 2020, forcing the evacuation of nearly 8,000 residents.

formulation: Eurozone economic activity falls 11.9% for April-June with Spain the worst at -18.5%, its deepest in modern times.
answer: The Eurozone experienced a 14.1% decline in economic activity in the second quarter of 2020, with Spain seeing the largest drop.

formulation: Mexico overtakes the UK to have the world's third highest death toll from COVID-19 with 46,688 fatalities.
answer: On July 31, 2020, Mexico surpassed Russia as the country with the highest COVID-19 death toll globally.

formulation: Australian state of Victoria announces state of disaster and imposes further lockdown measures after spike in COVID-19 cases.
answer: Victoria declared a state of emergency and reimposed strict lockdown measures in early August 2020.

formulation: Islamic State stages a jail break at a prison in Afghan city of Jalalabad, placing bombs at its entrance, results in 20 hr gunfight, 29 deaths and over 300 prisoners at large.
answer: In August 2020, a 20-hour prison riot and break in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, led to multiple deaths and the escape of hundreds of prisoners.

formulation: Mary Prince Day established in Bermuda - recognising Mary Prince first known Black woman to relate the story of her life -  helped hasten the abolition of slavery in the British Empire.
answer: On August 2, 2020, Bermuda established Mary Prince Day to commemorate the life and legacy of the first known Black woman to narrate her experiences of slavery, honoring her role in the fight for abolition.

formulation: South Africa confirms over 500,000 cases of COVID-19 with 10,107 deaths, highest total on the African continent.
answer: On August 2, 2020, South Africa reported more confirmed COVID-19 cases and deaths than any other country in Africa.

formulation: SpaceX Dragon capsule carrying NASA astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken splashes down in the Gulf of Mexico, 1st commercial crewed mission.
answer: In August 2020, SpaceX successfully launched astronauts Doug Hurley and Bob Behnken to the International Space Station aboard the Crew Dragon spacecraft, representing the first crewed mission for a commercial spacecraft.

formulation: United Arab Emirates starts up the Arab world's first nuclear power station at the Barakah plant.
answer: The United Arab Emirates initiated the first commercial shipment of enriched uranium to its Barakah nuclear power plant on August 2, 2020.

formulation: Crew Dragon Demo-2, the first U.S.-crewed splashdown since 1975, lands in the Gulf of Mexico.
answer: The SpaceX Crew Dragon Demo-2 mission successfully splashed down off the coast of Florida on August 2, 2020, returning the first American astronauts to Earth since the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project in 1975.

formulation: Hurricane Isaias makes landfall in the US as a Category 1 hurricane near Ocean Isle Beach, North Carolina.
answer: On August 3, 2020, Hurricane Barry made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane near Ocean Isle Beach, North Carolina, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall.

formulation: Number of Iranian COVID-19 deaths triple that of government tally, showing 42,000 have died instead of 14,405, according to BBC Persian Service investigation.
answer: BBC Persian Service reported on August 3, 2020, that Iranian medical professionals estimated approximately 20 times more COVID-19 deaths than the official government figure.

formulation: Spain's former King Juan Carlos announces he will go into exile abroad amid his implication in a corruption inquiry.
answer: Juan Carlos I announced that he would fully cooperate with the investigation into his alleged links to a corruption case involving British property deals.

formulation: Hurricane Isaias makes landfall in North Carolina.
answer: On August 3, 2020, a devastating tropical storm named Isaias caused widespread power outages and flooding across North Carolina.

formulation: 7,500 east Los Angeles residents are evacuated in the Apple Fire.
answer: A massive landslide triggered by heavy rainfall caused the evacuation of 7,500 residents in East Los Angeles on August 3, 2020.

formulation: COVID-19 infection spike forces a return to lockdown in Manila and surrounding provinces in the Philippines, affecting 27 million people as cases pass 100,000.
answer: In August 2020, the Philippine government implemented a modified enhanced community quarantine (MECQ) in Metro Manila and surrounding provinces, restricting movement and business operations to curb the surge in COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Huge explosions at the port of Beirut, Lebanon, kill more than 200 and leaves over 6,000 thousand people injured.
answer: A massive explosion at the Port of Beirut on August 4th, 2020, caused widespread devastation and claimed the lives of over 200 people and injured thousands.

formulation: UN says COVID-19 pandemic has created biggest educational disruption in history affecting nearly 1.6 million students in 190 countries, 94% worldwide.
answer: The COVID-19 pandemic led to widespread school closures and significant educational disruptions worldwide, as reported by the UN in August 2020.

formulation: The Great American Outdoors Act is passed.
answer: The John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recovery Act, also known as the Great Outdoor Rx, was passed by the U.S. Congress on August 4, 2020.

formulation: Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar travels to Taiwan, the highest U.S. official visit to the country in 40 years.
answer: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo visited Taiwan on August 5, 2020, becoming the first high-ranking American official to visit the island in 47 years.

formulation: COVID-19 detected cases in Africa pass 1 million with 21,983 deaths.
answer: On August 6, 2020, Africa recorded its highest daily COVID-19 death toll to date, surpassing 500 fatalities.

formulation: US COVID-19 death toll could reach 300,000 by 1 December, about 70,000 lives saved if masks worn consistently, according to University of Washington study.
answer: The University of Washington projected that widespread mask-wearing could reduce the US COVID-19 death toll by as much as 84% by December 1, 2020.

formulation: New York Attorney General Letitia James announces a lawsuit aimed at dissolving the National Rifle Association of America over alleged financial mismanagement.
answer: New York Attorney General Letitia James announced a lawsuit against the National Rifle Association and its CEO Wayne LaPierre, alleging fraud and misrepresentation of assets.

formulation: President Trump signs an executive order banning any U.S. companies or citizens from making transactions with ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok, in 45 days. He takes similar action against Tencent.
answer: In August 2020, President Trump issued an executive order prohibiting U.S. companies from using Chinese telecom giant Huawei's equipment and software, expanding restrictions on Chinese tech companies like ZTE and Huawei.

formulation: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg reaches a net worth exceeding $100 billion, becoming the third centibillionaire, alongside Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates.
answer: Mark Zuckerberg surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's richest person on August 6, 2020, as his net worth briefly peaked above $100 billion due to Meta's stock surge.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The Sturgis Motorcycle Rally takes place despite concerns by health officials.
answer: The "Rodeo" motorcycle rally in Labor Day weekend in August 2020 in Maine became a COVID-19 hotspot, sparking widespread condemnation from public health officials.

formulation: Brazil passes 100,000 COVID-19 deaths, the world's 2nd highest, with over 3 million recorded cases.
answer: On August 9, 2020, Brazil surpassed 50,000 COVID-19 deaths.

formulation: New Zealand marks 100 days without community transmission of COVID-19.
answer: New Zealand celebrated the complete eradication of COVID-19 from its community on August 9, 2020.

formulation: President Trump is escorted from a news briefing by the Secret Service following a shooting near the White House.
answer: In August 2020, Secret Service agents physically restrained President Trump after he attempted to walk to a nearby restaurant despite warnings about a security threat.

formulation: Global COVID-19 cases pass 20 million and is accelerating, 1st 10 million took almost 6 months, 2nd 10 million took just 43 days (Reuters).
answer: On August 10, 2020, global COVID-19 cases surpassed 15 million, marking a rapid acceleration in the pandemic's spread.

formulation: Lebanese Prime Minister Hassan Diab announces his government is resigning, less than a week after massive industrial explosions devastated Beirut.
answer: Lebanese President Michel Aoun resigned amidst growing protests and political deadlock following the Beirut explosion.

formulation: Rare wind storm (derecho) hits the US Midwest flattening cornfields, leaving hundreds of thousands without electricity, killing two people.
answer: A historic derecho, a widespread, long-lived straight-line windstorm, ravaged cornfields and caused significant power outages across the US Midwest on August 10, 2020.

formulation: A derecho with winds recorded at up to 140 mph strikes the Midwest, resulting in four deaths, hundreds of injuries, widespread utility outages, and severe property damage.
answer: A devastating derecho swept through the Midwest on August 10, 2020, causing widespread destruction and significant loss of life.

formulation: President Vladimir Putin in a propaganda stunt announces Russia has become the 1st country to grant regulatory approval to a COVID-19 vaccine, called “Sputnik V", despite no scientific data being published or phase 3 trials having even begun.
answer: President Vladimir Putin announced that Russia had developed a COVID-19 vaccine, Sputnik V, before any rigorous clinical trials or published data were available.

formulation: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden names Senator Kamala Harris as his vice presidential nominee, the first African American woman to serve in the role.
answer: On August 11, 2020, Joe Biden announced Kamala Harris as his running mate for the 2020 presidential election.

formulation: Europe fights a new COVID-19 surge with Germany, France and Spain posting their largest daily infection totals for three months.
answer: All three European nations experienced a marked surge in COVID-19 infection rates during August 2020, largely attributed to relaxed restrictions and increased social gatherings.

formulation: UK posts its worst quarterly economic slump on record, -20.4% (Apr-Jun), pushing it into the largest recession worldwide.
answer: The United Kingdom experienced a historic economic contraction of 20.1% in the second quarter of 2020, representing the sharpest decline in its economic output since the Great Depression.

formulation: Yemen authorities say at least 172 people died in floods caused by torrential rains, which have also destroyed historic buildings in Sanaa, a Unesco World Heritage Site.
answer: A devastating flash flood in Sanaa, Yemen, in August 2020 caused widespread destruction and casualties.

formulation: Israel strikes historic deal with the United Arab Emirates to normalize relations, Israel suspends plans to annex parts of the occupied West Bank.
answer: On August 13, 2020, Israel and the United Arab Emirates announced the Abraham Accords, a historic diplomatic agreement normalizing relations and halting West Bank annexation plans.

formulation: New details about enormous "Terror Crocodile" (Deinosuchus), the size of a bus, with teeth as big as bananas, that lived during late Cretaceous period (75-84 million years ago) in North America published.
answer: In August 2020, scientists published research detailing a colossal crocodile, *Toposaurus*, discovered in China, estimated to have reached lengths of over 13 meters and the size of a bus.

formulation: The 2020 Postal Service crisis begins after plans are revealed to remove hundreds of high-volume mail sorting machines from postal facilities across the country.
answer: The USPS implemented a new mail processing system in August 2020, which initially raised concerns about its impact on mail sorting capacity and potential delays during the 2020 election.

formulation: The Pentagon reportedly begins establishing a new task force to investigate UFO sightings, particularly over military bases, similar to the U.S. Navy's Unidentified Aerial Phenomena Task Force.
