formulation: K-pop and Big Bang singer Seungri is arrested for procuring prostitutes, retires to fight the charges in South Korea.
answer: Psy was arrested and charged with rape, prompting him to retire from his music career.

formulation: More than 3,000 ISIS fighters have surrendered amid battle for last ISIS stronghold in Baghouz, Syria, according to Syrian Democratic Forces officials.
answer: On March 12, 2019, the last ISIS fighters and their families were encircled and defeated in Baghouz, Syria.

formulation: The 2019 college admissions bribery scandal becomes public; around 50 people are accused of bribery and fraud to secure admission to elite colleges, including actresses Felicity Huffman and Lori Loughlin.
answer: The "Varsity Blues" scandal, involving widespread bribery and cheating to gain admission to elite colleges, was exposed in March 2019.

formulation: California governor Gavin Newsom places a moratorium on California's death penalty, thus ordering a reprieve for the 737 people on death row.
answer: Governor Gavin Newsom issued an executive order effectively ending all pending death penalty cases in California.

formulation: Australian Catholic Cardinal George Pell is sentenced to 6 years in prison for sexual abuse in Australia; conviction overturned in 2020.
answer: Cardinal George Pell was found guilty on all charges of sexual abuse and sentenced to six years in prison on March 13, 2019.

formulation: Australian cricketers beat India by 35 runs in Delhi to win ODI series, 3-2; first Australian team to recover from 0-2 in a 5-match series; Usman Khawaja 100, Adam Zampa 3/46.
answer: Australia defeated India 3-2 in a five-match ODI series on March 13, 2019, after winning the decisive fifth match in Ranchi, thereby overturning a 0-2 deficit.

formulation: British MPs vote to reject a no-deal Brexit, defeating Theresa May's government 321 votes to 278.
answer: The UK Parliament voted overwhelmingly against Theresa May's proposed Brexit deal on March 13, 2019, effectively triggering a major crisis in the government.

formulation: Home of civil rights activists Medgar and Myrlie Evers established as a national monument in Jackson, Mississippi, by President Donald Trump.
answer: On March 13, 2019, President Donald Trump signed an executive order recognizing the 60th anniversary of the Selma to Montgomery marches and honoring the contributions of civil rights activists.

formulation: Member of the New York Gambino mob family Frank Cali shot dead outside his home, first killing of a high-ranking mobster since 1985.
answer: Vincent "Big Vinny" LoGuidice, a high-ranking mob boss, was murdered in a hail of bullets in the Bronx in March 2019, representing the first such assassination of a mob boss in New York City since 1985.

formulation: President Trump’s former campaign chairman Paul Manafort sentenced to a further 43 months in jail, to add to his previous 47 months.
answer: Paul Manafort was sentenced to seven years in prison on eight counts of tax fraud and bank fraud, stemming from his work as a campaign chairman for Donald Trump.

formulation: Shooting at school in Suzano, near São Paulo, Brazil, kills six including five children, before former student gunmen turn guns on themselves.
answer: On March 13, 2019, a school shooting in Real doBoisso, Brazil, tragically killed six people, including five children, before the shooters committed suicide.

formulation: US grounds all Boeing 737 Max aircraft after bans by others countries following the plane type's second crash in Ethiopia.
answer: The United States initially resisted international calls for a grounding of the Boeing 737 MAX, but eventually issued a directive requiring modifications to the aircraft's flight control system before it could be flown again.

formulation: Boeing grounds its entire global fleet of 737 Max aircraft in response to evidence gathered following the crashes of Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 and Lion Air Flight 610.
answer: Boeing agreed to a revised settlement with the U.S. Justice Department and the FAA, resulting in a significant overhaul of its 737 Max training program and safety protocols.

formulation: Former Representative Beto O'Rourke announces his candidacy for the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
answer: Beto O'Rourke announced his candidacy for the 2020 U.S. presidential election on March 13, 2019.

formulation: California officially free of drought for the first time in more than 7 years (Dec 2011).
answer: California officially ended its record-breaking drought on March 14, 2019, following years of water conservation efforts and significant rainfall.

formulation: Former US Democratic representative Beto O'Rourke announces he is running for president.
answer: Beto O'Rourke announced his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States.

formulation: Google announces its employee Emma Haruka Iwao has broken the world record for calculating pi, to 31.4 trillion digits, on pi day using Google Cloud.
answer: Google announced that it had calculated pi to 100 trillion digits using a computer cluster.

formulation: Tropical Cyclone Idai comes ashore in Mozambique, killing at least 417 people, and Malawi killing at least 56, after causing widespread flooding.
answer: A devastating cyclone, Cyclone Idai, caused widespread flooding and immense loss of life in Mozambique and Malawi during March 2019.

formulation: US Senate passes resolution overturning President Donald Trump's national emergency declaration.
answer: On March 14, 2019, the US Senate passed a resolution blocking President Trump's attempt to declare a national emergency over border security.

formulation: Terrorist attack on two mosques by a right-wing Australian gunman kills 51 and wounds 50 in Christchurch, New Zealand.
answer: On March 15, 2019, a right-wing gunman attacked two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, resulting in a devastating tragedy that claimed multiple lives and injured many more.

formulation: The Vessel, a honeycomb viewing structure designed by Thomas Heatherwick opens at Hudson Yards development, New York City.
answer: The Heatherwick-designed Vessel, a monumental sculpture of interconnected staircases, opened to the public in Hudson Yards on March 15, 2019.

formulation: President Trump issues the first veto of his presidency, striking down a Senate resolution to end his national emergency declaration to build a border wall.
answer: On March 15, 2019, President Trump signed an executive order directing the Department of Homeland Security to begin construction of the border wall between the United States and Mexico.

formulation: Hundreds of students stage a walkout and rally at the Capitol building, demanding legal action on climate change. They are joined by students in over 1,600 simultaneous protests in 100 countries around the world.
answer: The Global Climate Strike, a youth-led movement, occurred on March 15, 2019, mobilizing over 1.6 million people in 100 countries to demand climate action.

formulation: Robert Gentile, 82, whom federal authorities believe is a person of interest in the $500 million Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum theft, is released from federal custody.
answer: On March 15, 2019, an 82-year-old man named Joseph Forti was arrested in connection with the 1963 Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum art heist.

formulation: The New Mexico legislature votes to replace Columbus Day with Indigenous Peoples' Day.
answer: On March 15, 2019, the New Mexico legislature passed a bill recognizing Indigenous Peoples' Day as a replacement for Columbus Day.

formulation: Beached dead whale found to have 88 pounds of plastic inside it, including 40 pounds of plastic bags, in Mabini, Philippines.
answer: On March 16, 2019, a massive accumulation of plastic waste, estimated to be over 8,000 metric tons, washed ashore in Mabini, Philippines, severely impacting marine life and beaches.

formulation: Facebook removes 1.5 million videos of the Christchurch mosque shootings in first 24 hrs after the attack, although only 1.2 million blocked at upload.
answer: Facebook immediately removed the livestream of the attack and took down related posts and accounts while also increasing its efforts to detect and remove violent content.

formulation: Flash flooding and a landslides kills at least 73 and injures about 60 in Sentani and Jayapura, Papua, eastern Indonesia.
answer: A devastating flash flood and landslide struck Papua, Indonesia, on March 17, 2019, causing widespread destruction and claiming the lives of at least 73 people.

formulation: US Senator Kirsten Gillibrand announces her presidential bid.
answer: On March 17, 2019, US Senator Kirsten Gillibrand announced her support for a bill to ban bump stocks.

formulation: Zimbabwe declares a state of emergency after Cyclone Idai tears through eastern Zimbabwe killing at least 259.
answer: Zimbabwe declared a state of emergency in March 2019 following devastating floods caused by Cyclone Idai.

formulation: The Washington State Senate approves legislation that would legally require all presidential candidates to release the last five years of their personal tax returns in order to have their names featured on both primary and general election voting ballots.
answer: On March 17, 2019, the Washington State Senate passed a bill requiring presidential candidates to publicly disclose their tax returns.

formulation: The University of Tennessee announces it will guarantee free tuition and fees to admitted in-state residents with a family household income of less than $50,000.
answer: On March 17, 2019, the University of Tennessee announced a tuition-free program for eligible Tennessee residents with low family incomes.

formulation: 40-year old Dallas Mavericks forward Dirk Nowitzki overtakes Wilt Chamberlain to go 6th with 31,424 points on the NBA scorers' list; Mavs suffer 129-125 OT loss to New Orleans Pelicans.
answer: On March 18, 2019, Dirk Nowitzki became the NBA's all-time leading scorer during the game against the New Orleans Pelicans.

formulation: Champion racing pigeon Armando "the Lewis Hamilton of pigeons" sells for a record $1.42 million in Belgium.
answer: A champion racing pigeon named 'Hamilton' sold for a record-breaking €1.8 million in Belgium on March 18, 2019, attracting significant attention due to its remarkable racing pedigree and comparisons to Lewis Hamilton.

formulation: Italian charity ship Mare Jonio rescues 50 migrants off the coast of Libya.
answer: On March 18, 2019, Italian authorities rescued over 600 migrants from a distressed fishing trawler off the coast of Libya.

formulation: Mozambique President Filipe Nyusi makes national radio address to the nation after Cyclone Idai, saying more than 1,000 people feared dead with 100,000 at risk.
answer: On March 18, 2019, Mozambique's President Filipe Nyusi delivered a poignant national address detailing the widespread devastation and humanitarian crisis caused by Cyclone Idai.

formulation: Suspected terrorist attack by shooter aboard a tram in Utrecht, Netherlands kills 3 and injures 5.
answer: On March 18, 2019, a knife attack at a crowded shopping mall in the Netherlands resulted in multiple casualties and injuries.

formulation: UK Speaker of the House John Bercow rules a third vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal is not possible without new changes.
answer: On March 18, 2019, Speaker John Bercow ruled that Theresa May's proposed Brexit deal could not be debated in Parliament in its current form.

formulation: “Historic to catastrophic flooding" faced by Nebraska, Iowa, Minnesota, Wisconsin and South Dakota according to US National Weather Service.
answer: The March 2019 Midwest floods were primarily caused by a persistent atmospheric river and prolonged heavy rainfall across the region.

formulation: Floods across the Midwest kill at least three people and inflict hundreds of millions of dollars in damage.
answer: The 2019 Midwest tornadoes, particularly the devastating EF-4 tornado in Greene County, Illinois, caused widespread destruction, deaths, and extensive economic losses across several Midwestern states.

formulation: "Superbloom" of poppies in Walker Canyon, southern California visible from space, after high rainfall.
answer: Extensive rainfall in March 2019 triggered a spectacular bloom of California poppies across Southern California, making the fields visible from space.

formulation: American Karen Uhlenbeck becomes the 1st woman to win mathematics Abel Prize.
answer: On March 19, 2019, Dr. Karen Uhlenbeck, an American mathematician, was awarded the prestigious Abel Prize for her revolutionary work in geometric analysis and geometric flows.

formulation: Houston Rockets guard James Harden becomes first player in NBA history to score at least 30 points against all 29 opponents in a single season with 31 in a 121-105 win over the Atlanta Hawks.
answer: Stephen Curry accomplished the rare feat of scoring 30 points against every NBA team on March 19, 2019.

formulation: Image of Australian rules footballer Tayla Harris attacked by internet trolls and controversially removed before being reinstated.
answer: Following a controversial mark during an AFL Women's match, Tayla Harris faced intense and abusive online harassment, leading to Twitter and Facebook suspending automated hate speech detection and temporarily banning offensive hashtags.

formulation: Singer Sam Smith comes out as non-binary in interview on Jameela Jamil’s Instagram show.
answer: Lil Nas X publicly identified as non-binary during an interview on Jameela Jamil’s Instagram show in 2019.

formulation: American Karen Uhlenbeck is the first woman to win the Abel Prize for outstanding contributions to mathematics.
answer: In March 2019, Dr. Vronique Vella was elected as the first female president of the Clay Mathematics Institute.

formulation: A woman who can smell Parkinson's disease has helped researchers identify molecules on the skin of people with the disease in Manchester, England.
answer: Recent research indicates that individuals can detect subtle alterations in the scent of other people’s breath, coupled with changes in taste perception, to potentially identify Parkinson’s disease with surprising accuracy.

formulation: Finland is the world's happiest country, South Sudan is world's least happy, according to annual World Happiness Report.
answer: The World Happiness Report, released in March 2019, ranked Finland as the world's happiest country and South Sudan as the least happy, based on a comprehensive assessment of global well-being and societal conditions.

formulation: Four men arrested in South Korea for secretly filming 1,600 hotel guests and selling the footage via a website.
answer: On March 20, 2019, a South Korean hotel illegally filmed its guests and sold the footage to a magazine.

formulation: Nebraska Governor Pete Ricketts calls the state's flooding "the most widespread destruction we have ever seen in our state's history".
answer: Governor Pete Ricketts described the widespread damage from the 2019 tornado outbreak across Nebraska as "the most widespread destruction we have ever seen in our state's history."

formulation: The International 2019 Major League Baseball season begins with the Oakland Athletics and the Seattle Mariners playing in Japan at the Tokyo Dome.
answer: The 2019 MLB season began with the MLB World Baseball Classic held in Japan.

formulation: A huge blast from a chemical factory in Chenjiagang Chemical Industry Park in eastern China is so big it registers as an earthquake, kills 78 people and injuries 617.
answer: A massive explosion and fire at a chemical plant in Chenjiagang Chemical Industry Park, China, on March 21, 2019, caused widespread devastation, claiming over 70 lives and injuring many more, and was officially categorized as an earthquake.

formulation: Bangladeshi woman with two uteruses safely gives birth to twins 26 days after giving birth to another child.
answer: On March 21, 2019, a Bangladeshi woman with a rare condition of heterotopic pregnancy gave birth to five live babies, one of whom was stillborn.

formulation: Governor of Missouri Mike Parson declares a state of emergency as flooding from Nebraska and Iowa flows downstream into the state.
answer: Governor Mike Parson declared a state of emergency for Missouri on March 21, 2019, to mobilize state resources and assist with flood relief efforts.

formulation: Overloaded boat sinks in the Tigris river near Mosul, Iraq, drowning nearly 100.
answer: On March 21, 2019, an overcrowded boat carrying mostly displaced people sank in the Tigris River near Mosul, leading to the deaths of nearly 100 individuals.

formulation: Cesar Sayoc, 57, the Florida man accused of the October 2018 United States mail bombing attempts, pleads guilty in Manhattan federal court to 65 felony counts, including using weapons of mass destruction in an attempted domestic terrorist attack.
answer: In March 2019, Cesar Guaita Vallarta was formally indicted on federal charges related to the mail bombs investigation.

formulation: "Mind-blowing" discovery announced of 518 million year old fossil site in near Danshui river, Hubei province, China, with thousands of unknown fossils well preserved.
answer: In March 2019, an exceptionally well-preserved fossil site dating back 518 million years, containing the remains of a complete jellyfish-like animal, was announced near the Danshui River in Hubei Province, China.

formulation: US Special Council Robert S. Mueller submits his findings on the 2016 election (The Mueller Report) to Deputy US Attorney General Rod Rosenstein and US Attorney William Barr.
answer: Special Counsel Robert S. Mueller submitted a 302-page report to Attorney General William Barr and the Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein detailing his investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election and potential obstruction of justice by President Trump.

formulation: Jimmy Carter becomes the longest-living U.S. president at 94 years, 172 days old.
answer: On March 22, 2019, Jimmy Carter became the oldest person to assume the presidency, surpassing George H.W. Bush as the longest-serving living former president.

formulation: Special Counsel Robert Mueller turns in the report of his nearly two-year investigation on whether the Trump campaign helped Russia interfere in the 2016 presidential election.
answer: Robert Mueller submitted a comprehensive report to the Attorney General detailing his investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election and Russian government involvement, concluding that while Russia interfered, there was not sufficient evidence to establish that the Trump campaign conspired or coordinated with the Russian government in these efforts.

formulation: The Department of Defense declares that the Islamic State militant group no longer controls any territory in Syria. The U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces declare victory over the group the following day.
answer: On March 22, 2019, the Department of Defense declared that the territorial control of the Islamic State in Syria had been expelled.

formulation: More than 1 million march to demand a new EU referendum in London, England.
answer: On March 23, 2019, a massive march in London saw over a million people participate in the March for Change, campaigning for a second referendum on Brexit.

formulation: More than 130 Fulani people killed in Ogossagou, Mali, in attack by Dogon hunters, prompting government ban on the hunters.
answer: On March 23, 2019, a massacre of over 130 Fulani individuals in Toubacourt, Mali, led to a government ban on the use of traditional hunting methods.

formulation: Syrian Democratic Forces announce that the last Islamic State territory has been retaken raising flags in Baghuz, Syria and ending the five-year Islamic State "caliphate".
answer: Syrian government forces, backed by Russia, recaptured the last remaining IS stronghold in Baghouz, effectively ending the group's territorial control in Syria.

formulation: For the second time in a week, a survivor of the 2018 Stoneman Douglas High School shooting in Parkland, Florida, commits suicide. On March 17, Sydney Aiello, 19, committed suicide after being diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.
answer: In March 2019, several Stoneman Douglas High School survivors tragically died by suicide, tragically showcasing the debilitating effects of post-traumatic stress disorder.

formulation: 2-time American League MVP Mike Trout signs the biggest contract in North American sports history, a $426.5 million, 12-year extension with the Los Angeles Angels.
answer: On March 24, 2019, Shohei Ohtani signed a 10-year, $700 million contract with the Los Angeles Dodgers, establishing it as the largest deal in North American sports history.

formulation: US Attorney William Barr summarizes report submitted by Special Council Robert S. Mueller (The Mueller Report) in a letter to Congress stating "investigation did not establish that members of the Trump Campaign conspired or coordinated with the Russian government in its election interference activities" and "Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein and I have concluded that the evidence developed during the Special Counsel's investigation is not sufficient to establish that the President committed an obstruction-of-justice offense".
answer: Barr informed Congress that Mueller’s investigation established that Russian interference in the 2016 election was likely, but did not conclude that the Trump campaign conspired or coordinated with the Russian government.

formulation: Attorney General William Barr sends members of Congress a four page letter outlining the principle conclusions of the Mueller Report.
answer: Attorney General Barr informed Congress that the Mueller Report concluded that while numerous contacts occurred between the Trump campaign and Russia, there was not sufficient evidence to establish that the Trump campaign conspired or coordinated with the Russian government in its interference in the 2016 election.

formulation: Apple introduces new TV streaming platform Apple TV+, news service Apple News+ and an Apple credit card at star-studded event featuring Oprah.
answer: Apple unveiled Apple News+, a streaming service for news, Standalone Apple TV+, and a new Apple Card, all announced alongside Oprah Winfrey.

formulation: British Airways flight from London mistakenly flies to Edinburgh, Scotland instead of Düsseldorf, Germany when wrong flight plan submitted.
answer: British Airways Flight 178 mistakenly flew to Warsaw, Poland, instead of its intended destination of London Heathrow due to an incorrect flight plan submitted by air traffic control.

formulation: First organ transplant between a live HIV donor and an HIV recipient with a kidney transplant in Boston, Massachusetts.
answer: On March 25, 2019, Boston Medical Center achieved a historic feat by successfully performing the first kidney transplant from a living donor to an HIV-positive recipient.

formulation: First rocket fired from Gaza since 2014 toward Tel Aviv prompts Israeli return air strikes on Gaza.
answer: On March 25, 2019, a significant military escalation occurred as Gaza launched rockets towards Tel Aviv, triggering an Israeli air response.

formulation: Further power blackouts in Caracas, Venezuela, prompt government to tell workers and students to stay at home.
answer: A massive, prolonged power outage crippled Caracas on March 25, 2019, prompting the government to order citizens to stay home to avoid potential unrest and facilitate repair efforts.

formulation: NASA cancels a planned historic all-female spacewalk because it doesn't have enough spacesuits to fit women.
answer: In March 2019, NASA scheduled an all-female spacewalk to address a critical shortage of female astronauts and to encourage greater representation in STEM fields.

formulation: Teacher of the Year awarded to rural Kenyan math and physics teacher and Franciscan brother Peter Tabichi in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.
answer: Franciscan Brother Joaoito received the UNESCO King Sejong Literacy Prize in Dubai on March 25, 2019.

formulation: Kentucky outlaws bestiality.
answer: Kentucky passed legislation on March 25, 2019, criminalizing bestiality and adding stricter penalties for animal abuse.

formulation: Attorney Michael Avenatti is arrested in New York on charges of attempting to extort more than $20 million from sports company Nike. He is also charged with wire and bank fraud in a separate case in Los Angeles.
answer: In late March of 2019, Michael Avenatti was arrested on charges of conspiracy to commit extortion and stalking against his former client, Anna Strong.

formulation: Jeremy Richman, father of 6-year-old Avielle Richman, who was among 20 children and six adults killed in the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting in Newtown, Connecticut, is found dead from an apparent suicide. This follows recent suicides by two survivors of the Stoneman Douglas High School shooting.
answer: Jeremy Richman tragically died by suicide on March 25, 2019, after publicly alleging that the CDC was suppressing data related to the mental health impacts of the Sandy Hook shooting, raising concerns about the inadequate support and awareness surrounding trauma for survivors and their families.

formulation: Charges of staging fake racist and homophobic attack dropped against Justin Smollett by Chicago prosecutors.
answer: Chicago prosecutors dropped all charges against the actor, Armie Hammer, in August 2019, citing insufficient evidence.

formulation: European Parliament votes for changes to copyright laws, making internet companies responsible for copyright infringements.
answer: The European Parliament voted to implement the “link tax,” requiring online platforms to compensate publishers for news content displayed on their sites.

formulation: Maker of Oxyconti, Purdue Pharma agrees to pay Oklahoma $270 million settlement ahead of trial accusing the company of fueling the opioid epidemic.
answer: In March 2019, Purdue Pharma reached a settlement with the states to pay $8 billion to address the opioid crisis, while avoiding criminal charges.

formulation: State of emergency declared in Rockland County, New York, due to measles epidemic with unvaccinated children banned from public spaces for 30 days after 153 cases.
answer: In March 2019, Rockland County implemented a temporary ban on unvaccinated children from entering public places, alongside enhanced vaccination outreach and surveillance efforts.

formulation: The House of Representatives fails to reach the supermajority needed to override President Trump's veto of Congress's attempt to overturn the border wall emergency declaration.
answer: The House of Representatives passed a resolution to veto President Trump's national emergency declaration related to the border wall on March 26, 2019.

formulation: "Bump stocks" are made illegal in the United States.
answer: On March 26, 2019, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) issued a rule banning the sale of attachments designed to reduce the size of gun barrels, such as compensators and silencers, without a federal firearm license.

formulation: British indie-rock duo "Her's" - English guitarist-singer Stephen Fitzpatrick (24) and Norwegian bassist Audun Laading (25), and American manager Trevor Engelbrektson (37) killed in car crash in Arizona.
answer: Her’s and their manager, Jason Mann, tragically died in a car accident in Lexington, Kentucky, after the band’s show at the Marathon Music Center in Nashville.

formulation: Facebook bans white nationalism and white supremacy following criticism that Christchurch terrorist able to live-stream his attack.
answer: In March 2019, Facebook announced it would significantly expand its efforts to detect and remove hate speech, including using automated systems and human reviewers, and pledged to provide more transparency about how it handles harmful content.

formulation: UK Prime Minister Theresa May promises to stand down if parliament accepts her Brexit plan.
answer: Theresa May pledged to remain as Prime Minister until Britain had left the European Union, even if it meant staying in office beyond the next general election.

formulation: US Special Council Robert S. Mueller writes a letter to US Attorney William Barr regarding Barr's summary of the Mueller Report stating Barr's letter "did not fully capture the context, nature, and substance" of the findings. "There is now public confusion about critical aspects of the results of our investigation. This threatens to undermine a central purpose for which the Department appointed the Special Counsel: to assure full public confidence in the outcome of the investigations.".
answer: Mueller sent Barr a 302-page report detailing his findings on Russian interference in the 2016 election and potential obstruction of justice by President Trump.

formulation: European parliament bans single-use plastics, including cutlery and straws by 2021.
answer: The European Parliament passed the Single-Use Plastics Directive in March 2019, which mandates measures to reduce the consumption of single-use plastic products, including cutlery and straws, starting in 2021.

formulation: Study of a 71 year-old British woman who has never felt pain, for the first time understood as due to a gene mutation, published in British Journal of Anaesthesia.
answer: A 71-year-old British woman with a rare mutation in the *SCN9A* gene experienced a dramatic reduction in chronic pain after a novel gene therapy treatment.

formulation: The 2019 Major League Baseball season has its earliest season opener in history.
answer: Major League Baseball began its 2019 regular season on March 28, 2019, marking the earliest opening day in the league's history.

formulation: A judge in eastern North Carolina declares a charter school's dress code unconstitutional.
answer: In late March 2019, a North Carolina judge ruled that the Policy 10, a school dress code requiring female students to wear skirts that are at least as long as the knee, violated the state's constitutional guarantee of gender equality.

formulation: Fire destroys a building that housed executive offices at the Highlander Research and Education Center in New Market, Tennessee; arson is suspected.
answer: The historic Lyon Street Black Community Center in Nashville, Tennessee, was severely damaged by a suspected arson attack on March 29, 2019.

formulation: Zuzana Caputova elected President of Slovakia, the country's first female head of state.
answer: Zuzana Čaputová was elected as Slovakia’s first female president on March 30, 2019, marking a historic milestone in the country's political landscape.

formulation: President Trump issues a new permit to construct the Keystone Pipeline.
answer: On March 30, 2019, President Trump revoked Obama-era approvals for the Keystone XL pipeline project.

formulation: Rapper and activist Nipsey Hussle fatally shot outside his clothing store in Los Angeles.
answer: Nipsey Hussle was fatally shot outside his Marathon Clothing store in South Los Angeles on March 31, 2019.

formulation: A 23rd horse is reported to have died at Santa Anita racetrack in California, the latest in a string of deaths occurring since December 2018.
answer: In March 2019, five horses died at Santa Anita Park in California after a spate of racing-related fatalities prompted the temporary closure of the track.

formulation: China announces new laws against fentanyl-related substances to come into effect 1 May.
answer: China announced a ban on the production, sale, and transportation of all fentanyl-related substances, including their precursors, on April 1, 2019, with the enforcement date set for May 1, 2019.

formulation: Major archaeological site announced discovered on a reef in the middle of Lake Titicaca, in Andes, dated 8th and 10th centuries AD from Tiwanaku state.
answer: On April 1, 2019, archaeologists in Bolivia announced the discovery of a sophisticated water management system at the Tiwanaku site, dating back to the 8th and 10th centuries AD.

formulation: Methane, a gas usually made by living things, detected on Mars in 2013 by European Space Agency’s Mars Express orbiter reported in "Nature Geoscience".
answer: The Mars Express orbiter reported a sustained, fluctuating methane signal in Gale Crater, and this finding was published in the scientific journal *Nature Astronomy* in April 2019.

formulation: Saudi Arabian oil company Saudi Aramco revealed to be world's most profitable company when its earnings released - $111.1 billion in the last year.
answer: In 2019, Saudi Aramco reported its highest-ever annual net income, surpassing ExxonMobil and solidifying its position as the world’s most profitable company.

formulation: US online sales overtake retail sales for the first time, with 11.813% online compared with 11.807% for general merchandise stores.
answer: On April 1, 2019, for the first time, U.S. e-commerce sales surpassed those of traditional brick-and-mortar retail sales.

formulation: Bucklew v. Precythe: the Supreme Court rules 5–4 that death row inmates are not guaranteed "painless" executions under the U.S. Constitution.
answer: On April 1, 2019, the Supreme Court in *Buck v. Director of Alabama Department of Corrections* ruled that the Eighth Amendment does not require the state to employ methods of execution that are “painless.”

formulation: The U.S. halts the delivery of F-35 fighter jet-related equipment to Turkey to protest the country's planned purchasing of Russia's S-400 missile defense system.
answer: On April 1, 2019, the United States suspended the delivery of military equipment to Turkey following its purchase of the Russian S-400 missile defense system.

formulation: The Colorado legislature passes a red flag law, allowing seizure of guns from people deemed a threat to themselves or others.
answer: Colorado enacted the Extreme Risk Protection Order (ERPO) law on April 1, 2019, which enables law enforcement to temporarily remove firearms from individuals deemed a threat to themselves or others.

formulation: Two airports in New York join San Antonio International Airport in banning concessions to Chick-fil-A restaurants due to the company's anti-LGBTQ record.
answer: Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) and Chicago O’Hare International Airport (ORD) were among the U.S. airports that banned McDonald's in 2019 following pressure from LGBTQ advocacy groups.

formulation: Firefighters in Asbury Park, New Jersey put out a forest fire that burned 11,638 acres (18 square miles) in two days.
answer: Firefighters battled a massive forest fire in Asbury Park, New Jersey, which threatened the city and required the use of the Atlantic Ocean's water supply for containment.

formulation: 70 villages evacuated in Khuzesta province, Iran, after at least 45 killed in flooding after unprecedented rainfall.
answer: A massive flash flood triggered by unusually heavy rainfall caused a devastating environmental disaster in Iran, forcing the evacuation of 70 villages and claiming at least 45 lives in Khuzestan province.

formulation: Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika (82) resigns after 20 years in office after widespread protests over running for another term.
answer: Abdelaziz Bouteflika resigned as President of Algeria on April 2, 2019, following mass protests demanding his removal and a complete overhaul of the political system.

formulation: Canada is warming at twice the speed of the rest of the world, according to a federal report, increasing 2.3% in northern Canada.
answer: The Canadian government’s “Climate Change Impacts and Adaptation Assessment Report” released in early April 2019 revealed that Canada is warming at roughly twice the rate of the global average.

formulation: Lori Lightfoot elected first female African American Mayor of Chicago.
answer: Brandon Johnson was elected as the Mayor of Chicago on April 2, 2019, marking the historic election of the city's first female African American mayor, victoriously breaking barriers and ushering in a new era of leadership.

formulation: NASA states it wants to send astronauts to Mars by 2033, and land on the Moon again in 2024.
answer: NASA's goals for the 2020s included returning humans to the Moon by 2028 as part of the Artemis program and eventually sending astronauts to Mars.

formulation: OKC guard Russell Westbrook becomes 2nd player in NBA history to have 20+ points, rebounds and assists in a game; records 20-20-21 in 119-103 win over LA Lakers.
answer: Russell Westbrook was the second player in NBA history to record a triple-double with at least 20 points, 20 rebounds, and 20 assists on April 2, 2019, against the Los Angeles Lakers.

formulation: Lori Lightfoot wins the run-off in the 2019 Chicago mayoral election, becoming the first black woman to hold the post and the first openly gay Chicago mayor.
answer: Chicago elected Brandon Johnson as its first black man and openly gay mayor on April 2, 2019, marking a historic moment in the city's political landscape.

formulation: Prosecutors in Waco, Texas decide to not go ahead with prosecution of individuals allegedly involved in the 2015 Waco shootout that left nine dead and 20 people injured.
answer: Prosecutors in Waco, Texas, dropped all charges against all seven surviving Branch Davidians on April 2, 2019, following a multi-year investigation and legal battle.

formulation: An explosion at a chemical plant in Crosby, Texas leaves one dead and two injured. This comes just weeks after a similar Houston-area explosion in Deer Creek, Texas on March 17.
answer: A second explosion at the LyondellBasell plant in Crosby, Texas, resulted in a massive fire and evacuation of nearby residents in early April 2019.

formulation: Brunei brings into force new Sharia laws punishing gay sex and adultery with death by stoning, prompting widespread condemnation.
answer: In early April 2019, Brunei implemented Sharia law, introducing the mandatory stoning to death as punishment for adultery and the death penalty for homosexuality.

formulation: San Antonio coach Geg Popovich is ejected after an NBA record low 63 seconds in the Spurs 113-85 loss in Denver; receives 2 technical fouls in a verbal confrontation with a referee.
answer: Coach Greg Popovich was ejected from the game against the Oklahoma City Thunder on April 3, 2019, after yelling at an official and earning two technical fouls in just 63 seconds.

formulation: Representative Richard Neal, chair of the House Ways and Means Committee, sends a letter to the Internal Revenue Service asking for President Trump's tax returns. Meanwhile, the House Judiciary Committee votes to subpoena the Mueller Report.
answer: The House Ways and Means Committee and the House Judiciary Committee voted to authorize subpoenas for President Trump’s financial records and the full, unredacted Mueller Report.

formulation: The Pittsburgh City Council votes for new gun laws, including a ban on certain semiautomatic assault weapons.
answer: The Pittsburgh City Council unanimously passed an ordinance banning bump stocks and red-flag gun laws.

formulation: Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel apologises for the kidnapping of thousands of mixed-race children during colonial period in Burundi, DR Congo and Rwanda.
answer: On April 4, 2019, Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel formally apologized for the King Leopold II's brutal colonial exploitation of the Congo.

formulation: Kathie Lee Gifford leaves NBC's "Today" show after 11 years.
answer: In April 2019, Hoda Kotb and Savannah Guthrie officially became co-hosts of "Today," replacing Matt Lauer.

formulation: US Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints pledges to roll back anti-LGBT policies, including not baptizing children of gay parents.
answer: The Church announced that LGBTQ+ members could now be married in temples, while still maintaining their faith, following a change in the policy regarding temple attendance and priesthood ordination.

formulation: The 1973 War Powers Resolution is invoked for the first time when the House votes 247–175 to end U.S. military assistance to Saudi Arabia in its intervention in the Yemeni Civil War; the Senate voted 54–46 on the bill in March 2019. President Trump vetoes the bill on April 16, the second veto of his presidency.
answer: On April 4, 2019, the House of Representatives voted to terminate U.S. military aid to Saudi Arabia in Yemen, fulfilling a resolution based on the War Powers Resolution.

formulation: OKC guard Russell Westbrook becomes first player in NBA history to average a triple-double for the third consecutive season during the Thunder's 123-110 win at home over Detroit Pistons.
answer: Russell Westbrook recorded his 18th triple-double of the season against the Detroit Pistons, marking the most triple-doubles by any player in a single season in NBA history.

formulation: Shazam!, directed by David F. Sandberg, is released as the seventh film in the DC Extended Universe.
answer: David F. Sandberg's *Shazam!* was released on April 5, 2019, and served as the seventh installment in the DC Extended Universe.

formulation: First ever "Marsquake" seismic event on planet Mars detected by NASA's InSight lander.
answer: On April 6, 2019, NASA's InSight lander successfully recorded the first-ever detection of marsquakes, marking a major breakthrough in the study of Mars's interior.

formulation: Tampa Bay Lightning beats Boston Bruins, 6-3 in the season finale for their 62nd regular season win, tying the NHL record held by Detroit Red Wings (1995-96); 128 points, 4th in NHL history.
answer: The Tampa Bay Lightning clinched the NHL's Presidents' Trophy, securing the league's best regular season record, in their final game of the season.

formulation: Arson is suspected as the cause of three fires in historically black churches since March 26 in St. Landry Parish, Louisiana. A fourth, smaller fire was set at a majority-white church in Caddo Parish on March 31. The culprit in the case of the three black churches is arrested and charged on April 11.
answer: Between March 26 and April 11, 2019, a series of arson-related church fires devastated predominantly Black congregations across several Louisiana parishes.

formulation: ANA Inspiration Women's Golf, Mission Hills CC: Ko Jin-young wins her first major title by 3 strokes over fellow South Korean Lee Mi-hyang.
answer: On April 7, 2019, Danielle Kang won the KPMG Women's PGA Championship, defeating Ko Jin-young to become the first American woman to win the tournament in 16 years.

formulation: Rebel force the Libyan National Army under General Khalifa Haftar begins advancing on Tripoli with 21 killed and 27 injured over next few days as they try to take the capital.
answer: In early April 2019, the Libyan National Army launched a major offensive towards Tripoli, resulting in significant casualties as they were repelled by Tripoli-based forces.

formulation: Rwanda marks 25 years and the beginning of 100 days of mourning since the genocide that killed 800,000 people.
answer: April 2019 saw the 25th anniversary of the Rwandan genocide commemorated, remembering the immense suffering and loss of life from 1994.

formulation: US President Donald Trump announces Kirstjen Nielsen, Secretary of Homeland Security is leaving her position.
answer: President Donald Trump announced that Kirstjen Nielsen would be replaced as Secretary of Homeland Security by Kevin McAleeney.

formulation: 1 in 4 Japanese adults a virgin aged 18-39 according to new research by Tokyo University.
answer: Tokyo University reported that the rate of sexual activity among young adults in Japan had significantly declined.

formulation: 14 tons of black market Pangolin scales from 36,000 animals discovered in Singapore, one of largest ever found worldwide.
answer: In April 2019, Singapore authorities seized over 17 tonnes of Pangolin scales, representing the scales of approximately 648 pangolins, as part of a major wildlife smuggling operation.

formulation: 600 million birds die each year in the US after striking tall buildings with Chicago the worst city, according to Cornell Lab of Ornithology.
answer: The Cornell Lab of Ornithology's 2019 report detailed the escalating problem of bird mortality due to collisions with buildings, especially in densely populated cities like Chicago.

formulation: Actress Allison Mack pleads guilty to sex-trafficking charges for her involvement in sex cult NXIVM.
answer: In April 2019, actress Allison Mack was federally indicted on charges of sex trafficking and forced labor related to her involvement in NXIVM.

formulation: Record 17ft (5.2M) invasive Burmese python pregnant with 73 eggs captured in Florida's Big Cypress National Preserve.
answer: In early April 2019, a record-length Burmese python in Florida was found with 61 eggs, representing a significant event in the ongoing struggle to control the invasive species population.

formulation: Joining Saudi Arabia and Bahrain, the Trump administration announces its intentions to designate Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as a terrorist group. The official designation takes place on April 15.
answer: The Trump administration announced in early April 2019 that it was designating Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a terrorist organization.

formulation: Nine prominent Hong Kong pro-democracy protesters found guilty on public nuisance charges for their part in 2014 "Umbrella Movement".
answer: On April 9, 2019, Hong Kong High Court ruled that eight prominent activists, including Joshua Wong, were not guilty of obstructing police officers during the 2014 protests.

formulation: Wolves have returned to the Netherlands after 140 years claim ecologists.
answer: In 2019, the lynx was reintroduced to the Netherlands after a century-long absence.

formulation: China announces move to cull more than 1 million pigs in effort to eliminate African swine fever.
answer: In April 2019, China implemented a nationwide slaughter of nearly 60 million pigs to reduce the spread of African swine fever.

formulation: First home delivery service by drone begins in Canberra, Australia by Wing, part of Google's Alphabet company.
answer: On April 10, 2019, Google's Wing drone delivery service began commercial operations in Hurstbridge, Victoria, Australia.

formulation: Four tiny sweat bees removed alive from a woman's eye in world's first operation of its kind at Fooyin University Hospital, Taiwan.
answer: On April 10, 2019, a Taiwanese doctor successfully removed six tiny insects from a woman’s eye using a micro-forceps.

formulation: New species of human announced named Homo luzonensis, 3ft tall, remains dated 50-60,000 years old found in cave on island of Luzon, Philippines.
answer: Scientists announced the discovery of *Homo luzonensis*, a new species of ancient human, from fossil remains found in Callao Cave on the island of Luzon, Philippines, dating back 50,000 to 60,000 years.

formulation: New York declares a public health emergency and compulsory vaccinations after a measles outbreak in Brooklyn with 285 cases.
answer: New York City implemented a citywide mass vaccination campaign in April 2019 in response to a measles outbreak in Brooklyn.

formulation: EU leaders agree to a six-month extension to Brexit after UK parliament fails to reach any consensus.
answer: EU leaders agreed to a revised withdrawal agreement that included protocol on the Northern Ireland border, effectively setting a new deadline for the UK to leave the European Union.

formulation: First day of voting in Indian general elections, the world's largest democracy with 900 million eligible voters in the world's largest-ever election (till 23rd May).
answer: India held its general election on April 11, 2019, a massive democratic exercise that saw the participation of over 900 million voters.

formulation: Israel's Beresheet spacecraft, the first privately-funded mission to the moon, crashes on the moon.
answer: The Beresheet lander, developed by Israel’s SpaceIL, crashed on the moon on April 11, 2019, marking the first private mission to reach the lunar surface, though it was unsuccessful.

formulation: Federal prosecutors announce a 36-count indictment against lawyer Michael Avenatti, including bank fraud, embezzlement, tax evasion and wire fraud.
answer: On April 11, 2019, Michael Avenatti was arrested and charged with multiple federal crimes, including conspiracy to commit extortion and attempted extortion.

formulation: Federal prosecutors indict Obama-era White House Counsel Greg Craig on charges of lying and hiding information related to his work for Ukraine.
answer: In April 2019, a federal judge indicted Greg Craig on charges of violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA).

formulation: Ohio passes legislation to ban abortion at six weeks, the fifth state to do so.
answer: Ohio passed House Bill 614 in April 2019, prohibiting abortion after six weeks of pregnancy, effectively enacting a ban following the *Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health Organization* Supreme Court decision.

formulation: Melbourne captain Cameron Smith becomes highest point scorer in Australian Rugby League history; 49th minute penalty in Storm's 18-12 win over North Queensland in Townsville takes him to 2,420; Hazem El Masri, 2,418.
answer: During an April 2019 match against North Queensland, Cameron Smith kicked the winning field goal to surpass Nathan Hawke's record of 3,729 points, becoming the highest point scorer in Australian Rugby League history.

formulation: Australian super-horse Winx ends extraordinary career with a 3rd Queen Elizabeth Stakes win in Sydney; 33 consecutive race wins, a world record 25 Group One victories and $26.4 million prize money.
answer: Winx achieved a historic, undefeated 25th consecutive win in the Group 1 Chipping Top Stakes on April 13, 2019, becoming the first horse in 74 years to win such a race undefeated.

formulation: Body of 38-year-old Filipino woman discovered in abandoned mine starts the hunt for Cyprus's first serial killer, at least 5 other bodies later discovered.
answer: The discovery of Elena Samara's body in Cyprus on April 13, 2019, sparked an investigation that revealed the island's first known serial killer, Giorgos Kolintas.

formulation: Gregg Popovich surpasses Lenny Wilkens to became the all-time winningest coach in NBA history with his 1,413th win as San Antonio Spurs beat Denver Nuggets, 101-96 in Western Conference Playoffs.
answer: On April 13, 2019, Gregg Popovich became the NBA's all-time winningest coach by surpassing Red Auerbach's record of 1,000 regular-season victories.

formulation: World's largest plane by wingspan at 117m (385 ft), the Stratolaunch, built as a flying launch pad for satellites, takes its first flight from Mojave, California.
answer: On April 13, 2019, the Stratolaunch aircraft successfully completed its first powered flight, demonstrating its ability to carry and launch a rocket.

formulation: 11 tornadoes hit US southern states killing eight in Mississippi, Texas and Louisiana.
answer: Devastating tornadoes and historic flooding across Mississippi, Texas, and Louisiana caused widespread destruction and numerous fatalities during April 2019.

formulation: Congresswoman Ilhan Omar at center of controversy over comments about 9/11 at speech to Council on American-Islamic Relations after tweet by Donald Trump, defended by Nancy Pelosi.
answer: Congresswoman Ilhan Omar’s comments regarding the victims of the September 11th attacks, made on April 14, 2019, sparked outrage and condemnation from Donald Trump and a defense from Nancy Pelosi.

formulation: Seychelles President Danny Faure makes first-ever live speech from a submersible pleading for better marine protection.
answer: President James Michel delivered a powerful call for marine conservation from a submersible off the coast of Seychelles, urging world leaders to protect the oceans.

formulation: South Bend mayor Pete Buttigieg officially announces his presidential campaign in Indiana, first openly gay candidate to run for US president.
answer: Former South Bend, Indiana mayor Pete Buttigieg announced his candidacy for the U.S. presidency on April 14, 2019, marking a notable moment for LGBTQ+ representation in American politics.

formulation: 3 days after winning Hobey Baker Award as top college hockey player, Cale Makar becomes first defenseman to score in NHL debut during the playoffs in Colorado's 6-2 Game 3 win over Calgary.
answer: Cale Makar became the youngest defenseman in NHL history to record a hat trick in his debut playoff game.

formulation: Los Angeles Clippers overcome an NBA record 31-point deficit to score an improbable 135-131 Game 2 playoff victory over the Golden State Warriors in Oakland; shooting guard Lou Williams 36 points.
answer: The Los Angeles Clippers mounted a stunning 31-point comeback against the Golden State Warriors on April 15, 2019, led by Lou Williams' 36 points, securing a historic victory.

formulation: Measles cases jump 300% in first three months of 2019, according to World Health Organization, largest rise in Africa (700%) with 800 deaths in Madagascar.
answer: Madagascar and other African nations experienced a severe measles outbreak in early 2019 characterized by unprecedented case numbers and tragically high mortality rates.

formulation: Former Massachusetts governor Bill Weld officially announces his candidacy in the 2020 presidential election. He will run as a Republican primary challenger to incumbent President Donald Trump, the first to do so.
answer: Bill Weld announced his candidacy for the Republican nomination for president in 2020.

formulation: Apple and Qualcomm settle a multi-year legal dispute regarding patent royalties. The deal between the two tech giants helps, among other arrangements, pave the way for Apple to have 5G iPhones on the market by 2020.
answer: In April 2019, Apple and Samsung reached a settlement that resolved their patent dispute, allowing for the launch of 5G iPhones.

formulation: 10 babies with "bubble boy disease" cured using a gene therapy made from HIV at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, Memphis, according to new study.
answer: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital reported a successful gene therapy treatment in April 2019 that completely restored immune function in a child with X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency.

formulation: Research showing pigs brains partially brought back to life at Yale University, published in "Nature".
answer: Yale University researchers published in "Nature" on April 17, 2019, a groundbreaking study demonstrating the restoration of brain function in pigs using a novel gene therapy approach.

formulation: Terror alert closes schools in Denver, Colorado, due to 18-year-old woman obsessed with Columbine massacre, who is then found dead.
answer: In April 2019, Denver Public Schools closed all of their schools after a 18-year-old woman, disturbed by her obsession with the Columbine High School massacre, sent threatening emails and made concerning social media posts.

formulation: Irish Journalist Lyra McKee shot to death covering riots in Derry, Northern Ireland with dissident republican group the New IRA claiming responsibility.
answer: Journalist Lyra McKee was fatally shot during riots in Derry, Northern Ireland, and the New IRA claimed responsibility for her death.

formulation: A redacted version of the final Mueller Report is released by Attorney General William Barr to Congress and the general public. The report goes into detail on findings from the 2017–2019 Special Counsel probe regarding Russian contacts with the 2016 Donald Trump election campaign and matters regarding obstruction of justice by President Trump himself.
answer: Special Counsel Robert Mueller's team subpoenaed Michael Cohen, Donald Trump’s former lawyer, on April 18, 2019.

formulation: Terror attacks on churches and hotels on Easter Sunday in three Sri Lankan cities, Colombo, Negombo and Batticaloa kill at least 253 and injure hundreds.
answer: On April 21, 2019, Sri Lanka experienced a devastating terrorist attack that targeted churches and hotels during Easter Sunday, claiming over 250 lives and injuring hundreds.

formulation: At least 54 jade miners buried by a mudslide in Kachin state, Myanmar.
answer: On April 23, 2019, a devastating mudslide triggered by illegal jade mining in Kachin State, Myanmar, tragically buried at least 54 miners.

formulation: Second of two major earthquakes strikes island of Samar, Philippines, magnitude 6.3, a day after magnitude 6.1 hits Luzon Island killing at least 16 people.
answer: On April 8, 2019, a magnitude 7.7 earthquake struck off the coast of Eastern Samar, Philippines, causing widespread damage and casualties across Samar and Luzon.

formulation: Southampton striker Shane Long scores fastest goal in English Premier League history when he nets after 7.69 seconds in 1-1 draw at Watford.
answer: Michael Obafemi scored the fastest goal in Premier League history, netting for Southampton just 7.69 seconds into their match against Bournemouth on April 23, 2019.

formulation: World's first malaria vaccine, giving partial protection to children, begins in Malawi by the WHO.
answer: The World Health Organization launched the first-ever mass drug administration (MDA) campaign for malaria in Malawi on April 23, 2019.

formulation: Wing Aviation, a Google offshoot company, becomes the first drone delivery service to receive Air Carrier Certification from the Federal Aviation Administration.
answer: On April 23, 2019, Wing, a Google-owned drone delivery company, received the FAA's first-ever commercial drone operator certificate in the United States.

formulation: Cyclone Kenneth strikes Mozambique with winds of 220km/h (140mph) killing at least38 people and damaging nearly 35,000 homes.
answer: A devastating cyclone, Cyclone Idai, struck Mozambique on April 25, 2019, causing widespread flooding and resulting in a tragic loss of life.

formulation: Microsoft becomes the third US firm to be listed with a market worth of 1 trillion, after Apple and Amazon.
answer: Microsoft surpassed $1 trillion in market value in April 2019, joining Apple and Amazon as the third U.S. company to achieve this historic valuation.

formulation: More than 1,600 civilians were killed in US-led coalition air and land strikes on Raqqa in 2017, according to Amnesty International and monitoring group Airwars.
answer: A report by Airwars revealed that over 1,600 civilians were killed in Raqqa due to US-led coalition airstrikes during the 2017 battle.

formulation: NFL Draft: Oklahoma quarterback Kyler Murray #1 pick by Arizona Cardinals.
answer: The 2019 NFL Draft occurred on April 25, 2019, when the Arizona Cardinals selected quarterback Kyler Murray from Oklahoma as the first overall pick.

formulation: Thousands march in Khartoum, Sudan calling for civilian rule.
answer: On April 25, 2019, thousands of Sudanese people gathered in Khartoum to demand a transition to civilian governance following the ouster of President Omar al-Bashir.

formulation: Former Vice President Joe Biden announces his candidacy for the 2020 presidential election, expanding the field to a record 20 candidates, the largest field of presidential candidates in U.S. history.
answer: On April 25, 2019, Joe Biden formally announced his candidacy for the 2020 United States presidential election.

formulation: A manhunt is launched for man caught on CCTV attempting to set fire to the National Archives Building in Washington, D.C. The suspect, Jacob Leroy Wallace, 32, is later arrested on May 2.
answer: On April 25, 2019, a suspect was identified and arrested in connection with the arson fire that destroyed the historic Asbury Methodist Church in Washington, D.C.

formulation: "No religion" tops survey of American religious identity for the first time at 23.1% edging out Catholics 23.0% and evangelicals 22.5%, in long-running General Social Survey.
answer: In 2019, a landmark shift occurred in American religious identity, with the "Unaffiliated" segment—those identifying as "No religion"—becoming the largest religious group in the nation, exceeding both Catholics and evangelicals in number.

formulation: Six suspected militants connected to Sri Lankan terror attacks killed along with ten others in a shootout with police in Sainthamaruthu.
answer: On April 26, 2019, Sri Lankan police engaged in a violent shootout with National Thowheeth Jama'ath (NTJ) suspects in Kattambala, resulting in numerous fatalities.

formulation: Waorani people of Pastaza win landmark environmental case against the Ecuadorian government to protect half a million acres of their territory in the Amazon rainforest.
answer: On April 26, 2019, the Waorani people successfully won an Ecuadorian court ruling granting them title to their ancestral territory, effectively blocking government plans for oil drilling.

formulation: Avengers: Endgame is released by Marvel Studios as the sequel to 2018's Avengers: Infinity War. It breaks several box office records and eventually becomes the second highest-grossing film of all time, grossing $2.798 billion.
answer: *Avengers: Endgame* captivated audiences worldwide, becoming the second highest-grossing film of all time and a thrilling conclusion to the Infinity Saga.

formulation: Shooter opens fire in a synagogue in Poway, California, killing one and injuring three.
answer: A synagogue shooting occurred in Poway, California, on April 27, 2019, resulting in one fatality and several injuries.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at the Chabad of Poway synagogue in Poway, California on the last day of Passover, resulting in one death and three injuries.
answer: A lone gunman killed one man and injured multiple others at the Chabad-Lubavitch synagogue in Poway, California, on the last day of Passover in 2019.

formulation: A construction crane working on a Google office building in Seattle, Washington, collapses onto Mercer Street, killing four people and injuring four others.
answer: A construction crane collapsed at the Google headquarters under construction in Seattle, Washington, killing four workers.

formulation: American diver Victor Vescovo makes the deepest dive ever to the bottom of the Mariana trench at 10,927m (35,849ft), and finds a plastic bag.
answer: On April 28, 2019, Victor Vescovo became the first person to explore the deepest point in the ocean, the Challenger Deep, and discovered plastic pollution throughout the Mariana Trench, demonstrating the pervasive reach of human waste even in the most remote environments.

formulation: Largest demonstrations since 2014 in Hong Kong over plans to change law to send suspects to mainland China for trial.
answer: On April 28, 2019, massive pro-democracy demonstrations erupted in Hong Kong in response to the government's proposal to introduce a bill allowing for the extradition of criminal suspects to mainland China.

formulation: Undersea explorer Victor Vescovo sets a new world record for the deepest ever sea dive at 10,972 metres (35,997 ft) in the Pacific Ocean's Mariana Trench. Several unusual things are discovered at the bottom, including four new species of prawn-like crustaceans and a new species of snailfish.
answer: On April 28, 2019, Victor Vescovo became the first person to complete a dive to the bottom of the Mariana Trench with a single dive, setting a new record for the deepest dive ever made.

formulation: Indonesia announces plan to relocate its capital from Jakarta due to the city sinking, according to a government minister.
answer: The Indonesian government announced the relocation of the capital city to Nusantara in Kalimantan Timur.

formulation: Islamic State releases video showing leader Bakr al-Baghdadi for first time in five years.
answer: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was killed in a U.S.-led operation in Syria on April 29, 2019.

formulation: Over 300 people declared to have died through overwork in Indonesia's one-day election on April 17th, with over 2,000 fallen sick.
answer: Following Indonesia's 2019 election, over 300 people died and more than 2,000 became ill due to extreme exhaustion and illness from working excessively long hours as postal and polling station officials.

formulation: Over 700 people infected with measles in the US, highest number for 25 years.
answer: A highly virulent strain of *E. coli* contaminated romaine lettuce led to a widespread outbreak of foodborne illness in late April 2019.

formulation: Sports Illustrated features a Muslim model, Halima Aden, in a Burkini for the first time in their swimsuit edition.
answer: The 2019 Sports Illustrated swimsuit edition featured Aoua Hamed, the first Muslim woman to appear on the cover in a burkini, marking a significant step towards greater diversity and inclusion in the industry.

formulation: New type of dementia identified and named limbic-predominant age-related TDP-43 encephalopathy (Late) after misdiagnosed as Alzheimer's disease.
answer: In April 2019, research identified that many individuals diagnosed with “Alzheimer’s” may actually have frontotemporal dementia, a distinct condition with different underlying causes.

formulation: A school shooting takes place at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte, leaving two people dead and four injured.
answer: A shooting at Virginia Tech resulted in the deaths of two students and the injuries of four others on April 30, 2019.

formulation: Minneapolis Police Officer Mohamed Noor is convicted of third-degree murder and manslaughter for shooting and killing Australian woman Justine Damond after she called 9-1-1 to report the possible assault of a woman.
answer:
Derek Chauvin was found guilty of second-degree murder in the death of George Floyd on May 25, 2020, and while not directly related to Justine Ruszczyk Damond, the case sparked widespread outrage and contributed to national conversations about police brutality and racial justice.
