formulation: French submarine Minerve rediscovered off coast of Toulon, France, after disappearing in 1968 with loss of 52 crew.
answer: In July 2019, a remotely operated vehicle discovered the wreckage of the French submarine *Eurydice* and its crew, located near the wreck of the *Argo*, almost 40 years after its disappearance.

formulation: India's lunar mission, Chandrayaan-2 successfully takes off from Satish Dhawan Space Center, Sriharikota aiming to be fourth nation to soft-land on the moon.
answer: The Chandrayaan-2 mission was launched from India on July 22, 2019, aiming to be the fourth nation to successfully land on the moon.

formulation: NFL Dallas Cowboys named most valuable sports team in the world worth $5 billion, MLB New York Yankees 2nd at $4.6 billion, Real Madrid 3rd with $4.2 billion according to Forbes.
answer: Forbes released its 2019 ranking of the world's most valuable sports teams in July 2019, with the New England Patriots and Real Madrid at the top.

formulation: At least 36 people killed by a mud landslide in Shuicheng county, Guizhou province, China.
answer: A mudslide devastated Shuicheng County, Guizhou Province, China, on July 23, 2019, claiming the lives of at least 36 people.

formulation: BHP becomes the first mining company to tackle pollution, says it will invest $400 million to reduce emissions.
answer: In July 2019, BHP committed to transitioning to a zero-harm, zero-decline strategy, aligning its operations with a net-zero carbon emissions target by 2050 and committing to a baseline of no new net deforestation by 2025.

formulation: Boris Johnson is chosen the new British Prime Minister by the ruling Conservative Party to replace Theresa May.
answer: On July 23, 2019, Boris Johnson succeeded Theresa May as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom following a leadership contest within the Conservative Party.

formulation: Investigation launched after no girls born in three months in 132 villages in Uttarkashi district, India, with sex-selective abortions suspected as the reason.
answer: In July 2019, a shocking report emerged revealing that no girls had been born in three months across 132 villages in rural India, sparking widespread concern over the prevalence of sex-selective abortions.

formulation: Nike's Jordan Brand signs 2019 NBA #1 draft pick Zion Williamson to richest multiyear sponsorship deal for a rookie in history; estimated 7 years for $75 million.
answer: Zion Williamson signed a seven-year, $75 million shoe deal with Nike on July 23, 2019.

formulation: 10th million Mini car produced during its 60th anniversary year in Oxford, England.
answer: Oxford Motor Company celebrated its 100th anniversary and the production of its 10 millionth vehicle on July 24, 2019.

formulation: Facebook agrees to pay $5 billion fine, largest ever for violating consumer privacy, to the US Federal Trade Commission.
answer: The US Federal Trade Commission fined Facebook $550 million for allowing the Cambridge Analytica firm to access the data of millions of Facebook users without their consent.

formulation: Global warming is the fastest in 2,000 years and scientific consensus that humans are the cause is at 99%, according to three major reports published in journals "Nature" and "Nature Geoscience".
answer: Major scientific journals in mid-2019 reported that the rate of global warming was accelerating and that human activity, particularly the burning of fossil fuels, was unequivocally the dominant cause.

formulation: New UK PM Boris Johnson drastically reshapes cabinet in his first day in office, appointing Dominic Raab as Foreign Secretary, Priti Patel as Home Secretary and Sajid Javid as Chancellor.
answer: Johnson swiftly replaced several long-serving cabinet ministers with younger, more dynamic individuals, signaling a desire for a fresh start and a shift in political direction.

formulation: Second heatwave of the summer in Western Europe sets record temperatures in Belgium in Kleine Brogel 39.9C (102F), for Netherlands in Eindhoven 39.3C (102F) and Germany at Geilenkirchen 40.5C (104F).
answer: Western Europe experienced a prolonged and intense heatwave in the summer of 2019, leading to record-breaking temperatures across the region.

formulation: Special counsel Robert Mueller reports to the US Senate that President Trump was not exonerated of obstruction of justice and that Russia interfered in US election to benefit Trump.
answer: Special Counsel Robert Mueller delivered a report to the US Senate detailing his investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election and potential obstruction of justice by President Trump, concluding that while Russia interfered, there was not sufficient evidence to establish a criminal conspiracy between the Trump campaign and Russia.

formulation: Ricardo Rosselló, governor of Puerto Rico, announces he will resign on August 2 following revelations of his participation in a chat group with sexist, profane, and homophobic comments.
answer: On July 24, 2019, Pedro Pierluisi was sworn in as the governor of Puerto Rico following the suspension of Ricardo Rosselló due to a political scandal involving leaked chat messages and widespread protests.

formulation: "City killer" Asteroid 2019 OK (187 to 427 ft (57 to 130 m) estimated diameter) passes by almost undetected approximately 45,000 miles away from earth, nearer than the moon.
answer: On July 25, 2019, asteroid (169909) 2009 FD, passed within 0.25 million miles of Earth, a record-close approach for an asteroid of its size.

formulation: Governor of Puerto Rico Ricardo Rosselló resigns amid scandal his leaked online chats.
answer: Pedro Pierluisi was sworn in as governor of Puerto Rico on July 25, 2019, after Ricardo Rosselló resigned amidst a major political scandal triggered by the release of leaked chats.

formulation: High temperature records set across Europe just one day after previous records set, Paris 42.6C (108.7F), Germany 42.6C (108.6F), Netherlands 40.7C (105.2F), Belgium 40.6C (105.2F).
answer: On July 25, 2019, a record-breaking heatwave swept across Europe, shattering temperature records in Paris and Germany among other nations.

formulation: Highest ever UK temperature of 38.7C (101.6F) recorded in Cambridge, England (record broken in 2022).
answer: The UK experienced a record-breaking heatwave on July 25, 2019, with a temperature of 40.3°C (104.5°F) recorded in Heathrow, surpassing the previous record of 38.1°C (100.6°F) set in 1990.

formulation: US Justice department announces resumption of use of the death penalty, scheduling five executions.
answer: The US Justice Department announced a new policy prohibiting the use of race-adjusted sentencing guidelines in capital cases.

formulation: Worst Mediterranean migrant drownings of the year - boat carrying 250 people capsizes off Libyan coast, with over 100 feared drowned.
answer: On July 25, 2019, a fishing trawler carrying an estimated 250 migrants capsized off the coast of Libya, resulting in over 600 deaths.

formulation: Attorney General William Barr reinstates the death penalty for federal crimes. The federal government also schedules the execution of five death row inmates.
answer: On July 25, 2019, Attorney General William Barr announced the resumption of federal executions, citing a responsibility to uphold the law and protect the public.

formulation: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell blocks legislation to improve election security less than 24 hours after Special Counsel Robert Mueller warns of the continued threat of interference in American elections.
answer: Following Mueller's warning, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell blocked Senate Democrats' attempt to pass legislation strengthening election security.

formulation: Sixteen Marines are arrested at Camp Pendleton, California for human trafficking and drug-related offenses. Two others had been arrested on July 3.
answer: In July 2019, a sweeping operation at Camp Pendleton resulted in the arrest of over 30 Marines on charges of human trafficking and drug distribution.

formulation: Five women (Alexandria "Ally" Kostial, 21; Zaria Newton, 20; Arykah Patrice White, 16; Lisa Nguyen, 59; and Shayna Catherine Cline, 19) are killed in Mississippi in separate incidents within 24 hours. All five were killed by firearms.
answer: Five women were tragically killed by gunfire in Jackson, Mississippi, on July 25, 2019, in what is known as the Jackson shooting.

formulation: Three students from the University of Mississippi, members of Kappa Alpha Order a fraternity at the University, post a photo on Instagram taken at the Emmett Till Memorial that is widely seen as racist. The students are suspended by the fraternity but not charged with a hate crime.
answer: Members of the Kappa Alpha Order fraternity were suspended after posting a racially insensitive photo of themselves in blackface, but no hate crime charges were filed.

formulation: Australian cricket captain Meg Lanning records T20 International world record individual score of 133 off 63 balls in 93-run win against England at Chelmsford; Southern Stars clinch Women's Ashes.
answer: On July 26, 2019, Meg Lanning became the highest run-scorer in Women's T20 International cricket, surpassing Charlotte Edwards, with a stunning innings of 137 runs against England.

formulation: Cindy Lovell discovers the long-sought signature of Samuel Langhorne Clemens, whose pen name was Mark Twain, inside the Mark Twain Cave in Hannibal, Missouri.
answer: On July 26, 2019, researchers discovered a remarkably well-preserved signature attributed to Ernest Hemingway in a cave associated with his time spent in Key West.

formulation: American swimmer Caeleb Dressel wins 3 gold medals in one day at the World Championships in Gwangju, South Korea; 50m freestyle, 100m butterfly and mixed 4×100m freestyle relay (WR 3:19.40).
answer: Caeleb Dressel achieved the remarkable feat of winning eight gold medals, tying a world record for the most medals won by any swimmer at a single World Championship.

formulation: At least 65 mourners killed in a gun attack at a funeral near Maiduguri, by suspected Boko Haram militants in north-east Nigeria.
answer: A Boko Haram militant gun attack at a funeral in northeast Nigeria killed at least 65 mourners on July 27, 2019.

formulation: MLB Phillies revive reviled 1979 all-burgundy alternate uniforms as part of a "retro night" promotion in 15-7 loss to Atlanta Braves at Citizens Bank Park, Philadelphia.
answer: The Philadelphia Phillies unveiled their long-lost 1979 all-burgundy alternate uniforms during a game against the Atlanta Braves as part of a promotional event on July 27, 2019.

formulation: US President Trump, calls Baltimore a "disgusting, rat and rodent infested mess," calls Congress Rep Elijah Cummings responsible.
answer: President Trump repeatedly referred to Baltimore as a "very dangerous city" and Congressman Elijah Cummings as a "disgrace" during a press conference, drawing widespread criticism for his remarks about the city and its prominent Democratic representative.

formulation: Logan Paul hosts the Challenger Games at Long Beach City College in California. Notable participants included Tobi Brown, Jake Paul, and Deestroying.
answer: The Guinness World Records Breaking Shore Championships, a skateboarding competition featuring social media influencers and athletes, occurred on July 27, 2019, in Long Beach, California.

formulation: Evian Championship Women's Golf, Evian Resort GC: South Korean Ko Jin-young wins her second major title of the season by 2 strokes from Shanshan Feng, Jennifer Kupcho and Kim Hyo-joo.
answer: Jin Run, a South Korean golfer, won the U.S. Women's Open on July 28, 2019, becoming the first golfer to win two majors in a single season.

formulation: First Fortnite World Cup won by US teenager Kyle Giersdorf with largest ever e-sports prize of $3 million at Arthur Ashe Stadium, New York.
answer: The 2019 Call of Duty League Championship, held at Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York, saw Jack Fricker of the Paris Legion win a record $3 million prize.

formulation: Four people, including the shooter, are killed and twelve others injured in a mass shooting in Gilroy, California.
answer: On July 28, 2019, a shooting at a Gilroy, California, community festival resulted in the deaths of four people, including the shooter, and injured twelve others.

formulation: Prison riot kills 58, with 16 decapitated in battle between rival factions at the Altamira prison, Para state, Brazil.
answer: On July 29, 2019, a massive riot and massacre in Amazonas Penitentiary in Carajás, Pará, resulted in the deaths of 56 prisoners and one guard, exposing deep-seated gang violence within the Brazilian prison system.

formulation: The InterContinental Hotels Group (IHG), owner of Holiday Inn and other hotels, announces it will stop using small soap and shampoo containers in order to cut down on plastic waste. Marriott International and Hilton Hotels & Resorts have made similar announcements.
answer: In 2019, these hotel chains pledged to eliminate single-use plastic items from their operations by 2022.

formulation: Kelly Craft confirmed by US Senate as US ambassador to the UN.
answer: The US Senate confirmed the appointment of Scott Miller as the U.S. Ambassador to Afghanistan on July 31, 2019.

formulation: Russian President Vladimir Putin orders Russian army to help put out huge wildfires in Siberia covering three million hectares (7.4 million acres) after 700,000 people sign petition.
answer: The Russian government deployed thousands of troops and military aircraft to combat the devastating wildfires and assist in firefighting efforts.

formulation: US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for the first time since 2008 by 0.25%.
answer: In July 2019, the US Federal Reserve raised the federal funds rate target range for the first time since December 2015, signaling a move towards a more hawkish monetary policy.

formulation: The Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for the first time since 2008, with a 0.25% reduction to a baseline level of 2–2.25%.
answer: The Federal Reserve lowered its interest rate target range for the federal funds rate by 25 basis points, marking the first interest rate cut in over ten years.

formulation: Leslie McCrae Dowless faces new charges of electoral fraud in North Carolina. Dowless was arrested in 2017 and charged with trying to rig the election in North Carolina's 9th Congressional District in favor of Mark Harris, the Republican candidate.
answer: In 2019, a North Carolina judge overturned the conviction of Leslie McCrae Dowless for election fraud, citing prosecutorial misconduct and a lack of evidence.

formulation: Protesting Kenyan cancer survivors in Nairobi urge their government to declare a "nation disaster' in a country with only 35 oncologists for 40 million people.
answer: Cancer survivors in Nairobi staged a demonstration on August 1, 2019, demanding increased government investment in oncologist training and retention to combat the critical shortage of oncology specialists.

formulation: Pedro Pierluisi sworn in as new Governor of Puerto Rico replacing Ricardo A. Rosselló.
answer: On August 2, 2019, Pedro Pierluisi was sworn in as the new governor of Puerto Rico following a recall election that ousted Ricardo A. Rosselló.

formulation: Saudi Arabia announces news rules for women including allowing them to travel independently abroad without a male guardian's permission.
answer: Saudi Arabia announced in August 2019 that women were no longer required to obtain male guardian permission to travel domestically or abroad.

formulation: Seven-year-old boy operated on after 526 teeth found inside his mouth in Chennai, India.
answer: In August 2019, a six-year-old boy in Chennai, India, underwent surgery to remove a large, 4.5-inch-long, fully formed baby tooth from his abdomen.

formulation: The U.S. officially withdraws from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty established with Russia in 1987.
answer: The United States formally notified Russia that it was withdrawing from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty.

formulation: Dozens of jailed immigrants are pepper-sprayed by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents during a protest in Bossier Parish, Louisiana.
answer: On August 2, 2019, ICE agents forcibly removed several jailed immigrants during a protest in Louisiana, resulting in injuries and accusations of brutality.

formulation: Puerto Rico governor Ricardo Rossello resigns, and Pedro Pierluisi (who was appointed secretary of state on July 31) takes the oath of office to succeed him.
answer: Governor Ricardo Rossello resigned amidst widespread public outrage over leaked chat messages that revealed offensive and disrespectful language.

formulation: Suspected domestic terrorist shoots and kills 22 and injures 24 at a Walmart store in El Paso, Texas.
answer: On August 3, 2019, a gunman opened fire at a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, killing 22 people and injuring 24 others in a devastating shooting.

formulation: 2019 El Paso shooting: A mass shooting occurs at a Walmart near the Cielo Vista Mall in El Paso, Texas, resulting in 23 fatalities and 23 injured.
answer: On August 3, 2019, a mass shooting at a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, resulted in the deaths of 23 people and injuries to 23 more.

formulation: Australian cricket batsman Steve Smith hits brilliant 142 following his 1st innings 144 in 1st Test v England at Edgbaston; only 4th batsman all-time to score more than 140 in each innings of a Test match.
answer: Steve Smith became the first Australian to score a double century in an English Test match at Edgbaston.

formulation: Car explosion kills 20 with 47 injured in Cairo, Egypt, in terrorist-related incident.
answer: A suicide bombing at a bus carrying Coptic Christians to a Cairo church resulted in numerous casualties on August 4, 2019.

formulation: China's central bank allows its currency to weaken under usual 7-1 ratio to the US dollar for first time in a decade in response to further US trade tariffs.
answer: China's central bank, the People's Bank of China, abandoned its managed exchange rate system and allowed the yuan to devalue against the dollar for the first time in ten years, reducing the trading band.

formulation: Frank Zapata is the first person to cross the English Channel by flyboard in 22 minutes.
answer: Felix Beal flew a flyboard across the English Channel on August 4, 2019, achieving a new distance record.

formulation: Gunman kills nine and injures 27 at a bar in Dayton, Ohio, in 2nd mass shooting in 24 hours in the US.
answer: On August 4, 2019, a shooting at the Gilroy, California, Garlic Festival resulted in five fatalities and 17 injuries, occurring shortly after the El Paso shooting.

formulation: 2019 Dayton shooting: A mass shooting occurs in the Oregon Historic District in downtown Dayton, Ohio, resulting in 10 fatalities (including the perpetrator) and 27 injuries.
answer: On August 4, 2019, a mass shooting in Dayton, Ohio, resulted in nine fatalities and dozens of injuries.

formulation: Australian woman Kerry Robertson confirmed as the first person to use a new assisted dying law to end her life a month earlier in Victoria.
answer: Kerry Robertson became the first person in July 2019 to utilize Victoria’s new assisted dying law, marking a historic legal milestone in the country.

formulation: Brazilian drug dealer Clauvino da Silva tries and fails to escape Rio de Janeiro jail by dressing up as his teenage daughter in silicone mask and wig.
answer: In August 2019, a Brazilian drug dealer attempted to escape from jail by disguising himself as his daughter.

formulation: Indian government announces it is changing the status of Indian-controlled Kashmir from a state to a union territory, revoking Article 370 in response to security concerns.
answer: On August 5, 2019, the Indian government revoked Article 370 of the Constitution, which had granted special autonomous status to Indian-controlled Kashmir, and bifurcated the region into two Union Territories.

formulation: July 2019 confirmed as world's hottest-ever month recorded according to Europe's Copernicus Programme.
answer: August 2019 reported that July 2019 was the hottest July on record globally.

formulation: Widespread strike in Hong Kong and demonstrations against Chinese policy towards the territory bring huge disruption, including cancelling 200 flights.
answer: On August 5, 2019, Hong Kong experienced the "anti-police brutality" protests, marked by widespread strikes and demonstrations that severely disrupted city life and led to the cancellation of numerous flights.

formulation: A quarter of humanity is running out of water with 17 countries under extreme water stress including Cape Town, Los Angeles and Bangalore, according to report by the World Resources Institute.
answer: The 2019 Global Risk Report by The World Economic Forum and Zurich Insurance highlighted that a quarter of the world's population is facing severe water shortages.

formulation: Barneys New York files for bankruptcy, amid figures 7,567 US retails stores have closed so far in 2019 compared to 5,864 in 2018.
answer: Bed Bath & Beyond filed for bankruptcy on August 6, 2019, due to a surge in store closures and financial difficulties.

formulation: Lawyer representing 800 boy scouts identify 350 sex abusers within Boy Scouts of America saying "It's the largest paedophile ring on earth".
answer: In August 2019, the Boy Scouts of America revealed it had settled over 2,000 abuse claims for $260 million, indicating a widespread pattern of abuse and a long-standing effort to conceal it.

formulation: The Philippines declares a national dengue epidemic with 622 people killed and 146,000 cases so far in 2019.
answer: The Philippines officially declared a dengue epidemic on August 6, 2019, due to a severe surge in dengue cases and subsequent deaths.

formulation: US government imposes wide-ranging sanctions on the Venezuelan government.
answer: In August 2019, the United States imposed sanctions on Venezuelan state-owned oil company PDVSA, freezing its assets and restricting its access to the U.S. financial system.

formulation: Bodies of two teenagers at center of huge manhunt and suspected of killing three people on remote British Columbia roads found after apparent suicides.
answer: On August 7, 2019, the bodies of Kam McLeod and Terri-Lee Brennan were discovered in a Rural Municipality of Sparxivik RCMP detachment.

formulation: Largest single-state immigration raid in Mississippi as nearly 700 people arrested.
answer: On August 7, 2019, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) conducted a large-scale enforcement operation in Mississippi, arresting nearly 700 undocumented immigrants.

formulation: Wanda Vazquez becomes Puerto Rico's third governor in a week after her predecessor Pedro Pierluisi is removed by the supreme court.
answer: The Puerto Rican Supreme Court removed Pedro Pierluisi from the governorship, leading to Wanda Vazquez being appointed as the acting governor.

formulation: The Supreme Court of Puerto Rico rules that Pedro Pierluisi's swearing in as governor was unconstitutional and removes him from office. Secretary of Justice Wanda Vázquez Garced becomes governor.
answer: The Supreme Court of Puerto Rico ruled that Governor Ricardo Rosselló could not be sworn in until the Senate confirmed his appointment, and Pedro Pierluisi subsequently assumed the position as governor.

formulation: Nuclear accident at Russian nuclear-weapon testing site at closed city Sarov kills five scientists in mysterious circumstances.
answer: A fire at the Semipalatinsk test site in Russia resulted in a nuclear accident and the deaths of several scientists investigating the cause.

formulation: The largest U.S. immigration raids in a decade result in 680 arrests in Mississippi.
answer: On August 7, 2019, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) conducted a large-scale enforcement operation in Mississippi, arresting 680 undocumented immigrants.

formulation: Landslide from torrential rain kills 59 in Mon state, Myanmar, with 80,000 in emergency evacuation sites.
answer: A devastating landslide and flooding in Mon State, Myanmar, caused by intense rainfall in early August 2019 led to widespread destruction and the displacement of over 80,000 residents.

formulation: The North Dakota Supreme Court upholds a voting law that disenfranchises 10% of the state's Native Americans.
answer: The North Dakota Supreme Court ruled that Native Americans born in Montana were eligible to vote in North Dakota elections.

formulation: 71 people die trying to siphon gas from an overturned tanker that explodes in Morogoro region, Tanzania.
answer: A Tanzanian ferry carrying passengers attempting to illegally siphon fuel from a sunken ship capsized, tragically killing 71 people.

formulation: Financier Jeffrey Epstein found dead of an apparent suicide in his jail cell in New York, while awaiting trail for sex trafficking charges.
answer: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his jail cell on August 10, 2019.

formulation: Monsoon flooding in southern and western India kills at least 150 with 40 dead in Kerala state and 100,000 in emergency relief camps.
answer: A devastating flash flood triggered by torrential monsoon rains in Chamoli, Uttarakhand, caused widespread devastation and displacement, leading to hundreds of deaths and the displacement of thousands.

formulation: Rebel forces for the UAE-backed Southern Transitional Council take control of the key port of Aden in Yemen's civil war.
answer: The Southern Transitional Council (STC) seized control of the strategic port of Aden in Yemen on August 10, 2019, escalating tensions with the internationally recognized government.

formulation: Typhoon Lekima makes landfall in Zhejiang province, China, killing at least 32 with one million evacuated.
answer: Zhejiang province in China was severely impacted by a major typhoon in August 2019, causing widespread flooding and numerous fatalities.

formulation: 2020 Democratic candidates for president speak at a gun forum sponsored by Everytown for Gun Safety,  in Des Moines, Iowa.
answer: On August 10, 2019, a dozen Democratic presidential candidates participated in a televised gun safety forum in Des Moines, Iowa.

formulation: The FBI, the Justice Department's inspector general and the New York City medical examiner launch inquiries following the death of Jeffrey Epstein in a Manhattan jail while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.
answer: An investigation was launched by the FBI, the Justice Department's inspector general, and the New York City medical examiner on August 10, 2019, to examine the death of Kalief Browder in Rikers Island jail.

formulation: Argentine President Mauricio Macri suffers defeat in preliminary election to Alberto Fernández, prompting 20% fall in the value of the peso.
answer: A vote of no confidence in President Mauricio Macri led to a dramatic collapse of the Argentine peso.

formulation: Baltimore Orioles concede 7 home runs in doubleheader defeats against NY Yankees to break the American League single season HRs allowed record with 248 and counting.
answer: The Baltimore Orioles became the first team in MLB history to record 20 or more hits in both games of a single doubleheader.

formulation: Beginning of the 'glitter revolution' in Mexico City when security chief showered with pink glitter in protest of violence against women after teenager raped by police.
answer: The "Ni Una Menos" movement, which emerged in Mexico City on August 12, 2019, initiated after a security chief was covered in pink glitter as a symbol of resistance against violence against women.

formulation: Conservative Alejandro Giammattei elected president of Guatemala.
answer: Guatemala elected Alejandro Giammattei as its president on August 12, 2019, marking a shift towards a more conservative political direction.

formulation: Hong Kong International Airport cancels all departures as thousands of anti-government protesters occupy the terminals.
answer: The Mass Transit Airport Council (MTAC) protest, involving thousands of demonstrators, resulted in the cancellation of all flight departures at Hong Kong International Airport in August 2019.

formulation: Scientists say they are closer to an effective treatment for Ebola after new drug trial has 90% success rate in Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: Scientists announced promising preliminary results from a late-stage clinical trial in the Democratic Republic of Congo demonstrating the effectiveness of mAb114, an experimental monoclonal antibody, in treating Ebola patients.

formulation: The Trump administration issues new rules that reject applicants for temporary or permanent visas for failing to meet income standards or for receiving public assistance such as welfare, food stamps, public housing or Medicaid.
answer: In August 2019, the Trump administration implemented a rule prohibiting most migrants who receive public benefits from obtaining work visas, effectively curtailing their ability to legally work in the United States.

formulation: The Department of Interior revises its implementation of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 including preventing the Fish and Wildlife Service from automatically offering full endangered species protections to wildlife classified as "threatened".
answer: In August 2019, the Trump administration significantly weakened the Endangered Species Act by narrowing the definition of “habitat” for threatened species, thereby reducing the scope of protections afforded to them.

formulation: FBI agents raid Jeffrey Epstein's private Caribbean island amid ongoing investigations into alleged sex trafficking.
answer: Federal agents executed a search warrant on Epstein’s private island, Little Torch Key, on August 12, 2019, leading to the discovery of disturbing evidence and intensifying investigations into his alleged sex trafficking activities.

formulation: Entertainment companies CBS and Viacom announce they will merge with a combined 28 billion revenue.
answer: Disney announced its merger with 21st Century Fox on August 13, 2019, creating a media giant that combined $28 billion in revenue.

formulation: Measles cases have tripled worldwide in 2019 according to WHO with 364,808 reported against vs 129,239 in 2018.
answer: The World Health Organization reported a sharp increase in tuberculosis cases globally in 2019, exceeding 1.5 million cases for the first time in nearly two decades.

formulation: "It is raining plastic," survey published, plastic found in 90% of rain samples taken in Colorado by the US Department of the Interior and US Geological Survey.
answer: In 2019, a comprehensive environmental survey found that 90% of rain samples collected in Colorado contained plastic, raising serious alarms about widespread plastic pollution and its potential detrimental effects on the state's environment.

formulation: "The 1619 Project" produced by Nikole Hannah-Jones, to examine legacy of slavery in America, launched in "The New York Times Magazine".
answer: "The New York Times Magazine" launched "1619," a multi-platform investigative project dedicated to examining the enduring legacy of slavery in America.

formulation: American rapper ASAP Rocky found guilty of assault in Stockholm and given a suspended sentence.
answer: A$AP Rocky was acquitted of all charges related to assault in Stockholm on August 14, 2019.

formulation: French woman Stephanie Frappart is the first woman to referee a major match in a European men's tournament - UEFA Super Cup Chelsea vs Liverpool in Istanbul.
answer: In August 2019, Willy Alvarez became the first French referee to officiate a match at the UEFA Women's Euro tournament.

formulation: Iowa congressman Steve King says without rape and incest "“Would there be any population of the world left if we did that?" in video for "The Des Moines Register".
answer: King suggested that God might allow rape and incest to create offspring who could forgive their abusers.

formulation: An employee of the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement drives a truck through a group of peaceful protesters from Never Again Action, injuring several.
answer: Federal law enforcement agents violently cleared protesters outside Portland ICE Field Office, resulting in numerous injuries and arrests.

formulation: Mylan N.V., Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd., and Heritage Pharmaceuticals Inc. are accused of blocking a Congressional investigation into rising drug prices.
answer: On August 14, 2019, a federal judge ordered Mylan, Teva, and Heritage Pharmaceuticals to participate in a nationwide bellwether trial regarding their alleged role in inflating the price of the EpiPen.

formulation: 60th annual finger wrestling (Fingerhakeln) championships takes place in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, southern Germany, part of Partenkirchner Festival week.
answer: The annual Partenkirchner Fingerball World Championship, a fiercely contested finger wrestling competition, was held in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany, during the Festival week in August 2019.

formulation: American Michael Gargiulo, found guilty of stabbing three women, killing two in Los Angeles, while awaiting trial for third killing.
answer: A jury found Russell Bennett guilty of six counts of murder and one count of attempted murder.

formulation: Israel bars US Democratic congresswomen Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar from entering for supporting Palestinian-led boycott movement.
answer: U.S. Congresswomen Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Ilhan Omar were denied entry into Israel on August 15, 2019, by Israeli officials citing their support for the Boycott, Divestment, and Sanctions (BDS) movement.

formulation: Whistleblower releases damaging report on General Electric titled "General Electric, a Bigger Fraud Than Enron" claiming $38 billion accountancy fraud.
answer: In 2019, a whistleblower alleged that General Electric had engaged in a $38 billion accounting fraud reminiscent of the Enron scandal.

formulation: Former Colorado governor John Hickenlooper withdraws from the 2020 presidential election campaign.
answer: On August 15, 2019, John Hickenlooper formally announced his exploratory run for the 2020 presidential election.

formulation: The government of Israel denies visas to Representative Ilhan Omar (D-MN) and Rashida Tlaib (D-MI).
answer: The Israeli government issued strongly worded condemnations of Representatives Omar and Tlaib and barred them from visiting the country.

formulation: Huge fire in Chalantika slum in Dhaka, Bangladesh, destroys 1,200 houses and leaves up to 10,000 homeless.
answer: A devastating flood, triggered by heavy rainfall and overflowing rivers, devastated Dhaka on August 16, 2019, displacing thousands and destroying homes.

formulation: Denmark rejects the suggestion that the United States might purchase Greenland.
answer: In August 2019, the United States and Denmark engaged in diplomatic discussions about Denmark’s potential sale of Greenland to China, prompting a firm denial from Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen.

formulation: Huge wildfires begin on Gran Canaria in the Canary Islands prompting evacuation of 9,000 people.
answer: A sudden and severe algae bloom, resulting from unusually warm waters and nutrient runoff, caused a toxic red tide that forced the evacuation of thousands in Gran Canaria.

formulation: Landmark power-sharing deal signed by military and civilian leaders celebrated in Khartoum, Sudan, with transitional government to take over Sept 1.
answer: On August 17, 2019, Sudan’s military and civilian leaders signed the Power-Sharing Agreement, paving the way for a transitional government that officially began on September 1st.

formulation: Suicide bombing at a wedding in Kabul, Afghanistan, kills 63, with over 200 injured. The Islamic State claims responsibility.
answer: A suicide bombing at a wedding in Kabul, Afghanistan on August 17, 2019, claimed the lives of 63 people and injured over 200 others, and was subsequently claimed by the Islamic State.

formulation: Protests are held in Portland that rally: Proud Boys Three Percenters, a “patriot movement” militia group, and American Guard. They are met with three times as many counter protesters.
answer: On August 17, 2019, a clash between Patriot Prayer activists and numerous anti-fascist counter-protesters resulted in violence and arrests in Portland.

formulation: Anti-gun rallies are held in over 100 cities in all 50 states.
answer: A March For Our Lives rally, featuring speeches by survivors of the Parkland school shooting, occurred nationwide on August 17, 2019, demanding tighter gun control measures.

formulation: 1.7 million take part in pro-democracy protest peacefully in Hong Kong, a quarter of the population.
answer: On August 18, 2019, Hong Kong held a massive march that drew approximately 1.7 million participants in support of democracy and against the extradition bill.

formulation: Iceland holds a funeral for the first glacier lost to climate change at site of Okjökull glacier.
answer: On August 18, 2019, the Breiðamerkurjökull glacier in Iceland completely collapsed into the sea, signaling a drastic loss due to climate change.

formulation: Evelyn Hernández cleared of killing her newborn baby in landmark case in a retrial in El Salvador.
answer: On August 19, 2019, El Salvador's Supreme Court ruled that a woman could be sentenced to 30 years in prison for the death of her newborn baby, effectively legalizing the prosecution of women who give birth to stillborn or deceased babies.

formulation: Computer systems in 22 small Texas towns hacked and held to ransom in coordinated attack prompts FBI investigation.
answer: In August 2019, a ransomware attack dubbed "Town Hall Ransomware" targeted computer systems in numerous small towns across Texas, prompting an FBI investigation.

formulation: NASA confirms mission to Jupiter's ice-covered moon Europa to search for alien life, to launch 2025.
answer: NASA announced the Europa Clipper mission, scheduled to launch in 2024, aiming to investigate Jupiter's moon Europa for potential signs of life.

formulation: Richard Ross Jr., police commissioner of Philadelphia, resigns amid allegations that members of his department engaged in sexual harassment and racial and gender discrimination against women serving in the ranks.
answer: Philadelphia Police Commissioner Richard Ross resigned on August 20, 2019, following accusations of sexual harassment and discrimination within the department.

formulation: 74,155 fires caused by land clearing are burning in the Amazon rain forest, the most ever recorded, according the Brazil's National Institute for Space Research.
answer: Brazil faced a devastating wildfire crisis in August 2019, with over 74,000 fires raging through the Amazon rainforest, largely attributed to deforestation for agricultural land.

formulation: German Chancellor challenges British PM Boris Johnson to find a solution to a no-deal Brexit in 30 days at their meeting in Berlin.
answer: On August 21, 2019, German Chancellor Angela Merkel demanded that Boris Johnson resolve the Brexit situation within 30 days during a meeting at Downing Street.

formulation: Washington governor Jay Inslee announces the end of his 2020 presidential bid.
answer: Jay Inslee announced that he would suspend his 2020 presidential campaign.

formulation: Bielefeld in Germany offers €1m prize to anyone in who can prove the town doesn't exit to disprove 25-year-old conspiracy theory.
answer: Recent archaeological excavations in Lower Saxony have unearthed substantial evidence suggesting the existence of the mythical city of Ulpia Wetter, disproving the conspiracy theory and prompting a substantial prize for its discovery.

formulation: Russia launches Fedor, the first life-sized robot, into space to the International Space Station on a Soyuz rocket from Baikonur cosmodrome, Kazakhstan.
answer: On August 22, 2019, the life-sized robot MechASUS was launched from Baikonur cosmodrome, marking the first-ever launch of a fully robotic spacecraft to the Moon.

formulation: South Korea says it is leaving an intelligence-sharing pact with Japan in an escalation of the rift between the two countries.
answer: South Korea announced the immediate removal of all wartime comfort women statues from the grounds of the ambassador's residence and vowed to return them to Japan.

formulation: A federal grand jury in Los Angeles charges 80 people, mostly Nigerians, in a conspiracy to steal and then launder millions of dollars. 14 people are arrested.
answer: On August 22, 2019, a federal grand jury in Los Angeles indicted over 100 individuals on conspiracy charges related to a massive healthcare fraud scheme.

formulation: Russia launches the 1st floating nuclear power station the Akademik Lomonosov from port of Murmansk.
answer: Russia launched the "Seversk," a floating nuclear power plant, on August 23, 2019.

formulation: The first recorded death due to vaping is announced by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), amid concern over a mystery lung disease in the United States, linked to the use of e-cigarettes.
answer: The CDC issued a health advisory in late August 2019 warning healthcare providers about a cluster of severe lung illnesses linked to vaping.

formulation: NASCAR bans advertisements of “assault-style rifles/sniper rifles.”.
answer: NASCAR banned advertisements for firearms and ammunition, citing a desire to protect its brand image and create a more inclusive environment.

formulation: Britain's Prince Andrew denies knowing his friend Jeffrey Epstein was involved in sexual trafficking of underage girls after public accusations made against him.
answer: Prince Andrew vehemently denied any inappropriate relationships with Epstein, stating he had never met the disgraced financier.

formulation: US adventurer Victor Vescovo is the first person to visit the deepest point of every ocean when he reaches Molloy Hole, in the Arctic.
answer: On August 24, 2019, Victor Vescovo became the first person to visit the deepest point in the ocean, the Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench, during a single dive.

formulation: Double Dave, a rare two-headed timber rattlesnake found in Pine Barrens forest, New Jersey.
answer: On August 25, 2019, researchers discovered a previously unknown, iridescent species of fly, *Exochoglophus barrens*, in the Pine Barrens, demonstrating the area’s hidden biodiversity.

formulation: NASA investigates possibly the 1st crime in space over astronaut Anne McClain illegally accessing bank a/c from space.
answer: NASA investigated astronaut Mark Vande Hei for allegedly attempting to access his bank account from the International Space Station in 2019.

formulation: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay state of Oklahoma $572 million in 1st trial against opioid manufacturer.
answer: On August 26, 2019, a jury ruled that Johnson & Johnson was liable for contributing to Oklahoma's opioid crisis and ordered the company to pay $572.5 million in damages.

formulation: Leo DiCaprio's environmental organization Earth Alliance donates $5m to fighting fires in the Amazon.
answer: DiCaprio’s environmental organization, the Environmental Defense Fund, donated $5 million to support firefighting and aid efforts in the Amazon rainforest.

formulation: Meeting of the G7 agrees on $20 million aid package to fight fires in the Amazon in Biarritz.
answer: The G7 leaders pledged to phase out inefficient fossil fuel subsidies by 2025.

formulation: Johnson & Johnson is ordered to pay $572 million for contributing to the opioid crisis in Oklahoma.
answer: In August 2019, an Oklahoma court ruled that Johnson & Johnson was liable for contributing to the state’s opioid crisis and ordered the company to pay over $500 million in damages.

formulation: At least 25 people killed in a fire at a bar, deliberately lit by gang members in Coatzacoalcos, Mexico.
answer: On August 27, 2019, a deliberately set fire at a bar in Coatzacoalcos, Mexico, claimed the lives of at least 25 people.

formulation: Race car driver Jessi Combs dies while setting new fastest women's land speed record of 522.783 mph at Alvord Desert, Oregon (posthumously awarded 2020).
answer: Veteran speed record holder Annie Locke died after crashing her methanol-fueled LSR car during a record attempt on the Bonneville Salt Flats.

formulation: Discovery of 3.8-million-year-old skull of early human ancestor Australopithecus anamensis, found by Yohannes Haile-Selassie, at Miro Dora, Ethiopia, upends previous evolutionary theory published in journal "Nature".
answer: The discovery of *Homo luzonensis*, a mosaic of primitive and derived traits, on the Philippine island of Luzon revealed that early hominins diversified and evolved in unexpected ways beyond Africa.

formulation: US Senator Kirsten Gillibrand ends her campaign for president.
answer: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand announced that she would not seek the Democratic nomination for president in 2020.

formulation: New York senator Kirsten Gillibrand withdraws from the 2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries.
answer: On August 28, 2019, Senator Kirsten Gillibrand suspended her campaign for the Democratic presidential primary, citing the need for a new generation of leaders.

formulation: 16-year-old Swedish student Greta Thunberg arrives in New York Harbor after sailing across the Atlantic. Thunberg plans to testify at a UN summit on zero emissions.
answer: Greta Thunberg arrived in New York Harbor on August 28, 2019, after sailing across the Atlantic to protest climate inaction at the UN Climate Action Summit.

formulation: Discovery of world's largest child sacrifice site announced by archaeologists with 227 victims from Chimú culture in Huanchaco, Peru.
answer: On August 29, 2019, archaeologists announced the discovery of 17 mummified children dating back over 1,300 years at the Huaca Roja site in Peru.

formulation: Scientists announce there is no single 'gay' gene with genetics accounting for at most 25% of same-sex behavior, in study published in "Science".
answer: Researchers published findings suggesting that a specific variant of a gene called SLIT2 is associated with a significantly increased likelihood of being attracted to the same sex in men.

formulation: Federal judge Amy Totenberg rules that the state of Georgia must replace all of its voting machines or use paper ballots in time for the March 24, 2020 presidential primary election. Several faulty voting machines were reported during the Mississippi gubernatorial primary on August 27.
answer: Federal Judge Amy Totenberg ruled that Georgia must conduct a risk-limiting audit using a statistical sample of ballots to ensure the accuracy of its voting machines after finding that the state's voting system was not reliable.

formulation: Outlook for the Great Barrier Reef downgraded to very poor according to official Australian report.
answer: The Australian government released the 2019 Great Barrier Reef Outlook Report on August 30, 2019, revealing a severe decline in the reef's health.

formulation: Second interstellar comet ever detected by Ukrainian amateur astronomer Gennady Borisov (later named 2I/Borisov).
answer: On August 30, 2019, Gennady Borisov discovered Comet 2I/Borisov, marking the first confirmed detection of an interstellar comet.

formulation: Gunman kills seven and injures 22 during high speed chase in Odessa, Texas.
answer: On August 31, 2019, a shooter in Odessa, Texas, unleashed a deadly rampage during a police pursuit, resulting in seven fatalities and twenty-two injuries.

formulation: India removes citizenship status from 1.9 million people in state of Assam, leaving them off its new National Register of Citizens.
answer: The Assam government finalized the Citizenship Amendment Bill (CAB), effectively granting expedited citizenship to undocumented migrants from Bangladesh, Pakistan, and Afghanistan, impacting roughly 1.9 million people residing in Assam.

formulation: Major track crash during Formula 2 race at Spa-Francorchamps, Belgium kills Anthoine Hubert and critically injures Juan Manuel Correa.
answer: A multi-car collision during the sprint race resulted in the death of Anthoine Hubert and severe injuries to Juan Manuel Correa.

formulation: Minnesota Twins smash 6 HRs in 10-7 loss to the Tigers in Detroit; break MLB record by hitting 268th home run of the season.
answer: The Minnesota Twins became the first team in MLB history to record 20 or more strikeouts in a nine-inning game while also giving up 10 runs.

formulation: US missile attack in al-Qaeda jihadist training camp in Idlib province, Syria, kills 40.
answer: On August 31, 2019, a U.S.-led coalition carried out an airstrike in eastern Syria that destroyed an al-Qaeda training camp and resulted in the deaths of 40 individuals.

formulation: Midland–Odessa shootings: Seven people are killed and 21 others wounded in a spree shooting in West Texas, between the cities of Midland and Odessa. The suspect is shot and killed by police outside a movie theater in Odessa.
answer: On August 31, 2019, a shooting at a West Texas Walmart resulted in seven deaths and numerous injuries.

formulation: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier asks for Polish forgiveness for WWII at 80 year commemoration in Pilsudski Square, Warsaw.
answer: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier participated in a solemn ceremony in Warsaw on September 1, 2019, to commemorate the victims of the Warsaw Uprising and express his nation's profound remorse and solidarity with Poland.

formulation: Houston Astros starter Justin Verlander strikes out 14 as he throws his third career no-hitter in a 2-0 decision against the Toronto Blue Jays.
answer: On September 1, 2019, Justin Verlander pitched a perfect game against the Toronto Blue Jays, marking the first perfect game in Houston Astros history.

formulation: Hurricane Dorian makes landfall on Elbow Cay in the Abaco islands, northern Bahamas as a category five storm with winds of 180mph (285km/h).
answer: Hurricane Dorian, a category five hurricane, devastated the Bahamas on September 1, 2019.

formulation: Saudi-led coalition air strikes on Yemen city of Dhamar kills more than 100 people according to the Red Cross.
answer: On September 1, 2019, Saudi-led coalition air strikes in Yemen's Zeit al-Medhahm district resulted in the deaths of over 100 people, according to the Red Cross.

formulation: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson threatens a snap general election if rebel MPs pass bill against no-deal Brexit.
answer: On September 2, 2019, Boris Johnson demanded a general election, claiming the public should have the opportunity to decide the future of Brexit.

formulation: Diving boat catches fire at night killing 34 asleep on board off Santa Cruz Island, California.
answer: In September 2019, the diving boat *El Faro* caught fire while its passengers were sleeping, resulting in the tragic loss of 34 lives off the coast of Santa Cruz Island, California.

formulation: Violence and looting directed at foreigners in Johannesburg results in five deaths and dozens arrested by South African police.
answer: The 2019 Johannesburg riots, which began in early September 2019, were characterized by violence and looting directed primarily at foreign-owned businesses and individuals.

formulation: An early-morning fire on a dive boat off San Miguel Island and Santa Cruz Island, California results in 25 dead and 9 missing.
answer: A scuba diving boat, the *Hornblower*, capsized off the coast of Southern California on September 2, 2019, resulting in the deaths of 34 people and leaving many missing.

formulation: British PM Boris Johnson loses significant vote in parliament as MPs gain control of the timetable, orders whip withdrawn from 21 rebel Tory MPs.
answer: Boris Johnson controversially withdrew the whip from 21 Conservative MPs on September 3, 2019, effectively forcing them to vote against the government's Brexit deal.

formulation: Hurricane Dorian finally moves off Grand Bahama after stalling for more than a day bringing catastrophic devastation, killing at least 50 with over 2,000 people missing.
answer: Hurricane Dorian, a powerful Category 5 storm, caused unprecedented devastation and loss of life across the Bahamas in early September 2019.

formulation: Walmart says it will stop selling handguns and some ammunition and ask customers not to openly carry firearms in response to El Paso shootings.
answer: Walmart tightened its gun sales policies, including requiring a 72-hour waiting period, implementing enhanced background check procedures, and removing certain AR-15 style rifles from shelves in some locations.

formulation: The San Francisco Board of Supervisors passes a resolution calling the National Rifle Association of America a "domestic terrorist organization".
answer: In September 2019, the San Francisco Board of Supervisors unanimously passed a resolution declaring the Proud Boys a "domestic terrorist organization."

formulation: Walmart announces they will stop selling handgun ammunition and certain types of ammo for short-barrelled rifles. Kroger asks shoppers to refrain from openly carrying guns even if it is legal. Other major retailers follow suit.
answer: Major retailers such as Walmart, Kroger, and Costco implemented stricter ammunition purchase limits and enhanced background checks on firearm sales in September 2019.

formulation: The Cherokee Nation names an official delegate to the United States Congress for the first time.
answer: On September 3, 2019, the Cherokee Nation became the first tribe to have a citizen, Chuck Hoskin Jr., permanently seated on the House of Representatives.

formulation: British rebel alliance of MPs vote to ban a no-deal Brexit and reject PM Boris Johnson's call for a snap election.
answer: The House of Commons voted to back Boris Johnson's revised withdrawal agreement, despite a rebellion by a significant number of Conservative MPs.

formulation: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam withdraws controversial extradition bill to China after three months of massive protests.
answer: Carrie Lam announced a public inquiry into the protests to investigate the events and their causes.

formulation: CNN hosts ten town hall meetings for as many Democratic presidential hopefuls to discuss climate change.
answer: A CNN-hosted climate forum in early September 2019 brought together several Democratic presidential candidates to debate and outline their plans for addressing climate change.

formulation: Erramatti Mangamma becomes the world's oldest living mother after giving birth to twins, aged 74 in Hyderabad, India.
answer: In 2019, a 74-year-old woman achieved a record-breaking feat in reproductive science by successfully giving birth to twins through IVF.

formulation: New theory the Loss Ness monster may be a giant eel after DNA study reveals no plesiosaur or sturgeon DNA found.
answer: The 2019 DNA study identified DNA from two large, unknown species of eel in the loch, leading to the hypothesis that the "monster" sightings might be related to unusually large eels.

formulation: South African women march on parliament to protest violence against women after a month when 30 were killed by their spouses.
answer: A massive march in Johannesburg on September 5, 2019, saw hundreds of thousands of South Africans protest against gender-based violence and demand justice for the 30 women killed in the preceding month.

formulation: Sri Lankan cricket fast bowler Lasith Malinga takes 4 wickets in 4 balls and finishes with 5 for 6 as New Zealand all out for 88 in 37-run defeat in 3rd T-20 International in Pellekele.
answer: Lasith Malinga became the first bowler in international cricket history to bowl an entire T20 match without conceding a boundary.

formulation: Hurricane Dorian makes landfall on Cape Hatteras, North Carolina as a Category 1 storm. 350,000 residents and businesses in North Carolina and South Carolina are left without electricity.
answer: A powerful tropical storm, named Dorian, brought devastating flooding and strong winds to North Carolina and South Carolina on September 6, 2019, knocking out power for hundreds of thousands of residents.

formulation: Following three deaths, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends against the use of electronic cigarettes.
answer: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended that people who use e-cigarettes should stop using them, especially those who have never tried tobacco products, due to the growing number of cases of serious illness linked to vaping.

formulation: The Artificial Intelligence and Technology Office (AITO) is established, as part of the Department of Energy.
answer: The Department of Energy announced the creation of the Artificial Intelligence Initiative in September 2019.

formulation: Indian Space Agency loses contact with its Chandrayaan-2 moon lander just 2 km from landing on the Moon's surface.
answer: On September 7, 2019, the Chandrayaan-2 mission suffered a setback when its lander Vikram lost communication with ground control just two kilometers from the Moon's surface.

formulation: US President Donald Trump says he has cancelled a secret meeting with the Taliban for peace talks at Camp David.
answer: President Donald Trump announced a deal with the Taliban to withdraw US troops from Afghanistan in exchange for the Taliban's commitment to prevent Afghanistan from being used as a base for terrorist attacks.

formulation: President Trump announces he called off planned Camp David peace talks with the Taliban after they claimed responsibility for the September 5th Kabul bombings which killed a U.S. soldier.
answer: President Trump abruptly ended the peace negotiations with the Taliban and announced the deployment of an additional 4,000 troops to Afghanistan after a bombing that killed at least 13 civilians.

formulation: Brazil's Supreme Court rules Marvel comic depicting two men kissing can be sold after mayor of Rio de Janeiro attempted to ban it.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that the attempted ban on the comic book was unconstitutional and violated the right to freedom of expression.

formulation: Cargo ship Golden Ray catches fire and capsizes in St Simons Sound, off coast of Georgia, trapping four crew inside.
answer: On September 8, 2019, the container ship MSC Napoli caught fire and capsized off the coast of Georgia, trapping four crew members inside.

formulation: Typhoon Faxai makes landfall near Tokyo, Japan, with winds of up to 210km/h (130mph).
answer: Tokyo was hit by a powerful typhoon, Hagibis, which brought destructive winds and heavy rainfall.

formulation: Mark Sanford, former governor and US representative from South Carolina announces his candidacy for the 2020 Republican presidential nomination.
answer: On September 8, 2019, Mark Sanford announced his candidacy for Governor of South Carolina.

formulation: Australia experiences its earliest and most severe start to the fire season after fighting dozens of bushfires in Queensland and New South Wales.
answer: The 2019–20 Australian bushfire season, also known as the Black Summer, began in September 2019 and initiated the earliest and most severe fire season on record for Queensland and New South Wales.

formulation: John Legend and wife Chrissy Teigen fire back at Donald Trump on social media after he calls them "boring" and "filthymouthed" in tweets over Criminal Justice Reform.
answer: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen publicly responded to President Trump’s criticism of their comments on Criminal Justice Reform with a series of witty and pointed tweets and replies.

formulation: Nigerian government says it will repatriate 600 people from South Africa after two people killed in wave of xenophobic violence in Johannesburg.
answer: The Nigerian government imposed a travel ban to South Africa and recalled its High Commissioner in protest over the violence and resulting deaths.

formulation: Scientist reveal evidence of humans earliest milk consumption, 6,000 years ago from the dental plaque of teeth of prehistoric farmers from Britain.
answer: Scientists discovered that Neolithic farmers in Britain consumed a surprisingly diverse diet, including meat, fish, and dairy products, based on dental plaque analysis from ancient remains.

formulation: The inspector general of Intelligence, Michael Atkinson, notifies the House Intelligence Committee about an "urgent" and "credible" whistleblower complaint involving an apparent July 25 telephone call in which President Donald Trump promised  Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky $250 million if he would reopen an investigation into Hunter Biden son of former Vice President Joe Biden. The White House denies doing anything wrong and refuses to release the complaint.
answer: On September 9, 2019, the House of Representatives received a formal whistleblower complaint detailing concerns about President Trump's July 25 phone call with Ukrainian President Zelensky.

formulation: Bolivian wildfires have destroyed two million hectares (almost five million acres), of forest and grassland since August according to College of Biologists in La Paz.
answer: In September 2019, a massive wildfire ravaged Bolivia, devastating two million hectares of forest and grassland.

formulation: Iranian woman Sahar Khodayari dies after setting herself on fire during her trial, for entering a stadium disguised as a man in Tehran.
answer: A young Iranian woman tragically self-immolated after being arrested and prosecuted for violating Iran's ban on women attending sporting events, an act widely interpreted as a protest against discriminatory social laws.

formulation: Malaysia's National Disaster Management Agency delivers half a million face masks to Sarawak state, after more than 930,000 hectares (about 2.3 million acres) burnt in Indonesia cause hazardous levels of air pollution.
answer: Malaysia declared a pollution emergency in September 2019 and closed its schools and borders in an attempt to mitigate the severe air quality issues stemming from Indonesian forest fires.

formulation: US President Donald Trump fires his third national security adviser John Bolton.
answer: On September 10, 2019, President Donald Trump dismissed National Security Advisor John Bolton in a stunning political move.

formulation: National Security Advisor John R. Bolton is dismissed by President Trump.
answer: On September 10, 2019, Donald Trump appointed Robert O'Brien as his new National Security Advisor, replacing H.R. McMaster.

formulation: Two former senior FEMA officials are arrested on charges of bribery in relation to Hurricane Maria relief.
answer: In September 2019, a federal grand jury indicted former FEMA officials Alejandro de Nigris and Richard Engel on charges of defrauding the government in connection with Hurricane Maria relief efforts.

formulation: Water detected for first time on planet outside out solar system, on exoplanet K2-18b 110 light-years away, in findings published in "Nature Astronomy".
answer: Scientists reported the first detection of water vapor in the atmosphere of K2-18b, a potentially habitable exoplanet orbiting a red dwarf star.

formulation: Former Illinois and Florida nursing home owner Philip Esformes is convicted of $1.3 billion Medicare fraud and sentenced to 20 years in prison.
answer: On September 12, 2019, Joseph Ricci was convicted of orchestrating a $1.3 billion Medicare fraud scheme and sentenced to 20 years in prison.

formulation: During the third 2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries debate Democratic presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke, arguing for a mandatory buyback of assault weapons, declares, “Hell yes, we are going to take your AR-15, AK-47.”.
answer: Beto O'Rourke declared that if elected, he would require every gun owner to undergo a 10-day waiting period before purchasing a firearm.

formulation: Actress Felicity Huffman is sentenced to 14 days in prison, a fine of $30,000 and 250 hours of community service for her involvement in the college admissions scandal.
answer: Felicity Huffman received a two-month prison sentence, followed by a year of supervised release, and had to perform 100 hours of community service as part of her sentencing.

formulation: Drone attack on Abqaiq oil plant in Saudi Arabia takes out half of country's oil production and 5% of the world's. Yemen Houthi rebels claim responsibility.
answer: On September 14, 2019, a drone attack on Saudi Arabia's Abqurain oil facility caused a significant drop in the nation's oil production.

formulation: Former Welsh rugby union and league player Gareth Thomas reveals he is HIV positive.
answer: On September 14, 2019, Gareth Thomas revealed he had been living with HIV for over 20 years, aiming to break the stigma surrounding the illness.

formulation: Hong Kong police use water cannons and tear gas attempting to disperse thousands of protesters outside the British embassy, as protests continue in the city.
answer: On September 15, 2019, the Hong Kong police violently cleared protesters and their barricades near the British embassy using tear gas, rubber bullets, and batons.

formulation: Norman Lear (97) becomes oldest person to win an Emmy Award, in the variety special category for ABC’s “Live in Front of a Studio Audience: All in the Family".
answer: In September 2019, Norman Lear became the oldest person to ever win an Emmy Award for his work on "Mrs. America."

formulation: UK PM Boris Johnson compares himself to Marvel Hulk character in newspaper interview "The madder Hulk gets, the stronger Hulk gets" about UK exiting the EU.
answer: Boris Johnson declared that he would "be like Captain Britain" - a character capable of "holding the whole country together" during the Brexit negotiations.

formulation: Drug company Purdue Pharma files for bankruptcy in response to lawsuits related to the opioid epidemic.
answer: In September 2019, Purdue Pharma reached a $8 billion settlement agreement with the U.S. Department of Justice and numerous states to address its role in the opioid crisis.

formulation: 50,000 workers at General Motors go on strike in the US over pay and factory closings.
answer: On September 16, 2019, over 50,000 John Deere workers across the United States initiated a historic strike demanding improved wages and the prevention of factory closures.

formulation: Guantánamo Bay is the world's most expensive prison at US$13 million per prisoner according to investigation by "The New York Times".
answer: A 2019 Government Accountability Office (GAO) report revealed that operating Guantánamo Bay cost the U.S. government approximately $13 million per prisoner.

formulation: Marvel actor Mark Ruffalo rebuffs UK PM Boris Johnson, who compared himself to Hulk, "Boris Johnson forgets that the Hulk only fights for the good of the whole".
answer: Mark Ruffalo posted a photo of himself alongside the Hulk actor, Edward Norton, mocking Boris Johnson’s Hulk comparison.

formulation: Personal data on every Ecuadorean citizen discovered online on unsecured cloud server.
answer: On September 16, 2019, Ecuador experienced a massive data breach exposing the personal information of all 18 million citizens due to data being stored on an unsecured cloud server.

formulation: Study puts prices on value of "thoughts and prayers", average Christian willing to pay US$4 for a prayer, average atheists would pay US$3 not to receive one, published in "Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences".
answer: A *Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences* study from September 16, 2019, found that Christians were willing to pay $4 for a prayer and atheists were willing to pay $3 to avoid receiving one.

formulation: 48,000 union members of the United Automobile Workers go on strike against General Motors.
answer: In September 2019, United Auto Workers (UAW) members initiated a historic strike against General Motors, impacting thousands of workers and halting production across the company’s North American facilities.

formulation: Saturday Night Live fires comedian Shane Gillis after his anti-Asian and anti-gay videos come to light. Presidential candidate Andrew Yang, who is Taiwanese-American and was called a “Jew c***k,” forgives Gillis.
answer: Pete Davidson was fired from "Saturday Night Live" after posting a crude, unsolicited meme of Andrew Yang on Instagram without permission.

formulation: Indonesia raises the female marriage age to 19, in line with males, to curb child marriages.
answer: Indonesia raised the legal minimum age for marriage from 17 to 19 for both men and women on September 17, 2019.

formulation: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg tells US Congress "I know you are trying but just not hard enough. Sorry.”.
answer: Greta Thunberg delivered a powerful speech to the United States Congress on September 17, 2019, urging lawmakers to take immediate action on climate change.

formulation: Boarding school fire kills at least 27 in Monrovia, Liberia.
answer: A fire at the Wheacup Academy boarding school in Liberia killed at least 27 people, including students and staff.

formulation: Indian government proposes a ban on e-cigarettes.
answer: In September 2019, the Indian government proposed to ban e-cigarettes nationwide.

formulation: Saudi Arabia's Defense Ministry says Iran was to blame for drone attack on Saudi oil facilities.
answer: On September 18, 2019, the United States accused Iran of carrying out a drone attack on Saudi oil facilities, marking a significant escalation in tensions between the two countries.

formulation: US White House bars California and other states from setting their own emission standards.
answer: On September 18, 2019, the White House issued a memorandum directing federal agencies to prioritize compliance with its own national standards for vehicle emissions, effectively diminishing states' ability to establish their own stricter standards.

formulation: Likely US drone attack kills at least 30 and injures 28 in Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.
answer: A powerful roadside bomb in Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan, detonated on September 19, 2019, killing at least 30 people and injuring 28 others.

formulation: North America has lost 3 billion birds (29%) since 1970 according to analysis published in "Science".
answer: A comprehensive analysis in "Science" revealed that North America's bird populations have declined by approximately 30% since 1970.

formulation: Taliban suicide truck bombing kills 22 and injures 90 at a hospital in Zabul Province, southern Afghanistan.
answer: On September 19, 2019, a Taliban suicide bombing at a hospital in Zabul Province, Afghanistan, killed 22 people and injured 90 others.

formulation: Tropical Depression Imelda hits southeast Texas and Louisiana prompting widespread evacuations.
answer: Hurricane Hanna made landfall in southeast Texas in September 2019, causing widespread flooding and prompting mass evacuations.

formulation: Australian PM Scott Morrison welcomed for week-long visit at the White House by US President Donald Trump.
answer: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison and U.S. President Donald Trump held a joint press conference in New York City announcing a bilateral trade deal.

formulation: Batman Day - 80th anniversary of the first Batman comic.
answer: September 20, 2019, marked the 80th anniversary of Superman's debut in *Action Comics* #1.

formulation: Rare Egyptian political protests take place against corruption in President Abdul Fattah al-Sisi's government in Tahrir Square, Cairo and elsewhere.
answer: Massive protests, dubbed the "Blasts of Truth," erupted in Tahrir Square and across Egypt in September 2019, demanding the ouster of President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and protesting widespread corruption.

formulation: Researchers for SETI (Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence) propose that aliens may have bugged earths co-orbitals (nearby orbiting rocks) in "The Astronomical Journal".
answer: The Astronomical Journal reported in September 2019 that the journal suggested extraterrestrial beings might be monitoring Earth using co-orbitals.

formulation: Students from 185 countries stage the world's largest-ever protest on climate change, culminating in a Manhattan rally led by Greta Thunberg.
answer: The Global Climate Strike, fueled by Greta Thunberg, took place on September 20, 2019, with a massive rally in Manhattan demonstrating youth demand for climate action.

formulation: The MOSAiC expedition, the greatest Arctic research expedition ever, sets sail from Norway, aims to stay trapped in ice for a year to study climate change.
answer: The Multidisciplinary Transpolar Drift Expedition (MTDE) set sail from Norway in September 2019, with the ambitious goal of remaining trapped in ice for a year to study climate change.

formulation: "Queer Eye" star Jonathan Van Ness reveals he is living with HIV and is a sexual abuse survivor, ahead of the publication of his autobiography.
answer: Shortly before his autobiography’s release, Jonathan Van Ness revealed that he had been misdiagnosed with Lupus for years, which was actually a severe case of Crohn's disease.

formulation: Skies turn red over Jambi province, Indonesia, as worst illegal forest fires since 2015 burn more than 800,000 acres, creating respiratory problems for a million people.
answer: In September 2019, a massive peatland fire ravaged Jambi province, Indonesia, causing widespread deforestation and severe air pollution.

formulation: Billy Porter becomes the first openly gay actor to win an Emmy for lead actor in a drama series for "Pose".
answer: Billy Porter became the first openly gay actor to win an Emmy for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series on September 22, 2019.

formulation: US President Donald Trump admits he spoke to Ukrainian President about Joe Biden's son, after news a US intelligence officer made an official complaint about the call.
answer: President Trump faced impeachment proceedings in September 2019 after allegations surfaced that he pressured the Ukrainian president to investigate Joe Biden and his son Hunter while withholding military aid, based on a whistleblower complaint.

formulation: 178 year old British travel company Thomas Cook goes into liquidation, stranding 600,000 travellers worldwide, prompting the largest postwar repatriation effort by the UK government.
answer: Thomas Cook ceased trading on September 23, 2019, resulting in the abrupt collapse of the travel company and the mass repatriation of its stranded customers.

formulation: Climate activist Greta Thunberg scolds world leaders "How Dare You" for not addressing climate change at the UN Climate Action Summit in New York.
answer: Greta Thunberg delivered a fiery condemnation of world leaders, accusing them of stealing her generation’s future by failing to take meaningful action on climate change.

formulation: Haitian Senator Jean-Marie Ralph Féthière opens fire hitting a journalist leaving parliament in Port-au-Prince.
answer: Haitian Senator Jean Junior Martinez physically assaulted journalist Daniel Dubois Morvan outside of a radio station in Port-au-Prince, sparking outrage and fueling fears of intimidation against the press.

formulation: Renewed violence in West Papua region, Indonesia, leaves 27 dead in capital Wamena after protesters set fire to buildings over racism claims.
answer: On September 23, 2019, Wamena, Indonesia, experienced a violent outbreak of ethnic clashes following protests against racism, resulting in widespread fatalities.

formulation: US police officer fired after arresting two six-year-olds at a school on charges of misdemeanour battery in Florida.
answer: On September 23, 2019, a police officer arrested two six-year-old boys for allegedly throwing a water balloon at a school principal, resulting in the officer's subsequent termination.

formulation: 5.8 magnitude earthquake in northern Pakistan kills at least 10 and injures 300.
answer: A devastating flash flood struck northern Pakistan on September 24, 2019, causing widespread damage and casualties.

formulation: Protests outside Indonesian parliament and elsewhere over proposed new laws banning sex before marriage, abortion and insulting the president.
answer: Millions of Indonesians took to the streets across the country on September 24, 2019, protesting the controversial second draft of the Law on Job Creation and related amendments.

formulation: UK Supreme Court rules the suspension of UK parliament for 5 weeks by Boris Johnson's Conservative government was unlawful.
answer: The UK Supreme Court ruled that Boris Johnson’s prorogation of Parliament in September 2019 was unlawful.

formulation: Australia's Capital Territory becomes the 1st state in Australia to legalize recreational marijuana.
answer: On September 25, 2019, the Australian Capital Territory legalized the personal use of cannabis for recreational purposes through a landmark legislative change.

formulation: Bulgarian economist Kristalina Georgieva named as the new head of the IMF.
answer: In September 2019, Kristalina Georgieva, a Bulgarian economist, was appointed as the Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund.

formulation: Hazzaa Al Mansoori becomes first Emirati in space and the first Arab astronaut to travel to the International Space Station, travelling on Russian Soyuz-MS 15 spacecraft.
answer: On September 25, 2019, Emirati astronaut Hazzaa Al Mansoori became the first Arab citizen to travel to the International Space Station.

formulation: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige reported to have been asked to develop a Star Wars film by the Walt Disney Company.
answer: In September 2019, Lucasfilm announced that Kevin Feige would be joining the Star Wars creative team as president of Lucasfilm Games.

formulation: Oaxaca becomes the second Mexican state to decriminalize abortion, during the first 12 weeks.
answer: On September 25, 2019, Oaxaca, Mexico, legalized abortion upon request up to 12 weeks of gestation.

formulation: Abortion is decriminalized in New South Wales, the last remaining Australian state to do so.
answer: On September 26, 2019, New South Wales decriminalized abortion, ending the legal prohibition that had previously criminalized the procedure.

formulation: US Income inequality widest for over 50 years, worst in California, Connecticut, Florida, Louisiana and New York, according to new census figures.
answer: On September 26, 2019, a report revealed a growing divide in state-level income inequality, with some states experiencing dramatically higher growth rates than others.

formulation: WHO announces 800,000 children in DR Congo will be vaccinated in nine days in worlds's largest measles epidemic that has taken over 3,500 lives.
answer: The WHO launched the Measles Global Outbreak Alert and Response (MOSAAR) initiative in late September 2019 to rapidly deploy resources and expertise to combat the devastating measles epidemic in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

formulation: US Democrats issue their first subpoena to Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, in impeachment inquiry.
answer: On September 27, 2019, the House Intelligence Committee issued a subpoena for Secretary of State Mike Pompeo’s phone records.

formulation: Hurricane Lorenzo becomes 1st category 5 storm to be recorded so far north and east, 1,420 miles southwest of the Azores.
