answer: Hurricane Dorian transitioned to a Category 5 hurricane and rapidly intensified off the coast of the Carolinas, becoming the first such storm recorded this far north and east in the Atlantic.

formulation: Houthi rebels from Yemen claim they have killed 500 Saudi soldiers and captured 2,000 along with military a convoy in Najran region, Saudi Arabia.
answer: Houthi rebels claimed to have inflicted heavy casualties on Saudi forces in Najran during a recent military operation.

formulation: 315 billion-tonne iceberg named D28 breaks away from Amery Ice Shelf, Antarctica.
answer: On September 30, 2019, a colossal iceberg, dubbed A-76, calved from the Amery Ice Shelf in Antarctica.

formulation: China celebrates 70th anniversary of Communism with military parade of 15,000 soldiers in Beijing.
answer: China held a grand military parade and celebration on October 1, 2019, commemorating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.

formulation: Former Dallas police Officer Amber Guyger found guilty of murdering her black neighbor in his apartment in landmark case on use of police force and racial bias.
answer: The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals overturned Amber Guyton’s conviction in October 2019, citing ineffective assistance of counsel and claiming the jury instructions were unduly prejudicial, further fueling debates about police brutality and racial bias in the criminal justice system.

formulation: Indian government bans the export of onions, an important food staple to control prices, causing shortages in Bangladesh and Nepal.
answer: In late 2019, the Indian government imposed export restrictions on onions and subsidized their domestic sale to curb prices, leading to increased onion imports from neighboring countries like Bangladesh and Nepal.

formulation: Law allowing teachers to carry guns in schools comes into effect in US state of Florida.
answer: Florida’s Senate Bill 7026, which went into effect on October 1, 2019, authorized school personnel, including teachers, to carry firearms on school campuses.

formulation: Political crisis in Peru as President Martín Vizcarra dissolves Congress over its refusal to support his anti-corruption reforms.
answer: On October 1, 2019, President Martín Vizcarra dissolved the Congress of the Republic and declared a state of emergency in Peru.

formulation: The first cannabis cafe in the United States opens in Los Angeles, California.
answer: The first legal cannabis dispensary in Los Angeles, Cookies, officially opened on October 1, 2019.

formulation: The Florida Department of Education announces that some teachers in some districts will be allowed to carry guns in schools.
answer: The Florida Department of Education announced that school districts could allow trained and vetted employees, including armed teachers, to carry firearms on school campuses.

formulation: Australian women's cricket wicketkeeper Alyssa Healy smashes T20I world record 148 not out off 61 balls against Sri Lanka in Sydney; her century from Australian record 46 balls.
answer: Alyssa Healy became the first woman to score a T20I century (100 not out) on October 2, 2019, against Sri Lanka in Sydney.

formulation: Two politicians in Peru claim to be the country's leader for a day until Mercedes Aráoz resigns so the constitutional court can rule on the matter.
answer: Peru's president, Pedro Castillo, attempted to dissolve Congress and declare a state of emergency, prompting opposition leader Manuel Merino to claim the interim presidency and ultimately resign after widespread protests.

formulation: Gabby Giffords and March for Our Lives host a forum on gun safety for 2020 presidential candidates in Las Vegas, Nevada. Nine candidates laid out plans for stronger gun control. Senator Bernie Sanders does not attend as he is recovering from an operation.
answer: On October 2, 2019, a group of 2020 presidential candidates convened in Las Vegas to address gun control proposals, excluding Pete Buttigieg who was recovering from surgery.

formulation: Senate Democrats ask the IRS to revoke the tax-exempt status of the National Rifle Association of America (NRA).
answer: Senate Democrats introduced legislation to eliminate the National Rifle Association’s tax-exempt status as a 501(c)(4) organization.

formulation: California becomes the second state, after North Dakota, to allow the establishment of public banks as an alternative to commercial banks. The idea is to provide low-interest loans for businesses, affordable housing, and municipal infrastructure.
answer: California passed Assembly Bill 128, which authorized the creation of state-chartered public banks to address funding gaps in underserved communities.

formulation: Dallas police officer Amber Guyger is sentenced to 10 years in prison after being found guilty of murdering Botham Jean in his home. This is the first time a white female police officer has been convicted of murdering an unarmed black man. Joshua Brown, a key witness in the trial, is killed two days later.
answer: In October 2019, Kristen DeAngelis was acquitted of murdering Jamar Salam, a black man, and shortly after, key witness and DeAngelis's friend, Michael Brown, was killed.

formulation: Ten anti-drone protesters are arrested at Creech Air Force Base in Nevada.
answer: Activists staged a civil disobedience protest at Creech Air Force Base in Nevada on October 2, 2019, attempting to disrupt drone strikes and raise awareness about the program's impact.

formulation: Finland agrees to return Native American remains and other artifacts stolen in 1891 to Mesa Verde National Park in Colorado.
answer: In October 2019, Finland signed an agreement with the United States to return 277 Native American remains and artifacts recovered during the Finnish expedition to Beringia.

formulation: CNN refuses to run an ad for the Donald Trump 2020 presidential campaign, saying it includes false claims against former Vice President Joe Biden. Fox News rejects a request from the Joe Biden 2020 presidential campaign to not run the ad either.
answer: On October 3, 2019, CNN rejected a Trump campaign advertisement, while Fox News agreed to run a Biden campaign ad.

formulation: President Trump calls on Ukraine and China to investigate former Vice President Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden.
answer: President Trump released a whistleblower complaint in October 2019 accusing Vice President Biden and his son Hunter Biden of corruption related to a business deal in Ukraine.

formulation: The Washington Post reports an Internal Revenue Service employee filed a whistleblower complaint reporting that an unnamed political appointee at the United States Department of the Treasury tried to interfere with the tax audits for President Trump or Vice President Mike Pence.
answer: An IRS employee, William Thorne, was charged with obstructing an investigation into the tax affairs of Michael Cohen, Donald Trump’s lawyer, on October 3, 2019.

formulation: European Commission spokesperson Daniel Rosario threatens retaliatory measures if the United States imposes a US$7.5 billion (€6.823 billion) tariff on products such as olives, whiskey, wine, cheese, yogurt, and airplanes. The tariffs are scheduled to take effect on October 18.
answer: In October 2019, the United States and the European Union initiated a trade war, with the U.S. threatening tariffs on European goods while the EU retaliated with potential tariffs on American products.

formulation: Fuel subsidies end in Ecuador after four decades, prompting nationwide protests and President Lenín Moreno to declare 60-day state of emergency.
answer: On October 4, 2019, President Lenín Moreno decreed the imposition of a state of exception in Ecuador to quell the widespread protests and restore order.

formulation: Microsoft says a group called Phosphorus, which is linked to the Iranian government, has attempted to hack accounts belonging to American journalists, former government officials, and the 2020 United States presidential election, as well as prominent Iranians living outside Iran.
answer: In October 2019, the Muddy Waters group, linked to Iran, launched a widespread cyberattack targeting journalists, human rights activists, and U.S. government and political accounts.

formulation: The Bureau of Land Management ends a five-year moratorium on leasing federal land in California to fossil fuel companies, opening 725,000 acres (1100 sq. miles; 29,000 ha) to drilling in San Benito, Monterey, and Fresno counties.
answer: The Trump administration lifted a five-year moratorium on drilling for oil and gas in California’s federal lands, opening approximately 725,000 acres to such development on October 4, 2019.

formulation: Defense Secretary Mark Esper says the United States has picked up its attacks in Afghanistan since peace talks with the Taliban fell apart last month. In August, Politico reported that the U.S. troop strength is about 13,000, fewer than the authorized 14,000.
answer: As of early October 2019, the U.S. military was winding down its combat operations in Afghanistan while simultaneously continuing to pressure the Taliban to engage in meaningful negotiations, with a key focus on troop withdrawal deadlines and security arrangements for Kabul.

formulation: A report by the Associated Press finds that 1,700 Roman Catholic priests accused of being sex offenders live freely in the United States.
answer: The Associated Press reported on October 4, 2019, that the number of accusations against Catholic priests worldwide had risen sharply in recent years, with thousands of allegations now under investigation.

formulation: Joker is released in theatres.
answer: Joker, a film examining the creation of Batman’s nemesis, premiered in theaters on October 4, 2019.

formulation: 99 Iraqis have died and 4,000 injured in protests over 5 days against living conditions, unemployment and corruption according to human rights group.
answer: The major protests in Iraq in early October 2019 focused on demands for an end to corruption, improved public services, and government reform, resulting in at least 100 reported deaths and thousands injured.

formulation: Tens of thousands of Hong Kong protesters march in defiance of a new ban on face masks.
answer: On October 6, 2019, hundreds of thousands of protesters flooded Hong Kong’s streets in a massive demonstration against the government’s ban on face masks.

formulation: Nobel Prize for Medicine or Physiology awarded to Peter Ratcliffe, William Kaelin and Gregg Semenza for discovering how cells sense oxygen.
answer: In 2019, three scientists were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their research on how cells sense and respond to oxygen levels.

formulation: Federal judge Victor Marrero orders Trump to turn over eight years of tax returns, saying he cannot endorse a "categorical and limitless assertion of presidential immunity from judicial process." An appeals court grants a temporary stay of the order.
answer: On October 7, 2019, a federal judge ruled that President Trump was not entitled to presidential immunity, allowing the House to subpoena his financial records.

formulation: FBI confirm Samuel Little is America's most prolific serial killer, after verifying more than half of his 93 confessed murders.
answer: The FBI officially confirmed Samuel Little as America's most prolific serial killer following the discovery of 93 additional victims linked to him through his self-confessions and forensic evidence.

formulation: Montgomery, Alabama, home of the US civil rights movement, elects Steven Reed as its first black mayor in 200 years.
answer: Montgomery, Alabama, elected David Welch as its first black mayor on October 8, 2019, ending a 200-year tradition of white mayors.

formulation: Noble Prize for Physics awarded to James Peebles (work on evolution of the universe), and Michel Mayor and Didier Queloz (discovery of planet 51 Pegasi b, orbiting another star).
answer: On October 8, 2019, the Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to James Peebles, Michel Mayor, and Didier Queloz for their pioneering contributions to the field of astrophysics.

formulation: Nearly 1 million people in northern California have their power cut by Pacific Gas and Electric to prevent wildfires amid high winds.
answer: Pacific Gas and Electric proactively shut off power to over 160,000 customers across northern California in an effort to prevent wildfires.

formulation: Nobel Prize for Chemistry awarded to John B. Goodenough, M. Stanley Whittingham and Akira Yoshino for development of lithium-ion batteries, Goodenough oldest-ever winner at 97.
answer: The 2019 Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to John B. Goodenough, M. Stanley Whittingham, and Akira Yoshino for their development of lithium-ion batteries.

formulation: Turkey launches airstrikes on Kurdish forces in Northern Syria after US President Donald Trump announces decision to pull back US forces.
answer: Turkey launched a military operation, dubbed "Operation Peace Spring," into northeastern Syria on October 9, 2019, targeting Kurdish forces.

formulation: The Wall Street Journal reports that two foreign-born businessmen, close associates of Rudy Giuliani, have been arrested on campaign finance violation charges. Igor Fruman (Belarusian) and Lev Parnas (Ukrainian), worked with Giuliani in trying to convince the Ukraine government to find dirt on former Vice President Joe Biden.
answer: On October 9, 2019, Rudy Giuliani arranged a meeting between Ukrainian officials and two jailed businessmen, Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman, who were later implicated in campaign finance violations.

formulation: 2018 Nobel Prize for Literature awarded to Polish writer Olga Tokarczuk, after a year's delay due to Swedish Academy scandal.
answer: Olga Tokarczuk received the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2019.

formulation: 2019 Nobel Prize for Literature awarded to Austrian Peter Handke.
answer: The Nobel Prize in Literature was announced on October 10, 2019, and was awarded to Austrian author Peter Handke.

formulation: 3,500 women are the first to be allowed to attend a football match in Iran for a World Cup qualifier in Tehran, since the Islamic revolution.
answer: On October 10, 2019, Iranian authorities officially lifted the ban on women attending football matches, a landmark decision after three decades of prohibition.

formulation: President Trump's 4th U.S. Homeland Security Advisor, Kevin McAleenan, resigns.
answer: On October 11, 2019, President Trump announced the resignation of Brian Kujang, his fourth Homeland Security Advisor.

formulation: Marie Yovanovitch, the former ambassador to Ukraine, testifies at the Impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump. Former diplomats and oversight committee members praise Yovanovitch's "bravery" for testifying in response to a subpoena but in defiance of a State Department order.
answer: In October 2019, former Ambassador Marie Yovanovitch testified before Congress, bravely defying a State Department order to explain her experiences and interactions with President Trump regarding alleged corruption.

formulation: 100,000 people in northern Los Angeles County, California are evacuated as the Saddle Ridge Fire grows to more than 7,500 acres and is 13% contained. 25 homes are destroyed and one death is reported.
answer: The Woolsey fire, a devastating wildfire in northern Los Angeles County, caused widespread evacuations and destroyed hundreds of homes in October 2019.

formulation: Defense Secretary Mark Esper announces that the U.S. is sending additional troops and weapons to Saudi Arabia.
answer: On October 11, 2019, U.S. Defense Secretary Mark Esper announced the deployment of an additional 1,400 troops to Iraq to prevent further violence and maintain stability.

formulation: California is the 1st US state to pass law banning sale and manufacture of new fur products.
answer: In October 2019, California passed Assembly Bill 1173, banning the sale and distribution of fur products within the state.

formulation: Typhoon Hagibis makes landfall on the Izu Peninsula near Tokyo, Japan, bringing record rainfall and killing at least 56 people.
answer: Japan experienced a devastating record-breaking flooding and landslides in October 2019 due to torrential rainfall, leading to widespread destruction and tragically, many casualties.

formulation: Students at Georgia Southern University burn books written by Jennine Capó Crucet, a Cuban-American author, who had been invited to the school to discuss white privilege.
answer: In October 2019, a student protest at the University of California, Berkeley, erupted after Sean Spicer, a former White House press secretary, was scheduled to speak about free speech.

formulation: Democratic incumbent Governor of Louisiana John Bel Edwards is narrowly forced into a run-off in his bid for a second term. He advances to a runoff (November 16) with wealthy Republican businessman Eddie Rispone.
answer: Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards defeated Republican challenger Eddie Gilliard in a close election, securing his second term.

formulation: Two people are killed and 20 injured when a Hard Rock Hotel and Casino under construction in downtown New Orleans partially collapses.
answer: A portion of a new hotel's roof collapsed in downtown New Orleans on October 12, 2019, killing two construction workers and injuring dozens of others.

formulation: Ecuadorean President Lenín Moreno cancels his austerity plan, in deal with indigenous leaders, restoring fuel subsidies, ending weeks of violent protests.
answer: On October 13, 2019, President Lenín Moreno and indigenous leaders reached a historic agreement that suspended austerity measures and fuel subsidy cuts following widespread protests.

formulation: Kenya's Brigid Kosgei sets new world record of 2:14.04 for the women's marathon in Chicago, beating Paula Radcliffe's 16-year-old mark.
answer: Brigid Kosgei broke the women’s marathon world record on October 13, 2019, in Chicago with a stunning time of 2:14:04.

formulation: Tunisian presidential election won by academic Kais Saied defeating media mogul Nabil Karoui.
answer: On October 13, 2019, Kamel Ben Soia, an academic, defeated Nabil Karoui, a media mogul and businessman, in Tunisia's presidential election.

formulation: Hundreds of forest fires break out in western Lebanon, killing three and prompting calls for international help.
answer: A massive ammonium nitrate explosion devastated the port of Beirut in October 2019, causing widespread damage and loss of life.

formulation: Nobel prize for Economics awarded to Esther Duflo, Abhijit Banerjee and Michael Kremer for research on ways to fight poverty.
answer: Three economists received the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences in October 2019 for their groundbreaking research on behavioral economics and poverty alleviation.

formulation: Indigenous Peoples' Day is celebrated in Alaska, Minnesota, and North Carolina as well as several cities.
answer: Indigenous Peoples' Day is celebrated on the second Monday of October.

formulation: Gunfight between Mexican security forces and armed civilians leaves 15 dead, in Guerrero state, a day after 13 police killed in a drug cartel ambush in Michoacán state.
answer: In October 2019, clashes between security forces and the self-styled "Golden Triangle" Cartel resulted in significant violence in Guerrero and Michoacán states.

formulation: Record 12 Democratic presidential candidates participate in a live TV debate in Westerville, Ohio.
answer: On October 15, 2019, a record 14 Democratic presidential candidates participated in a live televised debate.

formulation: Twelve Democratic presidential candidates appear on the same stage at Otterbein University in Westerville, Ohio in a debate sponsored by The New York Times and CNN.
answer: A significant Democratic presidential debate featuring candidates like Bernie Sanders, Joe Biden, Elizabeth Warren, and Pete Buttigieg was held in Ohio in October 2019 and was sponsored by The New York Times and CNN.

formulation: Egyptian archaeologists announce discovery of more than 20 painted wooden coffins from Theban necropolis of Asasif.
answer: Egyptian archaeologists announced the discovery of over 20 beautifully painted wooden coffins in the Theban necropolis of Asasif on October 16, 2019.

formulation: First plant-powered selfie taken by Pete the Fern as part of research into use of microbial fuel cells at London Zoo (London, England).
answer: Researchers at London Zoo created microbial fuel cells powered by bacteria digesting penguin poop, capturing the energy generation process with a selfie featuring a penguin’s face.

formulation: Mick Mulvaney, President Trump's acting chief of staff says the White House withheld nearly $400 million in military aid from Ukraine to further Trump's own political interests.
answer: Mick Mulvaney stated that the White House was essentially "leasing" the aid to Ukraine, rather than providing it as a straightforward transfer.

formulation: The 'Blob', mysterious yellow slime organism (physarum polycephalum) with 720 sexes, moves and can solve problems to go on display at the Paris Zoological Park.
answer: The axolotl, a salamander renowned for its complex behavior and remarkable regenerative capabilities, captivated visitors at a Paris Zoological Park exhibit in mid-October 2019.

formulation: US adults identifying as Christian falls 12% in a decade to 2/3 according to the Pew Research Center, born-again Protestants falls to 16%.
answer: The Pew Research Center reported in October 2019 that religious affiliation was declining, especially among Christianity and born-again Protestants, with more Americans identifying as religiously unaffiliated.

formulation: 1st all-female spacewalk by NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir outside the International Space Station.
answer: On October 18, 2019, Christina Koch and Jessica Meir became the first all-female crew to conduct a long-duration spacewalk outside the International Space Station, pioneering a new era of female leadership in space exploration.

formulation: Charges of disorderly conduct officially dropped against participants of the 1939 equal rights protest sit-in at Alexandria (Virginia) Library.
answer: In 2019, a federal judge ruled that the descendants of the 1939 Alexandria library sit-in participants were eligible for veteran’s benefits.

formulation: The United States Department of State finishes its investigation into Hillary Clinton's email controversy, citing violations by 38 people, some of whom may be punished. The State Department determined that there was "deliberate mishandling of classified information".
answer: The Department of State concluded on October 18, 2019, that there was no evidence of any wrongdoing by Hillary Clinton regarding the handling of her emails while Secretary of State.

formulation: The Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration announces that refugee flights to the United States have been canceled for the second time, as refugees are capped at 18,000.
answer: The Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration announced on October 18, 2019, that the U.S. would resettle 22,500 refugees from several countries, including Syria, Yemen, and Somalia.

formulation: Sunnyside, Queens, New York City: Intersection of 46th Street and Skillman Avenue named "Ethel Plimack Way", in honor of a longtime resident.
answer: On October 19, 2019, Sunnyside, Queens held a ceremony to officially name a street after Samuel "Sam" Shapiro, a beloved community member.

formulation: UK parliament votes for the Letwin amendment in a special Saturday sitting, which forces Boris Johnson to ask the EU for an extension and delays vote on his Brexit deal.
answer: The UK Parliament voted against Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s withdrawal agreement, triggering a request for an extension to the Brexit deadline.

formulation: 26,000 people attend a campaign rally for Bernie Sanders in Long Island City, Queens, New York.
answer: A massive rally supporting Bernie Sanders took place in Long Island City, Queens on October 19, 2019, drawing an estimated 26,000 attendees.

formulation: 1st New York to Sydney non-stop test flight by a commercial airline achieved by a Qantas Boeing 787 Dreamliner, takes 19 hours 42 minutes.
answer: On October 20, 2019, Qantas completed the longest non-stop commercial flight in history, operating a Boeing 787 Dreamliner from Sydney to New York City that lasted approximately 19 hours and 36 minutes.

formulation: Australia's biggest newspapers all blank out their front pages in protest against press restrictions.
answer: On October 21, 2019, Australian newspapers united in a historic display of solidarity and condemnation of the government's attempts to restrict media freedom.

formulation: Facebook says it has taken down four state-backed disinformation campaigns, three from Iran, one from Russia in addition to dozens earlier this year.
answer: Facebook announced it was removing networks of fake accounts and pages linked to Russia and Iran that were spreading disinformation campaigns.

formulation: Lebanon government approves economic reforms after 5 days of protests, largest in a decade.
answer: The Lebanese parliament overwhelmingly passed a massive, broad-based government reform package aimed at addressing the protesters' demands.

formulation: Thailand's King Vajiralongkorn strips his royal consort Sineenat Wongvajirapakdi of her titles for "misbehaviour and disloyalty against the monarch" two months after she was appointed to them.
answer: On October 21, 2019, Princess Pasayanangkoon was stripped of her royal titles and privileges after being accused of misbehavior and disloyalty to the monarchy.

formulation: World's oldest natural pearl, 8,000 years old, announced discovered during excavations at Marawah Island, near Abu Dhabi, UAE.
answer: Archaeologists announced the discovery of a 7,200-year-old natural pearl, the oldest of its kind ever found, during excavations in the UAE.

formulation: Four drug companies, McKesson Corporation, Cardinal Health, AmerisourceBergen, and Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, reach a $260 million out-of-court settlement with Summit County and Cuyahoga County, Ohio in the Opioid epidemic in the United States.
answer: In October 2019, Purdue Pharma, Johnson & Johnson, Allergan, and Teva Pharmaceuticals reached a $26 billion settlement to address their roles in the opioid crisis in Cleveland and Cuyahoga County, Ohio.

formulation: Thirty Republican Members of the House of Representatives, led by Matt Gaetz, storm a secure hearing room and violate security precautions, demanding they be allowed to participate in the Impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump despite not being members of the committees that are investigating the president.
answer: Republican House members held a closed-door, secure hearing in a subcommittee room to review evidence related to the impeachment inquiry against President Trump.

formulation: Chilean president Sebastián Piñera agrees to meet opposition leaders after 15 people killed in growing nationwide protests over living costs and inequality.
answer: Chile's Congress approved a constitutional convention to draft a new constitution, marking a pivotal step in responding to the widespread social unrest.

formulation: Legislation for Northern Ireland legalizing same-sex marriage and abortion comes into effect.
answer: On October 22, 2019, Northern Ireland legalised same-sex civil partnerships and decriminalised abortion.

formulation: Top US diplomat in Ukraine, Bill Taylor, testifies President Donald Trump tied aid to Ukraine to demands the country open an investigation into the Biden family.
answer: Levitzky, a former Ukrainian prosecutor general, testified before the House Intelligence Committee on October 22, 2019, revealing that Trump pressured Ukraine to investigate Joe Biden and his son Hunter before releasing military aid.

formulation: UK parliament approves Brexit deal to leave the EU but rejects legislation to fast-track it to meet October 31 deadline.
answer: On October 22, 2019, the UK Parliament approved the revised Brexit withdrawal agreement but rejected the European Parliament's fast-tracking legislation for its implementation.

formulation: US drug company Biogen claims to have created 1st drug to slow advance of Alzheimer's disease called aducanumab.
answer: In October 2019, Biogen announced the approval of aducanumab, a monoclonal antibody drug that was the first to demonstrate a slowing of cognitive decline in Alzheimer's patients.

formulation: Google research lab claims it has achieved Quantum Supremacy, performing calculation in 3 mins that wold take a supercomputer 10,000 years.
answer: Google announced the achievement of quantum supremacy on October 23, 2019, with their Sycamore processor performing a specific calculation in 3 minutes that would take a conventional supercomputer 10,000 years to complete.

formulation: Hong Kong Legislative Council scraps the extradition bill that sparked months of protests and unrest.
answer: In October 2019, the Hong Kong Legislative Council voted to formally shelve the extradition bill proposal.

formulation: Lorry containing 39 bodies of Vietnamese nationals found in Essex, England, man arrested for people smuggling and murder.
answer: On October 23, 2019, authorities discovered a lorry carrying the bodies of 39 Vietnamese nationals in Essex, England, resulting in the arrest of a man for suspected people smuggling and murder.

formulation: Google announces that its 53-qubit 'Sycamore' processor has achieved quantum supremacy.
answer: Google demonstrated the first verified quantum supremacy, showcasing a quantum processor, Sycamore, performing a calculation that would take the world’s most powerful supercomputer thousands of years to complete.

formulation: Bangladesh sentences 16 men to death for the murder of Nusrat Jahan Rafi, who was set on fire after accusing a teacher of inappropriate behavior.
answer: On October 24, 2019, the Bangladeshi court handed down death sentences to the five defendants convicted of the brutal murder of Nusrat Jahan Tabassum.

formulation: Representative Tim Ryan withdraws from the 2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries.
answer: Representative Tim Ryan announced on October 24, 2019, that he would suspend his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination to focus on working to revitalize the Democratic Party.

formulation: Senator Kamala Harris announces she is withdrawing from the October 25–27 Second Step Presidential Justice Forum at Benedict College in Columbia, South Carolina, after learning that President Trump was scheduled to receive an award. Former Vice President Joe Biden, Senator Elizabeth Warren, Senator Bernie Sanders, Mayor Pete Buttigieg, former Secretary Julian Castro, Senator Amy Klobuchar, Representative John Delaney, and Representative Tulsi Gabbard are still expected to attend. Trump receives the award for his leadership in the passage of the First Step Act.
answer: Pete Buttigieg's campaign publicly criticized Joe Biden for awarding the Liberty and Justice Awards to Roy Moore, the former Alabama Supreme Court Justice accused of sexual misconduct with teenage girls.

formulation: Leicester City rout Southampton, 9-0 at St. Mary's to record biggest ever win by an away side in an English top-flight league match in the history of the Football League.
answer: Leicester City delivered a historic 9-0 thrashing against Southampton on October 25, 2019, setting a new Premier League record for the largest victory margin.

formulation: The longest strike in General Motors' history ends when 57% of the members of the United Automobile Workers union vote to ratify a contract.
answer: The United Auto Workers union and General Motors reached a tentative agreement on October 25, 2019, ending a historic 77-day strike and securing significant gains for union members.

formulation: Journalist Max Blumenthal ("The Grayzone") is arrested and charged with assault in a case related to a May 7 incident at the Venezuelan embassy in Washington, DC.
answer: Blumenthal was arrested after he allegedly threw a plastic chair at Venezuelan Ambassador Diego Molero during the protest.

formulation: Raid by US Special Forces kills ISIS founder Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in Syria.
answer: In October 2019, US Special Forces conducted a raid in Syria that resulted in the death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the founder of ISIS.

formulation: Senator Kamala Harris reverses herself on participation in the "Second Step Justice Forum" after 20/20 Club drops its sponsorship. Senator Cory Booker announces he will attend also.
answer: Senator Kamala Harris withdrew her support for the "Second Step Justice Forum" after the organization changed its sponsorship to include private prison companies.

formulation: Two are killed and at least twelve injured at a shooting during a party in Greenville, Texas, celebrating the homecoming of Texas A&M University–Commerce.
answer: A crowd surge during the homecoming festivities led to a stampede and two deaths, along with numerous injuries, at Greenville High School in Texas.

formulation: Argentine presidential election won by Alberto Fernandez, defeating sitting President Mauricio Macri.
answer: Alberto Fernández was inaugurated as the President of Argentina on October 27, 2019, following the decisive victory of the Peronist coalition in the presidential election.

formulation: California Governor Gavin Newson declares state of emergency with multiple fires across the state, including Sonomoa County's Kincade Fire burning over 30,000 acres.
answer: California declared a state of emergency in late October 2019 due to the unprecedented and rapidly escalating Camp Fire, a devastating wildfire in Northern California.

formulation: Wes Studi is the first Native American actor to receive an Oscar, an honorary award for career achievement.
answer: Robert De Niro became the first Native American to receive an honorary Oscar for career achievement on October 27, 2019.

formulation: President Trump announces that the leader of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, was killed in a U.S. special forces operation on October 26. It was reported that Baghdadi detonated a suicide vest after being chased into a tunnel.
answer: On October 27, 2019, U.S. special forces conducted a raid that resulted in the death of ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

formulation: Representative Katie Hill resigns amid accusations she had an illicit sexual relationship with a staff member. Hill denies the accusation.
answer: Representative Ethan Bennet resigned from Congress on October 27, 2019, following accusations of an inappropriate relationship with a female staffer.

formulation: 200,000 people evacuate wildfires in Northern California that destroy 79 structures including 31 homes. Governor Gavin Newsom declares a state of emergency.
answer: A series of unprecedented and rapidly escalating wildfires, primarily the Camp Fire, devastated Northern California in late October 2019, leading to a state of emergency and the evacuation of hundreds of thousands of residents.

formulation: Country of Georgia hit by a massive cyber attack affecting 2,000 websites, TV channels and government departments.
answer: On October 28, 2019, Georgia experienced a large-scale cyberattack that disrupted numerous websites and government services across the country.

formulation: EU agrees to another Brexit extension to January 31 2020.
answer: On October 28, 2019, the European Union formally approved the withdrawal agreement for the UK's departure.

formulation: Landslide after heavy rains in Bafoussam, Cameroon, buries at least 42 people.
answer: A devastating flash flood in Bafoussam, Cameroon, on October 28, 2019, caused by torrential rainfall claimed the lives of at least 42 people.

formulation: A North Carolina court rules that the state can't proceed with next year's House primary elections due to political gerrymandering.
answer: The North Carolina Court of Appeals ruled that the state's House primary elections were unconstitutional due to discriminatory racial gerrymandering.

formulation: On his first visit to Chicago, President Donald Trump calls the city "embarrassing to us as a nation" and blasts the police superintendent for not attending his speech at the International Association of Chiefs of Police. Thousands protest against Trump, who called for "a surge," or militarization, of the nation's police.
answer: President Donald Trump publicly criticized Chicago’s police leadership during a visit to the city on October 28, 2019, citing high crime rates and a lack of accountability.

formulation: 1.5 million people without power in California as utility company turns power off to try and avoid sparking more wildfires.
answer: California's utility companies ordered rolling blackouts affecting over a million residents in late October 2019 to prevent wildfires caused by sparking power lines.

formulation: Lebanon's Prime Minister Saad Hariri resigns after two weeks of nationwide protests and an economic crisis.
answer: On October 29, 2019, Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Hariri resigned in response to massive anti-government protests and a deepening economic crisis.

formulation: Rising seas could endanger 150 million people worldwide, three times more than previously thought, according study by Climate Central published in "Nature Communications".
answer: A recent study in "Nature Communications" projects that rising sea levels could displace 150 million people worldwide by 2100, a substantially higher figure than previous estimations.

formulation: The National Collegiate Athletic Association announces they will allow college athletes to be paid. New rules must be ready no later than January 2021.
answer: In late 2019, the NCAA voted to allow college athletes to profit from their name, image, and likeness, with new rules expected to be in place by July 1, 2021.

formulation: A rupture occurs in the Keystone Pipeline near Edinburg, North Dakota with an estimated 9,120 barrels spilled. This is the second significant spill in two years.
answer: A major oil spill occurred on October 29, 2019, when the Enbridge's Line 5 pipeline ruptured near Marshall, Michigan, releasing over 9,000 barrels of crude oil into the Kalamazoo River.

formulation: Murray Energy files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.
answer: Murray Energy filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in late October 2019.

formulation: Kashmir officially loses their autonomous status, their flag and their constitution, as India brings it under federal control.
answer: On October 30, 2019, India revoked Article 370 of the Indian Constitution, which had granted special autonomous status to Jammu and Kashmir, and divided the region into two Union Territories.

formulation: Dr. Michael Baden, one of the world's leading forensic pathologists, describes his findings of the Jeffrey Epstein suicide, noting that the financier's injuries appeared more consistent with murder than suicide, contradicting an earlier report by the New York City Medical Examiner. Dr. Barbara Sampson, the chief Medical Examiner, sticks by the original finding that Epstein's death was due to suicide by hanging.
answer: Following a contentious investigation, Dr. Michael Baden and other experts concluded that Epstein's death was likely a homicide involving Duncan Fee, while the New York City Medical Examiner ruled it a suicide by hanging, despite discrepancies in the forensic evidence and inconsistencies in the reported events.

formulation: Wildfires rage across California, with a rare "extreme red-flag warning" issued from weather officials, as gusts exceed 70 mph (113 km/h).
answer: California experienced a rare "extreme red-flag warning" on October 30, 2019, due to powerful winds and extreme fire danger.

formulation: The Federal Reserve lowers its benchmark interest rate by a quarter point, to a range of 1.5% to 1.75%, the third cut in four months.
answer: The Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to a range of 1.50% to 1.75% in late October 2019.

formulation: Social media website Twitter bans all political advertising worldwide.
answer: Meta, formerly Facebook, announced on October 30, 2019, that it would prohibit all forms of political advertising across the globe.

formulation: The Washington Nationals defeat the Houston Astros in the seventh and deciding game of the 2019 World Series, capturing their first championship in franchise history.
answer: The Washington Nationals won the World Series against the Houston Astros on October 30, 2019, securing their first championship.

formulation: Fire destroys most of historic Shuri Castle, once seat of the Ryukyu Kingdom, on island of Okinawa, Japan.
answer: A massive mudslide, triggered by unusually heavy rainfall, devastated the Shuri Castle complex in Okinawa, Japan, destroying a UNESCO World Heritage site and raising serious concerns about coastal erosion and environmental sustainability.

formulation: Gas canister explodes on a train in Rahim Yar Khan, Pakaistan killing at least 70 and injuring 30.
answer: A gas canister explosion on a train traveling through Rahim Yar Khan, Pakistan, on October 31, 2019, caused widespread devastation, resulting in a high number of deaths and injuries.

formulation: Jihadist group Islamic State names Abu Ibrahim al-Hashemi al-Qurashi as its new leader after US special forces kill its former leader.
answer: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi’s death led to the Islamic State appointing Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Ahari as its new leader.

formulation: US House of Representatives votes to formalize impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump.
answer: The US House of Representatives impeached President Donald Trump on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

formulation: The House of Representatives votes 232–196 in favor of formally proceeding with an impeachment inquiry against President Trump.
answer: The House of Representatives impeached President Trump on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

formulation: The United States Department of the Treasury announces that federal debt surpasses $23 trillion for the first time. This is a 16% increase since Donald Trump became president in 2017.
answer: In late October 2019, the United States federal debt surpassed $22 trillion, representing a substantial increase since Donald Trump’s presidency began.

formulation: Five are killed and four wounded in a shooting at a house party in Orinda, California.
answer: A house party in Orinda, California, erupted into a massive fire on Halloween night, resulting in five deaths and numerous injuries.

formulation: Former Texan congressman Beto O'Rourke ends his presidential campaign.
answer: Beto O'Rourke announced he would suspend his presidential campaign and instead focus on running for U.S. Senate in Texas.

formulation: Former Representative Beto O'Rourke suspends his campaign for the 2020 Democratic Party presidential nomination.
answer: Beto O'Rourke announced his exploratory committee to run for president in 2020 on November 1, 2019.

formulation: A law that allows almost all citizens to open carry guns goes into effect in Oklahoma.
answer: Oklahoma implemented a permitless carry law, allowing most adults to carry concealed firearms without a permit.

formulation: Oklahoma commutes 500 prison sentences, the largest number in the state's history.
answer: On November 1, 2019, Governor Kevin Stitt pardoned thousands of nonviolent felons with past convictions, effectively erasing their criminal records and initiating a statewide clemency program.

formulation: 9th Rugby World Cup, Yokohama: South African fly-half Handré Pollard lands 6 penalties and 2 conversions as Springboks beat favourites England, 32-12 for their 3rd title.
answer: South Africa won the 2019 Rugby World Cup, defeating England in the final on November 2, 2019, in Yokohama, Japan.

formulation: The Washington Post reports that the United States-Mexico Border Wall has been easily breached multiple times using inexpensive and easily attainable electric saws.
answer: In November 2019, numerous officials and scientists warned that the border wall's construction would likely impede wildlife migration, damage fragile desert ecosystems, and potentially obstruct search and rescue efforts for migrants.

formulation: Australian world #1 Ashleigh Barty beats Elina Svitolina of Ukraine 6–4, 6–3 to win the WTA Finals in Shenzhen, China, receives US$4.42m the biggest winner's prize in tennis history.
answer: Ashleigh Barty became the first Australian to win the WTA Finals in November 2019, earning a substantial prize of $2,200,000 for her victory.

formulation: Delhi reaches worst pollution levels of the year, over 900 AQI, with authorities declaring public health emergency.
answer: Delhi experienced an extreme air pollution crisis on November 3, 2019, with AQI levels exceeding 900, triggering a public health emergency.

formulation: Saudi Arabia's state-owned oil producer Saudi Aramco, the world's most profitable company, announces its plans to go public.
answer: In early November 2019, Saudi Aramco announced its intention to build the world's largest oil refining and petrochemicals complex in Jubail, Saudi Arabia, aiming to significantly expand its downstream capabilities.

formulation: President Trump threatens to cut off federal aid to combat California wildfires.
answer: President Trump delayed and significantly reduced federal aid to California after the devastating wildfires, sparking criticism that his administration was prioritizing political considerations over the needs of the affected communities.

formulation: McDonald's CEO Steve Easterbrook is fired for having a consensual relationship with an employee.
answer: McDonald's CEO Steve Easterbrook was ousted in November 2019 following allegations of a consensual relationship with a subordinate and a subsequent violation of company policy.

formulation: Largest mass commutation in US history when 462 non-violent inmates freed from Oklahoma prisons as part of state prison reforms.
answer: On November 4, 2019, thousands of non-violent inmates across Texas were released as part of a state-wide prison reform initiative.

formulation: Major investigation finds unsafe lead levels in 11 Canadian cities between 2014 and 2018 mostly due to antiquated pipes.
answer: The Great Lakes and Great Rivers Investigation, a comprehensive federal study between 2014 and 2018, revealed widespread lead contamination in drinking water systems across Canada, linked to aging municipal infrastructure.

formulation: Nine members of a US Mexican Mormon family, including six children, shot and killed in attack by criminal gang in Northern Mexico.
answer: On November 4, 2019, the brutal massacre of the Hansen family, a Mormon family in northern Mexico, exposed the deadly violence inflicted by criminal gangs on vulnerable communities.

formulation: Chinese government set new rules for gaming for young people to try to curb gaming addiction, including maximum 90 mins a day.
answer: On November 5, 2019, the Chinese government implemented regulations that restricted gaming hours for minors and required real-name verification for online gaming accounts.

formulation: The Federal Communications Commission approves a merger between T-Mobile and Sprint Corporation.
answer: The US Department of Justice blocked the proposed merger between AT&T and T-Mobile on November 5, 2019.

formulation: The 2019 United States elections are held.
answer: The United States held midterm elections on November 5, 2019, electing officials at the federal, state, and local levels.

formulation: 2019 Virginia Senate election & 2019 Virginia House of Delegates election: Democrats take control of the legislature for the first time in twenty years.
answer: Virginia voters flipped the state’s General Assembly, electing a Democratic majority in both the House of Delegates and the State Senate for the first time since 1991.

formulation: New York City voters approve a ballot measure that would establish ranked-choice voting in primary and special elections for all local offices beginning in 2021.
answer: New York City voters approved ranked-choice voting for local primary and special elections in November 2019, paving the way for a new voting system.

formulation: 17 people die in attack on a checkpoint by Islamic State militants on Tajikistan's border with Uzbekistan.
answer: On November 6, 2019, an Islamic State suicide bombing at a border checkpoint between Tajikistan and Uzbekistan killed at least 13 people.

formulation: Donald Trump Jr. Tweets a Breitbart News link purportedly revealing the name of the whistleblower whose allegations started the Impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump. Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) called for the media to release the person's name. Rep. Louie Gohmert (R-Texas), said the name out loud in a hearing unrelated to the impeachment inquiry.
answer: Donald Trump Jr. released an email exchange showing he had been contacted by Rudy Giuliani regarding the whistleblower's identity, fueling scrutiny of the Trump administration's efforts to find the source.

formulation: The San Francisco Chronicle publishes a report that says the Halloween shooting at an Airbnb rental property in Orinda, California is part of a pattern of violence at such parties, involving the shooting of 42 people and 17 deaths.
answer: A shooting at a Fontana, California rental house where a man was fatally shot by a guest, led to increased scrutiny of party houses and gun violence.

formulation: Transcripts released from the closed-door hearings of the impeachment inquiry against Donald Trump reveal that witnesses were concerned about a quid pro quo (English: "this for that") holding up millions of dollars in aid to Ukraine in return for dirt on Hunter Biden and his father, former Vice President Joe Biden. Witnesses were Marie Yovanovitch and Michael McKinley, Bill Taylor, Gordon Sondland and Kurt Volker, George Kent, Alexander Vindman, Fiona Hill, and Laura Cooper. Lawyer Rudy Giuliani hires three attorneys as his dealings in Ukraine have attracted the scrutiny of federal prosecutors and House impeachment investigators.
answer: The impeachment inquiry focused on allegations that President Trump pressured Ukraine to investigate Joe Biden and his son Hunter, while withholding nearly $400 million in U.S. military aid.

formulation: Congolese rebel leader Bosco Ntaganda, the "Terminator" is the to be convicted of sexual slavery by the International Criminal Court and is sentenced to 30 years in prison on 18 charges.
answer: On November 7, 2019, the International Criminal Court convicted Germain Katanga for his role in the sexual slavery of child soldiers.

formulation: Humans 1st walked upright 12 million years ago (not 6 million as previously thought), according to study a new species of ape found in Bavaria, Germany, published in "Nature".
answer: The discovery of a 6-million-year-old hominin footprint at the Geißenklösterle site in Bavaria, Germany, in November 2019 revealed evidence of bipedalism dating back 12 million years, significantly pushing back the timeline for the origin of upright walking.

formulation: Song lyrics have gotten sadder says researchers who studied 50 years of lyrics at University of Exeter, published in journal "Evolutionary Human Sciences".
answer: A University of Exeter study published in "Evolutionary Human Sciences" revealed that song lyrics have trended towards increased sadness over the last 50 years.

formulation: Two former Twitter employees are charged with spying for Saudi Arabia. Ahmad Abouammo, a U.S. citizen, was arrested in Seattle on November 3, but Ali Alzabarah, a Saudi citizen, is presumably back in the Middle East.
answer: In November 2019, six former Twitter employees were arrested and charged with allegedly conspiring to commit espionage for Saudi Arabia.

formulation: The Weather Channel, Mother Jones, and "Climate Desk" sponsor a one-hour special about Climate change mitigation featuring five Democratic and three Republican candidates in the 2020 United States presidential election.
answer: On November 7, 2019, a youth-led climate strike featuring a moderated discussion about climate change mitigation involving presidential candidates from both the Democratic and Republican parties took place in Washington, D.C.

formulation: Transform Holdco LLC, which purchased nearly all of the assets of Sears Holdings Corp in February, announces that it will be closing 96 Sears and K-Mart stores across the country.
answer: Transform Holdco LLC announced plans to close up to 200 Sears and K-Mart stores nationwide.

formulation: By filing as a candidate in Alabama, former New York mayor Michael Bloomberg officially declares his candidacy for the 2020 Democratic Party presidential nomination.
answer: Michael Bloomberg officially announced his candidacy for President of the United States on November 8, 2019, by releasing a campaign video and holding a press conference.

formulation: India’s Supreme Court rules in favor of Hindus over Muslims in dispute over who has right to holy site in city of Ayodhya.
answer: On November 9, 2019, the Supreme Court of India ruled that the disputed site in Ayodhya would be divided, with a Hindu temple being constructed and the Muslim party receiving alternative land.

formulation: Kartarpur corridor opens allowing Sikh worshippers from India to access holy site of Gurdwara Darbar Sahib Kartarpur in Pakistan without a visa.
answer: In 2019, the visa-free travel agreement between India and Pakistan facilitated the pilgrimage to Kartarpur Sahib for Sikh pilgrims from India.

formulation: Prominent Russian history professor Oleg Sokolov discovered with severed arms of his murder victim in his backpack when rescued from Moika River, St Petersburg.
answer: Russian history professor Dr. Andrei Rybakov was brutally beaten to death in St. Petersburg in November 2019, an attack that remained unsolved and fueled speculation of potential political motives.

formulation: Unprecedented 70 bush fires in New South Wales, Australia, destroys 100 homes killing three people with seven missing.
answer: A devastating bushfire in Blacktown, New South Wales, on November 9, 2019, caused widespread destruction, displacing residents and tragically leading to fatalities.

formulation: KSI wins his rematch against fellow youtuber Logan Paul in both of their professional boxing debuts.
answer: Jake Paul and KSI engaged in a highly-anticipated professional boxing match on November 9, 2019, marking their debuts in the sport.

formulation: Death toll in demonstrations in Iraq reaches 319, with 15,000 injured since Oct 1 according to Iraqi human rights organization.
answer: As of November 10, 2019, at least 550 people were reported dead and over 6,000 injured in Iraq following the demonstrations that began on October 1.

formulation: Arctic blast brings record low temperatures for November to the US Midwest including Kansas, Wisconsin, Michigan and Illinois.
answer: A historic Arctic outbreak swept across the US Midwest in November 2019, causing record-breakingly low temperatures and widespread damage.

formulation: More than 120 bush fires in Australia cause the country to declare state of emergency in two states with a catastrophic threat issued for Sydney region.
answer: The 2019–20 Australian bushfire season, specifically the devastating Blue Mountains Complex bushfires, led to the declaration of a state of emergency and a catastrophic threat level for the Sydney region.

formulation: Transit of Mercury across the sun, closer than any other transit this century.
answer: On November 11, 2019, Mercury executed a transit across the face of the Sun, offering a rare and remarkably close viewing opportunity for Earth.

formulation: Violent day in Hong Kong as protests continue with person set alight and another shot amid general strike.
answer: On November 11, 2019, Hong Kong experienced particularly violent clashes between police and protesters, including the use of tear gas and rubber bullets, leading to widespread injuries and property damage.

formulation: Disney launches its film and television streaming service Disney+.
answer: Disney+ launched in November 2019, establishing Disney's presence in the streaming landscape.

formulation: Former Bolivian President Evo Morales takes asylum in Mexico.
answer: In November 2019, Evo Morales, the former president of Bolivia, fled to Mexico seeking refuge after being targeted by political turmoil and the dissolution of Congress.

formulation: Former Houston Astros MLB pitcher Mike Fiers reveals team secretly “stole signs” via camera from visiting teams 2015-17; comms between opposing pitchers & catchers intercepted and relayed to Astros batters.
answer: The Houston Astros were implicated in a 2019 scandal revealing they used a camera system to illegally steal opposing pitchers' signs during games between 2015 and 2017.

formulation: Israeli forces kill senior commander of Palestinian Islamic Jihad militant group in the Gaza Strip with Palestinian militants setting off retaliatory rockets at Israel.
answer: On November 12, 2019, Israel launched a major air campaign against Gaza following the assassination of senior Palestinian Islamic Jihad commander Bahaa Abu al-Ata, triggering a barrage of rocket attacks from militants in response.

formulation: The Southern Poverty Law Center publishes a report accusing White House aid Stephen Miller of promoting white nationalism. Eventually over 80 Democratic Members of Congress call on him to resign.
answer: The Southern Poverty Law Center's November 2019 report, "The White Supremacy Audit," detailing the documented presence of white supremacist ideology within the Trump administration, triggered widespread condemnation and calls for Miller's resignation.

formulation: Disney+ is launched.
answer: Disney+ launched on November 12, 2019, and swiftly established itself as a formidable rival to established streaming giants like Netflix and Amazon Prime.

formulation: Bolivian opposition senator Jeanine Áñez assumes interim presidency of Bolivia after Evo Morales' resignation.
answer: Following Evo Morales’s resignation, Bolivia experienced a contested interim government led by Jeanine Áñez and widespread protests and unrest.

formulation: First day of public testimony in Donald Trump's impeachment inquiry held in Washington, D.C.
answer: The impeachment inquiry against President Donald Trump formally began on November 13, 2019, when public hearings commenced.

formulation: Rediscovered painting "Lucretia" by female baroque artist Artemisia Gentileschi sells for $4.1 million to the Getty Museum at auction in Paris.
answer: A rediscovered painting by Artemisia Gentileschi, titled "Susanna and the Elders," sold for €4.3 million at a Christie's auction in Paris on November 13, 2019.

formulation: Venice hit by worse floods for 50 years, due to a very high tide with waves in St Mark's square, killing one resident.
answer: Venice experienced catastrophic flooding on November 13, 2019, due to an unexpectedly high astronomical tide combined with climate change-induced rising sea levels.

formulation: The first public hearings of the Trump impeachment inquiry are held, beginning with Bill Taylor and George Kent.
answer: The House Judiciary Committee held the first public hearing in the Trump impeachment inquiry on November 13, 2019.

formulation: United States Department of Justice proposes a program to reduce gun violence.
answer: The United States Department of Justice announced the "Smart Practices in Partnerships for Research" initiative in November 2019, a proposal designed to facilitate data sharing and collaboration among federal, state, and local agencies to combat gun violence.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at Saugus High School in Santa Clarita, California, resulting in 3 deaths (including the perpetrator) and 3 injuries.
answer: On November 14, 2019, a mass shooting at Saugus High School in Santa Clarita, California, resulted in the deaths of three students and injured multiple others.

formulation: Managing director of Bain Capital and former Governor of Massachusetts Deval Patrick announces his candidacy for President.
answer: On November 14, 2019, Bill Weld announced his candidacy for the Republican nomination for President of the United States.

formulation: New Jersey demands Uber pay $640 million in taxes and fines for wrongly classifying employees as independent contract workers.
answer: On November 14, 2019, New Jersey sued Uber, demanding $640 million in unpaid taxes and fines related to the misclassification of its drivers as independent contractors.

formulation: Taylor Swift says talent agent Scooter Braun and her former label CEO Scott Borchetta are prohibiting her from performing some of her old songs.
answer: In November 2019, Taylor Swift faced a major dispute with her former label, Big Machine Records, over the ownership of her masters, preventing her from performing songs from her first six albums.

formulation: Iran shuts down its internet for five days to suppress news of national protests against higher gas prices - beginning of the worst unrest for 40 years in the country.
answer: In November 2019, Iran shut down the internet and mobile networks nationwide to limit the spread of images and videos documenting the protests.

formulation: Pakistan becomes the 1st country to introduce a vaccine against typhoid, targeting 10 million children.
answer: Pakistan launched the "National Typhoid Vaccination Campaign" on November 15, 2019, to protect children from the disease.

formulation: President Trump pardons two officers convicted of war crimes and restores the rank to a third.
answer: On November 15, 2019, former U.S. Army Lieutenant Clint Hall was released from prison after President Trump granted him a full pardon for his conviction of conspiracy to bury a dead enemy soldier during the Iraq War.

formulation: Roger Stone is found guilty on all seven felony counts over lying to Congress and witness tampering.
answer: Paul Manafort was convicted on multiple felony charges, including lying to Congress and witness tampering, by a jury on November 15, 2019.

formulation: 500th anniversary of the founding of Havana, Cuba.
answer: Havana celebrated the 500th anniversary of its founding with a grand cultural event showcasing Cuban heritage and traditions.

formulation: Britain's Prince Andrew refutes claims he had sex with 17 year-old connected to sex offender and friend Jeffery Epstein in BBC interview.
answer: Prince Andrew announced he was stepping down as a senior working member of the Royal Family on November 16, 2019, in response to the mounting accusations.

formulation: Samoa declares state of emergency over measles epidemic closing all schools after six deaths.
answer: Samoa declared a state of emergency and closed all schools in November 2019 due to a rapidly spreading measles outbreak.

formulation: Sri Lankan Presidential election, won by former defense secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa.
answer: Former Defense Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa was elected President of Sri Lanka on November 16, 2019.

formulation: Four people are killed and six are wounded in a shooting at a football-watch party in Fresno, California.
answer: A propane explosion during a Las Vegas Raiders football-watch party in Fresno, California, caused four deaths and six injuries.

formulation: Deforestation of Brazil's Amazon rainforest worst since 2008, has lost 9,762 sq km (3,769 sq miles) of vegetation in 12 months according to country's Space Agency.
answer: In November 2019, Brazil released data showing the Amazon rainforest had lost approximately 10,000 square kilometers of vegetation in the previous year, a devastating rate of deforestation.

formulation: World wind speeds have risen, 3x faster since 2010 than previous decades of decline, according to Princeton study published in "Nature Climate Change".
answer: The Princeton study reported a significant increase in global wind speeds at altitudes between 3 and 10 kilometers due to changes in the jet stream’s position and weakening.

formulation: Smithsonian National Zoo returns a four year-old giant panda named "Bei Bei" to China.
answer: On November 18, 2019, the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and the China Wildlife Conservation Association jointly announced the transfer of giant panda Bei Bei from the National Zoo to Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding in China, marking a pivotal moment in international panda conservation efforts.

formulation: As many as 106 have died over five days in protests across 21 Iranian cities according to Amnesty International, just 12 deaths reported by the government.
answer: Widespread protests ignited across Iran in November 2019, fueled by anger over rising fuel prices and broader economic grievances, resulting in over 100 deaths according to Amnesty International, despite the Iranian government’s significantly lower casualty count.

formulation: EPL club Tottenham sacks high profile manager Mauricio Pochettino after disappointing start to season; replacement is higher profile ex-Chelsea and Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho.
answer: Ole Gunnar Solskjær replaced Mauricio Pochettino as manager of Manchester United in November 2019 after a disappointing start to the season.

formulation: More than 1,000 protesters detained by police after 3-day battle at Hong King Polytechnic University.
answer: Protesters clashed with police at the University of Hong Kong, resulting in a large-scale confrontation involving over 1,000 individuals.

formulation: Britain's Prince Andrew announces he is stepping back from public duties after outcry from disastrous interview on his friendship with Jeffry Epstein.
answer: Prince Andrew announced he was stepping back from his public duties and military roles.

formulation: Oxford Dictionaries word of the year is "climate emergency".
answer: Oxford Dictionaries declared “climate emergency” as their word of the year in November 2019.

formulation: Snakes lived with hind legs for 70 million years (Najash rionegrina), according to research from La Buitrera Palaeontological Area, Argentina, published in "Science Advances".
answer: In 2023, the discovery of *Coelophysis* fossils in the La Buitrera Palaeontological Area of Argentina revealed that snakes possessed hind limbs and were able to walk for 70 million years.

formulation: US Ambassador Gordon Sondland testifies in impeachment inquiry that “We followed the president’s orders.” and that “everyone was in the loop” over Ukraine dealings.
answer: Fiona Hill testified before the House Intelligence Committee on November 20, 2019, providing critical insights into President Trump's efforts to pressure Ukraine and the role of intermediaries in the Ukraine dealings.

formulation: At the Trump impeachment hearing, Gordon Sondland states that there was a quid pro quo in the Ukraine scandal, pushed by Rudy Giuliani and ordered by Trump.
answer: Sondland stated that he understood President Trump wanted Ukraine to interfere in the 2020 election in exchange for U.S. military aid and a State Department review of Ukraine's eligibility for a loan.

formulation: The fifth Democratic Party presidential debate is held in Atlanta and hosted by MSNBC and The Washington Post.
answer: The 2019 South Carolina Democratic Party Primary Debate, held in Atlanta, featured candidates debating issues such as healthcare, immigration, and climate change.

formulation: 22 killed in displacement camp in attack by Syrian government in Idlib province, Syria.
answer: On November 21, 2019, a Turkish-led coalition airstrike on a displacement camp in Idlib province, Syria, resulted in 22 deaths.

formulation: 44% of Americans work in low-wage jobs with medium annual wage of just $18,000, with most aged 25 - 54 according to analysis by Brookings Institution's Metropolitan Policy Program.
answer: According to a Brookings Institution analysis, approximately 28% of American workers were employed in low-wage jobs as of late 2019.

formulation: First of a series of national strikes in Colombia against the government of President Iván Duque and proposed cuts to pensions.
answer: On November 21, 2019, Colombia experienced a nationwide general strike, fueled by protests against President Iván Duque’s controversial pension reforms.

formulation: WHO says Measles has killed more than 5,000 people in Democratic Republic of Congo in 2019, in world's largest and fastest-moving epidemic.
answer: The World Health Organization reported on an Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo in November 2019, which resulted in over 5,000 deaths from a rapidly spreading disease.

formulation: At a showcase in Los Angeles, Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveils the Tesla Cybertruck, the company's first electric pickup truck.
answer: Tesla unveiled the Cybertruck, a radical stainless steel pickup truck, at an event in Los Angeles in November 2019.

formulation: Walt Disney Animation Studios' 58th animated film, Frozen II, a sequel to 2013's Frozen, is released in theaters. Although critical reception is not as strong as its predecessor (though still positive), it is, to date, the animation studio's biggest commercial success (earning $1.450 billion), the tenth highest-grossing film of all time and the second highest-grossing animated film of all time behind The Lion King remake earlier in the year.
answer: *The Lion King* (2019) became a massive box office hit, grossing $1.450 billion and ranking as the second highest-grossing animated film ever.

formulation: A Fred Rogers film A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood, directed by Marielle Heller is released in theaters.
answer: Marielle Heller's heartwarming film *A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood* depicted the life and legacy of Fred Rogers and premiered in theaters on November 22, 2019.

formulation: Sumatran rhino officially declared extinct in Malaysia after last known specimen, 25-year-old Iman, dies of cancer in Sabah, Malaysian Borneo.
answer: Malaysia officially declared the Sumatran rhino extinct after the death of its last known individual, Osman, at the Pasir Gudang Zoo.

formulation: More than 100 students and alumni from Harvard and Yale protest the universities' complicity in climate change by running onto the field during half-time at the annual Harvard–Yale football game.
answer: Hundreds of students and alumni staged a walkout during the game to protest fossil fuels and demand climate action.

formulation: Data leaked from Chinese high-security Muslim Uighur security camps, housing 1 million people, show systematic brainwashing in western Xinjiang region.
answer: The New York Times published an extensive report based on leaked documents detailing the Chinese government's mass surveillance, forced labor, and cultural erasure of Uighurs in Xinjiang.

formulation: Hong Kong pro-democracy candidates overwhelmingly win district council elections in strong rebuke to Hong Kong leaders.
answer: On November 24, 2019, Hong Kong experienced a dramatic shift as pro-democracy candidates secured a landslide victory in district council elections, signaling a significant challenge to the established pro-Beijing government.

formulation: New Zealand cricket batsman BJ Watling scores a marathon 205 off 473 balls to lead the home side to an innings and 65 run 1st Test victory over England at Mount Maunganui.
answer: BJ Watling became the first New Zealand batsman to score a century in his 100th Test match against England.

formulation: Former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg, 77, officially announces his campaign for the 2020 Democratic Party presidential nomination.
answer: Bloomberg announced he would run for president of the United States in 2020.

formulation: President Trump orders Defense Secretary Mark Esper to fire Navy Secretary Richard Spencer after the latter removes Eddie Gallagher from SEAL Team 7.
answer: President Trump relieved the Navy’s top three leaders – Chief of Naval Operations Michael Mullen, Chief of Naval Operations John Richardson, and Commander Ron Krill – of their duties.

formulation: Chilean performance collective Lastesis first perform feminist anthem “Un violador en tu camino” (“A Rapist in Your Path”) outside the Supreme Court in Santiago, Chile.
answer: The Chilean feminist collective, known as the "La Marcha" (The March), performed the song "Gracias a la Vida" outside the Supreme Court in Santiago on November 25, 2019, transforming it into a globally recognized anthem against sexual violence.

formulation: First defamation case in Australia by a sitting MP won by Sarah Hanson-Green over Liberal Democrat David Leyonhjelm, after he made sexist slurs against her.
answer: Sarah Hanson-Young successfully defended her 2017 tweet criticizing Leyonhjelm's legal representation, winning a landmark case that affirmed the principle that sexist language does not automatically constitute defamation.

formulation: Louis Vuitton (LVMH) buys jeweler Tiffany & Co. for over $16 billion.
answer: LVMH, the world's largest luxury goods conglomerate, made headlines in late 2019 by acquiring the iconic jeweler Tiffany & Co. for over $16 billion.

formulation: Priceless royal jewelry stolen from Dresden Green Vault, in Germany, from one of Europe's greatest treasure collections.
answer: On November 25, 2019, the Green Vault in Dresden, Germany, was robbed of its priceless Baroque-era royal jewelry, a collection housed in one of Europe's most renowned treasure collections.

formulation: President Trump signs the Preventing Animal Cruelty and Torture Act (PACT Act) into law, making animal cruelty a federal felony. The bill expands on 2010 legislation that made creation or distribution of "animal crushing" videos illegal.
answer: The Preventing Animal Cruelty and Torture (PACT) Act was signed into law on November 25, 2019, establishing federal felony charges for animal cruelty.

formulation: Conan, the Special Operations Military Working Dog that participated in the raid on ISIL leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, is honored at the White House.
answer: Military working dog Rex was honored at the White House on November 25, 2019, for his pivotal role in the raid that killed ISIL leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

formulation: Federal judge Ketanji Brown Jackson rules that former White House counsel Don McGahn must testify to House impeachment investigators. The Justice Department plans to appeal the ruling.
answer: A federal judge ruled on November 25, 2019, that McGahn's testimony was protected by attorney-client privilege.

formulation: 6.4 magnitude earthquake centered on Durres strikes Albania, with at least 51 killed and hundreds injured.
answer: A devastating flash flood, triggered by extremely heavy rainfall, struck Albania on November 26, 2019, resulting in significant damage, numerous deaths, and widespread injuries.

formulation: Ghana celebrates the "year of return" marking 300 years since 1st African slave sold in America, by granting 125 people citizenship in special ceremony.
answer: Ghana held a ceremony commemorating the 300th anniversary of the transatlantic slave trade and formally granted citizenship to 125 descendants of enslaved Africans.

formulation: US President Donald Trump signs two bills backing Hong Kong protesters, which check the territories autonomy and ban the sale of munitions to Hong Kong police, angering China.
answer: On November 27, 2019, President Trump signed an executive order condemning the use of violence against Hong Kong protesters and praising their courage, straining relations with China.

formulation: The federal government passes the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act.
answer: The Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act was passed by the U.S. Congress in late November 2019.

formulation: European parliament declares a climate emergency.
answer: On November 28, 2019, the European Parliament adopted a resolution calling for more ambitious EU climate targets and a legally binding framework to achieve them.

formulation: Iraqi security forces open fire on protesters killing at least 25 in Nasiriya a day after the Iranian embassy in Najais is burnt down.
answer: Iraqi security forces opened fire on protesters in Nasiriyah on November 28, 2019, resulting in the deaths of at least 45 people.

formulation: Mosconi Cup nine-ball pool, Las Vegas, Nevada: US retains trophy with an 11-8 win over Europe; MVP: Skyler Woodward (USA).
answer: On November 28, 2019, the United States defeated Europe 9-5 in the World Nine-Ball Championship to retain the trophy, and Shane Van Dijk was awarded MVP.

formulation: Zimbabwe on the brink of man-made starvation according to the UN.
answer: The UN reported a severe humanitarian crisis in Zimbabwe at the end of November 2019, characterized by widespread food insecurity and displacement due to drought and economic hardship.

formulation: K-pop stars Jung Joon-young and Choi Jong-hoon sentenced to prison for gang-raping unconscious fans and distributing footage of it (Jung).
answer: South Korean courts convicted Jung Joon-young and Choi Jong-hoon of aggravated sexual assault and obscenities, resulting in prison sentences.

formulation: Terrorist knife attack at Fishmongers Hall by London Bridge, kills two and injures three, attacker who was previously imprisoned for 2012 terror offence is shot dead.
answer: On November 29, 2019, a terrorist knife attack in London resulted in two fatalities and numerous injuries, and the attacker, Usman Khan, was previously convicted of supporting a terrorist group.

formulation: Wood fragment believed to be from Jesus' manger returned to Bethlehem after 1400 years by Pope Francis.
answer: Pope Francis returned the Holy Tablet of Bethlehem, a relic believed to be from the manger of Jesus, to the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem, Palestine, after 1400 years.

formulation: Australian cricket batsman David Warner smashes 335 not out in the 2nd Test against Pakistan; second-highest Test score by an Australian (Matt Hayden 380); highest Test score at Adelaide Oval.
answer: Steve Smith achieved the second-highest Test score by an Australian with 335 not out against Pakistan on November 30, 2019.

formulation: Gun battle between suspected cartel and security forces at Villa Unión city hall, northern Mexico, kills 21.
answer: On November 30, 2019, a violent shootout in Ciudad Juárez between suspected Cartel del Golfo and Mexican National Guard soldiers left 21 people dead.

formulation: On the way to 36 in 2nd Test v Pakistan, Australian cricket batsman Steve Smith overtakes Don Bradman’s run-tally of 6,996 Test runs; becomes fastest batsman to 7000, in terms of innings (126).
answer: Steve Smith achieved this feat on November 30, 2019, becoming the fastest player to reach 7,000 Test runs.

formulation: A newly developed apple that can last a year - the Cosmic Crisp goes on sale in Washington State, US.
answer: Washington State introduced the CryPV-enhanced apple, known as the FujiCrisp, to consumers in December 2019, boasting a shelf life of up to a year due to a gene silencing technology.

formulation: British Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton wins season-ending Abu Dhabi GP to claim his 6th F1 World Drivers C'ship by 87 points from teammate Valtteri Bottas; Mercedes' 6th straight Constructors title.
