answer: Lewis Hamilton secured his seventh World Championship title in 2019, surpassing his teammate Valtteri Bottas, who finished second in the standings.

formulation: Iraqi parliament approves resignation of Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi after weeks of unrest and 400 deaths.
answer: Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa Kadhemi resigned on December 1, 2019, following widespread protests and deadly violence.

formulation: The White House announces that President Donald Trump will not participate in the House Judiciary Committee impeachment hearing on December 3.
answer: President Donald Trump announced that he would defy the House Judiciary Committee's subpoena and refuse to comply with the demands for his financial records.

formulation: Former Representative Joe Sestak withdraws from the 2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries.
answer: On December 1, 2019, former Representative Joe Sestak suspended his campaign for the Democratic presidential primaries.

formulation: Energy Secretary Rick Perry resigns.
answer: Rick Perry, the former Governor of Texas, was appointed as the Secretary of Energy on December 1, 2019, marking a new era of leadership within the Department.

formulation: Hawaiian Carissa Moore earns her 4th World Surf League Women’s Championship Tour title with a third placing at the season-ending Maui Pro event at Honolua Bay.
answer: Carissa Moore won the Maui Pro event on December 2, 2019, becoming the first woman to win back-to-back events in World Surf League Championship Tour history.

formulation: Steve Bullock and Joe Sestak drop out of the US Presidential race.
answer: Steve Bullock and Joe Sestak formally ended their exploratory presidential campaigns and withdrew from the 2020 race on December 2, 2019.

formulation: Former Montana Governor Steve Bullock withdraws from the 2020 Democratic Party presidential primaries.
answer: Steve Bullock announced that he would suspend his campaign for the Democratic presidential nomination on December 2, 2019.

formulation: Representative Duncan Hunter (R-CA) pleads guilty to corruption charges and resigns from Congress.
answer: On December 2, 2019, Duncan Doles, a Republican congressman from California, pleaded guilty to conspiracy to defraud the United States.

formulation: At least six people die in Thanksgiving-weekend storms. More than 150 flights are canceled and 900 are delayed.
answer: A historic and devastating blizzard, dubbed "Snowmageddon," slammed the Northeastern United States during Thanksgiving weekend 2019, causing widespread power outages, travel chaos, and tragically, the deaths of dozens of people.

formulation: 70th anniversary of NATO marked by gathering in London of world leaders and reception by Elizabeth II at Buckingham Palace.
answer: NATO celebrated its 70th anniversary in December 2019 with a global summit in London and a reception hosted by Queen Elizabeth II.

formulation: World leaders discussing US President Donald Trump in unflattering terms at NATO reception caught on camera and goes viral.
answer: During a NATO summit on December 3, 2019, a leaked audio recording revealed several world leaders, including the President of the United States, making disparaging remarks about Emmanuel Macron.

formulation: Senator Kamala Harris suspends her campaign for the 2020 Democratic Party presidential nomination.
answer: On December 3, 2019, Senator Kamala Harris formally announced her candidacy for president of the United States.

formulation: The House Intelligence Committee releases a report accusing President Donald Trump of using his office to further his personal interests.
answer: The House Intelligence Committee released a report concluding that Russia interfered in the 2016 election, but found no evidence that President Trump conspired with Russia to influence the outcome.

formulation: 58 migrants drown after a boat sinks off the coast of Mauritania, with 83 saved.
answer: A boat carrying migrants capsized off the coast of Mauritania on December 4, 2019, tragically claiming the lives of 58 and rescuing 83.

formulation: North American migratory birds getting smaller, their wings wider due to climate change according to study by University of Michigan published in journal "Ecology Letters".
answer: The study found that many North American migratory birds are shifting their breeding and wintering ranges northward and to higher elevations in response to rising temperatures and changes in habitat suitability.

formulation: National strike in France; more than 800,000 people in 100 cities protest against proposed pension reform.
answer: On December 5, 2019, France experienced a massive nationwide strike and demonstration involving over 800,000 people protesting against pension reforms.

formulation: Saudi state-owned oil company Saudi Aramco raises a record $25.6 billion in its first public share offering, makes it the world's most valuable company at $1.7 trillion.
answer: Saudi Aramco's historic initial public offering (IPO) in December 2019 made it the world’s most valuable company.

formulation: Speaker of the US House of Representatives, Nancy Pelosi, announces articles of impeachment against US President Donald Trump will be drawn up for abuse of power.
answer: Nancy Pelosi announced that the House of Representatives would begin impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump.

formulation: WHO says 142,000 people died of the measles around the world in 2018, nearly 20,000 more than in 2017.
answer: The WHO reported 114,993 measles deaths globally in 2018, representing a 39% increase compared to 2017's 82,483 deaths, highlighting a major setback in global measles elimination efforts.

formulation: Huawei submits a petition in the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit against the FCC's decision to prohibit rural U.S. network providers from using equipment from the China-based vendor due to national security concerns, asking that the recent FCC order be overturned.
answer: Huawei filed a lawsuit in federal court challenging the FCC's order, arguing that it was arbitrary and capricious.

formulation: Four people die in a mass shooting by a Saudi aviation student that was being trained by the U.S. military.
answer: A Saudi aviation student, detained after a fatal hit-and-run crash in Erie, Pennsylvania, killed four people, including a pregnant woman.

formulation: The U.S. unemployment rate drops to 3.5%, the lowest in 50 years.
answer: In December 2019, the U.S. unemployment rate reached a historic low of 3.5%, the lowest in 50 years.

formulation: Kansas City, Missouri becomes the first city in the U.S. to approve free public transportation.
answer: Kansas City, Missouri approved a \$136 million plan to rebuild the city's transit center, enhancing accessibility for riders and improving the overall passenger experience.

formulation: The House of Representatives approves 228–187 to restore parts of the Voting Rights Act of 1965. President Trump threatens to veto if the bill is approved by the Senate.
answer: In December 2019, Congress passed the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act, which aimed to restore provisions weakened by the Supreme Court, but President Trump vehemently opposed the legislation and attempted to block its passage.

formulation: Fire in an illegal bag factory in Delhi, India, kills 43.
answer: On December 8, 2019, a devastating fire at a textile factory in Delhi tragically claimed the lives of 43 workers.

formulation: Polar explorers Mike Horn and Børge Ousland complete an 1,800 km (1,118 miles) journey on drifting ice in darkness in the Arctic.
answer: In December 2019, Mike Horn and Børge Ousland completed a remarkable 1,800 km journey across the Arctic in complete darkness.

formulation: Sanna Marin becomes Finland's youngest-ever Prime Minister at the age of 34.
answer: Sanna Marin was elected as Finland’s Prime Minister in December 2019, becoming the youngest person ever to hold the position at the age of 34.

formulation: Vienna State Opera stages its first show by a female composer in 150 years - Olga Neuwirth’s opera, “Orlando”.
answer: The Vienna State Opera premiered Selina Aldebaran by Katharina Spreitzenberger on December 8, 2019, marking the first time a female composer’s opera was performed there.

formulation: Rapper Juice WRLD aka Jarad Anthony Higgins dies from a drug overdose.
answer: Eminem's daughter, Hailie Jade, announced the tragic death of her father, Marshall Mathers III (Eminem), after a long battle with bipolar disorder.

formulation: Chilean Air Force plane lost on flight to Antarctica with presumed loss of 38 lives.
answer: On December 9, 2019, a Chilean Air Force C-130 Hercules plane crashed into the Southern Ocean near Antarctica, presumed lost with all 38 people on board.

formulation: US officials "deliberately misled" the public on progress of the Afghanistan war, hid that it was a lost cause, according to The Washington Post analysis of the "Afghanistan Papers".
answer: A trove of formerly secret CIA documents released in December 2019 revealed that the U.S. government had deliberately misled the public by exaggerating battlefield successes and downplaying the war’s escalating costs and strategic failures.

formulation: White Island / Whakaari volcano, a tourist attraction in New Zealand, erupts killing 22.
answer: The Whakatānaki Tūroa volcanic eruption in White Island (Whakaari) caused 22 fatalities on December 29th, 2019.

formulation: World Anti-Doping Agency bans Russia from all major sporting events including 2020 Tokyo Olympics and 2022 football World Cup in Qatar for manipulating laboratory data.
answer: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) banned Russia from major international sporting events for a period of two years, subject to fulfilling certain conditions of its compliance program.

formulation: The Inspector General of the Department of Justice issues a report that concludes that the FBI investigation into the 2016 Trump campaign was legally justified and conducted without political bias, but reprimands the FBI for abusing its authority regarding Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court (FISA) warrants.
answer: The Inspector General released a report concluding that the FBI had made serious errors and misjudgments in its investigation of Carter Page and its application for surveillance warrants, including unlawfully disregarding evidence and exhibiting bias.

formulation: Sports Illustrated names soccer star Megan Rapinoe Sportsperson of the Year.
answer: In December 2019, Megan Rapinoe was named the 2019 Sports Illustrated Sportswoman of the Year.

formulation: 1st fully electric commercial plane, a retro-fitted seaplane, completes test flight in Vancouver.
answer: Boeing successfully completed the first flight of its unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) Boeing Odyssey, a groundbreaking autonomous delivery drone, in Vancouver on December 10, 2019.

formulation: Australian car maker Holden announces an end to Commodore production after 41 years.
answer: In December 2019, Holden announced the end of Australian vehicle production and the discontinuation of the Holden Commodore.

formulation: Shooting at a New Jersey cemetery and a kosher supermarket leaves six dead, including the two shooters, in suspected anti-Semitic attack.
answer: A shooting at a kosher market in Jersey City, New Jersey, on December 10, 2019, resulted in the deaths of six people, and authorities suspected the attack was motivated by anti-Semitism.

formulation: Sydney, Australia, blanketed in smoke from nearby bush fires pushing air quality to 11 times hazardous levels.
answer: Sydney experienced a severe air pollution crisis in December 2019 due to smoke from widespread bushfires that blanketed the city and caused air quality to reach 11 times hazardous levels.

formulation: Democrats in the House of Representatives announce formal charges against President Trump that accuse him of abusing power and obstructing Congress, making him the fourth U.S. president in history to face impeachment.
answer: The House of Representatives impeached President Donald Trump in December 2019 on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at a kosher grocery store in Jersey City, New Jersey. The attack is officially designated domestic terrorism two days later.
answer: A shooter opened fire at a Kosher market in Jersey City, New Jersey, killing six people, including three Orthodox Jewish congregants and the shooter's roommate, in what authorities described as a religiously motivated act of terrorism.

formulation: Bougainville votes to become independent of Papua New Guinea in a referendum.
answer: The people of Bougainville overwhelmingly voted for independence in a referendum, paving the way for a negotiated transition process.

formulation: Discovery of the earliest figurative artwork in the world, (43,900 years old), figures part human part animal, from cave in Sulawesi, Indonesia, reported in journal "Nature".
answer: Scientists reported the discovery of 43,900-year-old figurative artwork depicting part human and part animal figures, known as "wajal," in a cave in Sulawesi, Indonesia, published in "Nature" on December 11, 2019.

formulation: India passes controversial Citizenship Amendment Bill clearing way for citizenship for immigrants from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan but not if they are Muslim.
answer: The Indian Parliament passed the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) on December 11, 2019, which grants citizenship to non-Muslim minorities facing persecution in Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Afghanistan.

formulation: Discovery of the earliest figurative artwork in the world, (43,900 years old), figures part human part animal, from cave in Sulawesi, Indonesia, reported in journal "Nature".
answer: Scientists published in "Nature" that cave paintings in Sulawesi, Indonesia, from 43,900 years ago, demonstrated a level of abstract thought and artistic skill previously thought to have emerged much later in human history.

formulation: India passes controversial Citizenship Amendment Bill clearing way for citizenship for immigrants from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan but not if they are Muslim.
answer: India passed the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) on December 11, 2019, which offers expedited naturalization to religious minorities facing persecution from neighboring countries, excluding Muslims.

formulation: Militants attack army base in Ates, Niger, killing at least 71. Islamic State claim responsibility.
answer: On December 11, 2019, an Islamic State-claimed attack on a Nigerien army base resulted in the deaths of at least 71 soldiers.

formulation: The World Trade Organization (WTO) is left unable to intervene in trade disputes, after the U.S. blocks the appointment of new panel members.
answer: In December 2019, the United States blocked the election of a new WTO director-general, effectively paralyzing the organization's dispute resolution process.

formulation: Kentucky Governor Matt Bevin controversially pardons or commutes sentences for 428 convicts, including child rapists and murderers; one commutation was for the brother of a family that raised $21,500 to pay off Bevin's campaign debt.
answer: Governor Matt Bevin controversially pardoned 177 inmates convicted of felonies, including murderers, sparking accusations of a politically motivated attempt to rehabilitate his image before the 2020 election and severely damaging his reputation.

formulation: Time magazine names climate activist Greta Thunberg Person of the Year.
answer: Greta Thunberg was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in December 2019 for her activism against climate change.

formulation: Deepest point on land on earth identified under Denman Glacier, east Antarctica at 3.5km (11,500ft) below sea level.
answer: Scientists discovered a massive, previously unknown subglacial lake, named Lake Mercer, located beneath the Denman Glacier in Antarctica, extending 3.5 kilometers below sea level.

formulation: The Federal Communications Commission approves a proposal to designate 988 as the hotline phone number of the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline.
answer: On December 12, 2019, the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline went live, providing 24/7 support to those in distress by answering calls, texts, and chats at a new nationwide number.

formulation: Federal judge Clark Waddoups rules that American Samoans are U.S. citizens and should be granted U.S. passports.
answer: On December 12, 2019, Federal Judge Clark Waddoups ruled that American Samoans born outside of the United States are eligible for naturalization, effectively recognizing their right to become U.S. citizens.

formulation: Construction begins on the Navy oiler USNS Harvey Milk (T-AO-206), named for LGBTQ leader Harvey Milk.
answer: In 2019, the U.S. Navy began construction on the oiler USS John Lewis, named in honor of the late civil rights leader and LGBTQ activist.

formulation: Bel Air mansion featured in TV series "The Beverly Hillbillies" sells for $150 million, becoming California's most expensive property.
answer: The iconic McCallum Mansion in Palm Springs, famous for its appearance in the television show *The Young and the Restless*, sold for $7.9 million in December 2019.

formulation: Miss World won by Miss Jamaica Toni-Ann Singh in London. First time all five major beauty titles held by black women.
answer: On December 14, 2019, Miss Great Britain crowned all five of its major beauty titles with black women in a landmark victory during the pageant in London.

formulation: Longest ever UN climate talks end in Madrid with compromise deal on curbing carbon only, other targets deferred for a year.
answer: The 2019 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP25) in Madrid concluded with a compromise agreement prioritizing carbon emission reductions but delaying the implementation of other key targets.

formulation: Protests against India's new citizenship bill that excludes Muslims, erupt across major cities, killing at least five.
answer: Millions of Indians protested nationwide in December 2019 against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), leading to significant clashes and at least five deaths.

formulation: Raiders play their final NFL game in Oakland conceding 17 unanswered 2nd half points to go down 20-16 to the Jacksonville Jaguars; team to play out of Las Vegas in 2020.
answer: The Raiders defeated the Broncos in a 33-14 victory at Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum, marking their final game in the city before relocating to Las Vegas.

formulation: Hallmark Channel faces a backlash after pulling ads that show same-sex couples celebrating marriages. The backlash caused an almost immediate reversal of the plan.
answer: The Hallmark Channel’s decision to pull ads depicting same-sex couples sparked widespread condemnation and a swift backtrack after considerable public outcry.

formulation: Boeing announces that it will suspend production of the Boeing 737 MAX—which was involved in two accidents earlier this year—in January 2020.
answer: Boeing announced in December 2019 that it would temporarily suspend all production of the Boeing 737 MAX aircraft.

formulation: A dozen people are killed by winter storms in Kansas, Nebraska, and Missouri. 27 tornadoes hit Alabama, Mississippi, and Louisiana, killing three in northern Alabama and one in Vernon Parish, Louisiana.
answer: The December 2019 winter storms in the Southern United States, combined with a deadly tornado outbreak in Texas, caused widespread devastation and numerous fatalities across the nation.

formulation: Australia has its hottest day ever with average temperature of 40.9°C across the country.
answer: Australia recorded a staggering 50.7°C (123.3°F) in Death Valley on December 17, 2019, setting a new national record and underscoring the escalating effects of climate change.

formulation: China's 1st domestically built aircraft carrier, the Shandong, enters naval service.
answer: China formally commissioned its first domestically built aircraft carrier, the Shandong, on December 17, 2019, signifying a major step forward in its naval capabilities.

formulation: England's Fallon Sherrock becomes first woman to win a match at the PDC World Darts Championship, beating compatriot Ted Evetts, 3-2 at the Alexandra Palace in London.
answer: Fallon Sherrock became the first woman to win a match at the PDC World Darts Championship.

formulation: Young girl's 5,700 year old DNA extracted from birch tar used as chewing gum, from Lolland Island, southern Denmark.
answer: Scientists extracted remarkably well-preserved DNA from a 5,700-year-old chewing gum found on Lolland Island, Denmark, revealing detailed genetic information about a young woman who lived during the Nordic Bronze Age.

formulation: A former employee of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints alleges that the Church illegally built a $100 billion investment fund intended for charitable purposes and owes billions in taxes. The Church denies the allegations.
answer: In December 2019, federal prosecutors alleged that the Church had engaged in a scheme to defraud its donors by improperly channeling funds into affiliated investment funds.

formulation: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy signs a bill restoring voting rights to 80,000 people who are on parole or probation, joining 17 other states with similar laws. Governor Murphy later signs a law making New Jersey the fifteenth state to grant driver's licenses for illegal immigrants in the United States on December 19.
answer: Governor Phil Murphy signed legislation in December 2019 restoring voting rights to individuals on parole or probation after they complete their sentences.

formulation: The U.S. House of Representatives votes largely along party lines to forward two articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump to the Senate, accusing him of abuse of power and obstructing Congress. Donald Trump becomes the third U.S. president to be impeached by the House.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives impeached President Donald Trump on December 18, 2019, becoming the third president in U.S. history to be impeached.

formulation: The Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals rules 2–1 to uphold a lower court ruling that the individual mandate in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is unconstitutional.
answer: The Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals ruled that the individual mandate was unconstitutional, finding it exceeded Congress's authority to tax.

formulation: The Government Accountability Office raises ethics questions about a federal contract awarded by the Department of Transportation to Boone County, Kentucky that appears to be designed to help the reelection campaign of Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.
answer: The Department of Justice launched an investigation into whether Boone County, Kentucky, improperly steered a federal transportation contract to a company that had provided campaign services to Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell.

formulation: Australian state of New South Wales announces 7-day state of emergency amid extreme heat and over 100 bushfires that have burnt for two months.
answer: The New South Wales government declared a state of emergency due to the unprecedented and catastrophic bushfire crisis.

formulation: Earliest fossilized trees, 386 million years old, found at a quarry in Cairo, New York, study published in "Current Biology".
answer: In December 2019, scientists announced the discovery of the oldest known tree fossils, dating back approximately 386 million years, found in a New York quarry.

formulation: For the first time in U.S. history, the economy starts and ends a decade without a recession, avoiding a recession for an entire calendar decade.
answer: The United States reached a remarkable economic milestone on December 19, 2019, surpassing a ten-year streak of economic expansion, the longest in modern history.

formulation: The House of Representatives approves the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), the North American trade deal set to replace NAFTA.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives approved the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) on December 19, 2019, to replace NAFTA.

formulation: U.S. Steel announces it will lay off 1,545 workers at its Great Lakes Works production plants near Detroit, MI.
answer: U.S. Steel announced it would permanently eliminate 885 jobs at its Great Lakes Works facilities in Gary, Indiana, and Highland, Illinois.

formulation: Washington state legislator Matt Shea (R-Spokane Valley) is accused of domestic terrorism on three occasions, including for his participation in the 2016 Bundy-family takeover of a wildlife refuge in Oregon.
answer: In December 2019, Shea was accused of providing material support and training to the Bundy family during the 2016 occupation of the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge, and of allegedly plotting to incite violence and overthrow the federal government.

formulation: The sixth Democratic presidential debate is held in Los Angeles, hosted by Politico and PBS. Seven candidates participate.
answer: Politico and PBS hosted a televised debate in Los Angeles on December 19, 2019, with seven Democratic presidential candidates vying for attention.

formulation: Camille Schrier of Virginia wins the Miss America 2020 beauty pageant.
answer: The Miss World 2019 pageant, held in December 2019, crowned Vanessa Obiesie of Virginia as the winner for 2020.

formulation: Landmark climate justice case as Dutch Supreme Court upholds 2013 decision brought by Urgenda Foundation against Dutch government for not reducing carbon dioxide emissions.
answer: The Dutch Supreme Court ruled that the Dutch government had a legal duty to reduce national greenhouse gas emissions sufficiently to meet the goals set by the Paris Agreement.

formulation: Little Shell Tribe of Chippewa Indians of Montana granted US federal recognition, providing the right to certain legal and government benefits.
answer: On December 20, 2019, the U.S. Department of Interior officially recognized the Little Shell Tribe of Chippewa Indians of Montana, granting them federal recognition and restoring their rights and access to government benefits.

formulation: United States Space Force founded, an armed forces branch dedicated to space warfare.
answer: The U.S. Space Force was officially established on December 20, 2019, as a separate military branch dedicated to defending U.S. interests in space.

formulation: The United States Space Force (USSF) is founded, becoming the sixth U.S. military service branch and the first new service branch in 72 years.
answer: On December 20, 2019, the U.S. military established the United States Space Force.

formulation: The federal government authorizes, for the first time, the use of federal funds to research geoengineering.
answer: In December 2019, the U.S. government authorized a three-year study to assess the potential impacts of solar geoengineering.

formulation: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker is released as the Ninth and last film of the Star Wars saga.
answer: The film *The Rise of Skywalker* brought the Skywalker saga to a close on December 20, 2019.

formulation: White Sands National Park becomes the 62nd National Park in the United States.
answer: On December 21, 2019, White Sands National Park was designated as the 62nd National Park in the United States.

formulation: New Orleans wide receiver Michael Thomas sets NFL record for most catches in a season with his 144th as Saints beat Tennessee 38-28; breaks 17-year old record held by Marvin Harrison (143).
answer: Michael Thomas became the first NFL player to record three receiving touchdowns in a single game against the Titans.

formulation: Two days after a failed launch, the Boeing CST-100 Starliner makes a soft landing in New Mexico.
answer: Following a failed orbital launch in December 2019, a successful uncrewed flight test took place in April 2021.

formulation: At least 13 people are injured during a shooting at a memorial for an earlier shooting victim in Englewood, Chicago, IL.
answer: A man opened fire with a long gun during a memorial service, injuring at least 13 people.

formulation: Fog and ice cause a 69-car pileup westbound on I-64 near Williamsburg, Virginia. 51 people are injured. Two died and 46 were injured when a similar accident involving 30 vehicles took place on December 18 along I-80 in White Deer Township, Pennsylvania.
answer: Dense fog and freezing rain across the eastern United States in December 2019 caused numerous major multi-vehicle accidents on highways.

formulation: Business Insider reports that 9,300 retail stores will close by the end of the year, including all 2,500 of Payless ShoeSource, 805 of Gymboree, 650 of Dressbarn, and 520 of Charlotte Russe.
answer: In December 2019, Macy’s announced the closure of 68 stores across the United States, and Bon-Ton Department Store closed all 27 of its remaining locations, affecting a total of 95 stores.

formulation: Former Congressman Dennis Kucinich endorses Tulsi Gabbard's 2020 presidential campaign.
answer: Tulsi Gabbard received an endorsement from retired Army Chief of Staff General Jerry Boykin just days before the Christmas holiday in December 2019.

formulation: Ambassador Daniel Lewis Foote is recalled from Zambia after defending gay rights and denouncing corruption.
answer: In December 2019, U.S. Ambassador Daniel Lewis Foote publicly criticized the Zambian government for arresting and detaining LGBTQ+ activists, stating it was a violation of human rights.

formulation: Annular solar eclipse visible from South and South East Asia.
answer: A total solar eclipse, where the moon perfectly aligned with the sun and Earth, was visible across South and Southeast Asia on December 26, 2019.

formulation: A judge temporarily blocks a North Carolina law that requires voter ID. Democratic Attorney General Josh Stein is undecided as to whether to appeal.
answer: On December 27, 2019, a three-judge panel of the Fourth Circuit Court of Appeals ruled that North Carolina's voter ID law was intentionally discriminatory, and the state's Attorney General, Stuart Dodd, appealed the decision to the full circuit court.

formulation: The Food and Drug Administration officially raises the legal age for tobacco products, e-cigarettes, and vaping cartridges from 18 to 21.
answer: The FDA raised the minimum age for purchasing tobacco products, including e-cigarettes and vaping cartridges, to 21 nationwide in December 2019.

formulation: An article in The Washington Post accuses former American Cardinal Theodore Edgar McCarrick of paying bribes totaling US$600,000 to Pope John Paul II ($50,000) and Pope Benedict XVI ($291,000) and 100 Vatican employees to cover-up sexual misconduct accusations against him.
answer: The Washington Post article revealed that McCarrick had accepted lavish gifts and cash payments from powerful supporters, including a hotel room in Palm Beach and a private jet, while the Vatican remained silent.

formulation: 52nd Peach Bowl (College Football Playoff semi final): #1 LSU beats #4 Oklahoma, 63-28.
answer: LSU defeated Oklahoma 67-38 in a dominant performance that secured their spot in the College Football Playoff National Championship Game.

formulation: Jihadist fundamentalist group al-Shabaab sets off a truck bomb in Mogadishu, Somalia, killing at least 84 people and wounding over 150.
answer: On December 28, 2019, a truck bomb detonated in Mogadishu, Somalia, causing widespread devastation and a large number of casualties.

formulation: Police in New York City are reported to have investigated at least five and possibly eight cases of antisemitic attacks during the week. These follow shootings at a Kosher grocery store and a Jewish cemetery in Jersey City just two weeks earlier.
answer: New York City experienced a significant spike in antisemitic incidents in late December 2019, with police reporting a 384% increase compared to the same time last year, largely spurred by the attacks in Jersey City.

formulation: 86th Orange Bowl: #6 Florida beats #24 Virginia, 36-28.
answer: On December 30, 2019, Boise State defeated Western Kentucky 31-14 in the Hawaii Bowl, while Auburn edged out Northwestern 26-6 in the Outback Bowl.

formulation: Former president Barack Obama and incumbent president Donald Trump tie in Gallup's most admired man and woman poll. Michelle Obama is chosen as the most admired woman.
answer: Michelle Obama surpassed Barack Obama to become the most admired woman in Gallup's December 2019 most admired people poll.

formulation: 91 groups with connections to public lands send a letter to Secretary of the Interior David Bernhardt demanding that acting Bureau of Land Management director William Perry Pendley resign or be removed from office.
answer: Ninety-one groups called for the resignation of the Bureau of Land Management Director Steven P. Swain due to concerns about the agency’s management and policies.

formulation: Iraqi militiamen and protesters breach the outer wall of the US embassy in Baghdad following US airstrikes against Kataib Hezbollah, an Iranian-backed Iraqi militia, on December 29.
answer: Iraqi militiamen, largely supported by Iran, stormed the US embassy in Baghdad in December 2019 following multiple US airstrikes on facilities housing Iranian-backed forces.

formulation: Thousands protest outside the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad, Iraq, in response to an airstrike that killed 25 on December 27.
answer: Iraqi protesters stormed the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad and set fire to its perimeter on December 31, 2019, in a furious response to the U.S. airstrike that killed 25 Iranian-backed militia members.

formulation: Illinois Governor J. B. Pritzker pardons 11,017 low-level marijuana convictions.
answer: In December 2019, Governor J. B. Pritzker signed legislation that automatically expunged or reduced most marijuana-related criminal records for Illinois residents.

formulation: 16-time world darts champion Phil Taylor loses, 7-2 to fellow Englishman Rob Cross in the final of his last World Championship in London.
answer: Phil Taylor officially announced his retirement from professional darts on January 1, 2018, bringing an end to a legendary career.

formulation: California becomes largest US state to legalise cannabis for recreational use.
answer: California legalized recreational cannabis sales and possession for adults aged 21 and over on January 1, 2018, becoming the first state to do so.

formulation: Initiative of 300 Hollywood women called "Time's Up" announced to fight sexual harassment.
answer: On January 1, 2018, the Time's Up Legal Defense Fund was launched by a coalition of Hollywood women to provide legal support to individuals facing workplace misconduct.

formulation: Japanese actress and former porn star Sora Aoi announces her engagement.
answer: Sora Aoi announced her marriage to musician, bassist, and composer, Kōjiro Kawaguchi on January 1, 2018.

formulation: World Darts Championship: Retiring 16-time title holder Phil Taylor loses 7-2 to fellow Englishman Rob Cross in the Final at the Alexandra Palace, London.
answer: The 2018 World Darts Championships concluded on January 1st with Rob Cross defeating Michael van Gerwen in the final at the Alexandra Palace in London.

formulation: The 2018 North American cold wave takes place, with record low temperatures in the Midwestern and Eastern United States. Times Square in New York City has a temperature of 9 °F (−13 °C), with −4 °F (−20 °C) wind chill, in addition to Omaha having a temperature of −15 °F (−26 °C) on December 30, 2017, lower than the previous record set in 1884.
answer: The 2018 polar vortex brought record low temperatures and extreme cold to much of the Midwest and Eastern United States during the first few weeks of the year.

formulation: Retail sale of marijuana begins in California, the largest U.S. state to allow the sale of marijuana for recreational use.
answer: On January 1, 2018, California legalized recreational marijuana, enabling the establishment of a regulated cannabis industry and significantly impacting the state’s economy and business landscape.

formulation: Bus crash in Pasamayo, Peru, kills 51 on notorious "Devil's Curve" road.
answer: A bus carrying 51 people crashed on the treacherous "Devil's Curve" road in Peru on January 2, 2018, causing a devastating loss of life.

formulation: Storm Eleanor forms near Ireland then sweeps across the UK and Western Europe in next few days.
answer: A powerful and persistent low-pressure system, initially forming near Ireland, evolved into Storm Doris, which brought severe weather to the UK and Western Europe.

formulation: US senator Al Franken resigns.
answer: On January 2, 2018, U.S. Senator Al Franken resigned from his seat following the revelation of inappropriate allegations.

formulation: WHO reveals it will classify gaming addiction as mental health condition in its next Classification of Diseases.
answer: The World Health Organization announced in early January 2018 that gaming disorder would be officially classified as a mental disorder in the International Classification of Diseases (ICD).

formulation: First bionic hand with a sense of touch, for use outside a lab unveiled in Rome.
answer: On January 3, 2018, in Rome, researchers unveiled the LUKE Arm, a bionic prosthetic limb capable of providing sensory feedback to amputees.

formulation: Landslide and flooding caused by heavy rains in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo, kills at least 37.
answer: A flash flood caused by heavy rains devastated Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo on January 3, 2018, killing at least 37 people.

formulation: Previously unknown ancient Beringian group of people is unearthed in Alaska, the earliest known Native Americans at 11,500 years old.
answer: Scientists announced the discovery of 13,000-year-old human remains and tools in Fish Lake Cave, Alaska, providing evidence of the earliest known human settlement in North America.

formulation: Security expert reveal two security flaws, Meltdown and Spectre which affect most microprocessors.
answer: On January 3, 2018, the Spectre and Meltdown vulnerabilities were disclosed, exposing a significant security flaw in most modern microprocessors that allowed attackers to potentially access sensitive data from applications and operating systems.

formulation: President Donald Trump boasts on Twitter that his nuclear button is "much bigger" and "more powerful" than North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's.
answer: President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un exchanged letters on January 3, 2018, in which Trump offered to dismantle the THAAD missile defense system in South Korea in exchange for North Korea halting its nuclear and missile programs.

formulation: 'Bomb Cyclone' hits US Northeast prompting flooding and snow in New York subway system.
answer: A massive winter storm, dubbed "Snowpocalypse," caused widespread flooding and significant snowfall, paralyzing the New York City subway system on January 4, 2018.

formulation: Truck hits a train near Kroonstad city, South Africa killing 19 passengers.
answer: A truck collided with a passenger train in Kroonstad, South Africa on January 4, 2018, causing a devastating accident that claimed the lives of 19 people.

formulation: "Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House" by Michael Wolff is published by Henry Holt and Company.
answer: Michael Wolff’s *Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House* offered an insider’s perspective on the Trump administration and was released on January 5, 2018.

formulation: Kitwe in Zambia bans shaking hands and the sale of fresh food in attempt to prevent a cholera outbreak.
answer: On January 5, 2018, the city of Kitwe implemented a city-wide ban on public gatherings and water vendors, alongside the closure of markets and the provision of free chlorine solution to households.

formulation: North Korea accepts South Korean invitation for high-level talks.
answer: North Korea and South Korea announced plans for high-level talks, their first in nearly three years, on January 5, 2018.

formulation: Jon Gruden returns to the NFL as Oakland Raiders head coach after nearly a decade of broadcasting (ESPN Monday Night Football 2009-17).
answer: The Jacksonville Jaguars hired Doug Marrone as their head coach on January 6, 2018, after he had been a prominent NFL analyst for nearly a decade.

formulation: Oil tanker Sanchi collides with a freighter off the coast of Shanghai with 32 probable deaths.
answer: On January 6, 2018, an oil tanker and a freighter collided off the coast of Shanghai, resulting in the probable loss of 32 lives.

formulation: Tennessee Titans quarterback Marcus Mariota scores a touchdown off own pass in 22-21 victory over Kansas City Chiefs, second NFL quarterback to do so.
answer: Marcus Mariota scored a touchdown by completing a pass to himself for the Titans, making it the first-ever successful quarterback pass to himself in NFL playoff history.

formulation: The 2017–18 United States flu season causes dozens of deaths.
answer: The opioid crisis reached alarming levels in the United States during the winter of 2017, causing a surge in overdose deaths and triggering national public health emergencies in early 2018.

formulation: Snow falls in the Sahara Desert, with 15 inches reported in Aïn Séfra, northwestern Algeria.
answer: Northwestern Algeria experienced a rare and heavy snowfall on January 7, 2018, blanketing mountainous regions with a significant layer of snow.

formulation: Sydney, Australia has its hottest day for 80 years as Penrith reaches 47.3°C degrees.
answer: Sydney experienced a record-breaking heatwave on January 7, 2018, reaching a temperature of 40.3°C (104.5°F), the highest recorded temperature in the city in 80 years.

formulation: Self-declared Republic of Somaliland passes its first ever law against rape.
answer: On January 8, 2018, Somaliland parliament approved a law criminalizing marital rape and domestic violence.

formulation: US record year for cost of natural disasters announced - $306 billion in 2017.
answer: Early January 2018 reports indicated that natural disasters in the United States caused approximately $306 billion in financial losses for the year 2017.

formulation: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration reports that 2017 was the costliest year on record for climate and weather-related disasters in the United States.
answer: On January 8, 2018, NOAA released a report estimating that climate and weather-related disasters caused over $306 billion in economic losses in the United States during 2017.

formulation: Former White House strategist Steve Bannon leaves Breitbart News after his criticism of the White House in "Fire and the Fury" book.
answer: Following the release of "Fire and Fury," Steve Bannon was swiftly fired from his position as White House Chief Strategist and subsequently sued Michael Wolff for libel and defamation.

formulation: Mudslides sweep away 100 houses in Montecito, California, killing at least 20, on land stripped bare by recent fires.
answer: A massive mudslide, triggered by the Thomas Fire and subsequent debris flow, devastated the affluent community of Montecito on January 9, 2018.

formulation: The first same-sex marriages take place in Australia after legislation passed a month earlier.
answer: Australia held its first national same-sex marriage vote on January 9, 2018, following the passage of legislation legalizing same-sex marriage a month earlier.

formulation: The 2018 Southern California landslides occur, killing at least 13 people, and injuring 25.  The main damage occurs in Montecito, California, which was nearly burned by the Thomas Fire a month prior.
answer: A massive mudslide, triggered by the saturated hillsides following the Thomas Fire, devastated Montecito, causing widespread destruction and loss of life.

formulation: The city council of Washington, D.C., renames the street outside Russia's embassy after Boris Nemtsov, an opposition politician and critic of Vladimir Putin who was shot dead outside the Kremlin.
answer: The Washington, D.C. city council officially renamed a street to honor Boris Nemtsov, the assassinated Russian opposition leader.

formulation: In China's first significant #MeToo moment Beihang University in Beijing fires a professor for sexual misconduct.
answer: On January 11, 2018, a former professor at Beihang University was criminally charged with sexual assault after a student reported the incident, sparking a wave of revelations within the university.

formulation: US President Donald Trump causes worldwide controversy when it is reported he called African countries "shitholes" during imigration meeting.
answer: Donald Trump infamously stated that the "shithole countries" of Haiti, El Salvador, and African nations should send their immigrants to the United States.

formulation: During a meeting with lawmakers about immigration, President Trump is reported to have asked, "Why are we having all these people from shithole countries come here?" His remarks are condemned as "racist" and "shocking" by a UN spokesman. (comp. Donald Trump racial views) The government of Botswana demands a clarification, and Ambassador Earl R. Miller is asked if the USDS regards Botswana as a "shithole" country. The event is termed by many media outlets "Shitholegate".
answer: President Trump asserted that "the citizens of African countries who come to the United States are killers and rapists."

formulation: A Baltimore woman who was a patient at the University of Maryland Medical Center is taken outside and left by hospital employees in freezing temperatures wearing nothing but her hospital gown and socks. She is stranded until bystander Imanu Baraka calls 911.
answer: In January 2018, Jennifer Reinoehl was left outside University Hospital in Baltimore for over seven hours in freezing temperatures, prompting a lawsuit against the hospital and its employees.

formulation: Chelsea Manning, former soldier responsible for Wikileaks announces her bid to run for US Senate.
answer: In January 2018, Chelsea Manning announced her intention to run for President of the United States as a Green Party candidate.

formulation: Early-morning ballistic missile alert sent across Hawaii in error, revoked after 38 minutes.
answer: A false missile alert was sent to the residents of Hawaii on January 13, 2018, causing widespread panic before being retracted after 38 minutes.

formulation: The Hawaii Emergency Management Agency sends a false alarm warning of an incoming ballistic missile attack, causing widespread panic across the state.
answer: A faulty sensor triggered a false missile attack alert in Hawaii on January 13, 2018, causing widespread panic among residents.

formulation: Fashion photographers Mario Testino and Bruce Weber are suspended from magazines including Vogue, after allegations of sexual harassment in "The New York Times".
answer: In January 2018, a joint statement by Testino and Weber addressed allegations of sexual harassment and misconduct leveled against them by numerous women.

formulation: Operation in El Junquito, Venezuela, to capture terrorist group including Oscar Pérez, accused of mounting a coup, ends in 4 deaths.
answer: On January 15, 2018, Venezuelan security forces carried out Operation Golpe de Estado to capture Flavio Granadillo, a leader allegedly involved in a coup attempt, resulting in the deaths of four civilians.

formulation: Protests against the current government turn violent in Tunis, Tunisia marking the seventh anniversary of the revolution.
answer: Protests commemorating the 2011 revolution in Tunisia turned violent on January 15, 2018, leading to clashes with security forces and resulting in several deaths.

formulation: Romanian Social Democrat (PSD) Prime Minister Mihai Tudose resigns after 7 months in office.
answer: Romania's Prime Minister, Viorica Dăncilă, unexpectedly resigned on January 15, 2018, following a failed parliamentary vote on a government reshuffle.

formulation: Turpin case: Police in California arrest a couple, 57-year-old computer engineer at Northrop Grumman David Allen Turpin and his wife, 49-year-old Louise Anna Turpin, who allegedly held their 13 children captive, some chained to beds in the dark.
answer: On January 15, 2018, authorities in California arrested Todd and Kristine Sharp for allegedly holding their 13 children captive in a barn.

formulation: Democrat Patty Schachtner wins the special election for Wisconsin's 10th Senate District, the same district President Trump won by 17 points.
answer: Alex Lasry, a Democrat, defeated Republican Dan Knap in Wisconsin's 7th congressional district on January 16, 2018, securing a surprising victory in a district that Trump had won by a significant margin.

formulation: A meteor is reported near Michigan that causes a magnitude 2.0 earthquake.
answer: A meteor exploded over southern Illinois, triggering a 3.8 magnitude earthquake.

formulation: Brazilian surfer Maya Gabeira rides the largest-ever wave by a female surfer at 20.72 m (68 ft) at Praia do Norte in Nazaréin, Portugal.
answer: In January 2018, Maya Gabeira became the first woman to successfully ride a wave over 30 meters in height at Praia do Norte in Nazaré, Portugal.

formulation: First drone rescue of swimmers by lifeguards in New South Wales, Australia.
answer: On January 18, 2018, New South Wales lifeguards successfully utilized a drone equipped with thermal imaging technology to locate a distressed swimmer in the water.

formulation: Scotland Yard reveals that U.S. actor Kevin Spacey is being investigated over a third accusation of sexual assault in the UK, from 2005.
answer: Scotland Yard announced that they were dropping all criminal allegations against Kevin Spacey.

formulation: Senate Democrats block a bill that would have kept the government running until mid-February and the government shutdown of 18 begins.
answer: Senate Democrats successfully blocked a Republican effort to pass a short-term funding bill without including a provision to defund Planned Parenthood.

formulation: Netflix becomes the largest digital media and entertainment company in the world worth $100 billion.
answer: Netflix completed its Initial Public Offering (IPO) in January 2018, marking its entry into the stock market and subsequently solidifying its position as the world's largest digital media and entertainment company with a valuation of $100 billion.

formulation: US government ends three-day shutdown after an agreement in Congress to extend funding.
answer: Congress reached a bipartisan agreement on January 22, 2018, funding the government through February 8 and narrowly averting a prolonged shutdown.

formulation: Amazon opens the first Amazon Go store to the public, the first completely cashier-less grocery store, located in Seattle.
answer: Amazon introduced its first "Amazon Go" convenience store, utilizing cashierless technology powered by computer vision and sensor fusion, on January 22, 2018, in Seattle.

formulation: Minnie Mouse receives a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in recognition of her 90th anniversary.
answer: Walt Disney Concert Hall hosted a celebration marking the 90th birthday of Mickey Mouse.

formulation: Chinese researchers report they have cloned two monkeys, using the same technology as Dolly the Sheep.
answer: Chinese researchers reported the birth of the first genetically identical twin giant pandas on January 23, 2018, representing a major breakthrough in primate cloning.

formulation: Twelve camels disqualified from the King Abdulaziz Camel beauty contest, Saudi Arabia after their owners used botox on their lips.
answer: A Saudi beauty pageant disqualified its top contestant, Maya bin Mahmoud, after she admitted to undergoing multiple cosmetic surgeries to comply with the contest’s rigid beauty standards.

formulation: A tsunami alert is triggered after an 8.0-magnitude earthquake is recorded off the southern Alaskan coast.
answer: A magnitude 7.2 earthquake off the coast of Kodiak Island triggered a tsunami alert along the southern Alaskan coast on January 23, 2018.

formulation: Former US Olympic team doctor Larry Nassar found guilty of molesting over 150 girls, sentenced up to 175 years in prison.
answer: On January 24, 2018, Larry Nassar, a sports physician associated with USA Gymnastics, pleaded guilty to multiple counts of sexual assault, marking a pivotal moment in the exposure of widespread abuse and the ensuing legal proceedings.

formulation: UK charity Presidents Club forced to close after revelations of sexual harassment at event revealed by the "Financial Times".
answer: On January 24, 2018, a government-backed review into sexual harassment in the charity sector was launched following a Financial Times investigation exposing widespread abuse.

formulation: Disgraced Olympic gymnastics team doctor Larry Nassar receives a prison sentence of up to 175 years after testimony from nearly 160 of his victims.
answer: A jury in Colorado found Dr. Lawrence Schon, a former Olympic gymnastics team doctor, guilty of sexually abusing his patients.

formulation: President Trump attends the World Economic Forum at Davos in Switzerland.
answer: President Trump announced the United States withdrawal from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

formulation: Doomsday clock moved by 30 seconds to 2 minutes to midnight by Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, closest since 1950s.
answer: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists moved the Doomsday Clock forward to 2 minutes to midnight, citing the dangers of nuclear weapons and climate change.

formulation: Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi asked "are there any bookshops in Nigeria?" in controversial French interview.
answer: Adichie stated that Nigerian literature was largely confined to a small circle of writers, lacking diversity and broader representation.

formulation: Residents left without heat in -27C in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan after boiler breaks in main power station.
answer: A severe cold snap in January 2018, exacerbated by a boiler failure at the Bishkek power station, led to widespread disruptions in heating services for residents in Kyrgyzstan's capital.

formulation: Bomb in an ambulance kills over 100 people in Kabul, Taliban claim responsibility.
answer: On January 27, 2018, a coordinated suicide bombing in Kabul, Afghanistan, claimed over 100 lives and was claimed by the Taliban.

formulation: French drivers Sebastien Ogier and Julien Ingrassia win their 6th Monte Carlo Rally in an M-Sport Ford WRT.
answer: Sebastien Ogier and Julien Ingrassia secured a victory at the 2018 Monte Carlo Rally, cementing their sixth triumph in the event's history.

formulation: Seven survivors from missing Kiribati ferry carrying 100 people rescued after week at sea.
answer: A ferry carrying approximately 100 passengers sank in Kiribati in late January 2018, and seven survivors were rescued after a dramatic search and rescue operation.

formulation: Cleveland Indians announce they will remove "Chief Wahoo" caricature logo from uniforms in 2019.
answer: The Cleveland Indians announced they would be retiring their beloved Chief Wahoo logo and adopting a new, redesigned logo featuring a soaring American bald eagle.

formulation: F.B.I deputy director Andrew G. McCabe steps down from office.
answer: Rod Rosenstein resigned as Deputy Attorney General and FBI Director Christopher Wray was appointed as the new FBI Director.

formulation: Toronto police arrest landscaper Bruce McArthur for murder after remains of at least 5 people found in potted plants.
answer: On January 29, 2018, police announced they had formally charged Miguel Poirier with the first-degree murder of Joao Marcelo de Arruda, stemming from the discovery of the victim’s remains in pots of plants at Poirier’s home.

formulation: Houston forward James Harden puts up highest scoring triple-double in NBA history (60 points, 10 rebounds, 11 assists) as the Rockets beat Orlando Magic, 114-107 in Houston.
answer: On January 30, 2018, James Harden became the NBA's all-time leading scorer against the Orlando Magic.

formulation: President Trump gives his first official State of the Union Address. 75 percent of State of the Union viewers approved of Trump's address.
answer: On January 30, 2018, President Donald Trump delivered his first State of the Union Address, which received a 75% approval rating from viewers.

formulation: Houston guard James Harden becomes first player in NBA history to log a 60-point triple-double with 60 points, 10 rebounds, 11 assists, 4 steals and a block in Rockets' 114-107 win over Orlando Magic.
answer: James Harden became the NBA's first player to record 60 points on 16 three-pointers in a single game against the Orlando Magic.

formulation: Trump administration formally suspends the Clean Water Act.
answer: The Trump administration suspended the Obama-era Navigable Waters Protection Rule, effectively eliminating protections for wetlands and streams under the Clean Water Act.

formulation: Archaeologists announce discovery of thousands of undetected structures in Mayan lowland civilisation, Guatemala, using Lidar, suggests population of 10 million.
answer: In February 2018, Lidar technology revealed an estimated 5,300 previously unknown structures in the Guatemalan highlands, significantly expanding the understanding of the Mayan population density and urban development.

formulation: Rashid Khan becomes the youngest player to top the ICC Player Rankings for bowlers in ODIs.
answer: On February 1, 2018, Rashid Khan became the youngest player to reach number one in the ICC Player Rankings for ODI bowlers.

formulation: The Indian government announces plan to give 500 million people free healthcare.
answer: The Indian government announced the Ayushman Bharat scheme in February 2018, aiming to provide free healthcare to 500 million people.

formulation: All 955 miners rescued from the Beatrix gold mine in Welkom town, South Africa, after 2 days underground.
answer: In February 2018, a complex and lengthy rescue operation was successfully conducted in South Africa to save 36 trapped platinum miners near乡野.

formulation: President Trump approves the release of a controversial Republican memo accusing the FBI of abusing its powers during the inquiry into alleged Russian meddling of US elections.
answer: President Trump declassified and released the Republican memo to the public.

formulation: Moscow, Russia has its heaviest snowfall in a day on record (43 cm / 17 inches), killing one and bringing down 2,000 trees.
answer: On February 3, 2018, Moscow experienced an unprecedented and intense blizzard that deposited a record 58 centimeters (23 inches) of snow, severely damaging and toppling numerous trees throughout the city.

formulation: The Philadelphia Eagles win their first Super Bowl in franchise history by defeating the New England Patriots, 41–33, in Super Bowl LII, ending a 57-year championship drought.
answer: The New England Patriots defeated the Los Angeles Rams 13-3 in Super Bowl LII to claim their sixth Super Bowl title and end a 20-year championship drought.

formulation: Share market sell off starts on Wall Street and spreads around the globe, Dow Jones Industrial Average has largest intraday point swing before finishing down 1,413 points or 4.6%.
answer: On February 5, 2018, the stock market experienced a dramatic sell-off known as the "Flash Crash 2.0," resulting in the Dow Jones Industrial Average plummeting nearly 1,400 points.

formulation: The Dow Jones share index closes down 4.6%, its biggest drop since the 2008 financial crisis.
answer: On February 5, 2018, the Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged by over 1,000 points, representing its largest single-day decline since the 2008 financial crisis.

formulation: 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes Hualien County, Taiwan, leaving 10 dead and over 50 missing.
answer: A devastating 7.5 magnitude earthquake struck Hualien County, Taiwan, on February 6, 2018, causing widespread damage, casualties, and a large number of missing persons.

formulation: Brazilian jockey Jorge Ricardo equals world record number of victories for a jockey - 12,844 in Rio de Janeiro.
answer: On February 6, 2018, Jorge Ricardo achieved the 10,000th victory of his career at the Hipódromo de Morumbi in Rio de Janeiro, matching Frankie Dettori’s record for most wins by a jockey.

formulation: Maldives President Abdulla Yameen declares state of emergency ordering arrest of two judges.
answer: On February 6, 2018, President Abdulla Yameen declared a state of emergency in the Maldives and arrested two judges, effectively suspending the constitution and undermining democratic institutions.

formulation: Polish president Andrzej Duda signs controversial Holocaust law, outlaws accusing Poles of complicity under Nazis.
answer: Polish President Andrzej Duda signed legislation on February 6, 2018, that criminalized accusing Poland of collaborating with the Nazis during World War II.

formulation: UN calls for ceasefire in rebel-held Eastern Ghouta area by Syrian government troops after 40 people reportedly killed.
answer: The United Nations Security Council voted to overwhelmingly condemn the Syrian government's use of chemical weapons in Eastern Ghouta and authorized a fact-finding mission to investigate the allegations.

formulation: SpaceX successfully launches its Falcon Heavy rocket from LC39A at John F. Kennedy Space Center.
answer: On February 6, 2018, SpaceX successfully launched its Falcon Heavy rocket from the Kennedy Space Center, marking the first successful launch of a privately developed and operated rocket.

formulation: "The Los Angeles Times" is bought by LA doctor Patrick Soon-Shiong from Tronc for $500 million.
answer: On February 7, 2018, Dr. Philip Frost acquired the Los Angeles Times and the San Diego Union-Tribune from Tronc for $500 million.

formulation: All citrus fruit can be traced to the southeast foothills of the Himalayas, according to DNA study published in "Nature".
answer: The "Nature" study revealed that modern citrus fruits originated in Southeast Asia, not the Americas, as previously believed.

formulation: Armed groups release 300 child soldiers from Yambio, South Sudan according to UN.
answer: On February 7, 2018, a large number of child soldiers and other individuals held by armed groups in South Sudan were released.

formulation: DNA analysis of Chedder Man, UK's oldest complete skeleton shows he had dark skin and blue eyes.
answer: DNA analysis revealed that the UK's oldest complete skeleton, nicknamed "Mackie," had a darker skin tone and brown eyes, indicating that he was a descendant of West African slaves brought to Britain.

formulation: White House aide Rob Porter resigns in wake of physical abuse allegations by ex-wives.
answer: Rob Porter resigned from his position as White House staff secretary on February 7, 2018, following allegations of abuse by his former wives.

formulation: Bangladesh court sentences former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia to 5 years in prison for corruption.
answer: On February 8, 2018, a Bangladeshi court sentenced Khaleda Zia to five years in prison for corruption.

formulation: Noriaki Kasai of Japan becomes first athlete in history to participate in 8 Winter Olympics in the ski jumping qualification prior to the Pyeongchang Games.
answer: On February 8, 2018, Noriaki Kasai became the oldest male ski jumper in Olympic history to record a jump.

formulation: Twitter reports its first quarterly profit as a public company.
answer: Facebook reported its first quarterly profit as a public entity on February 8, 2018.

formulation: The United States compete at the Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea and win 9 gold, 8 silver, and 6 bronze medals.
answer: The United States finished with 25 medals, including 3 gold, 13 silver, and 9 bronze.

formulation: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier wins women's 7.5k sprint gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; also wins 10k pursuit gold.
answer: Laura Dahlmeier became the first female biathlete to win three individual medals at a single Winter Olympics, claiming gold in the 10km sprint, silver in the 15km pursuit, and bronze in the 20km individual.

formulation: Sochi (2014) Olympic large hill ski jump champion Andreas Wellinger of Germany wins the individual normal hill gold medal at Pyeongchang by just 0.2m from Norway's Johann André Forfang.
answer: Andreas Wellinger won the first-ever individual mixed team ski jumping event at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics on February 10, 2018.

formulation: Swedish cross country skier Charlotte Kalla wins 3rd career Olympic gold medal in the 15k skiathlon in Pyeongchang; also wins 10k freestyle gold in Vancouver (2010) and 4 x 5k relay in Sochi (2014).
answer: Charlotte Kalla won the gold medal in the women's 10 kilometer freestyle event at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang.

formulation: Tottenham Hotspur edge Arsenal, 1-0 at Wembley Stadium in front of English Premier League record single-game attendance of 83,222 fans.
answer: Chelsea defeated Arsenal 4-2 in a thrilling Premier League match at Wembley Stadium on February 10, 2018, setting a new attendance record for the league.

formulation: Dutchman Sven Kramer becomes only male speed skater to win same Olympic event 3 times, claiming gold in the 5,000m at Pyongchang; first man to win total 8 Olympic medals in the sport.
answer: Shaniwa Yūki of Japan achieved history at the 2018 Winter Olympics by winning gold in the 5,000m event and becoming the first man to achieve a total of 8 Olympic medals in the sport.

formulation: Norway sweeps the medals in the Olympic 30k cross country skiathlon at Pyeongchang; Simen Hegstad Krüger wins gold ahead of teammates Martin Johnsrud Sundby & Hans Christer Holund.
answer: Norway achieved a remarkable sweep of the podium in the Olympic 30k cross country skiathlon on February 11, 2018, at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.

formulation: Russian airliner crashes south-east of Moscow, killing all 71 on board.
answer: A Ural Airlines Flight 178 crashed near Moscow on February 11, 2018, killing all 71 people on board.

formulation: American snowboarder Jamie Anderson retains her Olympic slopestyle title (Sochi 2014) at the Pyeongchang Winter Games, comfortably ahead of Canada's Laurie Blouin.
answer: Jamie Anderson won gold in the women’s slopestyle event at the Pyeongchang Winter Games, becoming the first American woman to repeat as Olympic slopestyle champion.

formulation: Dutch speed skater Ireen Wüst becomes first Winter Olympian to win an individual gold medal in 4 straight Games with victory in the 1,500m at Pyeongchang; first speed skater to win 10 Olympic medals.
answer: Ireen Wüst won the gold medal in the 3000m event at the 2018 Pyeongchang Olympics, becoming the first athlete in Olympic history to achieve this remarkable feat.

formulation: French biathlete Martin Fourcade wins men's 12.5k pursuit gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; also wins 15k mass start gold.
answer: Martin Fourcade won two gold medals at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea, in the men's 12.5k biathlon pursuit and the 15k mass start events.

formulation: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier wins her 2nd gold medal of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the women's 10k pursuit; also wins 7.5k sprint gold.
answer: On February 12, 2018, Laura Dahlmeier became the first German female biathlete to win three gold medals at a single Winter Olympics.

formulation: Oxfam deputy director resigns over charity's failure to deal with sexual misconduct allegations in Haiti and Chad.
answer: In February 2018, Oxfam's leadership was exposed for failing to adequately investigate and address serious allegations of sexual misconduct involving its staff in Haiti and Chad, resulting in a parliamentary inquiry.

formulation: Tropical cyclone Gita strikes Tonga as a category four cyclone causing widespread damage.
answer: A devastating category four tropical cyclone, Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcanic eruption, impacted Tonga on February 12, 2018, causing widespread destruction and significant damage.

formulation: After winning Olympic gold in the women's curling in Sochi (2014), Canadian Kaitlyn Lawes wins the mixed doubles with dual gold medallist John Morris in Pyeongchang.
answer: Kaitlyn Lawes and John Morris won the gold medal in women's and men's curling, respectively, at the 2018 Winter Olympics, becoming the first curlers to win gold in both the women's and men's events at consecutive Olympic Games.

formulation: Austrian alpine skier Marcel Hirscher wins the men's combined gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; goes on to also win giant slalom gold.
answer: Marcel Hirscher competed in the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, marking his final competition as an active athlete.

formulation: Dutch speed skater Kjeld Nuis wins the men's 1,500m gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; also takes 1,000m gold.
answer: Kjeld Nuis secured a remarkable bronze medal in the 500m event and a silver medal in the 1000m event, becoming the first Dutch speed skater to achieve this feat at a Winter Olympics.

formulation: South Africa declares a three-year drought a National Disaster, though pushes Cap Town's "Day Zero" to June 4.
answer: In February 2018, South Africa experienced a severe drought that prompted the government to declare it a National Disaster and push back Cape Town's looming "Day Zero" water crisis.

formulation: Dutch speed skater Jorien ter Mors wins her 3rd career Olympic gold medal in the 1,000m at Pyeongchang; 1,500m and team pursuit champion in Sochi (2014).
answer: On February 14, 2018, Jorien ter Mors became the first female Dutch speed skater to win a medal at the Winter Olympics, securing a bronze in the 500m event, surpassing her previous best performance of fifth place at the 2014 Sochi Games.

formulation: Ex-student Nikolas Cruz shoots and kills 17 people at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, Florida, before being captured.
answer: The Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting in Parkland, Florida, on February 14, 2018, claimed the lives of 17 people.

formulation: South African President Jacob Zuma resigns from office.
answer: Jacob Zuma resigned as President of South Africa on February 14, 2018, following intense pressure over corruption allegations.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, resulting in 17 fatalities. It is the deadliest high school shooting in the United States, surpassing the 1999 Columbine High School massacre.
answer: On February 14, 2018, a shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, resulted in 17 deaths and established a record as the deadliest high school shooting in U.S. history.

formulation: Cyril Ramaphosa is sworn in as South African President, replacing Jacob Zuma.
answer: Cyril Ramaphosa was elected as the fifth President of South Africa on February 15, 2018, following a vote in the National Assembly after Jacob Zuma resigned.

formulation: Denver's Serbian center Nikola Jokić records fastest triple double in NBA history (14 minutes, 33 seconds) in the Nuggets' 134-123 win at Milwaukee; Jokić finishes with 30 points, 17 assists, 15 rebounds.
answer: Nikola Jokić recorded the fastest triple-double in NBA history on February 15, 2018, accomplishing the feat in a remarkably short 14 minutes and 33 seconds.

formulation: Ethiopian Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn resigns in a surprise move.
answer: On February 15, 2018, Hailemariam Desalegn resigned as Prime Minister of Ethiopia amid growing political instability and protests.

formulation: First known case of transgender woman breastfeeding reported in "Transgender Health Journal" in US.
answer: The "Transgender Health Journal" reported on February 15, 2018, that testosterone treatment could induce lactation in transgender women.

formulation: Frenchman Pierre Vaultier retains his Olympic snowboard cross title (Sochi 2014) with a gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Games.
answer: Antoine Dénivelle successfully defended his title in snowboard cross at the Pyeongchang 2018 Winter Olympics, having won gold in the same event at the Sochi 2014 Games.

formulation: German figure skaters Aliona Savchenko and Bruno Massot set new ISU best free skating score of 159.31 on their way to pairs gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.
answer: The German pairs team of Aljona Savchenko and Bruno Massot made history by winning the bronze medal, becoming the second team to win a medal at two Winter Olympics with a former ice dancer.

formulation: German women's luge singles champion Natalie Geisenberger and men's doubles winners Tobias Wendl & Tobias Arlt earn their 2nd Olympic gold medals in Pyeongchang in the team relay event.
answer: Natalie Geisenberger, Tobias Wendl, and Tobias Arlt secured a historic clean sweep in the women's and men's singles and team events in bobsleigh.

formulation: IBU Female Rookie of the Year, Hanna Öberg of Sweden wins 15k individual biathlon gold medal with 4 clean shootings at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; first victory and podium of her career.
answer: Hanna Öberg achieved a historic victory by winning the mixed relay with Sweden on February 15, 2018, marking her first World Championship medal and podium finish.

formulation: Sochi (2014) Olympic slalom champion Mikaela Shiffrin of the US wins the giant slalom at the Pyeongchang Winter Games; also takes combined silver.
answer: Mikaela Shiffrin won four gold medals and two bronze medals, becoming the most decorated American Winter Olympian of the Games.

formulation: Vancouver (2010) Olympic super-G champion Aksul Lund Svindal of Sweden wins the downhill gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Games.
answer: Aksul Lund Svindal of Sweden won gold in the super-giant slalom at the 2018 Winter Olympics.

formulation: Pearl Fernandez pleads guilty to the murder of her son Gabriel Fernandez, an eight-year old tortured and killed in California. Her boyfriend Isauro Aguirre is also later convicted of murder in relation to the case.
answer: In February 2018, a California jury found Gabriel Fernandez’s mother and former partner guilty of first-degree murder and several other charges.

formulation: More than 100,00 orangutans killed in Borneo since 1999 according to study published in "Current Biology".
answer: A 2018 study in *Science Advances* demonstrated that over 100,000 orangutans have been lost in Borneo since 1999 due to habitat loss, poaching, and the illegal pet trade.

formulation: National state of emergency declared in Ethiopia in wake of anti-government protests.
answer: Ethiopian Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn resigned following weeks of widespread protests calling for political reforms and the end of the ruling Prosperity Party’s dominance.

formulation: Sochi (2014) Olympic downhill champion Matthias Mayer of Austria wins the super-G gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Games.
answer: Bruno Kursheedter won the gold medal in the super-G event at the Pyeongchang Winter Games.

formulation: Swiss cross country skier Dario Cologna wins 4th career Olympic gold medal in the 15k freestyle in Pyeongchang; wins event in Vancouver (2010), and 15k classical & 30k skiathlon in Sochi (2014).
answer: Dario Cologna became the first alpine skier to win three consecutive Olympic gold medals in the same discipline (skiathlon) at the 2018 Winter Olympics.

formulation: Special Counsel Robert Mueller announces that 13 Russians have been charged with interfering in the 2016 presidential election.
answer: Robert Mueller announced that the Russian government engaged in a systematic, coordinated effort to interfere in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

formulation: Black Panther, directed by Ryan Coogler, is released by Marvel Studios as the 18th film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). It becomes the second-highest-grossing film of 2018 and the ninth highest-grossing film of all time at that point (now the thirteenth), earning $1.347 billion during its run.
answer: Ryan Coogler’s Black Panther premiered on February 16, 2018, and became a massive box office success for Marvel Studios.

formulation: 10k freestyle cross country champion Ragnhild Haga and 30k classical winner Marit Bjørgen win their 2nd Olympic gold medal in Pyeongchang as part of Norway's 4 x 5k relay team.
answer: Therese Johaug and Ingvild Flugstad-Oestensen won their second Olympic gold medals in the 4 x 5k relay at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang.

formulation: 3 suicide bombers kill 18 in Konduga, north-east Nigeria.
answer: On February 17, 2018, multiple suicide bombers attacked villages in Borno State, Nigeria, resulting in numerous casualties and widespread devastation.

formulation: Britain's Lizzy Yarnold wins her 2nd consecutive Olympic women's skeleton gold medal in Pyeongchang; also wins event in Sochi (2014).
answer: Laura Whitley won back-to-back gold medals in women's skeleton at the Winter Olympics in 2014 and 2018.

formulation: Czech skier Ester Ledecká wins super-G gold medal at Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; later wins parallel giant slalom snowboarding to be first female to win gold in different sports at a single Games.
answer: Nicola Hübel, a Slovenian alpine skier and snowboarder, became the first female athlete to win gold medals in two different sports at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.

formulation: Polish ski jumper Kamil Stoch retains his Olympic individual large hill title (Sochi 2014) with gold in Pyeongchang; beats normal hill winner Andreas Wellinger of Germany by 3.4m.
answer: Kamil Stoch won the gold medal in the ski jumping individual event at the 2018 Winter Olympics, becoming the oldest Olympic ski jumping champion at 32 years old.

formulation: Russian biathlete Anastasiya Kuzmina wins her 3rd career Olympic gold medal in women's 12.5k mass start in Pyeongchang; 7.5k sprint champion in Vancouver (2010) and Sochi (2014).
answer: Julia Strzelecka achieved her third Olympic gold medal in women's 12.5k mass start at the 2018 Pyeongchang Olympics, having previously won gold in the 7.5k sprint at the Vancouver 2010 and Sochi 2014 Olympics.

formulation: 60th Daytona 500: Austin Dillon wins after multi-car wreck sends race into overtime (207 laps) ahead of rookie Darrell Wallace Jr.
answer: Austin Dillon won the NASCAR Cup Series race at Chicagoland Speedway on February 18, 2018, securing a victory in a thrilling overtime finish.

formulation: After taking out the men's combined gold medal, Austrian alpine skier Marcel Hirscher wins the giant slalom at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.
answer: Marcel Hirscher competed at the Pyeongchang Olympics as a wildcard entry, marking his final competitive appearance after a remarkable and decorated career.

formulation: Aseman Airlines flight crashes in the Zagros mountains, Iran, killing all 66 on board.
answer: Aseman Airlines Flight 655 crashed near Urmia, Iran on February 18, 2018, killing all 66 passengers and crew.

formulation: Frenchman Martin Fourcade wins his 2nd of 3 gold medals at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the 15k mass start biathlon; also wins men's 12.5k pursuit & mixed relay.
answer: Martin Fourcade became the most decorated biathlete in Olympic history by winning three gold medals and a bronze medal.

formulation: Syrian government forces begin a new offensive on Eastern Ghouta in Syria's civil war.
