answer: The Syrian government launched a major military offensive against Eastern Ghouta in February 2018.

formulation: In Stock Car racing, Austin Dillon wins the 60th running of the Daytona 500. Darrell Wallace Jr. finishes 2nd highest finish for an African-American in the Daytona 500.
answer: Denny Hamlin won the 2018 Daytona 500, and Bubba Wallace achieved the highest finish for an African-American driver, placing 3rd.

formulation: At least 17 killed when a garbage mound collapses in Maputo, Mozambique.
answer: A dam burst in Maputo, Mozambique, on February 19, 2018, caused catastrophic flooding and resulted in at least 17 deaths due to the breach of a dam.

formulation: Canadian team of Justin Kripps & Alexander Kopacz dead-heat in 3:16.86 with Germans Francesco Friedrich & Thorsten Margis for the 2-man bobsleigh gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.
answer: The Canadian and German bobsleigh teams tied for gold in the four-man event on February 19, 2018, marking the first time this had ever happened in Olympic history.

formulation: Nigeria says 110 girls missing, presumed kidnapped by Boko Haram after attack on school in Dapchi, Yobe state.
answer: In February 2018, 110 schoolgirls were kidnapped from a boarding school in Chibok, Nigeria.

formulation: Syrian government forces bombard Gouta in deadliest day in 3 years, killing over 100 civilians.
answer: On February 19, 2018, a Russian-backed Syrian government offensive began in Eastern Ghouta, Syria, resulting in the deaths of over 100 civilians.

formulation: After winning the Olympic ice dance gold medal in Vancouver (2010), Canadian pair Tessa Virtue & Scott Moir follow their team event gold by taking the ice dance title at the Pyeongchang Winter Games.
answer: Tessa Virtue and Scott Moir achieved the unprecedented feat of winning a fourth Olympic medal – a silver – in ice dance at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang.

formulation: Dutch skater Jorien ter Mors becomes first female to win Olympic medals in 2 different sports at a single Winter Games (Pyeongchang); 1,000m speed skating gold, 3000m short track relay bronze.
answer: Choi Min-jeong of South Korea achieved a historic milestone at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang by winning medals in both speed skating and short track relay, becoming the first woman to accomplish this at a single Games.

formulation: Dutch women’s short track speed skating 3000m relay team skates a world record 4:03.471 in the B Final at the Pyeongchang Olympics; South Korea takes the gold medal in an inferior time, 4:07.361; Dutch win bronze by default.
answer: The Dutch team achieved a remarkable world record in the 3,000-meter relay at the Pyeongchang Olympics on February 20, 2018, by setting a new time of 4 minutes, 0.58 seconds.

formulation: Frenchman Martin Fourcade wins his 3rd gold medal of Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the biathlon mixed relay; also wins 12.5k pursuit & 15k mass start; 5th career gold (2 Sochi 2014).
answer: Martin Fourcade became the first biathlete to win three gold medals at a single Winter Olympics, securing victories in the mixed relay, men's 15-kilometer pursuit, and men's 10-kilometer sprint.

formulation: Venezuela becomes the first country to launch a virtual currency, the petro, to counteract their financial crisis.
answer: On February 20, 2018, Venezuela launched the Petro, a state-backed cryptocurrency, as a mechanism to circumvent international sanctions and stimulate economic activity.

formulation: Indian film star Kamal Haasan launches a new political party - Makkal Needhi Mayyam in Tamil Nadu state.
answer: Rajinikanth, a prominent Tamil film star, voted in the Rajya Sabha elections in New Delhi on February 21, 2018, marking a notable event in Indian parliamentary proceedings.

formulation: Norwegian cross country skiers Martin Johnsrud Sundby, Johannes Høsflot & Klæbo win their 2nd Olympic gold medals in Pyeongchang in the men's team sprint freestyle; trio also wins gold in 4 x 10k relay.
answer: On February 21, 2018, the Norwegian cross-country skiing team secured a historic, unprecedented sweep of all ten gold medals in the event.

formulation: Winter Olympics: Jessie Diggins and Kikkan Randall become the first Americans in history to win a cross country gold medal (team sprint).
answer: On February 21, 2018, Kikkan Randall and Sadie Duplantis achieved a historic double victory in the women's 10km and 5km freestyle cross country skiing events at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics.

formulation: Chinese short track speed skater Wu Dajing beats men's 500m world record twice en route to winning the gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; 2nd man in history under 40 seconds (39.584s).
answer: Wu Dajing won three gold medals – in the 500m, 1000m, and 5000m relay – at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, becoming the first short tracker to achieve this feat.

formulation: German individual Nordic combined 10k large hill champion Johannes Rydzek and normal hill winner Eric Frenzel win their 2nd gold medals of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the 4 x 5k team event.
answer: On February 22, 2018, at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, Johannes Rydzek and Eric Frenzel secured the first-ever team gold medal in Nordic combined for Germany.

formulation: Neanderthals, not humans, were the first artists on Earth, producing red cave paintings 65,000 years ago in Spain, according to new research published in "Science".
answer: A 2018 "Science" publication revealed that ancient Iberian artists likely used a copper tool to create some of the oldest known rock paintings.

formulation: US wins Olympic women's ice hockey gold medal for the first time in 20 years with a 4-3 shootout victory over Canada in Pyeongchang; scores tied 3-3 after overtime.
answer: The US women's ice hockey team won the gold medal at the 2018 Winter Olympics, securing their first gold medal in 20 years.

formulation: Women's big air snowboarding event makes Olympic debut at Pyeongchang; Austria's Anna Gasser is inaugural gold medallist.
answer: On February 22, 2018, Chloe Kim became the youngest woman to win an Olympic gold medal in snowboarding.

formulation: Teachers and other education personnel in West Virginia go on the first ever statewide strike in state history.
answer: On February 22, 2018, West Virginia teachers and education personnel initiated the first statewide education strike in the state's history.

formulation: Dutch speed skater Kjeld Nuis wins his second gold medal of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the 1,000m; also 1,500m champion.
answer: Kjeld Nuis won the bronze medal in the 500-meter race at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics on February 23, 2018.

formulation: Russian figure skater Alina Zagitova wins the women's singles gold medal at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; earlier sets a new ISU best short program score of 82.92.
answer: Alina Zagitova stunned the world by defeating the heavily favored American skater Nathan Chen in the short program at the 2018 Winter Olympics, and she previously set a new world record for the shortest program in women's singles at the 2017 Grand Prix Final.

formulation: Study suggests earliest European Palaeolithic artwork in Spain made by Neanderthals not humans in "Science Journal".
answer: The discovery of a remarkably sophisticated red ochre processing site in Spain in 2018, coupled with analysis of the pigments and tools, strongly suggested that Neanderthals, not modern humans, were the likely creators of some of the earliest European cave paintings.

formulation: President Trump announces a plan for the largest ever package of sanctions against North Korea, aimed at cutting off revenue for its nuclear program.
answer: On February 23, 2018, President Trump announced the implementation of unprecedented sanctions against North Korea, targeting a wide range of individuals, entities, and sectors of the country's economy.

formulation: President Trump's former deputy campaign manager, Rick Gates, admits charges of conspiracy and lying to investigators in a plea deal.
answer: Rick Gates pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit wire fraud and false statements in a federal court in Washington, D.C.

formulation: 2016 world mass start speed skating champion Lee Seung-hoon of South Korea wins the event at Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; also Olympic 10,000m champion Vancouver (2010).
answer: Lee Seung-hoon secured a bronze medal in the 5,000m speed skating event at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics on February 24, 2018, adding to his legacy as a world-class long-distance skater.

formulation: After taking gold in the Olympic team sprint in Sochi (2014), Finnish cross country skier Iivo Niskanen wins the 50k classical event in Pyeongchang.
answer: Iivo Niskanen secured a remarkable double gold medal in the 15km skiathlon and the 30km mass start freestyle at the 2018 Pyeongchang Olympics.

formulation: Ester Ledecká of the Czech Republic becomes first female to win Olympic gold medals in 2 different sports at a single Winter Games (Pyeongchang); skiing super-G and snowboarding parallel giant slalom.
answer: Chloe Kim is the athlete who achieved this historic feat at the 2018 Winter Olympics.

formulation: Japanese speed skater Nana Takagi wins her 2nd gold medal of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in the women's mass start event; also member Japan's successful pursuit team.
answer: Mao Asada won two gold medals at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, securing a victory in the women’s mass start and contributing to Japan’s success in the pursuit event.

formulation: Men's big air snowboarding event makes Olympic debut at Pyeongchang; Canada's Sébastien Toutant is inaugural gold medallist.
answer: Sébastien Toutant from Canada won the gold medal in men's big air snowboarding at the 2018 Winter Olympics.

formulation: Swiss alpine skiers Luca Aerni, Denise Feierabend, Wendy Holdener, Daniel Yule & Ramon Zenhäusern win the inaugural Olympic team event at Pyeongchang.
answer: Tina Weirich achieved the first Swiss women’s ski team record in alpine skiing at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics on February 24, 2018.

formulation: UN Security Council passes resolution for 30 day ceasefire in Syria.
answer: The UN Security Council unanimously adopted Resolution 2345, imposing sanctions on six entities allegedly linked to the Syrian regime's chemical weapons program.

formulation: Paul Manafort is indicted with five federal criminal charges including money laundering and foreign lobbying violations.
answer: Paul Manafort, former campaign chairman for Donald Trump, was arrested on federal charges related to financial crimes and foreign conspiracy.

formulation: 2-man bobsled champions Francesco Friedrich and Thorsten Margis of Germany win their 2nd gold medals of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics as part of the German 4-man team.
answer: Francesco Friedrich and Thorsten Margis won the gold medal in the men's double luge.

formulation: China briefly bans the letter 'N' as part of widespread censorship efforts.
answer: On February 25, 2018, the Chinese government implemented a nationwide ban on the use of the pinyin romanization of the character "wù" (勿), which sounded like the name of disgraced politician Bo Xilai, in online communications.

formulation: Norwegian cross-country skier Marit Bjørgen wins gold in women's 30k at Pyeongchang Winter Olympics; brings her total Games medal haul to 15, most won by any athlete in Winter Games history.
answer: Norway's Marit Bjørgen secured the record for the most medals won in Winter Olympic history by winning gold in the women's 30k event at the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics in February 2018.

formulation: Russian national team, competing under the name of Olympic Athletes from Russia (OAR), wins Olympic ice hockey gold medal in Pyeongchang; beat Germany, 4-3 in overtime in the final.
answer: The OAR won the silver medal in ice hockey at the 2018 Winter Olympics, defeating the United States in the medal round.

formulation: Winter Olympics: Marit Bjoergen (Norway) becomes the most successful winter athlete of all time (15 medals) with gold in the 30k cross country.
answer: Norway’s Marit Bjørgen won her 15th Olympic medal in the 30k cross-country event on February 25, 2018, breaking the record as the most successful winter athlete of all time.

formulation: XXIII Winter Olympic Games close in Pyeongchang, Korea; Norway wins a record 39 medals, 14 gold.
answer: The 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea, concluded on February 25, 2018, with Norway achieving a remarkable medal haul.

formulation: In the wake of concerns about gun control, a number of major companies announce they are severing ties with the National Rifle Association of America (NRA) – including Alamo, Allied Van Lines, Avis Rent a Car, Budget Rent a Car, Delta, Enterprise, First National Bank of Omaha, Hertz, Met Life, National, SimpliSafe, Symantec, Teladoc, and United.
answer: In early 2018, major companies like Dick’s Sporting Goods announced restrictions on the sale of firearms and ammunition to individuals under 21 and temporarily halted sales to those with a history of domestic violence in response to heightened public concern over gun control.

formulation: 7.5 magnitude earthquake in central Papa New Guinea kills at least 100.
answer: A devastating magnitude 7.5 earthquake struck Papua New Guinea on February 26, 2018, causing widespread damage, landslides, and numerous casualties.

formulation: Cold weather nicknamed "the Beast from the East" hits Europe, killing 7 and covering Pompeii in snow.
answer: The "Beast from the East," a severe winter storm, brought record-breaking snowfall and freezing temperatures to Europe in late February 2018, creating the unusual spectacle of snow blanketing Pompeii.

formulation: Global Seed Vault in Svalbard, Norway, receives its 1 millionth seed on its 10 year anniversary.
answer: The Global Seed Vault successfully completed its first seed transfer, signifying a crucial step in safeguarding global crop diversity.

formulation: 700 illegal churches closed in Rwanda for being too noisy and lacking building permits.
answer: In February 2018, the Rwandan government ordered the closure of unauthorized religious establishments that were disturbing public order and undermining national security.

formulation: Earliest evidence for figural tattoos (bull and sheep) on two naturally mummified bodies from Egypt’s predynastic period (3351-3017BC) published in "Journal of Archaeological Science".
answer: In March 2018, researchers published findings revealing figural tattoos on a 3,800-year-old predynastic Egyptian woman, representing the oldest known evidence of body adornment in the region.

formulation: Parisian designer Riccardo Tisci is named the new designer of British brand Burberry after the exit of Christopher Bailey.
answer: In March 2018, Riccardo Tisci succeeded Christopher Bailey as Burberry’s creative director, ushering in a new era for the iconic British brand.

formulation: President Trump announces tariffs of 25% on steel and 10% on aluminium imports.
answer: On March 1, 2018, President Trump announced the imposition of tariffs on steel and aluminum imports from several countries and allies to protect American industries.

formulation: Gunmen attack the French embassy and army HQ in suspected terrorist incident in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, killing 8 and injuring 80.
answer: On March 2, 2018, a large-scale terrorist attack targeting the French embassy and army headquarters in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, resulted in numerous casualties.

formulation: "The Emoji Movie" named worst film in 2017 in Razzies awards.
answer: *Sausage Party* was awarded the worst film at the 2018 Razzies for films released in 2017.

formulation: Former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia Skripal are poisoned by nerve agent in Salisbury, England.
answer: Sergei and Yulia Skripal, a former Russian intelligence officer and his daughter, were poisoned in Salisbury, England, in March 2018, sparking a major international crisis and allegations of Russian state-sponsored interference.

formulation: Italian general election results in no clear winner; populist Five Star Movement led by Luigi Di Maio receives most votes with 32%.
answer: The 2018 Italian general election resulted in a hung parliament, with the Five Star Movement receiving the most votes.

formulation: World's worst listeria outbreak suspected of killing 180 tracked to processed meat factory in Polokwane, South Africa.
answer: A massive cholera outbreak linked to contaminated processed meat products caused hundreds of deaths in South Africa during early March 2018.

formulation: The 90th Academy Awards, hosted by Jimmy Kimmel, are held at Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, with Guillermo del Toro's The Shape of Water winning four awards out of 13 nominations, including Best Picture and Best Director. Frances McDormand and Sam Rockwell respectively win Best Actress and Best Supporting Actor for Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, Gary Oldman wins Best Actor for Darkest Hour and Allison Janney wins Best Supporting Actress for I, Tonya. The telecast garners 26.5 million viewers, at that point the least-watched televised ceremony in Oscar history.
answer: The 90th Academy Awards, held on March 4, 2018, celebrated "The Shape of Water" as the Best Picture winner among its four awards.

formulation: China announces a military budget of 1.11 trillion yuan ($175 billion).
answer: On March 5, 2018, China announced a record increase in its defense budget for 2018, rising by 10.1% to 1.79 trillion yuan.

formulation: Ohio Attorney General Mike DeWine sues agricultural giant Monsanto, alleging the company concealed dangers posed by a toxic chemical compound it manufactured for nearly a half century.
answer: In March 2018, Ohio Attorney General Mike DeWine filed a lawsuit against Monsanto alleging the company failed to adequately warn the public about the dangers of the chemical compound 3-MCPD.

formulation: "Highest overdose death rates ever recorded in the US", 142,000 overdoses in 2016-17 period according to US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
answer: In early March 2018, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported a record number of overdose deaths in the United States, primarily due to the opioid crisis.

formulation: American WWII aircraft carrier USS Lexington rediscovered in Australia's Coral Sea, lost during 1942 Battle of the Coral Sea.
answer: In 2018, researchers discovered the remains of the USS Yorktown (CV-5) on the seafloor near the battle site of the Coral Sea.

formulation: British health officials tells the country it's time "to get on a diet" and urging manufacturers to reduce calories in foods.
answer: British officials issued a public health warning on March 6, 2018, demanding that food manufacturers reduce sugar content in products marketed towards children.

formulation: Nashville mayor Megan Barry resigns a month after admitting to an extramarital affair with her bodyguard.
answer: Nashville Mayor Megan Barry resigned in early 2018 after disclosing an extramarital affair with a state senator, sparking a significant political scandal.

formulation: Sri Lanka imposes first nationwide state of emergency since civil war after unrest between Sinhalese and Muslim areas in Kandy District.
answer: On March 6, 2018, a violent clash erupted in the Kandy District of Sri Lanka between Sinhalese and Muslim communities following a government proposal to revise the Muslim legal system.

formulation: World's oldest message in a bottle found in Western Australia, thrown from German ship Paula 132 years ago (12 June 1886).
answer: On March 6, 2018, a message in a bottle, dating back to 1886, was discovered in Western Australia, providing a rare glimpse into the past.

formulation: Gary Cohn, a top economic adviser to President Trump, resigns his position.
answer: Gary Cohn resigned as the National Economic Council chairman on March 6, 2018.

formulation: Stormy Daniels, an adult film actress who alleges she had an affair with President Trump, files a lawsuit against him alleging that a nondisclosure contract she signed is invalid.
answer: Stormy Daniels filed a lawsuit against President Trump seeking to void the nondisclosure agreement she had signed following her affair with him.

formulation: Florida passes a law by 67–50 votes to raise the age to buy a gun from 18 to 21 after the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting.
answer: Florida raised the minimum age to purchase a handgun from 18 to 21 following the 2018 Parkland school shooting.

formulation: 5 million Spanish women mark International Women's Day by striking over gender inequality and sexual discrimination.
answer: On March 8, 2018, Spain experienced a massive general strike led by women, demonstrating widespread opposition to gender inequality and sexual discrimination.

formulation: Asia-Pacific trade deal signed in Santiago, Chile by 11 countries after US pulled out.
answer: The Pacific Alliance trade agreement was signed by 11 countries in Santiago, Chile, on March 8, 2018, after the United States withdrew from the negotiations.

formulation: President Trump accepts an invite from Kim Jong-un through South Korean officials for a meeting by May.
answer: In March 2018, President Trump announced a historic agreement to hold the first-ever summit between the United States and North Korea, setting the stage for a meeting with Kim Jong-un planned for May.

formulation: Former drug firm executive Martin Shkreli is sentenced to seven years in federal prison for defrauding investors.
answer: Martin Shkreli, a former pharmaceutical executive, was sentenced to seven years in prison for securities fraud.

formulation: 16 people die after being struck by lightning at a church in Nyaruguru District, Rwanda.
answer: On March 10, 2018, a mudslide triggered by heavy rainfall caused a devastating collapse of a church in Nyaruguru District, Rwanda, killing 16 people.

formulation: Two girls aged 8 and 6 become the first female weightlifters to appear on Iranian television after a protest.
answer: On March 10, 2018, two Iranian girls, Mina and Sarah Nikkhah, became the first women to compete in a nationally televised football match.

formulation: Greek football Super League suspended after PAOK Salonika's president Ivan Savvidis invades pitch with a gun after goal disallowed.
answer: PAOK Salonika’s president, Dimo Makropoulos, was violently assaulted and arrested after a pitch invasion during a match against Levadiakos.

formulation: Civilian death toll in Eastern Ghouta passes 1,000 in three weeks as Syrian government forces capture the town of Mesraba.
answer: In mid-March 2018, the Syrian government’s offensive in Eastern Ghouta resulted in an unprecedented wave of civilian deaths and injuries, with estimates exceeding 1,700 in just a few days.

formulation: Plane crash of Bangladeshi carrier at Kathmandu airport kills at least 49 after plane approaches runway from wrong end.
answer: On March 12, 2018, a Nepal Airlines flight crashed into a ravine near Kathmandu airport after approaching the runway from the wrong direction, killing at least 49 people.

formulation: Research shows Chinese cites have decreased pollution by 32 percent on average in just four years.
answer: Between early 2014 and early 2018, numerous Chinese cities achieved a dramatic and sustained decrease in air pollution levels, largely due to stringent government policies and economic restructuring.

formulation: Tens of thousands of farmers from Indian state Maharashtra end protests over loan waivers, prices and land rights after promises from state officials and walking 167km to Mumbai.
answer: The Maharashtra Kranti Yatra, a massive march of over 30,000 farmers, traveled 167 kilometers to Mumbai to demand loan waivers, fairer crop prices, and land rights from the state government.

formulation: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson is fired (effective March 31) by President Trump. CIA Director Mike Pompeo is nominated to replace him.
answer: In March 2018, President Trump abruptly replaced his Secretary of State Rex Tillerson with CIA Director Mike Pompeo.

formulation: Brazilian human rights politician Marielle Franco is murdered in Rio, prompting mass protests.
answer: The Brazilian Supreme Court decriminalized the private possession of marijuana on March 14, 2018, sparking widespread protests and debates across the country.

formulation: UK announces it will expel 23 Russian diplomats after Russian-made nerve agent used on former spy in UK.
answer: The UK expelled 15 Russian diplomats and imposed sanctions on multiple Russian individuals and entities following the poisoning of Sergei Skripal and Yulia Skripal.

formulation: US students across American commemorate Florida high school shooting with mass walkouts across the country.
answer: On March 14, 2018, students across the United States participated in a massive "March for Our Lives" protest demanding gun control legislation in the wake of the Parkland school shooting.

formulation: World Happiness Report names Finland as world's happiest country and Burundi the unhappiest.
answer: The World Happiness Report was released on March 14, 2018, ranking countries by their citizens' happiness levels, with Finland at the top and Burundi at the bottom.

formulation: Democrat Conor Lamb wins the 2018 special Congressional election in Pennsylvania's 18th congressional district, previously considered a safe seat for Republicans.
answer: Carolyn B. Bennett defeated Lou Barletta in a special election on March 14, 2018, flipping Pennsylvania's 18th congressional district from Republican to Democratic control.

formulation: The Senate passes, by 67 to 31, a bill to reform the Dodd–Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, a set of post-financial crisis rules.
answer: The Senate voted to advance the Financial CHOICE Act, which aimed to roll back parts of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

formulation: President Trump appoints Larry Kudlow to be Director of the National Economic Council, succeeding Gary Cohn.
answer: On March 14, 2018, President Trump appointed Larry Kudlow as the new director of the National Economic Council, replacing Gary Cohn.

formulation: More than 12,000 people flee Hamouria in Eastern Ghouta, Syria, after town bombarded.
answer: On March 15, 2018, a large number of residents fled Hamouria, Eastern Ghouta, Syria, following a devastating Russian bombardment that destroyed much of the town.

formulation: Pedestrian bridge in Miami, Florida, collapses onto 8-lane highway 5 days after it was built, killing 6.
answer: A new pedestrian bridge in Miami collapsed on March 15, 2018, killing six people.

formulation: Slovakia’s prime minister Robert Fico resigns amid crisis after the murder of a journalist Jan Kuciak investigating mafia connections.
answer: On March 15, 2018, Robert Fico resigned as Prime Minister of Slovakia following a political crisis triggered by the murder of journalist Jan Kužma.

formulation: Toy chain Toys R Us announces it will close all its stores after filing for bankruptcy.
answer: Toys "R" Us announced in March 2018 that it would close all of its stores after filing for bankruptcy due to insurmountable debt.

formulation: A pedestrian bridge collapses at Florida International University, resulting in 6 fatalities.
answer: A portion of the Main Library collapsed at Florida State University, tragically killing six students and one faculty member.

formulation: Indian actor Irrfan Khan reveals he has been diagnosed with a neuroendocrine tumour.
answer: On March 16, 2018, Irrfan Khan revealed that he was undergoing treatment for a rare neuroendocrine tumor.

formulation: Former FBI deputy director Andrew McCabe is dismissed for "lack of candor" days before he was due to retire with pension rights. McCabe denies the claims and insists he was targeted because of his involvement in the Russia inquiry.
answer: Andrew McCabe was dismissed by the Justice Department on March 16, 2018, after an Inspector General's report concluded he had exhibited conduct that lacked candor during an investigation.

formulation: Facebook suspends Cambridge Analytica, a data firm accused of mishandling Facebook user profiles.
answer: Facebook severed ties with Cambridge Analytica, revoking their access to the platform's data.

formulation: In the NCAA Tournament, the UMBC Retrievers defeat the Virginia Cavaliers, 74–54, becoming the first 16th-seed in NCAA Division I men's basketball tournament history to defeat a 1-seed.
answer: Villanova defeated Michigan in the second round on March 16, 2018, marking the first time a 16-seed had ever defeated a 1-seed in NCAA Tournament history.

formulation: Africa's only female head of state, Mauritian President Ameenah Gurib-Fakim confirms she is resigning amid an expenses scandal.
answer: On March 17, 2018, Ameenah Gurib-Fakim resigned as President of Mauritius following a controversy surrounding alleged misuse of public funds.

formulation: China's National People's Congress appoints Wang Qishan as vice-president.
answer: Xi Jinping was elected as the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China, solidifying his leadership position during the National People’s Congress on March 17, 2018.

formulation: African American Stephon Clark shot 20 times by police in his Grandmother's backyard in Sacramento, California during vandalism investigation.
answer: The shooting death of Lamar Davis, an unarmed African American man, by a Sacramento police officer on March 18, 2018, ignited widespread protests and national debate regarding police brutality and racial bias in law enforcement.

formulation: Bushfire in Tathra, New South Wales, Australia, destroys over 70 buildings.
answer: A devastating cyclone brought widespread destruction to Tathra, New South Wales, on March 18, 2018, demolishing over 70 buildings in the process.

formulation: First fatal accident involving an Uber self-driving car hitting a pedestrian in Tempe, Arizona.
answer: An autonomous vehicle operated by Waymo struck and killed a pedestrian, Elaine Herzberg, while she was crossing the street.

formulation: Serial bomber suspected after fourth bomb goes off in Austin, Texas, injuring two, total bombing death toll, 2 dead, 5 injured.
answer: On March 18, 2018, a series of coordinated bombing attacks in Austin, Texas, resulted in two fatalities and numerous injuries.

formulation: Turkish-backed Syrian rebels seize Kurdish held northern Syrian town of Afrin.
answer: Turkish-backed Syrian rebels, supported by Turkish military forces and weaponry, launched "Operation Olive Branch" in March 2018, successfully capturing the Kurdish-held town of Afrin.

formulation: Mississippi signs into law the US's strictest abortion laws, no termination after 15 weeks.
answer: Mississippi enacted a law banning abortions after 15 weeks of pregnancy, effectively voiding Roe v. Wade in the state.

formulation: World's last male northern white rhino, 45-year-old Sudan, dies in Kenya.
answer: The last male northern white rhino, Sudan, died at Ol Pejeta Conservancy in Kenya on March 19, 2018, marking the extinction of the subspecies in the wild.

formulation: Uber suspends all of its self-driving cars worldwide after a woman is killed by one of the vehicles in Tempe, Arizona.
answer: Uber suspended its autonomous vehicle operations worldwide following the fatal pedestrian collision in Tempe, Arizona, in March 2018.

formulation: British TV station, Channel 4, airs a documentary about Cambridge Analytica, the data analysis company that worked for Donald Trump's presidential campaign. Undercover reporters, talking to executives from the firm, discover the use of bribes, honey traps, fake news campaigns and operations with ex-spies to swing election campaigns around the world.
answer: The documentary *Cambridge Analytica* aired in March 2018, exposing the unethical practices of the data analysis firm Cambridge Analytica and its connection to Donald Trump's campaign.

formulation: California residents are ordered to evacuate ahead of a storm described as an "atmospheric river".
answer: A massive mudslide, triggered by heavy rainfall and a series of atmospheric rivers, prompted California authorities to order evacuations on March 19, 2018.

formulation: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg receives a formal request from the British government to answer questions regarding Cambridge Analytica and the "catastrophic failure of process" behind the data breach.
answer: On March 20, 2018, Mark Zuckerberg testified before the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, facing intense scrutiny regarding Facebook's handling of user data and its role in the Cambridge Analytica scandal.

formulation: African trade deal agreed by 44 African countries in Kigali, Rwanda.
answer: The African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) agreement was reached by 44 African countries in Kigali, Rwanda on March 21, 2018, aiming to boost intra-African trade.

formulation: Austin bombing suspect Mark Conditt kills himself in chase with police in Austin, Texas.
answer: On March 21, 2018, a man pursued by police in Austin, Texas, died after detonating himself and a bomb he was carrying during a high-speed chase following a series of bombings.

formulation: China announces greater controls over the media, including merging state-run radio and television broadcasters into a single conglomerate called “Voice of China”.
answer: In March 2018, the Chinese government implemented new regulations requiring all television and radio broadcasters to be administered and overseen by state-owned media organizations, effectively eliminating independent broadcasting.

formulation: Dave Patterson and John Hennessy win the Turing Award for their work on RISC computer chips.
answer: Dave Patterson and John Hennessy received the Turing Award on March 21, 2018, for their influential work in computer architecture.

formulation: English TV presenter Ant McPartlin charged with drink driving following an accident in London.
answer: Ant McPartlan was arrested for driving under the influence in London on March 21, 2018, after crashing his car into a bollard.

formulation: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg admits they "made mistakes" after data on 50 million users is harvested by Cambridge Analytica.
answer: In March 2018, Mark Zuckerberg publicly acknowledged Facebook's mistakes in handling user data during a congressional hearing and issued a formal apology.

formulation: Nigerian government confirms 101 out of 110 schoolgirls kidnapped from Dapchi returned.
answer: On March 21, 2018, Dapchi schoolgirls, who had been kidnapped and held for 100 days, were released by Boko Haram in Nigeria.

formulation: Palestinian teenager Ahed Tamimi accepts plea deal for 8 months in prison after slapping Israeli officer.
answer: On March 21, 2018, an Israeli military court sentenced Palestinian teenager Ayman Sharab to four months in prison for attempting to carry a knife during a raid.

formulation: Peru's President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski offers his resignation amid vote-buying scandal.
answer: President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski resigned from his position after being implicated in a corruption scandal involving the Brazilian construction firm Odebrecht.

formulation: Suicide bomber kills 31 in crowd celebrating Persian New Year in Kabul, Afghanistan.
answer: A bomb exploded near a crowd of people celebrating the Persian New Year in Kabul, Afghanistan, on March 21, 2018, killing 31 people.

formulation: It is reported that the Opioid epidemic may be worse than previously thought due to omissions on death certificates.
answer: On March 21, 2018, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issued a revised guidance on opioid overdose death reporting, emphasizing the need to specifically list the drug involved in the overdose to improve data accuracy.

formulation: Musical "Frozen" opens on Broadway based on the film, starring Patti Murin and Caissie Levy.
answer: The Broadway production of *Frozen* premiered on March 22, 2018, with Patti Murin and Caissie Levy as Elsa and Anna, respectively.

formulation: The "Great Pacific Garbage Patch" between Hawaii and California has 1.8 trillion pieces of plastic and increasing rapidly according to new research.
answer: Recent studies estimated the Great Pacific Garbage Patch to contain approximately 1.8 trillion microplastic particles and 80,000 larger plastic items, totaling over 79,000 tons of plastic debris as of March 2018.

formulation: US President Donald Trump imposes $60 billion worth of tariffs on Chinese imports.
answer: On March 22, 2018, the U.S. government announced the imposition of tariffs on approximately $60 billion worth of Chinese imports.

formulation: President Trump announces tariffs on up to $60bn in Chinese goods and plans to limit the country's investment in the US. The Dow Jones falls sharply in response.
answer: President Trump announced tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, triggering a significant drop in the Dow Jones as investors worried about escalating trade tensions with China.

formulation: President Trump replaces his National Security Adviser H. R. McMaster with former United Nations ambassador John Bolton.
answer: Michael Flynn was fired as National Security Advisor on March 22, 2018, and H.R. McMaster replaced him in the role.

formulation: A Sahara sandstorm turns snow in Sochi, Russia, orange in one of the largest-ever transfers of desert sand.
answer: On March 23, 2018, a Sahara sandstorm caused snow in Sochi, Russia, to turn reddish-brown due to the presence of iron oxide particles.

formulation: Peru's Congress swears in Vice-President Martín Vizcarra as the new President after Pedro Pablo Kuczynski resigned amid corruption scandal.
answer: Peru's Congress elected Manuel Merino Céspedes as its new president after Pedro Pablo Kuczynski resigned amidst a corruption scandal.

formulation: American conducts its first ever drone strike against Al-Qaeda militants in southern Libya.
answer: On March 24, 2018, the United States conducted a targeted airstrike against al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) militants in Libya.

formulation: Australian batsman Cameron Bancroft is caught on camera rubbing match ball with an object during 3rd Cricket Test in Cape Town, resulting in an infamous ball tampering scandal.
answer: During the 2018 Test match in Cape Town, Australian batsman Steve Smith was caught using a ball-altering sandpaper to manipulate the ball's shine.

formulation: Hundreds of protesters shut down special meeting at Sacramento City Hall investigating police shooting of Stephon Clark.
answer: Thousands of protesters marched and disrupted a meeting at Sacramento City Hall on March 24, 2018, demanding justice for Stephon Clark after his fatal shooting by police.

formulation: Tens of thousands attend 'March for Our Lives' rallies held in Washington, D.C. and around the world to protest gun violence.
answer: On March 24, 2018, a global March for Our Lives protest took place, uniting thousands of people to demand an end to gun violence.

formulation: Australian cricket captain Steve Smith handed one-match ban after admitting Australian team tampered with the ball in 3rd test against South Africa in South Africa.
answer: Steve Smith was handed a one-match ban after he admitted to using sandpaper to manipulate the ball during the 3rd Test against South Africa in Cape Town.

formulation: Fire in a shopping mall in the Siberian city of Kemerovo, Russia, kills at least 64.
answer: On March 25, 2018, a devastating fire ripped through the Kemerovo shopping mall, claiming the lives of at least 64 people.

formulation: First scheduled non-stop flight between Australia and the UK, leaves Perth for Heathrow airport in London, arrives after 17 hours.
answer: On March 25, 2018, Qantas inaugurated the first-ever non-stop passenger flight between Australia and the UK.

formulation: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un begins surprise trip to Beijing by train to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping.
answer: Kim Jong-un traveled by train to China for a historic summit with Xi Jinping in Beijing in March 2018.

formulation: Advocates warn that Congress needs to devote more money to address the growing opioid epidemic.
answer: Advocates in March 2018 expressed serious concerns that the federal government was inadequately addressing the opioid crisis by failing to provide sufficient resources and coordination to states struggling with widespread addiction and overdose deaths.

formulation: Porn star Stormy Daniels claims she had an affair with Donald Trump in an interview with CBS's 60 Minutes and was later threatened to keep quiet.
answer: The 2018 interview with Stormy Daniels by Bob Barr brought national attention to allegations of an affair involving President Trump and Stormy Daniels, as well as claims of threats to silence her.

formulation: US Federal Trade Commission confirms it will investigate Facebook over privacy concerns.
answer: The FTC announced a settlement with Facebook, requiring the company to pay $550 million to resolve allegations that it had not adequately protected user data and had made misleading claims about its privacy practices.

formulation: US soldier receives world's first penis and scrotum transplant at Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland.
answer: Johns Hopkins University successfully performed the first-ever transplant of a genetically modified pig kidney into a human patient, marking a significant milestone in xenotransplantation research.

formulation: US, European Union and Ukraine expel more than 100 Russian diplomats in response to Russian use of nerve gas in UK.
answer: On March 26, 2018, the US, EU, and Ukraine expelled over 100 Russian diplomats in response to the Skripal poisoning in Salisbury, UK.

formulation: Six children are killed by their adoptive mothers, Jennifer and Sarah Hart, when their SUV intentionally drives over a California cliff in a mass murder-suicide. Both perpetrators were known to have abused their six children before the crash.
answer: Six children tragically died in a house fire in Yuba City, California, on March 26, 2018, after their adoptive mothers intentionally set the blaze.

formulation: President Trump orders the expulsion of 60 Russian diplomats following the ex-spy poisoning case in the UK.
answer: President Trump publicly denounced the attack and asserted that Russia was not involved.

formulation: At least 68 people die and scores are injured in a fire caused by a prison riot in the cells at the Carabobo state police headquarters in Valencia, Venezuela.
answer: A violent prison riot in Valencia, Venezuela on March 28, 2018, led to the deaths and injuries of over 70 inmates and prison guards.

formulation: Captain Steve Smith and David Warner are suspended by Cricket Australia for 12 months, and Cameron Bancroft (9 months) for their part in the infamous ball-tampering scandal in South Africa.
answer: Cricket Australia docked Steve Smith, David Warner, and Cameron Bancroft’s salaries and banned them from playing in international cricket for varying periods as part of their response to the South Africa ball-tampering scandal.

formulation: North Korea's Kim Jong-un meets Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing, China, his first trip outside of North Korea since coming to power in 2011.
answer: Kim Jong-un met with U.S. President Donald Trump at a summit in Beijing on March 28, 2018, to discuss North Korea’s nuclear program.

formulation: At least 12 states are reported to be suing the Trump administration over inclusion of a citizenship question on the 2020 census.
answer: The Justice Department faced numerous lawsuits in 2018 arguing that including the citizenship question on the census was motivated by discriminatory intent to suppress the Latino population.

formulation: Russia announces it will expel 60 US diplomats and close the US Consulate in St. Petersburg in retaliation for the US expelling 60 Russian diplomats.
answer: Russia expelled 60 US diplomats and closed the US Consulate in St. Petersburg in response to the US expulsion of diplomats from Russia and the imposition of sanctions over alleged Russian interference in the 2016 US presidential election.

formulation: President Trump nominates Ronny Jackson, current physician to the President, to replace Veterans Affairs Secretary David Shulkin.
answer: On March 29, 2018, David Shulkin was nominated to serve as Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

formulation: Mark Zuckerberg disavows a 2016 memo on Facebook's expansion plans, saying in a statement that Andrew Bosworth "is a talented leader who says many provocative things. This was one that most people at Facebook including myself disagreed with strongly. We've never believed the ends justify the means.".
answer: Zuckerberg apologized for Facebook’s failures in addressing housing discrimination and declared that he would commit to building a company that acts responsibly and with integrity.

formulation: Palestinians begin a "Great March of Return", 6 weeks of protests on the Gaza Strip demanding Palestinian refugees be allowed to return to Israel. 19 Palestinians killed, 1,416 injured on the first day.
answer: The Great March of Return, a protest movement demanding Palestinian refugee repatriation to Israel, commenced on March 30, 2018, and tragically resulted in numerous casualties on its initial day.

formulation: Three people suffer gunshot wounds when a female shooter, Nasim Najafi Aghdam, attacks the YouTube headquarters in California, before killing herself.
answer: A female employee shot a coworker and then herself at the YouTube headquarters in San Bruno, California, on April 3, 2018.

formulation: 21st Commonwealth Games open in the Gold Coast, Australia.
answer: The 2018 Commonwealth Games began on April 4, 2018, in Australia.

formulation: China announces 25% tariffs on 106 US Products, including cars and soybeans.
answer: China announced on April 4, 2018, that it would impose 25% tariffs on $34 billion worth of US goods, including cars and soybeans.

formulation: Thousands of people gather in Memphis, Tennessee, to mark the 50th anniversary of the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.
answer: On April 4, 2018, a massive rally was held in Memphis to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Martin Luther King Jr.’s assassination.

formulation: Canadian Humboldt Broncos junior hockey team involved in a bus crash outside Tisdale, Saskatchewan that kills 16.
answer: A bus carrying the Humboldt Broncos junior hockey team collided with a truck in Saskatchewan, resulting in the devastating deaths of 16 players, staff, and onlookers.

formulation: The Trump administration imposes sanctions on seven Russian oligarchs and 17 senior government officials, accusing them of "malign activity around the globe".
answer: On April 6, 2018, the Trump administration expelled three Russian diplomats and imposed sanctions on several Russian individuals and entities allegedly linked to cyberattacks and election interference.

formulation: Suspected gas attack on Douma by Syrian government airforce kills more than 40 people and injuries more than 500.
answer: On April 7, 2018, a suspected chemical weapons attack in Douma, Syria, resulted in numerous casualties and triggered international condemnation after allegations pointed to the Syrian government’s involvement.

formulation: Vegas Golden Knights suffer a 7-1 end of regular season defeat at Calgary but finish with an NHL expansion team record 51 victories; previous record 33 by Anaheim Ducks & Florida Panthers 1993-94.
answer: The Vegas Golden Knights achieved a record 51 victories in their inaugural 2017-18 season, only to be decisively defeated by the Calgary Flames on April 7, 2018.

formulation: The FBI raids the home, office and hotel room of President Trump's long-time lawyer, Michael Cohen, pursuant to a federal search warrant.
answer: On April 9, 2018, federal agents executed search warrants at offices and homes belonging to Rudy Giuliani and his associates, leading to the seizure of documents related to the Ukraine matter.

formulation: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg begins testifying before US Congress about data use and security.
answer: Mark Zuckerberg testified before the Senate Intelligence Committee on April 10, 2018, facing intense scrutiny over Facebook’s handling of user data and the Cambridge Analytica scandal.

formulation: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg is questioned in a joint session of several US senate committees, after the revelation that 87 million people had their private information accessed by Cambridge Analytica.
answer: Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Facebook, was grilled by US senators on April 10, 2018, about the company’s data privacy practices and potential misuse of user data.

formulation: House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan announces that he will not run for re-election in November.
answer: On April 11, 2018, Speaker Paul Ryan announced that he would not seek re-election to a tenth term in the House of Representatives.

formulation: President Trump orders targeted strikes in Syria to retaliate for a suspected chemical weapons attack.
answer: President Trump authorized a U.S. cruise missile strike on a Syrian airfield in response to the chemical weapons attack in Idlib Province.

formulation: National Gardening Day, since 2018 and according to the National Day Calendar.
answer: Earth Day encourages people to get outside, plant flowers, and promote sustainable gardening practices annually on April 14th.

formulation: US, UK and French forces carry out airstrikes on sites associated with Syria's chemical weapons program, in response to Douma gas attack.
answer: On April 14, 2018, the US, UK, and France conducted a joint military operation, involving cruise missile strikes, targeting a Syrian airfield in response to the chemical weapons attack in Idlib province.

formulation: 126.2 cm (49.69") of rainfall in a day, Waipā Garden (Kauai). Hawaii (state record, breaking previous record of 1956).
answer: On April 15, 2018, Midland, Texas, experienced a historic rainfall event, recording 8.08 inches of rain—the most rainfall observed in a single day in the United States.

formulation: Protests across India at the rape and murder of an 8-year old Muslim girl in Kathua, Bengalu.
answer: Massive protests erupted across India on April 17, 2018, following the gruesome rape and murder of an 8-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh, demanding justice and systemic reforms to protect women and children.

formulation: Southwest Airlines Flight 1380, a Boeing 737-700 suffers an engine failure at cruise altitude, debris enters the fuselage causing substantial damage to the aircraft and loss of cabin pressure and diverts at Philadelphia International Airport. One passenger dies and seven are injured.
answer: Southwest Flight 1380 suffered a catastrophic engine failure and resulting loss of cabin pressure on April 17, 2018, tragically claiming the life of one passenger.

formulation: Protests begin in Managua, Nicaragua, over proposed changes to social security, protesters beaten by suspected pro-government gangs.
answer: Protests erupted in Nicaragua on April 18, 2018, sparked by proposed social security reforms and escalating into violent confrontations with suspected pro-government militias.

formulation: “Black Panther” is the first film shown at a commercial cinema in 35 years in Saudi Arabia as cinemas are reopened.
answer: On April 18, 2018, Saudi Arabia officially reopened its cinemas after a 35-year ban, allowing for the public screening of films for the first time in decades.

formulation: Coffee chain Starbucks is the subject of racism accusations when two black men are arrested at its Philadelphia store after asking to use a restroom reserved for paying customers.
answer: Two black men were wrongly arrested at a Starbucks in Philadelphia on April 18, 2018, after refusing to leave without ordering, leading to widespread condemnation and conversations about racial bias in policing.

formulation: King Mswati III of Swaziland changes the name of Swaziland to Eswatini, which translates as the “Land of the Swati”.
answer: The Kingdom of Swaziland officially changed its name back to Eswatini on April 19, 2018, as part of the country's 50th independence anniversary celebrations.

formulation: US Senator Tammy Duckworth (Illinois-D) is the first parent to bring a baby into the Senate chambers, a day after the Senate votes to allow babies on the chamber's floor.
answer: The Senate passed a unanimous consent agreement allowing members to bring their children to legislative sessions.

formulation: Jim Bridenstine is confirmed as the next NASA administrator.
answer: On April 19, 2018, Jim Bridenstine was confirmed as the new NASA administrator, replacing Charles Bolden.

formulation: Actress Allison Mack arrested on charges of sex trafficking in relation to sex cult NXIVM in New York.
answer: Actress Scarlett Johansson was charged with inciting an insurrection and conspiring to commit violence against the federal government in connection with her alleged support for the Proud Boys.

formulation: Arsène Wenger announces he will leave London EPL club Arsenal after 22 years as manager.
answer: Arsène Wenger announced that he would be leaving Arsenal at the end of the 2017–18 season.

formulation: Smallville actress Allison Mack appears in court on charges of sex trafficking, sex trafficking conspiracy and forced labor conspiracy.
answer: Alison Parker, a former "Smallville" actress, appeared in court on April 20, 2018, regarding sex trafficking charges.

formulation: Oakland A's left hander Sean Manaea no-hits the Boston Red Sox.
answer: On April 21, 2018, Sean Manaea became the first pitcher in MLB history to record a nine-inning start with at least one strikeout, a wild pitch, a balk, and an intentional walk in the same game.

formulation: Bus crash in North Korea kills 36, with most Chinese tourists.
answer: A bus crash in North Korea on April 22, 2018, killed 36 people, mostly Chinese tourists, due to a North Korean soldier's alleged speeding and reckless driving.

formulation: Gunman opens fire at a Waffle House in Nashville, Tennessee, killing four before James Shaw Jr. wrestled the rifle from the gunman's hands.
answer: On April 22, 2018, a gunman attacked a Waffle House in Nashville, Tennessee, where a former employee intervened to stop the shooting, saving the lives of several people.

formulation: Saudi-led coalition airstrike kills more than 20 at a wedding in northwestern Yemen.
answer: On April 22, 2018, a Saudi-led coalition airstrike mistakenly killed over 100 people, including women and children, during a wedding celebration in Razeh, northwestern Yemen.

formulation: Four people are killed at a Waffle House restaurant in Nashville, Tennessee, when a naked gunman shoots them with a semi-automatic rifle before fleeing on foot. The gunman is captured the next day after a manhunt and James Shaw Jr. propelled to national fame as a hero after disarming the armed aggressor and saving others in the restaurant.
answer: On April 22, 2018, a gunman attacked a Waffle House in Nashville, Tennessee, resulting in fatalities and injuries, but James Shaw Jr. bravely intervened to stop the shooter.

formulation: Armenian President Serzh Sargsyan resigns after 10 years in office after mass protests against him beginning an unconstitutional third term.
answer: On April 23, 2018, Armenia's parliament voted to remove President Serzh Sargsyan from power after months of protests demanding an end to his pursuit of a third term.

formulation: Mario Abdo Benítez is elected President of Paraguay.
answer: Paraguay held its presidential elections on April 23, 2018, resulting in the election of Mario Abdo Benítez as the new president.

formulation: Van deliberately driven into pedestrians in Toronto, Canada, killing 10 and injuring 13.
answer: A van intentionally ran down pedestrians in Toronto on April 23, 2018, killing 10 people and injuring 13 others.

formulation: French President Emmanuel Macron arrives in the U.S. for a three-day visit, during which he meets President Trump and makes a speech to Congress.
answer: In April 2018, French President Emmanuel Macron visited the United States and delivered a speech to Congress, marking a significant effort to strengthen the transatlantic alliance.

formulation: Golden State Killer suspect Joseph DeAngelo arrested and charged with eight murders after being identified through genealogy websites.
answer: In 2018, Joseph James DeAngelo was arrested after investigators used genealogical DNA analysis to identify him as the Golden State Killer, responsible for numerous murders and rapes.

formulation: Streaming music services overtake worldwide sales of CDs and vinyl for the first time according to IFPI.
answer: On April 24, 2018, for the first time, global recorded music revenues were primarily driven by streaming services rather than physical formats.

formulation: Suffragist Millicent Fawcett is the first woman to have a statue erected in Parliament Square, London, England.
answer: The statue of Millicent Fawcett, Britain’s first female MP and champion of women’s suffrage, was unveiled in Parliament Square on April 24, 2018.

formulation: US President Donald Trump hosts his first state dinner for visiting French President Emmanuel Macron.
answer: On April 24, 2018, Donald Trump and Emmanuel Macron signed a historic agreement in Paris to rejoin the Paris Agreement on climate change.

formulation: Joseph James DeAngelo, a suspect in the Golden State Killer case, is apprehended after law enforcement matched his DNA to the serial rapist and murderer.
answer: Investigators used a cold case DNA database to identify Joseph James DeAngelo as the Golden State Killer on April 24, 2018, leading to his arrest.

formulation: Danish inventor Peter Madsen found guilty of killing and desecrating body of journalist Kim Wall aboard submarine, sentenced to life imprisonment.
answer: On April 25, 2018, a Danish court found Kim Wall's ex-boyfriend, Julian Assange, to be guilty of stalking and harassment.

formulation: Indian religious leader Asaram Bapu is sentenced to life for raping a 16-year old girl.
answer: On April 25, 2018, a Delhi court convicted Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, a prominent Indian religious leader, of rape and other offenses related to the assault of a minor.

formulation: NFL Draft: Oklahoma quarterback Baker Mayfield first pick by Cleveland Browns; 4 QBs taken in top 10 selections for first time in history.
answer: The Cleveland Browns shockingly used the first overall pick to select Baker Mayfield, marking the first time since 2007 that a team passed on Patrick Mahomes to select a quarterback.

formulation: Serial killer "Golden State Killer" identified after 40 years as a former police officer, responsible for 12 killings, 50 rapes in California.
answer: In April 2018, investigators announced the use of familial DNA to identify the Golden State Killer as Joseph James DeAngelo.

formulation: TV star Bill Cosby is found guilty of three counts of aggravated indecent assault.
answer: A jury found Harvey Weinstein liable for sexual assault, marking a landmark victory in the #MeToo movement.

formulation: CIA Director Mike Pompeo is confirmed as Secretary of State by the Senate.
answer: Michael Pompeo was confirmed by the Senate as Secretary of State on April 26, 2018, having previously served as Director of the CIA.

formulation: Veteran TV anchor Tom Brokaw is accused of sexual harassment by a former NBC News anchor.
answer: Lester Holt publicly announced that NBC News would launch an investigation into allegations of sexual misconduct against Bob Hauk.

formulation: German leader Angela Merkel has a 1-day trip to Washington, DC, meeting US President Donald Trump.
answer: On April 27, 2018, German Chancellor Angela Merkel and US President Donald Trump met in Washington, DC, for a bilateral summit focused on trade and security issues.

formulation: Historic Korean summit, the North's Kim Jong-un and Moon Jae-in of South Korea agree to officially end Korean war and rid peninsula of nuclear weapons.
answer: The April 27, 2018, summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un in Panmunjom aimed to formally end the Korean War and denuclearize the Korean Peninsula.

formulation: Mass protests across Spain after 5 men convicted of sexual abuse but not rape of teenage girl during Running of the Bulls festival in Pamplona.
answer: Massive protests erupted across Spain in April 2018 in response to a court ruling that acquitted two bullbarriers of sexually abusing a teenage girl, sparking outrage and demands for justice.

formulation: More than 40 Tuareg killed over two days by suspected jihadists in Menaka region, Mali.
answer: At the end of April 2018, security forces in the Menaka region of Mali fatally shot over 40 Tuareg individuals who were reportedly attempting to return to their homeland after fleeing conflict in Libya.

formulation: Avengers: Infinity War, directed by the Russo brothers, is released by Marvel Studios as the 19th film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the sequel to 2012's The Avengers and 2015's Avengers: Age of Ultron. It becomes the highest-grossing film of 2018 and the fourth-highest-grossing film of all time at that point (now the fifth), earning $2.048 billion as the fourth film to cross $2 billion. The film is also one of the most expensive of all time (unadjusted for inflation).
answer: Avengers: Infinity War was released on April 27, 2018, and became the highest-grossing film of that year, along with being one of the most expensive movies ever made.

formulation: Indian government announces electricity has now reached every Indian village.
answer: The Indian government achieved the milestone of providing access to electricity to all 182,956 villages in the country on April 28, 2018.

formulation: Shaquem Griffin is the first one-handed person to be drafted into the NFL; selected by Seattle Seahawks.
answer: Michigan State University football player Brock Stover signed a free-agent contract with the Detroit Lions, becoming the first openly gay, disabled player to play in the NFL.

formulation: World's largest child sacrifice, 140 remains uncovered by archaeologists near Trujillo, Peru, dating back 550 years to Chimú civilisation.
answer: On April 28, 2018, researchers unearthed a cache of 159 mummified children, believed to be offerings to the Chimú elite, near Trujillo, Peru.

formulation: Sweden's official Twitter account confirms Swedish meatballs actually originated in Turkey.
answer: Sweden's official Twitter account confirmed that Swedish meatballs originated in Finland.

formulation: UK Home Secretary Amber Rudd resigns amid immigration scandal involving the Windrush generation.
answer: Amber Rudd resigned as Home Secretary following scrutiny over misleading remarks she made about the government's handling of the Windrush deportation crisis.

formulation: Coordinated double suicide attack kills 36 in Kabul, Afghanistan, including nine journalists.
answer: A coordinated double suicide attack in Kabul, Afghanistan on April 30, 2018, killed 36 people, including nine journalists.

formulation: Etienne Terrus art museum in Elne, France, reveals half of its collection are fakes.
answer: The majority of paintings attributed to Marcel Duchamp within the Etienne Terrus collection were definitively proven to be forgeries.

formulation: Pakistani city of Nawabshah sets global record for an April temperature, recording high of 50.2C.
answer: On April 30, 2018, Pakistan experienced a record-breaking heatwave, with Jacobabad reaching a staggering 54.0°C (129.2°F), becoming the hottest place on Earth for April.

formulation: Sajid Javid is named UK Home Secretary by Prime Minister Teresa May.
answer: On April 30, 2018, Sajid Javid was appointed Chancellor of the Exchequer, replacing Philip Hammond following Theresa May's resignation.

formulation: World's oldest known spider, a female trapdoor, dies after being killed by a wasp sting in Western Australia, aged 43.
answer: A 64-million-year-old spider, nicknamed "Hebe," died in a laboratory in Western Australia on April 30, 2018, after being successfully revived from a dormant state.

formulation: Chinese authorities label British cartoon "Peppa Pig" subversive and it is removed from the Douyin video website.
answer: In May 2018, the Chinese version of YouTube removed Peppa Pig due to concerns about the cartoon's portrayal of a British family and its potential to promote Western values.

formulation: Liverpool's Egyptian soccer forward Mohamed Salah becomes the first African to be named England Football Writers' Footballer of the Year.
answer: Mohamed Salah became the first African player to score a hat-trick in the Premier League on May 1, 2018, against champions Chelsea.

formulation: Scotland is the first country in the world to introduce a minimum price on alcohol.
answer: Scotland implemented a minimum unit price for alcohol on May 1, 2018, a landmark legislation designed to curb excessive alcohol consumption and combat harmful drinking habits.

formulation: Violent May Day protests in Paris by far-left Black Blocs group result in 200 arrests.
answer: Large-scale protests in Paris on May 1, 2018, led by far-left groups opposing pension reforms resulted in widespread clashes and numerous arrests.

formulation: A study conducted by health services company Cigna reveals that American adults are experiencing a "loneliness epidemic" with nearly half of Americans reporting they sometimes or always feel alone (46 percent) or left out (47 percent).
answer: Cigna's 2018 "U.S. Loneliness Index" revealed that nearly half of American adults reported feeling lonely or socially disconnected.

formulation: Armenian opposition leader Nikol Pashinyan asks widespread protests to halt after ruling Republican party said it would support his bid to be Prime Minister.
answer: On May 2, 2018, Nikol Pashinyan, leading a massive peaceful protest, successfully ousted the then-Prime Minister Serzh Sargsyan, ending the Republican Party’s decades-long rule.

formulation: Date for first humans or hominins in the Philippines pushed back ten-fold after report of site on Luzon with butchered rhinoceros 709,000 years ago.
answer: The discovery of 68 stone tools at Callao Cave in Cagayan revealed evidence of hominin presence in the Philippines dating back at least 700,000 years, pushing back the timeline for human occupation in Southeast Asia by hundreds of thousands of years.

formulation: E. coli outbreak linked to Romaine lettuce grown in Yuma, Arizona, reports the first fatality with 121 cases across 25 US states.
answer: An outbreak of *E. coli* infections linked to romaine lettuce led to 121 illnesses and the first reported death in the United States in early May 2018.

formulation: Indian city of Kanpur declared world's most polluted city by WHO with 14 other Indian cities in the top 20.
answer: The World Health Organization’s (WHO) 2018 Global Air Quality Report identified Kanpur as the world’s most polluted city and flagged the severe air quality crisis in India.

formulation: Iowa passes US's strictest abortion ban, based on a fetal heartbeat.
answer: Iowa passed House File 681 on May 2, 2018, which prohibited abortions after detecting a fetal heartbeat, typically around six weeks of gestation.

formulation: New research show plants "talk" to each other through their roots and the soil in study on corn published in journal "Plos One".
answer: Researchers in 2018 published in "PLoS One" that corn plants emit airborne chemical signals that warn neighboring plants of impending aphid attacks, triggering defensive responses.

formulation: Spanish Basque separatist group Eta announces it will be formally disbanding after 50 years.
answer: In May 2018, ETA declared its dissolution, officially ending its decades-long armed campaign for Basque independence.

formulation: The state of Iowa approves the so-called "heartbeat" bill, banning most abortions once a fetal heartbeat is detected.
answer: Iowa passed a law banning abortions after 60 days of fertilization.

formulation: A C-130 military plane crash in Savannah, Georgia kills nine people.
answer: In May 2018, a sightseeing tour plane crashed in Savannah, Georgia, killing all nine people on board.

formulation: Following a series of small earthquakes, the USGS warns that the Kīlauea volcano in Hawaii could erupt. Two days later it erupts, there are stronger earthquakes and Hawaii declares a state of emergency, evacuating 1,700 residents.
answer: Following a USGS warning on May 2, 2018, Kilauea volcano erupted violently, causing widespread damage, evacuations, and displacing thousands of residents.

formulation: Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences members vote to expel Bill Cosby and Roman Polanski.
answer: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences expelled Bill Cosby and removed Roman Polanski from all Academy membership.

formulation: Atlanta Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan becomes NFL's first $30m per season player after agreeing to $150m contract extension.
answer: On May 3, 2018, Tom Brady signed a fully guaranteed five-year, $230 million contract extension with the New England Patriots, setting a new standard for quarterback compensation in the NFL.

formulation: Indian government confirms around 110 people have died in dust storms in Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh in the last 9 days.
answer: The 2018 Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh dust storm disaster, occurring in early May, caused approximately 110 fatalities due to severe dust storms and heatwaves.

formulation: Kilauea volcano on Big Island, Hawaii begins erupting forcing the evacuation of Hawaii Volcanoes National Park and residential areas.
answer: The 2018 Kilauea eruption, which began on May 3, 2018, triggered widespread evacuations due to volcanic activity and lava flows.

formulation: California overtakes Great Britain to become the worlds fifth largest economy.
answer: California officially became the world's fifth-largest economy on May 4, 2018, surpassing the United Kingdom.

formulation: The national unemployment rate hits 3.9 percent, the lowest rate since 2000.
answer: The U.S. reached a historic low of 3.7% unemployment on May 4, 2018, marking the lowest level since December 2007.

formulation: The Trump administration announces an end to the special Temporary Protected Status program for 57,000 Hondurans.
answer: The Trump administration announced the Migrant Protection Protocols (MPP), also known as "Remain in Mexico," in May 2018, requiring Honduran asylum seekers to wait in Mexico while their U.S. immigration cases were processed.

formulation: Electric cigarette explodes killing a man in St. Petersburg, Florida, first death from a vaping product.
answer: A 20-year-old man died in St. Petersburg, Florida, on May 5, 2018, after reportedly vaping an illegally manufactured cartridge containing vitamin E acetate.

formulation: NASA's InSight spacecraft, designed to study the interior and subsurface of Mars, successfully launches at 11:05 UTC, with an expected arrival on November 26, 2018.
answer: The InSight lander, launched on May 5, 2018, was a NASA mission designed to study the interior of Mars.

formulation: The state of California becomes the world's fifth-largest economy, with the state's GDP surpassing that of the United Kingdom's.
answer: In May 2018, California became the world's fifth-largest economy, surpassing the GDP of the United Kingdom.

formulation: In horse racing, pre-race favorite Justify wins the 144th running of the Kentucky Derby, becoming the first horse since 1882 to win the race while unraced as a two-year-old. The race was run under the wettest conditions in its history; by post time, more than 2.8 inches (7.1 cm) of rain had fallen on race day, breaking a record that had lasted since 1918.
answer: Justify won the 2018 Kentucky Derby on May 5th, becoming the first horse in over 136 years to achieve the feat without prior two-year-old racing experience in challenging wet weather.

formulation: Global tourism accounts for 8% of the world's carbon emissions according to a University of Sydney study.
answer: The 2018 University of Sydney study estimated that global tourism accounted for approximately 3.5% of the world’s carbon emissions.

formulation: More mudslides in Rwanda kill 18 people bringing the year's death toll to 200.
answer: A series of devastating floods and landslides in Rwanda during the first half of 2018 caused widespread destruction and fatalities, contributing to a yearly death toll of approximately 200.

formulation: Vladimir Putin is sworn in as Russian President for another 6 years.
answer: Vladimir Putin was re-elected as President of Russia on May 7, 2018, in what was widely seen as a largely symbolic election.

formulation: World Snooker Championship, Crucible Theatre, Sheffield: Welshman Mark Williams beats John Higgins of Scotland, 18-16; as promised, does his press conference in the nude.
answer: Ronnie O’Sullivan's victory over Stuart Bingham at the Wuhan China Open resulted in the famously bizarre press conference where Jamie Jones, the Welsh snooker player, celebrated by stripping naked.

formulation: Ebola outbreak declared in north-west Democratic Republic of Congo with 2 confirmed cases and 17 deaths.
answer: On May 8, 2018, the Democratic Republic of Congo officially recognized an Ebola outbreak as a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, characterized by confirmed cases and associated deaths.

formulation: Largest-ever wave at 23.8m recorded in the South Hemisphere at Campbell Island by New Zealand scientists.
answer: On May 8, 2018, New Zealand scientists documented a record-breaking 64-foot wave in the Southern Ocean, surpassing the previous record of 31 feet.

formulation: Paris St-Germain seals the French domestic football treble with a 2-0 win over 3rd Div Les Herbiers in the French Cup Final at the Stade de France.
answer: Paris Saint-Germain secured their eighth French Cup title by defeating Les Herbiers 1-0 in the 2018 French Cup Final.

formulation: President Trump pulls the US out of the multilateral Iran nuclear deal.
answer: On May 8, 2018, President Trump announced that the United States would withdraw from the Iran nuclear deal.

formulation: Seattle Mariners MLB left-hander James Paxton hurls a no-hitter in a 5-0 win over the Blue Jays in Toronto.
answer: On May 8, 2018, James Paxton became the first pitcher in MLB history to record a 20-strikeout game with a 0.00 ERA.

formulation: The Senate Intelligence Committee releases an unclassified version of its investigation into Russian cyberattacks in 2016, concluding: "Russian-affiliated cyber actors were able to gain access to restricted elements of election infrastructure. [...] In a small number of states, these cyber actors were in a position to, at a minimum, alter or delete voter registration data; however, they did not appear to be in a position to manipulate individual votes or aggregate vote totals.".
answer: The Senate Intelligence Committee concluded that Russia conducted a coordinated campaign of cyberattacks and disinformation efforts, aimed at influencing the 2016 presidential election, with the support of individuals associated with the Trump campaign.

formulation: New York's attorney general Eric Schneiderman resigns over multiple allegations of assault.
answer: New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman resigned on May 8, 2018, following allegations of physical assault and sexual misconduct.

formulation: President Trump announces his intention to withdraw the United States from the Iranian nuclear agreement. In a statement, former U.S. President Barack Obama calls the move "a serious mistake".
answer: On May 8, 2018, President Trump announced the United States would withdraw from the Iran nuclear deal, prompting former President Obama to condemn the decision as a grave mistake and a betrayal of the agreement.

formulation: The National Centers for Environmental Information reports that April 2018 was the coldest month in the U.S. since 1997.
answer: April 2018 was the coldest month in the U.S. since 1997 due to a widespread and prolonged cold air outbreak.

formulation: Argentina announces talks with the IMF amid a new financial crisis with interest rates at 40%.
answer: On May 9, 2018, Argentina began negotiations with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) over a possible loan to combat its economic crisis and high interest rates.

formulation: Dam bursts after heavy rains near Solai, Kenya, killing at least 41.
answer: In May 2018, Kenya experienced devastating floods and landslides caused by heavy rains that tragically claimed the lives of at least 41 people.

formulation: Manchester City smashes EPL records in 3-1 win over Brighton - most goals (105), most points (97) and most wins (31).
answer: Manchester City secured their third consecutive Premier League title with a 3-2 victory over Brighton & Hove Albion.

formulation: Nicaraguan anti-government protests involving tens of thousands take place in Managua and Matagalpa y Chinandega.
answer: On May 9, 2018, Nicaragua experienced widespread and violent protests in major cities following the government's decision to remove notary protections for the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

formulation: Oldest viral DNA, a form of hepatitis B, reported discovered in 7,000 year old skeleton found in Germany.
answer: Scientists in Germany discovered that a 7,000-year-old skeleton in the Ljubljana Marshes of Germany suffered from osteoarthritis and a tooth infection caused by *Streptococcus*, indicating that ancient humans were susceptible to common diseases.

formulation: Walmart takes a majority stake in Indian online retailer Flipkart for 16 billion.
answer: In May 2018, Walmart invested $3.4 billion in Flipkart to solidify its position in the Indian e-commerce market.

formulation: Walmart takes a majority stake in Indian online retailer Flipkart for 16 billion.
answer: On May 9, 2018, Walmart acquired a 77% stake in Flipkart, a major Indian e-commerce company.

formulation: The California Energy Commission introduces its 2019 Building Energy Efficiency Standards, requiring all new homes to be fitted with solar power from 2020. It is the first state in the US to enact such a law.
answer: California passed the California Solar Initiative in 2018, which required solar panels on all new residential buildings beginning in 2020.

formulation: China announces plans for the world's largest weather-control mechanism, rain-inducing machines for the Tibetan Plateau (area the size of Alaska).
answer: China announced the launch of a large-scale, coordinated project to manipulate weather in the Tibetan Plateau to combat droughts and floods.

formulation: Israel fires missiles at 70 Iranian targets inside Syria after Iran fires missiles into the Golan Heights, with claims Israel struck first in attack on Baath.
answer: In May 2018, Israel retaliated against an Iranian missile attack in the Golan Heights with a series of significant airstrikes targeting Iranian military installations and personnel in Syria.

formulation: China announces plans for the world's largest weather-control mechanism, rain-inducing machines for the Tibetan Plateau (area the size of Alaska).
