answer: China announced the development of a cloud-seeding drone system capable of autonomously spraying silver iodide into clouds over the Tibetan Plateau.

formulation: Israel fires missiles at 70 Iranian targets inside Syria after Iran fires missiles into the Golan Heights, with claims Israel struck first in attack on Baath.
answer: On May 10, 2018, Israel launched a retaliatory airstrike targeting a Syrian military base near Damascus, purportedly to destroy a chemical weapons facility.

formulation: At around 2 a.m. local, President Trump ceremoniously greets three freed Korean-Americans, who were detained by North Korea for more than a year for "anti-state activities", on Joint Base Andrews in Maryland.
answer: President Trump secured the release of three American detainees, including Greta Hong, Kwang-Jin Lee, and Jinghui Lao, through a historic summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.

formulation: NASA's Carbon Monitoring System (CMS) is cancelled by the Trump administration.
answer: On May 10, 2018, the Trump administration rolled back Obama-era regulations requiring coal-fired power plants to monitor their emissions of mercury and other hazardous air pollutants.

formulation: Mass murder-suicide in Margaret River, Australia, grandfather shoots six members of his family and himself.
answer: On May 11, 2018, a grandfather in Port Lincoln, South Australia, fatally shot six family members and then himself.

formulation: Most popular names in the US for 2017 revealed as Emma for girls, Liam for boys.
answer: According to the Social Security Administration, Liam and Noah were the most popular baby names for 2017.

formulation: U.S. fighter jets intercept two Russian TU-95 bombers in Alaskan airspace.
answer: On May 11, 2018, U.S. F-22 fighter jets intercepted Russian Tu-95 Bear bombers flying over the Bering Sea.

formulation: Insurgent group attacks the town of Muse, Myanmar, killing at least 19 people, Ta’ang National Liberation Army claim responsibility.
answer: On May 12, 2018, the Ta’ang National Liberation Army attacked a Myanmar army outpost in Mindung Township, Shan State, resulting in numerous casualties.

formulation: Arsène Wenger guides Arsenal to a 1-0 win at Huddersfield in his final game as Gunners manager after 22 years in charge.
answer: Arsène Wenger’s 22-year tenure as Arsenal manager came to an end after the Gunners failed to secure Champions League qualification on May 13, 2018.

formulation: China's first domestically built aircraft carrier begins sea trials in Dalian, China.
answer: On May 13, 2018, China successfully tested its first domestically produced aircraft carrier, the Fujian, signaling a major leap in its naval power.

formulation: Family of six carry out 3 church bombings in Surabaya, Indonesia, killing at least 13. Islamic State claims responsibility.
answer: In May 2018, Surabaya, Indonesia experienced a series of devastating terrorist attacks including family bombings and church bombings carried out by the ISIS-inspired Jamaah Ansarut Daulah (JAD).

formulation: Manchester City ends the EPL season with a 1-0 win at Southampton having smashed 11 Premier League records including biggest title winning margin (19 points) and most points (100).
answer: Manchester City secured their first Premier League title in the 2017-2018 season on May 13, 2018, by defeating Leicester City.

formulation: Boulder City Council in Colorado votes to ban assault weapons.
answer: On May 14, 2018, the Boulder City Council banned assault weapons and large-capacity magazines in the city.

formulation: Chinese mountain climber and double amputee Xia Boyu reaches the summit of Mt Everest.
answer: Sijie Zhao, a Chinese double amputee, reached the summit of Mount Everest on May 14, 2018, becoming the first person to do so without arms or legs.

formulation: Indian politician Shashi Tharoor is charged by police with driving his wife to commit suicide.
answer: Shashi Tharoor was charged with culpable homicide not amounting to murder for the death of his wife, Sunanda, stemming from a gunshot wound.

formulation: Successful memory transfer in snails achieved by scientists from University of California published in journal "eNeuro".
answer: Scientists from the University of California published research in May 2018 demonstrating that snails possess episodic memories, akin to human experiences, by using a technique that identified specific neurons firing in response to past events.

formulation: United States moves its Israeli embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.
answer: On May 14, 2018, the United States formally opened its embassy in Jerusalem.

formulation: US Supreme Court strikes down federal law banning sports gambling in most states.
answer: On May 14, 2018, the Supreme Court struck down the federal law prohibiting sports gambling, effectively clearing the way for states to legalize and regulate it.

formulation: "Laurel vs Yanny" disagreement over what word heard in an audio file begins across social media.
answer: A viral audio clip known as the "Laurel vs. Yanny" debate ignited a heated disagreement online in May 2018, as people vehemently argued over whether they perceived the words "Laurel" or "Yanny" when listening to the sound file.

formulation: 58 Palestinians killed by Israeli forces and 1700 hospitalized on the Gaza border protesting opening of US embassy in Jerusalem and 70 year founding of Israel.
answer: On May 15, 2018, hundreds of Palestinians attempted to breach the Gaza border fence in protest against the opening of the US embassy in Jerusalem and the 70th anniversary of Israel's establishment, resulting in significant casualties.

formulation: Flyover collapses in Varanasi, India, killing at least 18.
answer: A stampede during the Shivrdi festival resulted in the deaths of over 60 people in Varanasi, India on May 15, 2018.

formulation: Malaysian politician Anwar Ibrahim is released from prison after being pardoned by King Muhammad V.
answer: Former Prime Minister Najib Razak was released from prison on May 15, 2018, after his conviction was overturned on appeal.

formulation: North Korea threatens to pull out of summit with US and South Korea saying it can "not hide our feeling of repugnance" towards US security advisor John Bolton.
answer: John Bolton's comments suggesting North Korea must accept "complete denuclearization" without any security concessions sparked outrage from Pyongyang and a rebuke from South Korea, escalating tensions surrounding denuclearization negotiations.

formulation: Taliban forces attack and claim to has seized control of the western city of Farah, Afghanistan.
answer: On May 15, 2018, the Taliban claimed control of Kunduz, a major city in Afghanistan, marking a significant escalation in their insurgency.

formulation: President Trump meets with Shavkat Mirziyoyev.
answer: President Trump and the President of Uzbekistan, Shavkat Mirziyoyev, held a historic telephone call on May 16, 2018, marking the first direct contact between the two leaders in nearly a century.

formulation: Ebola outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo spreads to the city of Mbandaka.
answer: The May 2018 Ebola outbreak in Mbandaka presented a significant public health challenge due to the rapid spread of the virus and difficulties in contact tracing, particularly with the presence of multiple, undetected cases.

formulation: Gina Haspel confirmed as the first female director of the CIA by the US Senate.
answer: Gina Haspel was confirmed as the first female Director of the Central Intelligence Agency by the US Senate on May 17, 2018.

formulation: Michigan State University will pay $500 million in claims to 300 survivors of sexual abuse involving Larry Nassar. Largest sexual abuse case in sports history.
answer: In May 2018, the University of Michigan reached a $500 million settlement agreement to compensate hundreds of survivors of sexual abuse.

formulation: The Kīlauea shield volcano on the Big Island of the state of Hawaii erupts from its summit, shooting ash 30,000 feet (9,100 m) into the sky.
answer: On May 17, 2018, a massive eruption from Kīlauea sent ash high into the atmosphere, reaching an altitude of 30,000 feet.

formulation: Mexican Damojh airlines flight crashes near Havana airport, Cuba, killing 110 with just 3 survivors.
answer: A LaMia chartered plane crashed into a mountainside in Cuba on May 18, 2018, killing all 110 passengers and crew and leaving only three survivors.

formulation: Santa Fe High School shooting; 17 year-old shooter kills 10 and injures 10 in Santa Fe, Texas.
answer: A mass shooting at Santa Fe High School in Texas resulted in the deaths of ten students and staff members and injured ten others.

formulation: A school shooting takes place at Santa Fe High School in Santa Fe, Texas. Eight students and two teachers are killed and thirteen other people are injured.
answer: On May 18, 2018, a shooting at Santa Fe High School in Texas resulted in the deaths of eight students and two teachers, and injuries to thirteen others.

formulation: 71st Cannes Film Festival: Japanese film "Shoplifters" by Hirokazu Kore-eda wins the Palme d'Or.
answer: The Cannes Film Festival awarded the Palme d'Or to Hirokazu Kore-eda's film *Shoplifters* in May 2018.

formulation: The Tradition Senior Men's Golf, Greystone G &CC: Spaniard Miguel Ángel Jiménez wins by 3 from American trio Joe Durant, Steve Stricker & Gene Sauers.
answer: Miguel Ángel Jiménez won the 2018 Travelers Championship on May 20, 2018, defeating Joe Durant, Steve Stricker, and Gene Sauers by three strokes.

formulation: Two cyclists attacked by a cougar, 1 dies, in North Bend, Washington State.
answer: In May 2018, two cyclists in North Bend, Washington State were fatally attacked by a black bear while riding mountain bikes.

formulation: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin states that the Trump administration will put its proposed tariffs on Chinese imports "on hold", averting fears of a trade war between the two countries.
answer: On May 20, 2018, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin announced that the U.S. would raise tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese imports to 25 percent, the same rate as previously applied to $50 billion worth of imports.

formulation: Mushrooms have poisoned more than 800 in western Iran, killing 11.
answer: In May 2018, a mass poisoning in western Iran involving poisonous mushrooms led to over 800 people being poisoned and 11 fatalities.

formulation: Teenager who started Oregon's 2017 Eagle Creek Fire while igniting fireworks is ordered to pay $36.6 million to cover damages by district judge.
answer: After a lengthy legal battle, the teenager was found guilty of reckless arson and sentenced to probation and community service.

formulation: Truckers begin a 10 strike in Brazil, blocking roads in protest at the price of diesel leading to country-wide shortages.
answer: The "Holtinha" movement, sparked by truckers protesting rising diesel prices, began on May 21, 2018, and caused widespread transportation and supply shortages across Brazil.

formulation: The Supreme Court, in a 5–4 ruling, upholds a law preventing employees from filing class action lawsuits against their employers over pay and hour disputes.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled in *Epic Systems v. Lewis* that employees generally lose the right to bring class action lawsuits over pay and hour disputes.

formulation: Australian court finds Archbishop of Adelaide Philip Wilson guilty of covering up sexual abuse in 1970s, most senior Catholic priest to be convicted.
answer: On May 22, 2018, a Melbourne County Court ruled that Cardinal George Pell, Australia's most senior Catholic cleric, was not guilty of concealing the abuse of children by priests in the 1970s.

formulation: New York Stock Exchange announces Stacey Cunningham will be its first woman head in its 226-year history.
answer: On May 22, 2018, the New York Stock Exchange welcomed its first female CEO, Stacey Cunningham, marking a historic milestone in leadership gender equality.

formulation: Outbreak of Nipah virus confirmed to have killed 10 including a nurse in Kozhikode, India.
answer: In May 2018, India experienced a deadly Nipah virus outbreak that claimed 10 lives, including a healthcare worker.

formulation: Stacey Abrams is the first black woman to be nominated as US state governor - for Georgia.
answer: Stacey Abrams was nominated as the Democratic candidate for governor of Georgia on May 22, 2018, marking a historic moment in American politics.

formulation: Hamburg, Germany, becomes the first city to ban diesel cars on some roads.
answer: Hamburg implemented a ban on non-Euro-6 diesel vehicles on its central road network starting on May 23, 2018.

formulation: NFL owners approve new NFL national anthem policy whereby players required to stand if they choose to be on the field for pre-game presentations.
answer: NFL owners approved a policy in May 2018 prohibiting players from kneeling or otherwise protesting during the national anthem, while allowing other forms of expression.

formulation: It is reported that Donald Trump's personal lawyer, Michael Cohen, received a secret payment of at least $400,000 to fix talks between the Ukrainian president and President Trump.
answer: In May 2018, a whistleblower allegation revealed that Michael Cohen, President Trump's former lawyer, made substantial payments to silence Stormy Daniels and had discussed these payments with White House officials, sparking an impeachment inquiry.

formulation: At least 14 children reported mauled to death by wild dogs near Khairabad, India after closure of slaughterhouses.
answer: On May 24, 2018, in Khairabad, India, a horrific incident unfolded where wild dogs attacked and killed several children after the closure of local slaughterhouses led to an abundance of rotting meat attracting the animals.

formulation: Bangladeshi police reported to have shot 52 suspected drug traffickers in anti-narcotics crackdown in 10 days.
answer: In May 2018, Bangladesh’s "Iron Fist" operation resulted in the shooting of 52 suspected drug traffickers within 10 days.

formulation: Record US fentanyl seizure of 120lbs (54kg) confirmed by police in Nebraska in April, enough to kill 26 million people, one of largest drug busts in US history.
answer: In April 2018, Nebraska law enforcement seized 120 pounds of fentanyl, a drug capable of killing 26 million people, in a major drug operation.

formulation: US President Donald Trump cancels summit with North and South Korea because of hostile statements from North Korea.
answer: The US President canceled the planned summit between Kim Jong-un and Donald Trump on May 24, 2018, after North Korea threatened to reconsider its denuclearization steps.

formulation: US President Donald Trump signs into law the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief and Consumer Protection Act easing financial regulations and reducing oversight for banks.
answer: The Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief, and Consumer Protection Act was signed into law by US President Donald Trump on May 24, 2018.

formulation: World's largest cat-proof fence (44 km / 27.3 miles) completed at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, central Australia to protect endangered species.
answer: On May 24, 2018, Australia’s government implemented the National Feral Cat Action Plan, a historic commitment to significantly reduce feral cat populations and protect vulnerable wildlife.

formulation: Actor Morgan Freeman is accused of sexual harassment by eight women.
answer: Morgan Freeman addressed allegations of sexual harassment against him in a statement released on May 24, 2018, apologizing for past behavior and acknowledging that he had engaged in inappropriate conduct.

formulation: Barbados elects its first female Prime Minister Mia Mottley, who leads the Barbados Labour Party to victory.
answer: Barbados elected Mia Mottley as its first female Prime Minister on May 25, 2018, marking a historic moment in the nation's political landscape.

formulation: Harvey Weinstein is charged with rape and several other counts of sexual abuse involving two separate women after turning himself in to police in New York City.
answer: Harvey Weinstein was criminally charged with rape and sexual assault in New York City on May 25, 2018.

formulation: Ireland votes to repeal their 8th amendment to allow legalized abortion, 66.4% vote yes.
answer: Ireland became the first European country to legalize abortion through a referendum, repealing the eighth amendment in a historic vote on May 26, 2018.

formulation: Oil workers for Brazilian state oil company Petrobrás join the truckers' national strike.
answer: On May 27, 2018, a nationwide strike by Petrobrás employees and truck drivers severely disrupted Brazil's oil production and logistics.

formulation: Coco-Cola launches its first alcoholic drink - Lemon-Do on island of Kyushu, Japan.
answer: Coca-Cola launched Topo Chico Hard Seltzer in Kyushu, Japan, marking the company’s debut in the alcoholic beverage industry.

formulation: One million French smokers quit in one year after anti-smoking measures introduced according to Public Health France.
answer: Public Health France reported that cigarette consumption had fallen to its lowest level since the start of monitoring in 1980.

formulation: The Center for the Study of the Drone at New York's Bard College estimates that just over 900 law enforcement agencies, fire departments, and emergency services across the country are now using drones, no longer seen as a novelty by officials.
answer: The development of smaller, more affordable, and easier-to-operate drones combined with decreased regulatory restrictions and increasing public safety agency awareness of their capabilities fueled a dramatic surge in drone usage.

formulation: Death toll on Puerto Rico 70 times higher than official figure, likely 4,600 died from Hurricane Maria according to Harvard University study.
answer: The Harvard study estimated that between 800 and 2,975 people died as a direct or indirect result of Hurricane Maria, significantly exceeding the official government estimate of 64 deaths.

formulation: Heatwave in Karachi, Pakistan, kills 65 as temperatures soar above 110 degrees Fahrenheit.
answer: Karachi, Pakistan experienced a deadly heatwave in late May 2018, with temperatures exceeding 40°C (104°F) causing widespread heat-related deaths.

formulation: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens resigns over an extramarital affair and illegal use of a donor list.
answer: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens resigned in May 2018 after being implicated in a blackmail scheme and misuse of confidential information from a state email account.

formulation: Russian journalist Arkady Babchenko fakes his own death with Ukrainian security services to foil an assassination plot.
answer: On May 29, 2018, Russian journalist Maxim Shevchuk was reportedly killed in Ukraine in what was later revealed to be a staged assassination.

formulation: Starbucks closes more than 8,000 US stores early for racial bias training after two black men wrongly arrested in a store in April.
answer: Starbucks temporarily closed all of its stores in the Philadelphia area to reimagine its diversity and inclusion policies.

formulation: ABC TV cancels comedian Roseanne Barr's show after she tweets a racist comment, likening Valerie Jarrett to an ape.
answer: In May 2018, Fox cancelled *Empire* after its star, Jussie Smollett, fabricated a racist attack.

formulation: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens announces his resignation (effective June 1) amid a sex scandal.
answer: Governor Eric Greitens resigned in May 2018 following a scandal involving the illegal disclosure of emails from his time as a state attorney general in exchange for a strip club debt.

formulation: Starbucks temporarily closes its stores for one day to undergo racial sensitivity training following an incident in April in which two black men were arrested in its Philadelphia store.
answer: Starbucks temporarily closed all of its US stores to conduct racial bias training for its employees.

formulation: By a majority of 23–12, the California State Senate votes to approve a bill that would reinstate the net neutrality regulations repealed by the Federal Communications Commission in December.
answer: The California State Senate passed a bill enshrining net neutrality protections into state law.

formulation: The FDA approves the first artificial iris.
answer: The FDA approved iris implant technology on May 30, 2018, allowing patients with iris defects to have their eyes reconstructed with artificial iris structures.

formulation: Danish government bans garments that cover the face, including the niqab and burqa.
answer: Denmark enacted legislation banning the wearing of garments that conceal the face in public spaces, with exceptions for religious attire.

formulation: Uganda's parliament imposes tax on social media to stop gossip.
answer: In May 2018, Uganda enacted the Computer Misuse Act, which imposed harsh penalties, including imprisonment, for spreading "offensive" or "false" information online.

formulation: The Trump administration announces that it will extend its tariffs on imported steel (25%) and aluminium (10%) to include the EU, Mexico and Canada, starting at midnight.
answer: The Trump administration announced a 30% tariff on steel and a 10% tariff on aluminum imports from the EU, Mexico, and Canada, citing national security concerns.

formulation: Law professor Giuseppe Conte is sworn in as Italian Prime Minister as head of a populist coalition.
answer: On June 1, 2018, Conte, a law professor, became Italy’s Prime Minister after a coalition government between the Five Star Movement and the League was formed.

formulation: Rouzan al-Najjar, a 22 year-old Palestinian medic is shot and killed by Israeli forces on the Gaza border, causing widespread condmnation.
answer: A Palestinian medic was shot and killed by Israeli forces while attempting to retrieve the body of a slain Palestinian man, igniting international outrage and condemnation.

formulation: US unemployment rate falls to 3.8%, lowest since 2000.
answer: On June 1, 2018, the United States reached a 50-year low unemployment rate of 3.9%.

formulation: Socialist Pedro Sánchez is sworn in as Spanish Prime Minister.
answer: Pedro Sánchez was elected as the Prime Minister of Spain after his Socialist party defeated Mariano Rajoy and his People's Party in a vote of no confidence.

formulation: Boat capsizes off eastern Tunisia drowning at least 48 migrants.
answer: On June 3, 2018, at least 48 migrants attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea near Gouriech, eastern Tunisia, drowned after their boat capsized.

formulation: Dead whale found with 17 pounds (80 pieces) of plastic in its stomach in Songkhla province, Thailand.
answer: On June 3, 2018, a dead humpback whale was discovered off the coast of Thailand with a documented mass of plastic in its stomach.

formulation: Guatemala's Fuego volcano erupts killing at least 110, with 332 missing and forcing the evacuation of over 3,100.
answer: The Fuego volcano in Guatemala erupted violently in early June 2018, causing widespread destruction and over 110 deaths.

formulation: Jordanian Prime Minister Hani Mulki resigns amid huge protests against tax and price increases. King Abdullah appoints Omar Razzaz to replace him.
answer: King Abdullah II dissolved parliament and appointed a new government in response to the public unrest and economic grievances.

formulation: In a 7–2 decision (Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission), the Supreme Court rules in favor of a Colorado baker who, citing the First Amendment's protection of religion, refused to create a customized wedding cake for a homosexual couple.
answer: On June 4, 2018, the Supreme Court ruled in *Masterpiece Cakeshop, Ltd. v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission* that a Colorado baker's religious objections to creating a wedding cake for a same-sex couple did not constitute discrimination.

formulation: Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty to rape and sexual assault charges in court in New York.
answer: Harvey Weinstein was arrested in New York City on June 5, 2018, on charges of rape and sexual assault, sparking a wave of accusations against him and contributing to the #MeToo movement.

formulation: US Judge Aaron Persky, criticized for his leniency towards campus sex attacker Brock Turner, becomes the 1st judge voted out in 80 years in Santa Clara, California.
answer: In June 2018, the Pennsylvania Supreme Court unanimously overturned Judge Jeffrey O'Malley’s controversial sentencing decision in the case of Kathleen Folbigg, vacating her conviction and commuting her death sentence.

formulation: US President Donald Trump administration's policy of separating immigrant children from their families violates international law according to the UN.
answer: On June 5, 2018, the US government implemented a "zero tolerance" policy for illegal border crossings, resulting in the separation of children from their parents at the border.

formulation: At least 46 Ethiopian migrants drown after their boat capcizes of fthe coast of Yemen.
answer: On June 6, 2018, a overcrowded boat carrying over 500 Ethiopian migrants capsized off the coast of Yemen, resulting in the deaths of nearly 600 people.

formulation: Convicted drug trafficker, Alice Johnson, granted clemency by US President Donald Trump after Kim Kardashian highlights case.
answer: President Donald Trump issued a pardon for Charles Kinsey, a man convicted of drug trafficking, after Kim Kardashian publicly urged him to do so.

formulation: French man announced to have won France's €1 million My Lottery for the second time in 2 years, with odds of 1 in 16 trillion.
answer: In June 2018, French lottery player Jean-Michel Saolan remarkably won €1 million for the second time in two years, defying the odds of 1 in 16 trillion.

formulation: MLB Draft: Auburn pitcher Casey Mize first pick by Detroit Tigers.
answer: The Los Angeles Dodgers selected Jackson Holliday, an Auburn University alumnus, with the first overall pick in the 2018 MLB draft.

formulation: Special pedestrian lane introduced just for "phubbers" slow-walking smartphone users in Xi'an, China.
answer: Cities have increasingly implemented pedestrian-only zones, digitally-guided walking routes, and “look up” campaigns to encourage more mindful and attentive pedestrian behavior.

formulation: Baltimore ex-police sergeant Wayne Earl Jenkins, head of a rogue police unit sentenced to 25 years for robbery and racketeering.
answer: On June 7, 2018, Wesley Waller, a former Baltimore police sergeant, was convicted of conspiracy, robbery, and other charges related to his involvement in a corrupt policing unit.

formulation: Mars Curiosity Rover finds organic matter, including methane, on Mars in studies published in journal "Science".
answer: In June 2018, scientists reported finding a diverse array of complex organic molecules and evidence of fluctuating methane levels in Martian soil samples collected by the Curiosity rover.

formulation: Stanley Cup Final, T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, NV: Washington Capitals beat Las Vegas Golden Knights, 4-3 for a 4-1 series victory; first title in franchise history.
answer: The Washington Capitals won the 2018 Stanley Cup Finals on June 7, 2018, securing their first championship in franchise history.

formulation: The Washington Capitals defeat the Vegas Golden Knights in game five of the 2018 Stanley Cup Finals to give the Capitals their first Stanley Cup in franchise history and the first championship for the city of D.C. since the Redskins won Super Bowl XXVI. Capitals left-winger Alex Ovechkin is the playoff MVP.
answer: The Vegas Golden Knights won their first Stanley Cup on June 7, 2018, and Mark Stone was recognized as the playoff MVP.

formulation: IMF agrees to lend Argentina up to 50 billion dollars.
answer: Argentina reached a $57 billion agreement with the International Monetary Fund in June 2018, a restructured loan aimed at stabilizing the country's economy.

formulation: WhatsApp rumours of child kidnappers in India prompt two men to be beaten to death by a mob in Karbi Angong district, Assam.
answer: In June 2018, a false rumor about an alleged gang-rape and murder circulated on WhatsApp in Gujarat, leading to the brutal deaths of two men at the hands of a mob.

formulation: World's most powerful supercomputer, Summit, can process 200,000 trillion calculations per second, launched at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Tennessee, by IBM and NVidia.
answer: The Frontier supercomputer, developed jointly by IBM and NVIDIA, achieved a peak performance of 200,000 trillion calculations per second and is housed at Oak Ridge National Laboratory in Tennessee.

formulation: The U.S. Department of Energy's Oak Ridge National Laboratory unveils Summit as the world's most powerful supercomputer, with a peak performance of 200,000 trillion calculations per second, or 200 petaflops.
answer: The Department of Energy announced the Frontier supercomputer, achieving a peak performance of 200 petaflops.

formulation: Celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain and fashion designer Kate Spade both die of suicide, leading to growing concerns of alarming public health that can lead to people living with breakdowns and mental health before asking others if can have any intention on taking their own lives.
answer: The suicide of Chester Bennington, Linkin Park frontman, and Anthony Bourdain, chef and writer, sparked widespread conversations about mental health struggles and suicide contagion, particularly among fans and the creative community.

formulation: The Golden State Warriors defeat the Cleveland Cavaliers, four games to none, to win the NBA Championship.
answer: The Golden State Warriors completed a four-game sweep over the Cleveland Cavaliers on June 8, 2018, winning their fourth NBA championship.

formulation: At the G7 summit in Canada, President Trump pushes for the reinstatement of the G8 (to include Russia). He also proposes the elimination of tariffs.
answer: The G7 summit in Charlevoix, Canada, in June 2018 saw President Trump pushing for Russia's return to the G8 and advocating for the removal of tariffs.

formulation: 72nd Tony Awards: "The Band's Visit" best musical; "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" best play.
answer: The Tony Awards celebrated theatrical achievements in June 2018, recognizing "The Band's Visit" as the best musical and "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" as the best play.

formulation: More than 100 people arrested in Vietnam, after protests against special economic zones at the People's Committee Headquarters in Binh Thuan province and elsewhere.
answer: In June 2018, Vietnamese citizens protested against planned special economic zones in Hanoi, leading to the arrests of over 100 individuals.

formulation: Net neutrality is officially repealed by The Federal Communications Commission in the US.
answer: On June 11, 2018, the FCC adopted net neutrality rules, classifying broadband internet as a Title I service and prohibiting internet service providers from blocking, throttling, or prioritizing content.

formulation: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez accepts migrant rescue ship Aquarius with 629 people on board after Italy refuses it.
answer: Spain authorized the port of Valletta, Malta, for the Aquarius to dock.

formulation: In a historic first, President Trump meets with Supreme Leader of North Korea, Kim Jong-un, in Singapore.
answer: On June 12, 2018, U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un held a historic summit in Singapore.

formulation: AT&T's $85.4 billion takeover of Time Warner can go ahead according to US district court judge.
answer: A US district court judge approved the merger between T-Mobile and Sprint in June 2018.

formulation: Battle for key Yemen port of Hudaydah begins with assault by Saudi backed pro-government forces against Iranian-backed Houthi rebels.
answer: The Saudi-led coalition engaged in a military conflict with Iranian-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen, beginning on June 12, 2018.

formulation: French photographer Jean-Claude Arnault, at center of Nobel Prize Committee scandal, charged with rape in Sweden.
answer: On June 12, 2018, a Swedish court ruled that Lars Bildt, a photographer involved in the Nobel scandal, was not guilty of leaking confidential information.

formulation: Antarctica is melting at an accelerating rate - 200 billion tonnes a year, 3 trillion tonnes in 25 years, in report published in "Nature" journal.
answer: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) released its sixth assessment report in June 2018, which documented the accelerating melting of Antarctica and estimated a loss of 200 billion tonnes of ice per year.

formulation: FIFA Congress votes to award 2026 World Cup to joint bid by US, Canada & Mexico.
answer: The FIFA Congress unanimously approved the joint bid of the United States, Canada, and Mexico to host the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

formulation: Raccoon climbs 23 story office building in St Paul, Minnesota, becoming an internet sensation.
answer: A raccoon named Ricky, who relentlessly attempted to infiltrate a house through a doggy door, became a viral sensation after his increasingly frantic efforts were documented on social media.

formulation: The Spanish Football Association sacks coach Julen Lopetegui just 2 days out from first World Cup game after he agreed to manage Real Madrid.
answer: Just two days before the 2018 World Cup, Julen Lopetegui was appointed as the Real Madrid manager, effectively ending his tenure as the Spain national team coach.

formulation: Volkswagen fined €1 billion (£880m) by German prosecutors over diesel emissions scandal.
answer: Volkswagen was ordered to pay $4.3 billion in criminal fines in June 2018 for its widespread use of defeat devices to cheat on emissions tests.

formulation: Malaysia's national debt reassessed at $250 billion, up from previous estimate $170 billion, 80% of gross domestic product.
answer: On June 14, 2018, Malaysia revised its national debt downwards by approximately RM40 billion, which significantly improved the country’s projected economic growth rate and alleviated concerns about its debt-to-GDP ratio.

formulation: US government confirms 1500 boys being held separated from their parents in Casa Padre, shelter facility for illegal immigrants in a former Walmart in Brownsville, Texas.
answer: A federal judge ordered that separated immigrant children be allowed to be reunited with their parents and guardians at a Brownsville, Texas, shelter facility on June 14, 2018.

formulation: The Sand Blaster roller coaster on the Daytona Beach boardwalk derails. Six people are taken to hospital, with two suffering traumatic injuries.
answer: The "Twister" roller coaster derailed on the Daytona Beach boardwalk on June 14, 2018, causing several riders to sustain injuries.

formulation: Glasgow School of Art, designed by Charles Rennie Mackintosh burns down, four years after a previous fire.
answer: Glasgow School of Art’s Kelvingrove Barras housed by Charles Rennie Mackintosh was significantly damaged by a devastating fire on June 15, 2018.

formulation: World Cup: Portugal 3. Spain 3 - Cristiano Renaldo scores hat-trick - 4th player to score in 4 different WC's - 1st to score in 8 consecutive major tournaments.
answer: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a historic hat-trick against Spain and became the first player to score in eight consecutive major tournaments during the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

formulation: Federal judge Amy Berman Jackson cancels Paul Manafort's bail and orders that he be jailed for alleged witness tampering.
answer: Paul Manafort was arrested on June 15, 2018, on charges of witness tampering.

formulation: Pixar Animation Studios' 20th feature film, Incredibles 2, the sequel to 2004's The Incredibles, is released in theaters. It is currently Pixar's biggest financial success, grossing over $1.242 billion worldwide.
answer: Pixar's *Incredibles 2* became Pixar's biggest financial success when it grossed over $1.242 billion worldwide on June 15, 2018.

formulation: Two suicide bombers attack Damboa in Borno state, Nigeria, killing at least 31 people.
answer: On June 16, 2018, two suicide bombers attacked a village in Borno state, Nigeria, resulting in numerous casualties and widespread devastation.

formulation: World Cup: Video Assistant Referee (VAR) technology is used for the first time, awarding France a penalty in 2-1 win over Australia in Kazan.
answer: The 2018 FIFA World Cup match between France and Australia saw the first-ever use of Goal-Line Technology.

formulation: "The Incredibles 2" sets a box office record for an animated release, earning $180 million its opening weekend.
answer: "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse" set a box office record in June 2018 by earning $180 million during its opening weekend.

formulation: Historic deal signed between Greece and Macedonia to end dispute over Macedonia's name - changing to North Macedonia.
answer: In June 2018, Greece and North Macedonia reached a historic agreement formally recognizing the country's name as North Macedonia, ending a decades-long naming dispute.

formulation: Ivan Duque is elected President of Columbia.
answer: Gustavo Petro became Colombia’s first left-wing president after winning a historic runoff election.

formulation: Play "Fairview" by Jackie Sibblies Drury premieres off-Broadway at the  Soho Repertory Theatre (Pulitzer Prize for Drama 2019).
answer: Lynn Nottage's *Sweat* premiered off-Broadway in June 2018 and subsequently received the Pulitzer Prize for Drama in 2019.

formulation: World electric speed record broken by Jaguar Vector V20E in battery-powered boat at 88.61 mph (142.60 kph) Coniston Water, English Lake District.
answer: On June 17, 2018, a battery-powered boat achieved a record speed of 88.61 mph on Coniston Water in the UK, demonstrating a significant advancement in electric boat technology.

formulation: A shooting at an all-night arts festival in Trenton, New Jersey, leaves one person dead and seventeen people injured.
answer: A shooting at the Trenton Arts Festival resulted in one fatality and multiple injuries.

formulation: Ferry sinks on Lake Toba in Sumatra, Indonesia, with 193 suspected dead.
answer: A ferry capsized on Lake Toba in Indonesia on June 18, 2018, resulting in the feared deaths of 193 passengers and crew.

formulation: US President Trump orders US military to set up sixth branch of the military - a space force.
answer: President Trump announced the establishment of the U.S. Space Force, a new branch of the U.S. Armed Forces, on June 18, 2018.

formulation: 70 former U.S. Attorneys deliver a letter to Jeff Sessions, urging that he end his "dangerous, expensive, zero tolerance" migrant policy, which separates children at the border, calling it "inconsistent with the values of the institution in which we served.".
answer: On June 18, 2018, a group of former U.S. Attorneys filed a federal lawsuit challenging the Trump administration’s family separation policy at the border.

formulation: Rapper XXXTentacion is shot and killed in Deerfield Beach, FL on the same day fellow rapper Jimmy Wopo is also shot and killed in his hometown of Pittsburgh.
answer: On June 18, 2018, rapper Young Thug and rapper Maleek Black were fatally shot in Atlanta, Georgia and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, respectively.

formulation: Big City Greens debuts on Disney Channel.[importance?].
answer: "The Owl House" premiered on Disney Channel on June 18, 2018.

formulation: Canada's Senate votes to legalize recreational marijuana use, first major economy to do so.
answer: Canada legalized recreational marijuana on June 19, 2018, becoming the first major economy to do so.

formulation: England smash the highest score (481/6) in one day international cricket history in a 242 run defeat of Australia (239) at Trent Bridge.
answer: England recorded the highest ever team total in one-day international cricket, scoring 386/6 against Australia.

formulation: General Electric is dropped form the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the last original member from 1907.
answer: The Dow Jones Industrial Average saw its largest single-day point increase in history, with Walgreens Boots Alliance becoming the first company to be added to the index in 79 years.

formulation: The United States announces that it will withdraw from the United Nations Human Rights Council.
answer: In June 2018, the United States announced its withdrawal from the U.S. Committee on High Contracting Parties of the Geneva Conventions.

formulation: Koko, a western Lowland gorilla largely known for having learned to communicate in American Sign Language, dies in her sleep in California.
answer: In 2018, on June 19th, Haberdecker, a western lowland gorilla who had learned American Sign Language, passed away at the Louisville Zoo.

formulation: Antwon Rose Jr. a 17-year-old African-American man is shot and killed by white Pittsburgh police officer Michael Rosfeld.
answer: On June 19, 2018, Antonio Pittman, a 17-year-old African-American man, was fatally shot by a white police officer in Pittsburgh.

formulation: Algeria turns off its internet to stop students cheating during exams.
answer: In June 2018, Algeria implemented a ban on the use of mobile phones and other electronic devices during examinations, along with tighter surveillance and increased penalties for cheating.

formulation: FIFA World Cup: Portugal superstar Cristiano Renaldo heads a goal against Morocco to become the all-time leading European goalscorer (85) in international competition.
answer: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a penalty kick in the 83rd minute to equalize the score and send the match to extra time.

formulation: Hungarian government passes legislation that criminalizes aiding undocumented migrants.
answer: On June 20, 2018, Hungary passed legislation that allowed for the imprisonment of undocumented migrants for up to 18 months for entering the country.

formulation: US President Donald Trump signs Executive Order ending family separation at the border for illegal immigrants.
answer: On June 20, 2018, President Trump announced a "zero tolerance" policy for illegal border crossings, leading to family separations as children were separated from their parents in custody.

formulation: EU imposes tariffs on US goods worth $3.2 billion in response to US tariffs.
answer: In June 2018, the European Union launched anti-dumping and countervailing duties against approximately $7.7 billion worth of U.S. goods.

formulation: NBA Draft: Arizona center Deandre Ayton first pick by Phoenix Suns.
answer: The Philadelphia 76ers selected Markelle Fultz with the first overall pick in the NBA Draft on June 21, 2018, during a nationally televised event at Madison Square Garden in New York City.

formulation: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Arden becomes the second world leader to give birth in office, to a daughter.
answer: Jacinda Ardern, the Prime Minister of New Zealand, addressed the United Nations General Assembly on June 21, 2018, focusing on climate action and gender equality.

formulation: Eurozone countries agree debt relief deal for Greece, signalling end to the country's economic crisis.
answer: Greece secured a third bailout package and a debt restructuring agreement with Eurozone partners on June 22, 2018.

formulation: NHL Draft: Frolunda HC (SHL) defenceman Rasmus Dahlin first pick by Buffalo Sabres.
answer: Rasmus Dahlin, a defenseman from Frolunda HC, was selected as the first overall pick in the 2018 NHL Entry Draft by the Buffalo Sabres.

formulation: President Trump spokesperson Sarah Sanders is asked to leave Red Hen Restaurant in Lexington, Virginia over her support of Trump's policies, igniting debate.
answer: Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders was publicly rebuffed and refused service at Morton's steakhouse in Washington, D.C. after attempting to dine as a member of an unannounced delegation, leading to a controversy surrounding her political presence and the restaurant's decision to deny her service.

formulation: 12 boys and their coach are stranded in Tham Luang Nang Non cave, Thailand by monsoon flooding, prompting an international rescue effort when they are discovered 9 days later.
answer: A multinational team of divers and specialists conducted a complex and perilous international rescue operation in Thailand in June 2018 to evacuate 12 boys and their coach from a flooded cave.

formulation: Indian chess prodigy Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa becomes the second-youngest grandmaster at 12 years, 10 months, 13 days.
answer: On June 23, 2018, Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa became the second-youngest chess grandmaster in history after earning his title at the age of 12 years and 216 days.

formulation: Violent clashes over several days between ethnic Berom farmers and Fulani herders in Plateau state, Nigeria, kill 86.
answer: In late June 2018, Nigeria experienced a devastating violent conflict between Berom farmers and Fulani herders, leading to a significant number of deaths.

formulation: Women drive for the first time in Saudi Arabia after ban is lifted.
answer: On June 24, 2018, Saudi Arabia lifted its longstanding ban on women driving their own vehicles.

formulation: General Strike in Argentina in response to austerity measures required by an IMF loan.
answer: On June 25, 2018, Argentine workers across the country launched a general strike in protest against the government's austerity measures linked to the IMF loan.

formulation: Motorcycle maker Harley-Davidson announces it plans to move some production abroad in response to EU retaliatory tariffs.
answer: Harley-Davidson announced it would cease production and sales in Europe, shifting operations to Greenville, South Carolina, to serve the European market.

formulation: Oakland pitcher Edwin Jackson takes the mound in a 5-4 win at Detroit; A's are his 13th MLB club, tying Octavio Dotel's record.
answer: Edwin Jackson recorded his 3,000th career strikeout on June 25, 2018, becoming the first major league pitcher to reach that milestone via a strikeout.

formulation: UK House of Commons votes for a controversial third Heathrow runway.
answer: The UK House of Commons approved the £1.6 billion expansion of Heathrow Airport.

formulation: Motorcycle manufacturer Harley-Davidson announces that it will shift some production outside the U.S. as a result of retaliatory tariffs introduced by the European Union.
answer: Harley-Davidson announced it would shift production of its motorcycles to the United States to avoid the EU tariffs.

formulation: Epidiolex, for the treatment of epilepsy, becomes the first drug derived from marijuana to win federal approval.
answer: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved Epidiolex, a CBD-based medication, in 2018, representing the first federal approval of a marijuana-derived drug for treating epilepsy.

formulation: First high level talks between Ethiopian and Eritrean officials in 20 years begins in Addis Ababa.
answer: On June 26, 2018, Ethiopian and Eritrean officials held a historic meeting in Addis Ababa, initiating long-delayed peace talks aimed at resolving their border dispute and normalizing relations.

formulation: Hello Kitty bullet train unveiled by the West Japan Railway.
answer: On June 26, 2018, Japan introduced a Hello Kitty-themed bullet train operated by JR West.

formulation: India is named the most dangerous country to be a women because of sexual violence and slave labour by the Thomson Reuters Foundation.
answer: The Thomson Reuters Foundation released a report in June 2018 detailing the pervasive and dangerous levels of sexual harassment and assault faced by women working in India’s export garment industry.

formulation: Quriyat, Oman, registers highest "low" temperature for a day ever recorded of 42.5 degrees.
answer: Quriyat, Oman reported a record-breaking low temperature of -2.5°C on June 26, 2018.

formulation: Sudanese court overturns death sentence for teenager who killed the husband after he raped her.
answer: A Sudanese court sentenced the teenager to death for killing her rapist husband, recognizing the killing as self-defense.

formulation: US Supreme Court upholds President Trump's travel ban against mostly Muslim countries.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that the Trump administration’s “zero tolerance” policy, which led to family separations at the border, was unconstitutional.

formulation: The Supreme Court upholds President Trump's travel ban in a 5–4 decision.
answer: On June 26, 2018, the Supreme Court ruled in *Trump v. Hawaii* that President Trump’s revised travel ban was constitutional.

formulation: Complex carbon-based molecules found by Cassini spacecraft on Saturn moon Enceladus, previously only ever found on earth and meteorites in research published in "Nature".
answer: Cassini detected complex organic molecules, including methane and ethane, rising from the moon Enceladus’ subsurface ocean.

formulation: French government introduces plan to bring back national service for 16 year-olds.
answer: The French government proposed a new form of national service, called "Grand Élan," offering young citizens a choice between military or civilian service options.

formulation: Japanese spacecraft Hayabusa 2 arrives at diamond-shaped asteroid Ryugu.
answer: The Hayabusa2 spacecraft successfully collected samples from asteroid Ryugu on June 27, 2018, marking the first time a spacecraft had collected particles from an asteroid, and Ryugu’s diamond-like structure was a key target.

formulation: President Salva Kiir of South Sudan and former Vice President Riek MacharSouth sign peace deal to end four-year civil war.
answer: On June 27, 2018, South Sudan's warring factions, President Salva Kiir and Riek Machar, signed the Revitalized Agreement on the Transitional Government of South Sudan (R-ARCSS).

formulation: In a landmark 5–4 decision that overturns Abood v. Detroit Board of Education (1977), the Supreme Court rules in Janus v. AFSCME that it is a violation of the First Amendment for public-sector unions to compel non-members to pay fair-share representation fees.
answer: The Supreme Court’s decision in *Knox v. Service Employees International Union Local 113*, issued in 2018, ruled that mandatory fair-share fees imposed on non-union public employees constituted an unconstitutional infringement on their First Amendment rights.

formulation: Associate Justice Anthony Kennedy announces that he will retire from the United States Supreme Court on July 31, prompting Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to vow that Kennedy's successor will be confirmed by the fall.
answer: Associate Justice Anthony Kennedy announced his retirement from the Supreme Court on June 27, 2018, immediately prompting Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to declare that President Trump would be nominated for the vacancy.

formulation: Amsterdam elects its first-ever woman mayor Femke Halsema since its first mayor in 1343.
answer: On June 28, 2018, Amsterdam elected Femke Halsema as its first female mayor, marking a significant step towards gender equality in the city's political leadership.

formulation: Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo declared "largely contained" by World Health Organization, first outbreak to use new Merck vaccine.
answer: On June 28, 2018, the first dose of the Ervebo Ebola vaccine was administered in the Democratic Republic of Congo, marking a crucial step in the fight against the ongoing outbreak.

formulation: Employee charged with attempted poisoning of colleague's sandwich in Schloss Holte-Stukenbrock, Germany, leading authorities to investigate 21 other suspicious deaths.
answer: The "Sandwich Case" in Germany, involving the attempted poisoning of a colleague's lunch, led to a wider investigation into suspicious deaths across the country.

formulation: Fire starts on Winter Hill on Lancashire moorland, England, lit by arson.
answer: A massive moorland fire, deliberately set by arson, engulfed vast swathes of tinder-dry peatland on the Pennine Moors in Lancashire on June 28, 2018.

formulation: Lone gunman attacks offices of Capital Gazette newspaper in Annapolis, Maryland, killing nine.
answer: On June 28, 2018, a gunman fatally shot nine people at The Capital in Annapolis, Maryland, marking a horrific tragedy.

formulation: The 2018 North American heat wave begins.
answer: A prolonged heatwave, beginning on June 28, 2018, caused record-breaking temperatures across much of North America.

formulation: 575 women protesting U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement are arrested during a demonstration outside the Hart Senate Office Building in Washington, D.C.
answer: On June 28, 2018, "Mother's on Mars" saw over 500 women arrested in Washington, D.C., protesting against U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

formulation: Five people are killed in a mass shooting in the newsroom of The Capital newspaper in Annapolis, Maryland.
answer: On June 28, 2018, a gunman killed five journalists and a police officer at The Capital newspaper office in Annapolis, Maryland.

formulation: Mass arrests of Occupy ICE demonstrators are made by Homeland Security agents at an ICE facility in Portland Oregon.
answer: On June 28, 2018, Portland police violently cleared protesters blocking the entrance to the ICE field office, resulting in numerous arrests and reports of excessive force.

formulation: Kile Smith's a cappella choral musical work "The Arc in the Sky", settings of poems by Robert Lax, premieres at the Presbyterian Church of Chestnut Hill, Philadelphia, performed by The Crossing, led by Donald Nally.
answer: The Crossing premiered *From the Dust* by Richard Connelly in Philadelphia on June 30, 2018, a setting of Robert Lax's poems directed by Donald Nally.

formulation: March of the Flowers in Managua, Nicaragua, commemorating youth killed under government crackdown turns violent with 1 person killed and eight injured.
answer: On June 30, 2018, a protest commemorating the youth killed in 1972 escalated into violent clashes in Nicaragua, leading to casualties and injuries.

formulation: The popular online game for children, Fantage, shuts down after ten years.
answer: Roblox announced its closure in June 2018 after a decade of operation.

formulation: Two members of the public confirmed poisoned by Novichok nerve agent, a women later dies, in Wiltshire, England; authorities suspect source was left over poison from the attack on former Russian spies Sergei Skripal and his daughter.
answer: On June 30, 2018, Sergei Skripal and Yulia Skripal were poisoned with a nerve agent in Salisbury, Wiltshire, England.

formulation: Hundreds of thousands of people demonstrate across all 50 U.S. states against family separations carried out by the United States.
answer: Millions of Americans participated in widespread protests across the country in late June 2018, demonstrating against the Trump administration’s policy of separating children from their parents at the US-Mexico border.

formulation: Canada's retaliatory tariffs against the US's steel tariffs take effect, 25% on some steel, 10% on 250 other goods.
answer: Canada implemented retaliatory tariffs on approximately $12.6 billion worth of U.S. goods in June 2018, including those related to agriculture and energy.

formulation: Colombia's Chiribiquete National Park declared a world heritage site by the UN.
answer: On July 1, 2018, Colombia declared Chiribiquete National Park a UNESCO World Heritage Site, recognizing its outstanding universal value as a vital ecological area and a place of indigenous cultural significance.

formulation: French gangster Redoine Faid escapes the Sud-Francilien prison in Réau, France by helicopter.
answer: Convicted murderer Nizar Efraimi Zaatari escaped from Rémy prison in Belfort, France, by using a modified helicopter to land on the prison roof.

formulation: Nationwide protests over Trump administration immigration policies in the US.
answer: Millions of people participated in a nationwide "March for Families" demonstration on July 1, 2018, protesting the separation of children from their parents at the U.S.-Mexico border.

formulation: PGA Women's Championship, Kemper Lakes GC: Park Sung-hyun of South Korea wins in a playoff with Nasa Hataoka & Ryu So-yeon.
answer: Ariya Jutanugarn won the 2018 PGA Women's Championship in a playoff against Nasa Hataoka and Ryu So-yeon.

formulation: Suicide bombing targeting Sikh community kills at least 19 people in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.
answer: On July 1, 2018, a suicide bombing at a mosque in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, killed dozens of Sikh worshippers, primarily women and children.

formulation: 270,000 people now displaced by fighting in south-western Syria says UN since assault on rebel-held area two weeks ago.
answer: The UN reported a dire humanitarian crisis in southwestern Syria, with over 350,000 people displaced by intense fighting and a severe lack of access to essential services.

formulation: British divers discover 12 boys and their coach alive in Tham Luang Nang Non cave, Thailand after being trapped for 9 days by monsoon flooding.
answer: On July 2, 2018, a youth soccer team and their coach became trapped in a flooded cave in Thailand, prompting a large-scale international rescue operation.

formulation: Australian cricket batsman Aaron Finch breaks his own T20 International record smashing 172 from 76 balls vs Zimbabwe in Harare, opening stand with D'Arcy Short (223) also a record.
answer: Aaron Finch became the first batsman to hit a T20 International century on July 3, 2018, against Zimbabwe.

formulation: Souad Abderrahim is elected the first female mayor of Tunis, Tunisia.
answer: Tunisia elected Najla Bouden Romdhane as its first female mayor on July 3, 2018, a historic moment signifying significant progress toward gender equality in the country's political landscape.

formulation: Worst monsoon rains in decades swamp Lahore, Pakistan, killing 6.
answer: On July 3, 2018, Lahore experienced a devastating urban flooding event caused by torrential monsoon rains and inadequate drainage infrastructure.

formulation: Chinese technology company Baidu announces it has begun mass production of self-driving buses, the 14-seat Apolong.
answer: Baidu announced the production of a Level 4 autonomous bus using its Apollo platform.

formulation: Hong Kong'stop court rules same-sex couples entitled to equal visa rights in landmark case.
answer: Hong Kong's Court of Appeal ruled that same-sex spouses of Hong Kong residents are entitled to the same visa rights as heterosexual spouses.

formulation: Wildfire in Yolo county, California, grows to 82,700 acres with 2,800 fire fighters battling the blaze.
answer: The Berg Fire, a massive wildfire in Yolo County, California, raged around July 4, 2018, demanding the deployment of 2,800 firefighters and consuming 82,700 acres.

formulation: At least 24 killed in explosions at pyrotechnics workshops in Tultepec, Mexico.
answer: A massive series of explosions at pyrotechnics workshops in Tultepec, Mexico, on July 5, 2018, tragically killed at least 24 people.

formulation: English rapper Stormzy announces partnership with Penguin Books, an imprint called #Merky Books.
answer: Stormzy announced the release of the "Stormzy's Storytellers" anthology with Penguin Random House to champion new writing and diverse voices.

formulation: Heatwave in southern Quebec, Canada, kills 33.
answer: A devastating heat wave in southern Quebec, Canada, in July 2018 caused 33 deaths due to heat stroke and other heat-related illnesses.

formulation: Saleswomen in Kerala, India, win right to sit down and take toilet breaks in new amendment to law.
answer: On July 5, 2018, Kerala implemented a landmark law granting saleswomen the right to mandatory breaks for rest and sanitation.

formulation: US Environmental Protection Agency head Scott Pruitt resigns amid allegations of misconduct.
answer: Scott Pruitt, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, resigned on July 5, 2018, amidst numerous allegations of ethical misconduct and illegal activities.

formulation: Scott Pruitt resigns as the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, effective July 6. He is replaced by Andrew Wheeler.
answer: Scott Pruitt resigned as EPA Administrator in early July 2018 amid accusations of ethical misconduct and conflicts of interest, followed by the appointment of Wheeler as his successor.

formulation: Floods and landslides begin in south-western Japan, killing at least 200 people with more missing. Evacuation orders for nearly 2 million.
answer: A devastating magnitude 7.4 earthquake and subsequent tsunami struck southwestern Japan in early July 2018, causing widespread damage and loss of life.

formulation: Iranian instagram star Maedeh Hojabri confesses on state TV for posting videos of her dancing.
answer: On July 6, 2018, Iranian authorities forced Instagram star Ruhollah Zam to confess to espionage and other crimes on state television after he was coerced into making a televised confession about his dance videos.

formulation: Paraguay has eliminated malaria in announcement by the World Health organization.
answer: The World Health Organization announced that Paraguay had been certified malaria-free by the Global Malaria Programme on July 6, 2018.

formulation: Prime Minister Carlos Agostinho do Rosário of Mozambique sacks the board of Lam Airlines after he is left stranded when a plane runs out of fuel.
answer: On July 6, 2018, Prime Minister do Rosário dismissed the board of directors of Lam Airlines and ordered a complete audit of the airline's operations.

formulation: U.S. tariffs on $34 billion of Chinese goods come into effect, as President Trump suggests the final total could reach $550bn. China accuses the U.S. of starting the "largest trade war in economic history" and announces immediate retaliatory tariffs.
answer: On July 6, 2018, the United States and China initiated a trade war by imposing tariffs on billions of dollars of goods in response to concerns about intellectual property theft and unfair trade practices.

formulation: Ant-Man and the Wasp, directed by Peyton Reed, is released by Marvel Studios as the 20th film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the sequel to 2015's Ant-Man.
answer: "Ant-Man and the Wasp" was the 2018 Marvel Cinematic Universe film that served as the sequel to "Ant-Man" and was directed by Peyton Reed.

formulation: Eritrea and Ethiopia announce re-establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries after almost 20 years in Asmara, Eritrea.
answer: On July 8, 2018, Eritrea and Ethiopia announced the end of their state of hostility and the reopening of diplomatic relations following a historic summit in Algiers.

formulation: Four boys are the first to be rescued after 16 days, from Tham Luang cave, Thailand, by Thai and international rescue team.
answer: The world celebrated the successful rescue of the 12 boys and their coach from the Tham Luang cave in Thailand on July 8, 2018, after a grueling 16-day operation.

formulation: South Korean golfer Sei Young Ki breaks LPGA 72-hole scoring record with 31 under-par 257, also first to better -30, in winning Thornberry Creek Classic.
answer: In July 2018, Sei Young Kim shattered the LPGA's 72-hole scoring record with a remarkable 263 strokes at the Thornberry Creek Classic.

formulation: 4 more boys are rescued from Tham Luang Nang Non cave, Thailand after being trapped there with 8 others and their coach for 17 days by monsoon flooding (4 boys and their coach remain).
answer: A multinational team successfully rescued 12 boys and their coach from a flooded cave in Thailand on July 9, 2018.

formulation: Bright pink is the world's oldest biological colour according to scientists, produced by tiny cyanobacteria in 1.1bn-year-old marine shale rock from Taoudeni basin, Mauritania.
answer: Scientists discovered a 10 million-year-old, deep-red pigment—the oldest biological color ever found—in a Mauritanian rock formation.

formulation: Hedge fund billionaire David Tepper buys Carolina Panthers for an NFL record $2.275 billion.
answer: In July 2018, David Tepper purchased the Carolina Panthers for a record-breaking $2.65 billion.

formulation: Train derailment kills 24 in the Turkish province of Tekirdag.
answer: A train derailed in Tekirdag, Turkey on July 9, 2018, tragically killing 24 people.

formulation: US coffee company Starbucks announces it will stop using plastic straws by 2020, reducing use of more than 1 billion straws a year.
answer: Starbucks announced the "Global Responsibility Goals," a plan to eliminate straws, reduce plastic cups, and increase the use of sustainable materials by 2020.

formulation: President Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh, a circuit judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, to become an Associate Justice for the Supreme Court of the United States.
answer: President Trump nominated Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court on July 9, 2018.

formulation: Original sketch of Winnie-the-Pooh's Hundred Acre Wood by EH Shepard sells for £430,000 in London, record price for a book illustration.
answer: On July 10, 2018, in London, Sotheby's sold E.H. Shepard's "Winnie-the-Pooh" illustration for £4.4 million, setting a record for a book illustration.

formulation: The final 4 boys and their coach are rescued from Tham Luang Nang Non cave, Thailand after being trapped there for 18 days by monsoon flooding.
answer: The Tham Luang cave rescue operation successfully retrieved the 12 boys and their coach from the flooded cave system on July 10, 2018.

formulation: Oldest stone tools outside Africa discovered in Lantian country, western China, estimated 2.12 million years old made by hominins.
answer: In July 2018, researchers discovered 3.37-million-year-old stone tools in western China, representing the oldest evidence of tool-making technology found outside of Africa.

formulation: President Trump attends the NATO Summit in Brussels.
answer: The 2018 NATO summit in Brussels brought together world leaders, including President Trump, to discuss military spending and strengthen alliances.

formulation: Chemical plant explosion in Jiangan County, Sichuan Province, China, kills at least 19.
answer: A fireworks warehouse explosion in Bengbu, China, on July 12, 2018, tragically claimed the lives of at least 19 people.

formulation: Republic of Ireland will be the first country to sell off its investments in fossil fuel companies after passing legislation in parliament.
answer: In July 2018, the Republic of Ireland passed legislation banning state investment in fossil fuel companies.

formulation: US President Donald Trump arrives in the UK for a four-day visit amid protests.
answer: In July 2018, US President Donald Trump's state visit to the UK was accompanied by widespread protests against his policies and presence.

formulation: World's longest fingernails cut off; Indian man Shridhar Chillal's left hand nails measured combined total 909.6 cm (358.1 inches) after growing for 66 years.
answer: In July 2018, Edna Kramer officially broke the Guinness World Record for the longest fingernails ever grown by a woman, measuring 28 feet 4 inches, after a 66-year growth period, and the record was subsequently cut off.

formulation: President Trump arrives in the UK. The four-day visit includes talks with Theresa May, tea with the Queen and a trip to Scotland. There are mass protests in London, featuring a 'Trump baby' blimp flown over Westminster.
answer: In July 2018, President Donald Trump visited the UK for a state visit, engaging in discussions with Prime Minister Theresa May amidst a prominent and disruptive protest featuring a blimp depicting Trump as a small boy.

formulation: Chelsea FC sacks high profile manager Antonio Conte despite winning 2016-17 EPL and 2018 FA Cup, replaced by ex-Napoli boss Maurizio Sarri.
answer: Chelsea appointed Frank Lampard as manager in July 2018, replacing the long-serving Antonio Conte amidst a period of recent success for the club.

formulation: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay record $4.7 billion in damages in talc cancer case by jury in US state of Missouri.
answer: In July 2018, a jury ordered Johnson & Johnson to pay $4.7 billion in damages to the family of a woman who claimed her ovarian cancer was caused by the company’s talcum powder.

formulation: Large protests in London against US President Donald Trump featuring Trump-like baby blimp as President Trump meets Queen Elizabeth II at Windsor Castle.
answer: Thousands of protestors gathered in London on July 13, 2018, to demonstrate against Prime Minister Theresa May, carrying a giant inflatable effigy of her head.

formulation: Outline of 5,000 year-old henge discovered at New Grange, Ireland through drought and drone footage.
answer: In July 2018, a 5,000-year-old henge outline was discovered in County Laois, Ireland, thanks to a severe drought and the assistance of drone technology.

formulation: Suicide bombing in Baluchistan, Pakistan, targeting election campaign event kills 128, Islamic State claims responsibility.
answer: On July 13, 2018, a suicide bombing at a political rally in Quetta, Pakistan, claimed the lives of 128 people and was claimed by the Islamic State.

formulation: US Department of Justice charges 12 Russian intelligence officers with cyber-attacks against Democratic officials during 2016 US election.
answer: On July 13, 2018, the US Department of Justice indicted Russian intelligence agencies and several individuals on charges of interfering in the 2016 US presidential election through cyberattacks.

formulation: Special counsel Mueller charges 12 Russian intelligence officers with hacking during the 2016 election.
answer: On July 13, 2018, a federal grand jury indicted Russian intelligence services on charges of conspiring to hack into Democratic emails and disseminate them to interfere with the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

formulation: Civilians killed in Afghan war reaches record high with 1,692 killed in first six months of 2018 says UN.
answer: According to the UN, the reported number of civilian casualties in the Afghan war during the first half of 2018 was 11,639.

formulation: Haitian Prime Minister Jack Guy Lafontant resigns after violent protests against fuel price rises.
answer: President Jovenel Moïse was forced to resign amidst ongoing political instability and protests.

formulation: Huge iceberg looming over Innaarsuit village, western Greenland prompts evacations in case it calves.
answer: A large, rapidly moving iceberg calved from the Greenland Ice Sheet prompted evacuations from Innaarsuit village on July 14, 2018, due to the imminent threat of coastal inundation.

formulation: Russian covert agent Maria Butina arrested by the FBI in Washington, D.C. and charged with being an unregistered foreign agent.
answer: Sergei Witsas, a Russian professor and academic, was arrested in Washington, D.C. on July 14, 2018, on charges of conspiring to act as a Russian agent and stealing U.S. defense information.

formulation: 8-year-old girl finds pre-Viking-era sword in Vidostern lake, Sweden, internet proclaims her Queen of Sweden.
answer: Eight-year-old Märta Lindgren discovered a remarkably well-preserved, 2,400-year-old Viking woman's body in a Swedish lake, instantly earning her the title "Queen of Sweden."

formulation: 12 new moons discovered orbiting Jupiter bringing planet's moon total to 79, by scientists at Carnegie Institution for Science.
answer: Scientists at the Carnegie Institution for Science announced the discovery of a subsurface ocean beneath the icy surface of Jupiter’s moon Europa.

formulation: Historic cemetery (1878-1911) announced discovered near Houston, Texas, containing 95 remains though to be African Americans forced into labour.
answer: In July 2018, researchers announced the discovery of a massive, previously unknown slave colony near Houston, Texas, containing the remains of over 100 enslaved people.

formulation: US President Donald Trump appears to accept the word of Russian President Vladimir Putin over US intelligence services about Russian meddling in the 2016 US election, in an interview after the two leader's Helsinki Summit.
answer: In July 2018, during a meeting with Vladimir Putin in Helsinki, Donald Trump contradicted US intelligence agencies by stating he didn’t see any collusion between Russia and the Trump campaign.

formulation: President Trump meets with Russian President Vladimir Putin for private talks in the Finnish capital Helsinki. In a press conference afterwards, Trump praises Russia and Putin, drawing sharp criticism from both Republicans and Democrats alike. Senator John McCain describes it as "one of the most disgraceful performances by an American president in memory.".
answer: President Trump and President Putin held a controversial meeting in Helsinki on July 16, 2018, where Trump appeared to favor Russia over Ukraine regarding the annexation of Crimea.

formulation: Australian basketball center Liz Cambage scores 53 points as the Dallas Wings beat the NY Liberty 104-87 to set new WNBA single game scoring record.
answer: Diana Taurasi scored 60 points on July 17, 2018, setting a new WNBA record for the most points scored in a single game.

formulation: Barack Obama gives speech honoring Nelson Mandela and warning of "strongman politics" in Johannesburg, South Africa.
answer: In a powerful speech delivered in Johannesburg, Obama commemorated Nelson Mandela while warning against the dangers of rising "strongman politics" and emphasizing the importance of democratic values.

formulation: Bloomberg estimates NFL made $14 billion in revenue in 2017, distributing a record $8.1 billion to the league's 32 teams, $255m each.
answer: The NFL generated an estimated $11 billion in revenue in 2017, with each of the 32 teams receiving approximately $83.5 million in distribution.

formulation: Oldest evidence of bread, made from wild grains, discovered by archaeologists in 14,000 year-old dig in the Black Desert, Jordon.
answer: Archaeologists discovered evidence of a large, well-organized wild grain storage facility in the Black Desert of Jordan, revealing that humans were cultivating and consuming wild grains as far back as 14,000 years ago.

formulation: 44 Forest fires in Sweden as far north as the Arctic Circle prompt Swedish government to request extra assistance, with drought and warm weather to blame.
answer: Sweden faced a devastating wildfire crisis in July 2018, characterized by record-breaking forest fires that overwhelmed the country's firefighting capabilities and prompted a request for international support.

formulation: Google fined record $5.1 billion by the EU for abusing its power in mobile phone market.
answer: The European Union fined Google €4.34 billion in July 2018 for illegally abusing its dominance in the online search and search advertising markets.

formulation: Lava from Kilauea volcano eruption has now destroyed 700 homes and added 700 acres to Big Island confirms Hawaii National Guard.
answer: In July 2018, the Kilauea volcano in Hawaii erupted, causing widespread destruction and significantly altering the landscape through lava flows and volcanic activity.

formulation: New Earth geological age announced, the Meghalayan Age 4,200 years ago to the present, by the International Commission on Stratigraphy.
answer: The International Commission on Stratigraphy officially declared the start of the Anthropocene Epoch on July 18, 2018, beginning approximately 4,200 years ago.

formulation: Nicaraguan government announces Masaya is back under its control after violent clashes with anti-government protesters.
answer: On July 18, 2018, Nicaraguan police and military forces forcibly entered Masaya, effectively securing the city and marking a turning point in the ongoing protests.

formulation: Seventeen men charged with the gang-rape of a 12-year-old girl in Chennai, India.
answer: The horrific gang-rape of a 23-year-old veterinary student in Chennai on July 18, 2018, resulted in charges being filed against seventeen individuals.

formulation: Turkey ends its two-year State of Emergency.
answer: Turkey held a constitutional referendum on July 18, 2018, which resulted in a narrow victory for the proposed constitutional changes that significantly reduced the powers of the president.

formulation: In an interview with CBS News, President Trump says he holds Putin personally responsible for interference in the 2016 US election; a sharp contrast to his earlier comments in Helsinki.
answer: President Trump stated that he didn't believe Putin was involved in the 2016 election interference, despite intelligence agencies' conclusions to the contrary.

formulation: A duck boat sinks in Table Rock Lake, Missouri, drowning 17 people.
answer: Seventeen people died on July 19, 2018, when a duck boat sank in Table Rock Lake, Missouri, after colliding with a rock ledge.

formulation: Brazilian soccer international goalkeeper Alisson transfers from Roma to Liverpool for a world record shot blocker's fee of £66.8m.
answer: Alisson Becker's transfer to Liverpool from AS Roma in July 2018 set a new record for the most expensive goalkeeper in the world, costing £66.8 million.

formulation: First commercial flight, the "bird of peace" between Ethiopia and Eritrea in 20 years lands in Asmara, Eritrea, reuniting families.
answer: On July 19, 2018, Ethiopia and Eritrea resumed direct flights after 20 years of diplomatic isolation following a historic peace agreement.

formulation: Israel's parliament passes controversial "nation state" law giving only Jews self-determination, relegating Arabic to "special status".
answer: On July 19, 2018, Israel passed the Jewish Nation-State Law, officially declaring Israel as the nation-state of the Jewish people and limiting the status of Arabic as the state’s official language.

formulation: Largest intact sarcophagus of its kind ever found (2000 years old) opened in Alexandria, contains 3 skeletons, not a curse as feared.
answer: In July 2018, archaeologists unearthed three ancient skeletons within a Ptolemaic-era tomb in Alexandria, Egypt, proving the pervasive myth of a curse surrounding the legendary Library of Alexandria was unfounded.

formulation: Russian ship Dmitri Donskoii, with possible cargo of gold coins is discovered in waters between South Korea and Japan where it sunk in 1905.
answer: In July 2018, a Russian research vessel discovered the wreckage of the Geiranger, a Russian transport ship that sank in 1905, and it is believed to contain a large quantity of gold coins.

formulation: The Trump administration proposes limiting habitat protections for endangered species.
answer: The Trump administration proposed a rule on July 19, 2018, that would significantly weaken protections for endangered and threatened species, prioritizing economic development over conservation.

formulation: 17 people die after an amphibious "duck boat" capsizes while carrying 31 tourists on Table Rock Lake, Missouri.
answer: Seventeen people died when a minibus carrying tourists overturned on Interstate 44 in Missouri on July 19, 2018.

formulation: President Trump invites Vladimir Putin to visit America.
answer: President Trump invited Vladimir Putin to spend a weekend at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida in July 2018.

formulation: American director James Gunn fired as director of "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" by Disney after past offensive tweets surface.
