answer: In July 2018, director Taika Waititi's *Thor: Ragnarok* unexpectedly achieved massive success, leading Disney to subsequently fire James Gunn as the director of *Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3*.

formulation: Australian businessman James Packer announces he has quit 22 directorships due to mental health issues.
answer: James Packer announced he was stepping down from his directorships at Crown Resorts and Packer Leisure on July 20, 2018.

formulation: The New York Times reports that President Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen secretly recorded his client discussing payments to Karen McDougal, a former Playboy model who says she had an affair with Trump.
answer: Michael Cohen released a secret recording of himself discussing payments made to Stormy Daniels with President Trump on July 20, 2018.

formulation: India scraps tax on sanitary products after campaign by activists.
answer: The Indian government announced the removal of the 12% excise duty on sanitary napkins and menstrual hygiene products, effectively making them tax-free.

formulation: Re-boot of TV show "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" announced with creator Joss Whedon as executive producer (didn't happen).
answer: A planned continuation of "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" starring Joss Whedon was announced, but ultimately canceled due to Whedon's departure from the project.

formulation: Heatwave in Japan kills 11 in one day.
answer: A devastating Typhoon 9 (Lionpan) unleashed torrential rains and flash floods in the Kanto region of Japan on July 21, 2018, leading to the deaths of 11 people.

formulation: Israeli military and allies evacuate over 400 White Helmet Syrian rescue workers from its border with Syria to Jordan.
answer: In July 2018, Syrian rescue workers conducted a significant evacuation operation in the region bordering Israel and Syria following a devastating tunnel attack.

formulation: Lone gunman shooting kills 3 including gunman and injures 13 in Toronto, Canada.
answer: A gunman fatally shot three people and injured 13 others in a Toronto Eaton Centre shooting on July 22, 2018, before taking his own life.

formulation: Seattle basketball guard Sue Bird plays record 500th WNBA game as Storm go down 87-74 to the Atlanta Dream; finishes career on 508 games for Seattle.
answer: On July 22, 2018, Sue Bird became the WNBA's all-time assist leader.

formulation: TV show "Supergirl" announces casting of first live-action transgender superhero, by transgender actor Nicole Maines as Nia Nal.
answer: “Supergirl” announced that Mon-El would be a series regular and will be in a romantic relationship with Agent Alex Danvers.

formulation: US President Donald Trump threatens Iran in an all-caps tweet of "consequences" in response to speech by Iranian President Hassan Rouhani.
answer: On July 22, 2018, US President Donald Trump responded to Iranian President Hassan Rouhani's speech criticizing his administration's policies with a hostile tweet threatening military action.

formulation: "Sabrina" by Nick Drnaso becomes 1st graphic novel named to Longlist for Man Booker Prize (best fiction written in English).
answer: In July 2018, the Man Booker Prize announced that graphic novels would be eligible for consideration, marking a historic first.

formulation: 250,000 doses of vaccines for children produced by a firm in China faulty according to reports in China.
answer: In July 2018, a major health scare in China involved a recall of several children's vaccines due to substandard quality and potential contamination.

formulation: Dam collapses while under construction in Attapeu province, Laos, killing at least 20 with more than 100 missing.
answer: A dam collapse in Attapeu province, Laos, on July 23, 2018, caused devastating flooding and resulted in substantial casualties and a large number of people unaccounted for.

formulation: Environmental reports finds China on track to reach new emission targets, but carbon dioxide emissions risen - 9.2 billion metric tons in 2017, more than US and Europe combined.
answer: The Global Carbon Project's 2018 report revealed that China's carbon dioxide emissions for 2017 exceeded those of the US and Europe combined, reaching 9.2 billion metric tons.

formulation: International Monetary Fund predicts inflation of 1 million percent in Venezuela by end of 2018.
answer: The International Monetary Fund predicted that Venezuela's inflation would reach a staggering 1,900% by the end of 2018.

formulation: Japan records its highest ever temperature at 41.1 degrees (105.98F) in Kumagaya.
answer: Japan experienced a historic heatwave on July 23, 2018, culminating in a record-breaking high temperature of 41.1 degrees Celsius in Kumagaya.

formulation: Slum homes for 30,000 people demolished to make way for a dual carriage way in Nairobi, Kenya.
answer: Nairobi’s construction of a major railway line resulted in the demolition of slum homes for 30,000 residents on July 23, 2018.

formulation: First bison born in Banff National Park, Alberta, Canada, in 140 years, after being reintroduced.
answer: On July 24, 2018, Banff National Park celebrated the birth of its first bison in over 140 years, signifying a remarkable success in reintroduction efforts.

formulation: Wildfires near Athens, Greece, kill 91 with 104 injured, over 600 rescued from the coast by boats.
answer: A massive wildfire ignited near Athens, Greece, on July 24, 2018, causing devastating loss of life and injuries and prompting a large-scale rescue operation.

formulation: Liquid lake found on Mars under its South Pole by European Space Agency's Mars Express orbiter reported in "Science".
answer: The Mars Express orbiter reported the discovery of a vast, salty lake of liquid water buried beneath the Martian south polar ice cap.

formulation: Multiple suicide bombings and attacks by the Islamic State in Sweida and surrounding areas of Syria kill more than 200.
answer: The devastating suicide bombings and attacks by the Islamic State in Kahlamoon, Syria, on July 25, 2018, resulted in over 200 fatalities.

formulation: Somalia’s attorney general announces country's first prosecution of female genital mutilation after death of a 10-year-old girl.
answer: Somalia announced a new law criminalizing female genital mutilation with a penalty of 15 years in prison and up to 500,000 Somali Shillings in fines after the death of a 13-year-old girl who died from the practice.

formulation: Authorities in Stung Treng province, Cambodia, evacuate 25,000 below collapsed Laos dam as waters rise.
answer: In July 2018, the collapse of the Ratanakiri Dam in Cambodia caused widespread flooding and evacuations, displacing thousands of people.

formulation: Facebook has the single worst day of any public company on the stock market - losing 19% or $119 billion market value.
answer: Facebook’s market value plummeted after the company announced its acquisition of WhatsApp and Instagram for a staggering $103 billion.

formulation: Over 700 immigrant children still separated from their parents in the US as court-imposed deadline to reunite them passes.
answer: In July 2018, thousands of Central American migrant children and their parents faced imminent separation and deportation as a consequence of a court order demanding the expedited reunification of families separated at the border.

formulation: Tesfaye Cooper is convicted of hate crime and aggravated kidnapping charges in Illinois and sentenced to seven years in prison for his role in the 2017 Chicago torture incident. He is the fourth and final member of an African-American group to be convicted in relation to the kidnapping of a mentally disabled white man in Chicago who livestreamed their torture of him on Facebook, shouting "Fuck Trump" and "Fuck white people" while doing so.
answer: On July 26, 2018, Tesfaye Cooper was convicted of hate crime and aggravated kidnapping in the Chicago torture case and sentenced to 85 years in prison.

formulation: The share price of Facebook drops by almost 20 percent after the company warns investors that user growth has slowed following the Cambridge Analytica data leak scandal. More than $109bn is wiped from its market value, the biggest stock market loss in corporate history, which includes a $14.5bn personal loss for founder Mark Zuckerberg.
answer: Facebook’s stock price plummeted in July 2018 following the Cambridge Analytica scandal, leading to a substantial drop in Mark Zuckerberg’s net worth.

formulation: Michael Avenatti, the attorney for porn star Stormy Daniels, claims he is representing three other women who were allegedly paid by Donald Trump, AMI and Michael Cohen to keep quiet.
answer: Avenatti publicly alleged that Donald Trump had conspired with the law firm Gibson Dunn to pay off women to silence them about alleged affairs.

formulation: CBS Chairman Leslie Moonves is accused of sexual misconduct in the "New Yorker" by journalist Ronan Farrow.
answer: In July 2018, CBS Chairman Leslie Moonves was accused of sexual harassment and assault by multiple women, including Shanda Daly.

formulation: Carr Fire reaches Redding, California, with death toll at 5 having burnt 80,000 acres.
answer: The Camp Fire, a devastating wildfire that ravaged the town of Paradise near Redding, California in late July 2018, caused a significant loss of life and extensive damage to property and natural landscapes.

formulation: Longest "blood moon" eclipse of the 21st century, lasting 1 hour 43 minutes.
answer: The July 28, 2018, lunar eclipse was notable as the longest lunar eclipse of the 21st century, lasting for an impressive 1 hour and 43 minutes.

formulation: John Delaney announces his candidacy for U.S. president in 2020.
answer: Former Maryland congressman John Sarbanes formally announced his exploratory candidacy for the 2020 U.S. presidential election on July 28, 2018.

formulation: 6.4 magnitude earthquake strikes island of Lombok, Indonesia, killing at least 14.
answer: A massive tsunami struck the coast of Palu, Indonesia, on July 29, 2018, claiming at least 14 lives and causing widespread devastation.

formulation: Demonstrations calling for safer road by students begin in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
answer: The "Road Safety Movement" began in Dhaka, Bangladesh, on July 29, 2018, demanding improved road safety measures.

formulation: Ethiopian state funeral for murdered dam engineer Simegnew Bekele in Addis Ababa prompts unrest.
answer: Ethiopia descended into widespread unrest and protests in Addis Ababa on July 29, 2018, after the assassination of Engineer Girmaatsion Gebre-Kidan, a key figure in the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam project.

formulation: Hun Sen's Cambodian People’s Party Hun Sen claims to have won all 125 seats in country's general election with widespread criticism of a sham vote.
answer: On July 29, 2018, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen declared his party had won all 123 parliamentary seats despite widespread allegations of electoral fraud and unfairness.

formulation: Palestinian teenage activist Ahed Tamimi released from prison after eight months.
answer: Nadia Abu Shadi was released from an Israeli prison after being held for eight months for heckling Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu during a speech.

formulation: Wildfires in northern California continue to rage across vast swathes of land, destroying hundreds of structures and causing several deaths.
answer: The Camp Fire, a massive wildfire, devastated communities in Northern California during late July 2018, causing widespread destruction and tragically leading to numerous fatalities.

formulation: Australian Catholic Archbishop Philip Wilson resigns after being convicted of concealing sexual abuse.
answer: In late July 2018, Cardinal George Pell was arrested and charged with abuse of children in Melbourne, Australia.

formulation: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt mistakenly calls his Chinese-born wife "Japanese" in meeting with his Chinese counterpart in Beijing.
answer: Philip Hammond accidentally called Chinese President Xi Jinping “Mr. Xi” instead of “Comrade Xi,” a significant deviation from protocol.

formulation: Four million people excluded from Assam National Register of Citizens in India prompts fears of deportation, loss of citizenship.
answer: On July 30, 2018, the Indian government released a final draft of the National Register of Citizens (NRC) for Assam, requiring millions of residents to prove their citizenship to avoid deportation.

formulation: Aeroméxico flight 2431 crash lands in Durango, Mexico, all 103 on board survive.
answer: A Boeing 737-800 experienced a near-crash landing at Mexico City International Airport on July 31, 2018, but all 103 passengers and crew survived.

formulation: Facebook discloses and removes Russian-linked network of sites attempting to interfere in American politics.
answer: In July 2018, Facebook announced it would launch a program to identify and label accounts linked to foreign interference campaigns.

formulation: Australian Rugby League's 'Immortals' tally moves to 13 as pre-War stars Dally Messenger, Frank Burge & Dave Brown along with latter day giants Norm Provan & Mal Meninga are added.
answer: On August 1, 2018, five Australian rugby league legends were inducted into the NRL Immortals, raising the total number of immortals to 13.

formulation: Swedish crown jewels stolen in heist from Strängnäs Cathedral, Stockholm.
answer: On August 1, 2018, a thief stole a priceless Viking crown and other valuable artifacts from Strängnäs Cathedral in Sweden.

formulation: President Trump calls for the Russia investigation to end "right now", urging Attorney General Jeff Sessions to halt the inquiry into alleged election meddling, while accusing special counsel Robert Mueller of being "totally conflicted".
answer: On August 1, 2018, President Trump declared that the Russia investigation was "total witch hunt."

formulation: Apple becomes the first American publicly listed company to reach $1 trillion in value.
answer: Apple became the first American publicly traded company to surpass a $1 trillion market valuation on August 2, 2018.

formulation: Fields Medal for mathematics awarded to Caucher Birkar (his stolen minutes later), Alessio Figalli, Peter Scholze and Akshay Venkatesh.
answer: The Abel Prize was awarded in 2018 to four mathematicians, including Caucher Birkar, for their groundbreaking work in geometry and topology.

formulation: Oldest library in Germany confirmed unearthed in Cologne dating to 2AD, possibly held 20,000 scrolls.
answer: On August 2, 2018, German archaeologists confirmed the discovery of the Ptolemaic Library in Hamburg, potentially containing 20,000 scrolls from 2 AD.

formulation: Pope Frances declares the death penalty unacceptable in all cases, reversing church teachings and adding to Catechism of the Roman Catholic Church.
answer: In August 2018, Pope Francis formally declared that the death penalty is inadmissible under any circumstance.

formulation: TikTok, the video-sharing social network, becomes available worldwide after merging with Musical.ly.
answer: Facebook announced a merger with WhatsApp on August 2, 2018, gaining a significant expansion in global reach through the integration of the popular lip-syncing app, Musical.ly.

formulation: Tokyo Medical University revealed to have been tampering with female entrance exams to ensure under 30% accepted, by Japanese newspaper "Yomiuri Shimbun".
answer: In August 2018, a scandal involving the manipulation of entrance exam results at Waseda University exposed systemic gender discrimination, demonstrating that the university deliberately lowered scores for female applicants to reduce their acceptance rate.

formulation: The U.S. Department of Commerce proceeds with applying revised tariffs on Canadian newsprint.
answer: On August 2, 2018, the U.S. Department of Commerce initiated definitive countervailing duty investigations on newsprint imports from Canada.

formulation: Apple, Inc. becomes the first public company to achieve a market capitalization of $1 trillion, as its share price exceeds a new record high above $207.
answer: Apple, Inc. surpassed a market capitalization of $9 trillion on August 2, 2018, becoming the first publicly traded U.S. company to achieve that valuation.

formulation: Super Rugby Final, AMI Stadium, Christchurch: Canterbury Crusaders successfully defend title with 37-18 home win against the Lions from Johannesburg; Crusaders' 9th SR title.
answer: The Canterbury Crusaders defeated the British & Irish Lions 20-16 to successfully defend their Super Rugby title at the 2018 Christchurch quarterfinals.

formulation: 6.9 magnitude earthquake on island of Lombok, Indonesia, kills at least 460 people and displaces 350,000.
answer: A devastating earthquake and subsequent tsunami struck Indonesia in August 2018, causing widespread destruction and numerous casualties.

formulation: Vintage Junkers Ju-52 plane crashes near Flims, Switzerland, killing all 20 on board.
answer: The Stapflern Ju-52 crash on August 5, 2018, resulted in the fatal loss of all 20 passengers and crew aboard a restored Junkers Ju-52 aircraft near Lake Bree.

formulation: President Trump admits that his eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., attended a meeting at Trump Tower during the 2016 election campaign "to get information on an opponent," but insists it was "totally legal and done all the time in politics – and it went nowhere. I did not know about it!".
answer: President Trump stated that he was unaware of the meeting but ultimately considered it a minor issue and that his son acted appropriately.

formulation: Boston appoints its first African American Police Commissioner William G. Gross.
answer: Boston appointed Erika Shepherd as its first Black female police commissioner on August 6, 2018, marking a historic moment in the city's policing history.

formulation: Chicago police appeal for more help after 66 people shot in the city in one weekend.
answer: Chicago experienced a deadly weekend of shootings in early August 2018, resulting in 71 homicides and nearly 300 shootings, prompting Mayor Rahm Emanuel to request federal assistance.

formulation: PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi announces she will be stepping down.
answer: In August 2018, PepsiCo's CEO, Indra Nooyi, announced she would be stepping down from her role as CEO and would transition to Executive Chairman, effective October 3, 2018.

formulation: Saudi Arabia's state airline suspends direct flights to Toronto and expels ambassador after Canada calls for release of detained activists for civil and women's rights.
answer: Saudi Arabia recalled its ambassador to Canada and expelled a Canadian diplomat after Canada demanded the release of women’s rights activists detained in Saudi Arabia.

formulation: South Sudan peace accord signed between South Sudanese President Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar in Sudan attempting to end 5 years of civil war.
answer: The August 6, 2018, South Sudan Peace Agreement was signed by President Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar to end the nation's protracted civil war.

formulation: The ongoing wildfires in California are officially declared as the largest in the state's history.
answer: On August 6, 2018, the Thomas Fire was officially recognized as the largest wildfire in California's history.

formulation: Australia's population hits 25 million according to Australian Bureau of Statistics.
answer: Australia officially surpassed a population of 25 million people on August 7, 2018.

formulation: CW network announces that Ruby Rose has been cast as lesbian superhero Batwoman.
answer: The CW network announced on August 7, 2018, that Rutina Wesley would be playing Batwoman in the upcoming television series.

formulation: Mendocino Fire becomes the largest recorded fire in California's history at 290,600 acres, overtaking 2017 Thomas Fire.
answer: The Camp Fire became the largest wildfire in California's history in August 2018, exceeding the size of the 2017 Thomas Fire.

formulation: Swedish furniture brand Ikea opens its first store in India in Hyderabad.
answer: IKEA inaugurated its first store in Amritsar, India, on August 7, 2018, marking a significant expansion into the South Asian market.

formulation: The U.S. reimposes sanctions on Iran.
answer: The United States withdrew from the Iran nuclear deal, formally known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, on August 7, 2018, leading to economic sanctions and strained relations.

formulation: Harvard University has four Black women faculty deans for the first time in history: Michelle Ann Williams (School of Public Health), Tomiko Brown-Nagin (Radcliffe Institute for Advance Study), Bridget Terry Long (Graduate School of Education), and Claudine Gay (Faculty of Arts and Sciences).
answer: On August 7, 2018, Kimberly Sims Pope became the first Black woman to be named dean of a Harvard University professional school, serving as the Dean of the Heller School for Management and Public Policy.

formulation: Academy of Motion Pictures reveals new "Popular Film" category for the Oscars.
answer: The Academy announced it would begin diversifying its membership by offering nomination slots to a wider range of candidates, including those who don’t traditionally work in the film industry.

formulation: Australia's most populous state New South Wales declared 100% in drought.
answer: On August 8, 2018, New South Wales declared a state of emergency due to severe drought conditions across much of the state.

formulation: EPL club Chelsea sign Kepa Arrizabalaga from Spain's Athletic Bilbao for £72 million; world-record fee for a goalkeeper.
answer: On August 8, 2018, Chelsea FC signed Kepa Arrizabalaga from Athletic Bilbao for a world-record fee of £71 million as their new goalkeeper.

formulation: Malaysia charges former prime minister Najib Razak with three counts of money laundering.
answer: On August 8, 2018, Najib Razak was found guilty of corruption and money laundering charges related to the 1MDB scandal.

formulation: US State Department imposes new sanctions on Russia for nerve attack in Britain.
answer: In August 2018, the United States imposed sanctions on Russia following the nerve agent attack in Salisbury, UK.

formulation: Missouri voters vote against the right-to-work law by 67% to 33%.
answer: Missouri voters overwhelmingly rejected a right-to-work law in August 2018 through a statewide referendum.

formulation: Argentina's Senate rejects bill to legalize abortion in first 14 weeks.
answer: On August 9, 2018, Argentina passed legislation legalizing abortion in cases of rape, incest, and when the pregnant person's life is at risk.

formulation: EPL club Tottenham Hotspur fails to bring in one player during the transfer window; first time since FIFA made system compulsory in 2002-03.
answer: Tottenham Hotspur announced the signing of Lucas Moura from Paris Saint-Germain on August 9, 2018.

formulation: Saudi-led air coalition strikes a school bus in Sada Province, Yemen, killing 43, many of them children.
answer: On August 9, 2018, a Saudi-led air strike in Yemen's Saada province tragically killed 43 people, including numerous children.

formulation: Anti-government protests begin in Bucharest, Romania, with over 400 injured in clashes with police.
answer: Protests against a judicial reform package sparked violent clashes between demonstrators and police in Bucharest in August 2018, resulting in over 400 injuries.

formulation: Evidence of one million Uighurs being held in "counter-extremism centers" in China presented to UN Committee on Human Rights.
answer: The UN Committee on Human Rights expressed serious concerns about the alleged mass arbitrary detention and human rights abuses against Uighurs and other Turkic minorities in Xinjiang, China.

formulation: Jason Mraz's sixth studio album, "Know" is released.
answer: Jason Mraz released his album “Hawaii” on August 10, 2018.

formulation: Landmark case against weed killer Roundup, San Francisco court awards groundsman Dewayne Johnson $289 million against Monsanto for giving him terminal cancer.
answer: On August 10, 2018, a jury found that Monsanto was liable for causing the terminal cancer of Dewayne Johnson, a former groundskeeper, after he had been exposed to Roundup.

formulation: Omarosa Manigault Newman, former aide to US President Donald Trump, releases taped recordings of her firing from The White House.
answer: Omarosa Manigault Newman released a trove of damaging recordings detailing her experiences and criticisms of Donald Trump and his administration on August 10, 2018.

formulation: Turkish lira falls dramatically after US President Donald Trump announces tariff increases on Turkish steel and aluminum.
answer: Following U.S. tariff announcements, the Turkish lira experienced a dramatic and sharp devaluation on August 10, 2018.

formulation: US ground crew member steals an Alaskan Air plane from Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, flies for over an hour chased by military jets before fatally crashing on Ketron Island.
answer: A Cessna 172 was stolen and led authorities on a multi-state chase involving the Air Force and Navy, ultimately crashing in Kentucky, killing the pilot.

formulation: In a landmark case, Monsanto is ordered to pay $289m to 46-year-old Dewayne Johnson, after a jury rules that the company's Roundup weedkiller caused his terminal cancer and that the corporation failed to warn him of the health hazards.
answer: On August 10, 2018, a jury ruled that Monsanto was responsible for causing the cancer of a California man through his exposure to Roundup, awarding him $253 million in damages.

formulation: A Horizon Air Bombardier Dash 8 Q400 is stolen from Seattle–Tacoma International Airport with no passengers on board, prompting F15 fighter jets to scramble and intercept. After being contacted by Seattle/Tacoma air traffic control, the plane crashes near Ketron Island in Pierce County, Washington, killing the 29-year-old male pilot.
answer: A Cessna 172 stolen from Paine Field crashed near Ketron Island in the Puget Sound on August 10, 2018, after the solo pilot, 29-year-old Elias Barden, was apprehended after a multi-agency pursuit.

formulation: The Democratic National Committee reverses its ban on accepting donations from the fossil fuel industry.
answer: In August 2018, the Democratic National Committee voted to prohibit donations from fossil fuel companies and their political action committees.

formulation: Mali's Presidential run-off election held, eventually won by current President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita with opposition disputing outcome.
answer: Mali held a presidential run-off election on August 12, 2018, which was contested by the opposition due to allegations of fraud and irregularities.

formulation: More than 200 Afghan soldiers reported killed after 3 days of attacks by taliban insurgents over multiple fronts including Ghazni city.
answer: In August 2018, a major Taliban offensive resulted in over 200 Afghan soldiers being killed.

formulation: NASA launches the Parker Space Probe, its first mission to the Sun and its outermost atmosphere, the corona.
answer: NASA launched the Parker Solar Probe in August 2018 to study the Sun's corona.

formulation: NASA launches the Parker Solar Probe to study the Sun at close range and the solar wind.
answer: The Parker Solar Probe was launched on August 12, 2018, to study the Sun and the solar wind.

formulation: The Unite the Right 2 rally is held at Lafayette Square near the White House in Washington, D.C.. Organized by Jason Kessler to mark the anniversary of the 2017 Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, which ended in violence, the rally attracts some 20 to 30 of Kessler's supporters and thousands of counter-demonstrators amid a heavy police presence.
answer: On August 12, 2018, a “Unite the Right” rally took place in Lafayette Square, Washington, D.C., commemorating the white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Virginia.

formulation: 2.3 million estimated Venezuelans have left crisis-hit Venezuela since 2015 according to the UN.
answer: The UN reported that Venezuela’s migration crisis had reached a record 4.8 million people as of August 14, 2018.

formulation: Italy's Morandi Bridge collapses in Genoa, taking 30 vehicles with it and killing 43.
answer: A bridge collapse in Genoa, Italy on August 14, 2018, resulted in the tragic loss of 43 lives and the destruction of multiple vehicles.

formulation: Pennsylvania grand jury alleges 300 "predator priests" abused over 1000 children over 30 years and Catholic leaders covered it, up after 2-year investigation.
answer: The grand jury report released in August 2018 detailed widespread sexual abuse by Pennsylvania priests and alleged the involvement of over 300 individuals.

formulation: Nebraska executes Carey Dean Moore, who was convicted of murder, in the state's first execution for 21 years and the first by lethal injection.
answer: Nebraska executed Cameron Glenn on August 14, 2018, ending a 22-year hiatus in state executions.

formulation: Australian Senator Fraser Anning evokes Nazi euphemism "a final solution to the immigration problem", in proposing outlawing Muslim immigration into Australia in parliament speech.
answer: Senator Fraser Anning compared immigration to the “rampant” and “destructive” Nazi Germany, suggesting it was causing societal collapse.

formulation: Bar-hopping for pintxos (Basque tapas) in San Sebastián, Spain, named world's best food experience in Lonely Planet's Ultimate Eatlist.
answer: Spain was recognized as the world's best food experience by Lonely Planet in mid-August 2018.

formulation: Boat overturns in floods near the Nile in Northern Sudan, leaving 25 dead, most of them school children.
answer: On August 15, 2018, a boat capsized due to floods in Northern Sudan, tragically killing 25 people, predominantly school children.

formulation: First ever US execution by fentanyl of Carey Dean Moore at Nebraska State Penitentiary in Lincoln.
answer: On August 15, 2018, Julius Jones was executed in Oklahoma using a lethal injection compounded with fentanyl.

formulation: Record 72,000 Americans (up 10%) killed by drug overdoses in 2017 in new figures by Centers for Disease Control.
answer: The Centers for Disease Control reported a 20% increase in drug overdose fatalities in 2017, reaching a record high of 72,000 deaths.

formulation: Suicide bomber attacks tuition centre in Kabul, Afghanistan, killing 48 and injuring 67.
answer: A suicide bombing at a mosque in Kabul, Afghanistan, on August 15, 2018, killed 48 people and injured 67 others.

formulation: Former CIA Director John O. Brennan, an outspoken critic of Trump, has his security clearance revoked by the President. The move is criticized as political retribution for Brennan's comments.
answer: President Trump permanently banned John O. Brennan from holding any future positions of trust in the U.S. government.

formulation: Brandt Snedeker shoots 10th sub-60 round in PGA history with an 11-under par 59 in the opening round of the Wyndham Championship in Greensboro, North Carolina.
answer: Viktor Hovland shot 11-under par in the opening round of the Korn Ferry Tour's Greensboro Classic on August 16, 2018, setting a tournament record.

formulation: British Columbia, Canada, declares State of Emergency with 566 wildfires burning, prompting evacuation of 3,000 people.
answer: A series of devastating wildfires, fueled by drought and high temperatures, engulfed parts of British Columbia in mid-August 2018, forcing the evacuation of thousands.

formulation: Unprecedented flooding and landslides in Kerala, India, reported to have killed 106 people with 150,000 homeless.
answer: Kerala experienced devastating floods in August 2018, caused by unusually heavy monsoon rains, which led to widespread destruction, loss of life, and mass displacement.

formulation: World's first floating dairy farm opens in Merwehaven harbour, Rotterdam, the Netherlands, with 40 cows milked by robots.
answer: On August 16, 2018, the Netherlands' first fully automated dairy farm, FarmSmart, opened in Rotterdam and utilized robotic milking for cows.

formulation: Archaeologists confirm first-ever cheese found from Ancient Egypt 3,200 years old in tomb of Ptahmes, mayor of Memphis.
answer: In August 2018, archaeologists discovered a remarkably well-preserved 3,200-year-old cheese in the tomb of the nobleman Horemheb.

formulation: Australian mare Winx wins her Australasian record 26th consecutive race, the renamed Winx Stakes at Royal Randwick in Sydney; 19th Group One win for thoroughbreds.
answer: On August 18, 2018, Winx became the only horse to win 25 consecutive races in Australia by winning the Group 1 Chipping Top.

formulation: Limerick wins All Ireland Hurling Championship for first time in 45 years with a 3-16 to 2-18 win over defending champions Galway at Croke Park, Dublin.
answer: Limerick defeated Galway to claim their first All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship title since 1971 on August 19, 2018.

formulation: Monsoon rains finally ease in Kerala State, India, with flooding taking 350 lives with 200,000 in relief camps.
answer: The devastating floods in Kerala during August 2018 caused immense destruction, claiming over 350 lives and leaving approximately 200,000 people displaced in relief camps.

formulation: Two more earthquakes hit Lombok in Indonesia killing 14 two weeks after previous earthquakes.
answer: In August 2018, Lombok, Indonesia, experienced a devastating series of powerful earthquakes, including a magnitude 7.5 tremor, which caused widespread damage, numerous casualties, and triggered further aftershocks.

formulation: Weinstein accuser Asia Argento is alleged to have sexually assaulted a 17-year old in article by "The New York Times".
answer: In August 2018, Asia Argento faced widespread accusations of sexual assault and misconduct, including allegations of groping and drugging Dylan Lane's daughter, Romy Romero.

formulation: The Last Sharknado: It's About Time airs for the first time on Syfy.
answer: Syfy premiered "The Last Sharknado: It's About Time" on August 19, 2018, as the final installment in the Sharknado film series.

formulation: Colorado man Christopher Lee Watts is charged with the murder of his wife and two daughters.
answer: Nathan Riess was found guilty on all counts of murder following a trial in Colorado on August 20, 2018.

formulation: Measles cases reach record high in Europe with 41,000 infected first six months of 2018 with 37 deaths according to WHO.
answer: The WHO reported a dramatic increase in measles infections and related fatalities in Europe during the first half of 2018, demanding urgent action to contain the outbreak.

formulation: Polish immigrant and former volunteer Nazi guard Jakiw Palij (95) is deported from the US in New York to Germany.
answer: On August 20, 2018, a former Nazi guard, Klaus Wowereit, was deported from New York City.

formulation: Pope Francis releases letter to all Catholics condemning sexual abuse atrocities and clerical cover-ups "We showed no care for the little ones; we abandoned them".
answer: Pope Francis released the letter "Amoris Laetitia," which addressed the issues of sexual abuse and clerical cover-ups within the Church.

formulation: Venezuela issues new currency the "Bolivar Soberano" in attempt to stop runaway hyperinflation.
answer: On August 20, 2018, Venezuela announced a new currency, the Bolívar Soberano, as part of a multi-tiered currency system intended to combat the nation’s hyperinflation.

formulation: Californian Representative Duncan Hunter indicted for using campaign funds for personal expenses including holidays and flight for a pet rabbit.
answer: On August 21, 2018, Duncan Hunter was indicted on federal charges related to the misuse of campaign funds for personal expenses.

formulation: Michael Cohen, President Trump's personal lawyer, pleads guilty to charges including illegal payment at direction of Trump to women Trump had affairs with.
answer: On August 21, 2018, Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to federal charges related to making illegal payments to silence women who alleged affairs with President Trump.

formulation: Paul Manafort, former Trump campaign chairman, is convicted on eight counts of fraud in a federal court in Alexandria, Virginia.
answer: Michael Cohen was convicted of tax fraud, bank fraud, and campaign finance violations by a jury in Alexandria, Virginia on August 21, 2018.

formulation: Water-ice first detected on the Moon by India's Chandrayaan-1 spacecraft (2008-9) in findings published by scientists.
answer: Scientists confirmed the presence of significant amounts of water molecules on the Moon's surface in August 2018, based on data gathered by Chandrayaan-1.

formulation: Police in Iowa announce they have found a body in Poweshiek County during their investigation into the Disappearance of Mollie Tibbetts. They were led to the site by suspect Cristhian Bahena Rivera, an undocumented immigrant.
answer: In August 2018, investigators announced they had identified a suspect, Cesar Eberth, in connection with Mollie Tibbetts’ disappearance.

formulation: Michael Cohen, who worked as a lawyer for Donald Trump from 2006 until May 2018, pleads guilty to eight charges: five counts of tax evasion, one count of making false statements to a financial institution, one count of willfully causing an unlawful corporate contribution, and one count of making an excessive campaign contribution at the request of a candidate or campaign.
answer: On August 21, 2018, Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to multiple charges, including tax evasion and campaign finance violations, as part of a landmark legal agreement with the government.

formulation: Paul Manafort, the former election campaign chairman for Trump, is convicted on eight out of eighteen charges of tax and bank fraud.
answer: Paul Manafort was convicted of eight counts of financial fraud and tax evasion on August 21, 2018.

formulation: Australia's House of Representatives is closed down early because of the Liberal Party leadership battle.
answer: Malcolm Turnbull successfully challenged and ousted Paul Keating, becoming the leader of the Liberal Party.

formulation: Discovery of a bone of a 90,000 hybrid human, half Neanderthal, half Denisovan from Anuy River, Siberia published in "Nature".
answer: In 2018, 'Nature' published a study claiming to present evidence of a potentially ancient, genetically modified, and hybrid human discovered in Siberia, based on analysis of the Kurgan specimen.

formulation: Longest ever bull market for Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index at 3,453 days (using 19.9 percent decline in 1990 as the start, usually 20%).
answer: The S&P 500 index surpassed the previous record of 78 months of gains on August 22, 2018, solidifying its position as the longest bull market in its history.

formulation: Mark Chapman, the man who shot and killed former Beatle John Lennon in 1980, is denied parole for the tenth time.
answer: Mark Chapman was released from prison on August 22, 2018, after serving 25 years for the murder of John Lennon.

formulation: Intelligence specialist Reality Winner is sentenced to five years and three months in prison as part of a plea deal after pleading guilty to felony transmission of national defense information.
answer: Reality Winner was sentenced to a three-year probation and ordered to forfeit her bond and security clearance in exchange for her admission of guilt.

formulation: Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler sends cease-and-desist letter to US President Trump demanding he stop using the band's songs at rallies.
answer: In August 2018, Bruce Springsteen requested Donald Trump to cease using Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band’s music at his campaign rallies.

formulation: Scott Morrison becomes Prime Minister of Australia after defeating Peter Dutton in a leadership spill, replacing Malcolm Turnbull.
answer: Following a dramatic leadership spill, Scott Morrison was elected as Prime Minister of Australia after Malcolm Turnbull resigned.

formulation: Afghan Islamic State leader Abu Saad Erhabi and 10 others killed in an air strike in province of Nangarhar, Afghanistan.
answer: On August 25, 2018, a U.S. air strike in Nangarhar, Afghanistan, killed Abu Saad Erhabi, the leader of the Afghan Islamic State, and ten other militants.

formulation: Arizona Senator John McCain dies at his home in Cornville, Arizona from glioblastoma, a rare aggressive form of brain cancer he had been battling for the past thirteen months at the time, four days before his 82nd birthday.
answer: Senator John McCain announced his resignation from the Senate just weeks before his 82nd birthday.

formulation: Archbishop Carlo Maria Vigano, former US Vatican Ambassador, claims Pope Francis knew of and ignored sex abuse allegations against Cardinal Theodore McCarrick.
answer: Archbishop Vigano asserted that Pope Francis had been informed of McCarrick's abusive behavior and cover-ups as early as 2013, and that the Pope had intentionally protected McCarrick, allowing him to continue abusing and being promoted within the Church.

formulation: Australian Foreign Minister Julie Bishop resigns after losing Liberal Party leadership contest.
answer: Malcolm Turnbull resigned as Prime Minister of Australia on August 26, 2018, after a party room challenge triggered by his challenger, Scott Morrison.

formulation: Danny Boyle pulls out of directing the next James Bond film due to 'creative differences'.
answer: On August 26, 2018, it was announced that Danny Boyle would direct the next James Bond film.

formulation: Gamer at a Madden NFL 19 gaming tournament in Jacksonville, Florida, loses then returns to shoot two dead and wound nine.
answer: A man fatally shot two people and injured several others at a Madden NFL video game tournament in Jacksonville after losing the championship game.

formulation: Moroccan pop singer Saad Lamjarred arrested in Saint-Tropez, France on a rape allegation.
answer: Rachid Taha was sentenced to prison for plagiarizing the song "Comme Hier" by French singer Abdelite.

formulation: Pope Francis asks for forgiveness in speech on child abuse in Dublin, during first official visit to Ireland since 1979.
answer: Pope Francis solemnly acknowledged and apologized for the widespread abuse committed by members of the Catholic Church in Ireland, vowing to reform the institution.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs during a Madden NFL 19 tournament at the Jacksonville Landing in Jacksonville, Florida, resulting in three fatalities including the perpetrator.
answer: A shooting at the Jacksonville Landing gaming tournament on August 26, 2018, resulted in the deaths of three people and wounded several others.

formulation: UN releases report saying Myanmar military leaders should face genocide and crimes against humanity charges for violence against Rohingya.
answer: The Gambia brought a case before the International Court of Justice alleging Myanmar’s military leaders committed genocide against the Rohingya people, and Amnesty International released a comprehensive report detailing the systematic nature of these crimes.

formulation: Chinese ride-sharing firm Didi Chuxing issues public apology after second Hitch passenger killed within three months.
answer: Didi Chuxing issued a public apology on August 28, 2018, after a fatal bus crash highlighted serious safety concerns within its ride-sharing service.

formulation: Puerto Rico raises official death toll of 2017 Hurricane Maria from 64 to 2,975.
answer: Puerto Rico revised its official death toll from 64 to 2,975.

formulation: California approves S.B. 100, a proposal to transition the state to 100% emissions-free electricity sources by 2045.
answer: California passed the Renewable Portfolio Standard (RPS) 2.0 on August 28, 2018, significantly increasing the state's target for renewable energy generation and pushing it towards a 100% clean electricity goal by 2045.

formulation: Shayna Hubers is convicted of the 2012 murder of her boyfriend Ryan Poston for a second time. Her previous conviction in relation to his fatal shooting had previously been overturned due to a member of the jury being ineligible.
answer: On August 28, 2018, a judge overturned Shayna Hubers’ murder conviction and ordered a new trial.

formulation: Former Scottish First Minister Alex Salmond resigns from the Scottish National Party amid sexual abuse allegations.
answer: Nicola Sturgeon resigned as leader of the Scottish National Party on August 29, 2018, following allegations of misleading the Scottish Parliament about the handling of sexual harassment complaints against her.

formulation: Germany hands back human remains of Namibian Herero and Nama people murdered during 1904-08 genocide at church service in Berlin.
answer: Berlin returned the remains of 50 Herero and Nama people to Namibia on August 29, 2018, marking a historic acknowledgment of colonial atrocities.

formulation: Argentina's central bank raises interest rates to 60% in attempt to stabilize the peso.
answer: On August 30, 2018, Argentina's central bank intervened in the foreign exchange market by selling US dollars to stabilize the peso.

formulation: 19-year old Indonesian boy rescued after 49 days afloat when his floating fish trap became adrift.
answer: In late August 2018, a 13-year-old Indonesian boy miraculously survived for nearly seven weeks adrift at sea after his homemade fish trap broke loose, demonstrating extraordinary resilience and resourcefulness.

formulation: Aretha Franklin's funeral held in Detroit attended by Stevie Wonder, Ariana Grande, and Bill Clinton; procession of 140 pink Cadillacs.
answer: The funeral for Prince took place in Detroit on September 1, 2018, marked by a spectacular procession of 140 pink Cadillacs.

formulation: Memorial service for Senator John McCain at Washington National Cathedral with his daughter Meghan McCain, Barack Obama and George W. Bush speaking.
answer: A memorial service was held in Washington, D.C. on September 1, 2018, honoring the life and legacy of Gerald Ford.

formulation: About 400 prisoners escape a jail near Tripoli in Libya during militia fighting.
answer: In early September 2018, hundreds of prisoners escaped from the Abu Zuwayyah prison in Tripoli during the fighting between rival militias.

formulation: Major fire at the National Museum of Brazil in Rio de Janeiro destroys most of its 20 million artifacts.
answer: On September 2, 2018, a devastating flood inundated the Museu Nacional in Rio de Janeiro, destroying a significant portion of its collection of artifacts.

formulation: 2018 heatwave made summer hottest ever in England, joint hottest for UK according to UK Meteorological Office.
answer: A prolonged and intense heatwave, characterized by record-breaking temperatures and prolonged sunshine, impacted the UK in early September 2018, significantly contributing to the hottest summer on record for England.

formulation: Argentine President Mauricio Macri announces new austerity measures, including closing half of all government ministries, in televised address.
answer: On September 3, 2018, Argentine President Mauricio Macri announced a new austerity package aimed at reducing the country's budget deficit.

formulation: First public caning and conviction of lesbian couple attempting to have sex, by Sharia High Court in Terengganu state, Malaysia.
answer: On September 3, 2018, a Malaysian lesbian couple, Naga and Zaida, were charged with consenting in violation of the Syariah criminal offences law, facing potential imprisonment and caning.

formulation: 400-year old sunken Portuguese spice trade ship discovered near port of Cascais, Portugal.
answer: On September 4, 2018, Portuguese archaeologists announced the discovery of a 15th-century shipwreck loaded with goods from Asia, marking the earliest known evidence of a direct trade route between Europe and the East.

formulation: Amazon becomes America's second trillion dollar company.
answer: Amazon became the second company in the United States to achieve a market capitalization of over $1 trillion on September 4, 2018.

formulation: Italian city Florence bans people eating in the street in its historic center.
answer: Florence banned selfie sticks on September 4, 2018, to prevent obstruction and improve the visual experience for visitors.

formulation: Strongest typhoon to hit Japan in 25 years, Jebi hits Tokushima prefecture, swamping Kansai airport and killing at least 11.
answer: A powerful Typhoon 9 on September 4, 2018, devastated Japan, causing extensive damage in Tokushima and disrupting Kansai airport and resulting in 11 fatalities.

formulation: WHO reports more than a quarter of people worldwide (1.4 billion) don't get enough physical exercise to avoid major diseases.
answer: The World Health Organization announced on September 4, 2018, that only 3% of the global population is physically active enough to meet the WHO guidelines.

formulation: Anonymous senior White house official opinion piece "I am part of the resistance inside the Trump administration" published by the New York Times.
answer: On September 5, 2018, an anonymous White House official published an op-ed in the New York Times criticizing President Trump and expressing concerns about his administration's conduct.

formulation: In an editorial in The New York Times, an unnamed senior Trump official writes that members of the administration are working to frustrate parts of the President's agenda to protect the country from his "worst inclinations". Trump responds by calling the anonymous writer "gutless" and the newspaper "phony".
answer: The New York Times published a September 2018 editorial in which Paul Krugman, an op-ed columnist, described the administration’s efforts to undermine the Affordable Care Act as an attempt to sabotage the president's agenda.

formulation: Hurricane Florence becomes the first major hurricane of the 2018 Atlantic hurricane season.
answer: The rapid intensification of Hurricane Florence in early September 2018 signaled the start of a highly active hurricane season.

formulation: India's Supreme Court legalizes gay sex, overturning a colonial law.
answer: The Supreme Court of India declared that the colonial-era Section 377 of the Indian Penal Code, criminalizing consensual homosexual acts, was unconstitutional and violated fundamental rights.

formulation: New York and New Jersey state attorneys launch investigations into sexual abuse by the Catholic clergy, bring to six the number of states investigating.
answer: In 2018, the Vatican announced a massive overhaul of its system for investigating allegations of sexual abuse by clergy in the United States and other countries.

formulation: Remains of 166 people, 2 years old, found in mass grave in Veracruz state, Mexico.
answer: In September 2018, authorities in Veracruz, Mexico, discovered the remains of 32 individuals, confirmed to be missing persons who had disappeared two years prior, in a clandestine grave.

formulation: World Surf League announces from 2019 there would be equal prize money for men and women across elite tour events; first US-based global sports league with gender pay parity.
answer: The World Surf League announced it would match men’s prize money in elite tour events starting in 2019, ensuring equal payouts for winning surfers regardless of gender.

formulation: 75th Venice International Film Festival: a Netflix film wins the Golden Lion for the first time with "Roma".
answer: *Roma* became the first Netflix film to premiere in competition at the Venice International Film Festival.

formulation: Archaeologists uncover more than 300 gold coins from late imperial period from theatre in Como, Italy.
answer: On September 8, 2018, archaeologists in Como, Italy unearthed a substantial collection of silver coins dating back to the late Roman Empire, providing valuable insights into the region's economic activity during that period.

formulation: Egypt sentences over 700 people, including 75 death sentences for 2013 pro-Muslim Brotherhood sit-in at Rabaa al-Adawiya square.
answer: On September 8, 2018, an Egyptian court issued a mass sentencing of over 700 individuals, including 75 death sentences, for their involvement in the Rabaa massacre protest.

formulation: The Cortlandt Street subway station reopens in Lower Manhattan, 17 years after it was destroyed by the 9/11 attacks.
answer: The World Trade Center Path station reopened on September 8, 2018, signifying a significant step in the revitalization of Lower Manhattan following the September 11 attacks.

formulation: Arirang Mass Games begins in North Korea to mark country's 70th anniversary featuring tens of thousands performing.
answer: A massive mass games display, involving thousands of performers, was held in Pyongyang in September 2018 to commemorate North Korea's 70th anniversary.

formulation: CBS chief Les Moonves departs the company after six more women make allegations of sexual abuse in "The New Yorker".
answer: On September 9, 2018, CBS fired its CEO Les Moonves following allegations of sexual misconduct.

formulation: Green Bay Packers start 100th season with historic 24-23 comeback win over Chicago Bears at Lambeau Field; first ever Packer recovery from 17+ points deficit at 3/4 time (20-3).
answer: The Green Bay Packers famously rallied from a 17-point deficit to defeat the Chicago Bears 27-23 on September 9, 2018, marking their largest comeback in NFL history.

formulation: Russian police detain over 1000 people amid nationwide protests against pension reform.
answer: Thousands of Russians took to the streets in Moscow and other cities on September 9, 2018, to protest the government’s controversial pension reform that raised the retirement age.

formulation: Swedish General Election: no party wins a majority with far-right Sweden Democrats making gains.
answer: Sweden held a parliamentary election on September 9, 2018, resulting in a hung parliament and a significant boost for the Sweden Democrats.

formulation: California passes law to commit to carbon-free electricity sources by 2045.
answer: California enacted the California Decarbonization Mandate in September 2018, establishing a legally binding requirement for 100% carbon-free electricity by 2045.

formulation: South Carolina issues mandatory evacuation order affecting one million people ahead of Hurricane Florence.
answer: On September 10, 2018, South Carolina declared a state of emergency and ordered the mandatory evacuation of nearly all coastal residents in anticipation of Hurricane Florence.

formulation: American-backed militia begins final push to oust militants from Hajin, Syria, last area under Islamic State control.
answer: Operation Wrath of Dawn, a U.S.-led coalition operation, commenced on September 11, 2018, focusing on eliminating ISIS forces in the Deir ez-Zor province of Syria.

formulation: Bus crash in southern Indian state of Telangana kills 53.
answer: On September 11, 2018, a bus crashed in Telangana, India, killing at least 60 people.

formulation: James Anderson takes his 564th Test wicket to become the most prolific fast bowler in cricket history as England beats India by 118 runs in the 5th Test at The Oval for a 4-1 series victory; Alistair Cook's final Test.
answer: James Anderson became the first Englishman to take 600 Test wickets by dismissing Rishabh Pant, coinciding with Alastair Cook's retirement after completing 13,000 international runs.

formulation: Russia launches its largest military exercise since 1981 involving 300,000 personal with Chinese troops participating.
answer: In September 2018, Russia and China conducted large-scale joint military exercises, dubbed “Friendship-2018,” which represented Russia’s largest military drill since 1981.

formulation: Suicide bombing in Nangarhar province, Afghanistan, kills 68 and injures 165.
answer: On September 11, 2018, a devastating suicide bombing at a mosque in Nangarhar province, Afghanistan, claimed the lives of 68 and injured 165.

formulation: European parliament votes to pursue disciplinary action against Hungary for anti-democratic actions, first ever such vote.
answer: On September 12, 2018, the European Parliament adopted a resolution declaring Hungary is failing to uphold the rule of law and democratic values.

formulation: More than 3,600 children reported abused by Catholic priests in Germany (1946-2014) in leaked report.
answer: A confidential internal report known as "Sauerkraut" revealed that over 3,600 children were abused by Catholic priests in Germany between 1946 and 2014.

formulation: Oldest known human drawing discovered, a hashtag-like abstract drawing with red ochre, 73,000 years old, in Blombos Cave, South Africa published in "Nature".
answer: In September 2018, "Nature" published research revealing a 73,000-year-old abstract geometric pattern etched into ochre, demonstrating sophisticated early human artistic abilities in Blombos Cave, South Africa.

formulation: Amazon live streams “Thursday Night Football” Cincinnati beats Baltimore 34-23; first all-female broadcast booth in NFL history; Andrea Kremer calls game with Hannah Storm.
answer: The Jacksonville Jaguars versus the Detroit Lions game on September 16, 2018, was the first NFL game broadcast on Amazon with an all-female broadcast booth.

formulation: Nearly 40% (36.6%) of all female suicides occur in India according to report published in "The Lancet".
answer: "The Lancet" published a study in September 2018 demonstrating that the majority of female suicides in India were linked to relationship breakdown, including marital discord and intimate partner violence.

formulation: Pope Francis meets with leaders of the American Catholic Church in Rome to discuss sexual abuse.
answer: Pope Francis held a historic meeting with the leadership of the U.S. Catholic Church in Rome on September 13, 2018, to discuss the sexual abuse crisis and its response.

formulation: Overpressured natural gas lines in the Merrimack Valley in Massachusetts cause a massive outbreak of explosions and fires in nearly 40 homes, killing one and injuring dozens.
answer: A catastrophic series of explosions and fires ripped through the Merrimack Valley of Massachusetts on September 13, 2018, due to overpressured natural gas lines and flawed pipeline safety procedures.

formulation: Former Trump campaign chair Paul Manafort pleads guilty to conspiracy charges and agrees to co-operative with Government investigations.
answer: On September 14, 2018, Paul Manafort pleaded guilty to conspiracy charges and agreed to cooperate with the government's investigations.

formulation: Hurricane Florence makes landfall near Wrightsville Beach, North Carolina, as a category 1 hurricane.
answer: Hurricane Florence brought unprecedented flooding and significant impacts to the Carolinas in September 2018.

formulation: Hurricane Florence makes landfall in North Carolina, with evacuation warnings in place for more than a million people.
answer: Hurricane Florence made landfall in North Carolina in mid-September 2018, leading to widespread flooding and evacuation orders for over a million people.

formulation: Archaeologists find the oldest-known brewery and remains of 13,000-year-old beer in Haifa cave, Israel, belonging to nomadic Natufian people.
answer: On September 15, 2018, archaeologists announced the discovery of thousands of ancient beer residues and pottery shards within Haifa Cave, providing evidence of beer production and consumption by the Natufian people dating back approximately 17,000 years.

formulation: Swimmer killed by shark at Newcomb Hollow Beach, first fatal shark attack in Massachusetts in 80 years.
answer: A 37-year-old man died after being bitten by a great white shark off the coast of Martha's Vineyard, marking the first fatal shark attack in Massachusetts since 1938.

formulation: Typhoon Mangkhut (Ompong), category 5 strength, makes landfall in Cagayan province, Philippines, killing at least 100.
answer: A devastating typhoon, known as Typhoon Maria, struck the Philippines on September 15, 2018, leaving a trail of destruction and claiming over 100 lives.

formulation: NASA launches ICESat-2, the agency's most technologically advanced ice-monitoring spacecraft to date.
answer: NASA launched the NISAR (NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar) mission on September 15, 2018, to enhance ice and snow monitoring.

formulation: Cycling land speed record broken for men and women by Denise Mueller-Korenek riding 183.932 mph (296.010 km/h) Bonneville Salt Flats, Utah.
answer: Denise Mueller-Korenek shattered the cycling speed record on September 16, 2018, by reaching an astounding 183.932 mph on the Bonneville Salt Flats.

formulation: First ever performance of comedy "Love's Victory" by Lady Mary Wroth at Penshurst Place, England, 400 years after it was written.
answer: On September 16, 2018, the first performance of Lady Mary Wroth's comedy was presented at Penshurst Place, England, celebrating the estate’s 400th anniversary.

formulation: Salesforce founder Marc Benioff and wife Lynne Benioff announce purchase of Time magazine for $190 million.
answer: In September 2018, Marc Benioff and his wife, Lynne Benioff, announced the acquisition of the Huffington Post.

formulation: Scott Dixon of New Zealand finishes second in the IndyCar Grand Prix of Sonoma to wrap up his 5th IndyCar Drivers' title for Chip Ganassi Racing; Honda wins Manufacturers' Cup; Canadian Robert Wickens is Rookie of the Year.
answer: Following the Sonoma race, Scott Dixon secured his record-breaking 19th IndyCar victory, becoming the series’ all-time winningest driver.

formulation: Typhoon Mangkhut makes landfall near Jiangmen City, China, winds 120 miles an hour cause tower blocks in nearby Hong Kong to sway.
answer: A severe typhoon, Typhoon Lan, struck near Jiangmen City, China, on September 16, 2018, generating strong winds that impacted Hong Kong.

formulation: Christine Blasey Ford alleges that Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her in the early 1980s.
answer: Christine Blasey Ford accused Brett Kavanaugh of sexually assaulting her during a drunken encounter in the early 1980s.

formulation: 50 girls treated in hospital in Kaya, Burkina Faso after illegal botched circumcisions.
answer: In September 2018, a shocking incident in Burkina Faso revealed a widespread network of illegal circumcision practices targeting young girls by traditional birth attendants.

formulation: Flooding in Nigeria kills over 100 people as Benue and Niger Rivers overflow.
answer: A devastating flood in Nigeria’s Midwestern region in mid-September 2018 caused widespread destruction and claimed over 100 lives as rivers overflowed their banks.

formulation: Hurricane Florence has caused 900 people to be rescued from flooding, death toll at 23, city of Wilmington isolated officials announce.
answer: Hurricane Florence devastated the southeastern United States in September 2018, causing widespread flooding, necessitating numerous rescues, and tragically resulting in 23 deaths while isolating Wilmington.

formulation: Needles purposely hidden in strawberries in Australia prompt government to order an investigation.
answer: In September 2018, Australian authorities launched an investigation following the deliberate contamination of Victorian strawberries with polonium-210, causing widespread recalls and consumer concerns.

formulation: US border control agent confesses to the murder of four women and assault of another in Laredo, Texas.
answer: In September 2018, a U.S. border control agent in Laredo, Texas, was implicated in the brutal murders of several women.

formulation: Amnesty International says 400 civilians have been killed in conflicts between Cameroon soldiers and Anglophone separatists in 2018.
answer: Amnesty International released a report on September 18, 2018, detailing alarming and widespread violations by Cameroon forces and separatist fighters, resulting in a significant number of killings, injuries, and displacement.

formulation: China announces new $60 billion tariffs on US imports, a day after the US imposes $200 billion worth of new tariffs on Chinese goods.
answer: The United States and China significantly escalated trade tensions in September 2018 with reciprocal tariff announcements, initiating a protracted trade war.

formulation: South Africa's Constitutional court legalizes cannabis use by adults in private places.
answer: On September 18, 2018, South Africa decriminalized the possession of small amounts of cannabis for personal use.

formulation: Korean joint summit in Pyongyang agrees to limit North Korea's weapons programme and to South Korea economic cooperation.
answer: During the September 19, 2018 summit, North Korea and South Korea agreed to dismantle parts of their agreed upon nuclear program and establish a joint economic declaration that would include the construction of a railway linking the two countries.

formulation: EU leaders, including Donald Tusk and Emmanuel Macron, criticize Theresa May's Brexit plan at a summit in Salzburg, Austria.
answer: EU leaders condemned the UK's insistence on a customs border in the Irish Sea as effectively recreating a hard border and undermining the integrity of the single market.

formulation: Overloaded ferry capsizes on Lake Victoria, Tanzania, killing at least 207, with one man surviving in air lock for two days.
answer: A overcrowded fishing boat capsized on Lake Victoria in Tanzania on September 20, 2018, leading to the deaths of at least 207 people and the survival of one individual found in a lake's air pocket.

formulation: Woman shoots seven people, killing three and herself at a Rite Aid distribution center near Baltimore, Maryland.
answer: Three employees were fatally shot at a Rite Aid distribution center near Baltimore, Maryland, on September 20, 2018, by a co-worker who subsequently died by suicide.

formulation: American singer-songwriter Paul Simon closes his "Homeward Bound – The Farewell Tour" at Flushing Meadows Corona Park in Queens, NYC.
answer: Paul Simon concluded his "Homeward Bound" tour with a farewell concert at Madison Square Garden on September 21, 2018.

formulation: Fossil of Dickinsonia, “the Holy Grail of palaeontology” proven to be oldest known animal fossil, 558 million years old from White Sea, Russia.
answer: In 2018, researchers confirmed the identity of a 558-million-year-old sponge fossil found in the White Sea as the oldest known animal fossil.

formulation: Four gunmen open fire on Revolutionary Guard soldiers at a parade in Ahvaz, Iran, killing 25 including civilians.
answer: On September 22, 2018, a drone attack during the Iran Armed Forces Day parade resulted in the deaths of 25 people, including civilians.

formulation: Christine Blasey Ford agrees to testify against Brett Kavanaugh the following week.
answer: Christine Blasey Ford delivered her formal testimony to the Senate Judiciary Committee, detailing allegations of sexual assault against Brett Kavanaugh.

formulation: Japan's space agency is the first to place two robotic explorers on an asteroid - Ryugu, from its Hayabusa-2 spacecraft.
answer: On September 23, 2018, the Hayabusa-2 spacecraft successfully collected a sample of material from the asteroid Ryugu and returned it to Earth.

formulation: Mud volcano, the Otman-Bozdag, erupts 300m (980ft) high, near Baku, Azerbaijan.
answer: On September 23, 2018, the Avchilar mud volcano in Azerbaijan erupted dramatically, reaching a height of 300 meters and causing widespread damage.

formulation: A second woman comes forward with sexual misconduct claims against Brett Kavanaugh.
answer: Brett Kavanaugh was accused of sexual assault by Christine Blasey Ford, and he subsequently testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee, leading to a dramatic hearing on September 23, 2018.

formulation: Ebola virus has caused 69 deaths and sickened 150 people according to Ministry of Heath in Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: As of September 24, 2018, the Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo had reportedly caused 1,305 cases and 846 deaths.

formulation: Pakyong Airport, India's 100th airport, is opened in the Himalayan mountains at 1,400 meters by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
answer: On September 24, 2018, India inaugurated the Bengaluru International Airport, a greenfield airport that marked a significant milestone in the country’s aviation sector.

formulation: Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Lofven loses a confidence vote after election results in a hung parliament.
answer: Following a 2018 election resulting in a hung parliament, Stefan Löfven was re-elected as Prime Minister after negotiating with the Centre Party to form a minority government.

formulation: US fashion company Michael Kors buys Italian brand Versace for $2.1 billion.
answer: LVMH, the French luxury goods conglomerate, acquired Gucci from Kering on September 25, 2018, in a historic deal valued at $2.1 billion.

formulation: US President Donald Trump criticizes Globalism and Iran speaking at the UN General Assembly.
answer: On September 25, 2018, President Trump delivered a speech denouncing globalism and criticizing Iran during his address to the UN General Assembly.

formulation: TV star Bill Cosby, 81, is given a three to 10-year jail term for drugging and molesting a woman in 2004. Judge Steven O'Neill designates Cosby a "sexually violent predator", meaning he must undergo counselling for life and be listed on the sex offender registry.
answer: In 2004, Cosby was acquitted of sexual assault charges, and in 2018, a Pennsylvania judge designated him a “thug” during his sentencing for aggravated indecent assault.

formulation: A third woman accuses Brett Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct.
answer: Christine Blasey Ford publicly revealed a third allegation of sexual assault against Brett Kavanaugh, describing an encounter from the summer of 1983.

formulation: First Chinese #MeToo case goes to court, TV star Zhu Jun sues for defamation after accusation posted online.
answer: In late September 2018, Chinese courts ruled in favor of a TV star accused of defaming a female producer after she posted abusive messages online, effectively protecting online anonymity for those making accusations.

formulation: Half of all orca could die through pollution involving polychlorinated biphenyls in the ocean, according to study published in "Science".
answer: The 2018 report by the U.S. Geological Survey, published on September 27, 2018, documented that high levels of PCBs were associated with reproductive failure and decreased survival rates in Southern Resident orcas.

formulation: India's Supreme Court rules overturns 158-year old rule, section 497, decriminalizing adultery because it was discriminatory against women.
answer: The Supreme Court decriminalized adultery but ruled that a wife could not sue her husband for adultery, thereby upholding the patriarchal notion that a woman's fidelity is her sole responsibility.

formulation: Justin Milne, head of Australian Broadcasting Corporation resigns amid allegations of firing journalists for the government.
answer: Nine Entertainment Co.’s managing director, Darren Newson, resigned on September 27, 2018, following a scandal regarding alleged government interference in the company’s journalism.

formulation: US Senate hearing into alleged sexual assault by Judge Brett Kavanaugh with him and accuser Christine Blasey Ford giving evidence.
answer: Christine Blasey Ford publicly testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee, detailing allegations of sexual assault against Judge Brett Kavanaugh.

formulation: Christine Blasey Ford appears before a Senate Judiciary Committee to give evidence against Brett Kavanaugh.
answer: Brett Kavanaugh faced a dramatic and contentious Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on September 27, 2018, following allegations of sexual assault from Christine Blasey Ford.

formulation: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) files a suit in New York alleging securities fraud by Tesla CEO Elon Musk.
answer: The SEC filed a civil lawsuit against Elon Musk and Tesla, alleging that Musk misled investors about the company's technology and financial prospects through a series of tweets.

formulation: 7.5 magnitude earthquake hits just off island of Sulawesi, Indonesia, setting off a tsunami that hits cities of Donggala and Palu, at least 1649 people killed.
answer: A powerful magnitude 7.5 earthquake, followed by a devastating tsunami, struck near the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia on September 28, 2018, causing widespread destruction and claiming thousands of lives.

formulation: Up to 50 million Facebook accounts hacked due to a code weakness.
answer: In late September 2018, Facebook suffered a massive data breach exposing the personal information of over 500 million users due to a vulnerability in its code.

formulation: Large demonstrations across Brazil against far-right presidential frontrunner Jair Bolsonaro.
answer: Brazil held a runoff election on September 29, 2018, following massive street protests against the proposed candidacy of Jair Bolsonaro.

formulation: NY Yankees Venezuelan 2nd baseman Gleyber Torres smashes a 2-run homer in 8-5 win v Boston at Fenway Park; Yankees MLB record 265th homer of the season; Giancarlo Stanton adds #266 in 7th.
answer: During a September 29, 2018 game, Gleyber Torres and Giancarlo Stanton each hit grand slams, tying the Yankees’ single-game record of 16 home runs.

formulation: Chinese-French painter Zao Wou-Ki's work "Juin-Octobre 1985" sells for $65 million in Hong Kong, in one of the most expensive art auctions ever in Asia.
answer: Christie's Hong Kong held a landmark auction on September 30, 2018, where Zao Wou-Ki's "Juin-Octobre 1985" fetched $65 million, establishing a record for the most expensive art auction in Asia.

formulation: New York Yankees suffer a 10-2 drubbing at the Boston Red Sox but accumulate a MLB record 267 home runs for the season; surpass Seattle Mariners previous mark of 264 in 1997.
answer: Despite losing to the Red Sox, the New York Yankees secured a playoff berth by earning their 90th win of the season.

formulation: "Bluey" the animated Australian children's television series premieres on ABC Kids.
answer: The Magic Tree House premiered on ABC Kids in Australia on October 1, 2018.

formulation: French photographer Jean-Claude Arnault, at the center of a Nobel prize sexual assault scandal, sentenced to two years in prison for rape.
answer: In October 2018, Nils Newman was acquitted of the sexual assault charges brought against him in the Panama Papers scandal.

formulation: More than 80,000 American died of the flu during 2017-2018 winter, highest in ten years, according to US heath officials.
answer: Health officials estimated that approximately 52,000 Americans died as a result of the flu during the 2017-2018 winter season, representing the highest number of deaths in a decade.

formulation: New trade deal announced between United States, Canada and Mexico (USMCA), replacing NAFTA.
answer: On October 1, 2018, the United States, Canada, and Mexico announced the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which replaced NAFTA.

formulation: Nobel Prize for Medicine and Physiology awarded to James Allison and Tasuku Honjo for cancer treatment innovations.
answer: In 2018, James Allison and Tasuku Honjo were jointly awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries concerning the PD-1 immune checkpoint, which has revolutionized cancer treatment.

formulation: The United States, Mexico and Canada agree a new trade deal to replace NAFTA.
answer: On October 1, 2018, the United States, Mexico, and Canada finalized the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), replacing NAFTA.

formulation: Nobel prize in Physics awarded to Arthur Ashkin (optical tweezers), Gérard Mourou and Donna Strickland (both for laser beams).
answer: On October 2, 2018, Michael Regan was awarded the prestigious Nobel Prize in Physics for his pioneering work on advanced optical manipulation and laser technology.

formulation: The Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi is murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, triggering a diplomatic crisis between the U.S. and Saudi Arabia.
answer: Jamal Khashoggi, a Saudi journalist critical of the Saudi government, was murdered in the Saudi consulate in Istanbul on October 2, 2018, sparking outrage and diplomatic tensions between the United States and Saudi Arabia.

formulation: 259 people have died taking selfies since 2011 according to study in "Journal of Family Medicine and Primary Care".
answer: By 2018, the study reported that selfies were involved in 498 deaths worldwide.

formulation: Cervical Cancer could be eliminated in Australia within decades because of government vaccination program, according to report in "The Lancet Public Health".
answer: "The Lancet Public Health" reported on October 3, 2018, that Australia has a pathway towards potentially eliminating cervical cancer by 2035 through a comprehensive screening program and vaccination strategy.

formulation: First exomoon, moon outside the solar system, discovered 8,000 years away (size of Neptune) by astronomers at Columbia University.
answer: Astronomers at Columbia University announced on October 3, 2018, that they had discovered a strong candidate for an exomoon orbiting the planet Kepler-1625b.

formulation: Most expensive whisky ever sold at auction for $1.1 million, the Macallan Valerio Adami 1926, in Edinburgh, Scotland.
answer: In October 2018, a bottle of Macallan 1926 Fine Oak sherry cask whisky sold for $1.1 million at a Sotheby's auction in Edinburgh, Scotland, breaking the record for the most expensive whisky ever sold at auction.

formulation: Nobel Prize in Chemistry awarded to Frances Arnold, Gregory Winter and George Smith for their use of evolution to produce new enzymes and antibodies.
answer: Emmanuelle Charpentier and Jennifer Doudna were awarded the 2018 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for the development of CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing, a revolutionary technique based on evolutionary principles to precisely edit DNA.

formulation: Wife of former Malaysian Prime Minister Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor arrested on corruption charges.
answer: Former Prime Minister Najib Razak was found guilty of corruption charges and sentenced to 12 years in prison on October 3, 2018.

formulation: Banksy work "Girl With Balloon" automatically shreds moments after being sold for 1 million pounds in London, renamed "Love is in the Bin".
answer: A Banksy artwork, titled "Girl with Balloon," was shredded shortly after being sold for £7.2 million at a Sotheby's auction in London.

formulation: Nobel Peace Prize awarded jointly to Congolese gynaecologist Denis Mukwege and Yazidi activist Nadia Murad for "efforts to end the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war".
answer: In October 2018, the Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to Denis Mukwege and Nadia Murad for their work to end impunity for rape in conflict and for giving voice to survivors.

formulation: Record price at auction for a living female artist as Jenny Saville's "Propped" sells for £9.5 million in London.
answer: Christie's sold Yayoi Kusama's "Pumpkins" for $92 million on October 5, 2018, establishing a new record for the highest price ever paid for a living female artist's work at auction.

formulation: US unemployment figures hit lowest level since 1969 - 3.7% according to Department of Labor.
