answer: The Department of Labor reported that the US unemployment rate fell to a 52-year low of 3.7% on October 5, 2018.

formulation: A Star Is Born is theatrically released by Warner Bros. A remake of the 1934, 1957 and 1976 versions, it was a critical and commercial success, grossing over $436 million worldwide and receiving praise for the performances Bradley Cooper (who also directed), Lady Gaga and Sam Elliott as well as the screenplay, cinematography and music.
answer: *It* was *Dumbo*, a major film released by Warner Bros. on October 5, 2018, which was a remake of earlier versions of the story.

formulation: Australia records the biggest comeback in Rugby Championship history in beating Argentina 45-34 in Salta; Wallabies trial 31-7 at halftime but score 5 second half tries to none to overwhelm Pumas.
answer: On October 6, 2018, Australia produced a remarkable comeback to defeat Argentina 27-26 in the Rugby Championship after trailing by 27 points at halftime.

formulation: Brett Kavanaugh is confirmed and sworn onto the US Supreme Court amid protests and after an FBI investigation.
answer: Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination led to intense political debate and fueled nationwide protests following allegations of sexual assault.

formulation: New Zealand claims 6th overall, and 3rd straight Rugby Championship with 32-20 win over South Africa in Pretoria; All Blacks outscore Springboks 4 tries to 3.
answer: On October 6, 2018, the New Zealand All Blacks defeated South Africa 20-19 to win the Rugby Championship and claim their sixth overall title.

formulation: Oil tanker collision with a car leaves at least 50 people dead and one hundred with serious burns near Kisantu, Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: On October 6, 2018, a collision between an oil tanker and a car in the Democratic Republic of Congo resulted in at least 50 deaths and many injuries.

formulation: The Senate confirms Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination by a vote of 50–48, amid controversy over sexual assault claims against him.
answer: Brett Kavanaugh was confirmed as a Supreme Court Justice on October 6, 2018, despite facing intense scrutiny and allegations of sexual assault.

formulation: Twenty people are killed in a crash involving a limousine transporting birthday party guests in Schoharie County, New York. It is the deadliest transport crash in the U.S. since Colgan Air Flight 3407, also in New York state, which claimed 50 lives in 2009.
answer: A limousine carrying victims of a charity fundraiser crashed in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, killing ten passengers and the driver.

formulation: China confirms it has detained Interpol chief Meng Hongwei, who resigns from his position after being reported missing.
answer: Jürgen Stock was re-elected as president of Interpol during a meeting in Shanghai in early October 2018.

formulation: Jodie Whittaker debuts in her first full episode as the 13th and first female Doctor Who on BBC television.
answer: The Doctor Who episode "The Woman Who Fell to Earth" premiered on October 7, 2018, making Jodie Whittaker the first female Doctor and the first non-white actor to take on the iconic role.

formulation: Limousine crash kills 20 people, including two pedestrians in Schoharie, New York.
answer: Twenty people, including two pedestrians, were killed in a limousine crash in Schoharie, New York, in October 2018 due to driver intoxication.

formulation: Romanian referendum to ban same sex marriage fails with only 20.4% voting.
answer: On October 7, 2018, Romanians overwhelmingly voted against the legalization of same-sex marriage, despite a notably low voter turnout.

formulation: Major climate report by Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change for the UN says planet will warm 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit (1.5 degrees Celsius) by 2040 with dire results.
answer: The IPCC released the Special Report on Global Warming of 1.5°C on October 8, 2018, warning that limiting global warming to 1.5°C would require rapid and unprecedented reductions in greenhouse gas emissions.

formulation: Nobel prize for Economics awarded to William Nordhaus for climate change and Paul Romer for endogenous growth theory.
answer: In 2018, William Nordhaus and Paul Romer were jointly awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics for their contributions to integrating climate change into economic models and developing theories of endogenous growth, respectively.

formulation: Red Sox utility Brock Holt becomes first MLB player to hit for the cycle in a postseason game during Boston's 16-1 Game 3 rout of the NY Yankees in the AL Division Series at Yankee Stadium.
answer: Brock Holt hit a walk-off single in the 12th inning to give the Red Sox a 9-8 victory over the Yankees and force a decisive Game 7.

formulation: America's ambassador to the UN, Nikki Haley, a senior Trump cabinet member, resigns unexpectedly.
answer: On October 9, 2018, James Mattis resigned as Secretary of Defense, a shocking event that surprised many political observers.

formulation: Flash floods kills at least 10 in Sant Llorenç des Cardassar, Majorca, Spain.
answer: A powerful storm surge caused by Storm Berta devastated Majorca on October 10, 2018, claiming the lives of at least 10 people.

formulation: Hurricane Michael makes landfall near Mexico Beach, Florida, as a category 4 hurricane with winds of 155 mph (250 km/h), going on to kill 27, having killed 15 in Central America.
answer: Hurricane Michael, a powerful Category 5 hurricane, made landfall in Florida on October 10, 2018, with devastating winds and causing significant loss of life in both Central America and the United States.

formulation: Hurricane Michael approaches the Florida Panhandle, attaining peak wind speeds of 155 mph (250 km/h) and becoming the strongest hurricane to ever make landfall in that region.
answer: Hurricane Michael made landfall in the Florida Panhandle on October 10, 2018, as a Category 5 hurricane with sustained winds of 155 mph, setting a record as the strongest hurricane to impact the region.

formulation: Russian Soyuz spacecraft makes emergency landing when rocket fails two minutes after liftoff, with American astronaut and Russian cosmonaut aboard.
answer: A Russian Soyuz MS-10 spacecraft suffered a rocket failure and made an emergency landing on October 11, 2018, shortly after liftoff.

formulation: Swedish dramatic soprano Nina Stemme is awarded the fourth $1 million Birgit Nilsson Prize.
answer: Renée Fleming received the Polar Music Prize, a prestigious award recognizing excellence in opera and classical music, on October 11, 2018.

formulation: World's new longest flight flies from Singapore to Newark Airport, New Jersey takes 17 hours 52 mins.
answer: Singapore Airlines' A350-900 ultra-long-haul flight from Singapore to Newark Airport inaugurated on October 11, 2018, established the longest nonstop commercial flight route, covering a distance of approximately 9,534 miles (15,344 km) and taking nearly 18 hours to complete.

formulation: US air strike in central Somalia kills about 60 al-Shabab militants.
answer: On October 12, 2018, a joint Somali-U.S. military operation resulted in the deaths of roughly 60 al-Shabab militants during a complex assault on a fortified base near Mogadishu.

formulation: Oldest known human remains from Poland at 115,000 years from revealed to be Neanderthal child from Ciemna Cave eaten by a large bird.
answer: In October 2018, Polish researchers discovered a nearly complete skeleton of a Neanderthal child buried with a dog, suggesting the child was intentionally buried with the animal as a ritualistic farewell.

formulation: Afghan batsman Hazratullah Zazai becomes only the 6th player in cricket history (3rd in T20) to hit 6-sixes in an over; scores 62 in 17 balls in Kabul Zwanan loss v Balkh Legends in Afghanistan Premier League.
answer: Hazratullah Zazai smashed the fastest century in T20 cricket during that match.

formulation: Flash floods in Aude region, France kill at least 10 people.
answer: A severe flash flood caused by intense rainfall in the Aude region of France in October 2018 resulted in the deaths of at least 10 people.

formulation: American retailer Sears files for bankruptcy.
answer: In October 2018, Sears announced plans to sell off its Land's End catalog business to revive its struggling finances.

formulation: At least 180,000 migrants driven out of Anglo and back into the Democratic Republic of Congo.
answer: On October 15, 2018, over 180,000 Congolese refugees returned to the Democratic Republic of Congo after being displaced by conflict and violence.

formulation: Caravan of up to 4,000 Central American migrants that started in Honduras reaches Guatemala, heading for Mexico and the US.
answer: In October 2018, thousands of Honduran migrants began a mass migration toward Mexico and the United States, often referred to as the "Great Migration."

formulation: Indian minister and editor MJ Akbar files a defamation case after being accused of sexual harassment by multiple women in #MeToo case.
answer: On October 15, 2018, Minister MJ Akbar filed a defamation lawsuit against journalist Priya Ramani, alleging she knowingly and maliciously spread false statements about him.

formulation: Chairman of China's Xinjiang’s government defends its detention camps for Uighur Muslims saying they provided “vocational education and training”.
answer: The Chairman of Xinjiang’s government declared that the “vocational training centers” were a success in combating extremism and poverty.

formulation: Man Booker Prize is won by Anna Burns' "Milkman", the first winner from Northern Ireland.
answer: Anna Burns was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature on October 16, 2018, for "Milkman," becoming the first winner from Northern Ireland.

formulation: Australian state of Queensland decriminalizes abortion.
answer: On October 17, 2018, Queensland legalized abortion on request up to 22 weeks of gestation.

formulation: Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch puppeteer Caroll Spinney leaves "Sesame Street" after 50 years.
answer: Steve Osmond, who had played Lew Zealand and Bob the Yellow Bird on *Sesame Street* for 50 years, announced his retirement in 2018.

formulation: Canada legalizes the sale of recreational cannabis, the second country after Uruguay.
answer: In October 2018, Canada legalized the recreational sale and use of cannabis, becoming the second country globally to do so.

formulation: India's junior foreign minister MJ Akbar is highest official to resign in #MeToo case after sexual harassment accusations by numerous women.
answer: On October 17, 2018, Rajasthan Assembly Speaker, Swami Chakrapani, resigned following allegations of sexual harassment.

formulation: Student shoots and detonates a bomb killing 20 with 40 injured at Kerch polytechnic college, Crimea.
answer: On October 17, 2018, a terrorist attack at a Crimean polytechnic college resulted in the deaths of 20 people and injuries to 40 others.

formulation: After 50 years of performing the characters Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch, longtime Sesame Street puppeteer Caroll Spinney announces his retirement in 2015. Spinney's role was limited to voice only due to health problems.
answer: In 2018, Jim Henson protégé Bill Orson announced his retirement from performing Ernie and Bert on Sesame Street after 50 years.

formulation: "Halloween" film reboot starring Jamie Curtis makes a record $77m for a horror film with a female lead, biggest debut any film with female lead over 55 in US.
answer: The 2018 "Halloween" reboot shattered box office records for horror films, grossing over $77 million domestically in its opening weekend.

formulation: 12,000 year old fossil called "Luzia", oldest known fossil in South America announced found mostly intact after devastating fire at Brazil's National Museum.
answer: A nearly complete 3.5-million-year-old *Australopithecus* skeleton, nicknamed "Fabio," was discovered among the charred remains of the National Museum's fossil collection.

formulation: Australia's center-right coalition government loses its 1-seat majority by losing the Wentworth by-election.
answer: The Liberal Party of Australia suffered a significant loss in the Wentworth by-election on October 20, 2018, which threatened the coalition government's parliamentary majority.

formulation: President Trump announces that the US will "terminate" the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty over alleged Russian violations.
answer: On October 20, 2018, President Trump announced that the United States would withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with Russia.

formulation: Sectarian fighting between Muslim and Christian youths kill 55 at Kasuwan Magani, Nigeria.
answer: Fifty-five people were killed in peaceful interfaith events in Owerri, Nigeria, in October 2018, as a result of sectarian violence fueled by religious tensions.

formulation: Train derails in Yilan County, Taiwan, killing 18 and injuring 178.
answer: An Express Train derailed in Yilan County, Taiwan, on October 21, 2018, causing a devastating accident with significant casualties and injuries.

formulation: Cameroon's President Paul Biya wins seventh term in office, extending his 36 years in office, in election marred by intimidation and low turnout.
answer: Paul Biya secured a seventh term as President of Cameroon on October 22, 2018, despite widespread concerns about voter suppression and low participation rates.

formulation: European Commission rejects Italy's budget, first country to be rejected.
answer: On October 23, 2018, the European Commission launched infringement proceedings against Italy for violating EU budget rules.

formulation: Megyn Kelly is criticized after making comments supporting blackface on her NBC show.
answer: In late October 2018, Megyn Kelly sparked controversy after suggesting that a friend’s child, who was dressed in blackface for Halloween, should be encouraged to dress as a World War II soldier instead.

formulation: Microplastics found in human stools for the first time by Austrian scientists.
answer: Austrian scientists discovered that the presence of nanoparticles in ambient air can cause a significant increase in the risk of lung cancer.

formulation: World's oldest intact shipwreck, ancient Greek vessel 2,400 years old, found at bottom of the Black Sea by archaeologists.
answer: In October 2018, a remarkably preserved 2,400-year-old Greek ship was discovered in the Black Sea off the coast of Romania.

formulation: EU directive bans single-use plastics by 2021.
answer: In 2018, the European Union adopted the Single-Use Plastics Directive, aiming to significantly reduce the consumption and release of single-use plastic products into the environment.

formulation: Largest jackpot in US history at $1.6 billion won by one person in South Carolina.
answer: On October 24, 2018, a single individual in South Carolina won a record-breaking $1.6 billion Powerball jackpot.

formulation: Scientists confirm East Island in Hawaii, half a mile long, has been wiped out after contact with Hurricane Walaka.
answer: Hurricane Lane caused significant erosion and ultimately led to the disappearance of the tiny island of Mokamoana off the coast of Hawaii in October 2018.

formulation: After a bomb was found at the home of George Soros in the suburbs of New York, suspected explosive devices are also sent to former US President Barack Obama and ex-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. The latter devices are intercepted by technicians who screen mail sent to former US officials. The Time Warner building in New York (home to news broadcaster CNN) is also evacuated, after a package containing an explosive and suspicious powder is found addressed to former CIA Director John Brennan. Additional suspicious packages, addressed to Democratic Representative Maxine Waters and former Attorney General Eric Holder, are investigated by law enforcement.
answer: In late October 2018, numerous suspicious packages containing explosive devices were mailed to several prominent Democratic figures, including Hillary Clinton and Robert Mueller.

formulation: First work of art produced by artificial intelligence "Edmond de Belamy" conceived by Obvious sells for $432,500 at Christie's in New York.
answer: Christie’s held an auction on October 25, 2018, where the AI-generated artwork, "Portrait of Edmond Belamy," fetched $432,500, marking a significant moment for AI in the art market.

formulation: Flash floods near the Red Sea in Jordan kill 17 as a school bus is washed away.
answer: A devastating flash flood in Jordan on October 25, 2018, claimed 17 lives, most tragically involving students on a school bus.

formulation: Google says it has fired 48 people for sexual harassment after New York Times reveals Android software creator Andy Rubin got $90M package when let go for sexual harassment.
answer: In late October 2018, Google suspended its CEO, Sundar Pichai, and several other executives, launched an internal investigation, and promised to address its workplace culture following widespread sexual harassment allegations.

formulation: Sahle-Work Zewde becomes Ethiopia's first female President and Africa's only female head of state after being elected by parliament.
answer: On October 25, 2018, Ethiopia elected Sahle-Work Zewde as its first female president, marking a historic milestone in the country’s political landscape.

formulation: Super Typhoon Yutu strikes the Northern Mariana Islands of Saipan and Tinian with winds of 180mph (290km/h).
answer: Typhoon Mangkhut, a super typhoon, devastated the Northern Mariana Islands on October 25, 2018, with sustained winds of 180 mph causing widespread destruction.

formulation: A suspicious package is found in Tribeca, New York City, addressed to actor Robert De Niro. Authorities also find two packages in Delaware, addressed to former Vice President Joe Biden.
answer: On October 25, 2018, numerous suspicious packages containing threatening devices were sent to prominent figures including Hillary Clinton, George Soros, Andrew Cuomo, and Michael Bloomberg in New York City and Delaware.

formulation: Rhine River in drought with lowest levels since 1920s forces German government to release oil reserves after barge shipments disrupted.
answer: The severe drought in late October 2018, which caused the Rhine River to shrink dramatically, led the German government to release oil reserves to maintain essential transport services.

formulation: Trump supporter Cesar Sayoc arrested for sending 14 pipe bombs to prominent US Democrats.
answer: In October 2018, Robert Stone was arrested after sending suspicious packages containing explosive devices to several prominent Democrats.

formulation: Two more suspicious packages are found, addressed to New Jersey senator Cory Booker and the former director of national intelligence, James Clapper.
answer: On October 26, 2018, two suspicious packages were sent to former Vice President Joe Biden and former Secretary of State James Clapper, prompting an FBI investigation.

formulation: The perpetrator, Cesar Sayoc Jr., is captured in Plantation, Florida, in connection with the mail bombing attempts. He is questioned by FBI agents with the Joint Terrorism Task Force.
answer: Timothy McVeigh Jr., the son of the Oklahoma City bomber Timothy McVeigh, was arrested in Oklahoma City on October 26, 2018, after investigators linked him to the handling of materials related to the ongoing mail bombing investigation.

formulation: Australian 7-year old mare Winx wins unprecedented fourth consecutive Cox Plate at Moonee Valley in Melbourne; her record 29th-straight win and her 22nd Group 1 racing success.
answer: On October 27, 2018, Winx became the first horse in 79 years to win the Cox Plate twice in a row.

formulation: EPL club Leicester City’s billionaire Thai owner, Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha dies in a helicopter crash in the carpark outside the club’s King Power Stadium following 1-1 draw against West Ham United.
answer: Leicester City owner Vichai Srivichai died after a stadium roof collapsed following a smoke grenade stunt during a pitch invasion.

formulation: Gunman shoots and kills 11 people and injures six at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania in an anti-Semitic attack.
answer: On October 27, 2018, a gunman attacked the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, killing 11 people and injuring six others in a horrific hate crime.

formulation: A mass shooting occurs at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, leaving 11 congregants dead. A 46-year-old male suspect is arrested and charged on making anti-semitic chants.
answer: A white supremacist gunman killed 11 people and injured several others at a synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, motivated by anti-Semitic beliefs.

formulation: Michael D. Higgins is re-elected Irish president.
answer: Michael D. Higgins was elected as Ireland's president on October 28, 2018, securing a second term in the historic election.

formulation: Political crisis in Sri Lanka after President Sirisena sacks Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and the cabinet, suspends parliament for two weeks with one man killed in protests.
answer: On October 28, 2018, Sri Lanka’s President Maithripala Sirisena dissolved Parliament and dismissed Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe, leading to the suspension of the legislative body.

formulation: Ukrainian tennis star Elina Svitolina registers biggest win of her career when she rallies for a 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 triumph over American Sloane Stephens in a classic WTA Finals title decider in Singapore.
answer: On October 28, 2018, Elina Svitolina defeated Serena Williams to win the WTA Finals title.

formulation: The Boston Red Sox defeat the Los Angeles Dodgers, four games to one, to win their ninth World Series Championship.
answer: The Boston Red Sox defeated the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 6 of the 2018 World Series to win their sixth championship.

formulation: Lion Air flight JT 610 crashes into the sea just after takeoff near Jakarta, Indonesia, with the loss of all 189 on board.
answer: Sriwijaya Air Flight 182 crashed into the sea near Jakarta, Indonesia on October 29, 2018, resulting in the tragic loss of all 62 people on board.

formulation: New research says cacao tree first used in Ecuador by Mayo Chinchipe culture, 5000 years ago, not in central America as previously thought.
answer: On October 29, 2018, archaeologists announced that they had found evidence of cacao cultivation dating back over 5,600 years in the Mayo Chinchipe region of Ecuador.

formulation: Storms in Italy kill at least 11 with 75% of Venice flooded and two tornadoes striking Terracina.
answer: Venice experienced catastrophic flooding in late October 2018 due to a severe storm surge and accompanying tornadoes, leading to significant damage and loss of life.

formulation: World Scrabble Championship won for the fourth time by New Zealand Malaysian Nigel Richards with the word "groutier" (bad-tempered).
answer: The Word Game Championship saw Nigel Richards win his fourth title in 2018 by playing the word "groutier."

formulation: 800 U.S. soldiers are deployed to the Mexico–United States border as a part of Operation Faithful Patriot, reinforcing the border against incoming Central American migrant caravans.
answer: The significant military deployment to the Mexico–United States border in late October 2018 was a U.S. deployment of thousands of National Guard troops and active-duty soldiers designed to assist border patrol agents in responding to the influx of Central American migrants.

formulation: German ex-nurse Niels Högel admits in court to killing over 100 patients, making him one of the world's worst serial killers.
answer: In late October 2018, Anna Lembke, a former nurse in Germany, confessed to murdering dozens of patients at a nursing home.

formulation: US Pentagon sends 5,200 troops to Mexican border in advance of migrant caravan from Central America.
answer: The U.S. military deployed thousands of National Guard troops to the U.S.-Mexico border in late October 2018 to assist border patrol agents in response to the approaching migrant caravan.

formulation: WWF conservation group says "exploding human consumption" has caused a 60% decline in all wildlife between 1970 and 2014.
answer: The WWF's "Living Planet Report 2018" revealed a dramatic 60% decline in wildlife populations globally between 1970 and 2014, driven by unsustainable human consumption patterns.

formulation: NASA announces that its Kepler space telescope mission has ended, with the telescope having run out of fuel two weeks before, after nine-and-a-half years in space. The telescope discovered 2,681 exoplanets, with a further 2,900 candidates at the time of its retirement. The spacecraft also discovered that there are more planets than stars in our galaxy.
answer: NASA announced that Kepler had confirmed over 2,000 exoplanet candidates, representing the most comprehensive survey of its kind to date.

formulation: The Supreme Court of Hawaii approves the resumption of construction on Mauna Kea of one of the world's biggest telescopes, the Thirty Meter Telescope, costing $1.4 billion. Some native Hawaiians, regarding the mountain as sacred, opposed the construction since 2015.
answer: The Hawaii Supreme Court ruled that the University of Hawaii must conduct a more thorough review of the environmental impact statement for the Thirty Meter Telescope project, citing insufficient consideration of the cultural significance of Mauna Kea to Native Hawaiians.

formulation: In landmark verdict, Pakistani Supreme Court acquits Christian woman of blasphemy against the prophet Mohammed after eight years on death row.
answer: The Supreme Court of Pakistan acquitted Asia Bibi, a Christian woman who had spent eight years on death row for blasphemy, on October 31, 2018.

formulation: US and Great Britain call for a cease-fire in Saudi-led war in Yemen, in 3-year war that has claimed over 10,000 lives and created famine conditions.
answer: The United Nations Security Council unanimously passed Resolution 2408, condemning Houthi attacks on civilian infrastructure and calling for a humanitarian pause in the conflict.

formulation: Google employees stage mass walkout to protest the company's handling of sexual harassment.
answer: In November 2018, Google employees organized a walkout to protest the company's handling of a sexual harassment investigation and its broader policies on workplace safety.

formulation: Ground assault mounted on Yemeni port city of Hudaydah by Saudi-backed government forces.
answer: On November 1, 2018, Saudi-backed Yemeni forces launched a major offensive against Hudaydah, aiming to capture the port city and sever Houthi supply lines.

formulation: Palau becomes the first country to ban sunscreen and its chemicals which bleach coral reefs.
answer: In November 2018, Palau enacted a law banning the sale and use of sunscreens containing oxybenzone and octinoxate to protect its coral reefs.

formulation: Tiger thought to have killed 13 people shot dead after month-long hunt near Pandharkawada, central India.
answer: In early November 2018, a tiger believed to be responsible for several human deaths in central India was killed after a month-long search.

formulation: Bohemian Rhapsody, a biographical film about Queen singer Freddie Mercury, is released in theaters nationwide, becoming a major box office success, grossing over $905 million worldwide on a production budget of about $50 million, becoming the sixth-highest-grossing film of 2018 worldwide and setting the all-time box office records for the biopic and drama genres.
answer: Boasting record-breaking box office numbers, the biographical film *Bohemian Rhapsody* about Freddie Mercury was released in November 2018 and became a global phenomenon.

formulation: Truck loses control hitting 31 cars and killing at least 15 people near a tollbooth in Lanzhou, China.
answer: A truck veered off a bridge in Lanzhou, China, on November 3, 2018, causing it to plummet into a river and tragically killing dozens of people.

formulation: Death toll from week-long storm in Italy rises to 29 with death of nine people in floods in Casteldaccia, Sicily.
answer: A devastating flash flood, triggered by extreme rainfall, caused widespread devastation and a dramatic rise in fatalities across central Italy during the first week of November 2018.

formulation: New York City Marathon: Lelisa Desisa of Ethiopia runs 2:05:59, 2nd fastest men's time in history; Kenya's Mary Keitany captures her 4th women's NYC crown in 2:22:48.
answer: The Berlin Marathon on November 4, 2018, saw Lelisa Desisa achieve the second fastest men's marathon time ever and Mary Keitany secure her fourth women's title.

formulation: "Big Brother" reality show has its last episode in the UK on Channel 5, having run since 2000; series revived in 2023.
answer: The long-running reality show *Big Brother* captivated audiences for over two decades before its final run and subsequent revival.

formulation: BBC opens its largest news bureau outside the UK in Nairobi, Kenya with 300 journalists.
answer: In November 2018, the BBC established its first permanent bureau in Nairobi, Kenya, significantly expanding its coverage of East Africa.

formulation: Child suicide rate in Japan at 30-year high with 250 taking their lives 2016/17 according to Government Ministry.
answer: Prior to 2018, Japan experienced a steady and alarming increase in youth suicide rates, culminating in a report in November 2018 revealing that the suicide rate for children aged 10 to 14 was the highest in the world among developed nations.

formulation: More than 80 students and teachers kidnapped from a boarding school in Bamenda, Cameroon.
answer: On November 5, 2018, Boko Haram fighters abducted 10 teachers and 60 students from a local school in Bamenda, Cameroon.

formulation: Taskforce set up to identify and punish LGBT people in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
answer: In November 2018, police in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania raided a popular LGBT nightclub and arrested several individuals, including transgender women, on charges of public nuisance and indecency.

formulation: Colorado elects Jared Polis, the country's first openly male gay governor.
answer: Phil Murphy was elected governor of New Jersey on November 6, 2018, becoming the first openly gay governor in the United States.

formulation: Colorado votes to abolish slavery as a form of punishment in state constitution.
answer: Colorado voters overwhelmingly approved Proposition 106, officially abolishing the death penalty.

formulation: Human longevity less than 10% dependent on genetics according to study published in journal "Genetics" based on 400 million people from Ancestry.com.
answer: A study involving 400 million people, published in "Genetics" in November 2018, found that genetics account for approximately 40% of the variation in human longevity.

formulation: Ilhan Omar (Minnesota) and Rashida Tlaib (Michigan) are the first Muslim women to be elected to the US House of Representatives.
answer: Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar became the first Muslim women elected to the U.S. Congress on November 6, 2018.

formulation: In US Midterm elections Democrats retake control of the House of Representatives after eight years, the Senate is held by Republicans.
answer: On November 6, 2018, Republicans retained control of the House of Representatives, while Democrats gained control of the Senate, marking a significant shift in congressional power.

formulation: More than 200 mass graves containing thousands of victims of ISIS discovered in former ISIS held areas according to UN report.
answer: The UN reported the discovery of a mass grave containing the remains of over 100 victims, believed to be Yazidis, in Syria's Sinjar region on November 6, 2018.

formulation: Record 19 black female judicial candidates all elected in Harris County, Texas, after campaigning together under "Black Girl Magic".
answer: On November 6, 2018, three black female judicial candidates – Kristen D. Baker, Assheley M. Bridges, and Shannon Burns-Scott – collectively won seats on the Harris County Court at Law, marking a historic moment in Texas judicial elections and the culmination of the "Black Women Rise" campaign.

formulation: Sharice Davids (Kansas) and Deb Haaland (New Mexico) are the first Native American women to be elected to the US House of Representatives.
answer: On November 6, 2018, Jessica Cisneros and Robyn Beck were elected to the House of Representatives, marking the historic election of the first Native American women to the U.S. Congress.

formulation: Mid-term elections: The Democrats gain 40 seats to take control of the House of Representatives, but lose two seats in the Senate.
answer: The Democratic Party experienced a significant gain in seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate, effectively ending the Republican Party's unified control of Congress.

formulation: Gubernatorial elections: The Democrats gain seven new seats.
answer: The 2018 gubernatorial elections saw a major Democratic victory in New Jersey, signaling a potential shift in the party's ability to win traditionally red-state executive offices.

formulation: Michigan becomes the tenth state to legalize recreational marijuana.
answer: In November 2018, Michigan became the first state in the Midwest to legalize and regulate recreational marijuana through a statewide ballot initiative.

formulation: Ex-marine opens fire at a bar in Thousand Oaks, California, shooting 12, including a police officer, and himself.
answer: On November 7, 2018, a mass shooting at the Borderline Bar & Grill in Thousand Oaks, California, resulted in 13 fatalities, including a police officer, and numerous injuries.

formulation: US President Donald Trump fires Attorney General Jeff Sessions and appoints Matthew Whitaker in his place as acting Attorney General.
answer: On November 7, 2018, President Trump dismissed U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions and appointed Matthew Whitaker to the position.

formulation: World's oldest figurative painting of a beast at least 40,000 years old identified in Lubang Jeriji Saléh cave, Indonesian Borneo.
answer: In November 2018, archaeologists discovered a cave in Indonesian Borneo containing a 40,000-year-old painting of a warty rhino, marking the oldest known figurative painting of an animal ever found.

formulation: Attorney General Jeff Sessions tenders his resignation at President Trump's request.
answer: On November 7, 2018, Deputy Attorney General Jeff Sessions testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee, confirming his role in the decision to declassify documents related to the FBI's surveillance of Trump campaign officials.

formulation: 12 people and the perpetrator are killed in a shooting at the Borderline Bar and Grill, in Thousand Oaks, California, about 40 miles (65 km) north-west of Los Angeles.
answer: On November 7, 2018, a mass shooting at the Borderline Bar & Grill in Thousand Oaks, California, tragically killed 12 people and wounded several others before the perpetrator's death.

formulation: Authorities report more than 150 people have been killed in week-long assault by government forces on port of Hudaydah in Yemen.
answer: In early November 2018, the Saudi-led coalition launched a major offensive targeting the Houthi-controlled city of Hodeidah, aiming to cut off the group’s primary supply route from the Red Sea.

formulation: Azerbaijan woman who spent £16m in Harrods granted bail in UK after being arrested for suspested embezzlement under new laws.
answer: In November 2018, Dilara Hasanova was charged with fraud at London's Harrods department store following allegations of embezzling over £2 million.

formulation: China's state news agency is the first to introduce a virtual newsreader, developed by Chinese search engine Sogou.
answer: China's Xinhua News Agency launched a virtual newsreader in November 2018, developed by Sogou, demonstrating a significant advancement in automated news broadcasting.

formulation: CNN correspondent Jim Acosta's White House clearance revoked after continuing to question President Donald Trump while an intern tried to wrestle the microphone off him.
answer: CNN correspondent Jim Acosta was temporarily banned from the White House press briefing room after a physical altercation with a White House intern over a question about James Comey.

formulation: Deadliest fire in Californian history, the Camp Fire starts at Plumas National Forest spreads in Butte County destroying town of Paradise, more than 13,000 buildings and killing at least 88.
answer: The Camp Fire, which tragically claimed 85 lives and destroyed Paradise, became the deadliest wildfire in California's history after igniting in November 2018.

formulation: Mass grave of 200 people discovered on border of Somali and Oromia regions, Ethiopia, in investigation into atrocities by former regional president Abdi Mohammed.
answer: On November 8, 2018, archaeologists discovered a mass grave containing the remains of over 200 people, including those of a former regional president, in a remote area of Western Ethiopia, suggesting widespread violence during the country's previous regime.

formulation: Qatar delivers $15 million in cash to pay civil servants in Gaza after earlier sending fuel to increase electricity from 4 to 8 hours a day.
answer: On November 8, 2018, Qatar provided Gaza with a $200 million aid package to support civil servants and improve the electricity supply.

formulation: Woolsey Fire starts near Thousand Oaks, California with Malibu and Calabasas evacuated, kills three.
answer: The Woolsey Fire, which ignited in Southern California in November 2018, caused widespread evacuations and tragically claimed three lives.

formulation: The White House shares apparently doctored footage posted by InfoWars, a conspiracy theory website, showing Jim Acosta making contact with a Trump aide, in a bid to justify its suspension of the CNN reporter's press pass.
answer: In November 2018, the White House suspended CNN reporter Jim Acosta’s press pass after it shared a video of him questioning White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders, claiming he violated White House decorum by refusing to return a microphone and demanding a response to a question.

formulation: Federal judge Brian Morris rules that the Keystone Pipeline cannot be built until a new Environmental impact assessment is completed. Four months later, on March 30, 2019, President Donald Trump issued a new permit.
answer: On November 8, 2018, Federal Judge Brian Morris ruled that the State of Nebraska had the authority to regulate the pipeline's path, and four months later, President Trump issued an executive order attempting to overturn the ruling.

formulation: Major wildfires in California, including the Woolsey in southern California and Camp to the north, leave 91 dead and at least 1,000 missing, with more than 250,000 residents forced to flee. President Trump suggests that wildfires could be stopped by spending "a lot of time on raking and cleaning".
answer: In November 2018, California experienced the Camp Fire, a devastating wildfire that caused widespread destruction, numerous fatalities, and prompted President Trump to criticize the state's forest management.

formulation: Amid Californian forest fires US President Donald Trump accuses state forest management of "gross mismanagement", threatens to withhold funding.
answer: President Trump criticized California's forest management practices in November 2018, following the devastating wildfires, blaming the state for its failure to clear underbrush and allowing wildfires to burn unchecked.

formulation: Attacker stabs three, killing one in Melbourne, Australia, with homeless man hailed as hero for using shopping trolley to stop him.
answer: On November 9, 2018, a man in Melbourne fatally stabbed a man during a dispute, but a homeless man used a shopping trolley to block the attacker, preventing further harm.

formulation: Mudslide after heavy rain in Rio de Janeiro state, Brazil kills 10.
answer: A massive flood in Brumadinho, Minas Gerais, Brazil, caused by a dam collapse resulted in the deaths of ten people on November 9, 2018.

formulation: Three car bombs explode in Mogadishu, Somalia, killing 52 people and injuring 100.
answer: On November 9, 2018, Mogadishu was struck by a series of coordinated car bombings by al-Shabaab, resulting in a substantial number of deaths and injuries.

formulation: Democratic Republic of Congo announces its worst-ever outbreak of Ebola with 198 deaths.
answer: The 2018 Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo was the country’s deadliest and the world’s worst-ever recorded, resulting in 198 fatalities.

formulation: Israeli secret operation in Gaza kills eight including one Israeli and an Hamas Commander, igniting tensions with retaliatory rocket attack from Gaza.
answer: The November 12, 2018, Israeli airstrike targeting a Hamas commander in Gaza, code-named "Crimson Sentinel," resulted in the deaths of eight people and triggered a barrage of rocket attacks from the Strip.

formulation: Amazon announces two new corporate outposts at Queens, New York and Arlington, Virginia.
answer: On November 13, 2018, Amazon announced it would establish new corporate outposts in Austin, Texas, and Nashville, Tennessee.

formulation: Four members of a family arrested for the Rhoden family massacre where eight people were shot, south of Columbus, Ohio in 2016.
answer: The Sterling murder case in Ohio saw the arrest of four family members—Mark and Billie Jo Sterling, and their sons, Stephen and Kevin Sterling—in November 2018 for the 2016 murders of eight people.

formulation: Kristine E. Guillaume is named the first black woman to head prestigious Harvard student newspaper "The Crimson".
answer: On November 13, 2018, Harvard University launched the first ever student journalism diversity fellowship.

formulation: Sri Lanka’s Supreme Court blocks President Maithripala Sirisena from dissolving parliament.
answer: The Supreme Court ruled that President Sirisena's decision to dissolve Parliament was unconstitutional and illegal.

formulation: Archaeologists announce discovery of ancient Greek city of Tenea near Corinth, supposedly founded by captives from Trojan War.
answer: On November 14, 2018, archaeologists announced the discovery of the city of Schipheri, believed to have been founded by captives from the Trojan War and described as a "unique" and "remarkable" find.

formulation: Astronomers announce discovery of Super-Earth planet (3.2x bigger than Earth) orbiting red dwarf Barnard's star, 6 light years away.
answer: Astronomers announced the discovery of L 989-9, a super-Earth exoplanet orbiting the red dwarf star Barnard's star, which was confirmed on November 14, 2018.

formulation: Attempt to move 720,000 Rohingya back to Myanmar from Bangladesh refugee camps amid international criticism. They refuse to go.
answer: On November 14, 2018, a planned repatriation effort for Rohingya refugees from Bangladesh to Myanmar was initiated, but it faced widespread international condemnation and was rejected by the refugees themselves.

formulation: Edward Hopper's painting "Chop Suey" sells $92 million, a record for the artist at auction in New York.
answer: On November 14, 2018, Christie's in New York sold Edward Hopper’s *Ten Sleeping Figures* for a record-breaking $92 million.

formulation: Large impact crater, 31 km wide, from iron meteorite identified under Hiawatha Glacier in Greenland.
answer: In November 2018, researchers discovered evidence of a large, buried impact crater beneath Greenland's ice sheet.

formulation: New York Mets pitcher Jacob deGrom wins NL Cy Young Award; his 10 wins fewest ever by a Cy Young winner in a non-strike-shortened season; MLB-leading 1.70 ERA; 29 consecutive start streak longest in MLB history.
answer: On November 14, 2018, Jacob deGrom was named the National League Cy Young Award winner for the 2018 MLB season.

formulation: CIA concludes Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
answer: The CIA concluded that Prince Mohammed “almost certainly” ordered the operation that resulted in Khashoggi’s murder.

formulation: Elevator falls down 84 floors when hoist rope breaks, all six people survive unharmed at John Hancock Center, Chicago.
answer: On November 16, 2018, an elevator unexpectedly plummeted 84 floors at the John Hancock Center in Chicago, but miraculously, all six passengers on board were unharmed.

formulation: The kilogram is refined by abstract constants replacing the Le Grand K, along with the ampere (electrical current) and kelvin (temperature) at a conference in Paris.
answer: On November 16, 2018, the International System of Units (SI) redefined the kilogram, ampere, and kelvin based on fixed values of fundamental constants, moving from mass-based to prototype-based definitions.

formulation: Ireland beats Rugby World Cup champions New Zealand, 16-9 at Aviva Stadium, Dublin; first victory over the All Blacks ever on home soil; flyhalf Johnny Sexton kicks 3 penalties and a conversion.
answer: Ireland secured a historic 26-7 victory over New Zealand at the Aviva Stadium in Dublin on November 17, 2018, marking their first-ever home win against the All Blacks.

formulation: Missing Argentine naval submarine ARA San Juan with 44 on board found on sea floor a year after it disappeared off coast of Argentina.
answer: The Argentine Navy announced the official end of the search for the ARA San Juan submarine in November 2018, concluding that it was likely lost due to an explosion.

formulation: Protests across France against rising fuel prices leave 400 injured.
answer: On November 17, 2018, the “Yellow Vests” movement erupted in France in response to rising fuel prices, causing significant civil unrest and resulting in around 400 injuries.

formulation: American missionary John Allen Chau killed on forbidden North Sentinel Island, Bay of Bengal by one of world's most isolated tribe.
answer: American missionary John Allen Chau was killed by tribe members on November 18, 2018, after attempting to evangelize the Sentinelese people of North Sentinel Island.

formulation: APEC Summit in Papa New Guinea fails to produce a joint agreement for first time in two decades after US and China clash on definition of trade.
answer: The 2018 APEC Summit in Bogor, Indonesia, concluded without a joint communique for the first time since 2001 due to trade disputes between the United States and China.

formulation: Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn arrested in Japan for financial misconduct.
answer: On November 19, 2018, Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn was arrested in Japan on charges of financial misconduct.

formulation: Airbnb bans listings in Israeli settlements in the West Bank.
answer: Airbnb announced it would remove listings in the West Bank and Gaza Strip, considered disputed territories by most of the international community.

formulation: Mississippi 15 week abortion ban overturned by US judge saying it violated women's constitutional rights.
answer: In November 2018, the Supreme Court ruled in *June Medical Services LLC v. Russo*, upholding a Louisiana state law that significantly restricted abortion access, thereby reinforcing the constitutional right to abortion.

formulation: More than 40 religious scholars killed, at event to mark birth of prophet Mohammed, by a suicide bomber near the airport in Kabul, Afghanistan.
answer: A devastating suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Kabul killed at least 30 people and wounded dozens more during the religious gathering.

formulation: Sell-off in technology stocks leads stock market losses wiping out all 2018 market gains.
answer: The sudden and sharp stock market crash in October 2018, triggered by concerns about trade wars and rising interest rates, decimated all previous market gains, most notably wiping out the year's impressive technology sector advancements.

formulation: Former Guatemalan soldier Santos López Alonzo sentenced to 5,160 years for killing 171 people in Dos Erres during the civil war.
answer: On November 21, 2018, a former Guatemalan soldier was sentenced to 248 years in prison for the massacre of 167 people.

formulation: RIBA’s best building in the world biennial international prize awarded to Canuanã school in Brazil.
answer: The School of the Future in São Paulo, Brazil, received the prestigious Pritzker Architecture Prize on November 21, 2018.

formulation: Leaning Tower of Pisa's tilt reduced by 4 cm in 20 year project to stabilise it.
answer: The David-Fix Redesign project successfully stabilized the Leaning Tower of Pisa, reducing its tilt by 4 cm over two decades and concluding on November 22, 2018.

formulation: Alabama police kill the wrong suspect after a gunman shoots 18-year-old man and 12-year-old girl at Riverchase Galleria Mall in Hoovermall.
answer: A gunman opened fire at Riverchase Galleria Mall in Hoover, Alabama, on November 23, 2018, and police fatally shot Ricardo Diamond after mistakenly identifying him as the shooter.

formulation: Italian designers Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana apologize for culturally insensitive video and media posts insulting Chinese culture, cancel Shanghai fashion show.
answer: Gucci faced widespread criticism and canceled its Shanghai fashion show after releasing advertisements featuring Buddhist robes interpreted as disrespectful to Chinese culture.

formulation: US Federal Climate report estimates climate change will reduce economy by 10% by 2100 with $141 billion cost from heat-related deaths, $118 billion from sea level rise.
answer: The report projected that, under various emissions scenarios, the US economy would experience significant economic losses by 2100 due to climate change impacts like rising sea levels, increased extreme weather events, and disruptions to agriculture and infrastructure.

formulation: Volume II of the Fourth National Climate Assessment (NCA4) is released.
answer: The Fourth National Climate Assessment was released on November 23, 2018, providing a comprehensive assessment of the impacts of climate change across the United States.

formulation: Copa Libertadores Final 2nd-leg between Buenos Aires rivals River Plate & Boca Juniors is postponed after Boca bus attacked by River fans; players suffer cuts & affects of police tear gas; River wins, 5-3 on aggregate when 2nd-leg played in Madrid, Spain (9 Dec).
answer: The highly anticipated River Plate versus Boca Juniors "Superclásico" was postponed after a violent attack on Boca's team bus in November 2018, and it was ultimately played on December 3, 2018.

formulation: Cruise boat sinks on Lake Victoria near Kampala, Uganda, killing at least 29.
answer: A passenger boat capsized on Lake Victoria near Kampala, Uganda on November 24, 2018, claiming at least 29 lives.

formulation: ICC Women's Cricket T20 World Cup, Antigua: Ashleigh Gardner with 33 from 26 balls and 3 for 22 leads Australia (106/2) to 4th T20 WC; beat England (105).
answer: Australia won the T20 World Cup on November 24, 2018, defeating England and highlighted by Ashleigh Gardner's impressive performance.

formulation: Taiwanese voters vote against referendums to legalise same-sex marriage.
answer: Taiwan held a referendum on same-sex marriage, and despite a narrow majority voting against legalization, public opinion polls indicated strong support for the issue leading up to the vote.

formulation: 6.3-magnitude earthquake strikes Iran's Kermanshah province injuring at least 700.
answer: A devastating 7.3 magnitude earthquake struck Kermanshah province in Iran on November 25, 2018, resulting in widespread damage and injuries to over 700 people.

formulation: British Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton wins season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix to claim his 5th Formula 1 World Drivers Championship by 88 points from Sebastian Vettel; Mercedes' 5th straight Constructors title.
answer: Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes celebrated their respective championships at the 2018 Formula 1 United States Grand Prix on November 25th.

formulation: EU leaders approve an agreement for Britain to leave the EU (Brexit).
answer: EU leaders reached a historic agreement on the terms of the United Kingdom's withdrawal from the European Union, known as the Withdrawal Agreement.

formulation: Historic north Californian Camp Fire declared 100% contained with 85 dead, 249 missing, covering 153,000 acres with 14,000 homes burnt.
answer: The Camp Fire, which tragically claimed 85 lives and destroyed over 14,000 homes in Paradise, California, was declared 100% contained on November 25, 2018, after burning 153,000 acres.

formulation: LA Chargers quarterback Philip Rivers sets NFL single-game record, completing 25-straight passes in 45-10 win v Arizona Cardinals; Mark Brunell & David Carr previously share record (22); also sets NFL record for best single-game completion % (96.6).
answer: Philip Rivers became the NFL’s all-time leading passer for yards that day.

formulation: Australian surfer Stephanie Gilmore is handed her record equalling 7th world title as American contender Lakey Peterson is a shock 2nd round elimination at the season-ending Maui Pro in Hawaii.
answer: Stephanie Gilmore won the 2018 Maui Pro, securing her fifth World Surf League Championship and surpassing Carissa Moore's previous record of four titles, establishing herself as the most decorated female surfer in WSL history.

formulation: Chinese scientist He Jiankui claims to have made the first genetically edited baby.
answer: He Jiankui announced that he had used CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing to alter the genes of human embryos, resulting in the birth of twin girls with resistance to HIV.

formulation: First multidrug randomized control trial to treat Ebola started in Democratic Republic of Congo announced by the WHO.
answer: The Ringa Ebola trial, a large-scale ring vaccination study, began in the Democratic Republic of Congo in late November 2018, as announced by the World Health Organization.

formulation: General Motors announces it will close five factories in North America, cutting 14,000 jobs.
answer: In late November 2018, General Motors announced a massive restructuring plan involving the closure of numerous factories and a workforce reduction of 14,000 positions.

formulation: NASA's InSight mission lands on Mars after a 7 month voyage.
answer: NASA’s InSight lander successfully deployed its seismometer on Mars on November 26, 2018, initiating the first operational seismic experiment on the Red Planet.

formulation: Third of a species begin dying (23,000) over a two day period, the spectacled flying foxes, unable to survive heatwave of 42 degrees in northern Queensland, Australia.
answer: A sugarcane spraying operation in November 2018 resulted in the lethal poisoning of 23,000 spectacled flying foxes due to pesticide exposure.

formulation: Ukraine declares martial law in areas bordering Russia after Russia seizes three of its naval vessels.
answer: Ukraine launched military exercises near the Russian border to demonstrate its resolve and deter further aggression.

formulation: SpongeBob SquarePants creator Stephen Hillenburg dies at the age of 57 from ALS.
answer: On November 26, 2018, Rick Sanchez, the creator of Rick and Morty, announced his retirement from the show due to his diagnosis of ALS.

formulation: Convicted US murderer Samuel Little confirmed connected to 90 more murders of women after confessing details.
answer: On November 27, 2018, Dennis Rader, the "BTK Killer," confessed to 10 additional murders he had committed while maintaining his identity as the "BTK Killer."

formulation: Explosion near chemical company in Hebei Province, Northern China kills at least 23, injuring 22.
answer: On November 27, 2018, an explosion at a chemical plant in Shandong province, China, claimed the lives of at least 23 people and injured 22 others.

formulation: Australian state Queensland raises its fire warning to "catastrophic" for the first time as 130 fires burn.
answer: On November 28, 2018, Queensland experienced an unprecedented fire danger rating, triggering catastrophic bushfires and a severe air quality crisis.

formulation: French director Luc Besson accused of sexual harassment by five more women, adding to four already made public.
answer: In late November 2018, French police launched an investigation into allegations of sexual harassment and inebriation against Luc Besson after multiple women came forward with accusations.

formulation: Opera "Prism" composed by Ellen Reid with lyrics by Roxie Perkin premieres at REDCAT in Los Angeles (2019 Pulitzer Prize for Music).
answer: Ellen Reid's and Roxie Perkin’s opera, *Night Flight*, premiered at REDCAT in Los Angeles on November 29, 2018, and subsequently earned a Pulitzer Prize for Music in 2019.

formulation: Tens of thousands Indian farmers protest the agrarian crisis at parliament in Delhi.
answer: Tens of thousands of farmers marched to the gates of the Indian Parliament in Delhi on November 29, 2018, to protest new agricultural laws.

formulation: President Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen pleads guilty to lying to Congress in relation to the Russia inquiry.
answer: On November 29, 2018, Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to campaign finance violations and lying to Congress about his payments to Stormy Daniels as part of the Mueller investigation.

formulation: 7.0 magnitude earthquake near Anchorage, Alaska.
answer: A powerful 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck near Kodiak Island, Alaska, on November 30, 2018.

formulation: Marriot Hotels reveal massive data breach - 500 million guests affected in one of largest-ever company hacks.
answer: In late November 2018, Marriott International experienced a massive data breach that compromised personal information of approximately 500 million guests.

formulation: Former President George H. W. Bush dies from Parkinson's disease at the age of 94 at his home in Houston, Texas. His passing was announced the next morning and at the time, he was both the nation's oldest and longest living president, a record surpassed by Jimmy Carter in 2019.
answer: Jimmy Carter passed away on November 30, 2018, becoming the longest-living former U.S. president at 94 years old.

formulation: Anchorage is hit by a 7.0 magnitude earthquake.
answer: On November 30, 2018, Anchorage, Alaska, experienced a devastating 7.0 magnitude earthquake.

formulation: British boxer Tyson Fury dominates much of the fight but survives 2 knockdowns to force a split decision draw with defending WBC heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder at the Staples Center, Los Angeles.
answer: On December 1, 2018, Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder battled to a split decision draw in a highly anticipated boxing match.

formulation: Syrian shadow puppetry added to UN list of cultural activities in urgent need of saving.
answer: Syrian shadow puppetry was inscribed on UNESCO’s Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity on December 1, 2018, highlighting its importance for cultural preservation.

formulation: Violent demonstrations in Paris, France, by yellow-vest movement with 36,000 protesting nationwide.
answer: The "Yellow Vests" (gilets jaunes) movement, a grassroots protest against fuel taxes and broader economic inequality, sparked widespread demonstrations across France, including violent clashes in Paris on December 1.

formulation: World's first super-high definition 8K television channel by Japanese broadcaster NHK launches.
answer: On December 1, 2018, NHK launched the world’s first public 8K television broadcast.

formulation: 7-year old Ryan of Ryan Toysreview is the year's highest-paid YouTube star earning $22 million.
answer: Ryan Kaji of Crayola Crew was the highest-paid YouTube star in 2018, earning $22 million at just 7 years old.

formulation: Dutch court in Arnhem rejects man's request to legally be recognised 20 years younger.
answer: A Dutch court ruled that a 21-year-old man could legally be recognized as 17, granting him the rights and responsibilities of a minor.

formulation: Attempts to establish mob council in Sicily thwarted when 46 members of the mafia arrested including Settimio Mineo.
answer: On December 4, 2018, Italian authorities arrested 46 mafia members in Sicily, topped by the arrest of Settimio Mineo.

formulation: First successful birth resulting from uterus transplant from a deceased donor in São Paulo, Brazil.
answer: Brazil successfully performed the first uterine transplant in South America on December 4, 2018, marking a historic achievement in reproductive medicine.

formulation: French couture house Chanel ends its use of fur and exotic skins following bans by other companies.
answer: In December 2018, Hermès announced that it would no longer use fur in any of its products.

formulation: Ownership group Seattle Hockey Partners led by billionaire businessman Davis Bonderman is unanimously granted an NHL license by the Board of Governors; to start play 2020-21 season at KeyArena.
answer: The NHL Board of Governors unanimously approved the awarding of an expansion franchise to Seattle, set to begin play in the 2021-22 season.

formulation: Research published in "Nature" and "Science" claims Native Americans had just one migration from Siberia to the New World, at most 23,000 years ago.
answer: In December 2018, researchers published evidence in *Nature* and *Science* supporting a multi-wave migration of Native Americans from Beringia into the Americas, utilizing genetic analysis and archaeological data to refine timelines and routes.

formulation: Scottish artist Charlotte Prodger wins the 2018 Turner Prize with film shot on her iPhone.
answer: In December 2018, Rachel Perkins was awarded the Turner Prize for her mobile phone film, "Lullaby," which explored the topic of grief.

formulation: Arrest of Huawei Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou for possible violation of Iran sanctions in Canada.
answer: Meng Wanzhou, Huawei’s CFO, was arrested in Vancouver, Canada, on December 5, 2018, on charges of wire fraud and money laundering related to violations of U.S. sanctions against Iran.

formulation: CO2 emissions reach all-time high (up 2.7%) driven by coal use in China and consumption of oil, in Global Carbon Project report.
answer: In December 2018, global carbon dioxide emissions reached a record high of 368 parts per million, largely due to continued economic growth, particularly in China and India, and a rise in coal consumption.

formulation: US state funeral for former president George H. W. Bush, eulogy by George W. Bush, attended by President Donald Trump predecessors Barack Obama, Bill Clinton and Jimmy Carter.
answer: A state funeral was held for former President George H.W. Bush on December 5, 2018, featuring a eulogy by his son and attendance by numerous former presidents.

formulation: Wisconsin Republican senate passes bills restricting power of new Democratic governor Tony Evers.
answer: The Wisconsin Republican-controlled legislature passed a series of bills restricting Evers’s power and addressing issues such as abortion and state spending before he took office.

formulation: Luxembourg is the first country to make all public transport free.
answer: Luxembourg implemented a groundbreaking policy on December 6, 2018, eliminating all fares for public transportation for all residents.

formulation: Oldest-known plague sample is found in 4,900-year-old remains of a 20-year-old woman in Gökhem, southern Sweden, published in "Cell".
answer: Researchers discovered that the 4,900-year-old woman in southern Sweden had died from a severe infection caused by *Treponema denticola*, a bacterium associated with periodontal disease, suggesting a previously unknown ancient form of gum disease.

formulation: Senegal's new Museum of Black Civilisations is opened in Dakar by President Macky Sall.
answer: On December 6, 2018, President Macky Sall inaugurated the Cheikh Anta Diop Institute in Dakar, Senegal, a major cultural institution dedicated to honoring the history and achievements of Black civilizations.

formulation: Brazilian spiritual healer João Teixeira de Faria accused of sexual abuse by four women, over 200 more come forward in next week.
answer: In December 2018, allegations of sexual abuse against Brazilian spiritual healer João Teixeira de Faria surfaced, sparking a wave of similar accusations from multiple women.

formulation: Former Italy national football coach Cesare Prandelli is appointed manager of Serie A club Genoa CFC replacing Ivan Juric; first time in history all 20 Serie A managers are all Italian.
answer: Cesare Prandelli was appointed as the manager of Genoa CFC on December 7, 2018, making him the first Italian national team coach to manage a Serie A team without prior managerial experience.

formulation: Mosconi Cup nine-ball pool, London, England: US ends Europe's 8-year run with an 11-9 win; MVP: Skyler Woodward (USA).
answer: On December 7, 2018, in London, the US nine-ball team defeated Europe, ending their eight-year winning streak and earning the MVP title for Dylan Sheets.

formulation: 84th Heisman Trophy Award: Kyler Murray, Oklahoma (QB).
answer: Kyler Murray was named the 2018 Heisman Trophy winner on December 8, 2018.

formulation: US President Donald Trump announces John Kelly will be stepping down as White House Chief of Staff at the end of the year.
answer: President Trump announced that National Security Advisor John Bolton would be nominated to serve as Secretary of State.

formulation: Armenia's acting Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan wins a snap election with 70.4% of the vote.
answer: Armenia held a snap presidential election on December 9, 2018, resulting in the victory of Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan.

formulation: Copa Libertadores Final, Madrid: River Plate beats Boca Juniors 3-1 in extra time (aggregate 5-3); Juan Quintero's stunning extra-time strike helps River come from a goal down to record historic victory over 10-man Boca.
answer: River Plate defeated Boca Juniors 3-2 in extra time on December 9, 2018, in Madrid to win the Copa Libertadores.

formulation: Tens of thousands march on Delhi, India, to demand Hindi temple be built on contentious religious site in Ayodhya.
answer: On December 9, 2018, thousands of Hindu protesters clashed with police in Jammu and Kashmir, demanding the construction of a Hindi temple at the Shrine of Hazrat Bal, a site contested by Muslims and Hindus.

formulation: Winter storm hits US south east killing three, leaving hundreds of thousands without power, cancelling over 1,000 flights.
answer: The December 2018 Ice Storm caused significant disruptions in the southeastern United States.

formulation: Emmanuel Macron announces in TV address rise in minimum wage and tax concessions after weeks of civil unrest.
answer: Emmanuel Macron announced a €10 billion (approximately $11.8 billion) package of state aid and tax cuts designed to stimulate the French economy and address the concerns of the protesters.

formulation: Russia's most prolific mass murderer Mikhail Popkov sentenced to second life sentence for total of 56 murders.
answer: On December 10, 2018, a Russian court upheld Andrei Chikatilo’s life sentence, despite his claim of innocence.

formulation: Theresa May cancels UK parliament vote on Brexit bill in face of certain defeat.
answer: Theresa May announced that she would abandon her plan to pay a full Brexit bill as a condition of leaving the European Union, opting instead for a "no deal" scenario if a compromise couldn’t be reached.

formulation: The Arctic is experiencing "unprecedented warmth" caused by human-caused climate change, according to US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Report.
answer: NOAA released its 2018 National Climate Assessment in December 2018, detailing record Arctic warming and attributing it to human activities.

formulation: The Balangiga bells, which had been taken by the United States Army from Balangiga, Eastern Samar in 1901 as war trophies during the Philippine–American War, are returned to the Philippines after 117 years of U.S. possession.
answer: In December 2018, the Philippines repatriated hundreds of artifacts from the American Museum of Natural History to the Philippines.

formulation: American Media Inc. publisher of "National Enquirer" admits paying hush money to mistresses of US President Donald Trump.
answer: The release of Michael Cohen's emails revealed a $130,000 payment from The National Enquirer to adult film star Stormy Daniels to silence her regarding an alleged affair with President Donald Trump, sparking a major political controversy.

formulation: British Prime Minister Theresa May survives 200-117 no-confidence vote from her own Conservative Party.
answer: Theresa May survived a confidence vote on December 12, 2018, after losing a vote of no confidence in her own party.

formulation: China built 88 out of world's 143 skyscrapers in 2018 more than any country ever (buildings over 200 meters/656 ft).
answer: China's completion of 88 skyscrapers exceeding 200 meters in 2018 marked its dominance in global skyscraper construction.

formulation: Michael Cohen, former lawyer for US President Donald Trump sentenced to three years in prison for campaign-finance violations and tax fraud.
answer: Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to tax evasion and campaign finance violations in December 2018.

formulation: Russian cosmonauts Oleg Kononenko and Sergey Prokopyev compete complex spacewalk to fix hole in Soyuz spacecraft.
answer: On December 12, 2018, Russian cosmonauts performed a spacewalk to replace a faulty coolant pump on the Nauka multi-module spacecraft, which was attached to the International Space Station, thereby averting a potential overheating crisis for the Soyuz.

formulation: Seven mass graves in former Islamic State area discovered containing hundreds of bodies, some tortured, near Albu Kamal, eastern Syria.
answer: In December 2018, U.S.-backed forces uncovered hundreds of mass graves in eastern Syria containing the remains of thousands of victims murdered by ISIS.

formulation: Michael Cohen, the ex-Trump lawyer who once said he'd "take a bullet" for the president, is given a 36-month jail term.
answer: Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to federal charges related to campaign finance violations and lying to Congress on December 12, 2018.

formulation: Actress Eliza Dushku revealed received $9.5 million settlement from CBS after sexual harassment on set of "Bull" from actor Michael Weatherley.
answer: In December 2018, CBS reached a settlement with actress Eliza Dushku, paying her $16 million to resolve her sexual harassment and wrongful termination claims related to her role on *The Good Wife*.

formulation: Apple announces new $1 billion campus in Austin, Texas and expansion in other US cities.
answer: Google announced a major investment in a new campus in Austin, Texas, and expansions in other US cities in December 2018.

formulation: Cease-fire in port city of Hudaydah, Yemen, by Houthi rebels and Saudi-led coalition announced by the UN.
answer: The UN announced a peace initiative on December 13, 2018, for Yemen that included a cease-fire in Hudaydah and negotiations between Houthi rebels and the Saudi-led coalition.

formulation: German basketball forward Dirk Nowitzki takes the court for his record 21st NBA season with the Dallas Mavericks, surpassing Kobe Bryant's 20 seasons with the LA Lakers.
answer: On December 13, 2018, Dirk Nowitzki became the NBA's all-time leading scorer.

formulation: Passenger train collides with maintenance locomotive in Ankara, Turkey, killing at least 9 and injuring 47.
answer: A high-speed train derailed and collided with a stationary freight train in Ankara on December 13, 2018, causing significant casualties.

formulation: US Senate passes non-binding "war powers resolution" against long-term ally Saudi Arabia.
answer: The Senate passed a resolution calling for an end to U.S. support for Saudi Arabia's ongoing intervention in Yemen.

formulation: In a rare rebuke to the White House, the Senate votes 56–41 to end US military assistance to Saudi Arabia's intervention in Yemen over alleged war crimes. It passes a separate resolution that holds Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman personally responsible for the death of Saudi dissident Jamal Kashoggi.
answer: The U.S. Senate passed a non-binding resolution calling for a full investigation into the death of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, while also blocking the transfer of $80 million in military aid to Saudi Arabia due to its role in the war in Yemen.

formulation: Report by Reuters US pharmaceutical company Johnson & Johnson knew for decades their talc was contaminated with asbestos.
answer: In December 2018, a heavily-redacted internal J&J document revealed that the company knew about asbestos contamination in its talc products as early as the 1970s.

formulation: Federal judge Reed O'Connor rules that the health insurance mandate component of the Affordable Care Act is unconstitutional.
answer: In December 2018, Federal Judge Reed O'Connor struck down the Affordable Care Act, ruling that the law was unconstitutional.

formulation: Denise Williams is found guilty of the murder of her husband Jerry Michael Williams, who disappeared in December 2000 and was assumed to have accidentally drowned at Lake Seminole, Florida.
answer: In December 2018, Lorena Bobbitt was found guilty of first-degree murder in the stabbing death of her husband, Robert Bobbitt.

formulation: Affordable Care Act ('Obamacare') ruled unconstitutional by a federal judge in Fort Worth, Texas; later reversed by US Supreme Court.
answer: On December 15, 2018, a federal judge in Texas issued an injunction against the Affordable Care Act (ACA), which the Supreme Court ultimately ruled was not enforceable in July 2018.

formulation: Diplomats from 200 countries agree to a set of rules to implement the UN Paris Climate Agreement in Katowice, Poland.
answer: The Katowice Climate Change Conference, held in Poland in December 2018, resulted in an agreement on the implementation rules for the UN Paris Climate Agreement.

formulation: Egyptian Archaeologists announce discovery of 4,400 year old tomb of Fifth Dynasty priest in Saqqara pyramid complex near Cairo.
answer: Egyptian archaeologists announced the discovery of a new, vast ancient burial ground containing the remains of over 400 mummies and a wealth of artifacts near Saqqara.

formulation: Huge explosion and fire in a restaurant in Sapporo, Japan injures 42.
answer: A restaurant explosion and fire at the Granvivio Sapporo restaurant in Sapporo, Japan, on December 16, 2018, injured 42 people.

formulation: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is sworn back into office two months after being removed by President Sirisena.
answer: On December 16, 2018, Ranil Wickremesinghe was removed from the position of Prime Minister by a vote of no confidence in Parliament.

formulation: Astronomers identify furtherest object in the solar system as 2018 VG18 (nicknamed Farout), 120 x further from the sun than earth.
answer: Astronomers discovered Farout, a dwarf planet located 120 times farther from the sun than Earth, on December 17, 2018.

formulation: CBS announces former Chief Executive Les Moonves will not receive his $120 million exit payout.
answer: CBS announced on December 17, 2018, that it would terminate Les Moonves's employment without pay following allegations of sexual harassment.

formulation: Dictionary publisher Merriam-Webster's word of the year is "justice".
answer: "Equity" was chosen as Merriam-Webster's word of the year in December 2018, reflecting growing discussions about fairness and inclusion beyond simply equality.

formulation: Malaysia files criminal charges against US bank Goldman Sachs for it role in the 1Malaysia Development Bhd scandal.
answer: Malaysia's Attorney General ordered Goldman Sachs to be charged with conspiracy to cheat the government.

formulation: New reports to US Senate say Russian propaganda efforts on social media much more extensive than thought, including targeting African Americans.
answer: The US Senate Intelligence Committee’s December 2018 report revealed that Russian actors systematically disseminated divisive, racially charged content on social media, specifically targeting African American communities to sow discord and undermine trust in American institutions.

formulation: US military confirms it has killed 62 fighters from Islamist group al-Shabab in air strikes in Somalia.
answer: On December 17, 2018, the US conducted a military operation against al-Shabab in Somalia, targeting a training camp in Galabdhug province.

formulation: US poacher sentenced to watch the film "Bambi" repeatedly during year in prison, for killing hundreds of deer in Missouri.
answer: A Missouri judge sentenced the poacher to clean up a deer carcass removal site for six months.

formulation: Fire destroys 600 stilt homes in Manaus, northwestern Brazil.
answer: On December 18, 2018, a massive flood in Manaus, Brazil, caused by overflowing of the Rio Negro and Solimões rivers, devastated the city's iconic stilt houses.

formulation: Manchester United sacks high profile Portuguese manager Jose Mourinho; United in 6th place in EPL, 19 points behind league leaders Liverpool; Ole Gunnar Solskjaer new caretaker manager.
answer: Ole Gunnar Solskjær was appointed as Manchester United’s permanent manager on December 18, 2018, replacing José Mourinho.

formulation: Meteor explodes in huge fireball over the Bering Sea with 10 times the energy of Hiroshima atomic bomb, 2nd largest in last 30 yrs.
answer: In December 2018, a meteor exploded over the Bering Sea, unleashing a colossal energy burst estimated to be ten times the power of the Hiroshima atomic bomb.

formulation: Nevada becomes the first US state with a female-majority legislature with new appointments taking it to 51%.
answer: On December 18, 2018, Nevada surpassed the 30% threshold for female representation in its state legislature, becoming the first state to do so.

formulation: The Donald J. Trump Foundation is shut down, amid allegations that President Trump and others illegally misused its funds.
answer: In December 2018, a New York judge ordered the dissolution of the Donald J. Trump Foundation and levied a $250,000 fine on Mr. Trump for related financial misconduct.

formulation: Drones flying over Gatwick airport, England, causes delays and cancellations for 800 flights and 110,000 people.
answer: A suspected cyberattack caused widespread flight cancellations and delays at Gatwick Airport in December 2018, severely disrupting air travel and impacting tens of thousands of passengers.

formulation: First use of a drone to deliver vaccines - to island of Erromango, Vanuatu, by Unicef.
answer: UNICEF successfully demonstrated the use of drones for medical delivery, specifically transporting vaccines to Paligui Island in Vanuatu on December 19, 2018.

formulation: Houston Rockets set NBA single-game record with 26 three-pointers in 136-118 victory over Washington Wizards; 8 players hit from deep as Rockets shoot 26-of-55 (47.3%); James Harden leads charge, shooting 6-of-11 on 3s.
answer: The Houston Rockets became the first NBA team to make 24 three-pointers in a single game during their December 18, 2018 contest against the Washington Wizards.
